title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Surprisingly clean air conditioned TV screens Felt much safer than subways we've experienced in other cities

title: I guess it's okay?
review: It's good for a skytrain I guess But it would be better if it linked up with the metro better (one card instead of 2 separate cards)

title: Rise above the traffic jams of Bangkok!
review: The best way to move around Bangkok is to take the Skytrain It's frequent quick comfortable cheap and airconditioned Unfortunately most stations can only be accessed by stairs rising to at least the level to 2 floors The platforms are at a height of a further 2 floors of stairs It would not be suitable for those who have difficulty climbing stairs The Skytrain does not cover all of Bangkok but over the years it has been extended I would suggest taking the Skytrain as far as one can and then walking if near or to take a taxi from there

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: Like the title says  I was only in Bangkok for 3 days but you don't want to be sat around in the traffic Though taxis are cheap sky train is efficient cheap and easy to access I recommend googling your route before embarking on a journey as it can be tricky what with the rush and some staff not speaking english

title: Need more routes!
review: Very good and efficient service but lots of steps Not nice if you are hauling luggage Routes available are heavily traveled for business and tourism but some of the most popular tourist areas are far from the current lines

title: Excellent and affordable.
review: The Skytrain is a great option for getting around Bangkok It is inexpensive super convenient and the air conditioning works

title: cozy ride by sky train
review: cozy ride by sky train The hotel is nearer to Nana MRT from where one can reach anywhere in BangkokEven for reaching hotel I could take airport train to Piyothai and from there to Nana to reach hotel

title: Convenient mode of transportation
review: given the traffic conditions in Bangkok Skytrain is a very convenient mode of transportation in the city can get crowded during peak hours but still better than getting stuck in traffic in taxi

title: Best way to travel in the city.
review: A very convenient way of traveling around the city if you do not wish to walk Its affordable clean and convenient Way much better than taking a taxi or tuktuk as you do not need to get stuck in the traffic jam in the city

title: clean trasnportaion
review: if you want to travel fastuse BTSall the stations are well connected and have access to most of the mall on the sukhumvit line The prices have increased marginally but you save lot of time travelling

title: Fast and clean
review: Fast and clean train for reaching your target destination within Bangkok Nice view of Bangkok during trip

title: Easy to get around
review: Cheap and easy travel Only concern was that no escalator was in sight which can be difficult Good thing is that  you are not stuck in traffic which can be frustrating

title: Seamless efficiency
review: Don't be fooled by the Concrete and steps The BTS is a Must do to get around town just be smart and buy pre paid cards so you do not get stuck in tickets queues at peak times  The BTS is fast an efficient and beats the traffic grids that cripple your day all stations with maps live maps and more in thaibis directory httpgoogl843XoI

title: best way to get around
review: I was worried about using the BTS at first but its great We got help with our tickets the first time we used it and the staff are very helpful Its so cheap to travel its very clean and we got to so many different places Its better than taxi or tuk tuk didnt have a good experience with tuk tuk and not taking us where we wanted to go they wanted us to shop where they took us Its a great way to get to and from the airport

title: Fast and efficient
review: The hustle and bustle of Bangkok can be easily avoided using the Skytrain Having done the TukTuk and taxis and sat tin the traffic jams on even short journeys we bought a day pass TB150 per day (Â£3) we were able to visit all the major attraction A must do for travellers and very easy to use

title: Bangkok 6/2015
review: Should have more machine accepting bank notes Should have more escalators Should map and better signage

title: get out of town
review: Went to Nasa Vagas Hotel  to stay couldn't get out fast enough Went   to Kanchanaburi Great town great accommodation great food   Visited Hellfire Pass and Bridge over River Kwai

title: Super system
review: Great way to get about simple to use Very clean and cover a big area of the city so easy to get about

title: Easy to navigate
review: Easy to navigate cheap comfortable Air conditioning to beat the summer heat clean and fast Just need to map your trip to make the most of it

title: Easy Peasy
review: The Skytrain was just across the river from our hotel and extremely easy and efficient  We used it to get to dinner and our daughters used it to meet up with friends in another part of the city

title: Easy access
review: Really great to get around Cheapest way to travelstaff very helpful Sky trains close to all shopping & markets amenities  As well as very clean

title: Bangkok sky train rocks
review: Brilliant way to get around Bangkok easy to get the train from the airport to the city in not more than half hour and not expensive

title: Excellent public transportation
review: Clean stations and trains Great signage Overall great public transportation experience We loved the seating reserved for monks we've never seen anything like that before

title: easy, clean chep
review: There is nothing to dislike Easy to use aircon cheap Much faster than a taxi just stay away at rush hour

title: Cheap clean transportation
review: While not as convenient as a taxi no haggling or worrying about what crazy maneuver your driver will take but it can be very crowded at times

title: Best way to go
review: I come to Bangkok often enough to keep a BTS card that you can add Baht to so you don't need to buy a ticket every time The Sky Train is the best way to get around Bangkok and it also connects to the Airport link a cheap and easy way to get to the airport If you want to get to the river and take a ferry up river or go to the weekend market MBK Mall Siam Paragon Silom night market the Sky Train is the way to go

title: Transport
review: Skytrain in bangkok is a marvel Its busy cheap and quick Very good for getting around bangkok Be prepared to stand when you get on it fills as quick as it empties Stations have persons that can assist you with change and stops

title: Very convenient
review: The skytrain is super easy to use and the staff is very helpful Super clean and comfortable compared to what we have back in the states Great juice stands at some stations

title: Faboulous Short Summer Break in Bangkok
review: It is the perfect way to travel in Bangkok Clean Easy to understand even  for nonThai Speaking Tourists

title: Tangy day at Siam
review: Spend at least a day around Siam area for chic shopping experience Must try Mango Tango Check out Siam Centre Siam Square MBK (not worth going because of its pushy shop owners)

title: Best way to avoid terrible traffic
review: My flight was early in the morning and it made me very easy to reach Subarnabhumi International airport on time where as i was almost missing my flight before that visit

title: Fast, safe, cheap and easy to navigate through the city of traffic jams!
review: Easy to use transport link around Bangkok with several stations around Bangkok  Clean fast cheap and a regular service

title: Pleasant vacation at Bangkok
review: I really love the shopping havens of Bangkok There are so so many malls and I especially love to shop at Union Mall and i enjoyed the durian at Or Tor Kor Market and the wonderful visit to Terminal 21 and Asiatique Sky train and MRT made our travelling so easy and convenient The Thais are very mild and friendly

title: Quick and reliable
review: Quick and reliable yet doesn't allow travel to any of the main tourist attractions It is reasonably cheap though and can get you to the MBK complex

title: Skytrain - Bangkok
review: It is a great way to see the city while getting from point A to B quickly Avoid vans or taxis and support public transport

title: Quick and uncomplicatet transfer to the Airport
review: Quick and easy transport to the airport No delay but in rushhours kind of overcrowded good link to the inercity area

title: BTS SKYTRAIN.
review: The only way too go stops at all the right places every city should  have a system like this The system is clean cheap fares  and happy staff make it easy too  get around an otherwise congested city First class rail system

title: Great, Clean, Modern
review: I like the train system and handling Efficient and easy to get around Thanks to the guard at siam station who helped us finding our way back Excellent service mind

title: Fly over traffic
review: I think this is one of the best Ideas for a Megatown like Bangkok although for family of 4 and more it might be less cost effective and taxi are cheaper the time you save worth it there are two ways to buy your ride look at the stations chart placed near the automatic machines inside the name of your destination there is a number this is the fare change at the office to 10 Baht coins or use the new digital machines that accepts notes (and can print multiple tickets) remember the name of the last station in the direction you need pass your card and go to the station you need (Named the last station) and wait a few minutes or less The other option is to have a magnetic prepaid card which deduct the fare from your balance (good option for people staying longer then a few days)    Keep your ticket to get out and keep your valuables supervised at all times (wallets in front pocket and hand on purse) it i very crowded and some may exploit it Stations are clearly announced both in Thai and English When arrived take a minute to understand which exit you need just look at the sings

title: Get around on a Day Ticket
review: A day to fill and not sure what to do  Buy a Day Ticket for the BTS (Skytrain) and travel end to end on both lines  You'll need a BTS Map and a sense of adventure  Each station has a map on the lower floor depicting places of interest close by lots to see that the usual tourist doesn't get to know about  Parks Wats Shopping Centres Museums and if you get lost there are plenty of locals willing to help with directions For a day of exploring and interest its really affordable I had great fun and lots of photographic opportunities

title: Amazing way to get around Bangkok
review: My husband and I used public transportation to get around Bangkok on a recent visit to Thailand and I highly recommend it We were so impressed by the BTS Skytrain's cleanliness politeness of other riders helpful staff and ease of "figuring out" the maps etc with only speaking English Tickets easy to access at the machines very helpful staff and the best part is you can the city from above as you travel around We took the BTS to the airport when we left the cityand found it to be extremely efficient and cost effective

title: The best way to get. Around
review: It takes a few questions to get to understand how the BTS works but once understood it is cheap and easy The staff at the counter will change your notes to coins count the stations and most fares are from 15 to 44 baht Again finding the right platform just ask and every Thai person will tell you A 10 minute train ride one day was an hour taxi ride at 3 times the cost

title: World Class Public Transport
review: I was amazed by the Skytrain system in Bangkok Cheap clean always ontime and gets you to a vast number of areas in the city This is the best way to beat many of the traffic problems if you always travel by taxi I've never had a bad experience with the BTS system On occasion some people might find the air conditioning a little cool but I think it's a pleasant escape from the heat of Thailand There's also smartphone apps to help you better understand the everexpanding BTS system and the areas you can get to

title: Fast & Inexpensive
review: BTS (Skytrain) is the best way to get around Bangkok  The service is fast reliable and the carriages are very well maintained we never had to wait more than a few minutes for a train   During peak times they can be very crowded but that's to be expected as others have commented you get a great view of Bangkok while travelling Each of the stations has toilets fast food and drink stalls all well priced  We travelled extensively and bought one day passes for 130baht (as of 1672014) used in conjunction with metered Taxis which are often stuck in traffic jams it works out to be the cheapest way to get around

title: bangkok skytrain
review: in general i dont like snakes except one nice looking comfortable practical crossing tirelessly the city of bangkok i like it too much as it gave me the possibility to discover bangkok and its magic places

title: Bangkok BTS in 3 words: new, fast, cheap
review: Bangkok BTS or skytrain is the most convenient way for visitors to get around the heart of Bangkok like Siam Silom Sukhumvit I recommend you buy a oneday pass and you will be able to take a bird'seye view of Bangkok See how to buy a ticket in this blog httpthailandtravelguidesawasdeeblogspotcompblogpage_4318html

title: Fast , clean, convenient
review: Skytrain is the most efficient way to travel across the city Easy to reach stations are well organized  clear directoon marks Price very reasonable from 20  to 50 bht per ticket Stations and train are clean trains have air condition

title: Convinents to have  all Travellers
review: We have experienced express Commutcated the Skytrain for interconnection through all the Bkk City Hubs its great

title: Easiest way around BKK
review: Easiest way to roam around Bankok even in times of protests and stricks I visited BKK during political unrests so he most covenient way was Sky trains as many roads were closed by protesters It's cheap and very convenient if you're light with laggage Ask your hotel for nearest station it's usually walking distance away Take a map or guidence if need to change trains to get to your desired destination as it may become confusing and you may loose directions at multilevel stations with trains coming & going all the time NB do always keep coins with you for buying tickets as coin change que are usually long

title: Didn't use BTS? Are you kidding me?
review: You should use BTS to go round central BKK areas Especially if you are going tofrom Sukhumvit road From SiamParagon to anywhere to Thong Lor or more It's FAST and no traffic jam Trains are all airconditioned and clean Very safe and convenient I'm using taxi only if it's outside BTS area or if it's after midnight  Buy BTS "Rabbit" card it's *worth* your time it is fast and convenient to get on and off the train with "rabbit" card

title: Cheap and easy transport
review: The Skytrain was a surprise the first time I rode on it The trains are cheap clean air conditioned and frequent They can get crowded at times but are an efficient way of getting around BKK and out of the traffic If only the trains in Oz were as good

title: BKK sky train
review: I had seen Bangkok before the sky trains and have seen it now When it was being built I thought it was an eyesore that took away a lot of the natural light and sight of the buildings facade and the sky above however I guess it was a necessity to alleviate the traffic congestions Today I got used to it being there and in fact enjoy using it the sky train combined with the tube train give you all the access you need to the city and saves you a great deal of time compared to Taxis The trains are safe clean and cheap and not much waiting time for the next train Many exhibitions are held on the elevated walkways which at times is a nice pass time Again using the sky train gives you the opportunity to see the city from a birds eye view and allows you to find places you weren't aware of Tickets can be bought from the windows or the automatic vending machines the fares are very easy to work out from the maps on the wallThe train operators allow younger children to accompany their parents through special automatic doors instead of the regular turnstiles which is very convenient for parents with young children or children in strollers the operators of both Sky and Tube trains are like the rest of the Thais very helpful and courteous Overall a plus for the city in fact I only use Taxis now to go to the airport

title: very good:)
review: Skytrain is very goodyou can go somewhere very quickly and not make traffic because it's going upstairs(sky))i liked it

title: Nice to find some air con on a hot day
review: The Sky train is the best way to travel around Bangkok It can get extremely busy morning and evenings but during the day its not to bad The tickets system is a little confusing at first but once you have worked out the maps on the machines then it quite straight forward The trains are nice and clean and with the air con its a nice escape from the heat All the announcements are made in Thai and English so it makes it even easier not to miss your stop Make sure you pick up a map on the stations as they show you the roots and points of interest

title: so simple
review: It so simple and easy to use You can get to pretty much anywhere in the city or at least close and yuan catch a line straight to the airport The trains are airconditioned which is a nice change from the heat

title: Fastest and smartest way to move around a big metropolis
review: The Skytrain is a very modern transport system and the way it's run in Bangkok city makes it even more so for the following reasons   traffic on ground is quite intense and chaotic If you don't want to lose your head in the heat and chaos best bet is the skytrain   they are very well organised and fast rather than moving underground like the metro in Europe they move overhead and are therefore panoramic as well    they are very very clean as every public place and utility in Bangkok anyways  they are very cheap  the gap between the cost of skytrain tickets and regular taxis is an abyss  priority is given to children pregnant women old folks and anyone else who is on the weaker side What's new in this afterall it's the rule in every great city you might say The difference is that here this rule is abided by People just do the right thing

title: Convenient
review: This is a convenient way to get around in Bangkok but was a little confusing at first when purchasing a ticket We were assisted by a lovely Thai man on how to use the ticket machine

title: very good and very fast and cheep
review: before i arrive to bangkok i read on internet about sky train so very easy for meThe skytrain is beautiful and very usefulthe sky train very safe clean and quick

title: Best whe way to get around cheap and fast
review: Easiest way to visit main shopping centers Very clean Station arrivals and departures indicators inside the Skytrain is the best even for the most disorriented Not to mention it is cheap

title: Skytrain in Bangkok
review: We were in Bangkok for one week & discovered the Skytrain immediately It is very efficient & quick & the Skytrain takes you everywhere It is pretty simple to use once you figure it out & there is a person at the ticket counter as well It is a fabulous way to maneuver yourself around the beautiful city of Bangkok

title: Difficult for first time users
review: The skytrain is beautiful and very useful You can use it to visit most shopping malls but also main attractions However if you are a first time user it is quite difficult to understand how to buy tickets how the whole system works and where to get offon Also most stations do not have escalators or elevators making it difficult for women with babies or for elderly or disabled people to use it

title: Simple to navigate, the way to get around Bangkok.
review: We arrived in Bangkok 9am local time after an eleven hour flight from the UK and no sleep We got the sky train to our hotel and needed to navigate ourselves with 3 trains to get to our destination I was Somewhat anxious about finding our way but it was so simple In addition great value for money very safe clean and quick

title: Quick 'n Easy
review: Clean frequent air conditioned and a cheap way of access to shops and sights Avoid at rush hour can be crowded

title: Clean efficient Skytrain
review: I used this train in may 2014 and found it to be regular on timeinexpensive and clean  nnnnnnnnnnn

title: Best way
review: Those of you who have been to Bangkok before will know how good the BTS Skytrain is to get around the centre of Bangkok and to link up with bus stations    If you plan on spending a day going from place to place buy a one day pass about 130 TBH

title: Clean, easy and cheap
review: Clean easy and cheap Was great getting around Bangkok this way Was a lot less stressful jumping on the sky rain rather than getting ripped off by taxi drivers

title: SKYTRAIN
review: A very efficient service running every 510 minutes  The cost of the fare is also very reasonable & you can purchase your ticket from the vending machine or the ticket counter  Maps are also available & if your are not sure as to the platform there is always staff near the ticket counter who can direct you  This sure beats try to get a price from taxis who don't like using there meter & usually charge a lot more

title: Nice way of travel
review: When you first get the idea of how it works it is a quick and nice way to travel around And at the same time you will see some of Bangkoks backyards

title: Riding the Skyway in Bangkok
review: There are numerous buses that are cheaper but no air conditioning and they can turn and take you out of the way  Good luck finding someone that speaks English  However the Skyway is very simple to use and fast  In each station there are maps showing each train line and their stations including the subway lines that one might connect with  Then you look at a chart very easy and determine how much money (baht) to put in the machine for your ticket  Each station has money changers and I found that at each station one of the money changers speaks English When you have a ticket you insert it into a gate and it opens to allow you onto the platform and returns the ticket to you  When leaving your destination you insert the same ticket to open the gate this time the machine keeps the ticket  If you will be using the Skytrain a lot you can purchase passes to use more then once and save money  You can get around Bangkok using the Skyway and if needed the subway  Both are clean and cold  Each car has a seat or two dedicated just for Monks so do not sit in that seat  The most I every spent to get to the end of the line was about 75 cents USD  There are taxi's if needed at the end of the line and the fares are very reasonable  There are all kinds of services at most stations including food junk food and small shops of all kinds

title: No traffic
review: No traffic and you can reach most turist attractions Easy to get to the international airport  No queues no pain Better than tuck tuck as it has And cool air condition in it

title: Great way to see the city
review: If you have never used the BMT (skytrain) then you must give it a go Forget the Bangkok traffic jams  the skytrain is the way to see the city Quick cheap (anything from 20p to 90p for a journey) and the trains are so lovely and cool You can even get a train from the airport that connects to the Skytrainunderground network

title: What a pleasure!
review: Really easy to use when you know how Even if you don't know how or where to go there are plenty of people willing to help The announcement boards are in English The trains were very clean and whilst busy at times never uncomfortable Preferred this to sitting in a taxi in the traffic by far

title: Transport
review: Easy fast and cheap to get about use your wifi on train too best way to get around Bangkok that's for sure

title: What a way to travel.
review: A great 21st century travel system Clean fast and above all air conditioned Very popular mode of transport for getting round the city although lines are fairly limited Well priced and punctual a first class facility

title: Fortunately there is the Skytrain!
review: The Skytrain (BTS) offers an excellent service indispensable during traffic hours The wagons are clean the aircondition is quite cold i notice some people wearing a light jacket or scarf while entering the wagon During a rainy day we got around all Bangkok just paying the minimum ticket for one stop (Bt 15) we stop and get out of the train at many stations look at Bangkok and take some pics without going out from the station and than going back to our departure station Cost wise to get from A to B the relation between the cost of BTS and the cost of taxi is this one person will save 50% 2 people same cost 3 people cheaper by taxi

title: Tourists, please avoid rush hour...
review: Sky train or BTS is the best way to go here and there around city of BKK  (Now they also have MRT interchanged from BTS to MRT is available)  Even it is not yet covered all the Bkk it is still okay to avoid the traffic on the road   For sightseeing please try avoid rush hour (around 7830 am and 5630 pm) Last train is at midnight   Enjoy the ride with BTS ^^  PS BTS station map is available in googxx and also at their stations

title: Cheap n easy to get around
review: It is practically the cheapest n best way to get around It can bring u to almost everywhere to most of the major shopping areas

title: easy way to travel
review: we have used the sky train to get around certain parts of bangkok and found it so simple and never too crowded and would definately use it more often and the price is good

title: Excellent transportation to avoid traffic jams in Bangkok
review: The train is an excellent alternative tuk  tuk and taxis  Frequency of arrival of the train is high fast and cheap travel  Perfect for those who did not care to go a bit crowded

title: Best transportation, good organized, cheap and easy to use!
review: I used the Skytrain a lot as stations are everywhere you never wait longer than 5 minutes and it's very quick At daytime much better than taxi Unfortunately not driving in late night

title: Fast easy to use and clean
review: This transport helps you to get around Bangkok very easily  It's cheap and easy to use  You can always ask a local if you cannot work it out  It has 2 main lines that serve the city and also a connection to  Suvarnabhumi Airport  It also links up the the MRT underground system at certain parts of the city  The skytrian is simply that  It's built on concrete stilts that take you on a journey above the city traffic  You can also take the train to the river where you can catch a river boat up to the temples and grand palace

title: Excellent and efficient
review: A definatley mush so easy Go to the end of the line then catch a metered taxi to your final destination Why have all the fuss of catching a taxi to the centre Would take too long and cost to much Was 48B each

title: Ease and comfort
review: These are punctual organized at regular intervals and are clean and safe Plenty space inside the train For those unfamiliar with the routes the stations are announced and the legend is above each door so once the system is understood it is the most easiest thing to use The ticketing procedure is fairly easy to understand but if you need help each station has information booths and the staff are helpful  Love the way the lines for passengers waiting to board have been asked to form so that there is no pushing or pulling

title: Very Good
review: Very busy but run frequently you need change or you queue for change and then purchase your ticket from a machine which is easy to follow best way to travel as Bangkok is so busy it would take an age with a taxi

title: AVOID THE TRAFFIC
review: I always use Skytrain when I am in Bangkok Probably to avoid the queuing traffic when using a  taxi Plus the fact that it is so cheap but they need more ticket machines at peak hours to combat the long queues But be warned  Siam Square station is always very very busy

title: Best way to get around
review: We used the Skytrain daily when exploring Bangkok and it is definitely the way to go for less of the hustle and bustle of the street its air conditioned and cheap

title: Speedy communication
review: Best way to get around Bangkok Speedy reliable safew and cool And cheap Beats Taxi och TukTuk most of the time

title: BTS SKYTRAIN
review: This is the way to travel around Bangkok its easy no timetables all trains run every 5 minutes  All the stations are numbered and the price for the ticket  is  the number you press So from Asok to Chit Lom  will cost you 25 Thai BhtSo press 25 on the machine and then put in 25 Thai Bht in coin easy your ticket will shoot out and then go through  the turnstiles if you need help just ask the station staff The trains are nice and clean and with air con Chit Lom will take you to Central World shopping centre

title: Easy way to travel
review: It was so easy to get on the sky train & travel around the City Easy to work the Ticket machines   We walked from the air condition hotel across a bridge to the station so easy to do and it seems you don't wait to long for a train

title: Clean, safe, quick and fresh
review: With the MTR it is the best way to travel into BKK  It's a cheap way of travelling very clean safe and with aircon I recomment these 2 ways of transportation as main way and beside just take a taxi to bring you at your destination point

title: Easy
review: A great way to get around Bangkok day passes are inexpensive and they make all day travel a breeze  Trains can be packed at times so be prepared to stand plenty of straps and poles to hold on to  Newer trains have very well designed maps showing all the stops along the route and all stations have brochures explaining where the trains go  Lots of stairs but always escalators somewhere on the station Best way to travel in the city of Bangkok

title: Best way in bkk
review: One of the best way sto go from point a to b in Bkk   Combined with chao pra river express you will get almost any where in no time 100% better than taxi

title: Great way to get around
review: Fantastic quick and easy to use the top priced ticket is 52 baht less than a pound get changd from the booth put your money in the machine press the button out comes your ticket plenty of staff to help so easy  great fun

title: Bangkok Sky Train
review: Excellent way to get around the city clean frequent comfortable and reasonably priced But what I remarked most of all was the politness and courtesy of Thai commuters unlike the London underground or most other subways in the world A wonderful experience

title: The best way to move in BKK
review: The sky Train is the best way to move in BKK  All the stations leave you in the best places Even you have a sky train to the airport a reverse Not too much people know this and it is much better that bus or taxi The only thing is that you must be careful to take the train in the rush hours

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok.
review: I'd heard and read plenty of stories about tourists being ripped off by taxi drivers and all the scams so decided to avoid them wherever possible  The skytrain underground and airport link are a fraction of the cost of a taxi and avoid the jams at peak times The trains are also quick and clean with automated ticket machines to get rid of your loose change There is no problem taking your luggage  A lot cheaper and more efficient than the London Underground and all the announcements and station names are in both Thai and English

title: Excellent service beats traffic congestion
review: First buy a Rabbit card to travel on sky rail At peak times be careful when station packed if you use escalatorit just pushes more passengers onto a limited platform Trains are frequent passengers courteous next station appears within train plus there are route plans obvious for the first time traveller Cost is cheaper than taxi Do not use taxis on main routes when it rains as road traffic grid locks and you go no where

title: Skytrain
review: ItÂ´s a great option to travel ItÂ´s fast air conditioned clean The price is ok maybe little bit more than by taxi but itÂ´s really faster

title: Wish we had one
review: Sky train Brilliant fast clean air conditioned easy to use I would definitely recommend that you use the sky train   On two levels Concourse & platform the concourse is where you buy your tickets & other amenities and the platform is for waiting to get on or get off beware trains approach the platform any time from any direction  We should have these in our country

title: Clean, safe, time efficient
review: The Sky Train really made travelling easy it was clean and safe If it is possible to get to your destination with the sky train I would definitely recommend going via train and not taxis(will also save money) If you need help just ask the staff at the deskthey helped us a lot

title: I love it
review: I think this is a great service wish they had public transport like this in Adelaide its far more modern and efficient than most types of public transport I have seen and nobody seems to have much problems with it at all

title: Simple!
review: The skytrain is a very easy and convenient way to move around the city of Bangkok  Its cheap too for an all day ticket ~Â£3 i think  You can see plenty of the sights from the train and its air conditioned which is a welcome relief  The overground is much better compared to many cities underground systems They are still adding more stations too so this network will be improved further

title: Skytrain - cheap convenient and timely
review: Used a taxi once on first day in Bangkok then bought a 'rabbit' card at the Skytrain station  The Skytrain is so much quicker and easier to use to get around Bangkok  My preferred way of moving around  Used it to go to Chatuchak Weekend Market  PERFECT  The last Skytrain Train station is literally outside the edge of the markets  Thinking of tourists the BTS even announce each station coming up in English  Absolutely the best alternative to using the roads  Can be very packed at peak hours though

title: Excellent. Service
review: It is fastclean and efficientJust buy coins from the machines to pay for the journey It is cheaper than the taxis or tuktuk No hassle We used the skytrain most of the time  Easy mode of travel

title: Great way to travel and cheap
review: Went to Chatachak market on skytrain very well sign posted when and where to get off very cheap way to travel very busy and gets packed but always room for 1morewhen I come to bangkok again would definitely use the skytrain again

title: Fast and efficient
review: Great way to get about and avoid the traffic Can get crowded at busy times but easy to plan your journey and safe for everyone

title: Best Way to Travel in BKK - Cheap & Easy
review: The skytrain is simply the easiest and most convenient way to move around Bangkok  It's efficient cheap and very easy to understand  It's also worth jumping on to go to and from Suvarnabhumi airport which'll save you a few hundred Baht otherwise spent on a taxi

title: Fly around Bangkok
review: Fed up with TukTuk drivers taking you to the nearest tourist store to get their free perks Take the Sky train its cleanefficientsafe and easy to useNo worries about the Bangkok traffic you literally fly overheadTrains run every few minutes and on time Give it a try if only for the crack the cheapest way to travel

title: Easy to use and precise
review: Easy ticket purchase from machines at every station and trains run always on time very good service

title: Convenient
review: Most of the time I travelled by skytrain to all the malls It is very convenient due to the place we stay at And apparently the train is also clean as compare to last time Travelling time is also shorter

title: Easy and fast to move around in Bangkok
review: As an expatriate I am frequnelty making use of the skytrain especillay if I have to travel from my home at Sukhumvit 71 (Phra Khanong station) to downtown Bangkok I am also using the Skytrain for shopping trips with my children to the famous MBK Siam Paragon etc which area is always congested by heavy traffic

title: Save time and money, take sky train
review: Fast and easy way to travel Save time and baht getting from place to place You can get change at the station to pay for your tickets and there are plenty of people there to help you figure out your next destination

title: Moving Fast through Bangkok
review: The BTS & MRT are probably the most efficient and effective way to to get around Bangkok  The trains are frequent and clean  I live n Bangkok

title: Best way to travel during peak hours.
review: A clean safe and best way to travel during peak hours at Bangkok However more network shall be constructed to popular tourist shopping and destination area

title: Convenient transportation but it's very cold in the train.
review: It's runs through main area of Bngkok So you can go everywhere you want easily But it's very cold in the cabin You'd better have a long sleeve shirt or thin jacket BTS station has many steps from the road to the platform If you are young it gives you a good exasize but you are old age it will be very hard to walk up

title: The fast transport
review: This is the best way to transport in the heart of Bangkok If you want to go to do something in one day such as business shopping traveling and etc Please buy a ticket for the whole day pass because it's very easy to transport

title: The stairway to sanity in Bangkok!
review: I have now (2013) travelled pretty much every week on the BTS since it opened in December 1999 and I remember from that first day seeing the steps as the way to sanity in what is the chaos of street level Bangkok  It gets very crowded now and the newer Chinesemade trains are not as good quality as the original Siemens trains but the service continues to be generally excellent  To BTS management  PLEASE retain Saphan Taksin station  It is a vital station in the network

title: Forget the traffic jams and travel by Skytrain
review: Although the Skytrain network in not extensive it is very useful for getting to many downtown hotels shopping malls and the Chao Phraya River It operates between 0600 and midnight and gets extremely crowded during rush hour periods (to be avoided if possible) The Skytrain also interchanges with the newer Underground system (MRT) at Silom Sukhumvit and Chatuchak Although the MRT tends to serve more business and local residentialentertainment areas it is useful in that one terminus ends at the Hua Lamphong Railway Station for those travellers visiting upcountry locations by train Both systems are clean airconditioned and (usually) reliable so even if you are in the middle of a crush you know it's for a limited time only

title: cool and on time
review: the skytrain is very good form of transport in BangkokThey are on time and have good air con they can be busy in peak hour  the stations are very clean and easy to travel  and most of all safe

title: BTS trip
review: BTS is a great way to browse around Bangkok but please avoid traveling office start and end hours It is terrible time to travel 89am and 56pm

title: Confusion but Clean and Safe
review: No elevators at most of the stations so be sure you are strong enough to carry your luggages up and down through stairs Don't be surprised when doors open opposite site  to the announcementSometimes trains are overcrowded just because some passengers enjoyed their cell phones or tablets Overall  trains are clean and safe Enjoy your ride

title: Fast cheap service
review: Not like the ripoff taxi's & no traffic jams  I used the metro a fair bit & used the Slytrain when going to the airport so efficient & on time (far removed from that tosh we have to put up with in the UK)  Easy to navigate & FREEZING aircon  Highly recommended & as other say the only way to get around BKK

title: Great way to travel to tourist spots
review: This is ideal for people who want to see the main tourist sites that avoid the traffic congestion It is also the best way to get to Central World MBK and the main pier on the river The ticket price is 40Bt which is obtained from coin machines and if change is required there are note change booths at all stations However a travel card is worth buying to avoid having queue for tickets For the river get off at Saphan Thaksin and it is a short walk to the pier The best way to the Grand Palace is to take the river taxi which cost very little and the money is collected when on board The river taxis are frequent and identified by a loud whistle on arrival at the pier just follow the queue and enjoy the river If you find you are in need of a taxi make sure you say taxi meter and it is on the met should show 35Bt if not then get out and get another taxi I have visited Bangkok many times

title: BTS
review: Easiest safest and coolest way to get around the big mango Always super clean (no food or drink allowed) but is beginning to get overcrowded due to its huge popularity super aircon and relatively cheap tickets More carriages needed  especially during the peak times  but no signs of this happening yet Trains are frequent and regular and recently gates have been introduced at Siam (main interchange) to aid in the queuing system and provide added safety Watch out for the automated gates at the ticket machines  if you a not fast enough getting through they can give you a nasty bruise Love the interchange with the airport express at Phayathai  central Bkk to suvarnabhumi airport for 90baht

title: best means of transport in city
review: It can get crowded on the skytrain to the point where you are likely to ride standing rather than sitting But this is the most convenient safest and cheapest method of getting around the main part of town It is being extended to further points in the city though most of the areas tourists will go are already covered It is a bit of a pain if you are traveling past On Nut station because the transit authority has not figured a logical way of charging its passengers for the new stations

title: convenient and low cost to many interesting places
review: It is very convenient and cheap to travel in Bangkok by sky trainhe sky train will lead you to many interesting places in BangkokSuch as most of the shopping malls and many hotelsSo if you come to Bangkoktry to choose hotels nearby sky train station because it will make you travel easierSky train in Bangkok is just like underground train in many other countries

title: Best way to go around bkk
review: If you like to see much of bkk but with limited time then i suggest you ride skytrain from end to end Faster cheaper snd convenient Best way also to avoid rush hour traffic You can reach your destination at the time you planned

title: A great view of the city
review: Great views across the city Very efficient  clean great aircon giving relief from the heat and humidity very frequent service and reasonably priced

title: quick and clean
review: Once you have struggled up the stairs you are in for a good rideWhen you learn the stations better you never have to walk up to the top floorExellent value and good service

title: The best way to explore Bangkok !
review: With the sky train or BTS you can reach most of the tourist points in Bangkok  Of course it do not bring you to the Royal Palace  But why don't you try an advanture way starting from BTS Siam Square get out at Sapan Taksin station where it is right by the Chaopraya river  Then pursue to public boats 24 rounds every hours  The boat will bring you to travel to the most famous route of the river around 30 mins to the Royal Palace and the old quarter of Bangkok  Enjoy your trip

title: best way for traveling around
review: Bangkok traffic can be horrible so the skytrain is clean cool and quick Best way to explore this city

title: A good, crowded service
review: Quite a useful service but congested at times and relatively expensive by Thai standards Covers many tourist spots

title: Generally, the best way to get around Bangkok.
review: The BTS Skytrain tends to be our preferred method of travel for getting around Bangkok on most occasions Although taxis are relatively cheap in Bangkok they are of course susceptible to the horrific traffic congestion that the city is famous for A consequence of that is at certain times of day taxi drivers are reluctant to go to some destinations Quite often the simple answer is to to take the ever present and ever reliable Skytrain and if need be complete the final part of your journey by taxi  The BTS system puts the London tube to shame quite frankly It is clean air conditioned and efficient not to mention CHEAP CHEAP The service is very regular and more stations are being constructed at the moment to integrate with the MRT national rail network Already there is a service from Bangkok's international Suvarnabumi airport although I must admit we have yet to try that journey  It is easy to purchase tickets at the BTS stations through the vending machines which although often busy are quick to use (assuming everyone in the queue already knows their destination having looked at the schematic maps that are conveniently posted around the ticket machines) The useful alternative is choose and purchase a credited travelcard from the station ticketing office These can be for one day one week multiple journeys etc There is a great choice of options  If you are intending to be using the Skytrain on and off over a long period the "BTS Sky Smartpass" is a useful option It can be topped up whenever necessary and cashed in on completion (as the credit amount doesn't expire) and it is a quick "touch and pass" entrance at the barriers  Getting to where you want to go is simple Once you are through the barriers there are station maps posted directly in front of you so that you can confirm which platform the go to (depending on which direction you wish to travel and at some of the connecting stations which BTS line you wish to take) On the trains above the doors there are station maps that are illuminated and pinpoint where you are during your journey as well as next station announcements   Access is possible for wheelchairs onto the trains and most if not all stations have lift access as well as the normal escalatorsWhen the system is busy there is a remarkably ordered manner for embarking the trains On the platforms queues form either side of where the train's doors will stop as marked on the platform and disembarking passengers are courteously allowed off before others embark   The Skytrain is a very efficient cheap and reliable service that the Thai people are quite rightly proud of and it is used by many as a routine method of travel I always find it a pleasure to use

title: Not an attraction, but a necessity
review: The BTS (Skytrain) is the most important means of getting around Bangkok without having to deal with street traffic And believe me traffic can be bad  but you never really know where and when  We people living in Bangkok use it all the time   So whenever you can use the BTS (and also the MRT the underground)  Tourist stops of choice  Siam (Paragon Central World change train lines)  Chit Lom (Erawan Shrine lots of hotels Central World Central Chit Lom)  Mo Chit (Jatujak Weekend Market)  Saphan Taksin  Chao Phya River Oriental Shangri La Peninsular and more hotels river cruises etc  Saladaeng  Silom Road Patpong Dusit Thani hotel Lumpini park  National Stadium  MBK shopping center Jim Thompson house

title: The only way to get around BKK
review: Heavy traffic is notorious in Bangkok so if you want to get around quickly and economically the only way to do it is by using the "skytrain" or better known as the BTS

title: Wonderful Bangkok Skytrain!
review: For travellers whether for Business or Pleasure may I wholly recommend CENTERING your Bangkok visit on the excellent SKYTRAIN routes  Officially Bangkok has a population of 9  12 million The Real population is over 20 million There's never been a population Census so numbers are calculated on the amount of garbage the City collects (Really )  Bangkok's Traffic jams are the stuff of legend  Super Slow  Motorcycle taxi stands are everywhere cheap and fast but not much fun in the rain and a bit nervewracking  The canal networks offer speedy transits but take a lot of legend"knowing"  Just Google "Skytrain Bangkok" and a wonderful easy to follow world of clean fast and cheap routes  with truly Excellent Hotel choices to suit every pocket are yours for the canal choosing  The Skytrain links Suvarnabhumi  Bangkok's superb airport (pronounced  "Soo wannapoom") and cheap direct trains take only 20 minutes A wee warningyou can sadly have your luggage 'misplaced' if you check in at the Makkasan Terminus in Bangkok city  Use the Skytrain website to find a conveniently situated hotel check out Shopping stops sometimes right off the Skytrain platform and into the best Malls in the World  All the famous Temples and Palaces are made easily reachable thanks to the Skytrain  Rabbit Passes multipasses which save queueing  excellent value

title: Beat the traffic!
review: The Skytrain was the first attempt to beat the Bangkok traffic The original line has been extended and they are in the process of creating new lines It is a pleasant way to travel across the city because it is fast reliable and offers a view of Bangkok as it is built on elevated rails above the city hence it's name The Sukhumvit line is a valuable asset to make stops along this business thoroughfare But the other line that goes to the Chao Praya River and connects with the taxi boats to go to the old city is a great way to travel through the City of Angels

title: It is great if you are going where it goes.
review: Obtain a map from any station (free) and plot your trip You can obtain a permanent card if you are travelling a lot or you plan to return frequently You load on value and scan it each time you enter or leave the platforms Card stays valid for a considerable time (I have had mine for 4 years) Can be busy at certain times of day and getting a seat is a 50 50 chance at best Still most trips are not that long and it is cheap and frequent

title: Great way to see Bangkok
review: Best mode of travel in Bangkok and no traffic to worry about Trains are clean cool and frequent All stations are written in English as well as Thai so easy to find your way around and staff at the stations are friendly and knowledgeable

title: Rot Fai Fah
review: prices are sneaking up but still good to use and the air con is coldest at 11pm at night hmmm also in 5 years this will be the best form of transport in the world when its all finished

title: Essential to avoid major Bangkok traffic headaches
review: The Skytrain (or BTS in local parlance) is an essential tool for avoiding major vehicular traffic holdups especially at peak times increasingly "peak times" are becoming the norm throughout the day However at peak times the carriages are also very full so you gain from a speedier arrival at the expense of very congested spaces As a visitor it's useful to know the network in relationto where you're staying and where you're going so that you can combine taxiBTStaxi and get to your destination more quickly

title: Does the job
review: Clean cheapish and aircon for a single person If your going in a group to the same place It mite be worth taking a taxi instead

title: Best way to see Bangkok downtown
review: Easiest way to hop around Bangkok especially downtown Avoid bad traffic during peak time Good for shoppers can go all big shopping centers in one day Aree station is recommended for vegan lovers at Bann Aree various options of vegetarian at budget price in a very convenient location 3 minutes walk from BTS

title: Excellent & Convenient
review: It may not be the best choice However it is the most convenient way to travel in Bangkok The traffic jams are Now being extended to cover more stations around Bangkok And can be connected to the Underground Railroad Try not to travel by car or public bus in rush hour

title: Limited access to historic sites
review: The Skytrain provides quick to major shopping areas but you can't really get to the historic sites of interest Also consider traveling during offpeak hours as the rush hour crowds can be unbelievable  The connections with the newer subway line means that you can get off at Hualumpong Station for example and take a tuktuk or taxi to nearby Chinatown and from there to the palaces and other sites of interest in the old city

title: Needs more carriages
review: The skytrain has changed the shape of Bangkok but it is now most of the time so crowded that it is a very unpleasant experience Where possible take the subway which is fa less crowded

title: The way to go.
review: The traffic in Bangkok is horrendous so driving is very difficult and finding a parking place is next to impossible  Therefore for travelling in Bangkok the way to go is by the use of Skytrain that is not held up by excessive traffic is rather quick clean and has ac   In addition there is no need for locating a parking spot  I travel all over the City by Skytrain and leave my Benz under the roof

title: Views of a retired resident
review: Living in Bangkok I use the subway more often than the skytrain  As a senior I get a discount on the metro not on the skytrain  The skytrain is usually more crowded and the need to get change before getting the token to ride a nuisance  The metro system is better but the lines do not follow the tourist route along Sukhumvit Road  But it is is better than using the taxis or buses on the crowded roads

title: The Good, the bad and the ugly
review: I am a longtime resident of Bangkok The BTS system known as the Skytrain is  like many things in Thailand  a good idea poorly executed It is most certainly a very fast way of getting around some areas of Bangkok but there are just two lines and there are vast areas of the city that is doesn't cover or even go near It is cheap to use but if you are a casual user and do not need a stored value ticket (like London's curiously named Oyster Card) you come up against the bizarre practise that the locals probably understand but others do not There are machines that dispense tickets but with most you need change So you have to queue at a window where an always polite employee will give you that change Then you queue again at a machine and buy the ticket easy with the fare chart showing the fare to each station The always polite staff who give you the change will also sell you a stored value or daily ticket but not sell you a single ride ticket As I say this probably makes perfect sense to the Thais but baffles everyone else So far so good The bad is that the system is grossly overcrowded often even outside of the rush hours and it is not unusual to have to let one or more trains go before you can squeeze on board The good here is that the longest wait between trains is five minutes and because the system is small the journey time for most is rarely more than 15 minutes or so Why it is so crowded is because the trains are far shorter than the platforms They have recently expanded from three car to four car trains but for 500000 riders a day that is absurd compared to other major cities round the world that have eight or 12 cars When it was built like the airport there was absolutely no thought given to how many would use it The ugly is that like in much of Thailand the company operates a racist pricing system Over 60s can get a discounted ticket outside of the rush hours but only if they are Thai The similar underground railway system allows anyone the discounted fare regardless of race I invited the BTS to explain and justify their policy but alI I received was a stony and predictable silence

title: Great Value
review: Getting around Bangkok on the Sky train is the only way to go It is very clean gets you to most of the attractions with trains every few minutes You can buy a day pass for 130 baht which gives you unlimited travel until 1200 pm excellent value Taxis are very cheap but the traffic is unbelievable Staff are all very helpful advising which station to get off at or openning barriers when carrying luggage Also very good for getting to either of the airports with connections either by airport link for Suvarnabhumi  or bus from Mo Chit for Don Muang Airport

title: Sky Train (BTS)
review: Bangkok's Skytrain is a clean cost effectivesafe and reliable way to transit this vast city Easy to use well written and clear signage in English and best of all FAST

title: skytrain bangkok
review: earlier this year we visited Bangkok our hotel was in siam square which was very close to a couple of skytrain stationswe did a number of trips by skytrain to various locations and attractions once you had worked out which station was close to were you were going [there are easy to read maps on the walls at the stations] it was very easy and cheap to buy a ticket and find the right platform the trains leave very regularily so there is little waitingand there are announcements coming into each station you may not always get a seat but there are plenty of straps to hold ontowe found this the fastest cheapest quickest way to get around bangkok

title: Fast and Easy!
review: Getting to and from places in Bangkok is so easy with the sky train If you are staying in the sukhomvit area and would like to visit the main department stores such as Siam Paragon Siam Discovery and MBK the sky train is the best option Air con cabins comfortable reliable and fast

title: Reliable, cheap, clean and easy to use.
review: I live in Bangkok and use the BTS every day It is easy to use and navigate cheap clean and reliable Just look at the boards next to the ticket machines to see your current location where you need to get to and the required fare Either use coins in the ticket machine or go to the kiosk to buy your ticket then through the turnstyles and you're on your way  You can buy passestravel cards rather than individual tickets but there's no cost savings so I don't bother I nearly always have change for the machine and the queues for tickets (when applicable) are never too long  During busy times and when it's raining the BTS is usually quicker than taxis or tuk tuks providing of course that your destination is on one of the main routes If you're a tourists or on a shopping trip then it probably will be

title: skytrain
review: not only the fastest and cheapest way to get across the city its also a great way to see the city the train its self and all the stations are just so clean and immaculate

title: BTS (Bangkok Skytrain)
review: Our retirement home is Bangkok Though we own a car the Skytrain is a blessing to avoid traffic in peak times and key business areas It's clean dependable and very affordable The new overhead walkway linkages to department stores malls hotels and major buildings also make life more pleasant and allows us to breathe less polluted air and avoid the human congestion (normal on Bangkok busy streets) The signage is clearly marked staff are helpful and they will even open a gate for you if you have a stroller or a large bag   It has also helped reduce some traffic congestion so we also benefit even when we drive )

title: Imagine Bangkok without Skytrain
review: I visit Bangkok almost every month by car First thing I do park the car at the hotel and just leave it there until the day I am leaving Bangkok Using the Skytrain is the way to conquer this vibrant raucous untamed city it's easy to find your way even for a first time visitor There are times when the stations and the trains get pretty crowded but Thais in generell are disciplined and courteous when using the Skytrain unfortunately this does not apply when they are driving a bike or a car The trains are extremely clean no graffitis no garbage air conditioned and comfortable

title: Downtown commuter
review: The best way to travel in downtown Bangkok  You can avoid the allday hassle and bumpertobumper traffic  It's cool clean and save lots of time Look for the escalator to avoid scaling up the high stairway

title: Best way of transportation in big mango city!
review: To avoid the most terrible traffic of South East Asia take the sky train who stays the most convenient as well fastest way of transportation in Bangkok Such a great idea also to feel and touch the Thai touch with locals taking it on daily basis Just be aware you cannot eat drink inside of the train itself as well as soon you had passed the gate to access to the train A good way to see the mess in matter of traffic as well the impossible to describe arichitecture of Bangkok Always clean and on time

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: The Bangkok Skytrain is greatconvenient easy to use and inexpensive  Buy a rabbit card if you will be using it more than just once or twice

title: A pleasant use in an otherwise congested city.
review: The Skytrain is hands down the fastest and most convenient way to travel around Bangkok We very quickly learned that taking a taxi or Tuk Tuk from anywhere along Sukumvit Rd ended in gridlock The Skytrain bypasses all that and proved to be a very efficient and reliable means of transpo Upon our departure to the international airport we took the Skytrain directly to the terminal a far cheaper and relaxing ride than a taxi

title: A Hop On Hop Off Sightseeing of Bangkok
review: Whether you have a full day or few hours the Bangkok Transit System or commonly known as the BTS can be a perfect choice to see the city  The BTS crossed in Siam Square where the Paragon Department Store is located and span across the Sukhumvit Road all the way to the JJ Market in one line also starts from MBK Mall to Sathorn Road across the Chao Phya River  Best to choose the route near your hotel and enjoy the sight and sound of Bangkok  The BTS starts sometime around 600 am however anytime after 900 am would be a good time to venture around town with BTS without having to fight for standing space on the sky train  There are few stops that are worthwhile to spend time in walking around eg Siam Square Saladaeng Asoke Taksing Bridge and the JJ Market  Before boarding check whether they have any promotion rate for tourist for that day  Even if you pay full price the experience is worth the cost of the ride  You may buy a ticket that allow you to hop on and hop off without having to buy new ticket which can be irritating

title: Skytrain - 1st class
review: Fast efficient (sometimes crowded) however very convenient with stations at strategic spots around town Make sure you have coins and deciphering the ticket advice can be interesting when determining where you want to go

title: Skytrain Bangkok
review: We found the skytrain in combination with Bangkok's underground the best way to move around that city Skytrain stations are at the most important areas that one needs  it is inexpensive and ticketing machines & advice simple to understandApart from an internal map inside the train showing where you are each station is announced well ahead of time

title: Changed the City
review: The Skytrain allows you to plan meetings and arrive on time without hassle The system works efficiently is clean is safe and is well located for so much of Bangkok's business centres Buy a pass to save lining up for tickets and watch the fast closing gates as you walk through the gates Read the maps so you take the correct exit as the walkways can get you to most buildings in sheltered comfort Peak hour can be busy

title: Best way to get around
review: A frequent and efficient way to get around and it covers the shopping and entertainmant areas of Silom (Sala Daeng) Siam Square and all the way along Sukhumvit Road the weekend market is at Mo Chit but you are better off using the MRT for this and getting off at Kamphaeng Phet which is right inside the market It is incredible to think that this has been in operation for more than 10 years  still so clean wellmaintained and graffittifree It is quite busy all of the day and probably should be avoided at rush hours Tickets are only available from coinoperated machines but the cashiers will give you change if you do not have the right coins  and currently the machines do not accept 2 baht coins The interchange station at Siam is very busy with queues to get on the escalators but its not too bad A bit expensive by Thai standards but should be within the budget of most travellers Tickets are not valid on the MRT (underground) and separate tickets have to be bought for this

title: Frequent service, easy & good value
review: The BTS Skytrain is one of Bangkok's most efficient and cost effective forms of transport With one train every three minutes during the day there is little waiting Air conditioning gives respite from the constant Bangkok heat and it travels to many major city attractions

title: Very convenient
review: It's a must to use sky train during your visit to Bangkok Traffic are very bad  taking taxi bus tuktuk will take longer time to travel

title: Great transportation
review: The skytrain is very useful in Bangkok it has aircon and is very clean It is also quite cheap and it crosses the main attractions in Bangkok especially the business center

title: Easiest way to get around
review: Living in Bangkok we had our own car but still used the sky train to get around It's clean efficient and safe but best if all you avoid the traffic

title: Easy to navigate, clean, safe, friendly.
review: A must for quickly navigating this traffic filled city  I even choose my hotel based on the proximity of the nearest BTS stop My favorite area to stay is close to the Chong Nonsi BTS

title: Skytrain brings you everywhere
review: For europeans easy to manage One thing is the temperature in the trains  it could be 34 degrees higher When you come from outside you are really shocked about the low temperature inside

title: Excellent Transport
review: The SkyTrain in Bangkok is the most effective and affordable way of getting around in Bangkok The stations are placed very convenient for shopping and site seeing Currently the SkyTrain doesn't cover the whole of Bangkok but then you can travel by the subway However the ticket systems for the two lines are not compatible and may create a little bit of irritation having to carry two different tickets

title: Limited network but goes to most of the places you will want to!
review: Noisey with aggravating adverts blaring out and a limited route network which in fairness is being extended the skytrain offers am affordable quick and easy way to get to most if the key points in the city

title: the only way to get where you need to go without any hassles.
review: in a city that is infamous for its chaotic traffic taking the BTS Skytrain eliminates all of that  trips across greater BKK that used to take 3+ hours are now easily and comfortably achieved in 30 minutes  although there are only 2 lines in operation currently for a tourist most locations of interest to tourists are reached by the BTS and even more when connecting with the MRT subway system  reasonably priced clean and sanitary air conditioned and rarely delayed the BTS has become the ride of choice for locals and tourists alike  discount cards for multiple trips are available as well  most staff speak understandable English

title: Fast way of getting around, clean and low cost
review: The skytrain in Bangkok is probably the fastest way to get around in the city The only disadvantage still is the limited areas the lines cover Since there are only two lines operational yet (more to come) they only cover a limited part of the city But if you travel in these areas the skytrain are a nice cool clean and fast method of transport Fees are very much acceptable

title: Skytrain, noisy and full
review: The skytrain is nothing special Because of advertising by TV's and loudspeakers it's unpleasantly noisy During rushhours you can't at many plces board the train too full  But you'll need to use it anyway no good alternatives

title: I wish all cities had the Skytrain
review: I very rarely use any other transport other than the Skytrain in Bangkok (BTS) It is fast efficient and cheap also means you can avoid the manic traffic  It is also very clean as you are not allowed any food or drink on board I have used the BTS with friends with family with my husband and also alone  I love it

title: Most convenient mode of transport.
review: If you have to go from one place to another in Bangkok Skytrain is the most convenient Less time consuming and hassle free Just tell the ticket counter where you want to go and the staff will guide you to nearest station where you should get off We enjoyed going around in it

title: Really good mass transit, with AC
review: Remember sweltering in traffic before BTS was operational  Now it's a breeze to get around With the subway and airport connections BKK has to have one of the better systems around  Minuses  watch out for rush hour as you may not be able to board  Some stations do not have escalators or elevators up  Hauling luggage can be a struggle  Station agents are very helpfulGet the multiple ride pass and skip the ticket machines

title: fast
review: i always like to take the skytrainbecause you can reach fast and secure many attractionsand you have a free sightseeing tour in bangkok

title: Sky train the only way to get around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain  MRT system is very reliable and cheap If you are only going one stop buy a single ticket If you plan to trip around Bangkok grab a pass They come in different value amounts The Skytrain lifts you above the traffic and gets you to 80% of the places your need quickly comfortably and without fuss If your game couple this with motorbike taxis to et exactly where you need to be

title: Excellent
review: Great service Highly recommended All the train are clean and nice on cool One of my favourite thing in Bangkok

title: Skytrain Effeciency
review: I have been using the Skytrain in Bangkok since its inception  This is a clean efficient inexpensive and reliable mode of transport  In conjunction with the MRT this is the only way to get around Bangkok and avoid the traffic jams

title: Convenient
review: It's a very convenient way to travel around Bangkok for tourists There are some tips you should be aware of 1 There are 2 main lines the National Stadium line and the Sukhumvit line Each runs both ways They intersect at "Siam station" If you're not sure where you are just go to that station and start over You're not going to be charged extra as long as you don't get out from the BTS area (I mean returning the ticket) 2 If you are unaccustomed with the ticket machine you can just go to the ticket counter and ask for a ticket directly 3 Beware of the rush hours Bangkok may not be as crowded as Tokyo but it's not far behind 4 They are building new stations at the moment So There might be some station names that you've never heard of and don't know where they lead to It's a little confusing if you ask me Just don't panic and you'll be fine Besides Thai students are always around the BTS (In uniform) Most of them speak English well and you can always ask for direction )

title: Best value
review: Bangkok sky train like many major cities is the best way to travel safe clean and assistance available in English the only draw back is many of the sign direction at stations can be misleading They are written with the assumption the traveler knows the direction what I mean is you will get to many plant forms with just 23 minutes to orientate yourself There are not train personnel on the platform to assist you if you find yourself lost The prices are great But buy through the machines can be worrisome dependent upon the type and age of the machine Each terminal is loaded with "back packers" who in my opinion are the best source of help and information Sky train is safe clean and Well maintained

title: Getting around town
review: The BTS is the most convenient way to get around this very busy city It is fast  efficient and very  clean If you staying for a while buy the BTS card and top it up saves so much time when traveling too many long queue's at the ticket machines

title: BTS _ SKYTRAIN
review: The BTS is the fastest way to visit the BKK Center avoiding traffic and waste of time queuing around ticket costs 15 to 45  60 bath depending from your departure point major shopping mall are located directly in the BTS exits in Phrom Phong (Emporiun) Asok (Terminal 21)  Chit Lom (Central)  Siam (Paragon) and National Stadium (MBK)

title: Love it
review: Fastest way to move around city  Be sure to have plenty of coins in advance coz tickets are bought in machines and queues for exchanging bills for coins can be pretty big

title: It is the only way during rush hours!!
review: The Skytrain is a well run safe and inexpensive way to glide over Bangkok traffic jams  Taxis are inexpensive but often will not take you where you need to go  The Skytrain always takes you

title: very convenient.
review: Skytrain is very convenient and not expensive Air conditioned too Adverts may be a little loud but that's a Thai thing Good service to and from the airport too

title: Skytrain the fastest way to move in Bangkok.
review: The best and fastest way to travel in Bangkok as long as your destination is not too far from the lines It is possible to get "one day pass" for 120 bath per person pe day

title: See Bangkok from the Skytrain!
review: Taking the Skytrain is absolutely worth it even if you have no real reason to take it From the Skytrain you can see BKK from above The ride takes you through tons of interesting quarters of the city where you can see everything from glittering temples to contemporary sky scrapers Some of my best and most memorable images in my mind of BKK are from the Skytrain It is quite similar to the aboveground sections of Paris' metro

title: Perfect way to travel around bkk
review: Perfect way to travel around bkk it can get ver crowded at times around 810am & 47pm when ppl are traveling to and from work

title: best way to get around
review: provided you want to go fromto a place on the line there are no faster or more convenient way to travel in bkk you fly over the jam get a rabbit card to avoid the quest on rush hour

title: Skytrain
review: Skytrain (BTS) is a very convenient transport in Bangkok the local traffic in Bangkok is worse and worse you get in the skytrain without delay to your destination  You can transfer from BTS to MRT (Subway) and  or Airport Rail Link  BTS  operates daily from 0600 â 2400 hrs

title: Very good and convenient
review: This is a fabulous way to get around Bangkok  the lines go to most of the usual attractions and are cheap  clean and very frequent

title: A chance to see the city from another perspective
review: First dos and don'ts Do not travel at peak timesIt goes to the Airport but frankly unless you are a frequant travler I would advise using a standard tax meter taxithe coloured ones It is fast and comfortable and will give you a good look at Bangkok from aboveObtaining tickets is straight forward and inexpensiveTHey are clean  well kept very quiet  smooth andCertainly not claustrophobicAll signs are in both Thai and English so no worries PS I live in Thailand

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: There are many ways to get around Bangkok scooter taxi tuk tuk river taxi and regular taxi but by far the best and air conditioned as well is the skytrain Fast and reliable clean and cheap

title: I am a resident here in Thailand and Lived in Bangkok for 7 years. Now I live in the NorthEast province of Ubon Ratchath
review: The Sky train is a the local city transport system and they also have the underground called the MRT Both services pretty much covers Bangkok Very easy to get around in  Its better to use this service than taxi or bus because the traffic is horrendous in the city Reading the train map and connections is very easy The staff at the stations are very help this also includes the security guards who are all eager to help with a smile    The trains fares vary from destination to destination and all electronic ticket style card machines are in English as well You just cannot get lost The train system is not as big as London or New York but it serves Bangkok well  As mentioned I am a full time resident here in Thailand so the dates that has been mentioned  is incorrect because that's how far the tripadvisor goes back to August 2012 I have been here since February 2004

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Excellent way of getting around in Bangkok but avoid rush hours 08000900 and 17001930 hrs when it can get pretty crowded

title: A nice way to travel
review: The sky train is the easiest way to travel bangkok s overly congested streets and they are clean and air conned so a nice respite from the heat and humidity of thailands capital The sky train takes in most of bangkok s downtown and also has a airport stop for those who don't want to sit in traffic A great way to see bangkok

title: Exxtremely convinient mode of transport
review: The Bangkok Sky Train and MRT are two of the best ways to enter the city right from Airport The Network is being expanded however its adequate enough to reach main shopping destinations office areas and places of interest Its very cost effective and fast (as there is no dependancy on traffic) Would highly recommend for the people on their shopping spree and business related work

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Revolutionising transportation in Bangkok for almost 14 years Quality construction and almost faultless in use the BTS Skytrain is now a victim of its own success Solid with passengers most of the day with Siam Station struggling to cope with the sheer volume However there is no real alternative unless you have all day for a relatively short journey Extended over the river into Thonburi and almost all the way south to Bang Na Buy a "stored value ticket" and travel when you like for several days If you don't get off you can travel and sightsee Bangkok getting off the train anywhere with no charge or penalties just pay the distance to your final destination Probably the most economical sightseeing trip in the world A mixture of the original Siemens trains with new Chinese ones Try and imagine what it was like without it all day for a trip to MBK

title: Skytrain
review: Certainly beats the traffic although slower than the MRT (underground)  Also note the stations are open air so expect the sweat on most days if waiting at any station  Extremely crowded and chaotic than MRT

title: Skytrain
review: Excellent speedy and frequent service across the city  Can be regularly used in conjunction with the river ferry network  Simple to use no problems with change as the desk will always provide the necessary coins for your trips A great experience in itself

title: Takes you where you need to go
