review: The BTS Skytrain is a great form of public transportation to get to and fro around Bangkok  The trains stop at most major areas are are either right where you need to go or only a block or 2 away  Very clean and very affordable  Get a 1 day pass with unlimited rides  The kiosks and machines can be a little confusing to the first timers  There is security always around to keep things safe at all hours of the day and night  The same goes for the MRT (subway)  The BTS stations all have little shops and places to get snacks and drinks  Many even have restrooms and camera shops travel agents etc

title: Efficient and clean
review: I was very impressed with the skytrain on our last visit to Bangkok  The trains are punctual clean and nice and cool due to the air conditioning inside  I was surprised to step out of the intense heat and into cooled comfort  The train stops along all of the major parks and shopping areas and is very convenient if you are staying in central Bangkok    I was traveling with an 18 month old on the last trip and had a strollerbuggy which wasn't the greatest for maneuvering around the city anyway but I found that many of the stops had elevators although these could be difficult to find at times

title: Easy travelling within the city
review: Well a city like Bangkok of course also needs an adequate public transport system Especially as the streets are already packed the air is polluted While there are busses available they have to deal with same traffic conditions So a skytrain was the best the government could came up with and so it's the fastest easiest and perhaps also sustainable way to travel within Bangkok city

title: Fantastic
review: Best travelling tip is to stay somewhere close to transport and the BTS is fantastic transport  We purchased a 15 trip rabbit card which is great value  The BTS can take you basically anywhere in Bangkok in relative comfort and with high efficiency

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: Fast and easy way to get around in Bangkok Trains run very frequently Stations are near to many attractions some such as Paragon Centre accessed direct from the platform Changing lines simple and signs good when you get used to the map Using coins for tickets cumbersome but when you know the coinage and check fare on the machine quite acceptableFind out about day tickets etc Fares are very cheap compared with taxis and usually quicker Important  can be crowded so don't hang back grab a seat when you can

title: A Blessing to First Time BKK Visitors
review: Did plenty of research online before visiting Bangkok for the first time and because I & my companions were traveling independently it was a blessing to have the BTS easily accessible from the hostel we stayed in (Lub D Siam Square)  I was able to plan our entire 4day itinerary by building it around the BTS stations that were were gonna get off of (or take train transfers from)    The two BTS lines (Silom & Sukhumvit) are also interconnected with the MRT subway system and the boat station transfers are pretty seamless so we were able to pretty much do the very touristy things that any first time visitor is bound to do by simply taking public transport without having to deal with Bangkok's monstrous traffic jams  If you plan to use the BTS in the span of 1 day do get the 1day pass to save up on fare (unlimited rides for 1 day)  The BTS only operates until midnight so if your flight is coming in later than that you have no choice but to take a cab (which we did) or a bus to get to your hotel for our departure we were able to travel from our hostel to the airport via BTS and the Airport Rail Line (interchanged at Phaya Thai station) and travel was a breeze took us a mere 45 mins and saved us a few hundred bahts

title: The only way to travel!
review: Convenient fast and able to get to most locations without a traffic jam try the BTS Even for the new traveller this network is easy to navigate and has both English and Thai explanation at ticket machines or staff on standby to help with change or information

title: Fab travel on Skytrain
review: We travel to Bangkok often and love getting around the city via Skytrain quick cheap reliable and immaculately clean Also very cool in a vibrant but very hot city The Skytrain link from Bangkok airport to the city is also excellent and far quicker than taking a taxi to the city centre when you are shattered after a long haul flight We travel independently and have found it just as easy as using a travel agent and far more fun We have stayed in many areas of the city on our many visits so that we can get to know it better and  to recuperate from jet lag for a few days before travelling around different parts of Thailand   However if one wants an easy time of going out shopping from ones hotel try Hotel Asia it is a bit older and more dated than some but it has the advantage of having a Skytrain station (Ratchetewi my spelling is probably not accurate) immediately outside its second floor so it is a matter of leaving one lot of air conditioning into another and when coming back with loads of shopping its straight off Skytrain into the hotel Easy Also try the weekend market at Chatterchuck Again very easy from Hotel Asia aboard Skytrain It is a huge market but beware easy to get lost in it if you dont have a good sense of direction Thailand is a fascinating place and its people are lovely truly 'The Land of the Smile'

title: Easy, Safe and very convienient
review: if you carry a map of the BTS and MRT (BTS is skytrain and MRT is Underground) I am sure you would not need to take taxi or alternate transport for you trip  In Bangkok where the traffic can be chaotic most of the times this is a boon for travellers

title: Efficient
review: Very effective travel system around the city The roads are very bad in the city for traffic so having the sky train is essential for a modern city Although there's not many lines now they are extending and making new lines Long may the expansion continue  The AC is superb is such a hot city

title: BTS- lifeline of Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is the safest most comfortable and convenient way to get around Bangkok  a comfortable ride through central Bangkok  lifting commuters above the chronic congestion noise and pollution of the streets below  There are two BTS line 1) Silom line 2) Sukhamvit line SILOM LINE runs west to south between the National Stadium in the Siam shopping area to Wongwian Yai in ThonburSUKHUMVIT LINE runs north to east from Mo Chit to Bearing

title: Easy and cheap transport
review: Easy to use Ticket machines have english options to make it easier Always felt safe and very convenient

title: Quick easy to navigate
review: We used this a few times to get quickly around Bangkok quick cheap and easy to use Would recommend

title: Easy to use, safe comfortable and fast
review: This is a tourists dream in Bangkok  If you are use to mass transport systems this is no different and signage is clear and easy to read  No traffic jams and speedy travel in a congested city

title: fastest form of transportation
review: Definitely the fastest way to reach any corner of Bangkok if the sky train goes there Itâs fast and very comfortable In fact if you plan to travel a lot during a particular day buy a day ticket it will fall cheaper

title: Excellent way of beating the traffic
review: Skytrain's got to be one of the better public transit systems in the region if not the world The trains are very clean and the Thais certainly know their public transport manners very well The tickets are also very reasonablypriced but during offpeak hours when traffic's a little smoother taking a cab might be a cheaper option of getting around town The system also covers a large area of Bangkok and a good number (but not all) of popular tourist attractions in the city  BTS is great but one thing I wish they could improve on only some of the stations are equipped with escalators it'd be nice if they provided them at all their stations An extension is also overdue another line or two wouldn't hurt really considering that many parts of Bangkok are still beyond the reach of its mass transit systems (MRT & BTS)

title: The sky is the place to be
review: Arrived in bangkok and got a taxi to Thanon Suhkumvit where my hotel was The taxi trip was hell Gridlocked traffic was crazy I looked overhead to see the Bts skytrain going past Got to my hotel dropped off my luggage and proceeded to explore Got to the Asoke Bts station Working out where to buy a ticket and how much was very easy as there are a lot of posters showing you If you get confused you can always ask a guard or the information booth people (who also changed your notes to coins as the ticket machines only take coins) The trains themselves are fully air conditioned and was a welcome relief from the humid bangkok weather The station stops are broadcast in the train in both thai and English so there is no chance to miss your station If you travel during rush hours (Work and school times) then be prepared for a tight squeeze I travelled sometimes during the rush It's an adventure seeing how many more people can squeeze into an already packed train Reminds me of the mini car with all the dwarfs in it Packed in like sardines Still an enjoyable experience as the thai people are so laid back and relaxed   Tldr use the skytrain to beat the traffic but be prepared for the squeeze during peak hours

title: BTS at Asoke
review: Close to my hotel the Rembrant and easy to get to all areas One station to Emporium shopping and only a couple of stops to Siam

title: do yourself and environment a favour and take the skytrain
review: Forget TukTuks the free streaming pollution will kill you Forget taxis unless you have a long novel to read Get up on the sky train and speed to your destination Catch up on what young Bangkok is up to and where they are going during your rideSave time and the planet at  the same time

title: Very convenient
review: Just watch the tv for the station you want to get out because you will not understand to announcement

title: Skytrain to many places
review: Fantastic way to get aboutnot too dear though buses are cheaperHowever the skytrain is superbly efficientvery safe and runs very frequently There are Securicor guards on every platform and antiterrorist checksThere are 2 stations which connect with the equally efficient Subway trains(sign symbol a letter 'M')With a recent extensionit not only goes to the Chao Phrya river(Satorn station)where you can connect with a very cheap public ferry(great way to see Bangkok) but now carries on ACROSS the river to Wong Wian Waisoon to go even further away from the riverThe ticket macines take Thai 10 baht coins or 5 baht coins(change available from nearby office window)You can also take a skytrain to Chatuchak satsun marketthe biggest you'll ever see selling everything you could possibly wantJust secure your valuables before going into the busy alley ways as pickpockets are activeNo trouble otherwise and very safe

title: the best transport in bangkok but....
review: missed the train don't worry the next train will be reaching very soon it's really the fastest transport to travel around the city Only that the machines receive only coins of 10baht and 5 baht very troublesome especially during peak hours and also it's more expensive than taking taxi

title: Inexpensive, safe and easy to navigate
review: The stops of the 2 skytrain lines are at locations convenient to tourist sites Skytrain has ac and a very easy system in each train to know which station you are at Try to get a 30 day15 trips pass to save some funds and the hassle of having to "top up" the card (can only be bought at the ticket counter not at machine) and if you need to pair it with an MRT pass for the metro (3day tourist pass for MRT is THB 230 also bought at ticket counters at MRT stations) Between skytrain MRT and a few THB for ferries you can cover all sites in Bangkok

title: Clean, easy to use
review: Very clean easy to use great way to get around Bangkok esp during rush hours Much more crowded during rush hours however it's still my preferred choice  People are very polite and line up no pushing and shoving

title: Convenient alternative to cabs
review: 5 years seem like a long time in BKK The subway is a whole lot more crowded than we remember  And the jams were far worse too  There were several occasions when taking a cab or even the Tuk Tuk was impractical because of the severity of the jams so we had to take the Skytrain instead  We found it rather easy to navigate and figure out which train to take and where to alight though  that would depend on your experience with subway systems  Based on the times we took the Skytrain it was always packed even during non peak hours  Needless to say it's worse during peak hours  If you had planned a shopping trip then it might be wise to stay at a hotel near the major shopping areas to avoid commuting during jams

title: Above the Congestion
review: Take the Skytrain whenever possible  It is well run clean fully staffed and easy to understand Prices are very reasonable  I only wish that it would go to more areas  Loved it

title: Great way to travel around BKK, wish there were more lines
review: Love love love it as it is new wellmaintained and reasonably priced A few things to improve More frequant trains during rush hours More extensions to more remote locations

title: Modern thai train
review: Cheap fast easy and good Brings you to places like Asoke Ekkamal Thong Lo Chachuchat and many more tourist attraction places

title: easy to use
review: easy to use buy tickets and quick mode of transport Peak hours can get really crowded  Good connectivity to important locations and malls

title: best way to move in Bangkok
review: always easy to move around Bangkok crowded during peak hours but still much better than being stuck in a taxi in a traffic jam

title: Skytrain the way to go
review: Very easy to use although often requires quite a bit of stair climbing Some stations have easytouse ticket machines that take notes but otherwise you need 10 or 5 baht coins Most rides cost between 15 and 40 baht The ticket office at each station is happy to give change if needed They are also happy to help with directions Twice we bought 'allday' passes for 130 baht but it was hard to get enough rides in to make it economical However it did save queueing for tickets The major drawback (if you can call it that) is that there is no station near the major temple complexes However it's easy and great fun to take the Skytrain to the river and then catch an orangeflagged river boat that drops you off (at stop 9) right outside the Grand Palace

title: Good train
review: Fast train no problem with trafficjams If you alone it's the perfect way to move around the city But if you are couple you can take taxi

title: effective and comfy cold air inside1
review: just quick and effective and easy just 20 bath from silom to national stadium( Siam center) and Siam Paragon and MBK center

title: So convenient and easy to use
review: Safe and easy to navigate  look for a hotel as close to the Skytrain as possible and make the most of your time in Bangkok

title: 1st class
review: On time and was very cheap way to get around clean very fast as from the weekend market to Lumpini Park it got us there in around 15 mins or so

title: First tip to travel in Bangkok - get the Skytrain
review: There's no doubt that the traffic in BKK will get you down But everything changes when you get to the Skytrain The problem for casual Skytrain users is that each time you take a new journey you have to buy a ticket Apart from waiting in long queues this requires having the right coins in your pocket or another trip to the change office The simplest way to travel is to get the Skytrain Pass for easy progress through the ticket lines (The Skytrain Pass has recently changed to become the Rabbit Pass) The pass will save you lots of time in the queues and can be used in other outlets too  Purchase the Rabbit at the Change Office for 200 baht with 150 baht credit (this is an introductory price so be cool with any changes after 31December 2012)

title: Easy access
review: Loved that it is easily accessible dislike it that I have to go to the counter to get coins before lining up at the machine to purchase the tokens But this is a small issue

title: Great way to get around
review: I don't know how Bangkok survived before the invention of the sky train Busy yet clean and cool great way to get around the city and connect with the MRT

title: Bangkok BTS
review: Very crowded most of the time but it is made up by the frequency of the trains  Much faster than the taxi if travelling within the city area

title: Not so perfect
review: if you are alone its good A family would rather prefer risking getting ripped by a cabbie instead of walking to the station walking up paying quite a bit waiting  3  7 minutes  then walking again  the pros are that it beats the Bangkok traffic and the Aircon is a relief on a hot day

title: Easy to get around
review: The Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok Quick and clean and once you get the hang of how it runs it is a breeze to get around Very inexpensive for the value

title: Great way to travel the city
review: The skytrain is not as extensive as it should be (yet) but it does take you quickly to some great places  It is also great to get on train just to cool down the cars are absolutely arcticlike

title: To expand!
review: It's a nice idea now they have to invest some billions to build more lines till then not too usefull

title: Clean safe and Cheap
review: When in BKK you have the BTS and MRT they are both clean super cheap and usually cheaper that taking a taxi   Very efficient and highly recommended

title: Efficient travel
review: easy to hop on and off  stations are easy to access even for disabled people Relatively esay to navigate from the airport so highly recommended if you do not want the hassle of taxi drivers

title: TRANSPORT WITH A VIEW
review: This is the best way to travel around Bangkok its clean safeand so easy to use Last time we took the train to the Big market took no time to get thereolso you can view so much of the city as you travel along Never be afraid to use the Skytrain its very safe

title: The Best Public Transport I've Used!
review: I used to live in Bangkok and the BTS is essential for most locals It'll get you to most places you need to go in a fairly good amount of time especially compared to driving It's air conditioned which is nice for Bangkok heat and is attached to lots of shopping centers and hotels via its SkyWalk My dad and I are mall rats and would use our BTS cards (we got them before the Rabbit card was invented I recommend you get one of those if you visit now no matter how long your trip) to go through the Chit Lom BTS station and on to the SkyWalk for shopping If you go to Bangkok I recommend you try to skip the sometimesscamming taxis and use the Skytrain as much as possible to beat the mad traffic

title: Quick, cheap, easy but limited
review: This is a very quick easy cheap and stress free way to get around the new modern part of Bangkok But it is limited to this side of Bangkok only so if you want to get to the old part where grand palace is etc then it is no good for you Shame it doesn't go round all the city but it is still excellent t and very easy to use

title: Brilliant
review: I loved the sky train It was a novel way to travel for me and ver comfortable It only takes about 15 minutes from the airport to just inside Bangkok It is fast and the view is excellent It really feels like you are flying as you can see the whole city pass below you and the train itself is very quiet Great fun overall

title: Easy and cheap to get around
review: I found the Skytrain to be the cheapest and easiest way to get about in Bangkok As long as you have a map of the different stations and lines you won't have a problem  It is regular and has icy cold air conditioning  Don't spend half a day in taxis or tuk tuks just hop on the skytrain

title: the best public transportation in Bangkok
review: A very fast very often clean and cheap transportaion 2 lines Silom & Sukhumvit with a lot of stations Not depending on the famous Bangkok traffic Jams

title: Great way to get around
review: Great clean and COOL way to get around the city a little packed but there are so many services you can get anywhere and is easy to work out

title: The way to get around
review: This is the way to get around Bangkok Really easy and fast The locals will help you with the tickets if you need it

title: Easy to navigate
review: We purchased a Rabbit Card for 100 baht (50 baht refundable when returned)  we topped up the card 100 baht a time This enabled us to avoid long lines in the busy periods After each journey the machine told you what amount was left on the card The sky train was so easy to use and so clean The trains are also air conditioned which is so nice in the Bangkok heat You can get to almost all locations using the sky trains along with the river boats

title: Fast, cool, efficient.
review: Easy to use and navigate just a pity it doesn't access a wider area of Bangkok Easy to connect to Metro and Airport Express Not particularly cheap for short journeys

title: quick service
review: I liked that there was very short waiting time for trains I wish there were escalators at every station sometimes the stairs were  very steep

title: Can't live without it now.
review: Now I cango out during the dayBefore the skytrain traffic made me a virtual prisoner of the area I was staying

title: Great for Southeast Asian Standards
review: Very modern trains to the airport however if you are sharing with a friend it is almost the same price or just slightly more expensive to just hire a taxi I love train travel however if the price isn't economically justifiable then it doesn't seem worth the trouble

title: Easy transport around town
review: It is simple easy to use high level transport system clean and efficient and relatively easy to use

title: Relief from the traffic
review: Lots has been already written but again in my opinion this shouldn't be the forum to review public transportation Having said that the trains are clean and the ac blast is a welcome relief from t he humidity  As a family it isn't very cheapyou might be better off with a taxi Also it dependents on where you stay

title: very convinient
review: very convinient and economic as well as very clean and neat  it is very fast  and the ticketing station is very convinient and the service is very nice and afordable

title: there is more to C in bangkok than the public transport
review: Ok so the train is cool its cheap there is space and there is no traffic so they do provide a good service but i think there is a little more to see in the city than the train service like really who travels all the way to another country just to see the public tansport   Yes you get very good views of the city but you can get better views from one of the many sky bars around bangkok like zeroco the bar made famous from the hangover 2  fun fact during the red shirt protests the millitary used the skytrain as vantage points for snipers to shoot into the crowd

title: Awesome way to get about BKK & CHEAP!
review: Just amazing clean aircon  can get crowded at peak times so watch out for pickpockets & remember to give up your seats for the elderly & monks )

title: Cheap and convenient
review: Much much faster than taxi You should chose a hotel with walking distance to the sky train Ticket is 1530 baht It is a bit crowded but people are polite

title: Great though limited
review: Even the novice traveler can negotiate the best way around downtown Bangkok even though its scope is limited  Signage in both Thai and English are readily understood and there are always helpful Thais around eager to speak English  Crowded at rush hours  Make sure to get coins at the booths on the side before using the automated fare card kiosks in the center of the platform

title: Fastest way to commute around/into heart of Bangkok
review: BTS is definitely the fastest and safest way to commute aroundinto heart of Bangkok  Fastest  Hell yeah you know all how bad the traffic in Bangkok is regardless of time Morning afternoon evening or even late night And if it rains it get twice as worse  Safest  I feel sorry for foreignertourists that get tricked by taxi and tuk tuk (3wheel taxi) I'm not saying all of them are bad but there are plenty of them that like playing trick with you trying to cheat the taxi fee So why not BTS Price is right there You can't cheat the system I believe the fee starts from 15 baht (about $050 USD) and goes up to 40 baht ($ 125) If you like to oneday pass it's 130 baht The great benefit of oneday pass is that you don't need to line up to buy tickets every time that's very convenient especially during rush hours  Trust me you won't be disappointed

title: Bangkok by Skytrain
review: Skytrain travel is cheap quick and no traffic to worry about you just can't fault this systemall the places that one would travel to before Skytrain was by Taxiskytrain takes you to most places that tourist visit and to be honest there is nothing to dislike every train is clean and the service on the station regards ticket ect is very good

title: great
review: sky train was really handyalways on time very clean and comfortable for a short journeyget a day pass

title: easy way to travel around bangkok
review: Take the train for easy access around Bangkok The train is air conditioned and always on time And it is very cheap

title: Cool Train
review: Cool and fast way to travel around Growds can be big at times In expensive way to travel quickly and easily around bangkok connects to MRT as well in areas which allows you to get to other areas as well

title: best way to explore.
review: Best cheap fast cool comfort very efficient  BTS Travelling by taxi is a nightmare with constant traffic jams A waste of time At Victory Monument BTS  go to 1]  Siam station  5 mins 20b Here is Siam Center Siam Discovery Siam Paragon famous MBK just across the road Short walk to Platinum Plaza Pratunam side street market Panthip Plaza and Baiyoke side street shopping 2]  Mo Chit  15 mins 30b Adjoins famous Chatuchuk weekend market 3]  Nana station  10 mins 25b See famous Nana Plaza with discos bars and more  4]  Taksin station  15 mins 30b Adjoining the Chao Phraya riverfront and River City Take escalator down to ferry terminal Free ferry shuttle across the river to Asiatique esplanade at nights  an immense waterfront upmarket centre for music lounges live music bars restaurants boutiques artworks food stalls with excellent Thai Western food desserts and more Good for the family Worth the experience No naughty stuff here 5]  Sukhumvit station  7 mins 25b Explore this place with all it's famous terrific barsnight lifediscos

title: Easy to use and navigate
review: Going around Bangkok is easier with the Skytrain You can go visit the numerous malls go to the airport and see the temples by using the skytrain

title: The choice in Bangkok
review: Skytrain is the way to travel in Bangkok its quick reliable and  most important in summer  it has aircondition You can change you money at the counter (just tell them your destination) and then feed it into the machine if you dont see the route plan on the wall of the train because of rush hour traffic there is one on the back of your ticket

title: If you need to get around BKK, use the Skytrain
review: without a doubt this is the best thing to ever come to Bangkok  It is inexpensive it has air conditioning it is a great place to check out the local populace and it goes wherever you want to go  Use it  You will be glad you did

title: Best Mass Transit
review: This system is fantastic clean cool and efficient it gets you out of the Bangkok traffic It is so easy to get to where you need to go even if you are not a resident One of the best things about Bangkok

title: Simple and Fast Transportation
review: This was the cleanest and best public transportation I have ever been on  The system is cheap easy to use and the trains were very frequent  It was great that the stops were near boarding for water taxis and you could get all over the town using them  The AC was also a huge plus going cross town while keeping cool was a major bonus

title: convenient and efficient
review: The routes are simple and easy to navigate  I only wished that the ticket machines gave the option for multiple ticket purchases  We had to start a new transaction per passenger so for a party of 6 you have to complete the process 6 times  Also the machine only takes 5 and 10THB coins  It can not accept paper bills    In Singapore the train routes are complex and confusing (especially if you need to change trains) for a firsttime visitor but the ticketing process is simpler and faster

title: ultra clean and reliable
review: It doesn't get you everywhere you want to go and it can get crowded but as mass transportation goes in big cities this is a nice clean example

title: The only way to get around in Bangkok
review: Its fast efficient cold and affordable and really the only way to get around in BKK Get a value pass vs a one time ticket and be aware that service stops at midnight

title: Fast and Efficient
review: great to move around fast efficient and clean Great view of the city too Also the people on the train were very helpful when I need information  Thais are great

title: Skytrain is so helpful
review: Very easy to use helpful to get around Bangkok cheapest and easiest way to travel around town Trains are clean and well maintained It makes life easy

title: full, full and full. very short trains, bma is not going to extend the trains
review: full full full full full full full (i have to review 50 words you can guess the rest full full full full full full full this is as nonsence as the country in a whole gets anyway full full full

title: Excellent Transport System
review: Awesome BTS and is very easy to navigate Bangkok because of it You really don't need a taxi to get around Bangkok with their traffic jams being a norm So the BTS makes life much simpler around the CBD

title: Best option to travel in Bangkok - BTS Rocks
review: If you are travelling alone or in a couple you may travel in Bangkok by sky trains as the service is pretty good and in most of the locations the sky train stations what is locally called BTS is connected directly to the reputed big shopping malls so that you can directly enter the same from BTS Reputed malls like Siam Paragon MBK Tokyu etc are all connected with BTS  Specially nowadays the Tuktuk or the local taxis started demanding excessive fares from the tourists and are not interested to go on meter basis Sometimes to travel a distance 2 kms they demand THB300400 which is very high Their new technique is to blame the road jam and ask excessive money from the tourists Thus BTS is a cheaper option for convenient and fast travelling

title: Buy an easypass for a month and you can get anywhere easily
review: Easy on and off and all signs and announcements are in both Thai and English so easy to navigate the city

title: An efficient sky train system
review: The system is quite efficient and cheap But the trains are often crowded especially in the Siam & Chidlom areas

title: SKYTRAIN - A GREAT WAY TO GET AROUND
review: Cheap and very easy to use Air conditioned carriages which were very clean Beats sitting in the Bangkok traffic

title: The most efficient way to get around
review: No doubt the best and most efficient way to get around in a city that no mater what time it is always jam also suggest to take it from the airport

title: SkyTrain Stairs
review: Very few have escalators when needed so beware of heavy bags  stairs stairs and more stairs  Otherwise great efficient clean air conditioned and safe  Get a day pass if you will be using it all day (130 bht) or keep change handy  Most trips costs 2030 bht per and there can be lots of people lined up for change or to get a ticket at the machine

title: Fastest/Coolest/Safest way to get around Bangkok
review: I have just recently left Bangkok and found the BTSSkytrain to be user friendlysafe and a nice cool place to be for when you have had enough shopping And the best part about it its very cheap and don't have to contend with the constant peak hour traffic like the Taxis plus won't try to take you to there friends restaurantgem store  If only we had this level of service in Perth

title: Impressive
review: Fast & incredible easy to get from airport to town centre Nearly new Siemens electric trains Very easy to use & you can't fail to see the stations above the rooftops Good views from stations

title: Easy!
review: Simple to find your way around fast efficient cheap It's easier to buy a ticket if you have a pocket full of change

title: worth the price
review: use the skytrain it is a good way to escape the horror traffic It is useful also for those who want to go to the airport We used the taxi because we did not consider that it was expensive around 15 USD from our hotel in Silom area But the skytrain is a good alternative

title: An easy way to get around
review: Don't be afraid try the Skytrain It was easy to navigate and allowed us to get around town frequently

title: Convenient way to travel within the city!
review: Many of the stations don't have escalators which is very inconvenient for elderly travelers or the one with luggage However a good way to go from one end of the city to another in a time you would probably make a kilometer on the extremely busy roads and the ticket price is very reasonable

title: Taxis are cheaper!
review: It is cheaper to go with taxi if you go between 12 stations and if your group is more than 2  because 12 station will cost 20bath each and if 3 people will be 60bath if you use taxi will cost about 50 bath most of the time it is crowded and office hours will be very crowded for far away places it is good and Airport link is the best

title: Fast and Cool
review: Cheap fast and convenient The AC is so good Day pass is plus but you can pay and ride Fare depend on distance

title: Easiest way to navigate BKK.
review: Clean efficient cheap definitely the logical way to crisscross the Thai capital to avoid the grid lock traffic below

title: Cheap and can drive you anywhere
review: The skytrain is the cheapest way of transport in bangkok and it can drop you off wherever you need It may be crowded and can't get a seat but it's ok

title: Fast and clean
review: Great way to move around bangkok But also the taxis on the river are a great and cheap way to explore the city

title: Make use of the train
review: Train is efficient and easy to use  Make sure you have some coins on you to avoid queueing to change notes  Locals are happy to assist  After the first use is very easy

title: We need this in Canada
review: The sky train was my favourite transportation it goes by frequently there are many stations at important places Very clean and moderne walking into the sky train is like walking into heaven because it is so hot and humid out and the trains are cool and airconditioned

title: Clean and easy
review: Easy way to get around very clean cheap and lots of English signs to help you  it has televisions in the carriages they are air conditioned To buy tickets you put change in the machines and they give you a ticket (there are change booths) and you keep the ticket and use it when you get off

title: Just behind the Hotel.. about 5 mins walk to skytrain link to airport.
review: Like the location You can leave your luggage at hotel after check out Then go for last minutes shopping and then back to airport by Skytrain very convenient

title: Crowded unlike before
review: The lines for the BTS Skytrains have been extended so in recent months it has become far more crowded than just a couple of years ago since the trains have not been upgraded to longer cabins its still affordable travel just do not expect to get seats or much standing room anytime of the day

title: Cheap, clean and fast
review: A good way to get out of the traffic and stops at many of the major shopping areas But if you are travelling with a family it quickly gets cheaper to take a taxi

title: Great way to get around
review: Bangkok is a big noisy city with the craziest traffic I have ever seem so it was great to find the train system The ticket system is a bit difficult to negotiate but the prices are good and although typical of metro systems the world over it is often packed with commuters and tourists it is a great was to get quickly from a to b Use it in combination with the river taxi system to visit temples and palaces in the city The train system also runs to an from the airport and seems by far the easiest way to get in ad out of the city

title: Blissful
review: Airconed quick transportation  Clean and efficient  Take a few minutes to understand the system and your away

title: Cheap, clean and east
review: Very good way to get around town especially if going to places like the weekend market Aircondition is freezing in the trains a very harsh contrast to the heat of the city Maybe bring a shirt or something like that to wear on the train)

title: fast, easy, clean way to get around bangkok
review: The only thing i dont like is it can be hard to drag heavy suitcases & travel bags etc on & off the train  I love the value for money the cleanness & the safety of the whole network

title: Easy.... Not to worry about getting ripped off
review: Aircon in the sky train works good so you won't feel suffocated inside when it's pack however when peak hours come just see where to stand as you don't want to have an armpit smell all the way

title: Efficient way to go!
review: Frequency of trainsGreat network Not always able to get seatbut didnt matter that much Station staff always happy & helpfulbest idea to buy a ticket pass that lasts the time you will be on holidays forsaves looking for change

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Fast inexpensive travel but cold The Rabbit card is good value for travel over a couple of days or more

title: Fast Way To Travel in Bangkok
review: Actually it is the same everywhere just like MRT in S'pore clean fast and right on timebut I don't see escalator in most of the station which can be difficult for people with disability or people who carries little child

title: brilliant
review: easy to find  easy to use and you can get anywhere in the city in minutes

title: Fast, frequent and efficient
review: We never waited more than 5 minutes for the Skytrain and even when it was packed to the rafters which it frequently was everyone was very respectful of each other and they are well airconditioned

title: A Heaven Send
review: I still remember the gridlock of the early 90's when it took me 4 hours to get from Don Muang Airport to town Both the BTS & MRT are godsends and allow the easy navigation throughout the city as well as a very cheap way to reach the airport

title: Getting around Bangkok safely and fast
review: The Skytrain is our most used means of transportation around Bangkok and even for arrival from and departure to the airport (via the airport link)  Train stops are strategically located to places of interest  You also don't get cheated by taxi drivers or waste time in traffic

title: The best way to transport in Bankong
review: Fast and easy and simple and you can reach most of the places in short time

title: THB120 day pass
review: consider buying this pass if you travel over 3time a day

title: Good try
review: A bit expensive compared to taxi  Very crowded and the train does not have many cabins

title: Great Transport System
review: Tain come every few minutes and only cost 2040 Baht per trip

title: Very good transportation
review: With skytrain subway and boat I can go anywhere in Bangkok Cheap excelent facility

title: Fast and efficient
review: Clean and easy to use but only after figuring out how each trip is paid for Give yourself time to learn

title: Clean, comfortable and efficient
review: Compared to other mas transportation systems in Europe the Sky Train is cleaner and more comfortable (air conditioning)

title: When staying in Bangkok, make sure your accommodation is near a Skytrain station
review: After three really bad experiences with taxi drivers in Bangkok in as many days we were so thrilled to have discovered the amazing sky train  Easy quick and cheap to use the BTS is a great mode of transport for anybody visiting Bangers

title: Great the best way to travell around Bangkok
review: Easy fast cheap Can get a bit crowded at peak times but just push your way in

title: The best way to get around the city of Bangkok!
review: Sometimes crowded with standing room only it still beats sitting in a taxi on a crowded Bangkok street

title: The easiest and fastest way to travel in Bangkok
review: I use it all the time to travel with in Bangkok its really clean and cool and easy to use

title: Always take this ...it is always faster
review: The BTS is simply fantastic  Of all the monorail type projects in Asia this is the best  It is well managed and reasonably priced I only use this to get around from meeting to meeting in Bangkok

title: Lots of stairs but beats the traffic!
review: Great way to get around nice and cool and the trains are spotless

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok.
review: Fast and very efficient way to tour Bangkok which is a traffic nightmare by car

title: Forget the taxi- Go above the traffic
review: Download a good ipad app and learn about the BTSMRT system and avoid getting stuck in the notorious Bangkok traffic  The BTS is cheap and convenient  Get an Adult day pass but don't opt for the promotional passes offered (currently a carrot orange deal) since they really only benefit residents with loyalty points and cost a bit more  A good old BTS adult (or child) card works fine and lets you avoid the hassle of waiting at a machine to get a trip ticket

title: Great way to move around Bangkok
review: BTS is a quick way to move around Bangkok at rush hour

title: Going across BKK this is the way
review: Its cheap and streaches all trough the BKKarea Its easy to understand the system

title: It's a train in the sky
review: How this is the number one rated thing to do in Bangkok is beyond me  Yes it is clean yes it is efficient & yes it is cheap but shouldn't we all expect this from public transport

title: Cool and quick
review: Cheap fast useful mean of communication Skytrain (BTS)is connected to the MTR (metro) Air conditioned cars very clean and safe Also the view is excellent 10 15 and 30 days tickets are also available One trip tickets are sold on the station vending machines other tickets are sold on the box office in each station there are lots of motor bike taxis in each station so you never have to wait a conncting transportation

title: The only way to get around
review: It is simply great Cheap and efficient there is no other way to get around

title: Great! Easy!
review: Taxis are slow slow slow due to crazy traffic Use the BTS and metro to get thru town faster

title: Convenient and fast
review: It's easy to use fast cheap and airconditioned It beats trying to battle the Bangkok traffic in a taxi We were a bit hesitant at first but there are attendants at the stations who can help and it's very straight forward

title: must do
review: when you go by skytrain and see the beautiful and crazy city bangkok from high above donÂ´t forget to take your coat itÂ´s really cold in there but beside this itÂ´s a perfekt way to get an impression of the city

title: Cheap, Reliable Transport
review: If you are staying in Bangkok make sure you book your accomodation close to a BTS station The service is cheap fast and reliable A bit squeezy at rush times but everyone is well mannered and even line up to enter the train When the traffic is gridlocked you are flyiing above it to your destination If you are close to the BTS you can explore Bangkok easily and cheaply

title: Efficient!!!!!!
review: Probably one of the best city train systems in the worldCleancheapswifthassle free & the security guys at the entranceexit & on the platforms are extremely politefriendly & helpful

title: Good view
review: We used the skytrain from the airport to the hotel The journey was pleasant as we didn't need to brave the traffic jam on the highways below It was also a great opportunity to enjoy the views from the train If you're not in a hurry and you don't have much luggage with you I would recommend using the skytrain it's the cheapest way to get around Skytrain to our hotel in Ratchprarop (not sure about the spelling now) was around 35baht only one way

title: Very clean and modern way to travel
review: Very clean you can get to most destinations very quickly and cheaply

title: Quick transport
review: Easy way to get around Cheap and quick Staions are at each main area and above the road system so you have better views

title: Must try.......
review: the sky train is the cheap and easy mode of transport  especially now that since over a year its connecting the airport as well There are maps available on the station  this can really be helpful when you are in the main town areas during peak hours  when it takes a hell lot of time to reach someplace by cab  its well connected to all main hotspots and malls but check in on the map details for the train timings for start and end timings

title: Convenient, yes, but comfortable - no
review: Quickest way to get around central Bangkok  however having used it since its inception  it has become way way way too crowded  even at nonpeak times BTS has basically become happy to sit back increase fees take the money and put nothing into the system itself ie more trainstrains with more carriages I wouldn't use it if taking a taxi wasn't 3 times more lengthy (in time)  maybe BTS realizes this and have decided that they can do nothing and the customers will still come as they have no other choice

title: Easy, cheap and clean
review: We got the Express train from the airport and the the sky train to the hotel  Couldn't have been easier  Fairly long queue for the ticket machines (takes notes and coins) but moves fast  Well worth it instead of taking a taxi

title: Great way to travel for distance
review: This is an effective way to get to the outskirts of the city and some of the major sites

title: Fast, cheap and reliable
review: Cheap way to get from A to B way faster than any other transportation medium Two lines easy to master English information everywhere  On rush hours claustrophobic people should really avoid it though (actually they maybe should avoid Bangkok) )

title: Clean, fast, easy to use
review: Will get you down town to the designer malls or to other quarters of the city very quickly very comfortably only draw back is that service stopped at around midnight

title: Too heavy AC, bevare
review: Train is efficient but AC is a killer very very cold at least 15 degrees cooler than outside bring some extra jacket

title: Very efficient and close by
review: The trains are so quick and easy and come by quite often so you never have to wait long

title: excellent
review: yes i did take the sky trainit connected to all the shopping complexesu just have to walk from one into another

title: Easy but not comfortable.
review: I went to MBK and Siam after shopping I moved to Taksin Bridge Station to take a boat at Chao PraYa River There are cloudy people at Siam Station I wondered that how they can survive their life everyday by Skytrain but I greed that it's fast and easy to go

title: Great but avoid peak hours
review: excellent system however very crowded during peak hours Plan trips accordingly best to avoid 7am9am and 4pm7pm

title: Easy to Negotiate, Even for a Texan
review: The US lags notoriously behind many countries when it comes to public transportation and nowhere more so than in my home state of Texas The roadways in the major urban areas are always crowded with cars trucks and vans which generally have only a single driver What this means to you is that when I travel public transportation can be daunting to say the least It does not come natural to us Texans Luckily the Thai have us covered  The Skytrain is wonderful Efficient cheap and clean particularly when one considers that according to The Bangkok Post more than 500000 people use it per day   The station maps are easy to follow even if you don't read Thai (I don't) or English (I do) and even a rank amateur like myself can figure it out quickly Go for it

title: cool breeze
review: love the air con and the cool temp with the hot outdoors

title: Easy way to get from one place to another
review: The sky train in Bangkok is great The maps are easy to read and it's a cheap way to get around the city I would definitely recommend using it

title: Convenient way in BKK!
review: If you want to be at your destination faster than using your own car or a public bus just use the sktrain but it is always crowded in the morning time when people leave for work and also the afternoon time when people come back from work However this will help you to save your time surely as you know the BKK has such a terrible traffic so using the sky train is an interesting choice

title: fast and on time
review: this was a good way to look around the city and also a great way to see thai life too quick and efficient we had a fun day out and came back to our hotel on the skytrain we really enjoyed the trip plenty of the locals use it too so it is not simply for tourists

title: best thing bangkok has ever had!
review: bangkok would have been a really unbearable place to live if there hadn't been sky train Really makes life easier and teaches how a mass transportation should be direct links to main places of attraction shopping centerseven apartments widespreadcheap and very sweet looking some lack of walking stairs but it's a sport for me so i don't complain much about it)))

title: Best thing about bangkok
review: The title of this post might be pushing it but it really is great  Its cheap fast reliable easy to use clean airconditioned and it runs above the chaos and disorder that is Bangkok Also don't be afraid to try the underground metro  It is equally great and super easy to use

title: Great, affordable, and ari conditioned
review: The BTS is a great way to get around BKK Totally affordable it gets you to most places worth seeing It does not however get you to the Royal Palace But it now DOES get you to and from the airport  You can spend an entire day checking out the activity each sky train stop has generated Lots of good finds

title: Getting around Bangkok on the cheap
review: I am amazed every time I see the Sky Train It is quick clean cool (AC) and it is not expensive When I say quick it is QUICK

title: Great way to travel
review: Being mature ladies late 60's we were very anxious about travelling on the train but we had no trouble at all and it was clean and so easy we never needed a taxi It stopped close to where ever we needed to go and always a guard to help on the staion

title: An easy way to blend in to the fabric of Bangkok.
review: Take Skytrain and feel like a local for a few minutes The best thing about it is stepping off a hot humid sweaty platform into the refrigeratorlike interior of Skytrain  Which is necessary because you can be packed in like a baking dish full of sardines in a medium oven  Phew

title: Easy to use
review: Very efficient and great way to get around a very busy city quickly  Nice and clean

title: The better way to move in Sukhumvit
review: Skytrain is the fastest way to visit Sukhumvit It's simple and cheaper than any tuctuc motorcycle or taxi Due to Air Conditioning it's very cold inside Skytrain don't forget a sweatshirt

title: Very clean and useful
review: Useful way to move in a busy city like bangkok safe and clean Its starts at 6 am And close at midnight

title: convenient
review: Skytrain is quite convenient  It's quick clean and safe  They have announcement for each station so it is unlikely to get lost  But downside is (1) very often they don't have escalators and you have to walk up and down the stairs which may be difficult if you are carrying luggage (2) they don't have airconditioning in the station (but they have aircon in the train (3) most ticket machines only take coins and you have to go change coins before you can buy tickets (my advise is if you plan to use the skytrain a lot buy a stored value ticket to save time and trouble

title: quick but the ticket system was annoying
review: having to put a handful of coins continuously into the ticket machine was time consuming

title: Clean speedy ride
review: Really user friendly service Reasonable costwise clean and efficient

title: Easy to use
review: The best way to get around and extremely cheap The maps are simple and staff helpful

title: Fast & Clean compartment...
review: It's like everywhere in the WORLD FOR THIS KIND OF TRANSPORTATION but it's clean smell good and also not so pack like a Sadine Fish Can even on the peak hour one good thing is safety  One comment is they should have more Lines and go further than this especially to IMPACT where I stayed A big exhibition centre like this without this mean of transportation is not convenient for both exhibitor and visitor to comegoHope they hear about it and build another Line for this purpose

title: Clean, Safe and convenient
review: A great way to explorer the modern Bangkok and must faster as doing long trips in the traffic hell of Bangkok

title: Quick and clean
review: Convenient clean and safe On time and easy to use We did have an 'odd' experience though  we were told by the ticket seller to take 20 baht tickets to our destination but when we arrived we were 'charged' another 10 per person to get throw the gate  felt like a scam

title: Great way to get around the shopping district
review: Pros Frequent trains clean stations large carriages Cons Most expensive than Kuala Lumpur's LRT

title: It is really fast
review: We travelled 4 stops at Sukhumvit and it was fast and also air condition was great )

title: Fast and convenient
review: The BTS is clean and accessible but unless you have enough coins and don't mind queuing up for single trip tokens each trip using the Rabbit card isn't very affordable It costs 475 baht and 100 baht is nonrefundable The Rabbit card is tripbased and gives you 15 25baht trips It is more costeffective to take the taxi with meter if your group is large

title: Very easy to use
review: Easy to use very cheap However it does not go as far down as the Grand palace but it is easy enough to jump in a tuk tuk or taxi once you get to the stop nearest to it

title: Cool comfort at cheap price
review: Loved the discipline Of both tourists and locals when alighting and boarding the train

title: Easy to use...
review: The Skytrain is easy to use cheap and gives you good access to most areas of Bangkok

title: great way to commute in busy bangkok
review: fastest way to travel in Bangkok CBD Nice and clean 1 day pass gets you to see many things at a very economical way

title: Very Easy to Use
review: Not good for people in the Khao San area but the only way to travel elsewhere Very Cheap

title: Great way to get around Bangkok.
review: The skytrain is a cheap easy way to get around Bangkok

title: Access can be a problem
review: As a point to point system this works very efficiently trains come quickly are clean and have excellent ac  Downers would be that they can be terribly crowded a taxi may well be cheaper if more than one is traveling and access to stations and platforms invariably involves several flights of stairs  shopping center access mitigates part of this in places but not all  don't even consider this with a wheelchair stroller or if you're infirm Particularly if it's rainingrushhour I'll take the Skytain to the station closest to home and a taxi for the rest it can really save time if you're traveling more than a few stops Integration with the underground is pathetic in terms of proximity signage and ticketing systems Do be aware that Central World shopping mall is between Siam and Chit Lom stations and is a sweaty schlepp from either  Hope this helps

title: Very easy
review: A fast way to move A great airconditioning Remember to have ten and five bath coins

title: Awesomeness at its best
review: the most convenient affordable and accessible mode of transport in Thailand where one could be ripped off by tuk tuks and taxis a must recommend for everyone traveling to Bangkok   Please follow the route map which is available for free at your hotel and make good use of this system everything about this service was neat and clear cut

title: Great mode of transportation
review: Bangkok's sky train is a fantastic way to travel avoiding the notorious traffic jam of the city Its all very posh looking and well maintained however signs could be a bit confusing provided people dont speak much of English If you would want to change line that just adds to the confusion in the absense of clear direction All the more consufing when trains leave in both direction from the same platform But its very clean and cold really great for scorching bangkok heat Its also connected with the river taxi pier (Saphan Taksin) which is really convenient if you jump on the boat But lack of escalator makes it a bit inconvenient specially if you cant do stairs But day pass only if you are making tht many trips to make it cost effective otherwise single ride ticket is fine

title: Best cheap transport
review: Extremely easy to use the stations have manned booths that will give you the correct coins to purchase tickets  These trains are fast short waiting times airconditioned and very clean

title: Crowded and like Tokyo
review: Its fast and easy but never empty Very difficult access for wheelchairs or pushchairs

title: Easy to get around much better than taxi
review: This is a much better option as traffic is not good and its an easy system to use and understand

title: Make lgetting around easy
review: very easy to navigate & clean Cheap & orderly easy to get from there to subways too

title: Very convenient
review: The time taken is appx 15 min and cost just 150baht two way valid for two weeks It is comfortable

title: Fast, efficient, but very cold
review: Very fast and clean but not accessible for elderly and disabled people Very cold inside

title: Great Transport System
review: I have used since The Skytrain started in late 1999 I think it is one best systems in the World Living on one side BKK and it saves sitting in traffic Plus cheap with a oneday ticket Now 130 Thai Baht (Â£270)

title: Great
review: Fast easy reasonable price modern and great air conditioning  Do the cost analysis if you should buy the day pass or per run  I bought the day pass everyday just for the convince but I could have saved a little if I thought it out better

title: Easy & Accessible
review: it brings you to to the places of interest cheapest mode of transporttaion

title: Better than taxis!
review: Quiet clean and on time  Take SkyTrain all the time  It's the best

title: Very modern!
review: The Bangkok Skytrain is about as modern a metro system as anywhere in the world  It's very clean reasonably priced and it gets you to most parts of Bangkok with no fuss whatsoever  A day pass (unlimited riding for one day) costs 120 baht which is roughly equivalent to $400 US  The trains stop running at midnight

title: Train system is better then home!
review: Loved getting around by Skytrain So easy to use (signs in both English & Thai) & it was airconditioned

title: Skytrain Bangkok
review: Skytrain was cheap but similar to the London underground feel very busy but regular trains around the city

title: Excellant service.
review: Not expensive and very easy to get around on  I use the sky train regularily and now rely on it all the time  Can be busy at rush hours but rest of day it is usually possible to get seats easily

title: Brilliant!
review: Clean efficient and cheap Ideal to get around Bangkok much better than using the traffic clogged streets  Most efficient thing in Thailand

title: Well connected
review: If you wish to save yourself the trouble of all the huge traffic jams and would like travelling to all those shopping destinations at ease take a Map and head straight to the nearest BTS SkytrainThe best  part is its very well connected to all the major destinations with some walkways connecting directly to the malls like MBKTake a full day tourist ticket(costing about 130 bhat) and one can travel the whole day on the skytrain at any destination(the average fare is 25 bhat per station) so this is value for your money in u plan visiting multiple destinations on the same dayAlso saves time in standing in queues to get the ticket punch etc

title: BTS Sky Trains
review: Take sky trains more often as cab drivers are now trying to cheat you by not going by the meters Cabs around town should not be more than 60bahts but they are trying to charge you 150200bahts So stick to BTS sky trains

title: Great way to get from A-B
review: Easy to use  clean and efficient Enjoyed being away from the noise and bustle of the traffic

title: Great transport system
review: The only way to get around in a congested bottle neck for road traffic

title: Getting around town
review: Still a great way to get around town even if more crowed than ever

title: skytrain
review: quick easy and clean easy to work out where you were

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: We didn't travel by taxis at all The sky train was perfect Price is good value too The trains are clean and regular The best way to get about in Bangkok

title: fast ,cheap,time saving
review: the sky train is a gud way to travel thru bangkoki travelled in it alone at 10 o clockbut it was very safealthough train was very crowded at that timethe maps r easy to figure outn the guards at the station r very helpfuli went from siam bts to asokewhich took me 25 bahts individual ticket one way and 10 mins which would have taken easily 45 mins by taxi n around 150 bahts

title: Air-conditioned but standing room only.
review: Modern and cool but overcrowded  but then where in the East is efficient publich transport not overcrowded

title: Great and fast way to travel in Bangkok
review: this really great to travel in the sky train in bangkokcheap fast and best

title: Our trip to Thailand and more
review: The trip in Thailand and Babnkok biking was very good

title: bangkok adventure
review: easy to access  gives you a bird's eye view of the city and as it now goes to the airport  very convenient saves hassles with the taxi drivers

title: Easy transportation in busy Bangkok
review: Want to get quick from one side of Bangkok to the other take the skytrain Just step up to the platform and you wil find helpfull employees who change money to buy a ticket with the appropiate coins and give you directions

title: just like any other monorail..
review: the ride is okay and the coaches are clean and roomy but we had some slight difficulties buying the tickets

title: Great way to get around

title: Small network
review: Unless you happen to be going from very close to one of the stations to another location very close to another station (which is quite unlikely given that the network is currently limited) it probably makes more sense to take a taxi  Given the heat and humidity in Bangkok you will not want to walk far so you generally need to take a taxi then the skytrain then another taxi to reach your destination which is more generally more costly than taking one taxi (the Bangkok taxi pricing scheme is set such that they get a decent set fee per journey but then the meter goes up very slowly for distance)  Also it generally takes the same time as just taking one taxi This is because finding a taxi can take a long time in Bangkok so having to find 2 taxis rather than one is not advisable The exception is when it is rush hour (when traffic jams block all the main roads) but at this time the skytrain is so busy as to be an absolutely awful experience  As I say it is ok for commuters who have (intentionally bought an apartment next to a station and work in an office next to another station) but for general trips around the city I find taxis to be much better  The only positive is that (when it is not busy) the carriages are actually quite pleasant and if in the future they massively expand the network it could be a good alternative to taxis

title: Clean, cool and frequent...

title: More crowded than 3 years ago!
review: When we visited Bangkok 3 years ago we travelled around everywhere by Skytrain as it was a fast cheap and efficient way to get around the city  We found that it was much busier on our recent visit with trains often being overcrowded  Having said that we thought that the fares had not really increased in price   Tickets are easy to purchase  Even if you do not have the right change you can go up to the ticket booths tell them your destination and how many are travelling and they will give you the correct coinage and change for obtaining the tickets from the machine for your journey  There were no real language problems and it was all so simple The train map is very easy to understand and trains arrive very frequently so you can get to most of the important touristy sights and the river area very easily  Another plus is that because of its elevated position you get fantastic views as you travel around I would recommend using this form of transport as the roads are very congested at certain times of the day and it takes an age to get anywhere plus the train carriages are air conditioned which gives a welcome respite from the heat outside

title: Good way to avoid traffic

title: Best mode of transportation in Bangkok city
review: The infamous traffic jam in bangkok is the biggest reason the Sky Train (and also subway) is the best and the fastest mode of transportation It is also cheap and aplenty The network is quite impressive (sufficient for tourists to move about in generally most places in Bangkok city) During rush hour it can get packed but the frequencey of the trains are also increased The sukhumvit line is the most busiest with Siam station being the most busiest as it is the centre node  Choose hotels near to BTS and accessibility is in your hands it will save you precious time

title: Convenient
review: I found this to be the biggest change when I first visited Bangkok over 15 years ago It appears to have a huge affect on the economic development of the city It enables locals and visitors to get around the city in a much more efficient manner It also has physically connected major retail areas (ie Siam) or stops near them (ie Chatuchak) greatly increasing commerce

title: Best transport option in BK

title: The SkyTrain & metro are the fastest transport in BKK--it's these or walk!
review: People food sights Culture Friendliness Chang beer

title: EASIEST WAY TO GET AROUND BANGKOK
review: This is by far the easiest way to get arond bangkok  taking you to all the major attractions and major malls in air conditioned comfort for 25 baht ranging up to 45 baht you seriously cant beat that

title: Another use for the Skytrain.
review: When I took my girlfriend to Bangkok the first time I took her for a Skytrain ride to see the city "from above"  Because of the way the Skytrain is structured you can pay for a short trip and then go all the way to the end and back to your original destination for the same price  What we did was to get off at each stop remain on the platform and observe the surrounding area  It had the advantage of no crowds no rush a birds eye view and immediate access to air conditioning on the ride to the next stop  With this technique you are able to get a fairly quick tour of much of the city's highlights  And you get a chance to see where places are that you will want to return to This also gives you the opportunity to see the Bangkok skyline in a way you can not from the ground  And frankly you can see the ground differently than you can from the ground because your view is not restricted by walls fences or shrubbery

title: They just pick a pocket or two
review: I have travelled to Bangkok annually for 30 years and never had a problem Imagine my surprise when after getting off the Sky Train i stopped to buy an item from a street vendor and when paying my pockets were empty All cash gone So if this heaven forbids should happen to you this is what I did Reverse call to the insurance company then a visit to Lumpini Police Station at Wireless road where there is an Australian bloke who does the necessary translation You get a report which is important when claiming and keep your receipt when you change money as the insurance company asked for this as well All done in a matter of an hour so no hazzle Afterwards I could recall how it happened a full train at peak hours around 1630 one hand hanging on to the post the other to my bag another bloke not Thai seemed to get closer with his bag and there I was an open invitation So keep your hands in your pockets or leave them empty at peak hours

title: World class public transport

review: Its a great system and being expanded all the time The only issue is the usual one in Thailand everything is in Thai

title: It's a train!
review: Easy efficient travel around large areas of the city In other words it's a train system that does what it was designed to do if that's what pops your cork   enjoy

title: Clean and quick to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS skytrain is great to get around Bangkok Especially considering traffic in the city and the occasional painful process of dealing with cab drivers at times There is good security too when entering the station and it feels safe Trains were very clean and you are not permitted to eat or drink on the train so do not think it is a good idea to grab something to eat for the journey

title: No Social Distancing,  on BTS trains
review: The BTS trains are a vital component of Bangkok's lifestyle but the Social Distancing measures have  to improve I don't know how this can be doneunless they have more staff stopping people from  hurrying into the trains especially during RushHour Although there are continuous announcements about  wearing masks not talkingnot facing each other the insides of the trains are a bit too crowdedfor comfort The seats are not socially distanced  at all I hope the BTS  organisation take this seriously Thailand is lucky to be Covidfree for more than 80 daysBut this Virus just can't be taken for granted especially  in the public transport system

title: Wonderful modern system to travel around the inner city
review: If you want to miss the famous Bangkok Traffic jams just head for the "Sky Train"  Have single or multiple tickets availble HIGHLY Recommended for tourists

title: Good quick transit
review: Love the air conditioner on the train Very fast and cheap service Good way to get around the city

title: Great transit system
review: Great transit system  very efficient way of getting around the city Trains run every 5 or 10 minutes and are clean and cool  the air conditioning is a welcome relief from the heat    Pretty easy to navigate too

title: reliable
review: Clean busy fast reliable enough airconditioner  This can avoid traffic jam and bad air pollution  Easy to read the sign  Sometimes they need to check your bag for security  Feel safe  Slight expensive in Thailand living standard

title: Better than taxi
review: Much quicker than taxi and cheaper too Air conditioning is also a welcome benefit Gets very busy at peak times so choose your times wisely

title: Fast..clean..beat the traffic
review: Bangkok is a big city and the traffic can be crazy especially at rush hours A friend suggested the sky trainthat was the best option everThey are superfastright on timesuper clean and borh staff n pedestrians are organizedno pushing or noise or spitting everywherei was very impressed If you wanna be anywhere on timeuse the skytrain or metro and avoid late disappointments

title: Use it and stay cool
review: The best way to move around the city in safety and in ambient temperatures Trains are frequent clean aircooled and not expensive Coonects at several points with the citys MRT system (The Undergound) Very good

title: Always can improvr
review: BTS is always a good way to travel inside the city However it is also truly a bit pricy As well maybe just me but I always find BTS is freezing cold

title: Fast, efficient and affordable
review: The BTS sky train is amazing Fast efficient and affordable transport Much faster than taxis or Grab Trains are nice and cool

title: Perfect transportation.
review: Best way to go around in bangkok more fast then taking a taxi and never need to stay in the traffic queues Also good way for sightseeing because you are able to see alot of bangkok from above in conveniently way

title: Frequent Trains, Clean, Safe, Stops Announced in Thai & English
review: Not the cheapest transportation but very easy if you're heading anywhere near a stop or want to combine it with Grab Taxi If you get a seat you'll have some nice views of the city I used it frequently enough during my twoweek stay to invest in a Rabbit card but there's a fee for the card and no discounts for the fare so it's better to purchase individual trips or a day pass if you won't use it often (Rabbit doesn't work any other public transportation including the metro so not a general transportation pass)   We stayed at a hotel near the Asok station in Sukumvit so it was easier and faster to take a SkyTrain out of the jammed packed traffic area than a taxi With two or more people taxi is cheaper though River ferries water taxis and the MRT can help you connect with some of the stops A great option for getting around especially if you're alone

title: Easy to ride
review: Clean place polite people not that hard to use This train makes our trip easier to the tourist attraction

title: Not for the claustrophobic!
review: Perpetually busy and jam packed You are standing way too close to everyone Very difficult if you have bags of  shopping The cheapest and easiest way to navigate the city but brace yourself for the crowds

title: Simple to use
review: Very easy to use  Tickets can be bought from the counter  We used single use tickets for each journey  Out of rush hour it was quiet but during rush hour there were long queues to buy tickets and the skytrain was crammed with people  Ok for a few stops had aircon

title: Nice
review: Easy to use and can avoid horrible traffic on Bangkok streets Very convenient and clean Good for incity travels

title: Crammed but punctual
review: All I have to say is every country should take example of how to correctly run public transport from Bangkokoooh n as a side note  if you didn't realize how many people are in Bangkok catch the Sky Train to experience for yourself

title: Easy to get around
review: Love the skytrain Itâs fast convenient although it can get crowded during peak hours Just buy tokens from the counter

title: Amazing
review: Very convenient Easy to use Clean Convenient Awkward use this when in Bangkok Great to use everyday Safe

title: Inexpensive way to travel around Bangkok
review: Only a 4* because unlike the London tube the map and signage arenât that easy to follow and you have to have a fairly decent clue of where you are and where you need to go first After that itâs a doddle

title: Life Line of Bangkok
review: The SkyTrain was very Convenient Very well maintained The Stations can be a little bigger they were a problem during the rains

title: Futuristic
review: Coming from Rome capital of the shameless transportation the feeling is mindblowing It seems to be in the future

title: Great transportation
review: Best way to get around bangkok and avoid all the traffic  The train is super clean easy to follow along where you are and what stops are upcoming and reasonably priced

title: Easy and cheap
review: Use it it's clean and easy And you get great views of the city  Trains are frequent Can be busy at peak times

title: Sci-fi time
review: Watching it from down below it looks like being in a scifi movie like "ghost in a shell" or "Akira" Very clean and very much appreciated airc too bad it's not really very spread out and not very connected to metro System

title: Easy to find, use and navigate
review: Ist time in Bangkok and staying close to Suvarnamabhumi airport I taxi it to skytrain ( cabs are very cheap here) and am efficiently and Cooley whisked away to the city for only 40 baht Couldnât fit it this mornings train jam packednext one 2 minutes later Brilliant ð

title: Easy and handy.
review: BTS takes you all over to Bangkok Easy to find Cheap and easy transportation Definitely recommended

title: fast clean and easy
review: very good  clean not exellent just because of the pricequiet expensive in compare of any other transport in bkk

title: Quick, cool and fun - best way to travel!
review: Great fun to travel in the Skytrain  our kids loved it It's clean airconditioned fast and fun Don't visit Bangkok without it Do note that if you've just paid for a single journey you need to insert the card into the machine to exit rather than tapping (as you would on the London underground)

title: convenient, cheaper and safe mode of transport
review: Sky train is the cheapest easy mode of transport As a tourist You need not buy any card you can buy the ticket from the station even if there is a queue at ticket counter The queue moves very fast There are multiple trains to multiple directions There are sign boards and the route of the sky train mentioned at platform in English The localities are friendly and supportive in case you ask any query to them

title: no worry about traffic jam from city to airport
review: when I arrive in Suvarnabhumi Airport in Bangkok I love to take train to downtown of Bangkok via BTS Skytrain It is fast (about 30 min) Specially when I return to the airport for my fight I took this train I dont worry about traffic jams on the streets

title: Very efficient modern way to travel
review: The bts or skytrain is a very efficient clean and reliable way to travel to most tourist sites in bangkok Very clean organized and efficient way to get around the city Has standard charges so no need to haggle with taxi or tuktuk drivers

title: Easy way to get around
review: I pre purchased a rabbit card for the skytrain which I was able to top up This avoided the question at the counter for a ticket travel by BTS is clean and fast The staff are helpful and the signage as most signage in Thailand was also in English This also made easy and cheap to get to and from the Airport as my hotel was near a BTS station

title: Excellent form of transportation
review: Bangkok traffic is a drama Taxi Grab all cars get stuck in traffic BTS and Metro are clean save on time reliable and have air conditioning Best way to travel in Bangkok

title: amazing
review: Super easy to use well connected Always on time And the route covers pretty much tourists attractions

title: Convenient but crowded
review: The BTS enables the visitor to avoid the awful Bangkok traffic but can be very crowded in the main tourist and shopping areas

title: Good transportation
