review: Easy to use Cheaper than any transportation of Bangkok Have a full day ticket for only 150 baht Also have exits to malls shopping centreâs

title: Quite often crowded but convenient.
review: The train system throughout Bangkok is an experience in itself this system is quite function and handy although as stated it can get quite crowded at times

title: BTS SkyTrain -- clean, fast, convenient, reasonably priced
review: The BTS Skytrain moves farther to the outskirts every year and it is always an excellent ride Lately I have been in On Nut and the morning rush is so busy that when the train stops and the doors open there is no room I often have to wait for two or three more trains but they come every 2 or 3 minutes Even during the rush commuters are polite quiet and accommodating Everything about the Skytrain is modern clean (immaculate) and professional

title: Easy to get on but crowded
review: Took the BTS at 630 pm Crammed in like sardines But itâs efficient and you canât get anywhere by car

title: Skytrain
review: Easy too use and cheap You can travel quickly in the city and to MBK Center In the morning or evening  night its also uncomplicated

title: Quick and efficient
review: Fairly crowded but quick and cheap Better than driving and easier than  walking Good to get off the wet dirty streets especially in the rain there are roofs over the walkways Clear and simple to work out

title: Crowded but efficient
review: Hands down the best way to get around in Bangkok can get really crowded but people are courteous and follow a rhythm

title: Skytrain Travel
review: Easy clean and air conditioned these trains run efficiently and are simple to use All ticket machines are in English and Thai and take credit card and cash  We used them to get easy access down to the river There are only two lines so itâs simple to work out which train you need Good for families as you can use your stroller on and off the train  Cheap transport

title: Travelling
review: This is an excellent way to get around to both places of interest and restaurantsBuy a day pass very good value for money

title: The Best Way Around
review: Love it or hate it when packed the BTS is the best way around Bangkok It is a fantastic system but it is starting to get pricey according to many locals If you hold a rechargeable Rabbit Card & you are a foreigner for some strange & disturbing reason they are now requiring a copy of your passport etc just to simply recharge your card to ride on the BTS  Yes I have witnessed foreigners being asked for their passport when recharging their card Personally I would rather the hassle of using the coin ticketing machine than handing over such information to the private company that runs the BTS system The fact remains if you want to get around even if big brother is trying to harvest your data the BTS is the best & really only way unless you love sitting in traffic

title: very convenient to use BTS
review: it is convenient to go around with BTS the fare is not expensive in order to avoid long lines in purchasing tickets u can buy a stored value Rabbit Card u can just add the value if it is running out the card is good for 5 yrs

title: Easy access
review: Transportation can be a burden in some countries But in Bangkok BTS takes away the burden in transportation My hotel (Fraser Suites) wasnât far from the Nana BTS station and I was happy with the ease of commuting around Bangkok using BTS

title: Amazing
review: I was a little hesitant about travelling in this but it was so easy efficient inexpensive and clean Air con was a blessing

title: Impressed
review: Always clean prompt service affordable Great way to get around the city If you want to avoid the long lines to buy your card keep your coins handy and use the vending machines   Itâs very easy to get your card Simply find your hotel or destination stop and input that number on the screen(available in English)

title: Efficient and great way to travel
review: We stayed in central Bangkok and used this frequently Good and clean way to travel we didn't bother with day passes as it was quite easy to pop into any station and get tickets (Probably we didn't travel at peak times so it was quite smooth) For the money it was safer and better than tuk tuks

title: Public transit to get around
review: Efficient way of getting around Bangkok especially if you're not using to TukTuk Beware of taxi driver who try to ripoff tourists

title: Super convenient
review: Super convenient and fast but a bit expensive every ride cost you anywhere between 16 to 42 baths

title: It is fast and convenient
review: The sky train is fast and quite convenient  The price is ok It is quite crowded during rush hour but it is still better than taking a taxi

title: Bts travel
review: Great way to get around the city I used a day pass and found it to be very cost friendly  Staff were helpfull Whilst it can get crowded I found it to be very very safe

title: Nice and fast
review: It was very good nice and fast transportation via center of Bangkok to another side tourist attraction

title: Fast and effective
review: I ride the BTS going to the Airport A little bit anxious of getting late but my friends told me not to worry cause the BTS here is very fast and effective And that's what I've seen Even if you're going to DMK or Suvarnabhumi Airport BTS and Airport bus are there to assist you so you can catch your flight a head of time

title: traveling around Bangkok
review: quite convenient to go around Bangkok riding the bts skytrain   the station are located near shopping centers walking distance 1015 minutes via skyline walkway trains are neat and clean  full of people during rush hour though

title: BTS
review: Great way to get to various shopping and sightseeing locations Itâs inexpensive and faster than a taxi especially during rush hour Itâs crowed but your not on it typically more that 15 minutes

title: Very easy to use and best way of getting around Bangkok
review: The best way to get around Bangkok is by using the very convenient BTS service Traffic in Bangkok is crazy and we were stuck in it for 125 hours before better sense prevailed and we took the BTS everywhere We managed to stick to our itinerary because getting around by BTS was just so simple Everything is available in English and the tickets are reasonably priced

title: Quick convenient and cheap.
review: Good to use Only few lines available though Maybe crowded however But you must try it at least once

title: Quick and efficient service
review: This was a clean easy quick and efficient service for all our family Traveling with Young children can be difficult but this was cost effective and fun

title: BTS
review: clean & efficient  easy to navigate  easy to buy a 1 way ticket as there is an english option at the ticketing machine

title: Efficient, cold and a great way to explore Bangkok.
review: Best train service The air con is freezing the trains are efficient and the staff who manage the BTS are helpful You canât explore Bangkok without it

title: The best way to travel
review: If you are looking for efficient quick and cool travelling  use the sky train  The traffic in Bangkok is horrific and chaotic  very interesting to watch while having a drink but not to experience when you are trying to get from A to B Travelling by taxi is cheap but you need to allow a lot of time  the BTS (sky train) and MTR (undergroundâs train) are quick and extremely efficient  with trains coming every five minutes It might also be instances where you use a combination of train and taxi  get the taxi from a station close to your destination  Ticket are purchased either for single trips or a card for multiple trips

title: Crowded and confusing
review: I lived in London for years so no stranger to mass transport  System is bursting to capacity and ticketing system a nightmare if your on holiday to just make couple of uses  Worst is lack of lifts or escalators when you have a baby in pram with shopping

title: Good system but limited coverage (at the moment)
review: The BTS Skytrain is a good option to travel around Bangkok in combination with the metro The stations are very easy to locate as they are elevated unlike the metro underground Also in major places like malls and shopping centres the stations are connected with pedestrian bridges to provide a safe walk in a short time The down side is the coverage is still limited and does not cover quite large part of the city so you still need to take taxi or motorbike or tuktuk on the startend of your journey Good news is from our last visit in August 2019 we could see that the network extension was under way so we can expect a good connections and coverage in the future

title: Seamless travel throughout BANGKOK
review: Coming from London where we use the underground I was surprised at how uncomplicated the Skytrain is in comparison Super easy and super quick I think the whole thing with the Rabbit Card is really disappointing as I wouldnât want to be carrying ID around with me if I need to top up

title: Very Convinient....
review: We took a small journney from Sukhumvit Though we don't know the language we did not find any problem in the journey

title: Must transport in Bangkok city
review: This is the train service in Bangkok city which cover most of the attraction One serve for one day ticket or buy rabbit card( for top up purpose)

title: Excellent
review: Clean fast cheap and efficient service used the skytrain many times during our stay and it is a great way to get around Bangkok

title: Convenient
review: Convenient and easy to use  Very clean  Never much of a wait for next train  Inexpensive  I would recommend tourist get the full day pass on days they wish to use this service

title: Easy to use
review: Sky train is do easy to use as a foreigner and so cheap I use it every tone I am in bkk Plus you get to see a lot of bkk from atop down view I have found a few shopping centers that way

title: BTS SHould Take a few Lessons from Hong Kong or Singapore
review: Yes Bangkok does have a Mass Transit Railway System It might be OK for the locals but for tourist it can be a difficult experience Very POOR signage and maps for visitors Unlike Hong Kong or Singapore the system is not user friendly The connection from the Skytrain to the BTS has to be at least 14 mile++ with numerous slanted ramps and stairs If you have luggage you are better off taking a taxi

title: Good type of transportation
review: Good type of transportation very cheap and fast Can be very crowded all day long not only during rush hour

title: Clean super convenient
review: Always on time Super easy access Buying ticket is extremely simple Very clean Good air conditioning  Perfect

title: BKK Skytrain
review: Clean efficient and fast No timetable needed as the trains regularly ply the track on regular basis Very convenient as the Skytrain traverses the main artery of BKK avoiding the usual traffic jam that plague the city Price is also cheap

title: Ms Bec
review: Easy access  Convenient stops  Got off right at the mall and walked to the hotel Lots of fun  Great way to see the city  Got on at the museum and off at victory memorial

title: Skytrain
review: Great transport system in Bangkok Quick and easy toget around the cityon weekends and peak hrs it can get very  busy standing room only always use the BTS  Better than being stuck in a traffic jam below Also some stations link up with the MRT u underground

title: travel in Bangkok with BTS
review: It's easy to travel in Bangkok to avoid the bad traffic It's clean  fast and safe A bit expensive when compare with other expense

title: Fantastic
review: Been using the BTS since it started and come to Bangkok at least 6 times a year on business itâs just amazing  why can we not get anything like this in the UK

title: Perfect way to travel!
review: We loved it easy to understand and fast way to travel around No haggling with driversYou canât get everywhere but loads of locations are in near proximity of the sky train Itâs clean and the people are so polite the cue to the side to let everybody out there is no pushing or shoving what a great way to travel around the city

title: Sky Train experience
review: It is a nice transportation way but kind of heavily busy during the rush hour which is not recommended   But overall it is cheap clean and fast compared to the Taxi  Enjoy it

title: Saladaeng to Ratcha
review: After eating at After You at Silom complex we took the BTS from Saladaeng to visit the 4faced Buddha  which is one station away   When the bts door open the inconsiderate Chinese tourists refuse to move inside the trains as compared to the nice THAI  Overall  still a nice pleasant ride with the locals

title: easy service
review: easy service we found it simple to follow  english as thai on signs we did a couple of interchanges and staff were helpful

title: Great
review: Great to use to get around Very regular time table staff speak English at ticket booths Cannot get return tickets Always packed with people It won't wait for you so get in and out very quickly

title: Easy
review: Bought a rabbit card and traveled around Bangkok smoothly Clean cabins and easy to navigate Serves its purpose

title: Highly priced
review: The Sky train is too expensive and also crowded It is like a metro train in other parts of the world

title: Fast but so crowed in rush hours
review: I used sky train many times in 5 days in Bangkok It is so comfotable and fast to move to other locations However in rush hours there are a lot of people in one sky train I feel like my space becomes smaller gradually

title: Efficient and Convenient
review: One of the best means of transportation in Bangkok Very convenient and efficient Definitely recommend it in order to avoid the insane traffic in Bangkok

title: Good service
review: Itâs really good service to go from one place to another itâs so convenient and affordable Must try in Bangkok

title: cheap train ride
review: we use the train lots of time and was very clean and cheap to use and much quicker to go any werewould use again

title: Nice and clean
review: Very pleasant ride AC cooled and spacious Also very cheap Only 44TBH for up to 8 stops to Moh Chit staion

title: Toooooo crowded
review: BTS is easy to use but the problem is many times you have to miss the train because they have very less compartments so it gets over crowded   I don't understand why can they increase few more compartments  They are increasing more line that will make it more difficult for public to use the sky train

title: Easy to use and travel in Bangkok
review: Used the BTS during our 5 days stay in Bangkok very easy and cheap  Also best option to move fast in Bangkok

title: Always full
review: The system is terrible compared with other cities in this world The trains are infrequent and sometimes you cannot get on the train on a non peak time of the day When trains are so busy at 10pm and people can't get on then management need to wake up and increase the frequency of trains

title: Cheap and easy to get around
review: Used the skytrain many times as it was cheap and quick to get around Bangkok and still enjoy seeing the sights The National Stadium stop is the best exit for MBK Centre The trains are frequent and clean and people readily give up their seats if you look more needy There are more stations being built as we were visiting so the range will be a lot better

title: Efficient and cool
review: This was a very efficient way to get around Bangkok and to get to places close to the line quickly Itâll be better when the larger underground opens

title: Must travel in BTS Skytrain
review: BTS skytrain is so convenient and its so easy to travel from destination to destinationyou can save money by travelling in BTSbecause taxis and Tuk Tuk they are very expensive in Bangkok I personally love to travel in BTS because it connects the city

title: Reliable and affordable price.
review: Bangkok is easy to explore by using BTS Skytrain which is clean and reliable For tourists good to avoid morning and evening peak hours  Station staff are helpful in case you need any help

title: Convenient except ticketing
review: Bangkok's transport system is terrible  If you want to avoid trafffic tram take BTS  It is easy more reliable and cheap to travel by BTS especially that most famous shopping malls are connected to BTS stations  BTS however needs to improve the functionality of its ticketing machines which currently only accept coins hence there is always a long queue in front of the ticketing office

title: Efficient and better than taxis
review: We unfortunately decided to try this on our last day We regret not using the SkyTrain and Metro from the start Taxis get stuck in traffic for hours For those visiting Bangkok I would recommend getting a map of the train lines and using them wherever you go Sukhumvit line which we used was fantastic We saved a lot of time and money It is much much cheaper and you are guaranteed of arriving on time and fitting so much in your schedule

title: Crowded
review: Taxi fair is almost the same of the train The train however is crowded and finding a place to set is impossible Unless you are traveling solo a taxi is a better option as they are cheap and abundant

title: Fast and efficient
review: Surasak BTS was connected directly to our hotel Eastin Grand Fastclean and efficient method to get around Bangkok Trains are very crammed as you would expect but not uncomfortably so

title: Apparently quicker than a taxi
review: It isnât  packed in the afternoon limited connecting stations on our route (Emporium to Banyan Tree Sathorn Road) and very slow  Waits for every in station

title: Fast and convenient
review: Quick and convenient service to get directly to the airport and within the city very helpful staff  would be better if connectivity from the train stations to bus stops were more convenient

title: Transportation in Bangkok
review: BTW Skytrain is easy to use when it comes to travelling in congested and traffic heavy Bangkok   It is linked to major malls in the city and with covered walkways too  Rain or SHINE use BTS to get to your destination in no TIME

title: Very easy to manuver.
review: This train is fast and efficient and cheap  It's clean and easy to see where you need to go We were lucky to have had someone help us with buying the tickets  You have to look at the map count how many stops till your destination go get tokens at the booth then at the automated ticket booth you put in how many tickets and how many stops get the tickets put them in the slot at the escalator and board the train No food or drinks or smoking allowed

title: Very efficient!
review: The BTS sky train is an aboveground train (compared to itâs underground counterpart the MRT) It is fast and arrives at the station around every 3 minutes There are attendants at the platform to ensure people do not lean against the glass walls or step across the yellow line (if thereâs no walls)

title: Easy to get around- beats the traffic!
review: Got the BTS to pick up the Expique tuk tuk tour  Easy to navigate cheap to travel air conditioned and free WiFi Downside is that itâs very busy so you have to queue again at the doors we got on the fourth train to arrive at the station

title: Good service
review: Fast way and spend less it's good to take this service as it's fast and you will not spend much as taxi

title: Covenient
review: Very informative and BTS staffs are very Courteous and Friendly They go all the way to expalin to you how to change trains from BTS to MRT whitout any fuss Stations are very Clean and Passengers are also courteous when we Seniors are travelling cos they always offered their seats to us

title: BTS sky train is good but limited
review: The sky train provides a good efficient service sadly it is not available all over Bangkok We arrived at the Don Mueang airport we caught the A1 bus to the BTS sky train ask the driver he will tell you where to get off then get the sky train into centre of Bangkok we got off at the Siam Centre Bus cost 30 Bhat each and the train was 88 Bhat each Good value for money

title: Very convenient
review: Tired of Bangkok traffic  Start from 6pm it could take your an hour to just turn around the corner Taxi is also not good at finding the location and very few of them would use google map  Subway system is very good Just that you might have to queue at the kiosk to buy ticket  Although it is normally not crowded and goes to most places it would still be Diffinc to get a seat  Signage is also clear Improvement will be an indication of the next stop would be helpful to tourist

title: Quick and easy traveling trough Bangkok
review: We used the BTS for traveling to our hotel The hotel was located in Sukhumvit it quit close to the station It is a very cheap way of traveling through Bangkok

title: Slow but still efficient
review: The train speed is pretty slow but it is still a more efficient way to travel if you want to avoid jams

title: Best and cheapest transport mean in Bangkok
review: If you need to decide whether to use the Metro (underground) or BTS skytrain I would recommend to use the BTS skytrain Most of Bangkok's attractions can be reached via the BTS skytrain lines The metro lines do not really go to places where tourists are going Buy a Rabbitcard at one of the BTS stations The card costs 200 THB (of which 100 THB is for the card)  and loaded 500 THB extra value This is approx 20eur and I could easily use the BTS train intensively for 6 days long

title: Rabbit Card took us everywhere
review: There is a 100B non refundable deposit when you get a card (passport required) but the card lasts for years so you can just keep it and top up the next trip BTS is quite extensive and we took the train everyday during this trip

title: easy access
review: as a solo traveller its help me to bring me to the place that I want to visit for the first time  and it's fast  and the sign board of the information is easy to understand

title: The only way to travel in comfort - efficiently, cheaply and in a/c.
review: The only way to travel in comfort  efficiently cheaply and in ac Stopped using taxis because the network is fairly extensive and is being extended Wouldn't travel any other way

title: Best way to travel
review: Maybe a bit more expensive then tuktuk but you are 100% sure to get on time in AC cars usually not much crowded

title: Take the train, the skytrain
review: The Bangkok SkyTrain is underrated It is convenient and cheap Ok it does not go everywhere but it does go downtown to the river from which you can travel most places

title: Enjoyable experience
review: Good experience and very convenient going from one place to another Punctual and keeps to timing Helpful staff to direct tourists and help with buying tickets

title: Quick and efficient
review: The best way to get around and see Bangkokcarriages are very clean even though sometimes  Overcrowded but one eventually gets to know the busiest times of the day to travel A day pass will only cost you 140 Bhrt  Certainly a lot cheaper than a taxi or tuk tuk during peak hours  In the traffic congestionâs

title: Clean and cool way to travel around Bangkok
review: Very well air conditioned means of transport Fast Stops at midnight No eating nor drinking in the BTS system Get the Bunny card

title: Very handy
review: Been taking bets trains for travelling around bkk  Really convinient as it's fast clean cool and cheap just needs to be aware it can get quite cloaked in rush hours

title: A model for public transportation
review: We used the Skytrain throughout our stay in Bangkok and found it to be a wonderful way to get around  Not quite a fun as the occasional tuk tuk fast economical clean and efficient  It obviously can get very crowded at peak hours but passengers are always courteous  We were travelling with two small children and they never had to stand more than a stop before someone offered them their seat

title: Great
review: Easy to navigate and cheap very frequent and clean We used a lot to get around Bangkok to visit the sights and in the evenings  they run until around midnight

title: Bangkok trip
review: Used on several occasions to get to markets and sky walk Very easy to use and very cheap  Easy way to get around and see sights  Highly recommend

title: efficient but sometimes pricey esp if have family
review: We took BTS to Chatuchuk mkt from Asok and was sooo surprised that it cost 44 Baht pp We were family of 4 and so it cost like 176 bht WOWpricey it's effienct and you will get seat after Siam station But we realized it's cheaper and more comfortable just to take a cab It airconditioned and if stuck in traffic who cares We paid 75 bht for taxi back to hotel near Asok from Mkt  more than 12 price of BTS for 4 and it was quicker too The catch you must find taxi who will use meter and you should be 2 or more to breakeven  For shorter distance it may be close in price but still minimum you have to pay about 20 baht or more A cab to most places around bangkok is around 40  50 baht Max may be like 70 to 80 if further or traffic  We therefore took taxis everywhere in our 6 days in bangkok   Note there is a cheap money changer in many BTS stations Superrich Best rates in Thailand Line up goes pretty fast  The only time think BTS is best is when heavy rains and flooded streets or if you are traveling alone Otherwise taxis rules even if traffic

title: Packed and cold
review: The train takes a long time to come like half and hour and when it comes it is always fully loaded with passengers so be ready to feel like a canned sardine The positive aspect is that it is super cold despite a bit dark so you don't feel suffocated inside feels a bit adventurous to take the public transit in Bangkok but it is worth the try at least once

title: Excellent to explore Bangkok
review: The convenience of taking the metro everywhere was one that made our visit to Bangkok easy Prices were reasonable and accessible to most of Bangkok

title: Easy to use and clean
review: Very simple and easy to use runs on time Clean trains Station map free in most hotels and online Tickets can be bought at the machines or at the desks You get a plastic credit card sized ticket which you scan to get in through the barrier and then put in the slot to get out  the ticket gets recycled Great idea better than paper tickets

title: BTS
review: Not the best mass transport system but it works and far better than taxi or tut tutPlenty staff around to help out

title: Getting around
review: BTS cheap easy doesnât go everywhere but gets you to the major malls like MBK You can also take the BTS as far as possible and then hop on a bus

title: Beat the Traffic
review: Very very convenient to travel in the BTS Skytrain Yes you need to know names of a few important Junctions in the City lest you are on the wrong route

title: Convenient for budget travellers
review: BTS Skytrain in bangkok is the primary means of transportation for tourists in exploring bangkok Easy to navigate and you'll be reminded by the station where you at through the mini monitor inside and announcement in every stop

title: Easy use, clean, safe
review: Great easy way to get around Bangkok and skip the traffic jams  Definitely recommend using it  Ticket offices readily help tourists  Cool AC in the cars  Easy to read maps

title: Convenience & Affordability
review: The BTS is a really convenient way to get around Bangkok It's clean and wellmaintained A ticket costs about 16 to 59 baht (or maybe more) depending on how far you want to go You can even do your own "city tour" by purchasing the allday pass for 140baht Each station has their own culture and and almost all of them has a mall or group of shops attached

title: Very convenient
review: Cheapest fastest easiest way of transportation Once you understand the BTS routes it is very easy to travel Might get crowded during rush hours Clean and well maintained As the next station is displayed and announced inside the compartments passengers wont get lost

title: my favorite mode of transport
review: very convenient and cheap fare just avoid the rush hour very userfriendly as well the staff at ticketbooths speak english

title: Speedy centre
review: I recommend to take the trainthe fastest way to come from one side of the town to the otherjust watch ur belongings it can be quite crowded

title: Skip the crazy insane traffic and opt for BTS
review: Travelling on BTS route there is no better option as traffic can be maddening in those areas BTS is not only convenient but it saves a lot of time If you are travelling solo or as a couple it is more budget friendly as well

title: Recommended means of getting around
review: Covers quite a bit of central Bangkok and connects with other rail systems and the khlong boats Convenient and there is no need to bargain and haggle for the fare Ticket vending machines have instructionsmaps in English

title: Vacation CNRA tour
review: Crazy Not Rich Asian Tour We use BTS to go to the shopping mall from our hotel Atheneum Clean stations and trains buy ticket attendant not so service oriented

title: Great addition to Bangkok
review: Easy way to get around Convenient and efficient Can get very crowded though Good alternative to braving Bangkok traffic

title: Very intuitive
review: Riding the BTS is as advertised  It is super easy to use and get around and the cars are air conditioned

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: With all the traffic jams and vehicle pollution in Bangkok the BTS is a no brained to get around Itâs also very reasonably priced

title: visit to Ancient City taking BTS
review: Wonderful AC trains staff speaks English and responds to questions nicely  Inside the train screens provide detailed info as well a clear announcements

title: Wort getting a day pass
review: We use the skytrain as our mode of transport in Bangkok Well worth getting a day pass and then you can get on and off as many times as you like clean and airconditioned

title: Comments on BTS Skytrain
review: This is an excellent mode of transport to avoid huge traffic on Bangkok roads Faster hassle free and economic as well (if you travel alone)

title: Lovely ride if not on rush hours
review: The route is quite simple but check the destination well how far it is from the station  The trouble is that Thailand is very hot country  Without a good link to buildings or if you have to walk to far wouldnât be fun Mostly packed during rush hours but not too bad  I have seen worse than this in other major cities  Ticket vending machine may not be that friendly especially when you are not so familiar with Thailand coins  Suggest you que to buy the ticket  It is always quite  Less than 3 minutes wait most of the time

title: A Great Way to Beat the Traffic
review: Cheap fast reliable and safe Have a look at the map and see if Skytrain is an option  it sure beats sitting in a traffic jam

title: Transport that you need when u are in bangkok
review: Good transport system If you are there during weekday please know the peak hour time and avoid it If not you will have to wait for few train before your turn but people here are nice and they will give space if there is any

title: Good value
review: Relatively cheap but no English at airport counter Consequently couldn't tell me I had to buy another ticket to get on another line once the airport train terminated

title: Busy but efficient
review: I take the BTS every day Yes it's had its hiccups but overall it is a fairly efficient way of getting around BKK Will be better as more lines are opened in the near future

title: Convenient And cheap but clean and not crappy
review: The BTS is simple to navigate and very convenient to ride on Once you locked your own location and the destination The amount is shown for easy reference and there is always the friendly humanly manned booths to assist

title: Would ride again
review: Fast a little pricier than other modes of transportation but totally worth it Would travel by BTS Skytrain again

title: A comfortable and fast way to travel
review: BTS Skytrain  is a convenient and fast mode of transport It is an important help in the chaotic Bangkok because the traffic jam is really terrible It's an economical way of transport unfortunately there are only three subway lines

title: It's the way to get around Bangkok
review: Traffic jams are a everyday problem in Bangkok so the best way to get around is by taking the public transport On time very clean and always someone who is willing to help out tourists with directions

title: Best way to beat the Rush hour
review: BTS train is still my best choice for travelling in Bangkok I am from singapore and I think BTS system is very much better than the one we have in Singapore It is clean and run above the roads to evey parts of Bangkok From airport i took the BTS to siam and transferred to silom in less than 45mins It is very easy and you need to have alot of coins 1050 THB to buy the one time ticket so if your location in the BTS map is number 42 you got to put 42 THB The shops around there would not change for you Only at the BTS counter but usually very long queue between 0800hrs1100hrs and 1500hrs till 2100hrs

title: Easy transportation
review: BTS will be our choice if we will go to any places that BTS could reach Bangkok BTS is pretty new and clean I wish they would build more lines During rush hours they are very crowded But it is worth if you could take only a few minutes to get to your destination

title: very efficient
review: the sky train is the only way to get around bkk ok you can get a tuk tuk  and get a slice of real thai life but once was enough for me

title: Convenient and on time train
review: Convenient to avoid heavy traffic on road Clean and easy to get ticket However not every station will have lift or escalators You need to walk along the stairs with your luggage

title: Nice Service
review: Service seems to be proper But when you travel as a group itâs better to opt for a taxi which will be more cheaper

title: Have a jacket with you
review: BTS Skytrain is excellent and only transportation menas to get quick from one point to the other especially during rash hours

title: Amazing
review: very convenient and lineld to all major parts of the city Good network and connectivity Easy to use and well manned stations Pretty clean and infrastructure wise also very good

title: clean and clear routes
review: I am coming from singapore and it was almost similar u cant eat in the train u need to q to get into the train From airport i took the BTS to siam and transferred to silom If u r a tourist like me pls have alot of coins on u as u need to use coins to buy the one time ticket so if ur location in the BTS map is number 42 u got to put 42 baht The shops around there know that u need the coins for the machine yet there do not help So try to change the money and go to buy the ticket

title: The best way to travel
review: I strongly believe that immersing yourself in the day to day hustle of local life is important  What better way to do this than using public transit  This isnât your âole yellow school busâ as itâs quick efficient and cheap  Once I had a few trip under my belt the BTS became number 1 for getting around town I highly recommend using google maps and selecting the train to see the exact cost of your destination so that you arenât stumped when paying the toll  Compared to taxi or tuk tuk this is more efficient and certainly a fraction of the cost

title: Convenient!
review: The BTS network was a very convenient mode of travel during my last visit as I stayed in Sukhumvit line Major access to shopping malls and weekend market including access to boat network

title: amazing bts service
review: a one day pass is too good for travellers instead of waiting in the line every time for tickets to be purchased it just cost 140 baht with unlimited bts travel not applicable for mrt and buses

title: Bangkok's transport alternative
review: Its a train system that runs above streets (with rails of its own on concrete pillars) Its a alternative transport in Bangkok (during crowded hour  office and school) Mind that during those hours the train is full Also there is a unwritten rule  manner on enter the train (que on left and right of the entrance  exit at station before it arrived)  This system connected several tourist and shopping spot (please get a map and match it again at the station  due to the name that might had difficulties for some people to pronounce) Compare to other transports like taxi and the famous tuktuk) its cheap and faster (just make sure that the destination is near) they had provided destination name in alphabet at the station to make easy (still the need to know your direction is needed) Ticket system is similar with other countries (used magnetic card  put in a lot at the gate)  The only minus is that because the station is built above ground you need to go through stairs (not all station had escalators)

title: Easy easy easy
review: The key to our great time in Bangkok was our hotel being close to the skytrain station The entire city is accessible via this train system and the various train systems connecting to the skytrain  Trains are clean and efficient

title: Well organized. Easy to find your way
review: All trains are modern and have digital display to show you the route They have English announcements They are often crowded

title: get a Rabbit card
review: Rabbit card is a prepay card for the skytrain that can be used at the MBK food court too easy travelling without queueing for change

title: Beat the jams, take the trains!
review: Bangkok is well known for its traffic jams And while not the cheapest mode of transportation the BTS and MRT is relatively efficient and gets you to most places where you can then transfer to another mode of transportation It cuts through the hassle of weaving through traffic and you don't end up paying hefty taxi fares while being stuck in traffic Definitely one of my favourite modes of transportation

title: Cheap and chearful
review: Excellent way to get around bangkok You can either use the BTS or the cheap meter taxis Both are excellent  Buy a ticket top this ticket up with baht and away you go

title: makes it easy and affordable to get around
review: best buy a rabbit card at the station and it makes is quicker if you catch the train from the airport the last station joints the BTS The Aircon is frezzing in the carriage really cold

title: Limited but a nice way to get around
review: The BTS is a bit limited as it only really goes around the down town of Bangkok but it's always very clean and has air con so it's cool

title: Fast and Comfy
review: When you want to have a quick transportation in Bangkok try this one The next train services in every 510 minutes so you won't take a long time to wait

title: The best way to travel in Central of Bangkok City.
review: BTS can help you save time for Bangkok traffic  If you want to go somewhere no BTS you are better take BTS to the last station (nearest to the target location) and continue a taxi  During rainy season BTS may have some problems  The train traffic signal has some problems and delay the train time schedule Please plan your travel time

title: Convenient
review: The BTS gets me everywhere and always passing by within 5 minutes Great to have in Bkk and glad to hear it is expanding to other parts of the city

title: Great way to get arpund
review: The BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok to the areas where there is a bts stop Beats sitting in heavy traffic Goes to most tourist ateasattractions Highly recommend using it

title: Fantastic
review: I took BTS and MRT everywhere around the city Clean airconditioned punctual and cheap There is no reason to sit in Bangkok traffic

title: Clean and Reliable
review: The BTS Skytrain is a reliable way to travel in Bangkok It's much better than taking a taxi or tuk tuk because you can avoid the traffic on the roads So if you're in a hurry the BTS Skytrain is the way to go  It's very reliable and very clean as drinks and food are not allowed on the skytrain What's also nice is that all the skytrains are air conditioned   The BTS skytrain cost per trip is charged by distance so the farther you have to travel the more you will have to pay The cost ranges from about 15 thb to 45 thb There are maps in english that matches the destination with the cost to get to each stop so that is very helpful If you need assistance there are customer service counters at each station to assist you and to provide you with change if needed

title: Most pleasant when it is not rush hour
review: Just queue up like everyone else and enter train orderly In other major cities people just rush in  I cannot say that for rush hour just get in or be late

title: Efficient
review: The bts skytrain is great for getting around bangkok it is air conditioned too it can get crowded on the trains at times like rush hour but itâs far better than sitting in a cab not getting anywhere

title: Awesome when itâs traffic in BKK
review: You cannot skip this one traffic on BANGKOK roads Suckin the evenings specially you need to travel on BTS

title: As convenient as it gets
review: It is the one and only way to get from point A to point B without getting engaged in the city's heavy traffic jams There are only 2 lines so you dont have to think much cashiers help you designing your routes ticket is cheap and fair for Western standards (the more you travel the more you pay) wagons are fully airconditioned and clean Last but not least there are security officers in every platform and you feel safe during any minute of your stay over there

title: could be much improved
review: After living in Seoul for 12 years it's hard to go back in time and use Bangkok's BTS I have two really important function issues First why are customers forced to buy 3 cards  one for each city train Other cities figured this out over a decade ago Shame on Bangkok for allowing these train companies to do this to customers (Haven't been to Seoul Please do You can use 1 transportation card for all the trains buses and taxis  nationwide) Second BTS forces customers to know the names of the final stops No other clues are given to where you are going while you are up on the platform I think customers would appreciate signs saying "next stop is" and "last stop was" (And again Korea does this)

title: Easy and cheap way to get around parts of Bangkok
review: The overhead BTS skytrain is an Easy and cheap way to get around parts of Bangkok All the times I've taken the skytrain at all times of the day I rarely obtain a seat so govern yourself accordingly

title: Cool
review: Best choice in case BTS Line is match with your destination in Bangkok Really fast with reasonable price Unfortunately just available by two connected lines in present also connected to Airport Link (Skytrain) So when you access to BTS You can connect to new airport ( Suwarnabhumi airport) too )

title: More train carriages needed - poor traffic management
review: The trains are extremely busy most of the day and sometimes its near impossible to get on They need to add more rolling stock

title: An escape from the Bangkok traffic - The BTS Sky Train !!
review: For anybody who had to deal with the endless slow traffic in Bangkok the BTS is a reminder that there are modern reasonably priced alternatives which are quite efficient and even pleasant Together with the complementing modern subway (Metro) the 2 systems provide easy access to most significant locations in the city The situation is going to improve even further as new lines are being constructed to extend the service of the BTS to the periphery of Bangkok

title: easy to use
review: excellent service and very reliable fast and efficient and clean carriges with good selection of stations

title: Efficient way to get around
review: I was so impressed with the BTS sky trainhaving so used to travelling around BKK with hotel shuttles I decided to try it this time and never again would use any other means of transportation in BKK They had BTS staff in every station who speaks English and willing to help you in every direction Everything was well signed posted and Numbered for your exit Train was very clean and cold A pleasure to get in from the heat outside And they had kiosk in every station to help you quench your thirst after a long hot day walking And was amaze with the walkways that connects one Mall to another that you donât have to walk on the street with the traffic The best way to go around BKK if you want get to your destination on time and not sit in traffic for hours

title: much better than taxi
review: the skytrain is such a breeze compared to the long and slow trips in a taxi in rush hour easy ro use and navigate

title: Avoid the Rush Hour
review: BTS is a super convenient way to get around Bangkok if you time yourself well by avoiding the rush hours  LIke all Metropolitan city around the world office workers depend on its mass transit to get from home to office and back  Our office hours are between 8301700 hour  Between 9301600 hour is the best time to enjoy your ride and sightseeing of the city  If you stay in Bangkok for a few days it is a good idea to buy a Rabbit Card to avoid constant queue up at the ticketing machine  The card can be used at various food halls around town

title: Very Convenient!
review: The bts is wonderful and for us the best way to see more of bangkok and explore many more areas than we normally could  On time clean and secure  It does get a bit busy during rush hour but the effective air con inside the cabins makes for a very comfortable ride

title: BTS sky train Bangkok
review: This is my absolute first time riding public transit as I come from a small city The BTS is easy to use and inexpensive The routes are easy to read and signs are in English

title: Efficient travel system
review: I think the only way to travel around Bangkok efficiently is the metro or sky train We were staying in Sukhumvit and there was a station close by You purchase the ticket based on the number of stops Ours cost 40 Baht  enter and just make sure you are going the right direction Each station is in English and the train states what station you are coming into Quite crowded at the time but there personal space was not compromised Efficient quick and inexpensive Itâs the way to go

title: BTS is East to Use
review: I find that sometimes my experience in foreign lands can be difficult because f the language differences But the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok is easy to use First to purchase afare go the agent's window and tell them where you're going They'll give you the correct change for the ticketing machine You will have to purchase your ticket there Look nthe route map to see where you're going and purvhase yor fare It's that easy Take your time too There's no need for you to make a mistake The instructions are written in English

title: Conveniency
review: I have been using bts as a mode of transportation since it is the most efficient to travel around bangkok bypassing the traffic jams They are perfect for locals though  Its very safe and reliable yet some deficiencies and inconveniencies to those with baggages and also no lift (most stations) leading to the ground floor after existing that needs attention fo

title: Nice and clean
review: The BTS is critical to the the traffic jammed city It is clean and cool We always book our hotel along the BTS line However the train is getting more and more crowded

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: I moved to Bangkok 8 months ago In previous visits to research where I wanted to live I quickly realized that while taxis are inexpensive the rides can prove very frustrating Bangkok has some of the most frequent and worst traffic jams in the world However the BTS (elevated train system) and the MRT (subway system) are clean efficient air conditioned and easy to use I rented a condo near the Asok BTS station and Sukhumvit MRT station I use these systems daily They are inexpensive run frequently  sometimes at peak travel times trains run every 25 minutes You can either buy tickets from machines for individual trips or reloadable cards from the ticket windows I recommend the cards as the ticket lines can sometimes be long I always reload the cards when I notice lines at a particular station are short or nonexistant Unfortunately you need separate cards for each system but it's a minor inconvenience The trains and subways can be very crowded at peak times 910 AM &  48 PM on weekdays depending on the direction you are going I have always found both systems to be reliable and safe I've had no experiences with myself or anyone I heard of having trouble with pickpockets or thieves But you should always be alert to those possibilities when traveling in crowded situations The BTS website is informative and easy to navigate

title: Best way to get around
review: Whenever you visit Bangkok be sure to stay near a BTS station It will save you so much time not to mention money The BTS is sooo clean with blasting air conditioning throughout it's quick safe and takes you pretty much everywhere you need to go and close enough to all the main tourist attractions Quick hassle free ride to the airport no more sitting on traffic or dealing with cab drivers

title: Fast transport
review: It is the best way to travel in Bangkok Fast efficient and mostly on time It is crowded in rush hour but it is better than being stuck in traffic and not going anywhere

title: Clean, efficient, cheap!
review: Very easy to use and comfortable journeys with great air conditioning Heavy traffic so Sky Train much faster than taxis

title: Logistics to die for
review: Absolutely stunning Organised  on time  cheap and cheerful What a breath if fresh air  Coming and going anywhere could not have been easier  This system is making any foreigners life easier  You can get absolutely anywhere by using this Could get a bit crowded over peak  but that is normal  Never felt threatened and can recomend to anyone  Great aircon system  that is a breath of fresh air as you get on

title: Easy, fast, clean, comfortable
review: The Bangkok Skytrain is a really very easy fast clean and comfortable way to reach a destination in this huge city No need to worry about not finding the right ticket platform or even train Everything is well marked and the access is easy The only thing to keep in mind is to take some warming clothes as the air condition makes the train quite cold If only they had more lines

title: used it a lot
review: Very clean and easy to use subway station used it a lot during my visit to Bangkok Its clean very cold and very punctual

title: BKK Skytrain
review: Travelling by Skytrain is very cheap and convenient can get loaded during peak periods ( when locals going to and from work)  Gets you where you want to go  very reliable and frequent

title: Efficient transport. Beats the hell of traffic!
review: I am really into effective means of transport most specially in congested cities like BBK The BTS is the pipeline that takes you anywhere around the city and even has a link to Suvarbhuni airport No long queue in buying tickets or token and train comes every 10 minutes

title: Ideal mode of transport
review: What better way to travel than the BTS Skytrain in the notorious traffic laden streets of BangkokPunctualneat & efficientEasiest & hassle free way to get around in the capital of Thailand

title: Sky tube - busy, very effective
review: This is definitely worth using to get around in Bangkok the maps and the stations are very easy to follow as there only appears to be 2 lines  The tickets are cheap and easy to get and use  The trains themselves come really often if they look full they usually aren't and people will move further in if you push to get in (which you will have to) They are crowded and there is not seating space but it's a very effective means of transport in a city where the traffic is so bad

title: Excellent
review: This was an excellent way to get around this very busy city Trains were punctual people very respectful getting on and off the train The trains were clean strict eating and drinking rules on the platform resulting in all areas being clean with a feeling of order within the stations

title: Cheap and Easy
review: The Skytrain is cheap and simple to use as the ticket machines have instructions in English as well as Thai Trains are clean airconditioned and frequent  The only drawback is that the system is limited in the range of parts of Bangkok that it covers

title: Vacation
review: Efficient and frequent combined with cleanliness and both safe and economical Best way to travel in the city Easy to use

title: Fast efficient and cheap transportation
review: The BST SkyTrain is our favourite way of transportation in Bangkok The system works as a clockwork and you have clean and safe transport to many interesting parts of the city We recommend that you buy a prepaid card for 15 or more trips if you are here for some days that makes it even faster and more easy to travel around this amazing city

title: great public transportation
review: Bangkok roads are way too crowded and it can take you 30 min to drive 2 blocks in some places the skytrain is the perfect and fastest solution to get from place to place its cheap very clean and polite not too crowded and everything is also in English so the language is not a problem Use it

title: Great Transport
review: Use this BTS skytrain can visit around the famous place and super mall Many kind of hotel around the BTS station

title: Save traffic...
review: The BTS is a fast cheap and convenient way to conduct in some areas of Bangkok The procedure is very simple and anyone who does not get along with ticket kiosks can always access a staffed desk with an up to 3 minutes line get directions and purchase a ticket Upon arrival at the appropriate platform you can find signs on the platform where you have to stand in order to enter every car of the train These markings are designed so that there are 2 queues for those who waiting to enter to the train while leaving room for those that are about to get off the car When the train arrives the exit and the entrance from the cars are conducted in a remarkable order and with the exception of rush hours in some of the high congestion stations you find yourself in an air conditioned car with a pleasant traveling experience The ticket is also used to exit the train station so that it must be kept At the exit from the station in some places you can continue walking to the direction you need in the sky walk which is also spacious and convenient

title: Gets you from A to B
review: Really enjoyed using the sky rail very easy to use despite not speaking Thai Plenty of staff available if you need assistance

title: clean, air conditioned and spacious except in rush hour.
review: We used the Sky train and found it clean and efficient We were advised to buy tickets at the manned booths as the machines get busyThis was easy  one tip avoid in rush hour  We travelled at 1830 and it was very tightly packed Great air con keeps it comfortable when travelling  Ignore men who say this part of the track is closed it is a scam to get you to go somewhere else Smile and walk on

title: Very convenient
review: This is very efficient and travelers have the best mode of transportation in the Sky lane Additionally this is well connected with its convenient sky walk Mainly from Siam station that connects to leading Malls like Siam Paragon Central World Big C and MBK Trains are on time and extremely clean and provides efficient travel solution to city dwellers and its travelers in Bangkok

title: Views could be better
review: As far as public transport goes this is fast efficient and clean I expected to have seen more of the city but this was limited due to window coverings (I think to help keep the interior cool) Which was maybe a bit too cool You'll need to buy separate tickets to the BTS as the Airport Link MRT and BTS don't use compatible ticketstokens

title: Quick and efficient
review: The best way to get around Bangkok and it has great air conditioning Simple to navigate and to buy tickets There are warnings about pick pockets but we never saw any trouble just be sensible Interchanges between tracks are easy to navigate Download one of the apps for simple to understand maps

title: Very good!
review: the best way to get around if u donÂ´t want to be stuck in a traffic jam  Only coins accepted at the ticket machine what makes it laborious if you want to buy tickets for 3 people (they donÂ´t offer group tickets)

title: Efficient and fast
review: 25 Aug have taken a few stations from Nana to Chit Lom The train is fast quite though can be packed sometimes Air con is cold Overall a good ride

title: Transit system out of this world!
review: Our Hotel is connected to the BTS and it is so convenient The sky train system is so efficient and I wish they had this back in my State where I live in the US It takes you to so many places runs often and is not costly You must try it

title: Excellent and efficient
review: The train system is pretty good Trains are clean and the staff are extremely helpful and happy to guide the tourists Though tuk tuks and cabs are affordable in Bangkok the train will save you during peak hours and especially at areas such as Sukhumvit and Siam where traffic is always bad Hoping on the train will save you time and money and you can use the time and money that you've saved to good use The train system also comes with a really cool walkway that links you to the major malls but please note that you may have to leave the train station at times and reenter at a later section because there is not through road via the walkway

title: Great
review: Easy and cheap itâs perfect rain or heat Itâs air conditioned and if it rains forget using the roads Easy to buy tickets using machines or English speaking ticket sellers available

title: Convenient way of travel in Bangkok
review: BTS skytrain has two lines the silom and Sukhumvit lines If you are a frequent btraveller than Rabit card is good You can recharge it If you want few travels You can get ticket at every station but you need coins for this You get coins in station as well

title: easiest way to get around
review: cheap easy and fast  if you don't need to get a grab taxi tuktuk or gojek this way is the fastest and cheapest

title: Best Way to commute
review: BTS is the best and most cost effective way to commute in Bangkok  All the station are mirror clean

title: 5 Star
review: Very neat clean and time saving solution for travelling in Bangkok One gets to avoid the long and frustrating traffic Jams on the roads Rates are reasonable I suggest that BTS should introduce weekly tourist cards for shorttime traveler like us It would have saved us buying the ticket every time Overall a 5 Star

title: Very busy but easy to use.
review: Great public transport service to use that avoids the crazy traffic in Bangkok  Itâs quite simple to use but can be tricky to navigate from particularly when very busy

title: Best transport choice
review: Since Bangkok has so much heavy traffic car motorbikes tuk tuk etc The BTS is your best and convenience is assured  Plus you also purchase a prepaid card called a rabbit card its very convenient than doing single journeys everytime

title: Best way to transport in bkk
review: Very clean and very useful Always on time and the tickets are so cheap  I use rabbit adult card and recharge it whenever i visit

title: So convenient
review: BTS skytrain is the most convenient reliable economical and timely was to travel in Bangkok  No need to worry about being stuck in gridlock or getting ripped off by cab drivers  We found BTS skytrain easy to use and so reliable  You can purchase a day pass for 140 baht (US$450) unlimited rides  Or purchase tickets as needed ranges from 1644 baht per journey (50cents to $150)  The trains are modern clean and air conditioned  Such a relief to hop on the BTS after sightseeing or shopping

title: Clean and cool
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok It runs regularly is easy to find and is always heavily air conditioned Lines to get change are often long so save coins so that you can selfserve and buy your tickets at the machine

title: Super Easy to use
review: So easy and efficient transport system to use  Bangkok traffic is crazy and this is the best method to get around the city and quick

title: Family Holiday
review: We are thankful that we stayed next to the National Stadium Station of the BTS Skytrain  Bangkok traffic jam has gotten worse  The train was a savior  It is cheap and realiable  Yes there is a lack of escalators for seniors but it is better than suffering in the traffic jam  We use the BTS very often during our 5 days stay

title: Thailand 2018
review: What a pleasure to use The best way to go about in Bangkok I expensive no need to negotiate first or to visit a Taylor shop for a gas coupon This took a lot of stress from me to get my family from hotel to all the tourist sites We stayed at Nasa Vegas and it was easy to take train from there

title: Fast, cheap and with air conditioning!!
review: This is basically Bangkokâs London Underground but better   Why itâs better    stations are NUMBERED so itâs easy to know when to get off where you are etc   the price IS the destination  At first very strange but then you realise itâs genius  Youâre standing at the ticket thing you press the button next to the name of your destination ON the button is a number That IS the cost to that location from your location How simple is that   Well it would be but my western brain took a while to figure it out Thatâs why Iâm telling you here   air conditioning No need to say more We all want this on all the underground lines   phone signal Yes you can face time and chat in LINE while on the skytrain Everyone does and you should take a look around and do some shoulder surfing while your there   Bad points   Itâs a bit busy pretty much all the time  There are very few payment kiosks  There was only one exit gate to put your ticket in But it manages No idea what happens when it breaks though

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: This train system is excellent and great value 140 baht ( approx Â£350 for an all day ticket ) It is also a god send to get into the air conditioned carriages as so humid on the streets

title: Very Easy
review: Navigating and using the BTS is very straightforward and you get some great views  It can get quite busy depending on the time of day but still not a problem to get around

title: Trip to Mbk mall
review: When i need to Go fast into Bangkok city and malls best way is bts sky train no traffic and fast clean and reliable transport only down side only operate till 12 midnight and then no more so if out drinking with friends have go take cab back or go home before 12

title: Fast way to get through Bangkog
review: With the skytraon you can get quickly through Bangkog but it is overcrowded during rush hour The staff is very helpfull

title: So easy
review: I love the BTS and it is easy and clean I would definitely recommend it as a safe way to get around town

title: Efficient
review: Bought a pass with unlimited use for 1 daynight at the station Efficient and easy way to get around but does not cover all tourist areas Much quicker and cheaper than a taxi

title: The best public transport in Bangkok
review: In the begining a bit confusing how to get the ticket and the destination but after a few rude it so easy and convenience The best way to move around in Bangkok to beat the antiquity of Bangkok taxi driver

title: Easy transit
review: Why hire a private driver when you can take the BTS express to the airport Very cheap easy and runs frequently I also loved Grab ( like uber) through  our Thailand where available Great drivers clean cars and you never have to worry about being taken advantage of

title: Very easy to use and clean!
review: Very easy system to use especially coming from another country Make sure you have cash on your and especially coins as this is how you pay for the rides Worse case there are works who will give you change to pay for your fare

title: BTS Sky Train is excellent!
review: A fast cheap clean service with good security I bought a Rabbit card and regular travel over a week cost less than 400Baht or about $16 Australian dollars

title: By far the best and cheapest way to get around Bangkok
review: It gets crowded at rush hour but the trains are air conditioned so bearable All day ticket 140 baht so buy far the cheapest mode of transport If you want a thill take a tuk tuk

title: Cheap. Fast Travel
review: We used the Sky train to get around as it linked most of the places we wanted to visit Great way to find attactions & things but didn't understand the abrutness and unhappy faces of the staff

title: Cooler than Singapore or Taipei
review: Thai make sure their BTS and MRT are comfortable for the tropical weather They are well airconditioned and though they are not as extensive as Singapore or Taipei they are certainly more comfortable Cooling fans are everywhere along the platforms and the trains are wellairconditioned not that 80 degree air conditioning like in Taipei which can be miserable and kind of makes you wonder why they even bother with AC

title: Clean and efficient but must pay in cash
review: When you tour Bangkok you will need to us the MRT and the BTS Skytrain  We decided to get a prepaid card to avoid the long queues each time you buy a ticket but realized later it was not a good deal  You pay 200 baht for an adult ticket and 100 of that is nonrefundable There were 4 of us so what a waste We should have stuck to buying roundtrip tickets each time we had to ride the train  Unlike the MRT where you can pay in credit card BTS only accepts cash payment so be ready with baht

title: Quiet, fast and effecient air conditioning
review: Intuitive ticket machine Connected to the AirportCity Link Air conditioning worked well Very clear annoncement of stations Smooth and quiet

title: Nice
review: I like the bts train because its clean and announcements are in Thai and English  Some cons for me is that the ticket lines are long and the ticket machine only take coins not bills  Its not possible to buy a two way trip up front hence you will have to get on line again for a return trip

title: Easy to use
review: Quick and economical way to get around traffic  Gets you to a lot of the things you need to get to as a tourist

title: A busy commute.
review: Easily travelled from our hotel Cheep in comparison to the London Underground  You purchase tickets per stops in 16 bhat units if I remember rightly  Really fast clean great way to get around Connections with other forms of transport too

title: Good but needs more city coverage
review: The train experience was good it was clean and easy to understand The only downside is that it really doesnât cover a lot of Bangkok so you still need to depend on other forms of transportation

title: Convenient and easy transport
review: I love how it work for foreigners here very convenient and surely easy to find the places you wanna visits

title: Beatiful secanaries
review: The train was so good and the fair was so high which was not suitable for middle people and makes lot of good locations

title: Best Connect
review: The best way to reach places is the BTS it connects he city so well and that too very cheap try it u will like it

title: Great way to get around
review: The BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok and is expanding all the time  Is cheap and effective  best to pick a time outside peak hours and be aware of last train time if you intend to travel back to your accommodation later at night

title: Getting around the city
review: Easy to use cheap and great for exploring Bangkok Stops at all the main shopping centres you can stop at the river stop and take several different boat trips

title: Clean, reliable but expensive
review: We used this several times during our trip It's clean and reliable but expensive by Thai standards It does offer an interesting view of the city though as it carries you midway between street level and those who live and work up in the clouds

title: Reliable and cool inside, good value, much quicker than by road
review: If the sky train is going to or near where you want to visit take it then complete the journey by taxi

title: Great!
review: The BTS honestly takes you everywhere if your a tourist and is the best if you are ok with walking a little here and there

title: Very easy to get around
review: Hardest part is getting tickets as you need coin there is always a coin teller in which you say where you are going & she will exchange your money for coin Airconditioned which is lovely Very clean

title: Efficient BTS train but too cold and difficult to get tickets at peak hours
review: The Plus BTS train is clean well designed and generally on time The Minus the AC is too cold (freezing) and it's difficult to get tickets at peak hour Either you have your change and you can queue at machine to get tickets (machines don't accept bank notes and or credit cards) or you have to queue to the agent to change your cash The queue can length more than 10 min at peak hours

title: Avoid Rush and High Fares of Taxi and Tuk Tuk
review: Travelling with BTS Skytrain is a wonderful experience though you will get some rush in peak hours but you can easily avoid heavy traffic if you use BTS    A day pass is TBH 140 and single tickets depends on each station starting from TBH 16   All the lines are connected to several popular tourist attractions including shopping malls like MBK Siam Center Siam Discovery and Terminal 21   As advised by several travelers keep eye on your belonging all the time

title: Clean and Convenient
review: Skytrain rides are always nice Can be crowded at times but powerful AC makes the trips easy Trains are clean and well maintained

title: Buying of single trip tickets can be tedious when there is crowd
review: Single ticket machines only accept coins so need to first change coins at the counter before proceeding to buy tickets at the machine

title: Very busy on morning and evening
review: Very busy on morning and evenning especialy Siam station Morchit station Sukhumvit station Nowaday you can buy a card at the counter (In the past you must chang a note to a coin and pay it in ticket machine

title: BKK's BTS
review: BTS is very efficient but a little bit pricy If you are travelling with a group of 3 or more within the city you can ride a Cab with a lower price compared to BTS for a short distance Traffic is not really bad as compared to main roads of Manila ðð»

title: Quick, clean and reliable
review: Best way to get from the airport and around the city clean safe and easy to use Can get packed though

title: Once you've got the hang of it, really easy to use.
review: Don't hesitate to use this cheap comfortable transport Easy to use once you've used it and we had a really helpful staff member help us buy our first ticket

title: Best way to get around the city!
review: Our hotel was just minutes from the Skytrain We found it the quickest cleanest and coolest way to get around the city It is easy to understand how to use it and VERY inexpensive  Use the Skytrain when it Bangkok

title: Most convenient way to see Bangkok
review: Always crowded but clean  just plain fast and efficient I always use the BTS when I'm in Bangkok I see the DMK Airport stop is almost completed

title: Crowded but fast
review: Well if you are travelling in the main city area especially don't bother taking taxi cos you are constantly stuck in a jam It might be crowded but its still faster than a taxi People on the train are mostly kind so will give up seats to others One more thing is that the BTS system is a different one from the MRT so my Rabbit card can't be used for MRT and instead it has its own system Why can't they have only 1

title: Great way of getting around
review: This was a great way of getting around the city it was really cheap and not to over crowed we used it everyday to get round city for sight seeing

title: Easy to navigate...
review: Maybe its because we are New Yorkers and are well accustomed to large mass transit systems  but this train system was easy to navigate clean and efficient Great way to save a few $$$$ in Bangkok

title: very quick
review: good for traveling areas in Bangkok it comes and goes often and therefore give you the chance to move around very easyly

title: Cheap, clean & efficient.
review: Staying near Victory Monument meant we could easily access the Skytrain It's a pretty simple ticketing system as at the purchase point  each destination is marked with the cost Only hassle is lining up for change especially in busy periods

title: August
review: Easy to use efficient service by the staff Very similar to London Tube service so is confident using that then do not hesitate Peak work times obviously busy and unbearable but still quicker then sitting in the Bangkok traffic Does have air con though

title: The Only Way to Travel During Rush Hour
review: When Bangkok comes to a standstill during rush hour (79 am and 48 pm) the only way to travel is on the BTS Yes it will be crowded but AZ it is the best way to go Buy a BTS card and forget about standing in line Swipe in it tells you how much credit you have swipe off again it gives you your balance

title: Best way to avoid traffic jams
review: We used to travel by taxi in Bangkok however recently the traffic jams are getting worst in Bangkok So we had started to travel by BST in order to avoid the jam However please take note that the security guides are very strict about what you bring into the station It might be troublesome but it is for the safety of all the passengers

title: Super Cool !!!
review: Absolutely hygiene & super cool A convenient and easy way of transport to travel far away distance places

title: I Love ALL the LRT in Bangkok - Cheap Easy Way to Travel!
review: Whether it is the Airport Rail Link the BTS Sky Train or the Underground Metro Bangkok really has it together when it comes to LRT (Light Rapid Transit) It is a very economic and efficient way to get around Bangkok The trains can get very crowded during rush hour however it is nothing compared the gridlock faced on roads during the same time periods No to mention cabs can be quite costly You can get pretty much anywhere using the LRT and catching a TukTuk once in your desired Neighbourhood I Highly Recommend this System of Travel in BKK

title: Best way to travel
review: The best and most efficient way to travel around Bangkok fast and reliable just sit back and enjoy the air conditioning Easy to use signs and announcements are in Thai and English Try to avoid during peak times as it will be extremely crowded

title: Easy to use mode of transport in Bangkok
review: Easy to use and very convenient mode of transport across parts of the city Very modern and clean cars Also a very cheap alternative to cabs

title: Better than taking a taxi
review: It serves its purpose taking you from point A to point B It's much better than taking a taxi cheaper and it has air con inside As you can imagine it gets crowded during rush hours so keep that in mind As the name says "Skytrain" this means that you can have some interesting views of Bangkok

title: Quite straightforward and cheap
review: We had the sky train stop not far from our hotel and we decided  to go on a short adventure to a stop not far from one of the many night markets  The ticketing system was a little confusing and unlike in other major cities the different city metro train companies donât work in unison But the purchase of tickets at the station was ok with a little localadvice and kids travel at a discounted rate For 4 stops it was only about 160 Baht for 4 of us (Â£4â¬5$6)  The trains themselves are air conditioned modern and clean We didnât feel unsafe at any point and had we had more time we would have used it a bit more

title: Skytrains excellent
review: No problem getting around Sky Trains very clean easy to read next stations Stations easy to find can get tickets from English speaking staff

title: Good
review: The Sky Train is a very good option to move quickly in the Bangkok traffic Unfortunately it does not serve the whole city but if you can use it you will save some money but especially a lot of time Be aware that in the rush hours it could be very crowded

title: Useful and cheap
review: Getting around a city like Bangkok can be an issue However the sky train is the answer With stations dotted all over the city you can get to most places easily It is also extremely cheap to use With stations being numbered it saves trying to memorise names Announcements for the next train and on board the trains are done in English which is a great help

title: Organised, clean and minimum wait
review: I liked this city link train People are respectful and follow rules of letting people out before going in Cheap and with the bad traffic a great alternative to road transport Very well thought out compared to others cities countries and a must if you visit Bangkok

title: Awesome system
review: Bangkok have an awesome transport system which is nice and cheap and very efficient and speedy Plus the air conditioning is amazing

title: Easy and best way to get around in city
review: Bangkok is a busy city lots of traffic on road  BTS is like a blessing in this city to get around it is cheap safe and fast well connected to all the major malls and markets you can either take one way pass or a metro card starting from 200THB fare are on average 4050 THB one side BTS is well connected with Airport raillink We stayed in Bangkok for three days and used BTS at full and saved lots of money also it not much crowded like Indian metro trains BUT make sure that you use good deodorant as people feel uncomfortable and offended by your body odour easily

title: Best way to get around
review: Donât be tricked by taxi with no meters or TukTuks with âonly one stopâ Be brave  use the sky train   Itâs cheap  and you can buy a day pass too Itâs extremely easy to work Clean quick and I donât understand why so few tourists use it   Maps are everywhere and most popular tourist spots tell you which BTS they are located on   Even if youâre staying on Sukhumvit and want to visit the Grand Palace  donât book a tour yes itâs in the other side of the city but itâs 30mins on the MRT (underground  located at Asoke) or the BTS and change at Siam   Just do it  I promise itâs really easy My parents came to visit me when I lived there I left them in Bangkok for a day to go back to work  they loved the BTS and could even navigate it after a few (lot) of beer It may be a little stressful if you did it with small children though

title: Easy bustling transport
review: The coin toss of a taxi stuck in traffic or the bustling activity of the skytrain We chose the train  Staff were polite and spoke English providing guidance on the correct platforms   A little busy but no more than London Underground or the US subway   Child friendly and worth a go to see city views of Bangkok

title: Useful.
