review: It is too cheap and very useful If you go to  somewhere to trip or to make shop in Bangkok You should use BTS

title: Urban Transport At It's Best
review: Living in Sydney where public transport is often at best shambolic it is a pleasure to visit a city as big as Bangkok and actually enjoy moving about using public transport The BTS Skytrain is perhaps the ONLY way to get aroundcertainly beats the frustration of a taxi at ground level especially for anyone short of the patience a Saint

title: A great way to travel
review: Bangkok's BTS rail system is a treasure Remarkably affordable frequent service air conditioned immaculately clean it is a safe secure and convenient way to find your way around the city While taxis are inexpensive for a capital city their cost can be confused if you become caught in a traffic jamb and the fare ticks away while you sit still No such worry with the BTS There is a phone app available to help you navigate your journey

title: Extremely Helpful and Very Convenient
review: Since it's begun it's operations in late 1999 BTS in Bangkok been so efficient and effective carrying passengers of busy Bangkok metropolis   I have found this service very convenient and helpful each and every time when I visit Bangkok  BTS  charges are very fair and affordable to most budgeted traveler and it Carter's all ages including infantsbabiesfamiliesclergiespregnant moms etc  It's really helping to minimize the heavy traffic jams on roads and high ways and transport it's passengers to their stations on time  BTS service in Bangkok is amazingly helpful and very convenient indeed  It has a wide coverage of major roads and locations in Bangkok while further expansion of stations are underway  Most recently they have expanded the BTS SUKHUMVIT LIKE from Bearing station to Wanting on Samut Prakan That means out side the Bangkok city areaIsn't it nice and amazing  Traveler now can experience the temples and shopping areas in Wanting area as well  This all because of BTS  I found Bangkok BTS is one of the best elevated metro services in the world and what then good luck expanding their coverage more and more

title: Very convenient
review: Very fast for you need to go some area in city of Bangkok if you need to go shopping mbk or week end market is very convenient

title: Clean, effective and easy to get about.
review: Doesn't cover every inch of the city like some iconic city metros but it does enough and is very safe efficient and effective 44BHT will get to you most places you need to go  We queued patiently to board a train when someone yelled at me "This is Bangkok everybody just goes" Also be prepared to get friendly with randoms at rush hour they like to pack em in

title: Trains out of service
review: Travelled from Asok station to the river 2 trains approx 40min crowded but the AC was always good Delay caused by lack of trains service issue and I was there for 3 days never got better

title: Very good transportation system.
review: Efficient and so organised I am very impressed with the BTS As a foreigner itâs easy to navigate Staff are available if you need any help Thereâs a queue system for boarding the train  super civilised and well run And air conditioning is great ðð»

title: Best transport
review: This is by far the best transport affordable transport as you can buy a ticket to move around in Bangkok Staff very helpful

title: Easy to navigate
review: Easy to read system trains clean and well air conditioned  Would advise a few coins to purchase tickets at machines Fares range between 2045 baht No air trains run to old town

title: A great train service
review: The Bangkok Train Service or BTS as it is more commonly known is a great way to get around Bangkok It is very safe clean and comfortable most of the time except in peak periods where it can be very crowded and difficult to enter a carriage Obtaining a single journey ticket is easy but if you are in town for a longer period buy a stored value card

title: Mr
review: Great rail system easy to  find with logo quick and efficienteasy to use ticket office ladies very helpfulsome will give you a card to use and some will give you change for you to get a ticket from machine

title: Live the Skytrain
review: Live using this means if transit Beats all the traffic and so easy to use Theyâre are people to help with your journey Best way to get around hectic lovely Bangkok

title: Amazing public transport links.
review: When my boyfriend and I travelled around Thailand we spent 6 days in Bangkok exploring the various districts  The skytrain was without a doubt the most essential part of our trip  Extremely reliable fast frequent and cheap to use The routes were very easy to navigate around and the trains took us to all the places of interest we wanted to visit

title: Fastest way to travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS in Bangkok is great Usually the trains are crowded but they come so often that you donât really have to wait The busiest station is Siam which can be a little hectic during rush hour   The overall cost is good usually 2050 baht per journey The ticket machines only accept coins otherwise you will have to queue for the 1 or 2 ticket counters that are open No food or drink is allowed on the BTS  The only reason I wouldnât give it 5 stars is because of its size There are only 2 lines which mainly run in the central area

title: Easy to get around.
review: If you want to get around  the city this is the way to travel Cheap  convenient   Just don't  travel  peak time Like sardines  in a tin

title: Great way to travel ard Bkk without afraid being cheated and stuck in traffic
review: Pro  easier way to travel around town area no worry of traffic jam no need scared to be cheated by taxi  tuktuk driver with bad intention frequent train less waiting time no issue on communication for nonThai speaker there are many friendly and helpful staff  Con  long queue when need to buy token (prepare more 10thb coins so that can purchase token at machine that received coins only) only staircase are available at most BTS station lift is locked and available only upon request (there is 1 lift available for person in need) really crowded drg peak (haha based on observation less busy hour would be before 11am and after 8pm)

title: Easy
review: Bangkok is a crowded city To travel fast cheap and easy the BTS Sky train is the way to travel through Bangkok They also have a handy app for your mobile phone

title: BTS Very helpful..
review: The BTS and Subways are very helpful and easy way to travel in Bangkok City You save a lot of time comparing with Taxis I hope the existing extension will cover most of places in the city

title: Best mode of connections
review: If you choose to travel whilst in Bangkok BTS is your answer to quick and easy mode of transportation Takes you to places within minutes vs getting stuck in traffic for hours Most of the stations are connected to the prime malls Donât waste your time on taxis and tuk tuk when u have the BTS

title: Great way to travel around the city. Fast and brings you to major shopping centres linked to the BTS.
review: Great way to travel around the city Fast and brings you to major shopping centres linked to the BTS  Crowded during peak hours but trains are frequent  Wished it has more escalators  Good thing it has intsalled lifts at least to accommodate people with luggage

title: Convenient and easy
review: Convenient and easy even for first timer in Bangkok Only two lines but has couple of stations that connect to underground MRT

title: Cheap and easy to use
review: We travelled on the skytrain and found the trains really clean the staff were very helpful only difficulty was working out which side of the station we needed to be on

title: Excellent way to travel.
review: As the roads in Bangkok are so congested the skytrain is an excellent way to get around We used it a lot and it was really simple and cost effective

title: Easy to use
review: Easy to use when you get the hang of it  Air conditioned so great for the hot and humid weather  Everyone very polite and no pushing or shoving even at busy times  You even get some views as you are whizzing along in the air

title: Easy, clean and affordable transportation around Bangkok.
review: Easy clean and affordable transportation around Bangkok No hassle safe and very prompt I was very pleasantly surprised and will definitely prefer this method of transport over tuktuk or taxi next time I'm in Bangkok

title: Clean and Fast
review: It is clean and fast and best way to avoid traffic in the downtown area  It is connected to the shopping area and the sky walk was complete in the central world area  The price is also reasonable than that of taxi

title: Clean and reliable
review: A great alternative to taxis and tuc tics Really reliable and cheap It stops at all the must see places too

title: Too slow and rather expensive
review: Too crowded   and should run faster and frequentNo air conditioners and it is uncomfortable to wait for the BTS in a sunny day

title: Easy go
review: This time visit bangkok have a chance to use BTS to go many places due to my hotel located next to BTS It is very useful especially go for shopping paragon department store central world That's lovely

title: Getting crowded all the time now
review: Still the best way to get around BKK but its getting busy and 1600 to  2000 is mad Avoid Asok as it links with the subway

title: On time and clean
review: Well connected to visit all the attractions in Bangkok On time and clean The ticket rates are also budget friendly

title: Excellent service
review: The BTS Skytrain was the best means of transport during my stay at Bangkok It is really fast cheap and efficient

title: Great way of getting around Bangkok!
review: the air con is very cold and pleasant and it is by far the fastest way to get to and from the airport and around Bangkok

title: Great for transport
review: Miss the queues in a taxi on busy roads  simple to use and runs on time Great values as well Good connectivity Highly recommend you explore the city using the BTS

title: Good way to get around Bangkok
review: With Bangkok's traffic BTS is a good way to get around the city The train is clean and highly AC I think it's too cold tbh If you'll be using the skytrain a few times a day best to buy 1 day pass Also having coins will save you a lot of time for ticket purchasing as there are a few ticket machines that only take coins I notice only one machine that takes bank notes at the stations that we were at You can also do coin change at the ticket office but be prepared for a long line

title: SO EASY!
review: The sky train around the city is the easiest thing to use Even easier than the tube in London The tickets are really cheap and you can bulk buy journeys for example buy 10 tickets   The trains are really air conditioned and are not too busy or crowded They give a great view over the city and there are train stops all over   If you want to travel around the city then definitely do it by the sky train

title: Great sky train
review: The easiest and fastest way to get around in Bangkok As it is set on an uper level the city can be discovered Very close station to the Jim Thompson house

title: Good way to get around
review: The sky train is a very good way to get around if youâre a tourist Many taxi drivers didnât speak or read english and it made it difficult to get around Using the sky train is a easy and cheap way to get around Some times and areas are more busy then others

title: Easy for tourists
review: We were really impressed with the sky train for tourists We had a stop a 5 min walk outside our hotel (Rembrandt) and found it good value to buy a day ticket for about 120 baht and use the sky train all day   A bonus is also that itâs air conditioned so it made a nice cool break between exploring

title: Crowded
review: Crazy packed during peak hours Inefficient as the ticket queues were chaotic and both foreigners and locals were required to get the same boarding ticket reducing the efficiency

title: Very very crowded
review: Itâs the fastest way to travel around Bangkok as Bangkok are crazily crowded  however itâs very very crowded with lots of people inside the train

title: The trains schedule is fantastic.
review: It is fast clean affordable Bangkok is known for traffic jams the skytrain is a lifesaver You can connect with the skyrail to reach MBK shopping mall or other parts of town

title: cheap & convenient
review: probably the fastest way to travel trough Bangkok A pity there are just 2 lines very cheap (15 bath per ride) and there are trains every few minutes

title: Fast way to travel around
review: The Skytrain is always on time  very clean and easy to get tickets when you enter the station but beware their idea of air conditioning is close to freezing )

title: Busy busy
review: Excellent way to get round Bangkok especially if you donât mind being jammed next to people Amazing how everyone seems to be on their phones even when crammed in like sardines Very cheap and easy to use and much better than sitting in a taxi in a traffic jam

title: Best way to move in BKK
review: Nice and easy the fastest way to cross Bangkok Once you reach your area it will be easy to pick another way to move but using BTS you will be able to avoid the crazy traffic   It is improving slowly but you can see results year by year

title: Nice service
review: The people speak English or at least try to understand what you want  Everyone from the ticket clerk to the security personal have us friendly and patient reply to some questions  Really nice attitudes please keep it

title: High value and reliable.
review: Aircon is always nice and cool a nice break when traveling through out the city If you donât have coins the station attendants will change bills for you

title: Far better than a taxi
review: The BTS is prompt fast and clean  Highly recommended The charge by the stop so for us to go from the stadium to the Saphan peer was 40 baht each   If you have the right change in coins use a small ticket machine  The bigger machines accept notes

title: Go to for getting around
review: With the Bangkok traffic often being a nightmare the BTS is the go to for a lot of destinations especially considering the low fares involved  Remember to bring cash (coins) for the tickets though

title: There's no better way!
review: of getting around Bangkok in cleanliness and safety forget the tuktuks and the pollution at ground level buy a day ticket for 140baht and get yourself to the Saphorn pier Jim Thompson House Siam shopping MBK etcit won't take you to the palaces but it will take you straight to the Saphorn Pier for the ferries that willa reminder to give up your seat for elderly Thais

title: Vwey easy to use and a great cheap way to get around
review: Worth jumping on and even going from end to end if you want to see a different side of view of Bangkok other than the view from the boats

title: Essential for getting around BKK
review: Safe easy way to travel around BKK  Sit down and try to plan before you leave so you dont end up like us hopping on and off all the time

title: Really Easy and Convenient
review: Used this service in Bangkok and found it very simple We bought our tickets from the ticket office at the station no queues and map on the back showed clearly where to get on and off great

title: Crowd and noisy
review: Standard mass transit seevice in town To loud with advertising Monk travel on rush hournot good for commuter

title: Very Great Service
review: BTS saves the time and of course the money you spent in Bangkok If not for BTS we couldn't have seen half of what we visited in Thailand

title: Roll down your shirt sleeves if you have any
review: It's quite a shocking temperature difference when you board it and endure the exaggerated cold air till your stop I've been visiting Bkk since 33 years ago but never wore long sleeves until BTS was introduced I admire the spaciousness which is needed so much more at rush hours and respective distance between sitting passengers and standing ones across from them holding on strapsIdeal is the entrances middle standing circle of handrails above and central divided hand poles which secure standing a big bunch of people of any height Perforated shades of windows can still give you a great site of fascinating skylines along the way but  from the outside(due to advertising foil)  you can never see inside who is riding hahaha555 I miss the platform signs telling the stop name before and after

title: A fast way of getting around Bangkok
review: We used the sky train as it was much faster than the taxis the only downside was it was quite busy with the kids on the way back from the market

title: Easy to use
review: Simple and easy to use We downloaded apps before we went to make it easier Clean easy and safe service

title: Clean, air-conditioned and so convenient
review: We decided to use the BTS to most places we wanted to visit  If it did not go to the location we travelled to the nearest station and then walked or took a cab  Inexpensive way to travel and fast enough  I'd recommend getting a Rabbit() pass as it is faster and reduces waiting in line to get tickets  refilling is a breeze too

title: Best way to get around town.
review: BTS is the best way to get around Bangkok itâs clean and cheap not to mention you donât have to be stuck in the nightmarish BKK trafic bellow Love those tooktooks but the trafic and diesel pollution is a hassle

title: SO EASY TO FIGURE OUT
review: figured this out my first day in BKK  so easy  just have to remember which side of Thong Lor to go down the stairs when you get off

title: Quick and Cold
review: Very nice mean of transportation always clean and generally not too crowded (avoid rush hours tho) If you planning a long journey keep in your mind that they put AC like crazy

title: Get a Frequent User Card
review: Bangkok has a great transport system and the BTS is easy to use To make it easier by a regular use card from the first station you go to and just top it up It makes for a quicker entry and exit  Bangkok congratulations great system

title: Public Transport
review: We bought a Rabbit card to use whilst visiting Very efficient service Much quicker than a taxi Crowded every time we used it People very helpful in assisting us find the correct line to get back to our accommodation

title: Great
review: Great way to get around affordable and airconditioned Gets really packed during rush hour but otherwise great

title: Still the best option to get around bkk, but...
review: The BTS system and other mass transit is still the preferred option to travel around and commute in central Bangkok Once a visionary marvel of central planning the capacity has not kept up with the need Trains are more often overloaded than not especially during commuting times of day and into the evening What used to be a relatively pleasant experience has become more of an ordeal Improvements and expansion is underway and hopefully can improve the system to meet the need

title: Easy to get round
review: We used BTS few times and we really loved it 100% recommended   Suggesting have coins with you as the machines only except coines Also down load app for route map

title: Great system
review: We used the BTS a few times while in Bangkok Easy to use cheap and very efficient in very bad traffic times We took it along with the city train coming out of BKK airport and it was a great way to get to our hotel There are places to get food at the stations You can buy tickets from the machines and get change from the person at the booths Remember to keep your ticket after inserting it when enteringyou will have to insert it again at your end station to get out

title: Easy transport
review: Really easy to use and so cheap and efficient  About 30bahts per journey Carriages and stations are really clean and easy to use the machines

title: Awesome and Modern railroad system
review: One of the best trains in Asia next to Japan and Chinese maglev It is affordable and practical preferable than taking a bus or taxi The place is clean and pickpockets are nonexistent due to round the clock security Being on time to my desired place due to great arrival and departure system

title: Fast cheap and cery cold
review: Avoiding expensive tuk tuk or slow taxis especially in rush hours the bts is a perfect solution  Easy to use change in th station biljets in 10 thb coins xhoose the route and numer of persons put kn the onwy and there you fo In the BTS is a chart with the route so you do mot get lost But it is  very cold I always take a pull over with me

title: Quick clean and easy
review: Just remember children over 120cm in Thailand pay adult fares here as everywhere else it seems But even so it doesn't break the bank

title: Awesome travel system
review: What a great way to travel around this buoyant and vibrant city Cheap and easy to use avoid the stress of the streets and take theBTS every time

title: Great option!
review: You can connect to many of the ondemand places by using the BTS and will be easy for you to access different places

title: Very Helpful
review: The Skytrain was very helpful and cheap ( especially coming from Australia) this was a great mode of transportation for me and my family We would travel up and down the lines and it wouldn't even cost $10 This was easy and fast Try it

title: Bangkok metro- must try
review: It's convenient easy to usend very conveniently connected It's very clean nd mix crowd with lots of young Thais nd foreigners is something one must try to experience nd commute

title: Very Convenient
review: I highly recommend using the sky train as much as possible because the traffic congestion leads to a lot of time being wasted in traffic Day passes are also available and make a lot of sense of your planning to explore the city all day

title: Too Crowded during peak hours
review: Be careful when using the Skytrain during peak hours on weekday People keep pushing and you just can't get in the train

title: Good option for transporation
review: I think this is the good option where you go fromto subvarnabhumi airport to downtown The worthy price and the train athmosphere is comfortable and clean

title: Easy travel
review: Good option to travel in Bangkok and to avoid the 247 traffic jam If stay few days in Bangkok buy a 3 day pass and don't waist time in taxis

title: Best way to get around
review: Smooth speedy comes frequently and amazing air conditioning Even when crowded the Thais have a way of not standing too close

title: A train in Bangkok
review: A train passing through the city Excellent fast and cheap train The train is clean and modern Recommend using it when possible It is much cheaper than taxis and most importantly much faster

title: My first time on the skytrain
review: A decent quick trip with friends during the night time in Bangkok  It is a clean and efficient form of transport to get around Bangkok fairly cheap as well Extra seating would be handy however I wouldnt stress if about seating if you only have a couple of stops to go

title: Skytrain
review: So easy fast and no problem Can go where ever you want in Bangkok Easy to get space inside even if its full

title: Culture thrill
review: This train is packed from station to station you find yourself squished in amongs many locals travelling from end to end I found it fascinating and the best way to get to the huge epic market

title: Great Expirience
review: Clean and on time Frequent fast Safe and cheap to travel Best way to travel in the city respect to time and cost Hassle free Ticket machines are very user friendly and fast Getting change to get tickets is easy
The security can't speak english so i got wrong way many times but the train is clean and have so many access to get there

title: Convenient transportation in BKK
review: Traffic in BKK is terrible during rush hour and raining time BTS sky train is a smart choice for traveling but avoid rush hour because of overcrowded passengers

title: Best to travel around CBD of BKK.
review: The connection to subway is at Asoke station (sukhumvit station) And to the Airport like at Petchaburi station

title: Can not live without it
review: When I chose hotels in BKK I always make sure they are Close to the BTS so easy and fast to travl around to the main Places such Siam Nana MBK etc Taxi are almost worthless when u have the BTS Close and its cheap too And it also have a good conection tio the Phaya Thai where the Rail link to Airport goes

title: Good
review: So easy to use The train is fast and reliable Its a bit crowded especially during rush hoursI loved it

title: Clean and Efficient
review: The best way to travel around Bangkok It's clean and efficient The train service from the airport connects with the BTS making travel to and from the airport even more convenient Just avoid peak hours on weekdays (which would be my advice in any major city)

title: Fastest way and easy.
review: We used these a few times  It is a little hard with a stroller but simple for people riding alone  We didn't discover until later that for a family taxi is much cheaper  A single person probably would be cheaper with BTS  The signs are easy to read and great dropoffs  Great choice and if traffic taxis are very slow  Taxis are cheaper and faster late at night

title: It's perfect to travel in Bangkok
review: A very good connection in entire city Most of malls are connected with it To safe a lot of time in Bangkok traffic travel in metro Sometimes it's quiet crowded but still is comfortable It's cheap and affordable

title: Bts
review: The BTS Skytrain is very convenient and reliable Highly recommended especially during rush hour ððð

title: Clean train
review: I must say it is like the MRT in our country but cleaner and the air conditioning works well  Must recommend this if you dont want  to be engulfed in thailand traffic  Easy to get tickets

title: travelling with BTS
review: Actually BTS is a fast travel but you can find always BTS is out of service during rush hourand people are standing near the door specially chinese who has no mannerits really annoying i prefer to pay more and go by taxi grab taxi

title: AVOID TRAFFIC BUT AVOID DURING PEAK COMMUTER RUSH
review: Bangkok traffic is lengendary specially going in and out of the Siam Square area The BTS is a great option but be careful to avoid peak commuter hours  Also not most stations are not step free and can be an issue for those with mobility issues

title: BTS train
review: Love to travel by bts Its easy and fast With the traffic in bangkok taxis and tuk tuk take time With bts u can reach fast and its cheaper

title: Great way to get around and its cheap
review: We used this for all our transportation needs The station was 500 meters from our hotel and we could ride it to most everywhere we wanted from the temples  to malls restaurants and the night market

title: A convenient way to travel
review: Although not the cheapest but the BTS is a convenient way to travel to avoid the notorious traffic jams in Bangkok It is advisable to buy a stored value card to avoid the inconvenience of having to queue at the BTS stations to change coins which is the only form of money acceptable at the ticketing machines Queues can get pretty long especially at popular destinations like Chatuchak (Mo Chit BTS stn)

title: We used the sky train every day and found it to be excellent
review: The trains are frequent nice and cold and spotless We purchased a day ticket every day and some days made several journeys Very good value

title: Canât beat the convenience
review: Having travelled most of Southbound East Asia Bangkok is punching way about W itâs weight with the skytrainclean airconned and extensive  it gets you around the city with minimum inconvenience and maximum connectivity for small money Only two watch outs 1 Avoid office rush hours  8am and 5pm are a major challenge 2 No platform restrooms  do the due before embarking Enjoy

title: Great service
review: Train came every 5 minutes very clean was a nice ride Travelled to markets enough seats to accommodate everyone

title: CROWDED
review: A rapidly fading Bangkok facility Too many people too few carrages on the trainsrun for profit not for service

title: Goid when it's running
review: By now the BTS lines are connecting large stretches of Bangkok The rides are reasonable and the train runs get frequently Unfortunately there have been a lot of technical difficulties recently which can make your daily commute a long and sweaty journey

title: Great
review: Itâs a great way to get around in Bangkok and you gat a little bit of air condition on those HOT days ð

title: Very Modern Skytrain
review: Took the Skytrain from the river to the Weekend Market Clean easy to navigate and not expensive If you are at teh Weekend Market it is a great way to get to teh river

title: Clean and efficient
review: A great service at a reasonable cost With the terrible traffic around the city it is a must in order to get around Stations are in good locations

title: Great way to get around town but doesn't work for all destinations.
review: Nice clean COOL way to travel around BKK Not that cheap though if there are very many traveling together  Warning  Eating and drinking not allowed on the train

title: Great. Fast convenient and cheap
review: Great way to travel if it runs near where you are going Cheap Need change to buy ticket but they have a change booth

title: fantastic Transport in Bangkok Town
review: Very clean convenient way to get around Bangkok Town  cheap tickets   Not sure if there was timetable were actually one the platforms

title: Easy to use when you understand how it works
review: The BTS is a good alternative when taxis refuse to take you where you want (which will happen a lot believe me) you need coins to operate the machine or you can queue to pay at the windows The price depends on where you want to go so be sure to know where you stop and to show a written version of it to the operator Usually the price is around 3040 bahts (1â¬) People are really respectfully so queue on the platform behind the people already there and enjoy the hundreds of crazy commercials on the screen of the BTS

title: Nice, clean and easy to use
review: We were staying directly across from the Surasak station so we ended up using the sky train every day Very easy and reliable to use Iâve always been gob smacked by how well put together public transport is in other places in the world compared to Australia  Clean trains clean stations plenty of refreshments and food available at each station all signs and machines are in English too but there are also booths where you can speak to someone should you need extra assistance   Definitely recommend

title: Excellent way to get around
review: We have been in Bangkok 3 weeks now and love the skytrain Fast efficient regular and not bad cost wise The first few times we went it wasn't crowded but the last few times we've been like sardines in a can which can be hard when your 6 and 9 and wedged into a small place Local people are very good at letting you in and out Unfortunately some other nationalities lack travel ettiquite but that's life Definitely recommend

title: Extremely safe and cheap
review: Excellent and quickest way to get around Cheap day ticket on the blue line will cost around 200baht Quite easy to get around after you get your head around the area  Can get extremely busy between 79am and 47pm  Let me say we found it extremely safe to travel during different times of the day and the local commuters are always willing to help if you get lost or stuck  Taxi ride will cost more and take 1hr in traffic to get around whereas the Skytrain will get you there in minutes

title: Fast, airconditioned and clean
review: Very clean and tidy trains Always going and very effective Could have been timetables on the platforms though

title: Easy and quick way to get around the city
review: The skytrain is an easy and quick way to get around the city and fully air conditioned We where 4 people traveling together so taxies are cheeper when running on the meter outside rush hour but skytrain is faster during rush hour

title: So much better than taxis
review: The BTS is the solution to Bangkok's notoriously bad traffick With fairs that run around $1 the BTS is often packed but is so much better than sitting in traffick for hours  Very easy to use

title: As good as any big cities!
review: Clean clear signs convenient Good to take a printed copy of the BTS routes as people may not speak English to guide you   Ticket Machines can convert to English  Good to bring more coins as many machines donât accept notes You need to queue if notes machines are not working

title: Great
review: Very easy to follow rail network and air conditioned which is fab after you have been to the weekend marketalso it was only 490 thb for all day pass for a family of three

title: Great service
review: So easy to use and extremely cheap we never had to wait for more than a couple of minutes for a train

title: The best way to circulate in Bangkok
review: Fast efficientno jam and no surprise about the price like with most of the taxi drivers encountered in Bangkok

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Have held a card for the BTS for some years Charge it with THB300 at the start of each visit and then up that if necessary during my visit The system is clean modern and runs every 10 minutes or so that you are never waiting long for the next service Destinations and platforms are well signposted in both Thai and English Highly recommended

title: Short Break
review: The station is clean n organized If u want to feel in taking  public transport (train of course) i wld recommend It's only u need to know where to change train or their inter connection trainit's easy n if u are not very sure just ask their friendly staff In fact Thai citizen r friendly n easy to approachlanguage shdnt b a problemfor 1st time in Thailandu will enjoy

title: cheap way around Bangkok - easy to use
review: cheap way around Bangkok  easy to use don't be intimidated by crowds or language issues very convenient and accessible

title: Daily commute...
review: Good points Usually on time clean reasonably priced Room for improvement Itâs BKK so can be very crowded most trips has been known to breakdown guards are sometimes rude stations turnstiles can be dangerous if you are carrying a bag be sure to carry above your head through turnstiles will engage the gates to close on your leg very painful

title: Very easy to use
review: Easy to read signs and very easy and economical to get around on We caught a passenger boat on the canal and then jumped on a skytrain to terminal 21 for some shopping  Very easy to use

title: Clean and efficient
review: The skytrain is clean efficient reliable fast and aircon ) Despite the price it is recommended Also many more branches  stations coming soon

title: Amazing
review: Should try this one if visit thailand not waiting long time between trainfriendly and polite people

title: they make it difficult
review: good and well organized  I don't know why they take the tickets every trip I want to use it every time in put money in it no need to use the long q everytime

title: USER FRIENDLY EFFICIENT CITY TRANSIT
review: Due to the exponential increase in gridlock traffic the Bangkok Sky Train is an absolute necessity to efficiently get around the city  US credit cards are accepted but you must see an agent to exchange for baht and get coins to purchase a plastic pass using the kiosk  The cars are immaculate and comfortable stops are announced in English  Do not hesitate to use this invaluable service

title: Most convenient way to commute in Bangkok
review: BTS network has been continually extended  if we need to go to any place that is close to BTS station pls pick this mode of transportation as our first priority

title: Fast and affective
review: Really well organised system with police checkpoints and guards willing to help you Lovely cool air conditioning in trains Fast service that gets you where you need to go

title: Cool, well organized
review: No other way to travel around central Bangkok A few more lifts for older people wound be great Above ground walkways avoid the traffic pollution and well lit and safe

title: Easy access and hassle free
review: Using the BTS is as easy as 123 Simple and quick Price ranging from 10baht to 37baht  Access to anywhere in Bangkok But it maybe very crowded in the morning office and evening office hours It takes a few trains before u can get in But the Thai people are very helpful In case u need help any of them would be glad to help u  No worries in Bangkok

title: Fast and cheap
review: Once youâve managed to work out how to buy a ticket youâll be using this to hop on and off of all the time  Take the gamble  HBJB

title: Easy way to get around
review: Really easy way to beat the traffic in bangkok 144 baht a day for unlimited use Simple and fun to use

title: More expensive than the MRT and busier
review: Can get you to a lot of destinations easily but is more expensive than the MRT and can be much busier throughout the day

title: good way to get rid of traffic jam
review: The traffic in bangkok is extremely bad and there is traffic jam all the time  We mostly take BTS to travel around the city and it is cheap and convenient  We like this much

title: Invaluable transport option in a busy city
review: Invaluable transport option in a busy city Try it and you will love it Also tofrom Sukhumvit airport

title: Super convenient
review: Fabulous air con and really affordable and safe way to travel Frequent enough that we didnât have to plan ahead either

title: Skytrain
review: Easy access and easy to use Easier than hailing a cab and trying to negotiate fares  Very short wait for a train Staff at stations are helpful

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy to use and felt very safe riding on it with my family  Facilities were clean and well maintained and very inexpensive

title: Cheap not the cheapest
review: Unfortunately we booked a hotel far from the city center and had to extensively use the BTS Skytrain to and fro different lines Usually the found this mode of transportation cheap considering the fares that I saw in Grab but thn I bargained with the local taxi driver and negotiated a fare which was just 30 THb more thn the ticket price and it dropped me to my hotel

title: Too many different lines and staff not helpful.
review: DONT risk the train as too many staff and no one knows what train line to get and no one is helpful I have travelled all over and never experienced this I felt like it was a hustle to get tourists to pay more

title: CHEAP TRAVEL
review: Anywhere you travel in Thailand the transport is very cheap taxi  Boat but the cheapest of all is the Skytrain  we travelled to several places by skytrain  and is by far the  quickest way to go  and it is  always on time  from Labua Hotel to MBK shopping center was 40 Baht ( about $150 AUD ) Taxi always get caught up in traffic

title: Aound the city
review: The best way to get around in the city It has air conditioning which is an advantage for the hottest days It is easy to use it is cheap and much faster

title: A great way to travel around
review: We used the skytrain numerous times for getting around Bangkok and found it to be a very cheap and efficient means of travel  All trains are air conditioned and spotlessly clean  At each station there are ticket machines or manned counters if we needed help

title: QUICK, COOL, CLEAN AND CONVENIENT
review: It is very convenient to use this kind of transportation We didn't have to wait too long for the train (just 2 3 minutes) Trains are very clean and modern This is one of our favorite things to do in Bangkok

title: Quickest way to reach city
review: Just 20 mins of traveling looking over Bangkok city Very easy access and very cheap Only 40BTH per person and frequency is once in an hour

title: quicker than walking
review: we caught the skytrain from the MBK building to Lebua state tower which is about km Cheap way to travel and quite simple but can get very crowded We preferred this than getting ripped by a tuk tuk or taxi

title: One of the best ways to travel around Bangkok
review: I was with a group and instead of using taxis excepted when needed we used the BTS   You can either get a Rabbit Card(like the Oyster Card in London) or buy a single ticket With the Rabbit card you can pay by the amount of journies you think you might go on and you can always top it up When getting the rabbit card for the first time you will need your passport

title: Great Transportation
review: BTS is undoubtedly very vital for Bangkok Transportation system we use BTS a lot during our visit in Bangkok Since it is located above the ground (not like MRT which is underground) you don't have to walk a lot for reaching the train The waiting time is also quick but be careful to watch your destination since the announcer voice is not loud

title: Efficient & Clean
review: Great way to get around the city with minimal to zero exposure to traffic jams We used this daily from the Sathorn Pier used by a lot of hotel boat shuttles get to Saphan Thaksin BTS station to reach MBK and nearby Siam buildings

title: Great way to travel around Babgkok
review: Great way to get around So efficient and manned Lots of staff around to support customer and help you on your way We used it on several occasions Air con blasted out of it which was a God send in the heat  Cheap reliable and a nippy way to get around the city

title: Comfortable and convenient
review: This is the most prefered and most convenient public transport in Bangkok The MRT transportation is also similar The office rush hours are crowded though and may be a bit uncomfortable if you are traveling a long distance So if something is not time sensitive then try avoiding the office hours or else try going earlier The last train is at around 1130  1200 and the ticket counters close 10 minutes before the last train All the information is available on the station in English writing Also the frequency of the trains is almost 5 to 7 minutes apart and they cover a huge area in Bangkok The best part is that the BTS connects to the MRT at various stations and the MRT covers the areas that BTS doesn't so you can basically travel anywhere easily

title: Very fast and easy to use
review: BTS is the best mode of transportation The traffic is crazy in Bangkok It cost about 15 bhat  to go one stop

title: Convenient
review: The metro system is so convenient to explore the city The Network is well spread across the city to enable easy sight seeing

title: Clean and airconditioned
review: Used a few times during our stay in Bangkok Very efficient and easy to use especially during busy times when taxis are not feasible due to traffic

title: BTS skytrain fot every great place in bangkok
review: I would not say it is cheap For public mass transport it could still be cheaper And it is always crowded like anything Stations are small too But yeah takes you places

title: Crowded but very fast
review: BTS Skytrain has an easy to understand system and will bring you quickly to your destination for a low fare It's crowded in the skytrains so there may be no place for you in a skytrain However a skytrains stops by every few minutes

title: Great way to beat the traffic
review: I always use skytrain when In Bangkok Great way to beat the traffic Went from Surasak to National Stadium this time The whole process is easy and simple Everything is explained in Thai and English and easy to understand Ticket Machines super easy to use and very quick as well Directions posted everywhere so its difficult to get lost Train itself is very clean and air conditioned If the train is already packed (which often happens at rush hour at Siam station) people will patiently wait for another one in a queue

title: Lifeline of Bangkok
review: The easiest and  fastest to explore BangkokThe Station and public are disciplined and everything runs smoothlyThe connectivity of the network of stations are very convenient

title: Best way of transport in Bangkok
review: Getting around Bangkok without traffic jams Take BTS skytrain  The trains are well aircondioned and very clean There is also a train to the international airport

title: Fast route
review: A convenient way to get around Rather than getting a cab and get you stuck on the heavy traffic jam

title: Clean cheap and efficient
review: Cheap clean and efficient We used the Skytrain extensively while in Bangkok It's so easy to use and everything is written in English As we were buying single tickets we kept having to use coins in the machines as they did not accept notes

title: Breakfast walk-in
review: I am happy with  breakfast  and restaurant condition    Coffee is good  from lobby easy  to go to restaurant  all staff is greetings

title: Easy and cheap!
review: If you are used to city travelling on undergrounds this will be easy for you to navigate Easy to use and really cheap Most of the ticket people spoke English so helpful and able to point us in the right direction  You only pay for one way tickets and they run every five minutes

title: Such a great system
review: We took the train around Bangkok tickets are very cheap and the system is flawless and organised Carriages are also air conditioned Couldn't fault the system at all

title: Sky train
review: Quick and easy way to get around Recommend getting the rabbit pass this allows multiple trips depending on how much you preload it Each trip on on the rabbit card costs a flat 25bht

title: Bangkok Visit
review: While taxis are an easy way to get around town traffic can be a nightmare in Bangkok The BTS Skytrain is a convenient and inexpensive mode of travel  From your elevated position you can watch the stalled traffic as you move right along not to mention it's a great adventure

title: beat the traffic take the sky train!!!
review: If you have to travel across Bangkok during the day the sky train is the way to go Its efficient and cheap and will save you tons of time compared to a taxi

title: Use it if possible!
review: Bangkok has some of the worst traffic I have ever seen and we only use the roads it's absolutely necessary Far better is the skytrain which covers a good proportion of the city  It is clean efficient and very cheap Is your best option to get around the city is to use this as far as you can and then take a cab or motorscooter to do the rest of the journey This will save lots of time as the roads are gridlocked nearly all day and night

title: Never complain about the London Underground again!!
review: A quick and cheap way to get around Bangkok Air conditioned trains clear announcements and information posters very efficient But it does get supercrowded you can feel very rammed in Worth it though as the roads are basically car parks

title: Riding the subway in Bangkok
review: Got tired of the crazy traffic delays in Bangkok between meetings so started taking the subway instead Despite my initial trepidations found the whole process to be extremely easy  Ticket vending machines have an Englishlanguage option and the ticket fee process is very easy to understand  Found the BTS sky trains to be very clean and airconditioned which was important in mid 30 degree Celsius weather with crazy humidity  Platforms have great signage to help you figure out which way to go when exiting and they link into most of the office buildings along the line  A lot quicker and cheaper than taxis and none of the frustration of dealing with trafiic jams

title: Excellent, inexpensive Bangkok travel!
review: While visiting Bangkok with my wife in late June and in early July 2017 we grew quite fond of the BTS Skytrain Our hotel was located within 200 meters of one the stations So we ended up taking the BTS Skytrain multiple times each day It was cheaper and quicker to get around the congested city

title: Convenient and easy..
review: The bts is a great way to get around its cheap and clean trains are regular and timely However it doesn't cover all areas of Bangkok at the moment

title: Efficient way to move through Bangkok
review: Nice efficient and cheap way to move trought Bangkok even if it does not cover all areas of the city  Itis better to avoid the peak hours during the week meaning morning when people go to work and then when they leave work  A little warning it can be very cold inside due to the air conditionning

title: Hard to imagine Bangkok without it!
review: It may be odd why would anyone try to imagine Bangkok without it but if you have visited Bangkok before the Sky Train you will know what a difference it has made There are still some issues like BTS and MRT have different ticketing something that shouldn't be so hard to work out for the benefit of the millions of travellers that uses these transit systems For a visitor the system can be confusing but it is really not that difficult and should you do something wrong the staff is usually understanding and helpful

title: Economical & Convenient
review: This is the fastest and more convenient way to get around from the heart of the city to farthest end for sightseeing and shopping It took about half of the normal route of taxi from Siam to Chatuchak Weekend Market Plus it was safe Security personnel were visible at all times and quite accommodating and helpful They guided tourists like us willingly

title: Skies the limit on skytrain
review: Excellent fast easy inner city transportation We bought a full day pass and got on and off all over Bangkok very cheaply

title: Good transport to go around
review: It's a good option to go around bangkok as a solo person For a family of 4 person the total fare can be more or less same as a tuktuk fare Of course you need to haggle for tuktuk fare Good to travel if your destination is near the BTS stops otherwise you end up travelling in bus tuktuk or cabs At peak times it is fully crowded We had to leave 1 train and take next as it was crowded and had no place to fit in

title: Best way to move around in BKK
review: Cheap clean fast and easy in a huge city what else can you ask for One of the best public transportation in the world

title: Quickest and cheapest way around Bangkok
review: It's the quickest and cheapest way around Bangkok If you are lucky to have a stop close to where you're staying definitely take the sky train whenever possible

title: The biggest blessing in Bangkok
review: I literally took the BTS everywhere The traffic in Bangkok is horrendous so being able to zip around above the traffic is the best way to get from point to point We would put our destination in google maps (it works even without internetwifi) then would just walk to our destinations after exiting the sky train Easiest and best way to travel

title: Beat the traffic!
review: The BTS is easy to use cheap and certainly beats sitting in the traffic which is appalling most days all day and into the evening

title: Fly like an eagle
review: Easy way to get around town Only two lines though More material expansion required for this fast developing city Faster than taxis when heading to popular shopping areas

title: Fast, packed, and limited
review: Surely the fastest way to commute in Bangkok But it can be super crowded during rush hours and routes are still limited Many years to go before enough route to be efficient

title: Easiest, Cheapest way to get around!
review: Figuring out the BTS system is super easy and it makes a lot of Bangkok accessible It is cheap and the trains come often

title: Excellent way to get around town
review: I love public transportation because it is predictable and reliable  The BTS skytrain is one of them  It can be crowded and it does takes a few trips to get your bearing and the various transfer point  However I take it over the traffic jam so common in Bangkok streets  Plus I wanted to have a local experience with the "TutTut" but the moment the driver sees that I was not from Thailand he would quote an outrageous price  Even taxi drivers sometimes do that too  So I just take the trains when I can

title: What a system
review: Can't fault this transport system  We could only dream to run a train system as good as this one on time very cheap fast clean has a step by step guide to the next station when to get off to change  Best system along side china

title: the easiest way to go around the city
review: I guess you have no choice but to take skytrain simply because the traffic is so very bad in the city

title: Great
review: Love travelling on the sky train only 140 baht  for a full days travelCan get a bit crowded in the afternoon

title: Bangkok BTS offers quick service in cool comfort
review: The Bangkok BTS is great value for money and gets people from A to B quickly and comfortably Going to tourist locations like JJ Market or to the shopping malls along Sukhumvit the BTS is very convenient and avoids all the traffic down below on the road However the BTS may not be suitable to those using baby strollers or wheelchairs as not all stations have lifts

title: Getting worse and worse
review: As BTS continue to build out the trains are jampacked Huge difference from a couple of years ago Opting for Uber no more Skytrain for me bummer

title: Expensive if in a group or with family
review: If in a group or with family it is cheaper to take a "metered" cab Generally cabs ask for fixed amounts that you would need to negotiate Though the skytrain is located centrally and connects major locations from a tourist perspective prefer to take a tuk tuk

title: Quick cheap trsnsfer
review: The best way to transfer in Bangkok very cheap and avoid the traffic Reach almost every where the main bangkok tourist area and shopping malls I recommend to buy the rabbit card and top up for the total duration I top up 100 baht for one week Use google map to know the nearest station

title: clean and tidy as well as very busy
review: sky train is what it is  it gets you out of the madness of the roads of Bangkok travelled from Mo Chit ( jj market to Siam paragon) everybody in there own bubble or mobile phone nice to see working class normal thai people affording to use the BTS too

title: Fast and safe.
review: For a first timer it was an adventure People of Thailand not only friendly but also helpful They told us preciselly where  what and how late the BTS skytrain will be A must for any traveller to Bangkok Tick it off your bucket list

title: Round trip Thailand
review: Very easy way to displace in Bangkok Be aware to have enough coins as at the kiosk you can have long cues and sometimes they don't have tickets anymore So best to take the automation machine Also be sure to get out at the correct station as when you get to far you have to use you ticket to get out and that is detected by the automatic gate  Anyhow a great way to escape traffic jam

title: Easy to get around above the traffic
review: For tourists only using a short time  best to buy singleuse tickets as you need The prepaid Rabbit card will cost 100 baht and is nonrefundable and offers no discount over single use fares (only positive is that you may avoid lining up for tickets at busy times)

title: Pro train travellers
review: The BTS sky train has been our main mode of transport if travelling distances further than 1km So easy to hop on and off an interchange between the silom sukhumvit lines MRT and BRT (bus lines) The train is air conditioned at 8am and 6pm everything stops for the national anthem must be there to experience it Never managed to find toilets at the train stations though Use Google maps to help plan where you hop on and off There are decent enough maps at the train stations also and information centres Carry plenty of change to skip the cues at busy times or you will need to stay in a long line to convert money for coins for the ticket machine

title: Cheap way to travel Bangkok
review: clean easy safe and convenient and well pricedgreat experience lots of places to see on the journey

title: Good View
review: Good view & nice option to go around Bangkok even with families around Lot of eating options for quick bite

title: BTS
review: The BTS is a great mode of transportation within Bangkok I used it quite often throughout my stay especially in the non rush hours

title: "Super convenient"
review: If you are in Bangkok Thailand the best way to travel to MBK from Sukumvit is the sky train it takes only 15 minutes vs taxi about an hour  This train is so very clean and easy to travel

title: Awesome
review: Feel like you are in heaven wonderful memorable experience stunning views Highly recommended to everyone visiting must try

title: So clean and quick
review: Not much to say besides it was really quick and clean But it was really cold as well due to the air con You need a coat ð And the lady at the counter couldn't explain to us the cheaper way to do it Oh well still worth it to use

title: a quick and easy way
review: Taxis are very cheap in Bangkok but the traffic is very heavy The quickest way to get around is without doubt the sky train When you buy your ticket ask how many stops to get to where you want to go as all instructions are in Thai

title: BTS is the best thing in Bangkok!!  You travel cheap and it goes to the main shopping centres where we stayed in Lumpini
review: You need to spend around 3 days in Bangkok and something I would definitely recommend is the Grand Palace  It is amazing  In terms of food and places to eat Thai food is just excellent  We often ate inside the better shopping centres in their food courts  Lots of variety everywhere  Some nights we ate street food in the main streets  Mainly grilled fish and fresh salads as we are both vegetarians  Very safe

title: Shopping day
review: We found it easy to follow the rail station map & buying the tickets We used it in a Sunday and expected it to be very busy and overcrowded however it wasn't to bad and at times were able to get a seat

title: Worth using
review: Excellent service efficient on time clean and very reliable  Best to buy a Rabbit card so you can use for multiple trips and just top up as required

title: Great way to commute within the city
review: The BTS sky train is a great way to commute within the city rather than taking taxis The trip would be better if the BTS systems are connected to the other train systems platforms and have a single pass for entry into the station This would minimize the need to always queue and purchase tickets

title: Convenient (ish)
review: Great for beating the traffic jams although you end up paying a similar amount to taxi fare if you are with family Kids below a certain height travel free  Not great if you have a stroller as most stations are a long ish flight of stairs or two with few escalators if any

title: Efficient quick and cheap way of getting from BKK to the city centre and back
review: It's a nobrainier really to use this train to get from the airport into the city centre  Took a traveller pass  Signs in English too and great help from the 'ambassadors' at each station    Trains were clean and safe  I made a morning and early evening trip with a large suitcase   Would use the Skytrain again

title: Choose your time travel wisely
review: We have been visiting BKK for a long time and the BTS is our travel of choice However it just gets busier and busier It is sometimes almost quicker to go in traffic Just choose times outside peak hours and you should be fine Hope they put more trains on soon or make them bigger

title: Fast but expensive
review: We used the bts to reach the chatuchak and lumpini's park or the sathorn pier but ended up paying way more than we would have with a taxi  for our group( couple with 2 kids) it does goes way faster though not to forget the ecological aspect I think it is a fair option if you're traveling alone or if you're in a hurry Beware of pics hours though we felt really uncomfortable  felt way worse than the Tokyo or Paris metro even

title: Easy, clean, comfortable
review: Once you figure out the fare zone thing this is a great way to get around Fast airconditioned and spotless

title: Great System!
review: Love ithas taken away all the stress trying to haggle with Taxis and Tuk Tuk drivers  BTS is safe clean and air conditioned All stations are clean with great signage and great connectivity to greater Bangkok and connects to MRT as well  Also connects to the Skywalk which connects all the malls and give you good view of the city as opposed to walking on street level

title: First  time on Bangkok
review: We used the train to get to our meeting place for our tour and to return to our hotel It is quick and relatively easy to use the language barrier notwithstanding Also a cheap way to get around The ticket dispensing machines use coins only so come prepared or they will issue the coins   We  had a map of Bangkok which included the BTS and from that it was easy to figure out which direction to go once you had established your position on the map

title: GR8 to get around the city
review: Make surre you get a map of the rail system to take advantage of the places to visit this way to stop at the places you want toooo

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: Make sure you give the train a go it will save you heaps of time and money and once you get the hang of it you won't use cabs Air conditioned notices on speaker in Thai and English you can't go wrong just have a go

title: Air conditioned and punctual
review: Good well airconditioned carriages Stations can take much larger trains than in service Not sure considering the congestion at the BTS stations why they dont utalise the full length of the platforms

title: Easy way to get ariund
review: First visit to Bangkok and we discovered very quickly that this was a convenient way to reach places that you couldn't get to by boat Buying tickets was easy you can either use a machine or go to the ticket office We just bought individual tickets and didn't bother with any passes It was reasonably clear which train to get on to Something we learnt was to know the end station of the train This helped to find the correct direction They got crowded but not unpleasant due to the air conditioning and a reasonably civilised approach by everyone

title: Good cheap way to get around
review: Cheap and effective way to get around Bangkok better than sitting in traffic Or risking the back of a bike who's driver is hell bent on suicide Now the line has been extended you can walk to most places of interest using the BTS as your base Word of advise though remember this is a commercial City and at peak times you can do the sardines in a can trick just like in London or other international cities with an undergroundoverground rail system Also if you are in the rainy season be prepared to get drenched part of the joy of being there Take a spare tee shirt carry waterproof and wear shoes you don't mind getting wet

title: Clean and efficient train service
review: Best way to get around Bangkok on the BatS skytrain Takes us everywhere It's clean and efficient and no traffic jam

title: Fast efficient service
review: The BTS Skytrain offers you a easy and cheap method of transportation in Bangkok Be prepared to stand as the trains are usually pretty full especially on holidays and peak hours   Easy to connect with MRT the stations allow access to many of the must see places in Bangkok Route maps and attended ticket booths make life relatively easy to find your way around the system   On at least two occasions helpful locals advised us on what method we could get to xyz after exiting the station Thanks

title: Efficient and easy public transport
review: Easy to navigate signs are in English no graffiti trains run often ticket machines are easy to understand Melbourne should take a leaf out of Bangkok's book

title: Holiday 2017
review: Easy to use once you get the hang of it  and ridiculously cheap and far better than taxis which are stuck in traffic  Very busy though and always packed especially at peak times so be prepared to get close to your fellow humanity Mainly goes North to south but some East to west travel too

title: The BTS opens doors quickly from the Airport to Mo Chit
review: The BTS is a convenient link from the Airport link to the city with links to the water taxi to shopping at numerous locations (Siam) and Terminal 21 at Asok  The train runs early at 0600 and has connections to the MRT It's convenient and affordable  It's best to get a rabbit card if you plan on staying in the city or near the BTS  Keep in mind the Rabbit Card does not work on the subway (MRT)

title: Modern and Cool Transport Similar to Seoul
review: The BTS train is very modern the train is clean and the ac is very cool Very convenient way to travel around Bangkok

title: What a blessing
review: The BTS is the way to get around Bangkokthe trains have ac which is so inviting when you get in from the heatThey run about every 4 mins and are usually packed but very clean

title: Efficient and fast
review: I used this a couple of times and once I got the hang of it found it to be the best and fastest way to travel around the city

title: great and easy to get around
review: Loved the bts really easy to use and nice and cold inside  Better than sitting in traffic jams in busy Bangkok

title: Crowded most of the time
review: It's ok I guess Don't ride during rush hour I fact don't go anywhere during rush hour Traffic jam is terrible too

title: Fast, clean and takes you to most places.
review: I normally buy a daycard and go to many places in one day smooth ride and cool temperature  In many places you can connect with boats buses and other means of transportation

title: Very cheap and easy
review: It took us no time to understand how to use this public transportation with no instruction from anyone  Very quick to get around

title: Fast and reliable.
review: We bought the prepaid ticket card for 100 baht So worth it if you're using the train frequently We've never had to wait long for a train It gets pretty crowded sometime

title: A perfectway to move in the inner city
review: Bangkok BTS is a skytrain kind o subway It is very clean and very safe The bad point is that all stations are elevated and there are only a few escalator at each station Also not all the stations have an elavator which is very disabled person's unfriendly If you have to move along this BTS lignes it is the best way to avoid Bangkok's notorious heavy traffic

title: Fantastic way to travel around the city
review: So easy to use beats the traffic plus you get to see some lovely scenery on the way to your destination

title: aircon is great but  way too dense
review: they should add more cars to the train in rush hours it is hard to  breath there however it is clean and aircondition is great

title: Nightmare
review: The BTS are clean The issue is the traffic  No matter what time of the day you are on it it is always rush hour   Very busy but easily to get around and more efficient than taxi or tuk tuk and cheaper whenever possible  During peak rush hour try to avoid as it is a nightmare to go on  You will be packed like sardine cans and have to wait for several trains to get on  The population is just too big in the city to accommodate all the people (0 million) You are lucky if you can get a seat at 1000 or 1100pm at night

title: Brilliant, but gets crowded
review: The BTS is a fantastic way of getting around central Bangkok It is clean moderncheap and very efficient although I wouldn't suggest taking much luggage on it The line is above ground and weaves it's way through the highrise buildings of the city If it's quiet you can get some great views of the city If it's busy however it's packed

title: No traffic
review: A cheap option to get around without having to go through all the traffic  Guide inside the train as well as announcements so you know when your stop is coming up

title: Best way to get around.
review: Fastest and easiest way to get around town Fairly cheap and easy to use Many people during rush hour

title: Everywhere is easy to reach
review: The system is user friendly we can reach almost all spot by the train But just one thing we need to prepare lots of coins by the ticket because most of the kiosk accept coins only

title: This is fun
review: It's a fast and convenient way to get around bangkok it is also super cheap And the ride itself is good too

title: Fast trains but crowded
review: Trains come every 3 minutes Really crowded but a fast way to get around They have vending machines and also ticket stations but lines get long during rush hour It's kind of hard to ask Thais for directions because not a lot of them speak English The trains are fast clean and reliable

title: Easy Access!
review: The BTS Skytrain is a great way to get around Siam For the first timer visitorit would be easy to travel by BTS Skytrain because it has easy access and it has the easiest way to travel from hotel to downtown

title: Cheap as chips
review: Fast and faultless fastest way around the city On occasions I abandoned taxi journeys to take the train The air con is a blessing

title: Easier way to travel in Bangkok.
review: 120% cool AC Comes every 35 min Easy to travel between tour sights Rabbit card is a musthave Save you more money and time

title: Trains come regularly!
review: A bit crazy and hectic but reasonably easy to maneuver aroundif you get lost just ask someone from the ticket counter as they are very helpful Trains come regularly and are very quick which is great

title: Why TAXI??
review: World famous trafficjam happening every min in Bangkok highly recommend not to experience Taking BTS could take you to most sightseeing Spa or shopping mall you targeted Cheap and convenient they are connected with most key shopping mall like Siam Paragon Central World even Siam Big C now Recommend to buy a Rabit card for a fast and easy transit in and out the station You can get it either from the counter or vending machine in the station  So with this super train why brother taking taxi

title: Getting around
review: Fast convenient chwap airconditioned() way to get around the city Can be quite crowded come morning and afternoon commute times

title: Every city needs a subway or skytrain. HEY JAKARTA, I'M TALKING TO YOU!!
review: When the BTS first began it was a godsend Now we have gotten used to it and although the coverage has grown considerably I expect more  It is no longer dirt cheap and with 2 or more people you may still consider a taxi You would probably be wrong though If you think it is dirt cheap then come to Singapore and be amazed at what it could be  Really needs to expand probably run to Don Muang from Mochit Hualumphong to the west I know BKK is huge and that is the challenge but that is all the more reason to make it happen  Anyway I can't imagine what BKK traffic would be like today without the BTS and underground Use it wherever possible And Jakarta GET UP ON IT

title: Efficient, clean and easy to use.
review: Highly recommended Reasonably priced transport often full and standing is almost standard so not suitable for people with lots of luggage Shame my home town in Australia doesn't have anything even close to this efficient level of transport Embarrassing

title: Trains
review: Very accessible from our place walking distance only well built trains nice staffconnected to the malls

title: good train system
review: was an easy trip for us had no idea what we had to do and just went to the ticket machine selected our language and was straight forward from there

title: Making Bangkok accessible
review: Getting around Bangkok can be a real pain at busy times because of the traffic  Over many trips to Bangkok I got to really appreciate the BTS system and found it to be clean and efficient  The only challenge is that its overcrowded

title: Efficient, cheap, cool
review: What a great way to get around Bangkok It is relatively cheap clean and cool There are plenty of stops and it goes to many places  give it a go

title: Excellent
review: Very good transportation service Well maintained punctual cleanthe stations offer even a variety of food and services It can be crowded but never mind you get a fast and convenient transport The contrast with street level is amazing On the skytrain you feel being in a futuristic city with live TV aircon and modern design At street level you encounter a third world shanty town hot dirty and chaotic Recommended

title: Very Convenient
review: For a visitor to Bangkok buy a day pass to get around  Best way to travel to avoid the very bad Bangkok traffic

title: Travel with ease
review: Make sure you have enough change to buy your ticket which is super easy Tap the screen at your destination pay the required amount and the ticket will be sorted Don't stand back when boarding at peak times  you will be left on the platform ð

title: Nice cool ride
review: Quite interesting ride for my one stopto meet with my clients It was a pleasure to ride the sky train On a hot muggy day in Bangkok wearing a suit stepping on the train was a cool surprise The AC was incredible amid the large number of people on the train The process of buying tickets was very easy but wish they would take bills versus just change Great overall experience

title: Efficient
review: The train was timely clean and cool We used it from the airport to the city and highly recommend Because there were four in our group we elected to get a taxi for our return journey which was more comfortable and cheaper

title: Easy
review: Easy to use and you can link with the underground (MRT) too Very cheap way of getting around the city

title: The ONLY WAY to travel bangkok
review: If you wish to reach your destination don't even think about going down the road or taking a BIKE or A TAXI CAB Learn the skytrain lane and use it exclusively

title: Crowded and a bit expencive for a short ride
review: Kids have to pay full Price so for a family of five it is an expencive transport for a short ride Very Crowded in the trains Fast and not much waiting time

title: Extending
review: Good way to get around because cheap and fast and they keep extending the lines so more places to go

title: fastest!
review: Taking a taxi in Bangkok was horrible we fed up with negotiation to turn the meter on and traffic jam BTS however was clean easy to take and the fastest way to get to everywhere highly recommended) one bad thing was that only coins accepted coin change is available thought

title: Superb way to get around Bangkok
review: We almost entirely used the Skytrain and the Metro to get around BK Fast clean and cheap Though popular and crowded during rush hour it's calmer than the London underground and way calmer than the BK streets and roads

title: good transportation for avoiding traffic
review: Its good to avoid traffic if you have to go to busy places most of the time the sky train is full so you can not seat

title: Godsend compared to last generation bus service
review: Great rail system However still inaccessible to some parts of Bangkok though good enough for the main attractions

title: So easy to use and so handy
review: We travelled around bangkok using this as it was close to our hotel very easy to use and not expensive

title: Had a ride on da train.
review: I enjoyed da shopping malls at every  stopAlso enjoyed da viewThe train was very fastI would definitely recommend it for touristsThey also have an airport linkThe locals were very helpful on da trainThey told us about da different tourist attractions at every stop

title: Easy and Fast
review: Clean affordable and well air conditioned arguably the best way to get around Bangkok easily Short walk from all major attractions Far better than taxi

title: BTS as an 'attraction' ?? unless u like crowded spaces
review: How is the BTS an 'attraction'   In a city with 910 million this is a pitiful solution to public transport and congestion Trains are frequently crowded and dare anyone to travel in the long peak periods   And the rudeness of 'some'  it's far easier to occupy a seat check out and 'Like' 'Like'  on Facebook  Instagram than look to see if anyone elderly (eg my mum) could do with a seat   Sure it is cheap but there are currently no options to top up the Rabbit card via a machine one still needs to line up for that  The future expansion of 8 more stations on the Sukhumvit line will only add to the congested trains much like the road underneath  there urgently needs to be more lines crisscrossing the city

title: Excellent transport in the heart of the city
review: The BTS sky train is an efficient way to move around the city  Clean and easy to understand it is a way to beat the traffic which is never ending  Pricing is low in comparison to other means of transport  Worth a shot no matter where you are staying

title: Good value for money
review: An excellent mode of transport to get around Bangkok and avoid the traffic jams  If the sky train doesn't go directly to your destination I would suggest using it to get to as close to your destination as possible then pick up a taxi for remainder of journey again saving on time sitting in traffic jams Be aware traffic is horrendous in Bangkok but the sky train runs frequently is clean and feels safe at all times of the day It's also air conditioned  There are manned booths to help with travel costdirections give change as well as self service ticket machines

title: Beat the traffic with BTS skytrain
review: The trains are always clean and fast Depending on where you live you can avoid most of the Thailand traffic The stations have staff that speaks english and many signs in english so you know where your goingWhen i first arrived the staff was extremely helpfull and accomodatingMany of the stationsstops have tea shops coffee shops bakeries and even over the counter pharmacies So cool considering that in America they dont always have thatYou can literaly get a sandwhich beverage and medication before you head homeThere are buses taxisvans outside of most train stations

title: Very convenient way of getting around BKK
review: The BTS systems works very smoothly It's easy to get around town with this skytrain and also an easy and fast way to see something more from BKK while inside an airconditioned train Taxis are often stuck in traffic during most of the day

title: Cool and simple
review: Helpful when you want to skip the traffic AC works very well Trains are clean Its a quick and cheap way to go around Bangkok

title: Reliable
review: Its really the best way to get around Bangkok The airconditioning is great It can get a bit busy at peak hour timesbut its always generally better than taking a taxi Very reliable

title: Very handy
review: Very useful and much cheaper than taxis We tried to use it as much as possible Very efficient as well

title: Easy to navigate
review: Was very very easy to work out You look down at the traffic not moving Clean air conditioning and easy to us

title: Shopping
review: Bangkok BTS and MRT are seamless and well connected   They could do a bit more by showing more signs that lead to MRT Stations though I would said the rides are smooth

title: BKK TRIP
review: BTS sky train is fast and convenient however during the  busy hour too long queue for buying the ticket

title: A sturdy system
