review: I took the BTS Skytrain from Chit Lom to Mo Chit from Mo Chit to Siam and finally from Stadium to Ratchadamri on the 05 August 2017  As it was a late Saturday morning and that the weekend Chachuchak Market is open the train was so crowded that not all the passenger were able to get on the train I like the Thai culture of forming queues so an orderly disembarking and embarking can be done in the most efficient way by first allowing disembarking     On my trip from Mi Chit to Siam there is an issue of getting an entry ticket simply because the ticketing machine seem to accept only coin and those without coins have to form 2 queues to buy the ticket which I believe 1 baht is the service fee They should automate it for their sake as human intervention can lead unnecessary staff stress  The trip from Stadium to Ratchadamri was uneventful as  it is the start station One must look carefully as to which platform to use  On the whole I see the BTS as a sturdy system that don't sway or vibrate when it runs and they do so at respectable speed Of course they have no barrier at the embarking platform and this is where accident is waiting to happen Please install gates  The sound system is clear and at a level that is audible   A world class system that parallel to those in Hong Kong China and Japan

title: Bangkok Escaped
review: Very good to use the train instead of getting stuck with traffic riding taxi BIG HELP to go around town

title: good public transport
review: its the beat and easy mode of transport in city uts much economical and cheap way to travel within city to important places

title: Great
review: Great airport shuttle In less than one hour you can reach the final destination on comfortable train with air conditioning and a huge numbers of seats

title: Expensive and busy.
review: Before taking the skytrain check how many stations and changes you will need to make we traveled in a group of four people needed to change a train once The price was twice the regular taxi fee we would pay Needless to say that during the rush hour the trains are very busy

title: Exellent public transport
review: Cheap and easy to use public transport All  signs in  both Thai and English makes finding your way round easy

title: Visit to Markets
review: We were on a visit to with friends to visit a market and I was impressed with the cleanliness of our carriage and the frequency of the train Be prepared to be squashed in depending on when you choose to travel We had a day pass which suited our needs A great way to travel and to see different parts of the city as it is up high

title: great way to see the city
review: We used the train alot while we were visiting to Bangkok Definately worth getting the top up card and put money on it

title: Nice but expensive
review: I took the BTS everytime after work The worst thing is when is crowded by people between 6PM to 7PM IT'S JUST HORRIBLE but the Sukhumvit line deserved every shopping malls center so kind of easy to go somewhere else By chance my company give me a BTS card And for only one BTS station it already costs 15 baht Like the MRT it's expensive

title: One of the best transport in bangkok
review: It was ok for such a busy city definitely better form of transport comparing to taxi or tuk tuk as the traffic in Bangkok is always insane regarding what time is it One of the downside is that they don't really anounce every station and you need to be observant yourself or self you may miss the station upon exiting Overall they still need to expand the coverage

title: Great convenient transport
review: Amazing airconditioned smooth convenient trains Simple ticket buying in english or à¹à¸à¸¢  Great for viewing the city

title: Gets you fast to many places
review: The BTS Skytrain is a convenient way for transportation in busy Bangkok If you're heading for the weekend market for instance it will get you there quickly The AC is very strong in the cars so I'd recommend to have a light coat handy for those of you in need

title: Efficient and clean
review: We used this service every day whilst recently in Bangkok Was fast efficient and clean Easy to work out how to get from A to B  Staff in ticket office etc also helpful with directions Also airconditioned

title: A surprisingly fast and efficient mode of transport
review: If you are staying in the Sukhumvit area then make use of the sky train What a contrast to the snarled up traffic and mayhem on the roads below clean fast and airconditioned trains

title: A way to go around the traffic jams
review: The Skytrain is a convenient way to get to the destination but pretty crowded The terminating stations may not be the last station on the track so getting to the correct track may be a little inconvenient The trains are designed not for Travellers with big luggages as it is sometimes packed like a can of sardines and there are no racks to place luggage It is a good way to get around the city without getting swindled by the TukTuk or Taxi driver who insist on a nonmetered trip because of traffic jams

title: Good to go some tourist places but can be extremely busy
review: This MRT is good to help you get around some of the main areas of the city but is not as extensive as a usual metro system would be It runs pretty regularly but is a little expensive compared to public travel in some other Asian cities I have been to It can get very busy rush hour being the worst but it also gets busy an hour before and stays busy right through into the late evening Overall useful but crowded

title: Best way to avoid Bangkok Traffic
review: One of the best ays to get around Bangkok without the hassle of being stuck in traffic There are a bunch of stations connected by skywalk so you don't have to worry about crossing busy streets and most of them lead directly to the popular malls shopping and eating destinations Tip Its better to get a card if you plan on being in the city for a few days as it saves you the trouble of looking for change and waiting in line before every ride

title: Clean , safe , fast
review: An excellent way of travel in this bustling city Where a taxi might need say an hour to go from point A to B during traffic hours this Skytrain will take you there ( or near ) in 15 minutes An experience

title: Good as any modern city train service.
review: As you probably know or may have read you need to have Thai baht coins to purchase what we call in NY a MetroCard I forget what they call it in Thailand I guess BTS sky train pass Another thing that confused me when you get to your destination you place your BTS pass in the gate and you don't get it back the machine keeps it I kinda wanted one as a souvenir

title: Clean
review: Next to Singapore MRT I find that the Bangkok BTS Skytrain is also very clean and new It was also convenient especially if you are coming from Suvarnabumi Airport though it was kind of annoying buying a oneway ticket to stations because we cannot pay directly by coins at the counter by the entrance to the railway but queue to have your money get exchanged for coins and go to take another queue to the ticket machine slots to drop in your coins to obtain that oneway train ticket Anyway minus that part the trainride was pleasant and the system was easy to use

title: Excellent service and air conditioned!!!!
review: It was a great experience trying out the Bangkok metro Easy to take and tickets are quite cheap Prices differ according to distance Very convenient Must try  BTW do queue up as the locals do Don't jump the queue

title: just a great transportation
review: excellent convenient cheap a good way to travel into the city of Bangkok to avoid killer traffic and pollution forget about tuk tuk use the skytrain

title: THE BEST WAY TO TRAVEL
review: Don'tt bother with Taxis this air conditioned  efficient train is amazing cheap and SO easy to use We used it everyday and it was super easy  TIP the back of each ticket has the stations printed  simple

title: Very convenient
review: It's really worth for using we dont need to worry about traffic jam or hot weather outside Especially it has many stations in Bangkok so its so easy to access My boyfriend and me really like using BTS skytrain Hope that Vietnam will have it soon

title: A great way to avoid the crazy traffic in Bangkok
review: Easy to navigate cost effective and a very good option to get from A to B without standing in traffic queues all the timeand I mean ALL the time

title: Travel in Bangkok
review: Very easy to use in and around destinations of interest  Connects to some great shopping Take the NAtional stadium route and visit the MBK shopping center the Bangkok Culture and Art Museum  Take the walking bridge to Siam Discovery Center and Siam Center  Visit the aquarium in Siam Paragon  If you have a work permit bring it with you and the aquarium will give you a discounted price

title: Worth Using - Clean, Efficient & Cool
review: Easy to navigate  buy tickets at the desk from helpful staff  Trains are air conditioned and maps easy to follow  Stations clearly named

title: Easy to access
review: Bought the 1 day pass for THB 140 It is very useful as you don't have to queue up to buy cardtoken at the machine Unlimited ride per day

title: Tourist
review: I prefer to use bts because it shortens human time and it is fast and provides excellent service to all people and I always advise my friends to use it and I should mention that the prices of mobility are not expensive

title: Well co-ordinated life line of the city. Very crowded in office hours.
review: The trains move within restricted routes of the city One called the Sukhumvit line and the other Silom line The changeover is at Siam Most of the stations are interconnected to nearby shopping malls and hotels thus making it convenient to use in inclement weather Also there are bike taxis which operate from the inner lanes to the BTS station making it a smooth and fast journey There are certain stations like Asoke (Sukhumvit Line)  and Sala Daeng (Silom Line) which are connected to the underground MRT Paya Thai BTS is connected to the Airport Rail Link connecting the city to Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: Very convenient
review: I always use the sky train when I land in Bangkok it's really convenient and fast aswell as an extremely affordable way to get into Bangkok CBD I would recommend this over taking a taxi or a cab unless you have a very large budget the taxis and cabs tend to charge ridiculous prices and because bangkok is so busy it takes way longer aswell  Along with everything being written in Thai there is also English writing underneath it so it's easy to understand where you are and where you need to get off

title: Convenient
review: I was staying in the downtown of Bangkok Thailand the BTS we called it SKY train can reach to everywhere in the shopping area Just a bit crowded

title: Just a useful way to get around
review: It's cheap and easy  What's not to love especially if you avoid rush hour  Also connects with other transport links

title: Fast
review: Very reliable fast and affordable Although changing noted to coins can be long it helps one to avoid the jam on the busy roads of bkk

title: A great way to get around bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok The stations are easy to get around well sign posted with all the revelant information This was our main mode of transport We purchased a BTS One Day Pass which allowed us to use the system all day long & was cheaper than single tickets We went up to Mo Chit on Sunday & walked to the big weekend markets We stayed near Phaya Thai station & Siam was only two stops away all the large shops Also changed lines & went down to the river Great transport system wish ours was  as good in Australia

title: Best
review: Best way to move in place to place in Bangkok I recommend to book hotel near to skytrain stations It's cheap too

title: above the craziness
review: Pick your lodgings close to one of the sky train entrances and your access and enjoyment of Bangkok will soar  Out side of commuter times they are easy clean and safe

title: Crowded During Rush Hour
review: Very interesting experience If traveling during rush hours  be patient Easy to purchase ticket via machines  have coins

title: Stay close to the BTS and you'll be fine!
review: The best way of transportation in Bangkok without a doubt I always ensure to book hotels close to the BTS whenever visiting Bangkok Also combining transportation with a taxi app like Uber or Grab can really enhance your stay in BKK I don't enjoy the energy consuming task of negotiating about taxi meter vs fixed prices The only negative aspect about the BTS is that it can be quite expensive after several trips in one day which is not unusual

title: You have to try the BTS.
review: I passed on commuting the BTS on previous trips This time it was a must given the traffic and our destination (Erawan)  Quite the experience  Heads up  don't cross the yellow line or the security will start blowing whistles and yelling at you in Thai  lol

title: Helpfull facilities you can use.
review: I am not sure about the service is good or just like average but this facilities was help me a lot to move (in BKK)

title: Fast and efficient
review: Very convenient way to travel Bangkok although if it's 1 or 2 stops away I'd rather walk the streets as the stations are not too far apart Efficient and cost about 25 to 45 baht per journey   Downside unlike train systems in other countries when you switch from BTS to MRT you have to purchase a separate ticket

title: Excellent way to move around the city.
review: This is the best way to move around the city and avoid traffic It is like any developed country metro but on top of the city Sometimes it gets very crowded but that is not different from the rest of the world

title: Fast and Fabulous!
review: Want to get around we without being stuck in the Bangkok traffic for a fraction of the price Take the train Clean fast and efficient  If you dont mind a bit of cultural experience and see how the locals travel go for it Easy access to getting around the city the trains are air conditioned and get you around in a jiffy Do be mindful of peak times as the trains can get crowded The ticket counters and signage is clearly marked in English so any traveller will not get confused  There are not many people who are very familiar with English and asking around may be a hit and a miss so make sure you have a map and can point to people where you want to go  Crowded trains can be a haven for pick pockets so be sensibly cautious of your belongings and your wallet I had a very positive experience but it doesn't harm to be a sensible traveller and take home positive memories of this tantalizing country called Thailand  Bon Voyage and safe travels

title: Excellent Way to travel
review: Great way to travel around Bangkok We used this a few times during our stay Easy to navigate and value for money Really good for getting to Eastern Bus terminal and Mo Chit Nicely air conditioned and great to see the city from above  If getting to it from the River Taxis  get off at Central Pier you can walk to the sky train from there

title: Two nights in Bangkok!
review: Sky train was great Cheap and efficient As foreigners we found it a bit confusing to start with and were unsure where to wait for train but we soon got the hang of it  Highly patronised so even during what we considered off peak there was standing room only Would recommend you plan your journey before leaving home so you know what to ask for and which direction you need to be going in  Overall a fun experience that got us where we wanted to go

title: On time and clean
review: I use this every time I am in Bangkok Not only is it cheap but it is clean on time and SAFE The destination boards are easy to read and if you do have problems with the ticketing machines the staff are only too happy to assist It is much better to be above the traffic than stuck in it

title: Easy Smooth Comfortable and cheap transport
review: Buy a x day pass and shuttle around town at your pleasure Easy to figure out system easy to correct a mistake (if going to far or wrong direction) airconned clean and comfortable And the fastest way If travelling 34 pax together you may however consider taxi if considering the cost alone

title: Great way to travel
review: Used this recently and was really impressed with it's efficiency Trains are fast frequent and comfortable Great way to get around d the city

title: Easy and cheap
review: The BTS is easy and cheap to navigate and we used it to get around everywhere we needed to go in Bangkok

title: Cheap & reliable
review: 2x lines so not much to confuse you The ticketing system is easy to use (just remember to have coins) and cheap Very clean & efficient

title: clean efficient and cheap
review: the bts was about 10 min walk from my hotel and this is still the quickest way to get around the city especially if you are visiting the malls as they are connected We took this to siam paragon which was great Not family friendly but for a short trip this was OK

title: Great transport link across the city.
review: This transport link is air conditioned and offers easy and cheap transport to many of the top sites in the city  It can get very busy around 5pm and early in the morning  Trains are very frequent

title: Best way to avoid Bangkok traffic
review: We stayed at a hotel in Sukhumvit area and BTS was our main transport due to traffic Try to avoid using BTS between 700900 and 17001900 during weekdays if u can because it is overcrowded  If u wanna go to MBK or Siam Paragon shopping mall from Suvarnabhumi Airport u could use Airport Link to Phraya Thai then BTS to Siam station  If u wanna go to Terminal 21 shopping mall from the airport u could use Airport Link to Makkasan then use MRT (underground) from Petchaburi to Sukhumvit station  Food & drinks are not allowed on BTS All areas were kept tidy and clean at all times Staff were helpful and informative   It is very convenient to travel around Bangkok but not for disabled users as there is no facilities for them at most of BTS stations

title: Easy transport system
review: Easy to navigate transport system And if you get lost there is always a friendly Thai person around to help you The BTS is air conditioned which is great Takes you to great locations around Bangkok and is quicker cheaper and better than sitting in a taxi

title: Clean
review: It's a little crowded but people sincerely follow the rules  One can have o good view of the bangkok city

title: Skytrain Bangkok
review: The best way to get around BKK I usually by a day pass it's about 140 baht for a whole day  Shopping site seeing etc etc Skytrain is clean air conditioned and there is one every 35 minutes best public transport ever

title: Good Transportation System
review: The Metro system in Bangkok is really good good frequency and connectivity interchanging is a problem unlike Singapore Needs Improvement

title: Great way to get around the traffic
review: Get the day pass and jump over the traffic we had a ball getting on and off to shop and see the city  Gets a bit full during peak hours but still worth the time and money Will be getting on every day we are here love the BTS

title: Enjoyed riding
review: We made use of the skytrain daily for getting around Bangkok  Very easy to navigate at all stations    They can get crowded at times but never any issues   Everyone very friendly   The cost to ride is less than 50 cents

title: Very impressed!
review: Very impressed with the efficiency of the BTS Better organized cleaner and cheaper then the NYC subway Very easy to use

title: Train travels around Bangkok
review: Loved using this transport system So reliable and easy to access Station staff were very helpful The prices were good too Cheaper to get an all day pass or other options if spending a bit of time in Bangkok

title: Travel With Ease
review: Travelling from city to city is relatively challenging if you are new in town However the BTS Skytrain is a do it your self train line which is very traveler friendly

title: BTS Sky Train
review: BTS Sky Train Easy to come and good experience the connect of a part major  of Bangkok it's quicker and cheaper

title: Convenient, user-friendly
review: Easy access to various parts of Bangkok Fast & inexpensive Covers most tourists' areas A good choice other than taxi Can connect to Airport Rail Link

title: Clean and efficient
review: The skytrain did at first seem a wee bit daunting but once one is on it getting around us easy The stations are well sign posted and the trains are clean Everything runs quite efficiently

title: Best way to See Bangkok
review: Sky train offers a convenient way of traveling in all areas of Bangkok Try to get Daily pass as its cheap

title: Good Way To Get Around Bangkok
review: Rode the BTS several times to get around busy streets below  it is real easy to do and quite cheap when comared to Taxis  Depending when you go the trains can be quite full (standing room only) but the Thai people are polite and Hygenic so they do not omit bad body smells as compared to standing room only on Bart in SF California  The BTS is quite cheaper than Bart too

title: Very easy transportation around the bangkok city
review: Although most of the time we used taxi and uber but used BTS skytrain several times It was great on time and best transportation to avoid traffic jam

title: Limited utility
review: The skytrain itself is very reliable clean and predictable It reminds me a lot of the skytrain here in Vancouver BC except that it doesn't seem to connect well with other modes of transportation There are many sites in the city that are not easily accessed from the BTS However if you were site is on or near the BTS or MRT lines this is the way to go No need to find a reliable and trustworthy taxi driver

title: Excellent
review: It's the most economical and fastest way to travel in Bangkok  I would advise everyone to use it for long distances Maps are easily available as well

title: Travel
review: For a person whose not really been on trains the sky train was a good experience and also quite pocket friendly for people traveling on a budget

title: Best way to bomb round Bangkok
review: The trains are really cheap easy to use frequent and blissfully airconditioned They connect all the major parts of Bangkok

title: Nice expereince
review: BTS is a good sky train system All the trains come on time and crowded But safe and comfortable journey can be experienced

title: fast train bkk
review: modern  fast convenient  cheap way of travel in congested bangkok  and even to the airport it goes  must try

title: Good transportation
review: BTS is cheap Easy to purchase ticket It goes places where mrt does not go Since it is a monorail you can see outside

title: Just a great way to get around
review: It might seem odd to rate a mass transit system  which is actually what the BTS Skytrain is  but it is a great way to get around the newer parts of the city and absolutely the best way to avoid Bangkok's horrendous traffic  Its clean quick and air conditioned  It links to the underground system (also a great way to get around) so much of the wider city is very easy to get to around  The down side is that the BTS Skytrain does not get you to the big tourist areas down at the riverside (The Royal Palace etc) but you can get close enough to the river to be able to walk to one of the quay side taxi places for a river taxi

title: Clean easy fast way to get around
review: The Skytrain is so good that our tour guide took us on it instead of using the slow minivan method  It was clean easy and Ii would use it again

title: BTS Travel
review: By fare the easiest and simple way to get around BK city A cheap clean and efficient way to travel with good proximity to hotels and city locations

title: Simple as 123
review: Be like a local The most convenient and cheapest way to get around Bangkok Well connected to the Metro rails etc Stops right infront of all the big shopping centres

title: Excellent and value for money
review: forget the tuktuks  The BTS is a very efficient mode of transportation and will get you to anywhere you need to be  It is very easy to navigate and the trains run very often  Down side is that it gets really busy during peak hours but if you're a tourist then its easy to work around this

title: BTS skytrain
review: Very convenient and reliable mode of transportation though a bit pricey Stations are strategically located at shopping malls and are very accessible to tourist attractions Rush hour time was amazing

title: Squish squash
review: Love the bts Easy to use but can get very busy  Walking up and down the stairs will give you a good work out  I found myself buying a daily ticket for 140 bahtI found the queues buying tickets could be quite long  The worst people on the bts are the tourists who seem to forget they are on holidays and to relaxthe trains come frequentlyare cleanand safe

title: BTS line
review: The BTS line is easy to navigate The dark green and light green lines are clear purchasing of ticket is also easy at the station

title: The cheapest and efficient way to travel around Bangkok!
review: BTS Skytrains are very well connected across the city It is the best way to travel around in Bangkok Though it's crowded during the peak hours it is still better as you can avoid the heavy road traffic if you are on a budget trip then this is the best pick and its convenient as well There are trains almost every 510 mins and it's a huge time saver on a jam packed trip compared to the taxis or tuktuks

title: EASY TO USE
review: The train is an excellent way of getting around Bangkok  It is easy to use simple to purchase a ticket from the machine and the customer service counter will give change if you do not have it

title: Efficient
review: Best way to travel Bangkok Though there may be crowds almost unbearable at certain hours on certain days it is ten times better than taking the roads Would recommend most definitely

title: Best transportation
review: Best way to get around town It gets bit costly but it beats all the bangkok traffic It's definitely  the best way to cool the heat Almost too cold

title: Must use!
review: Cheap easy to use and takes you to different locations Downside   can be very very busy   Staff are helpful and work out for you the different stops you need for your journey

title: Room for improvement
review: The BTS is generally clean and efficient service but ticketing could be far better Most stations have a couple of old ticket machines and at peak times long queues can form More ticket machines would be useful The customer service booth only seems to be able to offer day tickets and change (old ticket machines only accept coins) I enquired about a day pass which in the end wasn't desirable for my needs I later found out about the rabbit card  a top up card you can keep for years The customer service agent despite having a good command of English didn't mention this option to me at all It would have been useful   More ticket machines would be great and all machines modernised to accept cash or insert a change machine rather than having to queue to see the agent just to get coins would be useful  Signage could also be improved  with the boards detailing the stops placed clearly at the bottom of each set of stairs up to the train platform

title: Efficient way to beat the Bangkok traffic
review: The BTS Skytrain is the elevated train in Bangkok which has two main lines The service is very efficient with trains running at quick intervals especially at peak times A very handy way to get around parts of the city and also tourist friendly Either single trip or stored value cards are available

title: Love public transport in Bangkok
review: The BTS is very reliable clean cheap and has air conditioning in all trains Best way to get around Bangkok They also have shops in some BTS stations

title: Convenient transportation
review: This is the quickest way of transportation in Bangkok Not very crowded and price reasonable Better buy a stored  value tickets if travel a lot around Otherwise getting a single journey ticket is easy But better prepare enough coins when taking BTS in peak hours because you have to line up for coins and line up for tickets

title: Excellent easy modern transport
review: Very quick and easy to use Clean cheap and efficient No need to use city taxis for airport transfers

title: Great but there are snags ...
review: It was an amazing initiative of Bangkok to introduce the BTS System and it is now quite popular with every tourist I dare say  Staff are typically very helpful and there are machines as well  The fares are affordable but the annual increase stands in no relationship with the quality of service because trains are overloaded now during peak hours  Safety In recent years security gates have been installed and G4S guards have not been replaced by those In fact BTS have now got a security officer at every exit on some of the station Quite an intrusion into your privacy since they expect you to open your bags publicly  and they then do not really inspect anything  a bit pointless  The security at the platform and on the sky walk are mostly unreasonable For example taking photographs is an issue as they push you to move on  although there might be 20m wide and 500m long strips with not a single person in sight I am not sure why security officers would engage when there is no 'security concern' nor 'risk'  I am still enjoying my journeys and I hope you like my images

title: Best to Avoid Traffic Jam
review: BTS is the beat option to travel in Bangkok  U save time to stuck in traffic with BTS  anyway the cab will be better option at night as rate will be cheaper sometime and no traffic

title: Convenient and cheap
review: Train doesn't come as frequent as expected but the BTS covers majority of the tourist locations that we planned to go to  It's very cheap as well One way tickets are around $1 USD only

title: Sky train saves my day
review: Clean and proper cheap and convenientthat's what I can describe about this wonderful means of transportation in Bangkok

title: Great system
review: Very impressed with BTS system and quality of service and trains  Easy to use  Very efficient and lots of lovely Thai ladies to brighten the day with their lovely smiles

title: Clean and affordable public transport.
review: Traveling on BTS is an easy way to get around Bangkok City You can get a farecard and top up at any station and the fare is just 25baht for around 4 stops   The only problem I have is when boarding at the exchange station where there are lots of passengers boarding and alighting but again it's an experience to commute like the locals   The trains are clean and the service staff at the station are very helpful in providing direction to which platform to take   Once you get out the ticketing gantry there are heaps of small stalls selling bites and drinks convenient to those who need a quick bite or thirsting for water

title: Great way to get around
review: Avoid the traffic dodgy tuk tuk and taxi drivers and just get the BTS and walk a little to your destination The BTS are a comfortable temperature even when crowded and you have to stand for a little while

title: avoid all Bangkok traffic
review: if your destination is on one of the two lines you're in luck comfortable and easy to get too and you avoid all the busy roads

title: Budget travel option
review: I went to Sam Yan MRT from airport From air port i took air port link  Paya Thai and get down from makkasan MRT then walked to Pechaburi  MRT from there took another MRT up to Sam Yan

title: Easy to use and quick
review: Simple easy to use and very quick cheaper than taxis and tuk tuks miss the misery of the Bangkok traffic jam and air conditioned bliss

title: It was okay,since it was crowded you could not view the ride and language problem was there with no signs to guide they
review: In Bangkok this is a must ride if you can be guided the worst thing noticed in bangkok was that  most Taxis are  not running on meters and ask foe exorbitent fares hence use of bts becomes essential

title: Easy to Travel
review: Decent price and very easy travel on the BTS Skytrain whether you are connecting from the airport or heading across town to the JJ market

title: Skytrain is THE way to get around in Bangkok!!
review: At one point we tried using a taxi  We'd still be stuck in traffic if our local friends hadn't shown up in time to get us on the right skytrain line

title: Not developed for Wheelchair
review: It is not developed for wheelchair or kids trolley as there is no elevators Crowded but easy to use and I advise to use them to avoid the traffic jams

title: Easy way to travel
review: If you destinationsite is close to a BTS station then definitely take the BTS It's comfortable air conditioned and cheap  Definitely get the 1day unlimited pass (available as of this writing) if you'll be taking the BTS four times or more in one day Tickets can be purchased from the machines or booths (which tend to be quicker regardless of time of day)  How to use at the gates Insert your ticket wait a second then retrieve it when it pops out Now walk through the gate When exiting insert your ticket (the gate will keep it on your exit) and walk through the gate  Major downside of the BTS Trains run between 1015 minutes apart If you miss one it can feel like a very long wait in the Bangkok heat and humidity

title: Very funny
review: It's very clean quick and simple to take The train goes to the main places of the city Not expensive

title: Easy access and nice connectivity
review: Cheap and great medium to go places in Bangkok The trains are clean and well maintained You need to first get change in coins and then take tickets using automated machines Being an outsider it wasn't difficult to figure out things They have made it very tourist friendly

title: Convenient public transport
review: The train can reach most of the popular shopping malls The fare is reasonable However do avoid peak period as it will get quite crowded

title: Efficient & Cheap
review: An easy clean cheap efficient & safe way to travel from the airport into the city  Highly recommended

title: Awesome
review: Clean efficient and cheap There really isn't much more I can say about it By far the best way to get about the city

title: BTS
review: It's really convenient for Bangkok people Clean and comfortable  If you have chance should try the best service of BTS

title: Easier than I thought!
review: Straight forward & faster than braving slow Bangkok traffic Clean & equipped with English translations

title: Better Choice
review: A lot better choice than a taxi in Bangkok Cleaner and faster No need to suffer locked in horror of traffice Jam in Bangkok City center

title: Easiest way to travel in Bangkok
review: Great experience easy to navigateticket machines on the station and cashiers who speak English   Prices very reasonable  At certain times peak office time it can be quite compact on the train however is a million times better than being stuck in the sea of a moving car park on all the roads below  It took 3 and a half hours stuck in the back of a taxi that I later learnt could have been travelled by BTS in 30 minutes at a fraction of the price    Check it out is definitely the fastest cleanest and a cheap way to travel

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Definitely recommend the skytrain if you're traveling in town Not too expensive lots of places to stop on and off and the staff is very helpful if you aren't sure what you're doing

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: With the infamous traffic jams in Bangkok the BTS is the best way to get around in Bangkok with the next best alternative being motorbike (only 15 to 45THB per ride) or tuk tuk (bargain) for the adventurous

title: The fastest way to get around Bangkok and miss the traffic jams.
review: The BTS [SKYWAY] can get you quickly efficiently and cheaply to just about anywhere you want to go plus it has stations that interchange with both the MRT [underground] and the Suvamabhumi Airport Link For shopping we would get off at National Stadium for MBK centre and Siam Square1 and short walk to Siam Centre and Siam Paragon and the board at BTS Siam to travel back to our hotel at Sala Daeng On the weekend we took the BTS to Chatuchak market which is a short walk from BTS Mo Chit For our visit to the Grand Palace we took BTS to Saphan Taksin station then a short walk to Sathorn Pier and caught a ferry All the station exit signage is really clear and easy to follow this is the BEST way to get around Bangkok

title: smooth trip and easy to use
review: Much easier to use the BTS Skytrain to transfer tofrom your hotel than taking a taxi as it's quicker and cheaper

title: The BTS in Bkk saves you time!
review: In BKK traveling around during the day in a taxi takes forever and in summer it's just got to walk around anywhere It can be 15 mins on the BTS vs 90 mins in a taxi during peak traffic The BTS or subway is the best way of moving around It's affordable clean safe air conditioned and convenient   The Thai people are one of the most polite people in the world and you notice it on the BTS I suggest you go ahead and get what they call a rabbit card which is a prepaid card for 500 to 1000 Thai Bhatt instead of waiting inline every time to get coins and then buy tickets The rabbit card can also be used to buy things at food courts etc  You can also use the BTS to go to the airport  but make sure your suit case has some good wheels on it The only draw back to the BTS is that at many places there are no escalators so you have to walk up and downstairs which isn't easy when you have young kids or heavy bags with you I suggest when choosing a hotel you chose one connected to the BTS or else really close

title: Best way to go around the city
review: With usual traffic jam in the city BTS skytrain in the most convenient way to roam around the city  It passes thru most famous shopping centers in the city

title: USE IT IF you can!
review: BTS skytrain is a very comfortable way to travel around in Bangkok  It's quick runs frequently and its air conditioned And if you don't have too much luggage you can even take it from the new airport Just get away from the rush traffic that can take hours into the city  The weakness of BTS is that it only runs 2 lines  which mean that you might need to take a taxi after you get close to your endpoint but you might have saved a lot of time during the main part of you trip

title: fast way in BKK
review: probably you know how overcrowded is BKK taking taxi is not an option as you will sitting hours in the traffic Skytrain is well air conditioned fast and good value for money don't think just take

title: Pleasant surprise
review: Thankfully easy to use and cheap Make sure you know the EXACT name of where you're going otherwise it makes life a bit tricky but everyone is very helpful Some of the views are pretty cool too Much easier and cheaper than the tuktuks and there is Air con

title: Fast and avoid traffic jam
review: buy the rabbit store value cardcard that is 200 where 100 for your use the card last for 5 years and you can top up paid by Visa if the amount above 300

title: Comfortable Air conditioned BTS
review: It was an amazing comfort in using the BTS The air conditioned BTS ride soothe your body after walking outside the warm weather I enjoyed touring Bangkok with ARL BTS & Canals boat I wished the BTS and  ARL schedule ride time will be extended during peaksummer season

title: travelling around Bangkok on BTS Skytrain
review: Wow as a traveller who has been to Thailand several times the introduction of the skytrain has been a Godsend rather than being gridlocked in traffic and tuktuks you fly across the city with fantastic views (I was taking photos like there was no tomorrow of the skyline sunrise sunset buildings wonderful)  Clean cheap and timesaving don't waste your time saving a bit by going by taxi or bus this is THE best way to travel around Bangkok and the lines are being extended

title: Great service
review: On time and efficient Clean air conditioned sky train A little jam packed from time to time but good value for money But far more pleasant than the London Underground

title: Don't use a Taxi
review: What a great way to get about  Bangkokclean efficientno grafitytravellers politeWe used this many timesa real example of how this type of transport should be rnand always on time

title: Plan your trips, based on Thai working hours!
review: If you're on holiday the BTS is an excellent way to get around Bangkok Harder to get lost if the BTS can be seen in the distance Get a map showing stops and times Get a daylong pass then no waiting in line for each stop  Go when the Thai workers aren't going to work in the morning and more importantly when the go home If you do go when busiest and you're on vacation let the weary workers and ladies sit

title: #1 way to get around BKK
review: It's fast and affordable  clean and convenient and if you ever have to choose between a taxi or the BTS when it's raining GO BTS  A taxi will get stuck in traffic and the BTS will get you where you need to go

title: Bangkok Travellings
review: The most convenient transportation in Bangkok Fast Cheap and Efficient Miss a train  no problem the next ones is within 5 minutes Connect ypu to All major attractions shopping malls & soon the airport Clean and hassle free ride as always when I'm in Bangkok Never late for appointment when you travels via the BTS

title: BTS train
review: Good clean transport However it is only close to a few of Bangkok's touristic area's  It has a great advantage though if you exactly want to visit these spots since there is a major traffic jam during the whole day Where you are in a taxi for 30 minutes to travel 2km in the city you'll reach your destination with BTS in 510 min  Unfortunately public transport stations are more difficult to understand than for example the public transport infrastructure in Kuala Lumpur

title: BTS skytrain
review: Excellent way to travel to the National Stadium Very cheap roughly 28 baht which equates to $115 one way Air conditioned but can get extremely crowded but thats all part of the fun Easy to use

title: Bangkok Sky Train
review: Really easy to use plus all the carriages have AC The ticket machines are touch screen and self explanatory

title: Great way to get around
review: When getting around Bangkok use the Skytrain and boat system as much as possible The traffic is horrendous and the skytrain is air conditioned fast and cheap

title: BTS seems really good
review: We only went by BTS just 2 or 3 times but it was so nice Really need this for the city coz the traffic was so bad Anyways the way was not too long so I take it as an experience

title: Daily user
review: Since two years I use the skytrain twice daily for commuting between house and office Traffic is a bad experience in overcrowded Bangkok and the BTS is the one and only solution to move around Every now and than a bit Tokyo style filled up like a can of sardines Fortunately Thai people have a proper sense of hygiene and as such it's okay Very much advised

title: convenient transportation
review: Convenient transport at low cost Advisable to take this as to taxi to avoid traffic jam Try to avoid busy hours

title: Round About In Thailand
review: I truly feels like home when I'm travelling in the train the directory board at the station has both Thai & English written clearly  The only one thing that the system lacks is a similar dual language signage in the train so that when the recorded broadcast of location tourist would be able to identify ourselves of our whereabouts

title: Easy to use
review: The Skytrain made transportation throughout Bangkok so much easier without having to worry about the stupid chaotic traffic

title: Great
review: All I can say is Efficient  Clean Cheap Easy to use  Although a little crowded staff are friendly and happy to help

title: Good and Affordable Way To Travel Around
review: The BTS Skytrain is a good way to travel around in BKK and very affordable It is very convenient too Although to get to Pratunam area one would still need to alight at Chit Lom or Siam station and walk   The walk there has been made an even better experience with the building of the RLink a linkway that connects the station all way through to Platinum Mall in Pratunam  It is usually crowded but getting on and to your destination should be a breeze

title: Best form of travel
review: The BTS is an absolute must if you plan on traveling around Bangkok  Not only will it keep you off the busy city streets  but it is a clean and enjoyable way to do what the natives do  Thousands of Bangkokians travel via the BTS everyday and it is understandable why The cars are clean  the facilities are in great shape  and things are always running on time  My family love getting onto the BTS anytime we want to go to the mall or one of the many city landmarks  If you are in Bangkok and haven't done so  try the BTS you will love it

title: Wonderful efficient clean service
review: Skytrain IS the way to get around Bangkok clean well run efficient and that great aircon Buy a day pass for better value and take unlimited trips You can get to most tourist attractions this way including Chatuchuk Market on the weekends SkyTrain also connects to the Airport Express which means you can get from the airport to the City and close to most hotels on the SkyTrain route for around BAHT130 (AUD5)

title: Sky train experience
review: My friend and I caught the sky train out to the Chatuchak Markets in Mo Chit  from the Surasak station  we had to change trains at the Siam Station  Before boarding the train you have to buy tokens that let you through the turn style There is a map showing the stations and how much money you need to get the tokens required There is also information offices to buy change from if you don't have the correct money and need help  We had to change trains at Siam Station which was a piece of cake The trains are pretty full but people are very respectful vacating seats for elderly and parents with children I found the whole experience hassle free and very easy The trains are clean and fast The frequency of the train schedule is every 4 minutes I believe And it was cheap it cost us 42 baht each for a one way journey I would definitely recommend BTS sky train travel

title: cheap and fast
review: After so many times visit Thailand this was the first time I used the BTS almost everyday Very cheap and fast comphare to taxi Avoid the rush hours otherwise you will hv to queue and it will be so crowded inside the train But it was still fun

title: Convenience
review: I had a good experience here when I first time used it That's was so fun if you go as group and save a lot of cost if you travel between the cities   DO IT

title: Fast, Reliable and Clean
review: We throughly enjoyed taking the BTS everywhere we needed to go in Bangkok We always felt safe at the stations it was clean reliable and the AC was a nice break from the summer heat

title: A/C, fast, clean, and not crowded
review: Such a great way to see the city from above Just wish it connected to more areas of the city but it's otherwise the best way to get around the major points

title: Nice ride
review: We took the BTS to Siam center and enjoyed both the experience and the speed of getting to the malls area

title: Convenient, efficient and fast
review: With the infamous Bangkok traffic especially during rush hour the BTS is really the best way to get around Bangkok It's clean and comfortable and efficient Frequent trains arrive and it's relatively quick to get from one location to another on the trains

title: Beat the traffic crap of journey!
review: Best way to travel thorough Bangkok down town in rush hour  And I promise Bangkok rush hour is Longgggggg  Traffic started jamming from 700am 10am then 11130pm as lunch time jam then 330pm830pm for evening Do not under estimate Bangkok traffic use the toilet before traveling ðð¤£ or BTS combined with MRT will be the best way of traveling downtown and out skirt of the town  Go to BTS & MRT Bangkok website Enjoy

title: Airconditioned carriages
review: Very frequent services Crowded during peak hours as the carriages have ac its not uncomfortable reasonable prices

title: Easy transportation
review: Yes I will admit it was a bit confusing but the police and people around helped us the best they could We used the skytrain a handful of times to get from the airport to the hotel and attractions It was fairly cheap (120 baht all day pass) and very packed but it was all a part of the experience This was by far the fastestcheapest choice of transportation around the city if you know how to use it  ** I recommend you do some research on the routes beforehand so you don't get frustrated when you are there trying to find your way   **Also you can't expect everyone to speak English so using google translate also helped us asked simple yes or no questions for directions

title: Not like it used to be
review: Still wonderfully air conditioned and efficient but seems a lot more busy than it used to be Very few times of day when I would go near it now and still feels like forever when you're waiting on the platform in the heat (sometimes after climbing the stairs) Horrible when you get to the top of the stairs and just miss a train

title: Amazing service and spped
review: So much better than using taxis and perfect if you want to go to the big malls for shopping and cinema

title: Good transportation
review: Very good and fast transportation in the city It's very good explained how it works and easy to find your way

title: too full
review: the only way to travel around bangkok fast price seem to get higher everyday The train should come more offten as it is always full just wishbthat i can have a seat sometime

title: Best way to get around.
review: We took the Skytrain from the airport to a station near our hotel It was very easy to do this for the first time We travelled on the Skytrain most days It was very safe and everyone was friendly and helpful if we needed help mostly when we didn't know what side of the station we needed to go to Great fun

title: Cheap, frequent and easy way to get around BKK
review: Cheap option for the tourists who want to get around Bangkok It is well connected to MRT at several stops

title: The Most Convenient Public Transport in Bangkok
review: The BTS sky train system in Bangkok is the most convenient form of transport especially when it comes to the central areas Thanks to its gradual expansion this is beginning to apply even to outlying areas except that some central areas are still not being covered It is clean efficient and delays are seldom There are increasing problems with the growing numbers of passengers but not increasing traffic making life on board very unpleasant for large periods of the day and evening especially on some lines Not infrequently do I feel like a "sardine"

title: Easy to use
review: We got a day ticket each which was approximately Â£7 for both of us You can pay to go between specific stations but as we just wanted to hop on and off as and where we fancied it was better to get the day ticket and at Â£350 each it's hardly expensive As the train goes from one end if the city to the other it's so easy to use and so uncomplicated unlike for instance the London tube where you have to change lines etc It was our 1st time on the Skytrain and would definitely recommend it as a good way of exploring

title: BTS Hours
review: BTS shuts down at midnight which is something to watch out for as most bars stay open to 200am Subsequently taxis can become pricey with many drivers not wanting to use their meters BTS trains between certain stations can be very busy at rush hours

title: excellent public transportation service.
review: The Bangkok Skytrain is a very good and cheap public transportation system It runs next to or close to many places you would want to shop at such as Siam Paragorn mall (one of the single best shopping locations I have ever experienced) It's safe and clean and the aircon is amazing

title: Very Comfortable and Time Saving
review: Just like Metro in any other part of the world it matches right up to the expectations Everything is nicely maintained and staff is supportive

title: Efficient and easy to travel on
review: There are counters where you can exchange notes for coins to use the ticket machines Sometimes they may issue the ticket there and then  Ticket machine is easy to use select corresponding fare from the map and insert coins A lot of the time it can get quite crowded but it is an experience

title: Need lots of change!
review: The train systems works well but I'm giving 2 stars because most of the ticket machines do not accept notes and it is a hassle to get change especially if the station is crowded   I have only seen some machines accepting notes at a main station and the rest only accept coins

title: Efficient and Reliable
review: Trains always running on time to get you from A to B quickly Metro Trains in Melbourne Australia should take a look at the BTS system and copy it

title: Convenient and easy.
review: he Bangkok public transport system is brilliant We stayed for 5 days and used either the BTS Skytrain or the MRT Underground as our main means of transportation Getting tickets is easy using the automatic ticket machines all you have to do is write down the stations you need to stop at as the names can be confusing Trains are clean and feel safe locals are polite and don't hassle tourists Make it a priority to take at least one trip as it is an experience not to be missed

title: Great experience!
review: Efficient and safe public transport system Very clean easy to access and easy to useIt has stations in important shopping centers

title: Love the BTS!!
review: Bangkok's BTS system is efficient and comfortable The air conditioned cars make even the crush of rush hour feel bearable I wish my hometown of San Francisco could have such a great public transportation option

title: Consistently good
review: I used the BTS for the first time back in 2010 and was impressed by the cleanliness punctuality and efficiency of the trains and the usefulness of the routes It was strangely affordable the stations felt quite safe and welllit even late at night and I found the entire experience wonderful  I used BTS again in 2016 and nothing has changed in 6 years The entire system is still clean organised and safe So it still gets full marks from me

title: Cool (Literally!) Ride
review: Quick cheap and cool way to get around busy hot and humid Bangkok Crowded but trains come frequently

title: Cheap
review: Its a very nice way for a tourist to reach especially MBK mall It is very affordable at 35baht and very ckean

title: Fast and cheap
review: Easiest transport by far Fast cheap very frequent Make sure you have change to buy your ticket  although there is a customer service desk that will change big notes for you

title: Clean , fast , easy access !
review: Really surprise to be riding on such clean train It's fast and easy access at many location With the traffic jam here I definitely can get some help with the BTS system in BKK

title: Easy to navigate
review: There is an app you can get that makes it easier but using the BTS is pretty straight forward and easy to use

title: Great.
review: The is great  So efficiently run  The platform Security personnel r so helpful in guiding u  Really Superb

title: Reliable and a great respite from the heat

title: Excellent Trip
review: Great way to get around Bangkok Easy to use and cheap too Plenty to see at different stops and easy connecting stations to other line and other transport methods

title: Very useful
review: If you are in Bangkok for sometime better use the BTS to go to places because it's very cheap and easy to use considering that the traffic is terrible and the taxis don't usually use taximeter you may be pay more than it worths Check where you are going first and then use it Bring some change because it's easy to use the machines to buy your ticket The entrance has a metal detector and if you have a bag the security will as you to open it so it's safe too Enjoy your ride

title: Very easy to use
review: Enjoyed the BTs sky train A fast comfortable and economical way of transportation Very well connected to the various malls hotels etc

title: Fun to do
review: Went on this just the once and enjoyed it Simple to use More expensive than taxi but still ridiculously cheap Clean and tidy carriages Even tvs in there

title: A great way to get around Bangkok.
review: I use this system all the time  The system is nearly always on time easy to understand and navigate and with the aid of a Rabbit card continual travel is easy

title: Easy to understand , quicker than cab
review: Been on sky train a few times when in BKK  Its quicker than Taxi in rush hour Air Conditioning is good Clean & Tidy  Staff at the stations are helpful

title: Convenient and modern
review: Beats the Bangkok traffic and is convenient Very well connected to almost all places of interest Even as a tourist we found it very convenient to navigate ourselves

title: Good fun!
review: Sky train is very convenient since the traffic in Bangkok can be very congested It offers a day pass and a one time ticket too We got one one time ticket for 44bht Its quite fast but a smooth ride We didn't have to wait for very long In fact it seemed like it comes every 5minutes There are ample seats and enough space to stand as well Every ticket has a map of the stops the train makes

title: A effective way to get around in Bangkok.
review: A effective way to get around in Bangkok Howewer there should be more stations Despite the crowd on the train this is more preferable than be stucked in a taxi The traffic in Bagnkok is overwhelming

title: BTS is great
review: BTS is great Invest in a pass you can buy at window and not stand in line to pay with coins This is the way to ride BTS

title: Rapid transport.
review: Excellent way to get around Bangkok Reasonably easy to navigate for non Thai speakers Very crowded but to be expected in busy city One of the cheapest and easiest ways to get from a to b Just ensure that you know exactly what route you plan to take before you pay for your ticket Also bag searches are commonplace so mind what you put in your bags

title: Fun
review: Everyone should ride on the BTS  Not only is it about the most convenient way of getting anywhere but it is also a fun experience especially if you enjoy people watching  You also get to see a little of the city  Can't go to Bangkok and not ride it

title: Very good travel to shopping plaza
review: Always best way to travel to shopping plaza Very clean and efficient and cheap or economical travel

title: A bit hairy at busy times but budget friendly
review: Squeezing into a tuk tuk with a family of 5 isn't always ideal and can be expensive day in day out the sky train really is the way to go It's fast and convenient for a fraction of the price Just be prepared at rush hour times for it to be busy

title: Become overcrowded.
review: Used to be a joy when it opened but it's now just another overcrowded misery like everywhere else That said it's still the best option for many journeys

title: Quite similiar to MUMBAI METRO
review: We had a quite similar experience of BTS like a Mumbai metro Very well connected to many locations across Bangkok

title: Vacation
review: Pleasant and well coordinated service Timely access to various destinations Very happy with the experience

title: I wish we had more of these
review: Air conditioned All going up can be done by escalator Lots of little store booths on the ticket level Bypasses heavy traffic of the main road  Taxis don't like to go too far If I am far from home I ride the BTS to 1 or 2 stops from home doing any more shopping and then catch a taxi home  Bonus Great place to get change Our laundry uses 10 baht coins I just hand the ticket people a 100 baht bill and get 10 coins for later  Con Can be very crowded Think like a sardine

title: Fast and conveient
review: A bit crowded but an excellent way to get to different places at an economical cost It was a disciplined and safe way to see the place But one has to get used to it A bit nerve racking in the beginning

title: BTS and boat are the best and safest way to get around Bangkok
review: Very busy but it works fine Take plenty of cash or use the changing machines you have to buy tickets from the machines Taking a taxi is pointless since traffic is extreme

title: Easy, cheap, has air con but often crowded
review: A great way to travel around Bangkok Most journeys are between 1550thb Often very crowded so you probably won't get a seat but it's pretty quick so you won't be on long anyway Air con is very good

title: BTS is a best way to travel in BKK
review: BTS sky train is a very convenient way to travel in BKK than car But in the rush hour BTS is crowed with many people

title: It's a train!
review: Don't know why but the people in Bankok love this It is efficient I think but doesn't go to many tourist places Not sure what the excitement is about However it's cleanyou are not allowed to take food and drnk on the platform or on the train

title: Good cheap way to get around Bangkok
review: Like the London Underground it was very crowded but a fast efficient and reliable way to get around Bangkok Taxis are cheap too but traffic here can be often in a gridlock  especially around rush hour Far easier to chose this method of transport Lots of stops  a day ticket is really good value Trains every 3 mins

title: Makes exploring Bangkok easy and fun
review: Great airconditioned public transportation  Visit different areas of Bangkok  No rental car necessary in Bangkok  Not expensive  But need change

title: Pocket friendly and clean
review: In bangkok i will suggest that if u dont have much luggage with u then i will definately suggest u all use sy traon in bangkok  They are inter connected with other metro line and u can easily search in google as per ur location nearest ro you  And metro station nearest to ur destination   And then take and change the train accoedingly   Its very fast time saving and pocket friendly  Also connected to suvarna bhumi airport  Provided u have to change traon in interlinked direction as the case may be

title: The air conditioning was a welcomed surprise
review: A great way to get around the city easily as the traffic is so slow They have the equivalent to an Oyster card which is really useful

title: BTS SKY TRAIN SO EASY.
review: Great way to get around Bangkok So easy and safe The most effective mode of transport for sure  Very clear info inside the train and the maps at the station are really easy   If unsure you can ask an attendant at one of the ticketing windows

title: Excellent experence,
review: Bought the 15 trip pass value for money and convient We used the sky drain everyday for all the 8 days we spent there very clean and signs properly posted

title: Best way to travel around in Bangkok
review: The BTS sky train in Bangkok is a an easy and convenient way to travel around in the city Although it's even busier than ever it's still better and quicker than taxi In the Silom district all of the stops have direct connections to the shopping malls It will take a few trips to familiarise yourself with the network and the cost is more than reasonable

title: Very easy to use system!
review: I'm a veteran of many mass transit systems   DC NYC Toronto Montreal Japan Europe and I find the BTS Skytrain a very easy system to navigate   Its safe plenty of English signage  If you don't feel like navigating the fares just buy a one day pass its a few bucks more but covers anything and there is a good chance you might take multiple rides

title: Convenient
review: Great way to travel around Bangkok Easy navigation get to most places Faster since the road are always jam

title: Very good, effective service
review: The Skytrain was a great way to get around the city We used Uber a few times (and tried but failed to get a taxi to drive us) but the Skytrain got us to most of the places we wanted to go We used Rabbit cards but next time we will go with the stored value Rabbit rather than the ones with a set number of trips

title: a must use to visit bangkok
review: only issue  crowded more and more with people   Take card pass and top up it otherwise loosing time with coin in machine

title: Easy to get around, Clean and Safe
review: Travelling anywhere new can be daunting This was the first part of my big solo trip and it felt so easy and user friendly It is busy but you're in a capital city like London or NY so its to be expected that its as busy as the Underground or Subway

title: Affordable, easy to navigate, and convenient!
review: I enjoy public transportation when in a new city being very familiar with DC NYC Boston and Los Angeles as well as London Paris Barcelona Madrid and others  As a firsttime visitor to Southeast Asia traveling alone I decided to try to master the public rail system on the first day and found it to be easy to navigate  Advice  if you are going to make more than 2 stops each way in a day always buy the 1day pass  In July 2017 it is 140 baht (less than $5)  With most trips being 2545 baht you quickly save money  But even on lower travel days the time saved of having to buy individual passes (first waiting in light to get change before getting in the line to buy the individual ticket) is worth the extra cost  I stayed in a hotel just off of Sukhumvit and found that to be a great location  easy access to many malls the Bangkok Arts & Culture Center the Jim Thompson House and Outlet Store weekend farmers markets and the Chatuchak Weekend Market  And even in going to places not on the BTS many connections were doable  I went to the Grand Palace and Wat Po by 2 trains and a ferry in going to a night market one night and a rooftop restaurant another it was an easy transfer to the MRT (although the two systems of passes are entirely different  one uses a coded card and the MRT uses a wooden token)  Sometimes the trains are VERY crowded but the status changes stop by stop And while people are pressed together occasionally there is no pushing or stress just crowding    I used the BTS system for a week in the heat of July and found the trains to always be well air conditioned  And the queuing system (platforms are marked with two rows of angled access from each side of each train door opening with a large exit area for deboarding) is the best I've seen anyplace in the world  Recommendations for improvement  merge the passtoken systems for BTS and MRT make it easier to buy multiple passes at the same time (both for going and coming as well as buying for 2 or more people traveling together) and make train maps more readily available  I picked one up at the airport information center and learned later that it was not replaceable at BTS stations  Advice  The specific Google Maps app on your smart phone allows you to plan trips using the Bangkok public transportation system (one trip at a time) whereas the Google maps app that is standard on an iPhone does not  It was great to have it for walking from a train stop to the location as it could track where you are and let you know if you're going the right direction (since I couldn't read Thai this was very helpful)

title: Love it
review: We Travelled from Suvarnabhoomi to Paya Thai and they charge 40 bhat per person which is Continent and easy way to reach the city

title: Great clean  and easy to take
review: The bts is a good means of transport in Bangkok especially for families It is economic and practical Inside it is hyper clean easy to take tickets

title: Easy to use!!
review: The sky train is in a central location right next to Sathorn Pier which was accessible from many ports and hotels   The sky train cost around 60p per person one way to go from one end of the track to another  Highly rate the sky train as it also has air conditioning

title: Good way to get from A 2 B.
review: It is a good source of transport if you want to beat the traffic queue Carriages were crowded and the instructions on the next station weren't great but adequate I'd prefer to go by Tuk tuk but that is quite an experience in itself

title: Easy travel
review: Easy  and cheap to get aroundClean comfortable  and on time Confusing when traveling the first time where and how to purchase the ticket

title: Cleanliness
review: The skytrains are soo clean and people are well disciplined  No loud talking No litter A nice commute from A to B

title: Getting around the city
review: I loved the BTS Super helpful mapspamphlets on the stops Fast Rushhours Affordable way to get around the city

title: Always busy and crowded at the station but it is fast moving and the BTS staff are all very helpful to direct you.

review: Fastest way to get around Bangkok though during rush hours it could get hectic The BTS can connect you to the MRT and even on the airport link going to Suvarnabhum airport

title: Makes life in bangkok easy
review: Efficient cheap easy way to travel around  Cost maximum 42 baht for any travel within city 1 station is 15 baht  Its crowded during rush hour But ppl are civilised they always queue up and dont rush

title: Easy acces, air-conditioned, regular trains, low cost
review: High capacity trains running on a well maintained and clean system Excellent security with good signage

title: Great transport
review: Used the Sky train so many times during our two night stay Easy to use and navigated our way around the city of Bangkok with ease

title: Cool down on the airconditioned train

title: Clean and Cool
review: Good train system of Thailand makes me wonder why we cannot do this in our country Use of trains makes it accessible to tourists and shoppers

title: Why taxi or tuk-tuk when the train is so efficient?
review: Apart from rush hour (when it can be very busy) the BTS Skytrain is an excellent way to get around Bangkok They run frequently are cheap clean and reliable No traffic jams

title: Very crowded and non healthy
review: This kind of transportation its not healthy and very dangerous u can't use in all the time special when the thai people coming out from the duty or in weekend and you can't using the BTS with children and older people  all the people try to pushing me in and when i am going out i did it because i need to out to my destination

title: BTS Skytrain is short trip but a lot of people in rush hour
review: in complex and traffic city BTS is a good choice to catch for direct station or near target place you want

title: Bangkok Holiday
review: Caught the skytrain several times  cheap fast efficient clean and airconditioned Can be a lot quicker point to point than cabs due to Bangkok traffic

title: Very convenient way to travel around
review: The BTS is the best way to travel around Bangkok It is cheap cleansafe comfortable and very frequent

title: Incredibly easy to use
review: Air conditioned And so easy to use Above ground so get a nice tour of the area as moving along If get off one too early there are also raised walking paths that keep you out of traffic as well Those were great as sometimes crossing the street can just be so busy Plus it's nice to view from Birdseye view the streets to get your bearings

title: Good
review: Bangkok sky train is one of the easiest and viable option to explore the city The traffic is crazy and taking the train saves a lot of time

title: Fast Rapid Transit
review: The  BTS  is  really great for getting to one destination in quick time  good  network  clean interiors and reliability are the strong points  this network is forever expanding and its easy to use too

title: Very good service

title: Easy to Use

title: Family trip

title: Great experience
review: A great service Didnt have to wait long at all between trains Very comfortable and suprisingly not too crowded either

title: Efficient
review: We went nearly everywhere by skytrain it was cheap and always fast but sometimes very busy during peak time

title: A bit if planning needed
review: The BTS is the easiest and best way to get around Bangkok considering the traffic situation in the city   The rabbit card is the only way to go  saves a tremendous amount of time and makes it so much easier   Every station  I have been to has a major design flaw   The BTS planners have never heard of traffic flow planning   Putting the cashiers right adjacent to the entry gates and then the ticket machines just opposite causes a huge coagulation of people all right in front of the turnstiles   If it was laid out linear instead  with cashier away from the main turnstiles then the ticket machines placed off to the sides on the way to the turnstiles it would stop the congestion and make it easier for people to navigate   Very poor planning  The trains are clean and cool inside   More trains are needed overall to reduce wait time and over crowding   Maybe putting in a few more escalators would be nice and having easy access to the to few elevators would also be a big improvement   Like many things in Thailand it was a great idea but fell short in the little details that would make it a much more pleasant experience

title: Clean, excellent Air conditioning, fast
review: Wow best sky train system So quick and clean Bests Bangkok traffic so you don't waste time in a cab or in a tuk tuk with no air conditioning It only costs around $150 bahts for a day pass

title: Great Transportaion
review: Used the train a few times to get back and forth Awesome Got where we needed to go quick clean and easy to use and understand

title: Clean, safe, ponctual and cheap.

title: Very good.

title: Great!
review: We used it only once to go to Lumpini Park Was very clean easy to buy tickets and get aroundWe recomended if you want to have an experience like the locals

title: Skytrain cheap and useful for airport trips or Chatuchuk Market

title: High in the Sky in Bangkok
review: So pleasant to get where you want to go (or at least closer) by just flying over the busy streets below BTS Skytrain is super modern and efficient and airconditioned What a welcome relief Travel outside rush hour and you'll even get a seat

title: Good way to get around in Bangkok for cheap
review: The BTS train is such a very economical way to get around most of Thailand for such a cheap price The train is always on time & usually runs till late night One thing for sure is that I do caution any user to be aware that the trains are usually packed most times since a lot of people do use this as a source of transportation One thing for sure is do pay attention where you are going as the train stations have multiple levels & if you don't read you'll end up lost as we did on our first try using it lol Also do pay attention for any changes that you need to make on your route as it can confuse anybody too The great thing about this source of transportation is that most signs around are in English & the majority of the workers there speak English as well in case you have any issues or problems

title: Best way to travel
review: When in Bangkok it's either a TukTuk for the experience and then the Sky train it's the easiest and fastest way to zip around the city and that's what we use most when we travel

title: Excellant train system
review: Very clean and efficient transport system for us tourists It's easy to get from one place to another without getting lost in this beautiful city

title: A great way to travel
review: This is a good way to get out of the jam and heat of the street We were in a taxi and it was caught up in the jam in Sukhumvit Decided to get out and use the trains instead Coins can be changed at the counter and tickets purchased from the machine Easy efficient and fast Trains can be very crowded during the rush hours but its cool and commuters are considerate A great way to travel

title: Cost and time effective way to get around
review: It can be crowded  It feels safe  It is easy to use to buy tickets to find your way around the platforms and the system  It's MUCH BETTER than sitting in Bangkok traffic for hours if it takes you where you want to go  Sidewalks in Bangkok are getting better so it's not so bad walking the last half mile

title: Cover most area in bkk
review: It covers most area and convenient in the train  But if you are travelling few days with moderate mobility i would recommend you to purchase rabbit card  So you can skip the double queing (for exchange coins and purchasing ticket) Especially you can't purchase 2 ticket at same time  You have to purchase one by one thus i find the queue was very long The card with cost you few bath (sorry i forgot the price) but it is effective compare wasting time

title: Fast, efficient, crowded
review: The best way to get around Reliable easy to buy tickets Expect crowds at peak times Often a nice respite from the heat of the day

title: Nothing too interesting
review: I was under the impression that this was a special thing to do but it's actually just a train It's quite similar to the Docklands Light Railway in London but it's manned where as DLR isn't  It got me from A to B with an elevated view but other than that it's nothing too interesting

title: Quick and efficient
review: Travelled on the skytrain and was slightly nervous with getting on the right one and cost etc There are a lot of information places and as long as you know where your going it's quite straight forward We put our coins in the ticket booth and were on our way It is a very cheap way to travel Well worth the experience

title: A clean and fast way in Bangkok
review: Congratulation to the public authorities and to the inhabitants of Bangkok I was impressed because it was a very clean and organized place

title: Easy in and out
review: BTS is my preferred mode of transportation It is safe clean and easy to use Ticket machine everywhere around just push the number of your final destination it tell you the cost The machine take 1 5 20 TBH All station also have ticket booth It is important to know that there is no eating and drinking inside the train otherwise they will have an announcement I love taking BTS rather than taxi

title: Clean efficient mode of transport
review: We used the BTS a lot as stayed near Sukhumvit Road so it was the most easiest way to move in Bangkok without getting stuck in Traffics or to haggle with Tuk Tuk riders on a price to pay Nice and clean trains with instructions in English and Thai language most of the stations had a safety door between the platform and train itself which opens only when train stops and its own door are open Most travelers were very courteous giving the chairs to older citizen ladies or ladies with children

title: Best mode of travel !
review: BTS Skytrain is the best mode of travel when you are in Bangkok It is convenient it is cheap it is clean and it takes you to any place in fastest possible way

title: Smooth, safe and reliable
review: Well layed out route Cheap way to get about Covers most tourist spots or within taxi reach of most Needs some getting used to but the staff is so helpful

title: First time trip
