review: We were at Siam Center and decided to take the train back to the condo we rented This was our first time taking the BTS It was a bit confusing at first in terms determining the amount we had to pay but we quickly figured it out and confirmed with the guy at the ticket booth Basically you find the stop you need to get off and there is price associated with that stop You buy the ticket for that amount We got on the Siam stop and got off at Bearing Bearing was the last stop and we thought it was going to take forever but it was about a 20 minutes ride Due to rush hour the train was VERY crowded but people made room and we just squeezed together Unlike NYC subway where you worry about some pervert trying to fondle or rub up against you there was no worry here at all People were very respectful We spent so much money on taxis and will now take the train whenever we can efficient and affordable

title: great transport
review: This is great and not expensive and you can travel straight from BKK to silom or phayathai and other areas where are alot of hotels are

title: Convenient trip
review: Very helpful and easy to understand Though the route is not covering all tourist objects and you need to have many coins of you want to buy single trip You can change it in customer service if you need the coins

title: really handy
review: great for getting around bangkokalso use it to get to there airportsaves on taxi and is quickernot getting stuck in trafficcheap as well

title: Clean and safe ride...
review: Before I ever used the BTS Skytrain one needs to know that I only had the experience of the Metro in Paris Boy I enjoyed so much riding the BTS since my first trip on it In my personal opinion I feel it safe and clean People are "normally" respectful and line up before entering the wagon and leave their seats for priority persons I say normally because there are always exception Well exception aside because it could happen anywhere the BTS is cool to ride except during rush hours where it can get pretty crowded at time especially at the following station but not limited to SIAM CHONG NONSI ASOK  The only thing I would say is annoying is the AC which is sometimes extremely cold but then it only happens when only few people are inside the wagon Not much they can do I guess since doors open every 12 minutes Besides I hope they expand their lines even more so that the traffic jam in BKK lessen and lessen and that we can travel even further without cars Last thing I hope for PLEASE create a monthly or annual card so that people who use the BTS very often can get a better price XD

title: Fastest way around Bangkok center
review: As our hotel wasn't in the heart of Bangkok we made extensive use of the BTS Skytrain The payment system is very easy to understand and if you keep lots of spare change buying a ticket takes only seconds Train have AC (which makes it a good place to be after a long walk) and are very clean considering the amount of people using them Beware that during the morning rush hour the trains can become very crowded and you just need to wait for the next one (or the next one after that)

title: The most spectacular way to avoid the traffic and move around Bangkok
review: I really had no idea of how much I would enjoy this way of moving around BKK The ticket service is very easy (the number near the name of the station is the amount of baht that you need to insert to reach that station WOW) the air conditioning is very powerful the people are very educated (stay in line) and the crossstation are very easy to understand Long story short take it

title: Best Way around Bangkok
review: This is the best way around Bangkok to get you to all the shopping and sightseeing spots Buy a Rabbit Card that is reloadable  just tap and go

title: Simple and Convinient
review: Skytrain is the easiest way to get around the central business district and out to Chatuchak market Tickets are easy to get from the automated machines but you do need to know where your stop is The machines only accept coins but you can change notes at the manned kiosk You can also get your tickets here if you're not comfortable with the automated machines Ratchatewi to Chatuchak is 22 baht I think Only thing to be aware of is the trains can get very busy at peak business hours so if possible try to stand near the doors so you can get out Also don't lose your ticket as you'll need it to exit the station at your stop

title: Cheap, cold and crowded
review: The tickets are very cheap but if you are more than 2 person usually not cheaper than going by taxi (with meter on) but it can be faster The traffic in Bangkok is quite bad lot of traffic jams but since the train goes over the roads it's not effecting the train so in rush hours it's the better choice Because of the previous reasons it can be very overcrowded It's also a good way to escape from the hot weather the airconditioning is always on extra cold so you can get refreshed during the ride  It's good if you have enough coins for the ride because most machines only accept coins and the line for changing is can be long The trains are nice clean and cold The are going very smoothly and with not too much noise

title: Singapore style MRT
review: There are 2 networks in Bangkok An above ground called BTS and the underground called MRT While the 2 are linked at certain transfer stations the ticketing is not U need to purchase a separate ticket to use for each system This is a drawback Other than that they are fast and efficient Ticket machines can accept cash and coins However the price is not cheap For a group of 4 persons it may be cheaper but slower to travel by taxi

title: Easy to use
review: If you travel with taxi  very traffic on Bangkok  roads so BTS skytrain is very easy and very fast way to take around the Bangkok city I stay in Bangkok since 2004 I use to take BTS most of my transportation

title: Travel above the masses
review: Clean efficient and frequent travel around the city My only frustration is that the airport link does not run at night and so I need to get a taxi from my late night arrivals

title: Needed
review: If you are staying anywhere outside of KSR or Chinatown you will definitely be using the Skytrain and why not It is air conditioned efficient and comfortable Tickets are bought from a vending machine taking coins only Maximum journey cost is B42 Change windows are available and now sell the tickets too which is a blessed relief If you are downtown and travelling in BKK and not using the Skytrain you are doing it all wrong

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: The trains are clean large and well run  Travelling along the BTS Skytrain only cost 50cents to just over a dollar and can take you through the heart of Bangkok quickly and cheaply  Don't bother with the Tuktuks or taxis this is the way to go

title: Very nice
review: Its  a very well maintained skytrain  My kids loved it  We travelled to thailand for the first time and and we can go bindaas on our own coz of this transport bts skytrain Very easy to go around as there are stations well placed and good connectivity

title: Convenient but needs a better ticket booking system
review: BTS is reliable and easy to use Also convenient for better transport and avoiding the surface traffic Only issue is the ticketing issue which is complicated if you have to purchase few times in a row  Weeks be good to improve this as well

title: Convenient for travel through Bangkok center
review: Lots of BTS stop in Bangkok center You can buy one day pass ticket or 1 week ticket if you need to move a lot Sometimes Thailand Ministry of Tourism offer free 1 day pass ticket for travellers just go to the office or website of Thailand Tourism in your country to see which promotion they have and find out the event in Thailand

title: great experience!!
review: The Skytrain was very good to use The ticket sales people were very helpful in ensuring we were going the right direction

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS is the best way to travel in Bangkok Bangkok has a lot of traffic jams and using the BTS will easily save you more than 20 minutes of travel time It is also cheaper than taxis The only drawback is that there is no BTS station close to the main attractions like the temples and the Grand Palace

title: Great way to go around Bangkok
review: If you want to avoid horrific traffic jam and enjoy the most of your time in Bangkok this is the way to go Clean fast with air Conditioning the best way to go around town

title: Easy to use
review: If you can use the tube in London you can use the BTS  great way to get around Bangkok The downsides are you have to buy tickets with cash and most machines only take coins or small notes Also most of the time the trains were packed and we rarely got a seat

title: Lifeline of bangkok travel
review: Bangkok had changed a lot I have been there 34 times but this was after 3 years long  The traffic situation has worsened It takes hell lot of time to go to near by location also I was at soi 11 and used to take 1 hour to go to platinum The BTS skytrain is the best time saving travel in bangkok Though it comes as much expensive when u r more then 2 persons But it saves lot and lot of your time The skytrain in bangkok is too expensive when compared to my country  But still best travel option you got Major routes you have to find space to breathe even

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: I was based in Sukhumvit and the skytrain was the quickest and easiest way to get around But tickets at the machines  get change from the booth is necessary  and off you go The carriages are quite crowded but nothing like London or Hong Kong Quick clean and easy to use Just travel above the traffic

title: Never had a single problem with the BTS
review: The BTS in Bangkok is one of the best things always functioning always arriving on time and never had any technical problems so far   The only thing to avoid is taking the BTS in the morning and the evening during rush hours

title: convenient
review: we stayed along sukhumvit and BTS was the main transportation we used during our stay very convenient and it could connect you to almost all places you'd like to visit in Bangkok we were surprised as to how local thais fall in line to get in the train very disciplined even if you go on a rush hour there will be no pushing or cutting in queue

title: Very efficient!
review: Given the fact that Bangkok traffic is quite bad the BTS Sky train is one of the better ways to get around the city  I suggest buying a refillable card so that you can add money to the card (there is a non refundable deposit) but sure beats lining up each time to buy single fares and from what I've seen most of the machine only accepts coins  So you might have to line up at the counter get change for coins then line up at the machine to buy the single fare tickets  Find a hotel that is close to a BTS station and you are set

title: Practical
review: Crowded at peak hours as to be expected in Bangkok Easy to find you're way around once in can be a challenge to get a ticket if you don't speak Thai however staff are friendly There may be long queues  frequent trains  Very budget friendly

title: Easy transport to anywhere
review: Fast clean air conditioned & cheap We stayed on river with transport to central pier then 2 mins walk up to station Very easy

title: Watch the commercials
review: I travel a lot using BTS and basically plan my whole journey according to the BTS route It is very convenient if you buy the Rabbit Card I used 300B (excluding the initiation fees) for 6 days in Bangkok It's cheaper than tuk tuk and most importantly you do not need to negotiate the price go to some tailorssouvenir shops where the tuk tuk driver will get commission from and breath in carbon monoxide emitted from the heavy vehicle along the busy bkk roads

title: BTS
review: BTS in Thailand is very easy to understand and navigate A much better option to travelling by road as the traffic is very unpredictable And definitely much cheaper and without the trouble of having to bargain for every taxituk tuk ride

title: Cheap, cheerful and easy to navigate
review: The staff on the metro are very helpful to easily confused people like me They were endlessly patient as I tried to navigate the currency and provide the right change The metro itself is well organised and easy to follow in English Best of all is the costpeanuts Far safer than a motorbike taxi quicker than a Tuck tuck and LOTS cheaper than a taxi or limousine

title: Quick and easy
review: Don't be afraid to use the BTS in Bangkok It's a simple (and air conditioned) way to get around Bangkok's legendary traffic snarls The system may take you a moment to figure out but it's quite simplechoose your destination identify the zone number attached to it push the corresponding zone button and pay the fare Most machines only take coins but it's a very common practice to ask for change at the booth The trains can be crowded but that's not unusual in any large city in the world

title: Fast ,smooth ,convinient
review: BTS on the top of the road The Best way to move in The city center BTS n MRT is different company Different ticket BTS price between 24B to 49B Prepare some coin n small bill to buy ticket Ticket only buy from machine Most people use BTS Saim to Asok is the most busy station Taxi maybe cheaper but traffic is terrible 50 50 50 50 50 50 50 words

title: cheap safe simple way to get around bkk
review: brilliant  fast reliable use it very simple to get used too i aLWAYys travel to jatujakk market and other attractions via BTS then if near get a taxi from nearest BTS station to destination

title: Ease of use
review: The Skytrain is so easy and affordable When in Bangkok opt for it than using a taxi Local commuters are also friendly when you are lost so is the staff at the train station

title: I wish my city has one
review: Definitely the cheapest safest and quickest way to move around Bangkok It takes 3 minutes to get in speed with system to start using it  Tip just go directly to ticket counter and tell thwm where do you want to go and they will give you the change and tell you which card you should buy

title: An Alternative and Fast Way of Traveling
review: Travelling from the airport to the Bangkok city centre was an amazing experience with BTS Skytrain That was first such experience so I enjoyed a lot My brother paid the fare I am not sure how much expensive he was feeling to pay

title: Easy travel around the city.
review: The Skytrain is great for getting around the city (so much easier than by road)  However it did get very full at times

title: Truly useful
review: If u want to move in Bangkok this is surely the best way to do that Traffic is unbelievable and it seems that's always the rush hour The only problem is that it doesn't serve the city centre but only the newer and modern part of the city

title: Fast,  reliable and cheap mode of transport
review: Awesome mode of transport very cheap and easy to work out where to get on and off Clean carriages which made it a pleasure to ride on Locals were very helpful to tourists who obviously knew little of the Thai language Free from being hassled by pushy taxi drivers and tuktuks  I would recommend the BTS Skytrain to my friends and family in New Zealand

title: Clean, fast and affordable
review: Never had a problem A few times there was a minor delay but other than that it was good Air conditioned clean and affordable train

title: to visit bkk
review: it was very nice and clean very safe people travelling were very cooperative puntual as far as timings were concerned

title: Rabbit Card - best way to travel on BTS
review: BTS is easy and efficient best way to travel without having to by a ticket each time  cost about 80 baht to by the rabbit card but if you have credit on there it will not expire this card is then can be loaded with cash so you can scan it in and out of the BTS without having to get a ticket each time   if you want to save some money and travel on the BTS everyday you can load this with a prepaid 15  25 trip etc and so on this then average your single trip to 30 baht which is a cheaper option if you travel more than 4 stops each time otherwise just load it up with cash amount up to 4000 baht let me know if you have questions

title: Convenient and On Time to beat the Traffic
review: BTS is Bangkoks Sky Train I stayed in Sukhumvit so my closest station was Asok From Asok you can use the Sukhumvit line to go all the way to Mo Chit for Jatujak Weekend Market You can also change to Silom line at Siam Interchange and use that to head to Saphan Thaksin to head to the river cruises on Chao Phraya Peak hours are huge rush in morning and evening through the week You can wait at the Ticket counter line to get tickets or self serve kiosks that expect exact change for chosen destination Another time saving but a little pricey option is taking a Rabbit Card which you can buy for 180 Bht With this card you can travel between the the two BTS Lines and keep topping up as and when The card cannot be used for 2 persons So a couple needs to get 2 cards and so on BTS Card is not valid for MRT trains Amazing Air Con and great connectivity with malls esp at Siam Chit Lom Stations Dont really need to return the Rabbit Card Just expire the credit and keep it handy for next trip Validity is close to 2 years Good to go to the Airport as well  if you are light on luggage

title: Convince transportation in BKK
review: We recommend to take transportation like BTS or MRT during BKK rush hour it will be a bit packed but better than park on the road all public transportation in BKK is convenience and have good access

title: BTS Skytrain Bangkok.
review: If you wish to avoid traffic and travel in comfort and affordable prices then use this Public Transport

title: Skip the traffic
review: one of the best transport option in Bangkok it saved a lot of my time and money it a big confusing for the 1st time use but after 1 trip you will find it easy to use

title: excellent to get around Bangkok
review: Air conditioned and hardly ever completely chock full (unlike the MRT at 6pm) So good for getting around to the various shopping places

title: Easy experience ,,,,,,,,,
review: Although at most times of the day this system is very busy it is very easy to use costing only pennies compared to the Â£'s  the same system would cost in the UK  Tickets are purchased from machines using coins only notes have to be changed at the kiosk We found it best to get a Rabbit card for 180 Bhat (Â£380) then just top up when needed Ours lasted for 4 days of traveling everywhere by B T S         If you miss the first train don't worry the next one will be along in about 90 seconds  We found the whole system very easy to navigate around as there are only 2 lines running either northsouthnorth or eastwesteast

title: Fast and cheap
review: I used this train a lot in Bangkok This is the fastest way to travel in Bangkok I used it also to travel to the airport but you have to take a bus from last train station

title: icy cold!
review: I was daunted by the amount of people on the train but the air conditioning kept it really cool  The BTS is always clean runs frequently and people getting on and off are orderly and courteous

title: the cashier need customer service training
review: used this for the first time I went to the cashier to buy the ticket Firstly I told the cashier that I want to go to Asok from Siam and she was saying the name of the station and produce the ticket right away Then I wanted to confirm my destination and she was quickly angry and gave me back my money to go to the machine I was shocked and ask her to produce the ticket for me but she just keep rejecting me and pointed to the machine What a customer service

title: Easy and Fast
review: BTS really help us to reach our destinations with easy efforts The route are simple to understand BTS can help us to travel  far distance in a few minute with good price

title: Fast and clean
review: Easy to get around on the train They have employees that help line up the crowds and make sure people don't jump ahead of you Air conditioned trains Perfect for summer travel

title: Easy & clean
review: The sky train is the easiest way to get to certain destinations in Bangkok Super clean trains We were able to get to the weekend market and mall from this train by ourselves just by reading the map Also the train is cheap and convenient

title: Day time only
review: Use this sky train in the day time unless you really enjoy sitting in trafffic for hoursNoght time use taxi or a tuk tuk if you are brave they are a little crazy

title: Cheap and Convenience
review: Sky Train or BTS is a convenient way to get around BangkokThe trains and stations are extremely clean and there are a variety of tickets passes that you can buy just look at the link below There is one subway line two skytrain lines and a branch that takes you to Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: Without this, Bangkok would be impossible!
review: It clean airconditioned reliable safe fast easy to navigate convenient & frequent stops in even the most farflung parts of the city plus relatively cheap given you don't have to sit in traffic in a taxi with a ticking meter What more can I say It does get very busy at commute times & it's popular at the weekend (obviously) so be prepared for a bit of a squeeze at those times I would never get in a taxi in central Bangkok again

title: What a way to go.
review: Rapid transit at its best Fast frequent trains easy to ticket yourself It makes easy access to different hub areas of the city  Inexpensive

title: Excellent
review: Great experience It'll take you all across Bangkok in speed and comfort and safety cheaply without hassle Air conditioned cars and wonderfully regular

title: Top Notch Metro System
review: Really top notch metro system One of the best in the world It is really fun as a tourist to ride the train and see the city at the same time

title: Awesome
review: Excellent experience using this Very user friendly When travelling alone its perfect But seems expensive with three or more people Strangely the ticket machines dont accept notes and inly coins And the charges are like 42 and 37 Very strange way of using the machine Almost always had to go to the ticket vendor But its clean and people courteous Wait in lines to get in the train High regards Well done bangkok

title: Convenient, fast and avoids BKK traffic!
review: Ideal way to move around the city Ticket machines can get a bit crowded and most machines only take coins so keep those coins If you're staying long consider dayweek tickets

title: Good mode of transportation
review: BTS is a good mode of transportation They should have tourist cards Buying one way tickets or day pass are the only options available Ticket machines should also accept currency notes It's difficult to carry coins However you can get coins ay the counter Coins slows down the process Apart from this it is fund for kids Very crowded which shows it is the necessity for a city like Bangkok We loved it

title: efficiÃ«nt
review: The Bangkok BTS sky train is a perfect way to go quickly from A to B No traffic jam CheapSafe During peak hours a bit uncomfortable but acceptable

title: Easy!
review: I used the skytrain a lot and found it easy and convenient Best to used slightly off peak times for comfort

title: Best way to beat jam if you travel alone in Bangkok
review: BTS is the best way to stay away from jam in Bangkok if you are traveling in the town during peak hour But it is consider slightly expensive comparing to those in other region in ASEAN except Singapore

title: Bangkok is a REALLY big city, so do yourself a favor and take the SkyTrain
review: I'm used to San Francisco that is less than 47 sq miles compared to Bangkok's 606 sqmiles Our BART pales in comparison to the SkyTrain  STrain is fairly quiet clean inexpensive has frequent trains easy to read and many maps of lines easy to figure out because there are only two lines I liked the extra security upon entrance where bags are checked  Paris France  are you reading this  Cons may be  no station bathrooms elevatorsescalators and there are many Bangkok areas not served by SkyTrain

title: Easy but expensive!
review: Please track your way carefully In most of the times taxi was less expensive especially with a party of 3 to 4  The train (BTS) can also be very crowdy & very cold  Check also the connections with the Metro (subway)

title: Easy to get around but crowded!
review: Used the Skytrain extensively Handy to get around clean quick  The station entrances get crowded easily as do the trains Also hard to know how much to pay as the ticket machines don't have destinations just prices

title: Train
review: Cheap way to travel but does get very busy at times Good modern commuter train that cuts out the hassle of the gridlock traffic

title: Quickest way to get through town.
review: This is worth the price  It is crowded and people don't care if you are carrying small children or elderly seats are first come first serve however it beats the hell out of sitting in the paralyzing traffic while your tuk tuk or taxi fare slowly crawls higher and you breath in exhaust  Quick  Easy  Clean

title: Good service
review: Even if you don't speak thai it's simple to figure out It has ac & it's very fast There's always a train behind the last

title: Comfortable and cheap
review: Easy and fast way around in bangkok Having studied in London i am amazed how well the Thai public transport as MRT and BTS is compared to the European subway

title: the best way to get round Bangkok
review: Super efficient transport if where you want to go is on the train line It is clean and cheap and you dont have the hassle of sitting in traffic in a taxi

title: Good
review: Crowded in rush hour but a good way to get around Avoid if possible unless you want to get up close and personal

title: Smart transportation
review: When in Bangkok u must use BTS Skytrain because its more effective transportation than taxi No Trraffice Jam and also no need to wait long

title: fast and easy
review: buying tickets is easy  you just choose the station you need to go on the monitor  and put some coins inside the machine On some station security asked us to open for check our backpacks  they all were very gentle  All the carriages are well airconditioned you almost freeze when you get inside ) and we have never waited more than 45 minutes to take the train And please  if you ask somebody the direction where to go to take the train  dont call it subway o tube o metro  just ask for BTS Thai people understand it better

title: Best way to the city from the aurport
review: Comfortable cheap clean quiet air conditioned route from airport to city Only took about 30 minutes and puts you in the heart of the city 20 minutes 100bht from Phaya Thai station to Khao San Road by taxi

title: Great way to avoid traffic and stay cool
review: google BTS Bangkok and use the online map to plan your trips around the city The BTS is a clean and efficient way to get arrow and it saves you time by avoiding the traffic Also keeps you out of any taxi scams and etc Try and avoid the BTS during work rush hours (800930am & 530700pm) as it gets very crowded

title: The quickest way to get around Bangkok
review: For the money this is by far the best way to get around Bangkok The train is cooled perfectly and its faster than any roadbased transport

title: Easy way to travel around Bangkok
review: Used the BTS after a few days using taxis Quick air conditioned trains   Used them late into the evening and felt safe all the time

title: Excellent way to travel in Bangkok
review: Most of the tourist location  attraction are connected via the BTS It's fast safe clean and awesome aircond to beat the heat after a whole day of walking

title: Bts skytrain
review: Great way to get around Bangkok If staying a while the multi ride packages are good value Easy to change trains and to metro at certain stations

title: Quick and easy travel around parts of Bangkok
review: Using the BTS is relatively straight forward You need to know which station you're in which station you're going to and whether you need a single or return ticket Then you need coins If you only have notes go to the station counter and they will change your notes for coins Once you have coins return to the automated ticket dispenser press the buttons for the station and type of ticket and insert the coins

title: Great way to get around
review: Quick comfortable and easy to get around especially between the shopping centres  We used it often buying day passes and then giving the passes to locals when we no longer needed them

title: super clean and safe.
review: spacious and very accessible see an interesting take on the city above it all between buildings Hold your things close though Bangkok is known for pickpockets but like anywhere be aware

title: Very efficient n clean
review: BTS is a very convenient and cheap way to get around BKK The cabins are very clean but there should be more booths to sell the onetime tickets

title: This is good for traveller, if you have idea of the city you can go first and cheap way  with nice scenery.
review: I had travel of this train for saving time some times I saw there are many rush in the roadbut in the sky train I thinking I am flying

title: Convenient way to travel
review: Easy to move around We had one full day during the end of our Thailand Trip and Skytrain was quiet convenient and cost effective to  between Airport and central Bangkok

title: Quick, comfortable way to get around
review: We took the Skytrain from the Chatuchak market towards downtown as an alternative to the buses The trains are new airconditioned and a pleasure to ride You'll pay a bit more than you would on the buses (~45 bhat vs ~5 bhat) depending on the distance of your trip but we enjoyed the ride and it's a great way to get out of the heat for a bit

title: Well it depends
review: Although bts Sky train is very convenient but to take it or not is depends on how big is the group you travel with For instance I traveled together with 2 of my friends we took bts to rachada from chit lom station It costs us about 190 baht (if I'm not mistaken) We took a taxi back to chit lom from rachada is also about that costs Meaning if u travel with more people taking a cab might be cheaper than taking bts

title: Very effuciebt
review: Very efficient on time clean and spacious If the train was too full it wasn't long until the next one came (about 5 mins) Also easy to use for a none local

title: Really efficient and reliable
review: A much cheaper alternative than taxis for longer distance as the traffic is horrible The train rides are smooth and there are securities stationed at the gantries as well

title: Safe, clean, cheap and has air con
review: As a first time visitor to Bangkok I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it is to get around safely on the skytrain While it can be busy at peak times (especially if you have luggage) it is easy to find your way around and the locals are very curtious and polite to tourists If only public transport everywhere was as good as this

title: Easy, safe and clean
review: Used the skytrain on our first day It was easy to find and to navigate Lots of fun traveling with the locals We felt comfortable and safe

title: A handy rail system but very poor signage
review: The BTS Skyrail expand across the city of Bangkok and it offers well a condition carriages in a very humid climate The stations manned and there is security guard present and the trains run regularly  The trains are relatively cheap however there is little or very poor signage with no information available to tourists  If you decide to take the BTS to the airport from Sukhumvit you need to have plenty of time on your hands and you will need to change trains twice so this can be quite inconvenient if you have a lot of luggage and gifts I would not recommend this is an option  Traveling to the Airport using the BTS there is no signage at all not even a plane symbol  You need to ask the station staff and they'll give you brief directions  There is no information and even when purchasing the ticket no one bothers to tell you that you need to purchase a nother ticket after changing trying to get on to the the airport link  If you can read Thai the service would probably put a few or no problems but as an Englishspeaking terrorist it could provide and not me and certainly wouldn't be something you wanted to use if you were in a hurry

title: "Very crowded during peak hours - Monday to Friday"
review: Excellent means of easily moving around BKK Announcements are unfortunately in Thai The daypass at THB 140 is very handy to avoid long cues at their vending machines and ticket counters  especially heading to Mo Chit (Chat U Chat Weekend Market) Not suitable for wheel chair users since elevators either don't exist and when they doThey're out of order

title: BTS skytrain
review: Used the BTS skytrain a few times Faster then taxis as traffic gets quite bad in Bangkok There are different types of tickets available Tickets are priced based on distance on the train Prices are very reasonable compared to London

title: Useful and a great break from the heat
review: The sky trains are so convenient and they have air con and so it's a welcome break from the heat of the city The cueing system is brilliant and people wait for you to get off before you get on It does get fairly crowded though but it's no different to the London Underground really

title: Super easy to navigate
review: It was the only mode of transport I took while in Bangkok  clean airconditioned fast and reliable just like public transport should be The trains were very frequent and the map was very easy to follow Get a day pass and explore the whole city

title: Convenient
review: We took this everyday in our trip it links to many destinations like the siam center JJ market It is not expensive as well

title: Fast Forward
review: Skytrains are the best way travel fast You can avoid jams and stuffs and its cheap as well You can start your skytrain journey right from the BKK Airport

title: Very good
review: The BTS SKYTRAIN is a very convenient mode of transport in Bangkok as you don't get stuck in the traffic It goes to all the famous Malls and locations It is clean nd very secure way of transport

title: the best way to get around in Bangkok
review: Traffic in Bangkok is a nightmare  morning noon and night  thank heavens for the Skytrain  For about 10 Bht (depending on where you are going) the clean quick air conditioned Skytrain will whisk you to your destination in central Bangkok  Highly recommended

title: Great service
review: The BTS is a great service however I would look upon YouTube on how to buy a ticket from the vending machine the MRT is a bit different so look it up to Best to have coins on you when buying a ticket

title: A blessing
review: A great way to travel in the city which is known for its ever present traffic jamsSuper clean and cool

title: Packed
review: The sky train has to be experienced if in Bangkok It is fast cheap but crowded in peak times We waited for 5 trains before we got on one that wasn't to crowded still no seat standing only at 7pm other times are ok You don't wait long between trains 3 or 4 minutes maybe But it's quicker than taxi or tuk tuk in the bangkok traffic

title: Cheap and easy to get around.
review: Easily the most convenient way to get around Bangkok The airconditioning on hot days is an added bonus too

title: Great way to get around
review: We really enjoyed using the sky train to get to and from the airport If is convenient It can get very packed but you should always give seating preference to monks and elderly Also very affordable form of transport and not traffic related so you can be guaranteed to be ontime

title: Good service
review: A great way to get around central Bangkok especially if your hotel is away from the centre of Bangkok

title: Convenient travel in busy city
review: I take the BTS often to save time and get across town During rush hours travel is slow BTS makes living in Bangkok tolerable Its a hassle free way to travel to most places however in the mornings its difficult to get aboard This is especially true for baby strollers and largesized people and big groups I have waited for four trains before getting on during busy times (evenings and mornings) Weekends are easy traveling The BTS closes at midnight 12AM I really like the BTS but its sort of rickety and if you don't hold on to a strap you will fall over and the BTS drivers hit the brakes very hard It makes me think they are always training someone new to drive the train and I have seen the drivers playing on their phones more than a few times

title: Easy way to get around
review: Don't be scared of using the skytrain it's very convenient to get around and staff and fellow passengers are very helpful It is easy to use and find out where you have to get off Use the ticket counter if you are unsure

title: Cheap helpful way to travel
review: Because everything's in English including the ticket machine and announcements it's a cheap and easy way to travel  Definitely worth it over taxis especially during rush hour

title: Best way
review: best transportation way to be around the shopping district so you can be in Central central world MBK and Siam pargon within 7 minutes

title: Busy but fast mode of transport in the city
review: The city sky train can get very crowded at peak hour so I recommend travel outside this time The trains do run every few minutes though you may have to wait to squeeze in the doors in a rush There are not many seats so be prepared to stand in a crowd

title: Always clean and cool!
review: The BTS is convenient and super easy to use  Make sure to get coins as it does not take paper money  Also a good tip to avoid the lines if you are traveling round trip on the BTS purchase your 2 tickets passes on your initial trip so you avoid the lines on the way home

title: Best bet for solo traveler
review: I take the BTS all the time to the week end market It's great for long distances when you travel solo It might make more sense to take a metered cab if there are 3 of you Stations are spotless and trains come all the time

title: Miss the traffic
review: A really pleasant and easy way to negotiate Bangkok Air conditioned trains and easy to understand route planners Speed along and watch the traffic at a standstill below The only negative not every station has an escalator or lift so for the less able or people with lots of luggage not so good

title: Public Transport
review: Fast Clean Cheap Safe but stop working to erleay in the night   Simply the transport no 1 in BKK  followed by MRT

title: Fast and cheap
review: It's cheaper and fastest mode to travel around Bangkok compare to taxi due to jam you can get the map from the counter for the station details

title: Wonderful for getting around Bangkok, and for travel to the airport.
review: Wonderful for getting around Bangkok and for travel to the airport I have used this service for many years

title: A visit to Bkk
review: Great transport system in Bkk which now links the BTS to the Airport at a very affordable rate and hassle free of Taxi's   Runs like clockwork and very easy to use

title: Travel was simple using public transport
review: Buying the tickets is a bit confusing as you have to go to the cashier and get change for the ticket machine even though they could sometimes give you a ticket

title: Clean and easy
review: After Singapore and the traffic in Bangkok we didn't expect such a clean and quiet well organised subway system

title: Super efficient
review: Was most impressed by the very efficient punctual and clean service Uk transport could do with taking a leaf out of their book

title: Best Transportation
review: Best Transportation in Bangkok Downtown area Modern overground transportation in the city Airco is very cold which can be a negative point in warm seasons Each few minutes a train and a clear to understand system in all directions Very cheap

title: Great way to get around
review: The BTS Skytrain is one of the best ways to get around Bangkok its cheap and very easy to navigate It also has air con which makes the trip even more worth it

title: Getting around Bangkok.
review: Easy to work out and simple to travel around Have plenty of change Great aircon for a break from the heat Very cheap method of travel REMEMBER always walk or stand on the right of stairs or escolators

title: Easy
review: Very straight forward to use and the ticket office is helpful However if you can do the tube you can do the skytrain

title: Forget the notorious Bangkok traffic jam
review: If you plan to visit a location close to any skytrain station your first choice should be this fast and reliable public transport system It almost certainly brings you to your destination faster than any taxi or motorbike and the train is airconditioned

title: The way to travel in Bangkok
review: Take the BTS skytrain and leave the terrible Bangkok traffic behind It is easy to buy tickets and to get around the city Cheap transportation but efficient clean and you don't have to wait more than about three minutes between trains Highly recommended

title: Fast and very efficient
review: Tuk tuks are fun are a fun way to get around  However for comfort and speed nothing beats the BTS  Get a travel card if you intend to be in BKK for two or more days   Tap on and off love it

title: Very good and efficient
review: Great way to travel around Bangkok Easy to navigate once you get your head around it clean & efficient Felt safe even when travelling peak hour

title: Really easy to use
review: I can only recomend that you buy a card and deposit somemoney so that you can move easily around bangkok  It is very easy and then you van skip the que

title: Confortable, easy to use and clean
review: BTS is very easy to use very clean place I adevice this mode of transportation because some connection with bus ligne

title: Not too expensive and easier than a Tuk Tuk
review: After a 4 day business trip using the Sky Train is a pc of cake The people are freindly and helpful and the train is very reasonably priced

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Smooth cool ride and its the best way to get from A to B in Bangkok Can be a littlebit crowded during the rush hours in the morning and evening but still the best and fastes way to get around

title: It is a great way to move around the city
review: It is a great way to move around the city   can be crowed in the morning between 730 and 9 and in the afternoon 400 to 600   it is clean airconditioned  not to expensive  all in all a good value

title: Lifeline
review: Great connectivity between key points of the city Unlike Singapore It's a bit difficult to understand at first but once you get a hang of how to commute it's pretty cool

title: Fast and efficient
review: A great way to get around the city quickly use in conjunction with motorcycle taxis taxis and the MRT

title: Skytrain
review: While in Bangkok I would recommend using skytrain it is cheap and reliable Just use skytrain It saves time because if you have been there the traffic is really bad

title: Good Option at Off Peak times
review: Within the plenty options available for transport the BTS is my preferred method   The timings of the trains is so frequent that I have never studied the timetable they just come every few minutes The stations are clear and well signed   The coverage is very good however it is a bit of a hassle to change trains as there are just few intersecting stations   If morning or evening rush hour comes the BTS becomes very very crowded People follow the lines and there are screens to entertain you but at times it is more convenient to take a taxi and stand in traffic then literally stand all the way to your destination   Definitive get a BTS top up card and use this system whenever you can it's reliable cheap fast and convenient  if you avoid the peak times

title: Great way to beat peak hours jam!
review: BTS & MRT are wonderful mode of transportation in BKK It is easy and convenient with good instructions and signages

title: Cheap & Comfortable transport
review: Used the Skytrain to travel from my hotel to the local malls The trains are quite cheap and are more or less on time Its a comfortable alternate to taxis which can be always held up in traffic Stations though are quite high above the road and not all access have escalators and you may have to walk across streets to get to an escalator to the top

title: So easy to use!
review: Super fast and easy way to get around Bangkok A lot quicker and cheaper than taxi's also really clean and comfortable

title: Busy at rush hours
review: It is the most convenient choice to traveling in bkk the fare is reasonable if you take a long way   Just suggest to avoid the rush hour in morning and early evening time

title: Seems to be confusing signs and direction also i believe its expensive
review: We tried to ride the BTS train from the sky bayokie hotel to Chinatown we had alot of walk before we arrived in the station the attendants does not understand where are we going since we are asking for directions lastly the price that we have paid is double that we took taxi ride  I suggest if you are 4 in the group better to ride a taxi since its more cheaper just insist to their meter

title: Recomended
review: Better than taxi  more faster and no traffic   Best way for tranportation and not expensive  Must use if u planing to visit bangkok

title: Overpriced , cold , no space but if you have no time just the best way to travel in Bangkok
review: On the rush hour from 600 to 900 and 1600 to 2000 there is no space for tourists with all there packs but still one of the fastes ways to travel in the City Recomed the preload rabbit card  so you dont have to loss much time to buy your ticket

title: Easy way to avoid Traffic in Bangkok
review: For anyone who can drive or can not and to avoid the Crowded Vehicles on Bangkok's streets especially on the rush hours Sky train or BTS can take you to the destination very quickly and cheaper Also some Sky Train stations are connected with another transport system SuBWAY or MRT or Airport Link such as BTS Saladaeng linked to MRT Silom (before Dusit Thani Hotel on Silom Road) or BTS Asoke linked to MRT Sukhumvit (near the Terminal One SC) and BTS Ratchathewi (à¸£à¸²à¸à¹à¸à¸§à¸µ) linked to AIRPORT LINK  BTS ChongNonSi is the only Station linking to the Rapid Bus or BRT The routes of present Sky Train are North (Siam to Mo Chit)  South (Siam to Bang Wa à¸à¸²à¸à¸«à¸§à¹à¸²) and East (Siam to Bearing à¹à¸à¸£à¸´à¹à¸)  South (Siam to National Stadium very short distance) Getting on the Sky Train with BTS Card can be bought from the Counter at BTS Station or at the Kiosk There are 2 types of BTS Card  One Day Pass or PrePaid Card The latter one begins from 200 Bht (50 Bht for the card deposit) then filling 100 Bht or more The prepaid card will be expired within 5 years  Standing or Sitting on BTS is good experience to tour around Bangkok and crossing Chao Praya River from BTS Taksin to the opposite side of the river and BTS Bang Wa is the last station at present  Next 510 years the Sky Train will be expanded to more routes to reach people living at Suburban of Bangkok or nearby cities such as Pathum thani à¸à¸à¸à¸¸à¸¡à¸à¸²à¸à¸µ or Nonthaburi à¸à¸à¸à¸à¸à¸¸à¸£à¸µ

title: It's a means of transport...and cooling!
review: The Skytrain in Bangkok known as the BTS is a great way to get around town Unless you're willing to take a motorcycle taxi (with the attendant risks) BTS is really the fastest way to get from one place to another A good combo is to take the BTS to as near as you can get to a place you're going and then walk or take a taxi from there The cost is minimal and you get where you're going fast An added bonus is the air conditioning which is really strongvery nice if you're just coming out of the Bangkok heat   The BTS is matched with the underground train the MRT and they meet relatively closely at several points including an almost direct transfer at Asok BTSSukhumvit MRT One down side of the BTS is that it is very popular and can often be quite crowded Interestingly as some forms of public transportation in Bangkok are very low cost or free like the red buses this means that taking BTS is something of a higher class activity In Bangkok the upper set takes the BTS if it wants to not sit in traffic especially the younger crowd who don't have the ability to drive as yet You'll also notice that there are comparatively a lot of foreigners taking the BTS There are a lot of languages being spoken in Bangkok's most famous airconditioning location  BTS is not undergoing a massive expansion I believe parts of this are due to open in 2017 with the whole system expanded by something like 2020 This includes lines that go into the main royal areas of Bangkok Chinatown and include a loop through the west side of the Chao Phraya River a very little known part of Bangkok aside from Wat Arun which is currently quite difficult to get to This expansion will make the BTS a real force for public transport across the city akin in some ways to the Underground in London MRT in Singapore etc Suffice it to say that when the BTS expansion opens Bangkok will be an even better place to visit that it already is

title: Quick, Easy and Convenient around downtown Bangkok
review: We use the BTS to quickly get around the Ratchaprasong area  from Siam to Asok or Chong Nonsi for example but they go well beyond the downtown area  The trains come often and are always very clean with very strong air conditioning  During heavy commute times it can be crowded but you can always catch the next train which will come fairly soon  usually within 10 minutes or so  We also purchase rabbit cards and load these up with Baht to use at the entrances to avoid waiting in any lines  Overall a very quick and efficient way to get around  especially during rush hour

title: bts in bkk so clean and perfect
review: if you want to go somewhere  take the bts always on time  compare to the traffic under the train u will be on time for sure

title: best way to travel in downtown
review: traveling in bangkok can be hectic dur to traffic but thanx to BTS sky train we can travel much faster it's fast and reliable (hust try to avoid peak times as there is no space to stand  well no place to enter)

title: Good choice to avoid traffic!!
review: BTS Skytrain is the best way to avoid traffic in BKK Its destinations are in the heart of shopping center and business area Cheap and quick

title: Easy to Use
review: This form of transport is great in getting around Bangkok Once you have your BTS Card loaded with Thai Bart your away Can take a little while to figure out which direction to go but once you get used to it it is the best watch for interchange with the underground trains for even more flexibility

title: Very helpful mode of transportation
review: Beating the rush hour traffic in Bangkok the sky train is a the best option Tickets are available on vending machines though you will also fall on a very long que during weekends and rush hours

title: Good Transportation
review: It's really comfy and save a lot of time to travel by BTS around Bangkok than using a car or taxi from one destination to another  You can reach many shopping places around the route line too

title: Super Convenient
review: Get around Bangkok quick and inexpensively on the BTS Only problem with the BTS is the midnight shutoff keep the trains moving People want to stay out late on vacation Get a multiple trip pass save some baht

title: Quick and productive
review: When you use the skytrain you can overfly the havy traffic Only in the rushers there are a lot of travelers in the train and sometimes you have to wait for the next train for about 34 minutes

title: Good reliable transportation in Bangkok
review: If you can plan your trip within Bangkok metro area you should plan on using BTS Skytrain  Can get crowed during rush hours especially at Siam Station

title: Decent
review: It's right up there  with other sky trains across the world  I was told to be careful of the peddlers and money snatchers  but it was one of the safest journeys I hv ever had   and not just once but many times

title: Regular BTS traveler
review: The sky train or BTS is excellent if you happen to be going some where near the line  The problem is that there are only a few lines and it may be your destination is nowhere near where the BTS travels  It can be cold on the BTS if it is not filled to capacity  Be prepared for that  Also rush hour gets quite packed and you may need to stand  If so hold on tight

title: A great way to get around Bangkok with pot the traffic
review: BTS is great especialy at rush hour times which in Bangkok can be most of the day until around 8 9 o clock in the eveningThe system works well and its clean and easy to use

title: Great for commuting around the city
review: you can connect to all the places of interest by BTS around the city and saves your traveling cost and saves your time for not being stuck in the traffic

title: The intelligent way to get around Bangkok
review: Unless you're fullon stupid this is an extremely simple and cheap way to move around the capital city Of course you might be too uptight and posh and think your toilet smells like roses and all that but really so long as you can read you can use this system

title: Best Form of Transport in Bangkok
review: Fast effective and airconned best way to travel in Bangkok Not expanding routes across the city People complain that Thai ingenuity is not great but this system far outstrips the trains in Paris Melbourne Sydney and London When in Bangkok make a point of taking this form of transport over any road  transport Taxis are unreliable and less safe

title: Very tourist friendly.
review: I enjoyed riding the train because they made it a point to have the PA system speak in english In other countries they would not have english and you are forced to listen very carefully the entire time to hear if you are already at your station

title: Gets you almost everywhere.
review: This public transportation is amazing and inexpensive Buy the day pass It can take you to most places in Bangkok

title: Trains
review: Easy to use and easy access to most popular places in Bangkok Clean and cool subway cart  Cost effective therefore reaching places faster than taxi due to much traffic in Bangkok

title: Clean and Efficient
review: A great way to see the "touristy" areas of Bangkok Cheap efficient and very simple to get around if you are a nonThai speaker

title: State of the art clean and efficient ravel
review: Best way to travel in Bangkok Air conditioned with map displays on LCD screeds easily understood announcements in English and Thai

title: Clean,fast mode
review: Network is not wide and doesn't reach tourist spots But good to reach areas inside city  Fast  clean

title: Easy to get around
review: So easy  to get around on the sky train if you havent got a lot of luggage its a lot cheaper than taxi I think it is about 70 Thai bht and only takes 20 min from the airport to the centre of Bangkok and if you are already in the city it is so much cheaper than taxi and a lot faster and the BTS will not rip you off

title: Convenience and air conditioning!
review: Why walk when you can sky train 140baht gets you a day pass  sure as heck beats walking in the heat Use this when visiting Bangkok

title: Most easy and confertable ride to meet all ends
review: Use it at evenings blindly Coz we had been stuck at traffic a lot of time and then jus dropped from taxi and took the BTS always reliable and fast  Never fails to impress However it is not at all stroller and wheelchair friendly it has huge stairs to walk normally as it is an overhead metro  Bts skytrain helped us to DIY the temple and palace tour Which saved us a fortune

title: Simple, Easy, Cheap!
review: Best way to travel around Bangkok is the BTS  Its cheap clean efficient  Simple to use just look at the map and the station you want to travel to it will show you a number that is the cost on Baht for you to get there    Plan ahead so you know what station you want to get off at for the sites or activities you want to do  The Siam station is the main interchange for the two lines  Also Siam Paragon Mall is at the Siam Station great for shopping lunch movies etc

title: Awesome sky train
review: This is a great sky train It has stops all around important areas of Bangkok I like how it goes from the south bus terminal to the west bus terminal Security is pretty tight so be prepared to open your bag when you travel Get the yellow card because that's an awesome deal and it lasts for 12 years even without using it I've had my same card for about 3 years now The trains are clean and the stations are clean and often offer delicious things for sale at the various stores My favorite is getting an iced coffee after getting off the train

title: Best trains system
review: Only way to travel in Bangkok as the traffic is horrendous excellent way to get around all day ticket is very cheap you can see a lot of Bangkok by going by a train

title: Overhead rail service
review: A good popular overhead rail service although not very friendly if you are handicapped elderly or travelling with young children as most stations are only equipped with up escalators in limited locations   Linking travel on different lines can be inconvenirnt Unfortunately there is also no linked ticketing system with the underground rail service

title: Always crowded
review: The fare is relatively not cheap and always crowded Some people always push you in even the train is full If you take it with children then should protect them carefully Besides hard to buy tickets you need to buy one ticket each time and with coins

title: Easy
review: Easy to get around and inexpensive using the BTS and MRT can avoid traffic jams and get around most areas of Bangkok easily between 6am and midnight

title: easy and good choice to travel around downton
review: you can travel to most of the popular locations via BTS with reasonable price airconditioning is quite strong

title: To Busy
review: one of the main points of Bangkok is a good train service wail there are two main BTS line are ok the trains are far to small and to long apart any time of the day wail the platform could take a much larger train for some reason they keep small trains lets hope one day they will get better and more mondern trains in Bangkok

title: Easy way of getting round!
review: Easy to use machines and the trains come every few minutes Not too busy and air conditioned You will pay no more than 50bht to go anywhere so is also really cheap Use this option when there's a sky train station near by the attraction you're visiting

title: Efficient way for traveling
review: This is the most efficient way for traveling around Bangkok They have plenty of stations you can access elevators for wheelchairs There are stations without elevators but they will have escalators

title: Great Service
review: The skytrain was so easy to use and cheap A great asset for Bangkok and an easy way for tourist and locals to get around the city The trains were all very clean and always on time with no waiting

title: Fantastic service!
review: The last time I had visited Thailand was 19 years earlier The Bangkok traffic was unbelievably appalling then and is actually a little bit better now I can see why The BTS Skytrain service is top class and extremely efficient I think more places (cities) should take notice and use this as an example of effective people transference without occupying more of the valuable land footprint Its positioning directly above Sukhumvit Road is perfect and sensible Well done Bangkok planners

title: One of the best Transport Ways to use
review: It is clean and Cold in every Train It is also very Cheap and fast And the Most important is that you will Understand the Underground and skytrain plan very fast It isnt so complicat like Tokyo or Berlin

title: Great for getting around
review: Bangkok is such a sprawled out city this is a great way to cover a lot of distance  Trains are spotless and was never late during our stay

title: Makes Travel In Bangkok So Much Easier
review: I am a regular business visitor to Bangkok and use the BTS extensively It is amazing and has enabled me to schedule more meetings in a day and makes getting around much less of a hassle than it used to be

title: Cheap and convinient!!
review: I used the skytrain to explore alot of bangkok It is really cheap and goes to alot of different places The trains arrive frequently so there is a very short waiting time The cabins are also air conditioned wich is nice in the bangkok heat I would prefere to use the skytrain rather than taxis wich want to rip you off all the time unless you take the time to find one that actualy uses the meter The sky train is really easy to use and i would reccomed to anyone

title: Easy Transportation, but Crowded
review: Unsurprisingly this is a very easy mode of transportation to get around Bangkok However do not be surprised that it is incredibly crowded Trains will get packed like sardines and your personal space will be invaded from start to finish It is high speed and would definitely recommend it to anyone needing to get around in a cheap and reliable way I did not see to many workers from the rail service so you may not get guidance help unless you already know where you are going

title: Very Tourist Friendly Public Transportation
review: From buying tickets to navigating around the city this is the way to get around  Clean and safe and the trains are air conditioned  If you'll be getting off & on get a Day Pass at the manned counter or even a Rabbit Pass which is reloadable (like a debit card)

title: Good system
review: The bkk mrt system works as well as many other mrt in the region taipei Kaoshiung hong kong singapore kuala lumpur Shanghai in fact there are many things that make them more alike than different The system is convenient & efficient the signs in thai & english every station is announced & diplayed on tv screens inside the metro Avoid rush hours

title: Easier to use than expected
review: My first experience was actually from one end of a lone to the other Because of that it was easy to get a seat It did rapidly fill though It is convenient to get around the city by as it misses out all those potential traffic jams Cost is ok Not as cheap as some but much cheaper than London for instance If staying for a longer period of time a rabbit card is useful to beat the queues for tickets

title: Good experience
review: Very clean On time A cheap alternative to travel to  from Bangkok airport Felt safe with no concerns

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok (BTS Skytrain)
review: BTS Skytrain provides informative and easy to use services Easy to understand Maps and helpful staff at stations makes it a good choice for tourists

title: Great, but not an attraction
review: Loved the airconditioned smooth running of the sky train Nice and cheap although not ideally setup for getting you from tourist spot to tourist spot so you may not want to get a day travel card as you probably will only use it once or twice a day

title: Great mode of transport given the never ending traffic jams in Bkk
review: Travelled quite a bit and even used it to go 34 of the way to IKEA store in Bangla  quite a distance from the city It is definitely the easiest comfortable and most convenient when you look at the traffic jams in Bangkok A big up to BTS and especially recommended if you are doing the hops around Sukhumvit district

title: All around Bangkok
review: We look the BTS everyday as it was the best value for getting around Bangkok during our visit It was clean cheap and quick The only down side is that no one moves when trying to get on or off the train but I guess this happens everywhere However felt as though this was worse in Bangkok

title: Convenient
review: I love the BTS It get's you to the place you want to go fast convenient and cheap The only downside is that you need different cards for the different types of public transport

title: Sky train boon in bangkok
review: the traffic in Bangkok is really bad and you can be stuck for hours without even moving an inch the sky train is quick economical and clean means to travel

title: Good way to get around
review: Nice way to get around Trains are packed at peakhour times so best to avoid then if possible Metre taxis are also a cheap way to get around town

title: Bangkok has out grown its transport system
review: The BTS Skytrain was a great concept Its a good and quick way to get around Bangkok however my experience this trip was that it just can't cope with the numbers If you don't mind getting crushed it is stll good but avoid taking small children andor baggage Unfortunately the alternatives are any better

title: Easy way to travel in Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain is easy to take and a great transport when travelling to Bangkok During our 4day stay at BKKthis has been our mode of transport apart from taxi and trying out "TukTuk"We have not tried riding the bus because in most areas the traffic jam is quite bad that's why it is recommended to use BTS During our stay we did not buy the BTS card thinking that we will not really take the train that oftenbut it ended up that we did use this in almost all our trips within the city I would highly recommend that you just buy the card (around 180BAHT with 100BAHT to use) and you can just top up the value instead of paying per rideThey do have some top up machines as well as the pay per ride kiosk you just need to make sure you have some coins otherwise you can always have it changed in the BTS counter What I admire most upon taking BTS is that Thai's do follow the que and no one would cut through just to go in Even if the que is long during peak hours the flow is quite smooth and fast It's really a convenient way of going around BKK

title: Most efficient way to get around Bangkok
review: It is Easy to get around via BTS in Bangkok whether on business or on holidays  It is Convenient as all banks major offices shops and Malls are within reach You can say Bye bye to traffic jam Therefore no excuse for being late for appointments   It is Clean and pleasant to ride on It is Reliableso far so good And most of all it is Safe

title: Beat Bangkok Traffic
review: BTS Skytrain is the best way to beat Bangkok Traffic Try to take a hotel near one of the BTS Skytrain Stations and you get connected to most parts of Bangkok Bangkok generally has heavy traffic & Taxi Drivers generally ask their own price to go to any destination and Skytrain is the solution to both problems  its cheap its efficient & its convenient

title: Good choice for transportation in Bangkok
review: Bangkok is always traffic and sky train is the best solution  It is easy and fast to go from one place to another place but sometimes you have to take motobike or taxi to reach your destination Sky train still not cover in all area in BKK but the attraction spot ex Siam Paragon Centralworld Siam MBK Emquatier Emporium Central Chidlom Central Embassy can be easily reach by sky train If you are tourist you might consider stay hotel which can link to both sky train and MRT station ex around asoke area

title: A quality, safe and efficient train service - use it
review: This is well worth a go once you've tried the tuk tuk  It's cheap and air conditioned and goes to some hot spots the Chutuchuk market the river the main shopping areas to start  My only tip is that you need coins so to avoid lining up to get coins bring your change

title: Clean and fast
review: The skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok quickly above all the traffic Very easy to use Getting on the train is very organized as everyone waits in a line designated outside the trains You need the ticket to get on and the off the train at the end You will need change to buy the tickets but can get it at the station by asking an attendant

title: The Best
review: Traveling around Bangkok is a hassle but not when you're taking the BTS That's the fastest way to get from point A to point B

title: Great Way To See the Sights
review: Taking the Skytrain was easy to figure out for tourists with plenty of English signs Take it to the river stop and hop on the tourist boat to really see the sights

title: Regular and rapid transport
review: An excellent way to get around Bangkok It travels above the streets solid with traffic and avoids difficult walkways and street crossings

title: Worth a try whilst in Bangkok!
review: Easy simple and quick to navigate around Make sure you have coins though fur the ticket machines Good to avoid pricey taxis and heavy traffic

title: Convenience
review: Due to the bad traffic in Bangkok during the rush hours or every Fridays or every times and days BTS Skytrain was the best transportation for the people in Bangkok  whose living or working along the BTS route  Some of the things that would be rather improve is the ticket and the fare fee 1 Shouldn't be better if BTS and MRT join the card (the pass ticket) for more inconvenience and easy  2 Eventhough we use the rabbit card the fare rate for member and nonmember are the same It's so absurd 3 The train always broken down during rush hours

title: great travel method
review: excellent way to beat the horrendous Bangkok traffic Good value for time Also good connections withe Mtro

title: Easy and convenient
review: Best way to travel around in Bangkok Prices are cheap you get a view and everything is explained properly I wished they would have the same system in Europe

title: Amazing train
review: Amazing train with air conditioning valuable during summer to escape from the "oven" of the street The train is even cold but it's nice even

title: Handy transport
review: Avoiding heavy traffic this is the best way to travel in Bangkok  cheap and efficient  Air conditioned and comfortable

title: BKK Transit
review: It's a must item for travelers to move inside BKK with ease Though NFC card among BTS & MRT and others are not available at this moment

title: Good system without good access
review: Its a good alternative to the busy traffic But not family friendly accessibility Locals are very considerate in the trains Good security too

title: Faster more than I've expected
review: It's quite fast more than I've expected that I can  reach around Bangkok faster  Ps don't forget to checkout or you'll miss the place

title: A Place I Would Love To Be In On A Hot Day
review: This is a very efficient train transport system around Bangkok I purchased a prepaid card to travel around freely I can even preload via ATM  The temperature inside is very cool and nice especially during the summer days of Bangkok

title: Always make sure you stay near the BTS
review: Everyone knows how bad Bangkok traffic is Not only that the ripoff "Taxi Meter" experience The only way to avoid it is to stay near public transit Make sure that you hotel is within at least 10 minutes walk from a station and you will make your visit so much better

title: Easy to use
review: The sky train is very busy but easy and inexpensive The locals queue in an orderly fashion to board the trains so makes it easy for us foreigners

title: easy access user friendly
review: great way to beat the traffic and too see the sights easy to access easy to understand Strongly suggest you access on your first day and familiarise yourself with the system it will save you long hours stuck in taxi that is trying navigate Bangkok traffic

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Easiest and quickest way to get around the city in conjunction with the underground system Stations all had security checks when we were there but these were conducted quickly and amicably and gave a great feeling of safety Stations were constantly being scrubbed clean too Very impressive

title: Different
review: The ride was good you get to see more of the country the train is clean easy to get to and very cheap for all

title: Fastest and Best transport mode in Bangkok!
review: Keeping the traffic in mind in Bangkok city I think the BTS is the fastest and the most convenient way of transport within the city It's well connected network helps one to travel to every part of the city Its convenient clean fast and safe Easy connectivity and transfers to different lines also helps to reduce time and reach your destination faster A one day travel pass helps to travel all around the city any number of times in a day

title: Very well connected
review: One of the best metros I be travelled pretty safe at all times and not expensive Green line is just too good I used it extensively Coupons and plastic swipe cards are used interchangeably People understand a bit of English at the ticket counter so it isn't a problem Grab a map at the station Not overly crowded most of the times best and cheapest mode of commute in Bangkok

title: Bangkok Finest way for transport
review: I used everyday when in Bangkok  Clean  Fast  Reliable  Safe always on time  i recommend BTS Bangkok for your regular transport

title: As expected
review: Used it to get around from our base in Sathorn to the river and up to Siam SquarePrantip Plaza and MVK On time reliable clean cheap and air conditioned What more could you want

title: Welcome to the 21st cebtury
review: It is a pleasure to use the BTS  It is clean  quiet  reliable  air conditioned  people are courteous and friendly  I recommend buying the electronic card  to avoid wasting time in the queue getting the tokens  and not to worry about exactly how much to pay for what station

title: Very clean and fast
review: We used the sky train when in Bangkok for one day visiting From the airport you can take the A1 or A2 bus to Ma Chit station to catch the sky train From there is is easy to travel around Bangkok without the worry of a questionable taxi driver It is clean safe and quick

title: Perfect to move in Bangkok
review: Excellent traint safe fast cheap and secure The best option to move in Bangkok It is possible to communicate with the Airport raillink

title: Boon to Bangkok
review: If you've ever tried to get around Bangkok in a taxi you will be very glad for the BTS Skytrain And in certain places the skywalk that links some stations There are two lines and they serve many of the city's tourist spots from its numerous hotels Fares are reasonable though they have been rising (where in the world have they not) and the ticketing system is reasonably easy to use You can buy an all day tourist pass a stored value ticket or single ride tickets There is usually a ticket office when you can buy stored value tickets or get change for the machines The system is found on most tourist maps and specific system maps are usually available at stations It is rare when the trains are not busy but they are super crowded at peak hours when people are trying to get to and from work The comfort of cool air conditioning is another bonus in Bangkok's sweltering heat

title: Perfect to visit bangkok
review: its the perfect way to visit bangkok the direction and map are so easy understand that you dont have to take help from anybody

title: Fast and cheap way to get to central Bangkok
review: Most people head to Khao san road and although this as of yet doesn't take you all the way it's a cheap option Take the sky train to the last stop then jump in a tuk tuk or meter taxi Just make sure you ask for the meter to be switched on first to save any confusion over price NIce and easy that way

title: Decent cheap way to travel around the city
review: If you're into seeing how people live and being part of the city you'll love this It's decent It's a nice way to move around the city It's cheap compared to taxis and tuktuks unless you're a group of 3 or 4 travelling for a short distance

title: The right way to move in Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is really the proper answer to the alwayshuge trafficjam in Bangkok I lived the time where the only way to move was taxi and I remember very well the hours spent for very short distances In the daytime I donât see anything better than BTS skytrain to explore the town The net is logic easy to learn and to understand and the prices are reasonable If you are in Bangkok and you prefer to spend your time visiting or doing interesting things this will be your right choice

title: ok but expensive
review: Very expensive and often too crowded  often better to use the canal system if you was a more authentic experience

title: Easy to use
review: Easy to use as the traffic in BKK is crazy And some taxi drivers try to rip you off Especially useful when you need to attend meetings on time I would highly recommend if you have tight schedules Only downside is its hot when waiting but endurable

title: clean , safe & efficient
review: to beat the bangkok traffic use the clean  safe & efficient BTS sky train its connected to almost all major malls

title: Good Mode of Transport to Beat the Jam!
review: This is a very efficient train system to beat the jams and overall a very comfortable ride The ticketing system could be better enhanced though (for now the automated system only takes in coins and if you will have to queue at the information counter to break your notes)

title: No tourist help. People cant understand English. People dont want to help you out. Not friendly.
review: They cannot understand English If other people can understand English they are not helping you they will just said no no no not tourist friendly

title: nice and easy to ride
review: much easier than other country mass transportation however ticket machine only use coins kinda irritated when you don't have some although there is a counter to change anyway good way to spend the coins

title: Very good transportation
review: The train itself  is very good and modern with very good air conditioning For tourists it covers many of the tourist areas (hotels malls) and it connects witht he airport train Tickets are between 1 to 2 US$ The ticketing is not very convenient You can use coins only in the machines If you do not have coins you queue to the change booth than at machine For people with physical limitations it is not very convenient

title: Great way to beat the traffic
review: Took the BTS from Asok on a rainy Friday evening The station was packed and there were long queues at the ticket machine  tip purchase tickets earlier in the day if you're planning to head out on the BTS on Friday evening   BTS trains were very new clean and efficient Waiting time was short between trains

title: Convenient
review: This is the easiest safest most convenient way to get around Bangkok Avoid rush hour though if you can as the trains are starting to be almost as crowded as Tokyo

title: Wonderful way to avoid traffic
