review: Our stay in Bangkok was helped greatly by the skytrain Our hotel Eastin Grand Sathorn has its very own stop that connects to the skytrain We used the skytrain to go to the Chatuchak Market Mo Chit station (@48 baht) and a few restaurants and shopping centers     This was a wonderful way to avoid the horrid Bangkok traffic and the hideous taxi drivers The skytrain is very efficient There are attendants at kiosks there to give you change and buy your ticket Most spoke english and we never had issues buying tickets Once you have a ticket you go through the turnsyle as you put your ticket in the slit You walk through and collect your ticket Save your ticket you will need to to exit the station once you get to your stop     On Chatuchak market days Friday Sunday there is a large increase in the amount of people in the train You will be packed with people around you Remember to be clean showered and beleive in the power of deodorant  If you are funky smelling you will be noticed for all the wrong reasons People are polite and keep to themselves Keep an eye on your purse and wear your backpack in the front just for common sense safety     There are seating available (seating is usually given to monks elderly and pregnant women but if it is empty have a seat) There are many places to hold onto if standing It is air conditioned so it will be a relief from the heat Many of the stations had food and snack stands in case you are hungry or thirsty I didn't notice if there were any restroomtoilet area As a family we felt safe and less stressed using the skytrain

title: Easy to use
review: We used the train the majority of our time in Bangkok and found the system to be very easy to use Would recommend

title: So cheap and fast!
review: Take the BTS at least to and from the airport and save yourself about 500 baht It's air conditioned fast and has centrallylocated stops If you're confused about how to buy tickets they have information booths at each station

title: Our tour guide took us
review: A little like the London tube  Hot busy Exciting  Cost only 40 Bart  Go early if possibleso busy  Perfect

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The easiest way to get about it's quick and cheap Direct from the airport to the city faster than any taxibus  Only down side escalators only go up many stairs take you down Main line runs NorthSouth quick access to the weekend market and river front

title: Booth workers not too friendly but not too croweded
review: The metro was not too crowded going to most places  but some of the ticketing areas are not user friendly and the booth workers were not very nice and helpful to foreigners

title: Brad the road traffic
review: A different way to see Bangkok & experience a little of the daily life of people living there An alternative to New York's Subway or the London Underground  I think it's pretty much always busy but it's a cheap way and fairly quick to get from one side of the city to another

title: Amazing
review: Best way to travel Such an efficient fast and affordable way to get around the city and reach all your favourite places Clean and easy to use Modernamazing

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: I have tried every method of transport in Bangkok which is a traffic blocked city The BTS is clean efficient and very good value It is also very easy to use and the ticket office staff are friendly and helpful

title: Definitely The Best Way to travel in BKK
review: The BTS system has improved so much over the years that it really is a wonder as to why one would not be travelling using this ultra convenient cheap and clean mode of transportation  The BTS links with major shopping malls eg Phrom Pong links with Emporium Siam links with Siam Paragon and National Stadium links with the infamous MBK

title: Overcrowded
review: Way to overcrowded I was literally being crushed against the door between some people Might be a good way of getting around but avoid peak hour at all cost

title: The Sky Ride!
review: Great train service but be aware that you must use coins or dollars to buy your ticket    There are two different train systems that require different types of tickets

title: easy!
review: easy to buy the ticket (prepare coins) help us to go to many destinations in Bangkok Although Bangkok people are not really proud of their BTS but for me this is adequate Of course a mass rapid transportation cannot come directly to your house but this is more than enough

title: The only way to travel in Bangkok
review: Forget about taxis and tuktuks They can take far too long from A to B  The main stations can be very very busy during peak times   Always keep coins to avoid queues for change

title: The most efficient transport system in the world, including the UK underground
review: OK first thing  You arrive in Bangkok  You haven't been to SEA before you're a little gun shy  Easy way to get to city from airport is taxi right  Don't  Step up  The BTS is easy just ask a local  It's cheap it's clean it's on time  Why waste the money on a moto or taxi

title: You can go to anywhere with BTS
review: I always love BTS ride The thing I love most about it is you can go anywhere with BTS and many shopping malls are connected to the stations

title: Accessible to reach most of the Tourist places
review: Accessible to reach most of the Tourist places  The must visit places via SkyTrain are Nana(Night Market) Asok(Terminal 21 Shopping Mall) National Stadium (Shopping Mall) Mo Chit (Weekend Market)  Sapan Taksin (Asiatique Riverfront Market)

title: Definitely the way to travel in Bangkok
review: Our family of four rode the BTS the length of both lines using one day passes  It's a great way to get a feeling for the city  As noted by others it can be crowded during rush hours but it is still a great way to move across the city  Anything that keeps you out of the ground traffic is a good idea  (Loved the subway for the same reason)  The BTS is clean efficient and the riders were very courteous and respectful  Be aware that during rush it can be quite crowded in areas close to the city center  We found the crosswalks and pedestrian walkways for the BTS a good way to avoid crossing the busy streets around Siam Square Terminal 21 and Central World  On top of everything else it is inexpensive and easy to use

title: It is quite convenient to ride
review: There are only two sky train lines But it is also connected to the underground metro as well Although a whole part of the city does not get covered by either It is still convenient to ride these whenever ther eis a station close by Beware that during commute hours it can get quite crowded though

title: City of life and love
review: Transportation are amazing and wonderful  Taxi are safe and sound  Cleaning everywhere  Safe and secure for everyone  Citizens are friendly and reliable  Bangkok is beautiful city  Shopping mall are superb  Enjoyable  Miss you Bangkok  Love you Thailand

title: Easy
review: Don't be scared Just use logic and buying tickets via the machine makes sense If not ask someone or a staff member Remember to pick up a printed map and make sure you get off at the right stop You can ride the whole train system for 25 bhat if you are inclined that way Just make sure it is within the two hours allocated If you exceed the time that be honest with the staff and confess and they will let you pay for another ticket and not the fine Now go exploring

title: Makes getting around easy!
review: Cheap efficient clean and easy to use Best to have a pocket full of change to avoid a long queue when you're buying a ticket On the ticket machine the number by the station you wish to go to is the fare you gave to pay Machines also give change if you haven't the exact cost of the fare Some of the stations do have a lot of steps to go up to the platform and one or two of the automatic exit barriers are a bit quick at closing so if you're male and don't want a painful experience don't hang about The trains obviously get very busy at certain times of the day so if you can't cope with being crushed against complete strangers then this mode of transport isn't for you

title: Smooth Ride
review: We took the BTS to the Saturday market which was very enjoyable No rush and pushing and people were very friendly to give us a seat

title: BTS the heart of Bangkok
review: This is just like Delhi Metro very easy to go any where in Bangkok yes defiantly not useful to go outside of city But really low cost transport

title: Fast, efficient and clean
review: BKK is notorious for it's traffic so the best way to get around BKK is the BTS  It's very clean fast and highly efficient with frequent trains It does get very busy during the rush hour though You can buy daily or weekly travel tickets which I would suggest to avoid buying a ticket each time you take the train it also works out a lot cheaper  The queues for buying the tickets can also be very long  If you run out of coins the lady at the counter can change your notes to coins but she will not issue you a ticket

title: Must Try
review: In Bangkok for my own opinion BTS is the most convenient public transport in city during peak hour or off peak  Sometimes during peak hour even is lots of people waiting but no doubt it still can send you to your destination more faster than taxi  Buy a rabbit card and reload the credit then you can easily to go anywhere you want

title: Easy way to travel around town
review: Sky train is a cheap and quick way to travel around Bangkok but unfortunately it doesn't go everywhere you need It does go through to main streets like Siam Sukhumvit Asok Nana and National Stadium to name a few which are all tourist destinations for their many malls and exciting street markets

title: The 'Life-Saver' in the heart of 'bumper-to-bumper' Bangkok !
review: Quick Easy Efficient & Dependable are the best ways to describe the wonderful system of transport in Bangkok Trains travel at 2 minute intervals  miss one and grab the next  Air Conditioning could be a tad cold for some but it is heavenly for someone who has just come off the hot sweaty streets of the city Cabins are clean and there are strict 'noeating or drinking' rules Commuters are most often very courteous and patient Signage and staff are excellent Access to stations and the 'Rabbit' Ticket system work very well

title: Easy to navigate
review: BTS Skytrain is easy to navigate for foreigners and very reasonably priced Air conditioned and friendly staff

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The skytrain is an excellent cheap way to get around Bangkok  Taxis may be a little cheaper but the skytrain is quick and efficient

title: Simple to use
review: The system connects you to major shopping but not to all the great tourist sites It is cheap and clean

title: Very convenient, easy, cheap
review: It has a booth for coins then you buy your ticket from a machine using coins only Your ticket price depends on how many stops you are going to pass Keep your ticket as you will need it to get out of the station There is no information booth but the employees at the coin booth are very helpful  The only negative thing is that the train is freezing

title: Easy to go
review: BTS SKytrain is the public transportation in Bankok Easy to go But sometimes tired coz need to go upstair and downstar always to get the train or stranfer station

title: Clean, cool and a good view!
review: We took the BTS a couple of times and during the day as well as at night the view and AC were a bonus to this very relaxed way to get around Bangkok The prices vary depending on the distance you want to travel The ticket machines are very easy to operate Definitely a do in Bangkok

title: Good way to avoid traffic jam
review: Although a Rabbit card costs nonrefundable THB80 I still recommend you to buy one to avoid from queuing for tickets

title: Reliable
review: Reliable and cheap Get your tickets before you get on at the machine Seems to take change only but there is a kiosk where you can get change Trains are every few minutes

title: Fab fast travel
review: Great  fast and clean train service Maps simple to understand but tickets not always easy to buy We managed to under pay for the number of stops buying through the ticket machine and then had to pay the excess fare at the counter  no fines just frustrating that we didn't work it out right Carriages get very busy in rush hour

title: Must go on this
review: If youre in bangkok its really difficult that you wont travel on the BTS It is a good overhead train service with various good stops and we used it quite often

title: Easy to Navigate!
review: This metro is easy to navigate around town and I felt super safe around all stations and areas Also inexpensive and clean

title: Only way to go....
review: It's the only way to get around cheaply with no taxituktuk ripoffs great scenery en route professionally run international standards for safety allows folding bikes alwaysnonfolding early morn and after 10 pm

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok
review: People are disciplined and have seen people give up their seats to the elderly pregnant women and kids Also very easy to understand which train to take

title: Clean and efficient
review: The skytrain is the way to go around bangkok If you don't have coins to buy tickets from the ticket machine buy it over the counter The ticket tellers are always nice You can buy a single ticket or a pass for several trips

title: Trip to Siam Square from Krung Thon Buri
review: Fast & efficient travel much better than taxi Best way to explore Bangkok city especially Siam Square where u can walk via Skywalk to Central World & surrounding areas

title: Great public transit system, easy to navigate!
review: I was coming from the airport and found the link between Mo Chi Station and the airport to be clearly identified I got off at Mo Chi and it was easy to navigate through the city Some stations like Sala Daeng accept coins only one at a time which makes the process really slow when buying transit tickets for a group of people but other stations have updated their system accepting cash and multiple people All of the stations I've visited have great selection of food and cafes nom nom nom Just be sure to finish everything before hopping on the BTS as food and drinks are not permitted

title: Fast and convenient
review: Easiest way to get around in Bangkok The ticket system isn't the greatest though if you're staying for a few days We ended up buying day passes most of our days

title: Don't be scared
review: Don't be scared to use BTS it's easy choose which station you want to go to and the number next to it is baht price press number it will light up and drop coins in to the value And card will drop out then put card in turnstile and it will be sucked in and then pop out at the top and the gates will open take the card and off you go

title: Cheap way to beat traffic
review: A cheap faster transportation option if you don't want to be fleeced by taxi drivers and caught in traffic

title: Smooth and quick public tranportation system
review: BTS skytrain in Bangkok just awesome Very quick and smooth No difficulties for new users so easy to buy tickets with coins available maps everywhere Announcement in every moment where it is and where to go

title: ComfortableTransport System
review: During the office hours there is a heavy rush so avoid office hours One has to take coins from the kiosk to buy tokens from the machine

title: Modern, convenient system
review: Trains are frequent and very comfortable The guard at the station was very helpful and friendy to me Signs at the station and announcements on trains are very great and helpful I enjoyed the view from windows so much This is way more fun than MRT Though the price is quite high for a relatively short distance

title: Fastest Transport
review: Stations are nicely arranged Properly directed Supporting peoples are helpful Inside the train is neat and clean and comfortable

title: Easy to Navigate
review: Easy to get around however if you are buying the one time ticket you need to standby coins else u have to go for the longer Q to pay with notes  Only downside ITS ALWAYS SUPER CROWDED

title: Best way of moving around Bangkok
review: Use BTS in the first couple of days of your stay in Bangkok before you get used to the somewhat chaotic traffic below your feet You can buy a Rabbit card (deposit THB 50 + as per number of rides) and use it on pay as you go basis Small kids under 100cm tall ride for free

title: Bts
review: Easy Get change from kiosk and buy ticket Most rides 42 baht Kiosk gives you a ticket sometimes  Trains frequent and clean Ca n be crowded

title: Bangkok the easy way!
review: Stay out of the fumes and jams by using the sky train It's cheap and easy to use The system is colour coded and the progress of the train is shown in lights so you always know which way you are going and where you are The best thing it's cheap plus you can get one day passes It's also safe and clean with dictated female areas if you really feel a little uncertain

title: Line for coin and line again for ticket!
review: I don't understand why we have to q up for exchange the coin then we have to q up again for a ticket and if you need to buy a day pass ticket please ask your hotel first if they have available at the hotel or not but anyway you have to queue with the same line with the passenger who want to change the coin Please change the coin from the hotel if you don't need to waste the time(especially for peak hour and busy station such as Paragon)

title: Awesome public transportation.
review: Best way to get around Bangkok Two separate lines that link at the Siam stop  Buy a Rabbit card to avoid waiting in line for change  You will be glad you did

title: Easiest and safest way to go around Bangkok
review: Best way to move around the city avoid traffic and be able to look at the surroundings as well Cheap ticket clean and takes you to every major sight in Bangkok

title: Great way to commute in Bangkok!
review: BTS is a fantastic way to roam around the city while beating the heat It's far less expensive as compared to taxis and far more comfortable than Tuktuk

title: Highride
review: Best way to travel in bangkok Fast easy access and reasonable cheap Our hotel was 50 steps away from the station so why look further

title: Faster and cooler way to get around Bangkok
review: The system is easy to understand faster than taking taxi especially during rush hour The people are organized and disciplined lining up and waiting patiently Felt safe since there were a lot of police presence near the trains The trains are clean eating is prohibited and the AC is strong Most of the time it's easy to find seating They give up seating for children pregnant women and monks Hopefully they will be able to update the ticketing as one reviewer mentioned It will be more convenient to have coins at hand to save time if not have to get in line at the counter for change

title: On time
review: I can control my timing to do business easy clean safety and convenient  good for life style in the capital but a little bit expensive

title: Best form of public transport I have ever used.
review: Easy to use safe and consistently reliable Also great for avoiding the intense heat due to the epic AC on board the carriages It's a shame it doesn't stretch throughout more of Bangkok because the MRT (although still good) is no where near as good as the BTS

title: Modern transportation
review: If you are tired of waiting for bus take the BTS skytrain it more expensive but faster and cleaner They have big map placed at strategic location at every stop or if dont know for certain you can ask the officer or juat show them the mapplace where you want to gostop

title: One of the best public transport systems in the world
review: Using the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok is the best way to get around quickly in Bangkok In a city of an estimated 12 million people (unofficially) traffic congestions and gridlock for hours is a common occurence The Skytrain gets you fast to your destinations and with the connections to the MRT subway system you have a very modern cheap and efficient way of getting around Now that the Skytrain has an airport link to the interrnational airport you can even get to and from Suvanabhumi to the city in no time

title: Modern and efficient except ticketing process
review: Originally modeled after the Vancouver Skytrain Bangkok's BTS Skytrain long in its planning (started around the early 1990s) and has gone through many iterations and building problems At the end it is a very modern and efficient public transport system It is the fastest way of getting around town especially during rush hour  beating driving taxis or even Tuttuts that can weave in traffic It runs along the busy road of Sukhumvit and Silom The stations are clean and modern with good security The trains runs very frequently so there is little wait time usually   However there are several shortcomings One the ticketing process is inefficient and chaotic as (singleride) rides are first required to line up to get changes (paper money into coins) at the both Then he will need to line up for a second time to purchase from a ticketing machine that has no queue lines When the traffic gets heavy the waiting time can be 15 minutes or so and the process is chaotic A cashless card you can chargerefill would be good I understand that they are working on a better ticketing system Secondly the cost of the Skytrain ride is expensive as compared to other methods of transportation in Bangkok say the MRT subway (even though the MRT is much older) Third the elevated (rather than underground) train kind of destroys the city landscape and produces noise and pollution

title: Safe, clean and well organised
review: One of the best Metro line I ever seen Secure clean well organised Having small cash helps to get your ticket promptly as most machine do not take note upper than 100 baths

title: Easy to usr
review: Used this for most of out traveling around Bangkok So easy to use and buy tickets very clean and also take in some scenery Some stations are busier than others but still no hassle best way and cheapest to get around

title: Easy
review: Easier than I thought It costs about 40 to go anywhere but pretty in expensive to use Great way to get to places to shop site see etc

title: Quick,  Clean, Inexpensive, Airconditioned
review: I wish all public transportation systems in major cities worked as well as the BTS Skytrain  The Skytrain was close to our hotel and was a gem to get us from one end of the Sukhumvit area to the other Highly recommend it

title: Safe, clean, comfortable, efficient, modern rapid transit
review: The BTS Skytrain is the best choice to avoid traffic jams and the hassle of traveling intoout ofacross central Bangkok  Although the fare is a little bit high compared with the cost of living in Thailand BTS Skytrain provide safe clean comfortable and efficient choice to the public with high standard  The drawback is only the limited number of lifts and escalators discouraging the elderly and the handicapped to use the service  It should improve accessibility

title: Good service
review: Good service can be more efficient and reliable though many people travel through it but not tourist friendly Not good as singapore

title: Clean, fast, air-conditioned, cheap
review: Use it while in Bangkok it's very clean can be busy but works on time and is very frequent Cost is per destination maximum you pay is abt 80cents

title: A great way to get around the City
review: I watched the BTS being built 18 years ago It had early faults but is now vastly improved Most stations have "up" but not "down" escalators Many stations now have elevators for wheelchair access etc This didn't used to be the case  New line extensions are currently being built The rail cars have powerful aircon offering a very pleasant respite from the hot humid climes outside Around the SiamCentral World & Chitlom areas there is a fair amount of elevated walkways which unlike Bangkok pavements is smooth & safe  Given the ever increasing traffic  this undoubtedly is the best way to get around the city and a bonus is you have an elevated view of your surroundings You can dismount at any station on your journey have a look at your surroundings from the station & reboard again or even cross over & go the opposite end without extra charge  For tourists it is best to buy a multiple trip ticket (10 or 20 trips etc) & it works out at 25 to 30 Baht per trip

title: Great
review: A great way to beat the traffic the trains run every 5 minutes and are clean The ticket you purchase has a map of the skytrain stops and each station is announced in English and thia as you approach

title: Cheap and efficient!
review: Very affordable and takes you almost everywhere (well close that is) Also very easy to navigate It is a very organized train system ) Ticket machines only accepts coins and there is cashiers always there being able to change cash to coins from very early to very late I also recommend getting the bts skytrain app it's very helpful and tells you which stop to get off depending on where you want to go or can tell you what is the nearest stop near you Great train )

title: The fastest way to avoid traffic jam
review: Bangkok is know as the city with traffic jam Its better than Jakarta but traffic is the problem BTS is the best way to avoid traffic It is convenient and on time Sadly it is not to all direction

title: Excellent service
review: Wonderful service  Reliable clean and safe reasonable prices if you want to move in the kaos of Bangkok

title: Easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is the monorail in Bangkok  It is clean runs frequently stops are announced in EnglishThai as well as appearing on screens and the stations have good signage  The ticket machines take only coins  go to the window to get coins if you do not have enough change for your trip  See photo below The trip's cost is by distance (1552 baht)  Look at the stop where you want to go to get the cost and then push that button then put in the coins for the ticket  The machine will give you a card for the trip and any change if due  If you are sensitive to AC bring a scarf or extra layer for longer trips  the cars can get chilly

title: Good people in Bangkok
review: We go to Bangkok with my little kids They are about 7 & 8 years old We take the BTS more than 10 times during the trip And the Thai people is  very polite  They  give the seats to my sons every times It  is very polite country

title: So easy!
review: The BTS Skytrain in Bangkok is one of the easiestcleanest and efficient train systems in the world

title: BTS
review: Great way to get around Bangkok avoiding the traffic Very cheap to Used the BTS 56 times and also used the airport shuttle to and from the airport

title: Very good service
review: The trains are always clean very comfortable and most important always on time This is the way to get around Bangkok

title: Good transport..
review: We used the BTS whilst exploring Bangkok as part of our holiday in Thailand We thought it was a good way of travelling in Bangkok

title: Super Effecient.  Best way to travel
review: Dont bother with the roads in Bangkok taxis rickshaws unless its very late at night when the roads are quiet(ish)   The BTS Skytrain is be far the best way to get around and its cheap air conditioned and very quick

title: Fast and convenient
review: This is a great way to move around in Bangkok Very easy and cheap Just stay away during rush hour

title: Train system
review: Very easy to use and understand Purchasing tickets were so easy it's the first system i have used with no complications  The train is very busy most of the time but they are so reliable and very cool and also very cheap I recommend this form of transport around Bangkok

title: Nice and well organized public transport
review: Any big city need a good public transportation and looking at the very busy streets of Bangkok any time of the day taking the BTS Skytrain is definitely a good idea Good speaking vendors in at the counter fair price (from 15 BTH onwards) and easy to use ticketing system

title: Best transport in Bangkok
review: After been in taxis with so congested slow traffic all the time or been walking in the dust noise and heat of summer getting into the train was such a good feeling  it's cool and clean and it has no traffic jams The only down side is you have to do self service at the machines to get your ticket and those machines only accept coins it can be troublesome when you try to figure out for the first time

title: very clean and quick
review: plenty of trains so you never have to wait long to catch one At some stations  single tickets can only be purchased from machines that only take coins which is a bit annoying because they make you queue to change your bills and then to get your ticket The stations are very clean everything is easy to find and the security level is high (bag checks etc)

title: Busy busy
review: Avoid rush hour  Excellent way to navigate Bangkok  Cheap easy and clean  Bangkok is such an amazing place easy to get lost but easy with this service in all the main spots

title: A good way of getting around town, but it can be crowded.
review: Although it only runs on two lines limiting its coverage of Bangkok it's an easy safe and inexpensive way to get around town  Be warned most of the ticket machines only take coins and the ones that accept notes won't accept anything bigger 100 baht it's a good idea to have some change before you go

title: Fast, efficient, affordable and clean
review: A lesson could be learned by Australian rail operators If they studied the BTS  A ticketing system that's simple to use and works every time Friendly staff who can be called upon to help at any time The platform safety barriers are great and the way Thais let the disembarking travellers off before joining the train is a great example of Thai curtesy This is one of the best rail systems in the world

title: Moving around BKK
review: BANGKOK has a very clean and reliable train system There are many shopping lodging and eating options along the BTS There is even an easy ride from the airport to the city center Research to save money on taxi's

title: Convenient
review: Apart from rush hours (when it's pretty busy) the BTS is pretty easy to use and so much faster than any taxi as BKK traffic jams are notorious

title: Really the easiest way around central Bangkok
review: This is a user friendly and essential way of getting around the normally chaotic central areas of Bangkok especially the main shopping areas along Sukhumvit Rd  The only negatives are the rush hour where the trains are packed and the often freezing airconditioning

title: Skytrain
review: Fantastic and quick Here to there in minutes and really efficient There were a few Mothers begging with children on the bridge but it was fine We used this skytrain daily

title: Very convenient
review: If you are going to be staying in Bangkok for more than a week be sure to get the Rabbit card It's a great new system and you can use it to buy food at the Siam Paragon and also MBK

title: Super efficient transportation
review: Our hotel was near sukhumvit So the skytrain was the best way to move from east to west of bangkok Even to catch boats on charopraya river it was fast to reach saphan taksin stop from anywhere around the skytrain There is a train every 3 min It s clean efficient and great to cool down when too warm in bkk It s cost efficient to take the day pass

title: Good unless you need an elevator
review: The BTS really makes getting around easy but if you need an elevator you're kinda hooped I was staying near Asoke station and while there was an elevator you were lucky if someone actually replied to the call button and brought the elevator down And if you were coming down from up there's no button to call you've got to hunt someone down to help So while the transit itself is good elevator wise this is not a user friendly system

title: Bangkok Metro
review: Its better and convenient to take BTS to go for shopping and sight seeing You can beat Bangkok trafficand also lots of bargain for Tuk Tuk and Taxi

title: Read up before hand
review: Easy to use just look at it before you travel this way you will have a better time Most trips on the Sky train are very cheap

title: Excellent and efficient service.
review: I used the BTS Skytrain as my primary mode of transportation in Bangkok besides walking  Just be aware that as is in many places in Bangkok there will be a security screener at the entrance that quickly checks peoples bags and purses for dangerous items  Just make their life easier and offer to show them that you don't have any dangerours items and you'll have no issues  Another tip If you are towing luggage through the entry gate turnstiles walk quickly through it so that the gate doesn't close on your luggage  Also be sure to use common sense and let people exit the train first before entering  The Thais are friendly and have common sense in this regard some tourists don't

title: Fast - faster than taxi and tuk-tuk
review: It's a pity that BTS doesn't go as far as to the river but a very good and efficient transport mode in Bangkok Mostly above ground so you can get an impression of the city as well  Trains can be crowded (not really a surprise) in particular during rush hours

title: Not cheap, long waiting time
review: Public transportation in Bangkok was only fair  The BTS was not cheap at all maybe taxi was even cheaper  However roads in Bangkok easily have traffic jam so tourists had no choice  We travelled a lot by BTS in the 4day visit in Bangkok

title: Train Ride OFF PEAK ONLY
review: Great way to travel cheaply the trains are very clean (cleaner than the streets) faster than a Taxi due to the road congestion DO NOT travel during office hours 79 am as you will be packed in like a Sardine

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Train clean and comfortable for tourist easy to use But BTS not integrated with MRT station sometime need to across street

title: Efficient & Air Conditioned
review: The BTS Skytrain is an excellent way to get around Bangkok On average a train will arrive every 6 minutes Each station provides well labelled easy to understand maps to help you get around without confusion easier to understand than the underground in London   One down side is that the line is not very extensive I recommend if you are a little far away from it just get a taxi to your nearest station and use the train from there as it will get you to most of the main attractions

title: Well connected-Until a point
review: Although the BTS is quite new it would be goo if they expanded t a bit more It is a good way to get to the centre of the city and everything is well indicated so you can't get lost And it's quite cheap too

title: BTS Skytrain...
review: We travelled from our hotel to the Ocean World Was very happy to see the respect given to us by the local traveler when we entered the train they offered their own seats to us

title: Great transportation
review: The BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok Esp from between 48pm where all traffic comes to a standstill  Air con is a releive

title: Quick and easy
review: This was public transportation that was extremely inexpensive and easy to use despite the language barrier You will get to your destination quicker than a taxis

title: So efficient, inexpensive and handy
review: If you arrive at the airport at a reasonable time and you know where you're going you can probably easily get there via the skytrain However it's best for getting from one area of Bangkok to another without having to be stuck in a traffic jam and if you like shopping all the Malls seem to be linked by the skytrain system With average prices of about 30p you can't go wrong

title: Awesome Transportation
review: The BTS is a great mode of transportation while is Bangkok My suggestion to visitors is to get the card where you can put a certain amount of money on it so you don't have to keep going to the machines

title: great efficient service
review: Great  servicevery cheap clean  easy to use Efficient for travelling around city Used it every day

title: Clean
review: It's really convient and cleanAlthough only 2 routesthey are all through the main viewshopping mall or any other in Bangkok

title: Beats sitting in traffic!
review: As public transit systems in the world go the BTS is surprisingly awesome and its arrival in Bangkok just over 15 years ago was a game changer for the entire city on multiple fronts traffic air pollution navigability It makes it possible to zoom through the city even when monsoon rains and rush hour traffic make streets impassable More and more stations are now connected to malls and other buildings by elevated walkways making it possible to see a lot of Bangkok's central attractions without braving the crowded sidewalks I ride it every day for my commute and encounter only the occasional delay If you're visiting Bangkok as a tourist it's a marvelous worryfree alternative to taxis who may "forget" to turn on the meter and then overcharge you or tuktuks who offer you cheap rides only to claim the temple you wanted to see is "closed for a national holiday" and deposit you at a tailor or gem shop instead The only downsides are that it doesn't cover nearly all of Bangkok  the underground MRT helps expand its range but neither covers the old town sites of greatest interest to tourists  and that at certain hours and certain stations it can suddenly become almost insufferably crowded Evening rush hour at Asok Sala Daeng or Siam station Oof Be ready to wait on an extremely crowded platform for multiple trains to pass before you'll be able to shoehorn yourself in And forget about buying a singleuse pass at those hours at those hub stations the lines are insane Get a rabbit card instead and you can zip right through

title: Best way to navigate around Bangkok
review: Very safe and cheapest way to get around Bangkok   genius     And easy to pay for the trips using the ticket machine  Easy to get used to

title: Best way to get around BKK
review: Quick and easy to navigate especially if youre on vacationclean cool and cheap Use this rather thank cabs

title: Great way to travel around Bangkok
review: The public transport system in Bangkok is very cheap reliable and clean and very easy to use  There are signs in English everywhere and the ticketing machine also have English translations  It's not too hard to transfer between the MRT subway and the sky train at Phetchaburi  Makkasan  The system is a bit disjointed but the have built a walkway between the two stations just follow the signs  Very user friendly

title: The Best Quick Solution for Bangkok Travel
review: Getting around Bangkok is always a pain at any time of the day The traffic is unpredictable The BTS is the best solution

title: Recommended
review: Used for few times while in Bangkok last July it's very cheap safe convenient and fast comparing to taxis to travel within the city but always full due to the large population there Still recommended

title: Yup it was OKI
review: Always take the BTS it beats the traffic and heat and gets you there surely and refreshed  Cheap too

title: A very useful mode of transportation in Bangkok
review: BTS is a really a good mode of transportation in Bangkok You can also get to see the whole city by sitting inside it I love their ticket purchasing system and it's very fast

title: Tinned sardines!
review: Essential for travel around Bangkok the BTS is a real Thai experience Rush hours are worse than the London tube but mostly people are kinder It's easier to buy a rabbit card and just keep topping it up as you need it The BTS stops at every mall bonus for shopping food and air con Thai's don't like to touch farang so be careful getting on & where you stand Less busy times it's a great ride to your destination & you have more chance of getting a seat although if it's just the next stop you need stay standing near the doors as its easier to get off quickly BTS stations are clean as are the trains no food or drink is allowed to be consumed on the train at all but you can carry food & drink Always offer your seat to elderly kids or pregnant women Thai people don't do this so they try & decline as they don't see this often keep offering though & they will eventually except it's nice to be nice & you may make a new friend for your journey

title: Faster than taxi
review: With the worst traffic in the world  This is the best choice from jamming on the road for more than an hour when you could reach infact in 10 mins

title: Best Way to Travel in Bangkok
review: Frequency of BTS is good and it connects quite good number of places in Bangkok  Better to take rabbit card which comes with a non refundable fee of 80 Bhat and can be topped up in multiples of 100 only

title: Best way to move around in Bangkok
review: Get a card and refill it when it is empty Avoid the 1819 timeframe it is really full   For short distances if at least 2 people get a taxi   Faster for long distances very cheap for solo travellers

title: Super modern transport system overlaying the city traffic chaos!
review: Very modern and efficient people mover system in Bangkok city centre Very frequent trains glide overhead above the chaotic city traffic roads good value for single and day pass journeys

title: Fast n easy
review: If traffic looks bad (as often it does) then the BTS is the best way to go if there are stations nearby Often crowded but worth the experience

title: Easy to go around
review: I love the Skytrain Its so easy to get around in BKK to almost wherever I want to go Instead of hours in taxi it could be just minutes with skytrain Though it can be very crowded it is never delayed The only minus is that ticket machines is very often out of service and you have to stand in a looong line to get a ticket

title: Save time & money
review: Heavy traffic is a very common picture in Bangkok Also there many issues with Taxi & Tuk Tuk  language & understanding In this respect only the solution is BTS Strain This service very easy & comfortable as well as smooth  Uses may know this device needs coins to be used & changing coins facility is available at the every station Visitors has to select the destination first & insert the coins into the machine ticket & balance will be delivers automatically Foreigners select the English version or station code whatever the convenient Ticket & other staffs are very supportive all the way   Pls make your journey comfortable & safe and enjoy BTS Skytrain in Thailand

title: Packed but convenient
review: It's packed most of the times especially during peaks hours but surely is more convenient that getting a taxi tuk tuk Uber From point station to station on BTS would take approximately 3 minutes or less but if you take a car it can take you even 10 20 minutes Traffic there is incredible so please use the BTS is going to bring you anyway to the most famous places

title: A must experience in Bangkok
review: Best way to explore and cut the traffic Makes life easier to travel across Would highly recommend to use this service

title: Very convenient efficient and clean
review: Loved using the skytrain Very efficient service very clean and very easy to figure out the routes So much faster than dealing with the Bangkok traffic

title: Good and reliable service
review: The BTS now over ten years in service SIEMENS made train system is clean efficient and very reliable both in service and speed Best way to get around and beat the traffic in Bangkok The BTS is along the main roads and routes and to most of the areas and tourist destinations Having skywalks and connecting bridges along and under the BTS and from the stations leading into the many Malls along the routes Well designed planned and established

title: Great to get around by bypassing the traffic but don't forget the train and subway that are also available.
review: Sometimes gets very crowded during thai working hours like 9am and 5 pm best to travel midday or midmorning or evening

title: Best way to get around!
review: With the insane heat and humidity  the sky train is the best way to get around Plus it is super affordable and saves you from taxi scams No safer way to travel

title: cheap way to get around
review: Cheap way to get around and explore easy to operate we felt safe day & night here using the transport

title: Great Public Transpo
review: We rode this everywhere is Bangkok and it was cheap and clean  Easy on and off and back on again  Looks like they are in the process of extending the line north and south

title: Good
review: Buy one day pass if you travel a lot is better than exchange for a coin especially at prime time very long queue

title: Easiest way to get around in central Bangkok
review: The BTS is an above ground rail mass transit system that is a very convenient way to get around central Bangkok  It's also good value  If you will be using it alot get a one day unlimited pass for BHT140

title: Great way to get around
review: While you can't beat the experience of a Tuk Tuk the shut rain is fast efficient cheap and air conditioned A great way to beat the traffic

title: Very convenient
review: Cheap and convenient Very clean and well airconditioned as well Major landmarks are walking distance from the BTS stations so you don't need to take taxi in the traffic hell  Get a daypass if you plan to go around a lot but if you are making a short trip to one or two desinations one time ticket will do Ticket machines have English menu so you won't have any trouble

title: Train to the future!
review: Very cheap and comfortable way of travel Nice nice to take when you want to see Bangkok in a very fast fast way and when you want to travel cheaper than the taxi

title: Very efficient transport
review: Only way to travel fast in Bangkok  Advice   1 make a picture of the name of the station you want to return to 2 Be aware that bags will be searched for security reasons

title: Bts & Mrt facility
review: The bts facility is very good both in terms of economically and time saving too As in Bangkok there is to much traffic jam where as this bts facility saves your lot of time  Even u can use their mrt service for traveling to their airport which is very economical as compare to taxi service

title: What a great alternative to Bangkok traffic!
review: We experienced being stuck in traffic trying to get from our hotel to the Grand Palace and realized how much time we were wasting trying to get from A to B When we had to move hotels we told the concierge that we preferred anything but taxi so he mapped out our journey on the skytrain It was very easy The train is very clean and well airconditioned We used it a few times when we were in Bangkok and I am sure we saved a lot of time and money It was 85 baht for three of us to travel through a few stations The card system is very similar to our home of Montreal  slip your card the slot it comes up the gate opens for you to pass through (but don't put your luggage ahead of you pull behind you  one of us made this mistake) keep your card to exit the train station  put your card in and the gate will open

title: Superb transportation in busy hours in Bangkok
review: I went to Siam station in BTS Skytrain experience was superb the train coaches were spacious and neat and clean even if someone is  new to this heshe can easily travel they have board in both English and Thai language Fare is also cheap I prefer this because of traffic during peak hours in Bangkok is very heavy

title: A great way to get around a busy city
review: We always use the Sky Train when in Bangkok Cheap and easy way to get around The staff we interacted with were helpful and friendly  Can be very crowded at peak times

title: It's a train
review: Seemed to run pretty well on schedule  Pretty easy to navigate although I wish they had maps available of all the systems and how to easily get from one to another

title: safe, fast, clean way to travel inside Bangkok
review: To travel inside Bangkok can be timeconsuming and stressingThe Skytrain is a fastsafe and clean way to move inbetween breat distance from thereon you can take the cab

title: I'll take you where you want to go...
review: So let me tell you this BTS Skytrain is for everyone It's easy fun and affordable You just see what location or destination you want to go to and pay for the stops up until then similar to the CalTrain or VTA Lightrail in the Bay Area (San Francisco San Joseetc) You can take the BTS Skytrain but don't lose your ticket That's how you enter and exit the train stations There's a map inside the skytrain with the location and stops (and they announce it) so you won't get lost  When in doubt skytrain out

title: A Raised view of the Bangkok hustle and bustle.
review: Enjoyed Journey on the BTS It had Air conditioning which was a welcome respite from the heat and humidity outside

title: Great Transportation
review: Very easy to use and navigate And if not sure ask Everyone so willing to help you It can be a bit crowded at times but only during rush hour

title: Fast and clean system
review: The sky train is easy and efficient  Go with plenty of coins so you don't need to go to a window and exchange paper bhat for coins to use In the ticket machines  Easy to use signs in English  Only regret is it would be better if it extended more around town

title: Couldn't agree more, it's a great way to get around the city!
review: Cheap reliable punctual and it lets you see parts of the city from above where you wouldn't normally see  Takes you all the way down to the river where you can pick up an equally reliable boat for a sail along the river

title: Convenient and reliable.
review: I gave an "Excellent" rating for the Skytrain because it is a modern clean cheap and punctual public transport system It is also well serviced by friendly customer support staff and security  It may not get you everywhere but it will get you to most places of interest (eg shopping ctrs  of all shapes and sizes main river night markets Red Cross Hospital etc) or it will link up with other public transport services In places it made an excellent elevated walkway It was very crowded but as expected when office staff were either going to work or leaving it As a tourist I had a choice to either avoid those times or except crowds Great way to see parts of Bangkok and easy to use

title: Convenient and inexpensive way to get around
review: The BTS was very easy to use connections were simple It was fast convenient clean and inexpensive Much better than taking taxis and dealing with the constant traffic we saw around the city

title: great way to get arround in Bangkok!
review: Perfect cheap and easy The skytrain get's you where you want to go in Bangkok It's clean and safe

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok!
review: Always clean and on time and have have superb aircon Perfect way to get around Bangkok Bangkok's BTS (skytrain) system is the best way to travel around Bangkok

title: Bangkok's Pride.
review: You know traffic is the main problem in bangkok now A place by walk of 15 min will take 25 min by taxi in office hour Whereas BTS skytrain don't face TrafficHaha It will take 2 min

title: Essential
review: Crazy traffic during the day so BTS will safe your life money and time Do not doubt it It is very safe and regular I used to take cabs uber and all kind of other transportation before trying I got already my BTS card for future trips

title: Always on time
review: Never had a delay It was always on time And short waitingtime Easiest way to get around Bangkok And it covers a big part of the city

title: Cheap and hassle free way to get around
review: Used to BTS skytrain for recent visit to Bangkok Hotel was located about a 2 minute walk from Asok station The skytrain will take you to most of the tourist attractions and shopping centres Very cheap and easy to navigate much easier then using taxi's who have a reputation for ripping you off Be aware sky train is very packed during peak times and you may have to get up close and personal with the person next to you Trains are fairly frequent but again during peak times you may have to wait for another train

title: Bts
review: Easy access and so rapid compared to the road traffic which is very heavy since 9 up to 23the only thing is that it is very cold inside

title: Go Anywhere
review: Easy to navigate your way around this huge city Everyone with a uniform on are there to help the foreign traveller

title: Great Way To Get Around The City
review: While the BTS Skytrain doesn't go everywhere and doesn't connect directly to many of the major tourist destinations you can use it to and from the airport and many locations As well there are often easy connections from BTS SkyTrain to the major destinations such as the Grand Palace The rates are cheap and the service and comfort is great so I highly recommend using it if it fits your travel destinations

title: Fast and Hassel free
review: Great way to get around town Better than a taxi that will eventually take you to sponsor shops such as a nieghborhood jeweler or a local tailor (Newest ploy to get riders to go to these vendors so that the drivers gets a kick back such as gas card) BTW SKYTRAIN saved me time money with a Hassel free environment

title: Convenient to travel
review: Able to connect popular attractions Easy & faster to reach destination than taking tuk tuk or taxi meter especially during peak period to avoid heavy traffic jam Also very cheap

title: Wish we had
review: We never actually used the sky train ourselves but spoke to several people who did We spent a lot of time stuck in traffic and wish we had known about the sky train earlier I was told it was very easy to use at a reasonable price And if I next visit bancock I will not hesitate to use it

title: BTS in Bangkok makes travelling easy and accessible.
review: Travelling is cheaper and easier with BTS to avoid the traffic in the city Just know where to go and which station to stop

title: Good off peak
review: This gets very busy so go when its quiet you will need coins to buy a ticket from a machine and each stop is a different price which caught us out  Its clean and air conditioned and super fast compared to the roads

title: Clean and modern
review: Plus it is being extended to the Bang Rak area The method of choice for certain areas in Bangkok such as Sukhumvit Easy not that expensive fast One has to like cold though

title: Cozy and easy
review: Travelled around 1130 pm to hua lamphong station and it was a nice and cozy commute i am sure if they add more BTS there will be less traffic on the road as traffic is the biggest problem in Bangkok

title: Convenient transportation with cheap price!
review: Great choice for going around in Bangkok They provided a good price for each way ) 7am or 8am are not a good choice to get on the train since they will be a lot of people off to work and school I always use BTS everytime I am in BKK )

title: National stadiam
review: We got out from the wrong entrance It was raining very heavy so we re enter and walk towards the opposite direction and was charge 61 bht per person It takes less than 2 min heading towards the other entrance to Pruthunam Princess Hotel MBK Sign board no English or  Chinese indicating the direction to MBK

title: Do not try to battle Bangkok traffic
review: The best way to get around Bangkok Convenient cheap and very easy to navigate It does get very busy around certain stations on Sundays and rush hour but better than spending hours in your car parked in traffic

title: No traffic
review: Traffic in Bangkok is terrible  Sure you can sit in an airconditioned taxi that wont cost a lot  but it may take you an hour to get to where you want when on the BTS it takes 20 minutes

title: Convinient
review: Modern and useful way of transport around BKK Shame it isn't all around the city In trains there is very cold because of AC and windows are very low  fi you are 180cm high and you are not sitting you can't see panoramic view But it is safe punctual convinient

title: Very nice experience
review: The sky train was perfect it was clean fast and inexpensive It was also easy to use and not confusing staff were helpful Only problem was there was what looked like a ticket booth so we asked for a ticket but instead we were gaven  change to buy a ticket from a machine the machine was confusing but staff were sure to help

title: Best Public Transportation for Solo Traveller
review: Well I really like this kind of public transportation during my travel and I often use it It's really confuse me first when I want to buy ticket and they gave me coins instead of tickets After some people give me instruction I just realize that I have to put it those coins inside the tickets machine to get entry card hahaha It's so hilarious because this is my first time ever

title: Best way to get around.
review: This is by far the best way to get around as I found taxi are troublesome and the roads are at a standstill most of the day Easy to buy ticket and follow the map and route

title: Great to get around
review: Once you get your head around the BTS sky train it is perfect for travelling We used it 23 times a day and it was ridiculously cheap Took us to pretty much all the tourist attractions

title: Great travel, convenient
review: Elevated train not handicapstroller friendly but what I love the most is people willing to offer their seats when they saw me pregnant and holding my son's hand Compared to what we have in our country the Siamese are extremely nice and selfless The offer seats wait for the passengers to walk out before entering the train fees are reasonable and people there are helpful Staff of ticketing counter don't speak much English so be prepare to learn some basics Trains are clean and cooling

title: save time in Bkk
review: Go through many interesting spots no time table but very often rides To purchase ticket should be easier to use the machine that can receive the bank note and changes

title: An Option to Avoid Bangkok Traffic Snarls
review: I use the BTS as one way of avoiding the road traffic in Bangkok especially when the roads are clogged or after a torrential downpour I also use the river and canal boats for the same purpose  Depending on the starting point and destination one or the other may be the appropriate choice For example one consideration if visiting Platinum Mall at Pratunam is the BTS station is a rather longer walk away compared to the canal boat station particularly on a hot day   BTS travel is generally cooler than boat travel However in peak hours the BTS trains can be like cans of sardines   One has to be nimble and quick when using canal or river boats  get in and out fast and with stability Further avoid water splashes while crusing along Boats can also be pretty packed at peak hours  Economics should not be ignored The BTS is excellent value for long journeys eg from Mo Chit to Saphan Taksin or On Nut BTS day tickets for much BTS travel in a day can prove to be a deal Taxis can be good value if travelling in a group of say 4 persons River and canal boats are generally inexpensive (perhaps tourist boats excepted) Don't forget the buses too as they are inexpsensive with the aircon ones being more comfortable The conductors and fellow passengers are generally helpful when it comes to point of disembarkation Motorbike taxis are convenient but when more than one is travelling consider the taxi too eg 20 THB for a short ride but for the same journey for 2 persons a taxi could be of equivalent cost Using the tuk tuk is an art when it comes to economics for a foreign visitor

title: Just about the most convenient way to get around Bangkok.
review: Clean fast comfortably airconditioned and best of all  far above the chaotic traffic Combine this with the MTS and the River boats and you have all of Bangkok covered (Well almost all)  If you plan to wander around Bangkok buy a day pass  140 Baht (about INR 280) We did that to explore the 'Amazing Thailand Sale'  at different malls and shops  made it easy for us to get around town You can use the convenient connections to get to Bangkok Station if you are taking the longdistance trains  especially if you are running late and have a longdistance train (or a flight from Dom Muang airport)

title: Efficient
review: Spent a lot of time walking in Bangkok but for those places to far to walk the BTS was fantastic quick efficient and easy to navigate clean and not too busy

title: affordable and easy to use - travel with the locals.
review: with traffic often a problem in Bangkok we decided to try the Skytrain It is clean efficient affordable and can get you close to where you need to go in most cases A great way to see Bangkok and avoid traffic woes

title: So cool
review: As long as you don't travel during peak hours this is a relaxing cooling scenic  and affordable way to get around the bustling Bangkok  Buy a multi card and get anywhere  you want

title: Very easy to use!
review: Great way to get around BKK It's very clean and staff are helpful It's cost effective too  It would be great to see this extended  Also more toilets and AC should be available A must use in BKK

title: Elevated train, nothing special, not handicap/stroller friendly
review: This is public transportation nothing different than the el train in Chicago or the mrt in Singapore not an attraction in my opinion but quite handy Note that you need coins to buy a ticket Also note that many stations do not have an elevator or escalators to go down do not the best form of transportation if you have a stroller or wheelchair

title: Great connectivity and clean
review: The sky train provides good connectivity to all the hotspots It is clean and has new coaches The ticketing system is simple and convenient If you have enough time and want to avoid the heavy Bangkok traffic then sky train is the answer

title: Independent travel for tourists!
review: V cheap to travel buy a day pass  (Â£3 ish per person) Everyone v friendly and happy to help with directions Much faster than taxis

title: Electric train system in Bkk
review: The BST light rail in the city is quite convenience and inexpensive for tourist who love to travel along the Sukhumvit road near the shopping area

title: Very efficient way to travel
review: Love the BTS Overtime we used it it was on time clean and air conditioned which was always such a welcome relief from the heat and humidity of Bangkok

title: Best moving in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is the best public transport from one point to the other It's very quick and easy overview

title: Very good, though my experience was during the evening rush hour
review: A very convenient transport to beat the heinous traffic of Bangkok The authority may think about other ways to expedite ticket vending system One has to stand in a queue first to get the necessary changes then go to the vending machines make a selection put in the required coins and then get one ticket at a time I needed 4 for my family and the whole process took about 10 minutes

title: Wonderful cheap clean air conditioned transport
review: Great service with frequent stops imagine the London Underground without the darkness heat and Mither Cheap as chips as well

title: Easy but very crowdy
review: We took the BTS to the water taxi during rush hour It is a very fast way of moving around but during rush hour extremely busy Thai people line up very nicely for onboarding But inside the BTS everybody was standing against each other

title: Clean and fast way to travel
review: Cheap and a very very fast way to travel Get a day pass or 3 day pass if you plan to goi around town

title: Clean and Efficient
review: Best way to go around the city if you want to avoid the gridlock down below Airconditioning is great It gets crowded but even on rush hour I did not experience it to be sardinestyle when I flew in from the airport on a Thursday afternoon 5pm Some stations have long queues to buy tickets and some don't accept bills so you have to queue separately to exchange your bills into coins Best way I thought would just buy a single ticket each time you ride  I have not tried the rabbit card though but it has the issuing fee which is nonrefundable however this will save you some time queuing up

title: The only way to get around in Bangkok
review: No traffic jams cheap air con and no haggling As a seasoned traveller in Bangkok this is the only way to get around in Bangkok

title: Efficient and Convenience
review: It is very efficient and convenience transport to go around It's very simple to use I suggest you to make a card not a singleused I think singleused is more expensive But if you are in group of minimal 4 persons I suggest to use a cabtaxi it will be cheaper and efficient you don't need to walk to the station

title: Travelling in Bangkok
review: It is good to get to know the BTS because it is so hard to get around the city  There are lines to buy the BTS pass  cheap and a must to has a pass

title: Best way to travel around in bkk
review: BTS is the fastest way to move around in bkk  I would not say cheapest as it doesn't touches every corners of bkk  Its clean n easy to use  I always prefer to buy a smart card as it saves me from the every time que   Cost of card is 180thb out of which 80 = card fee and balance 100 is for use

title: Very good public transport
review: The crowds are proof of the efficiency of their BTS Especially when you are unfortunate enough to cross swords with the Bangkok gridlock It is enough to ask for a visit from the grim reaper Now add rain to that and you've got it made The BTS is clean safe and cheap

title: Best Way to travel within Bangkok
review: This is the best and fastest way to travel within Bangkok The traffic is so bad in Bangkok that taxis can take a long time to get around the city   So if your destination is anywhere near a BTS station take this as your first option  If you are going to use it frequently buy a train pass at the station  You just add as much money as you want and you can always cash it out at the end of your trip  It saves you waiting in line to buy tickets especially during busy times  Trains come around every 5 mins so you never wait too long  And the AC on the train is comforting as Bangkok is Always Hot  Train rides are based on distance but expect to average $1 USD per one way  So it's clean fast and cheap

title: A Good System
review: Easy to get around using the city system Inexpensive as well Once you understand it is the usual 'know the direction you are going by knowing the end terminal both ways' and you have got it

title: Inexpensive and efficient
review: It is really modern and assists transport around the main points of Bangkok It does not go to the Grand Palace but that is only a short ride away bu TuckTuck   The locals are pleased to help and cash is available from the kiosks  then you have to use the ticket machine Also easy to use

title: Simple use
review: Even as a foreigner travelling the first time to Bangkok the sky train is very simple to use quick ( no traffic jam to be feared) low in terms of cost

title: Clean, safe, and efficient
review: An excellent mass transit system It conveniently connect with other mass transit systems in Bangkok including the MRT and Airport Rail Link It also connects with bus and boat transportation services   The trains are clean safe and well airconditioned for your comfort Try to avoid rushhour as they will be packed like sardines Ticket booths at stations are very convenient and offer change and helpful information Try to keep a supply of coins on hand as a majority of the automated ticket machines only accept coins   Fares range from only a few baht up to a maximum of 52 baht Frequent users should inquire about day passes and the Rabbit prepaid card which is convenient and also economical as it offers fare discounts

title: Well connecting
review: It covers most of Bangkok hotspot & happening areas Thumbs up Well connecting with other transportation like MRT & riverside boat rides

title: Good experience
review: A different way of travel if you do not want to take a taxi or tuk tuk It is a nice system that works fast and easy

title: Cheap and convenient
review: After watching movies and hearing stories we thought it was going to be a crazy mad house here in Bangkok It was crazy but it wasnât a mad house and the BTS Skytrain was very organized cheap and convenient People were friendly and answered questions if we had them provided they spoke some English Now the tuk tuk drivers are shady but you will not get cheated by published fares right

title: Accessible, Convenient
review: The BTS Skytrain is fast cheap accessible and close to most of the attractions in Thailand Take the train map from the station it will show you all of the places of interest you can reach within the BTS station   If you're lost seek a station conductor to guide you Even tho I have a bad experience with one of the station conductors who tried mislead my family when we're lost Unbelievable  But most of all trust your instincts and read the signs Some area is slightly more confusing then the others but most of the directions is pretty straight forward as they're written with English  I would recommend using the BTS Skytrain to avoid the taxis or tuk tuk scams

title: AlAlmost the worst public transport system in the world
review: Hot sweaty overcrowded under funded network that you are forced to use because the traffic is so bad Avoid rush hour at all costs

title: BTS is no BS
review: Great way to get around the city Fast and efficient Best way to get to and from the airport I reckon

title: Easy even for first timers
review: All signs are translated in English English option also available at the ticket machine Really easy to use and incredibly cheep but doesn't cover all attractions and areas of the city

title: Very user friendly
review: We took the skytrain a number of times Very cheap and tickets from the machines can be bought with coins and notes Great views of the city and polite queuing system

title: Most convinient
review: Skytrain is most convinient way to travel when in bangkok and not so expensive Taxis are mosty stuck in jam Tuk tuks rides are scary at times This is the best alternative

title: Quick, Clean and Safe
review: The BTS Skyttain in Bangkok is an extremely practical and reliable means of getting around  I had aome trouble with the machines to buy the tickets so just buy them at the counter

title: Nice and best
review: Awesome train good service and very convenient almost we could go everywhere because sky train connected with airport link also)

title: very clean and helpfull travel
review: It is one of the cheapest mode of transport compared to taxi and announcements are made in both Thai and English Language

title: Avoid the traffic
review: The Skytrain is highly recommended especially during rushhour periods It is fast efficient and wellrun Buy a day pass if you intend to do a few journeys

title: Cheap and fast!
review: Took the sky train from the airport 35baht so much cheaper than a taxi  After this I only took the skytrain and metro Can get busy but on time and regular

title: Very efficient and effective
review: This was our  main mode of transportation in Bangkok given the state of traffic there Keep a hotel close a sky train

title: Easy to use, very good service, strong aircondition
review: One of the best way to get around during rushhour especially for travelers  in Bangkok  At  that  time would be difficult to find a taxi If you catch a taxi charge will be sometimes with the meter but  most  likely inflated rate for  foreigner Avoid all this by using  BTS  The trains are clean cheaper and faster  than a taxi  If  you intend to visit more places during  the day  buy a day ticket  for 140 THB  Personally  I  use  frequently  Skytrain  than MRT

title: very easy to use
review: going around bangkok easily if you travel alone to bkk the price is reasonable and cheap you should using coin money for buying BTS ticket because you will buy with machine ticket there if you don't have coin money just ask the exchange room the staff can provide the coin machine for you they also give BTS MaP for foreign people the BTS is so fast clean

title: Skytrain
review: Very convenient will take you all over the city for cheaper than a tuk tuk Plus it's air conditioned

title: Always another train...well, until midnight.
review: The BTS of Bangkok is the best transit systems I have seen in South East Asia They do a great job They are friendly helpful and try to communicate with the customers wirh respect I recommend this form of transportation

title: Well managed  and easy to commute
review: Its one of  best and cheap  mode of transport in Bangkok You can reach and access all prime locations through BTS Sky trains   clean and well maintained stations   Easy to understand the routes   The staff is also very helpful in explaining the routes and rates  Maps are available  for tourists on all stations

title: BTS is very clean and fastest transfer, safety convenience comfortatble
review: BTS is very clean and fastest transfer safety convenience comfortable Price cheap and easy to buy ticket

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok.
review: The skytrain is by far the easiest way to travel around Bangkok Easy to navigate and relatively cheap compared to Bangkok's dreadful taxis Skytrain drivers will always stop at your station and allow you to enterexit the train Unlike the taxis who will refuse to take you or even turn on their meters and will physically attack you if you complain  The only drawbacks on the skytrain are the limited number of lines and destinations available but other lines are currently being built  Also the skytrain can sometimes feel like you are travelling inside a freezer uncomfortabley icey after the hot and humid atmosphere in Bangkok If you can take the skytrain to your destination  do so you won't regret it

title: The best and cheapest way to move in Bangkok
review: Okay there is a lot of people in Asok or Siam stations okay tuk tuk are more authentic But after 45 minutes of traffic jam in a tuk tuk you will maybe reconsider to take bts Haha  Most of the time the best way to move place to place in Bangkok is to take the BTS to avoid the traffic jam and save a tons of money and then take the taxi or a tuk tuk if you really like it since most of the places to visit arent that close from a bts station Enjoy your time in Bkk

title: Best Infrastructure
review: Awesome Experience and Perfect timing for all The best way to travel in the entire of Bangkok I really enjoyed all of my rides on BTS

title: Good n easy transport
review: No hassle with traffics  Most important is not need to negotiations with taxi driver I would suggest to choose accommodation close to BTS ( walking distance )

title: Easy, fast, cheap and air conditioned
review: I always prefer to go around by Skytrain Buy a day ticket if you use it a lot It is normally much faster than a taxi and has a super freezingly cold aircondition

title: A Lesson to Manage Rush
review: I belong to India To be specifically hail from Kolkata and now reside in Mumbai  Both the cities have respectively metro rail and train as the major commuting public transport Unfortunately both the cities crashed in front of extreme public rush   Coming to Bangkok and seeing the system if BTS sky train indeed a pleasure Starting from the self service counter to the coin changing offices to the mode of operation of the trains  is a lesson to manage huge rush   The city has made it possible in an extremely simple yet technologically and strategically efficient way ensuring safety and relief from the stranded traffic of the city

title: Great way to get around
review: Very easy to use each station has a information point Tickets can be bought either through self ticket machines or manned counters Very cheap for a 1 day tourist day pass (140 thai bhat) The map contains the various sites that can be visited at each station I strongly recommend using this transport as it will save you a lot of money plus time (traffic jams in Bangkok are awful)

title: Well maintained
review: Its the best mode of transport in Bangkok Gets crowded at peak hours but they are clean and well maintained

title: Easy to take
review: It's really simple train Usage of going around everywhere it's really convenient Always needs 10 TBH coins to buy ticket Or if take many times in a day better purchase 1 day pass

title: Easy, cheap and fast
review: Always take the skytrain when you can It's easy (once you understand the system so take 10 minutes to ask someone some questions) and comfortable

title: Best way to travel across Bangkok
review: Bangkok BTS Skytrain service spread across the city from East to West and North to South Language wont be a problem at all since every instruction is present in English as well The complete list of stations and the current station information is present at every exit Usually will be crowded But that doesn't matter if considered the traffic within the city The officials and security personnels are very friendly and helpful Tickets are very cheap and easy to get tickets as there are many ticket vending machines Most of the stations are connected to Malls etc

title: Convenient for travellers
review: The Skytrain in Bangkok is the most efficient way to avoid the terrible traffic However the route is somewhat short and do not access some areas in the city However in 5 years there will be 58 more routes that are under construction right now

title: Efficient and great way to travel
review: Provided you buy a one day pass BTS is a very quick and comfortable (air conditioned) way to travel We stayed in Silom and used the BTS to get to Chatuchak (Mo Chit BTS) and National Stadium  Siam BTS stations One day pass was great because it meant we avoided the long queues to buy single tickets

title: Great way to travel
review: The Skytrain is a great way to travel fast and frequent and ticket purchasing is straight forward and cheap I walked everywhere for the first couple of days before trying the Skytrain and it saved a lot of time  It can be very busy at peak times When queueing make sure to stand on the highlighted points to the side of the doors and don't be afraid to walk onboard before you get overtaken by the masses

title: great form of transport
review: We travelled by Sky train as a family of 4 with teenagers It was easy to get around with clear announcements of stations The trains were very clean fast air conditioned and felt safe The trains were regular too Definitely my preferred mode of transport in Bangkok

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: So impressed with the BTS skytrain  So easy to use clean efficient  and economical Staff very helpful with directions We traveled from the airport to the shopping centres It does get busy at times but you all board and disembark in an orderly manner It us clearly stated in both Thai and English what the next station is Felt safe traveling  The map guides are easy to understand and to purchase tikens and cards is not difficult When comparing to Melbournes MYKI public transport system I feel for any tourists here as its so inferior to the BTS

title: Great way of getting around
