review: Thought this was the easiest way of getting around the city Main downside is that it does not go to the Palace area where there is a lot of tourist attractions   Be careful of scams when exiting the station There are people claiming to be tourist information with green badges on They try and sell rip off boat trips on the river and try to get you into the tuktuks The official tourist information is an office   Stations are clean and it's good value

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Excellent service I recommend BTS if you are travelling anywhere on its routes The services are very frequent the stations clean and usually accessible via escalator there is always a guard on the platformthe trains are clean and the cost minimal Consider too that it saves you the hassle of finding a taxi that will use the meter and not want to charge a 'farangforeigner inflated rate Only one problem is endemicthe trains are almost always full  standing room only You need to be prepared to hold onto the overhead straps or whatever solid bar you can find However the trains do not sway too much and it is relatively easy to keep your balance

title: Quick and efficient
review: The BTS skytrain is quick efficient and always clean  The signage is easy to understand in terms of where you need to go You need coins to buy tickets but the manned desks exchange notes for coins Cheap to use too

title: BTS - Air con
review: Taking the Skytrain was fun When the weather is hot and humid the sky train offers very cool air conditioned cars The announcement before each stop is communicated in English Great riding the BTS with the family Appears very safe

title: Skytrain
review: The Bangkok Skytrain is very good for getting around the city It connects well with the underground

title: Good but not as good as MRT in Singapore
review: BTS is good in Bangkok and is good to beat the traffic jam however it is not as effective as MRT in Singapore BTS is not that efficient and one still needs to walk to reach the destination Besides one needs to change many trains and it is always very crowded and preconditioning is quite poor

title: Quick, clean and simple
review: Get a day pass or 3 day pass as it gives you more freedom and works out cheaper if you make a couple of trips  You can buy yhem at the counter on the station  Cleaner and more comfortable than London Underground best way to get around a very crowded city

title: Great system
review: In and around Bangkok this and the MRT are the only way to travel All are air comditioned and they get you out of the air pollution at street level which is really bad Faster than a taxi and less hasle They could do with an integrated ticket covering both systems and day passes Day passes are availabe for each system seperately  Limited places they travel too but good enough for a tourist

title: Best way to travel around the city
review: Best way to travel around the city of bangkok I love taking BTS whenever I want to go to stay away from the traffic

title: Easy
review: The sky train was wonderfully air conditioned and fun to ride Everyone was courteous and respectful getting on and off Easy to follow maps and reasonable prices

title: simple and easy to get round Bangkok and close to all shopping malls
review: great way to get round Bangkok and easy to navigate a simple and easy to get round Bangkok and close to all shopping malls and temples

title: Excellent
review: Clean fast quite cheap mode of transport around Bangkok You never have to wait long as a train comes every few minutes Recommended

title: Easy to use even for Non-Thai speakers
review: Many signs and pamphlets in English Maps of the BTS routes are also clearly displayed on a large board  I used the Nana BTS and Asok BTS Nana and Asok are nearby and are a 10 minute walking distance from each other Asok BTS also connects to Terminal 21 Mall   The BTS Stations are very well maintained and clean

title: Great way to get around
review: The BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok without encountering traffic heat rain and the hustle and bustle of a busy city The stations are clearly indicated above the doors and the messages are in English and Thai The cost is so cheap and easy to obtain a ticket Station staff are also helpful as it is confusing when you first try the BTS Once you have tried you will keep returning to this means of transport over others Some people may have difficulty reaching the station as some can only be accessed by stairs I notice that escalators have been introduced at some stations

title: Nice Ride
review: Although the train was extremely crowded tickets were easy to buy and the process was straight forward  It was easy to get to the places I wanted to visit  Overall if you don't mind the tight spaces the skytrain is an effortless and cheap way to get around

title: Use BTR versus the shady cabs!
review: The BTR is great Very clean safe and the AC is soooooo strong that you'll be more comfortable then sitting in a cab   Yes it can get busy during rush hour but it's moving at normal speeds versus being stuck in a cab that moves only a block every 30 minutes  Our first trip on the BTR was a bit confusing but the local people in Thailand are so friendly that if you ask someone for help they're more then happy to assist   Thank you Thailand for being such wonderful and nice people You guys made using the BTR so easy I'll always use the BTR versus getting ripped off by the taxi drivers

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: By far the best and easiest way to travel in Bangkok very cheap and easy to use the Air Conditioned carriages are a welcome stop off from the heat and humidity

title: Busy but a must in the heat
review: Easy to use and cheap but does get busy around 5 rush hournice to get out of the heat Plenty of stair to get to it though

title: Use BTS not taxis.
review: Bangkok has notorious for the traffic jam everywhere pretty much all day long Especially if you are travel in busy shopping district in town you would be better off use BTS train they are air conditioned clean running regular service

title: Best way to see the city
review: Always use the sky train when in Bangkok Its really easy to use and navigate and is as cheap as chips

title: Very nice and clean
review: It connects you to almost all tourists spots Very easy and user friendly Staff at ticket counter very helpful Stations very clean There are security checks to get in and out of the stations We looked like tourists and were accompanied by our child but we were not bothered by the guards Inside the train all stations are well written so its very easy to let you know when to get down Thumbs up to the authorities

title: Good
review: was a little crowded but thats normal for any large city public transportation Very fast cheap and easy to use even for someone who does not speak or write Thai language I use the BTS skytrain anytime I am traveling around Bangkok

title: Great way to travel in BKK
review: One of my favourite modes of transport in BKK to major areas of the city Usually select a hotel near a sky train station Easy and quick way to travel above the busy traffic Try to avoid peak times Does not go to all parts of the city but there are connections with the underground MRT trains and taxis are reasonably priced to complete journeys to sites  The trains are very clean with air con Convenient multi tickets are available or carry change to use in the ticket vending machines Can also get change from a staffed booth and pick up a free map of the system

title: Great value
review: Used the sky train many times during our visit to Bangkok very cheap and quick way to travel Good idea to have change available for buying tickets from the ticket machines

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: It is no doubt the best way to travel in Bangkok We just love riding the BTS when we are in Bangkok A true blessing for the city known for notorious traffic

title: Prompt - fast - easy - clean
review: Is so so convenient to travel by BTS skytrain to all the sites that you wish to visit in Bangkok The best part of the BTS skytrain stations are they have covered walkways that link to most of the big shopping malls With the horrendous traffic jams in Bangkok BTS skytrain is the best way to go about

title: Excellent Sky train in Bangkok
review: One of best ways to get around BangkokInexpensive and can be a lot quicker than a car in the heavy Bangkok traffic  From the airport you can catch the Sky train  It takes about 20 minutes and is the best way to get to the city centre  The Sky train will take you to Phaya Thai station and if you are travelling to MBK or Siam Paragon shopping malls it is only 2 more stops  These stops are only about 500 metres apart

title: Very Simple. . . .
review: At first I was worried about not knowing the language the city and the general direction of where everything is located but the first time we took the skytrain you realize how simple it is to follow  It's clean somewhat crowded on certain stops and simple to do

title: Cool alternatieve to traffic jams!
review: The Bangkok Transport System (BTS) or Skytrain is a cool and especially handy way around toen and the best way to beat the notorious traffic jams According to the latest TomTom Traffic index about 57% of travel time is now wasted on any time traveling on the streets of Bangkok not just between 57 PM For both Tourist and resident the BTS makes live easier to get around although the service does not cover all of Bangkok yet Various extensions are under construction   With clever use however you can go around beat traffic and get to all almost major attractions or connecting ways of transport like subway Airport Link Bus Terminals like Ekkemai meeting poinst like Victory Monument and the Chao Praya River Boat Express So the service is also handy as a starling point on a trip further away  There are 2 major lines the Silom line from National Stadium (near MBK Shopping Centre) to Bang Wah (Thonburi Side) and the Sukhumwit line from Mochit (near the Weekend Market) and Bearing (direction BangNa highway) Remember those endpoints as they are used on the signs as the direction of travel So let say travelling from Ekemai to Victory Monument the correct direction will be Mochit  Enter a BTS station (BTS logo and massive concrete construction above you're head) go to the ticket coin machine and hand over those 10 Baht coins These are the ones with the golden centre The machine will also accept smaller coins  Choose you're destination first by pressing the correspondent button (they have a unique code like E7 for Ekkemai) pay and collect the plastic ticket Keep it with you as you need it for passing the lane at start and destination  Nowadays there are also touch screen machines in Thai and English language which will accept both coins and banknotes At these touch screens you can als top up the Rabbit Cards a more easier prepaid way to avoid stacking up or changing banknotes at the counter You can buy the type1 card for 80  Baht (no deposit) and add eather a number of 30 day valid trips or an amount (100 Baht up to max 4000 Bath) or even both Unless you are frequent in Bangkok I advise the easy topup method Your money will keep it's value for some years Buy the Rabbit card at the counter they have Adult and Student types Just hold the card at the detection lane and wait for the green light to let you pass Usually there are seperate lanes for Rabbid card at most right hand side  Finally to sum up the major points on the 2 lines  Sukhumwit Line   N8 Mochit endpoint Weekend Market Bangkok Chatuchak (biggest semiopen Market in Thailand selling literally everything) Chatuchak Park and nearby Mochit Bus Terminal connection with Metro station Chatuchak Park  N3 Victory Monument (soawalee as Thai call it) walking distance to the old city centre with GrandPalace temple of declining buddha etc Also at this very busy interjunction at the left and right Side and in Soi to Phetburi Road several minivan services will take you to various destinations in and around Bangkok Ayutthaya for example Prices vary from 3035 Baht to 5060 Baht These services run all day untill early evening and are widely used bij Thai people commuting At Victory momument you pay at the counter along the way they will stop at bus stops to pick people up and you pay by putting money in a basket Just ask the price if you are not sure  N2 Phya Thai connection with the excellent and cheap Airport City Link to Suvarnabhumi Airport But also the getting off point for walking to the famous Pratunam (Watergate) river taxi stops Pratunam clothings Market and Central WorldErawan shrine if you like walking for about 45 minutes  E3 Nana for the (in)famous entertainment strip  E4 Asok connection with Metro  E7 Ekkamai for the Bus Station to Pattaya and eastern destinations Ice Speed Rink SubZero (wednesday discount 50% off regular price)  Silom Line   W1 National Stadium MKB shopping centre Sport Stadium (running track and olympic size swimming pool for those who want to sport)  Siam interchange between Silom and Sukhumwit line be sure to choose the right platform sometimes you have to go upstairsdownstairs look carefully at the signs  remember all 4 endpoints by name Siam Paragorn shopping centre and cinema Sea Aquarium  S2 Sala Daeng connection with Metro from here you can connect to 1 of the piers of the Chao Praya River Express boats  S3 Chong Nonsi connection with Bus Rapid Transit Route (BRT) a new bus service that runs south along Rama 9 and Rama 3 bridge to the Thonburi side to  S6 Saphan Thaksin Brinks to the bridge near The OriÃ«ntal hotel Silom Road and (in) famous Patpong area S10 Bang Wah terminal station not to far from busstop to The Mall Bangkae with Fantasy Lagoon rooftop swimming park (wonderfull for Family with children)  Oh and don't forget to grab a free copy of the BTS system with some handy maps

title: very convenient
review: Definitely very convenient especially for tourists and the people living in bangkokit's very comfortable and comprehensive too  the only gripe is that there is one more different lines in the outskirt can't remember the line and it can't accept the same BTS stored value card likely different operator  But still a major improvement in transport around bangkok

title: fully air conditioned comfortable journey
review: Air conditioned carriages are a true blessing in the hot humid weather Easy to navigate around and cheap

title: Fast and smooth
review: Riding the train was clean quick and smoothonly issue was having never riden a subway or commuter train like thisi didnt know how to get a ticket The train workers were very helpful with thisalso the stations were unbelievably clean and quiet  Great way to get around

title: From the NYC Subway to the BTS SkyTrain
review: Growing up in New York City I have become a bit of a snob when it comes to railed transportation in cities  The BTS SkyTrain is wonderfully kept easy to navigate and an absolute necessity to speedy travel above Bangkok instead of getting caught in the traffic below  A wonderful vein of the Bangkok daily life that everyone should venture on  JM

title: Easy - fast - nice price
review: the BTS Skytrain is a very easy and fast train to bring you everywhere in Bangkok According to the traffic jam i prefer this in most situation before i take a taxi (It`s faster and cheaper)  The system is really easy   Go to the station  Check at the plans (they are at the ticket machines) which destination you want  Directly at the Destination on the map you find a number (which is the price for one way  28 32 48 and so on)  If you don`t have enough coins go to the informationdesk they will change it for your (if you tell them where you want to go they give it already suitable to you)  go back to the machine and point on the number (which is the price)  so if your destination costs 28 Baht just point on "28"  Pay  Get the ticket and go to trains  That`s it  Easy and fast system  if i compare to german ticket machines it is really crazy how easy it is

title: Clean cheap and quick
review: Every entry has guards all the way through the night and day and it's easy to use  6 stops for 2 people Â£120

title: Clean n fast
review: My first time on BTS train n the cleanliness n timely schedule plus speed amazed me Only the queuing for tickets was v slow as queue was long Otherwise an amazing mass transporter

title: Best way to get around
review: BTS has lots of connections whether it may be the Airport link MRT bus or the normal train i enjoyed travelling by BTS and the trains are fascinating and fast My favorite station would be Sapkan Taksin because it only have one railway and both east & west trains need to stop by the bridge in order one of them to use it Fare is not that cheap but is worth it

title: If you are from London, This will Amaze You!
review: What can I say 1000 times cleaner than the Underground Trains amazing with big LCD Screens in each carriage Views are amazing from the windows If you want to see Bangkok use this and sight see for a few Bahts Maps are easy to follow and really cheap to use Far cheaper than taxis for sure

title: Inexpensive and effective
review: Used multiple times Allows for easy access to many locations around Bangkok particularly the airport Is cheap Only downside is it can become crowded especially during peak periods but that is standard for public transport worldwide Recommended

title: Convenient
review: BTS is great compare to the traffic in Bangkok it's quick convenient and runs on time If you can take sky train don't hesitate as the street traffic is soooooo bad it takes 1 hour for 4km

title: Fastest way to travel in Bangkok
review: If you have been to Bangkok even for a day or two you would have encountered its bad traffic situation The best way to travel in Bangkok is through sky trains (called BTS) or subways (called MRTs) They can get crowded at peak hours in the mornings and evenings but once you are inside one you would reach your destination on time guaranteed The roads however are notorious for getting jammed even at odd hours of the day

title: Clean & Easy to Use
review: Nice contrast to Europe cities to see a relatively clean transport system It is also air conditioned and only stuffy when it's  jam packed around rush hours

title: it's make city life more comfortable but pricing is not cheap enough for public transport.
review: it's make life easier when you have to travel in Bangkok especial rush hour Anyway If you compare price to other transportationsuch as taxi or busit's very expensive

title: The best way to get around
review: Ok if you have limited time in BKK like a day or so go with taxi if you have a few days go by BTS its fantastic and mostly its very cheap There is no place you cant go on the BTS well it takes you to main spots and locations and then the rest is up to you The main thing is this form of transport is fast and no traffic jams (famous in BKK) so do your selves a fovour and just travel on BTS its save and fast

title: Best way to avoid traffic in BKK
review: The BTS service in general is excellent trains are clean fast enough on time Lines covering most of the malls in BKK Always take the BTS and avoid the traffic nightmare in BKK

title: Accessible
review: Easy and practical access by having both MRT and BTS linked closelythe station positioned outside the hotel by riding two station you are linked to the BTS of Asok station in Sukhmvit

title: Easy way to get around a big city
review: Efficient on time and a great value to navigate a large city Use this instead of cabs whenever possible

title: Getting around the city commuter style
review: Very easy to usemore stations addedalthough it does not cover all the sights you may wish to see it is probably the fastest

title: Bangkok on the Move
review: Dependable  clean and crowded  Some time the queue to buy tickets may get long  They have day long pass  No week long pass

title: Very efficient mode of transportation
review: The BTS is great  it is clean safe  nicely airconditioned and very efficient The only complaint and this is a big issue is that not all stations have escalators so you often have to walk up 74 steps in the Bangkok heat and above the stifling air pollution  this is particularly bad for people who are disabled

title: Great fun
review: Loved the sky train we used it straight from the airport it took us straight to the area our hotel was in with a 5 min walk to the door used it for all our travel clean cool and cheap will do it again when we return

title: Everytime we visit Bangkok, we ride the Skytrain.  I love the simplicity and effectiveness of this raised system.
review: The Skytrain can take you pretty much anywhere you need to go in the majority of Bangkok areas  It is an easy system to use and daily passes are very inexpensive if you are going to do a lot of running around in the city

title: Why is this service not available in the UK!!!
review: What an amazing transportation system way more modern than the UK We in the UK have to settle for the London Underground system but people in Bangkok get to use this awesome train called a Skyline And trust me it is as cool as the name suggests   Cheap Cool  Safe

title: Must use!
review: The sky train is quick air conditioned and cheap if you get the one day pass(120 baht) Very easy to use and take you across most of the city

title: The original solution to traffic
review: the Skytrain is another mode of mass transport that beets both the traffic and the heat be warned that it gets very busy at rush hour especially if it rains

title: Great transportation and not too expensive
review: We used the train on part of our journey from the airport into the city (to the Siam centre) Very efficient and cost effective transportation

title: Cheap, Fast and breezy...
review: BTS skytrain is actually the best solution this country has came up with to beat the bad traffic in bangkok  As you know bangkok is a jam city it is actually faster to take train to get to your destination but you got to walk a littlethen to sit in the car and beating the traffic so you got to prepare to sweat a little  The coin machine will issue ticket and dont accept notes You need to change at the counter where you see queues Initially i thought i can get ticket over counter but the lady will tell you the fare and exhange coin for your note  So like in Japan you need to press the number which is actually the fare and then put the coins i couldnt get it at all on the display since there is no english at all  I forgot to take photo just now but the nearest station from where i stayed is mo chit One stop down i get to Big C the good supermarket in thailand  The train is clean and pleasant cooling   Go try

title: Easy to use and reliable
review: This is one of the easiest public transit systems of any major city in the world and also one of the least expensive Excellent air conditioning was welcome on a very hot day Just one quibble you need coins to purchase a ticket  At the busiest times of the day the lines for purchasing tickets are quite long

title: Easy way to get around
review: It works really well for a vast metropolis like Bangkok easy to access to get where you want to go and very cheap it's hard not to make use of

title: ONLY WAY to control time in Bangkok
review: Very easy to use with announcements in both Thai and English With the crazy traffic in Bangkok the BTS is the only way to get around efficiently

title: very convin
review: it is a very pleasant and convenient transportation  but the fee is not cheap than other transportation

title: I wish BTS is near to my house
review: I always use BTS to travel in Bangkok it's a good choice for people like me who are not driving a car But still quite limited because the BTS's journey is still considered pretty short you can't possibly travel everywhere I guess for me there are more advantages Super fast as well as clean

title: Lots of passengers
review: Bts runs through major malls and more convenient   Hectic chaos beware of pick pocket during rush hour   Avoid and take mrt I think it is better

title: Transportation
review: A great and inexpensive way to get around the city The aircon is also a great way to get a break from the heat and humidity

title: Easy travel
review: Cheap clean and fast to get across Bangkok which trying to do by road is a nightmare usually busy so don't expect a seat but it's air conditioned so nice when it's hot as it usually is in Bangkok

title: Highly convenient.
review: For more than 4 people meter taxi is more convenient but can get stuck in traffic in rush hour So bts is faster

title: Efficient but usually very crowded.
review: At peak times you'll feel like a sardine and often at other times as well Most of the time you won't get a seat But they run freqently and seem quite reliable As long as you have small change you can purchase tickets from a machine If you lack small change you can queue up to get some The BTS is often a faster alternative to going by taxi as traffic in some areas of Bangkok is notoriously congested

title: Efficient system
review: Quick and efficient system  well clean and well maintained coaches The fares are very reasonable Good experience

title: Fast & cheap transportation
review: My favourite transportation to go everywhere fast and cheap â¤ I can reach Bangkok's point in the centre of city i can reach Chatutchak weekend market even its located in the last point of BTS Then from Chatutchak market i can find airport with bus and amount THB 10 per person

title: Convenient and Normally Quick Transportation in Bangkok
review: I use the BTS to commute backforth to school twice a week It's convenient to my house about a 10 minute walk to Ploen Chit station I take the Sukhumvit line change at Siam to the Silom line to Chong Nonsi There are times that I have had to wait for a second train at Ploen Chit and once had to wait on a 3rd train at Siam Also the prices for the trip passes has recently increased The 15 ride pass is now 450 baht But it's still more economical money and time wise than buying individual fares The BTS covers much of Bangkok's attractions and riders can switch to the MRT or BRT at designated stations However if your destination is Ko Rattanakosin (the older part of Bangkok) you're out of luck with BTS However you can ride to Saphan Taksin and hop on a river boat taxi that will take you to Tha Tien pier where it is a short walk to Wat Po and Wat Phra Gaew

title: Better than nothing.
review: Everyday I'm suffering but thankfully at least there is something 3 Not gonna say it is bad tho since I still couldn't think of better way to work without using BTS

title: Best mode of transport
review: This is a must means of transport for visitors and locals alike it's fast super efficient and good value Best of all easy to use

title: Sky train is a blessing in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok
review: Skytrain is the most convenient way to travel inside the inner core of the city It is also well connected to the MRT (underground) system in Bangkok which makes travel even more useful Usually it is also very safe and I have not heard of any accident or pick pockets on the train

title: Fast and Clean
review: I am always amazed what Siemens can build This is a convinient and fast transportation munic would be blessed to have this form the airport to the city

title: Working public transport system
review: Traffic in Bangkok is horrible and this is one of the saving graces When we decide where to go or where to stay we always make sure that it is within walking distance from the BTS (or metro) The service is reliable and affordable Yes it is used extensively by many people so during peak times the trains are quite full but you are not that long on there so standing a few minutes between stations are not that bad If you plan on being in Bangkok for a longer period get a card  better than having to buy a ticket (with coins) at the machine each time

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is by far the best way to get around Bangkok as long as your destination points are near BTS stations  It is clean safe and you never wait more than a couple of minutes  The absolute best way to get between the many shopping malls in BKK which all seem to be stationed perfectly on the BTS line with entrances incorporated into the BTS station stops

title: usefull, fast and cheap
review: the title says it all totally worth taking it When you take a cheaper hotel outside the center we recommend to look that it is close to the skytrain also if you go to the airport it's very cheap don't get dumped by some bad taxi divers

title: Clean and Convenient
review: Clean on time pass through heavy traffic area a lot faster The coverage expand to cover more part of Bangkok and connect with subway so it easier not to drive in Bangkok

title: A most excellent way to travel around Bangkok
review: A extremely easy service to use Very cheap to use Always have plenty of coins to buy tickets and if not ask for change at the ticket counter

title: Safe time but routes are not cover
review: Safe time and comfortable but the routes are not cover the hub area in Bangkok Reasonable price with quite good service

title: Ride it
review: Very useful form of transport through the big city of Bangkok AC is cold and the stops are close to interesting places

title: Observing BTS Train
review: The best way to use the BTS is to get a Day Ticket Cost is 140bath The Train is clean and about every 15 minute here is a other one But avoid Peak  hours at about 1700 hr the the train is very full Most Train Station have Lift and escalators but some have step stepsThe Rain station are covered and lots have Train Police  so they are very safeAs the BTS runs above the Roads on Conkrete Lines You will have a very good view over Bangkok( Highly recommended)

title: Easy to use!
review: BTS Skytrain makes your visit to Bangkok worthed It really help in transpotting yourself around the city without traffic Easy to use with nice information in each stations I will absolutely use BTS Train if I come back for my holiday to Bangkok

title: Good way to travel
review: These Re fast and easy to travel around Bangkok They don't offered children's prices ( except for very young children) so that adds up when you are travelling with a family but it is a fun experience for children  Very clean and efficient  Could do do with some more stations

title: The only way to get around Bangkok!
review: Very clean amazing air conditioning has english and thai woman speaking directions on it and has a panel saying what is at each station as well as a clear map of where the train goes If you will use it all the time get a unlimited weekly (can't remember its name) well worth it

title: Ideal Transport
review: best way to get around Bangkok safe and inexpensive there is also access to the airport The trains run frequently and are comfortable and air conditioned

title: Good way travelling around in the city
review: Convenient for travelling around although it's always crowded Taking the BTS will save you a lot of time from the traffic jam in the city and it covered most the important area Thai people are very polite as well they always give up their seat for my wife and my kid

title: Fast and efficient
review: One of the best easiest and quickest ways to get around Bangkok Fast and efficient no delays between trains

title: just perfect!
review: A very modern and easy method of transportation in Bangkok The level of cleanliness and easy of use was remarkable

title: Cheap and convenient
review: Cheap and convenient but there are 2 green lines which can be a bit confusing It doesn't reach the old city but you can take it to the ferry and take the ferry which is also cheap to old city

title: It's dead easy to use!
review: I only did one short trip just to test it out The process is very easy at the ticket machine and within a couple of minutes you are through the barrier and on the train Good views of the city can be had from the train It's safe very clean and tidy

title: Mode of transportation that is the most convenient
review: This mode of transportation in Bangkok is very convenient However it can be really costly to travel Though costly it is way faster than the cars or buses

title: A different experience
review: Fast and efficient A different way of travelling into town It is wise to plan your journey and use the public transportation especially during peak hours instead of using taxis and tuktuks

title: I live here and know the lay of the land
review: Only way to travel in bangkok I take the local busses but I know all the routes Bus 25 goes up and down the main drag (Suk)

title: fast trains
review: Liked the air conditioning and frequency of trains Easy to travel in Bangkok in tidy trains One of the best commuting facility in the world

title: Excellent transport
review: This is so great for the tourist Easy transport to get everywhere so easy  cheap and fast Will use it all the time

title: Safe!
review: Quick clean and efficient Felt safe when travelling on Skytrain Stops at or near shopping areas including MBK

title: Bangkok sky train
review: Very effective cheap and regular just like using the tube in London We travelled to Pat Pong and visited the temples Recommend Shian Square and the Aquarium just as you get off the train

title: Efficient Easy travel
review: Cheap and easy travel to shopping destinations in Bangkok Staff at Station also helpful to passengers with bulky items eg luggage etc

title: Fast and Convenient mode of transportation in Bangkok
review: Its fast and connected to all major attractions in Bangkok For tourist  and for local commuters they have many passes ranging from one day to one month To avoid traffic in Bangkok use BTS Its safe

title: Good way to avoid the traffic
review: Reminds me a bit of the London Tube with the "mind the gap" The BTS is a good way to get around to the main areas of town and avoid the traffic

title: Fast Affordable Travel
review: Fast affordable travel But if with a group of 34 sometimes it may be cheaper to travel in a taxi or tuk tuk Travelling in skytrain is cheap only if 12 persons are traveling

title: very reliable
review: This is a great way to get around Spent sometime on the skytrain found it very easy and convienient to use Well worth it

title: BTS experience
review: although they have difficulty speaking english the train is very comfy considering the rush and hassle dazzle

title: To avoid traffic jam
review: If you have an appointment in Bangkok it is recommendable to take BTS upto the nearest station of your meeting spot in order not to be involved traffic jam and to reach in time

title: Consistently efficient
review: Having been on similar city metro trains in many cities worldwide the Sky Train in Bangkok is brilliant and great value

title: Easy Access but Prepare to Squeeze in!!!
review: This train is so busy that most people push and shove their way on This didn't bother me much but some people were pretty annoyed For the most part the Thai people are just trying to get to or come home from work so go easy on them and the tourists should learn to respect this  My only complaint is that the train is limited to where it can take you It doesn't take you anywhere close to the river but if you get off at the last stop and jump in a cab it's not too bad

title: Very easy to use - we love our rabbit card
review: Very efficient way to navigate the city We got a chargeable Rabbit Card (essentially the same as an Oyster Card in London or the Octopus Card in Hong Kong) Even at peak hours the trains were busy but cool and not uncomfortably packedNo rushing to get on board either A very good alternative to using a Taxi The Rabbit Card comes with a loyalty scheme that's called  you guessed it  Carrot Rewards Genius

title: Convenient transport - unless you are carrying luggage
review: Very few BTS stations have elevators  most stations are a maze of levels connected by stairs Can be very inconvenient when hauling luggage Otherwise the trains are clean airconditioned and and frequent although crowded during peak hour

title: Skytrain rules
review: Probably one of the most convenient ways to get around Bangkok Take a tuktuk or motorbike taxi (watch your knees) one time for the experience and switch to the skytrain for convenienc and ease of use For longer stays check out different ticket optionsq

title: New trains and fast
review: For sure this is the best way to move around bangkok The car traffic is really crazy in this huge city Safe your money and your time

title: Great public transport
review: Convenient and easy to access I hope a line to the Don Meung Airport opens soon  That is the only line that is needed then it is perfect

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around One things a did notice on this visit is that the trains might becoming to small to handle the capacity of people they might need to think about getting bigger trains

title: Get a rabbit and see the city
review: Bangkok roads are often grid locked getting about for those not willing to use motorbike taxi is via MRT BTS or the river The BTS is a sky train running through the centre of the city I would recommend buying a rabbit pre paid card then travel as much as you like until it runs out then top up don't forget when you leave you can get the deposit back The trains run regularly they are clean and airconditioned no eating or drinking on the train You can stop at major shopping centres entering the mall without having to go to ground level

title: A great way to view the city
review: Fast and easy to go And very cheap Buy a ticket and you can enjoy riding through the city with just 2 dollars Viewing from above is super nice especially when you got fed up with Bangkok's famous traffic jam Should do in daytime as 67pm is always packed

title: The best way to avoid Bangkok traffic
review: We took the BTS just once to get the feel and must say it is welcome break from the almost stationery Bangkok traffic No haggling with taxi drivers and a swift mode of transport

title: My fav ride in Bangkok
review: Public Transportation system is quite rich in Bangkok and among all the other options this is my favorite one I always stay close to Nana BTS station and thus I use this service a lot This is much cheaper than taxi and faster as well You can freely roam around your targeted attractions with it without traffic I always take the one day pass which lets me travel through the day under one ticket

title: Nice to see.,
review: nice to see the nice trant in Bangkok it's very nice to see that for suer you will be exithing wiht this sure

title: Great way to get around.
review: Excellent service and a clean and easy way to get around and explore Bangkok Give it a try for sure

title: once you get the hang of it
review: it is very easy to use and saves you a lot of money and time pick up a map at the station to see all the routes

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Best way to get around Bangkok Stations usually close to most hotels around the central shopping areas Cheap to travel on and along every 5 mins or so Quick clean and comfortable

title: 7 stops
review: This is a very clean and safe train which is punctual  Every station has a multitude of shops and our hotel was literally 50ft from the station

title: Best service
review: Best service Cheap fare Good Connectivity  Best service Cheap fare Good Connectivity  Best service Cheap fare Good Connectivity

title: BTS is BEST
review: Quick and easy way to travel affordable tickets good view of city and excellent connectivity Enjoyed

title: Most reliable and efficient transport in Bangkok
review: Most reliable and efficient transport in Bangkok city During traffic jams the BTS is so much faster than the tuk tuks

title: buy a rabbit card
review: If you are there for a few days and intend on using the BTS a bit  get a rabbit card made life very easy

title: Safe, Cheap and Convenient
review: Very cheap convenient and clean mode of transport if you are in Bangkok Every station is clearly marked in Englishand the trains are very well lit and  safe even late in the night

title: Convenient, Decent, yet Expensive.
review: I lived in a condominium closed to Krung Thonburi BTS station for almost 2 years It is quite convenient for me to use BTS to get around the place in Bangkok   The bad side of BTS are that  1) It is packed in rush hour from 700900 and 17001900  2) The ticket is expensive Taxis may be cheaper if you share with friends

title: great
review: very easy to use cheap and air conditionedticket are obtained from machines using coins only but they will provide change if you need

title: Best mode to commute
review: The way to travel in Bangkok is to use the BTS Skytrain as the traffic in the city is maddening and if you want to reach the place in time with all the comfort this is the way to go Though you will see this rush enter in and spring out of the trains but i guess thats fine in the peak hours and tourist seasons

title: Fast, Clean
review: I like how the BTS sky train in Bangkok It well maintained and clean Fast to get anywhere But one thing is the aircon overly cold for me especially during the rain season But overall I like it

title: Easy to use
review: Nice and easy system to use First timers without any knowledge got around fine Hot tip carry correct change or go to counter and get the change then get ticket through the machine For those travelers who donate or discard this small Thai baht coins keep them for the train and public ferry   Enjoy

title: So convenient!
review: it's so easy to get to anywhere with the BTS and people queue neatly for the train u won't see any of that in my country

title: Pricey
review: Expensive when you travel with family Taxi was always cheaper (if meter) Tuk tuk is never a value option always sÃ§am

title: easy travel
review: fast easy to use perfect to move more than taxi or mototaxi best can go opposite side of bkk or airport  without find any traffic jam

title: Great public transport in Bangkok
review: Excellent and cheap way to get around Bangkok  There are two lines to the BTS and it goes everywhere a tourist would want to for $12USD each way  One negative no drinks on the train

title: "My daily super transportation that really rocks"
review: The best way to stroll with the BTS around Bangkok to visit numerous places As well as a daily transportation very excellent for the daily business man to and from duty

title: Useful and cheap
review: This was handy to have In the day time also not very expensive clearly sign posted also before you got to terminals there were maps

title: Convenient and affordable
review: it is really convenient as it reaches to all the popular destination Cheap It was It has increased the price 3 times in 2 years as I remember But fair enough new trains are established Get maintained sometimes and people need to wait for hours

title: Best way to travel on land in Bangkok
review: Bts would be the best and most economy way to travel inside out in bangkok From bangkok international airport to the city is just 45baht which is less than $2  comfortable  safe and very convenient travellers going places frequently in a day should consider the one day no limit pass which is just 130 baht you definately gain if planning to hop up and down visiting different places of interest and one of the best way to bring you to see more of the local thai community which i would travel no where but always expact to have surprises added on to my vacations in bangkok and you will always find local drinks stall or shops that provide local cheap shopping experences

title: Excellent and CHEAP!
review: The best way of transportation in Bangkok to get rid of the traffic You can conveniently go anywhere Its convenient easy cheap but very well maintained Highly recommended

title: Fast reliable way to see Bangkok
review: This is Quicker and cheaper than getting a taxi from the Airport A way to see more of Bangkok and get a feel for the culture

title: Love Bangkok because of the sky train
review: This is such an easy service to use Loved using the sky train so easy to navigate around Bangkok by sky train We managed to visit numerous markets malls and other areas in one day with the one day Tavel pass which was super cheap The map at each station is really easy to use and I quickly learnt it was just like a London tube map telling you where to interchange stations making travel really quick and simple Loved it

title: Quick and easy to use
review: Quick and easy to use Can be quite crowded at rush hour  so be careful with your belongings People queue for the train in a very orderly fashion so make sure you don't skip

title: best way to travel through the city
review: The most easy way to travel from one place to another in Bangkok The trains are always very crowded but then again you don't pay that much to get where you want to be without standing still in a traffic jam

title: Convenient way to travel
review: Excellent value for money & fast 28 baht from train station to just outside our hotel We were pleasantly surprised by the friendly helpful staff

title: Very efficient transportation
review: We found it ro be very simple and costeffective OK even in rush hour Crowded but we'll organized  most recommended

title: Cheap & easy
review: I found the skytrain really easy to use and very cheap To the first time user you will need coins to buy a ticket If you have only notes take say 100B to the ticket office and get them to change it into 10B coins Take these to the ticket dispensers Find your destination station and check what number it is Example 2228 etc this is how much your ticket will cost We went from Chong Nonsi to National Stadium which is 28B so I put in that amount and got my ticket Take the ticket to the turnstile and put it in then retrieve to walk through Head for the platform which is your destination platform and catch your train Easy

title: BTS Quick and Clean
review: The best way to travel around Bangkok away from the heat and dust of the streets It's quick and clean

title: It works well
review: Easy to use  Clean as public trasportation can get  Clearly marked  Watch how you exit to be sure you are in the direction and the side of the streeet you need to be

title: Good choice for you
review: It helps you for going around Bangkok if you don't want to use a Taxi But the BTS not passing all of attraction places such as Grand Palace Wat Arun etc

title: Just use it !!!!
review: Beat the nasty Bangkok traffic in aircon comfort cheap and gets you to most parts of the city without the hassle

title: Clean and accessible
review: BTS is easily accessible  to most tourist areas Helpful staff to assist foreigners Bts starts at 6am and stops at 12 Can be expensiveas tickets is prices per stop

title: The only way to navigate Bangkok
review: If you are in Bangkok the BTS (and it's underground sister the MRT) are the only way to get around  With these you almost entirely avoid the traffic that Bangkok is known for  I would not consider a hotel that was more than a short walk from one of these systems

title: Easy to navigate
review: Great way to navigate outside the city to markets and suchEasy to use and accessible Wish there were more lines available but thats why they have a metro I suppose

title: Enjoy the view form the BTS walkways
review: Easy to use fast reliable convenient to get around Bangkok avoiding the notorious traffic jams and cheap  I would recommend buying a full day pass because it's so handy to hop on and hop off  especially around the main tourist areas  The announcements are in English as well as Thai and the stations are lit up on a display board over the doors  And if travel by different forms of transport is your thing it's worth using the BTS to connect with the inland waterway piers close the Siam Cente and the river boats

title: Let Sky train take the stran
review: an easy and cheap way to get around quart clean and efficienthet a pass for the day and explore a great way to get around

title: Best way to travel round the city
review: Easy to use cheap convenient clean Hopefully there will be more areas of the city covered next visit

title: Avoid traffic hassles with skytrain
review: Best way to get around Bangkok Very clean affordable and wellorganised Even better with shopping malls connected to almost every station

title: Quick, convenient and blissfully air-conditioned!
review: The BTS Skytrain remains one of my favorite public transport systems in the world You cant beat it for speed air conditioned comfort and the amazingly well planned and convenient skywalk access to all the malls and major hotels in central Bangkok

title: Way to go!
review: travel using the Skytrain in Bangkok I so fast and very easy to negotiate Very reliable and the best way to move around the city quickly

title: BTS it's cold in here
review: The sky train is a very clean safe air conditioned and easy way to travel in Bangkok At the moment there are two routs and it's very easy to learn Maps are in all stops If you miss a stop simply get off the train and get on a train going to opposite way You are not charged extra for missing a stop unless you leave the terminal

title: Convenience and clean
review: It would be nicer if BTS can operate longer as I always travel home late after midnight Also if they offer more promotion or special fare to be more affordable

title: Clean Metro
review: The best way to travel in bangkok Very nice and convenient way to travel cheaper than other modes of transport hence highly recommended

title: Best way to get around
review: If your hotel is located near the skytrain then this is the best transport option to get around Bangkok Trains run regular and are nice and cool Although be careful they do stop around midnight until early morning  If you plan on using throughout the day go to the cahier and purchase a day ticket for about 140 baht  saves a few baht over the day

title: Simple and clean
review: Very quick and easy way to get around From western perspective also very cheap  Surprised how clean everything is but there seems to be ban on littering and everyone following it Not even chewing gums or cigarette butts can be found on the floors  Even when it is very crowded at rush hour people still polite and not too pushy

title: clean and easy to get around town
review: so clean and easy to get around i didn't need to use taxis while i was in bangkok just took the train to get to chao phraya to siam mall area to chit lom for more shopping back to my hotel at ratchethewi and to the airport link train it was also very cheap you just pay according to how far you're travelling make sure to take note which direction you're heading it determines what platform you're getting on and also which train you'll be taking if your platform has multiple skytrain lines coming through it

title: Train or Traffic
review: The BTS Skytrain is great for maneuvering throughout the city during traffic hours Conveniently connected to malls and shopping centers this can be a great way to shop around without ever having to catch a cab The fairs however are somewhat equal to a cab so given nontraffic hours I would still prefer alternative modes of transportation

title: Convenient, clean and jam-free.
review: Convenient clean and usually very frequent  The airconditioning is almost always really powerful and cool as well  Best part is that it is not subjected to the traffic jams below

title: Forget the traffic jam in BKK.
review: A smart choice when you are traveler in Bangkok Clean an convenient But try to avoid rush hours from 79am and 57pm

title: Excellent Transportation.
review: BTS skytrain like its name Travels above the road It will brings you to almost all destination or conects you to the MRT which travels underground

title: BTS Skytrain
review: The BTS Skytrain is easy to use reliable and the fastest way to get around Bangkok  The trains are clean  The main drawback could be the need to climb stairs to reach them

title: Excellent way of getting around Bangkok
review: If you are going to use extensively get the day pass  Good clean air condition on carriages sufficient seating outside rush hours far quicker than taxi's and the airport link is great value for money

title: An excellent public transport system
review: Fast reliable service very reasonably priced easy to understand the ticketing system trains are very clean An excellent way to get around the city in a fast time

title: Safe, easy and cheap to use!
review: Easy to use reliable and very cheap The best way to get around Bangkok along with the local buses

title: Nice metro
review: the metro of bangkok are awesome really like it a lot had a good experience in it must visiti one to it

title: over rated
review: well connected to major places however fairly expensive to travel if you are more than 1 person like more expensive compared to taxi for shorter distance of 5 KMs

title: Great transport, avoid peak times if you can like any major city.
review: good clean cheap for getting around main part of Bangkok  definitely recommend easy to understand after riding once or twice

title: Try it out
review: Take the bangkok map with you and you are sorted for BTS travel Most of the popular destinations including Siam Centre MBK mall Chatuchak Market can be reached through this mode I would recommend this to beat the road traffic and save on money

title: Clean and efficient
review: Clean and efficient If you're not using it all day it's often cheaper to buy each ticket as you go  You can use the machines (in Thai and English) and it you don't have change the booth attendant will change a note for you

title: Travel to Chatuchak Market on BTS
review: We travelled on the BTS on Sunday 23rd August to Chatuchak market Very convenient way to travel Get your coins from the information counter and easy to get tickets and costs Very clean and easy way to travel Had a good view of the city as we made our way to the Market Very highly recommended

title: Excellent service
review: Probably the best way to move around Bangkok The skytrain is very clean very punctual very cheap and easy to navigate It can get quite busy but there are plenty of trains so no need to rush I loved the air conditioning and the incarriage TVs The only down side is that the network is limited and may not go where you want but it will take you to the major shopping destinations

title: Convenience
review: Connectivity between district to district is very convenient It actually covers most of the shopping district and must visit places

title: Flying around Bangkok - Wonderful, Efficient BTS Skytrain
review: Flying around Bangkok The BTS Skytrain is cheap efficient & a great way to mingle with new friends & neighbors Just get out there  be respectful  & smile Shopping at MBK or elsewhere Exhausted with too many bags after Just take Skytrain there & a taxi home

title: Very easy to use
review: This is by far the easiest way to travel throughout the city Was a bit concerned whether the language barrier would be any trouble But everything is explained step by step Although it gets crowded the air condition is equipped to make the brief journeys comfortable  The allday pass is a good bargain if you have a short time and are willing to cover different areas in a single day Otherwise stick to the regular tickets  Also check whether you need to change trains at the Siam Central station and switch between two sets of lines

title: bts
review: fastefficientreliableNo traffic jams however some trains might be quite full at certain times or routes

title: Like I like my food... Fast, cheap and easy!!
review: Great service very clean cheap and efficient and a fast efficient method to get to the airport Use it

title: Great way to get around Bangkok rather than by taxi or tuktuk
review: Great way to get around Bangkok (rather than by taxi or tuktuk) Cheap quick and easy For travellers I recommend to take BTS Sky Train to wander around the city to avoid the hassle of street traffic also taxi or tuktuk usually won't use meter so you need to negotiate the fare before the ride sometimes the driver cheat and give the fare far more expensive to tourist  I suggest that ticketing machine with notes payment method should be more provided rather than the ticketing machine with coins payment method

title: TAXIMETER!!
review: it is very handy but Bangkok is a some crowded city so I suggest you to transport with taximeters

title: STAFF ARE HORRIBLE
review: The customer service desk should at least know ENGLISH in tourism rich country like Thailand  The maps are not properly displaced next to the tickets vending machines

title: Better than slow peak hour traffic
review: only way to travel the busy street of Bangkok clean and look forward to walking into air conditioned carriages  The traffic is hectic all over Bangkok  but the BTS skytrain hover over all the traffic and is the best way to get  around bangkok

title: Best mode of travel in Bangkok!
review: Was an experience for my travelling internationally for the first time  The staff at the counter was really helpful in explaining to us which station was the closest to our destination  We had fellow travellers help us use the operating machines and I found the skytrain is best to use in Bangkok

title: GREAT WAY TO TRAVEL IN BANGKOK
review: By far the best way to get around Bangkok Fast cheap clean easy to use Gets you were you need to go quickly Can get very busy around rush hour no surprizes there but very well organizedTickets are purchased at self service machines and if you need change you can get it at the information counter usually opposite the ticket machine  All trains have aircon and all signs information is in English as well as Thai Most stations have lifts plus you will find small shops that offer anything from a cold refreshing drink a snack clothes mobile phones newsagent book shop or even a money exchange service  You can also use it to get too and from the airport

title: whole day ticket
review: if you are planning to go many times save your money with BTS skytrain when u buy a whole day ticket

title: Shopping made easy by BTS
review: Cheap on your pocketfast so that you can save time and stations located close enough that one does not have to look very farBut the whole city is not connectes with the BTSWe had to go to Khawsang Road so checked out that there was no connectivityBTS is well connected to all the shopping malls so easy to shop and travel

title: Easy, Fast, And Crowded
review: I love how Bangkok mixes old world and new world Tuk Tuk's are fun but when you need to get across the city the Sky Train is easy to use and fast It's also crowded and some stations make you stand in line to get coins to then put in the machine But it's all part of the experience All good

title: Efficiant
review: Very handy and very reliable  Stations are everywhere apart from near the river Pretty cheap and very clean

title: Fantastic mode of Transport
review: Great way to get around can be difficult for ticketing but cant come to too much harm if you remember your start pointThank you

title: Convenient way of going around
review: Easy to work out and use Air conditioned comfort at reasonable rates especially when the taxis refuse to use meters However it doesnt go near the Grand Palace or Wat Pho but Interchangeable with the Chao Praya River boat and MRT also

title: Excellent choice to get from the airport to city center
review: There are two lines red and blue one Try to catch the red one as it goesonly with one stop directly to the city center

title: Recommended to quick travels within the city.
review: Great way of transportation to various hot spots in Bangkok Very safe and easy to travel even though it is not very cheap

title: The best way to see Bangkok
review: As with any other major city transportation method it was packed to the point of over flowing but the air con on board was incredible and kept the temperature down and made the journey very pleasent

title: Very convenient and no need for taxis.
review: Very easy to use and so convenient to get around On time and also clean Easily accessible when arriving at airport and to get to your hotel (we stayed at Eastin Grand which is connected to skytrain via bridge)

title: Great mode of transport and very modern and efficient.
review: We took the BTS a few times and it was such a pleasure to ride Very clean very affordablerarely jampacked It is easy to navigate and to pay at the self kiosk and the train areas are very clean and a sight to see

title: BangkokSkytrain
review: Great way to get around Bangkok Cheap quick easy to use sometimes very busy Faster than Taxi at busy times

title: easy mode
review: Most convenient travel mode in Bangkok because of huge traffic situation this train helps us in reaching qucikly and on time we use it very often and it is easy to understand the routes

title: Excellent public transport
review: Frequent clean easy to use modestly priced public transport with rather amusing TV ads on the trains as a bonus

title: Flying over Bangkok
review: A great option for avoiding the horrible Bangkok traffic There are ticket machines in English and you get change for your bank notes on most terminals You should know your destination ask your hotel what would be the closest BTS

title: Went to the Sunday market
review: Had to use tokens Was a bit messy however once you got used to the system it was a good way to travel

title: Absolutely A Time and Money Saver
review: Thankfully this train now operates  It saves lots of time and even more money when you use it  Easy to access makes connections with the transit system in Bangkok  You would be foolish to use any other way to get into the city from the airport

title: Saves precious hours
review: The traffic in Bangkok can be frustrating even during nonpeak hours The BTS saved us when we were in a hurry to catch our flight after a dinner near Silom thanks to the connection with the airport link (train) at Makkasan station

title: Avoid the traffic - effortless!
review: If its anywhere near peak travel times or the traffic is bad (usually is) then think hard about hopping on the BTS  It will whisk you through the suburbs and across town effortlessly  Cheap airconditioned reliable and with stops where you need them

title: Extremely convenient and comfortable
review: Frequent trains convenient for foreigners easy to understand routes the best way to commute in BangkokGiven the way Bangkok traffic is you may actually save hours by taking the Skytrain Service is quite frequent  you can actually see the next train standing in the previous station The best way to commute in the city

title: Great way to get around
review: Cheap convenient and cold Our favourite way to get around in this highly congested city Unfortunately it doesn't go out to the palace or surrounding temples

title: Avoid Traffic
review: One of the best ways to travel in Bangkok and avoid the hassle of street traffic especially on FridaysEnjoy the Ride

title: Great transport
review: The sky train is a great way of getting around such a huge city like Bangkok It is cheap fast and efficient It stops at many places and out of rush hour is quite comfortable

title: Best way to get around bkk
review: Easy to use Good if your staying in bkk for a while You will get to know it the more you use it  Easy to use No hassle  Some times get busyif you miss one there be another pretty soonso your not hanging around to long

title: The only way to beat the jams in central Bangkok
review: On my visit to Central Bangkok I found the only way to beat the constant traffic jams that even the Tuk Tuks get stuck in is the Skytrain without a doubt

title: Why take a taxi?
review: The Skytrain is clean blessedly cool and easy to use All the signs are in English as well as Thai Unfortunately doesn't cover as much of the city as would be convenient but great for some places You'll see plenty of other tourists as well as locals so no worries if you get mixed up and need to ask for directions

title: fast track around bangkok
review: one of the best ways to travel around bangkok with stations very close to all the main tourist attractions and most of the big ferry landings  be prepared for the crowds and  climbing lot of stairs

title: On Track with these trains
review: Terrific system with elevated railways and pedestrian walkways Easiest way to get around Bangkok We use this all the time and make sure our hotel is near to a station

title: Best way to travel
review: When going around Bangkok this is the best way to go around Very safe and air conditioned It gets busy

title: Great to get around Bangkok.  Cheap & quick !
review: Great to get around Bangkok  Cheap & quick and goes to most of the new fun parts of town  It is clean and the fact that it is outside allows you to see the city from a height

title: Easy to use, good value and better access than taxis
review: Although taxis and tuktuks are the usual preferred convenient and cheap method of transport the BTS is definitely an excellent alternative Cheap efficient clean and air conditioned the BTS offers a practical alternative to getting around

title: 2 thumbs up !
review: what a beautiful way of transport in bangkokits an engineers marvel  its fastaffordable and convenientpeople of bangkok are very lucky to have a system like this and stay fit at the same time with all the quick walks

title: Cheap and fast
review: Skytrain is THE thing to travel arround Bangkok Yes it does not cover the whole city but two lines are good start to visit major locations (or to switch to other type of public transport) It is cheap and very fast

title: Great way to get around
review: The Skytrain was a great way to get around in Bangkok You can even take it to the airport It is fast but always packed even in non peak hour time Stops at major shopping areas You pay by the distance travelled Each extra station puts the price up but I don't know if there is  a ceiling  A good experience

title: A little confusing at first, but easier than other modes
review: It's a little confusing at first but it's air conditioned and not that much  You don't have to deal with Bangkok tuk tuk drivers hustling you and trying to communicate with a random taxi driver

title: Quick and On Time - Better than taking a rip off taxi
review: Thailand has a serious issue with their Cab drivers (hence no Uber)  There is no standard fee The skytrain is the best way to get around  if you shopping it has a lovely walkway that you can use to escape the street smells and food

title: Grab a BKK map
review: Really good & highly convenient with good frequency The announcements in English were really helpful for me who cannot speak any other language

title: Really cheap way of getting around.
review: Bit daunting at first but pretty simple once you work out where you want to go Quite cheap and you can pretty much see most of the city by using the skytrain

title: Great transportation system
review: Definitely the best way to get around BKK  If you are only here a day or so but expect to do a few trips each day  get a day pass (140 baht)  But if you are here for longer it's worth getting the stored value card ("rabbit") for convenience

title: Well run
review: Excellent  Cheap and fast  We travelled from the Airport to Pratunam for next to nothing  Everything is well run and on time  A taxi would have cost 800 to 1200 baht  I think we paid 70 baht each by train

title: Safe efficient way to get around Bankgkok
review: Very clean efficient easy to navigate and with destinations to most of the places you would like to visit  Not as extensive as other other major cities We always felt safe as there always seemed to be guardspolice around

title: Efficient and shopping friendly!
review: The BTS is a reasonably priced effficient way of getting around the main hubs of Bangkok especially if your are shopping with several stations exiting directly into malls such as MBK Central Silom Terminal 21 and Siam Paaragon etc It is more expensive than the MRTthe underground system and if you are in a large group it might be cheaper to just take a taxi But its a great option for getting good views of the city and beating traffic jamsThe thing i like best is that people are always courteous always queuing up to get in extremely safe and friendly for women clean and neat and on time Trains on the Silom line are a bit less frequent than on the Siam linebut overall a fantastic way to get around the city

title: Quick and easy travel
review: Clean beautiful quick and cheaper than the tuk tuks and taxis Pretty easy to travel and the station staff are pretty helpful in guiding people A great mode of travel to beat the city traffic

title: Cheap, quick and clean
review: If you want a cheap hassle free way to get around Bangkok then use the skytrain it's so cheap and quick it takes the hassle out of getting to certain parts of the city and misses the madness which is Bangkok traffic

title: Cheap and quick
review: So easy to use and close to hotel and a cheap option you can use from hotel but we opted for a taxi which cost 500 bhat

title: Complicated to recognize
review: Good service but language is barrier as mostly staff is unable 2 understand English  Tip is to stay the near display screen so you can read the destination name better 2 know which exit is to be taken Available Map guide is very helpful fastest mode of local traveling also  economical

title: Fast & Efficient Ride . Highly Recommended.
review: Fast and efficient ride and easy to access everywhere It also connects to all major malls and it's truly convenient You are able to beat the heavy traffic as well Highly recommended transportation mode

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Very convenient and nicely air conditioned If you say a few days try get the daily unlimited or better a 3 days unlimited BTS pass

title: Rapid Transport
review: Not frequent enough so very busy but still the quickest way around Bangkok Air conditioning is excellent

title: Excellent
review: An excellent service in Bangkok which is always clean very easy to access and quickest means to travel around the city Hopefully they will keep extending this service to more areas

title: The best way to travel in BKK
review: Certainly one of the cheapest (taxi bikes could be cheaper depending on the distance) ways to travel around the bustling capital of Thailand Trains are well maintained safe clean and cover most of the Malls and sights of Bangkok There is talk of expanding the train line to cover more of outer Bangkok too which would be great

title: Fast and effective
review: Clean effective and easy to use Takes you from one side of Bankok to the other side in just minutes And very cheap

title: Straightforward, inexpensive mode of transport for singles or couples
review: The BTS is one of 3 touristfriendly public transportation systems in that language will not be a problem The other 2 are the MRT (also trains) and BRT (buses with dedicated lanes)  BTS is inexpensive for singles and couples But for larger groups taxis may be competitive  The trains are frequent but not very long At rush hour they tend to be packed but that's too be expected in any city   There are only 2 limitations with BTS 1 There are only 2 lines  Sukhumvit and Silom But it does reach most attractions eg Chatuchak Weekend Market national monument  national stadium and major malls like Siam Paragon Siam Center Terminal 21 Central World Platinum Mall Emporium & Enquartier  2 Not all stations have ticket machines that take cash Where they don't you'll end up queueing to get change and then another queue to but the tickets On weekends at stations that access attractions like Chatuchak this is a major headache So keep those coins

title: Highly efficient
review: Great way to get around Bangkok  spotlessly clean and everyone is fairly well mannered moving on and off Excellent value for money and makes getting around very easy and hassle free Thoroughly recommend

title: Can't live without it in Bangkok.
review: First class public transport in a third world country  It is so convenient and beat the jam around town during peak hours

title: Add extra service
review: I have used the train on visits for many years I is about time the owners put some capital into upgrading with more rolling stock lifts that work and proper disabled access most of the stations that have lifts they are blocked off and out of order And their is no access to the platform except by stairs The trains are always packed and with new  extensions being built there appears to be no common ticket system nor can you use a card to buy tickets Whilst the service  is clean  It needs an update

title: Convenience at its finest
review: BTS was very easy to use Slightly more expensive than the City Train Line and MRT You have to use the touch screen vending ticket machine Just click the English option so it can turn to English language You can use BTS when you are along Bangna  to Mho Phit Then you can interchange to Phiya Tai going to the airport

title: Most efficient transportation in Bangkok
review: Bts sky train us cheapest and most efficient transportation in bangkok You can reach almost all tourism destination in bangkok You can get the train map in train station Enjoy

title: Best way to travel
review: The BTS Sky train is an excellent service which is always clean very easy to access and fast way to travel around Bangkok Hopefully they will keep extending this service

title: excellent transport - BTS
review: excellent way to get about in the big city of Bangkok and always someone about who speaks a little english to set you in the right direction  cheap too

title: Clean, efficient with aircon
review: Very clean It does cover BkK( ie most touristy areas) The Sky in conjunction with the MRT will get u where u want to go without the haggling and hassle of taxi tuk tuk  However there are 2 separate ticketing system for the Skytrain and the MRT You cannot use the MRT ticket with the Skytrain and vice versa A bit silly really So think before you buy either Pass

title: BTS great but gets busy
review: Great way to get around Bangkok Easy to buy tickets and work out the cost Uses coins but change stations at every stop  Really well air conditioned We were unfortunate to be on there with ovals and their bikes so crammed in like sardines

title: Confortable but get ready to run
review: Very conviniant way to explor Bangkok but do note that as soon as the doors open u need to run in order to win the race fir the seat

title: Beat the traffic
review: Excellent way to get around Bangkok  No traffic jams clean well priced with cold air con  It gets busy at rush hour but still the best way to get around the city

title: ease of travel
review: use this post you had the sight seeing in the morning easy and fast My hotel was nearby the sky train used the same to go to the river front and then to Asiatique

title: To airport - do it.
review: The train was fast efficient and not too crowded Not surprised as Thailand is great but it was a nice surprise

title: BTS skytrain - Get around & get a great view at the same time.
review: The first time you enter a station look for the ticket machines  maps show the station names you can get to and the price of that ticket in baht next to each name Look for a button of that value click it pop in your coins and voilÃ  you have your ticket  Lacking change Pass a note to the ticket teller 2 baht coins and notes don't work in the machines  Enjoy your ride and don't forget to get off  the view is so amazing its easy to be distracted and lose track of where you are

title: Great transport
review: Excellent way of transport in abusy city of bangkok It is super cheap and fast service Alwaysclean and well organized

title: Superb Ride
review: I used BTS from Terminal 21 mall Saphan Taksin to reach Wat pho The trains and stations are maintained really well The passengers behave really well

title: Great way to commute if you are alone !
review: We travelled all around Bangkok using the BTS It connects the city well Make sure you carry a map of the BTS Metro with you It works well costwise if you are single or a couple For more than 4 people it is same as taking a taxi

title: The most convenient mode of public transport
review: You can travel to most tourist spots by BTS in Bangkok The BTS is also linked to the MRT at certain stations making it very convenient The train service is extremely reliable Do take the BTS for fussfree jamfree rides especially during peak hours

title: Skytrain Fun
review: Easy to use clean fast and not too busy We didn't use it as much as we'd liked to have but we were there during the Bangkok bombing in August 2015 so we were a little concerned especially as we were travelling with our 3 children  I would recommend it though and will use it next time we are there hopefully early next year

title: BTS experenice
review: Never expect the BTS train to be so well maint Its always clean & cooling in the train & all the commuters are well behave & will always "q" up for the boarding of the train

title: Best way of transport for tourists
review: BTS is probably the best way for transport in Bangkok for tourists It is cheap you avoid traffic jams and it is visible for tourists where you can leave BTS for your destination (in contradiction to the busses) Only disadvantage is that it is sometimes very busy with Thai going to and from work but it doesn't weigh to the advantages

title: Great.
review: So easy to navigate excellent english speaking staff and clean efficient air conditioned trains Ten out of ten

title: UK traveler - amazed by bts skytrain
review: Cheap and convenient and easy to use You buy your tickets at the machines using card or cash Limited stops mean you can't get everywhere using this train but to get to city centre its great

title: Great way of transportation
review: Using the BTS Skytrain is great Paying and finding your way around is very easy There are instructions on all stations Felt very safe (mom with teenage daughter)

title: Best way around town
review: Best way to get around town but you need to coordinate with other modes of transport if you want to cover whole of Bangkok  It clean inside  strategic stations for you to get on and off fast and on time  But the drawback is that most only has stairs to go up and down the stations so be prepared to walk

title: clean modern metro system
review: A modern "metro" system linking Bangkok districts nice views from the elevated carriages  enjoy a visit to "Siam" for the shopping Paragon is great and MBK is good for electronics

title: Take the sky train it is easy
review: Clean and easy to use I always enjoy getting out of the traffic and travel with ease in a clean sky train

title: BTS system
review: We believed buying a day pass gave more freedom to get on and off the train when we spotted something interesting as we saw most travellers buy trip passes or a single trip passes Air conditioner was great on the trains and easiest way to get around

title: Faster than taxis and you can see so much more
review: Efficient clean and easy to use Goes to pretty much everywhere you need to go and being above ground let's you see a lot of the city along the way

title: Cheap, efficient and very cool.
