review: If you want hassle free and very affordable transport without traffic hold ups the skytrain is for you

title: Great Transportation in and out of the City
review: Excellent ride with very organized train routes plus all types of trains are here in the city airport link train yes going to provinces yes underground train yes  we use train most of the times since its lot less expensive than taxis and not too crowded and no traffic

title: Efficient
review: Having dealt with public transport in London I have nothing negative to say about this punctual costeffective and fast service

title: great
review: Absolutely the beat way to get around in the city fast clean and safe so easy to use friendly staff if you have any questions highly recommended

title: Among the best metro transportation in the world
review: While staying in Bangkok you're strongly recommended to experience the BTS Skytrain  It will take you to many destinations for little money with lots of comfort safety and ease to navigate   You'll be come an expert after your first ride Btw like many modem metro systems in the world you'll want to hold on to your ticket until your exit   You will be very independent all the way between buying tickets to exit the stop or transfer between lines   Most likely you'll find it a cheap and comfortable way to view Bangkok neighborhoods especially during day time

title: Cheap and quick but
review: I grew up in Philadelphia and have taken mass transit there Chicago Seattle and San Francisco  The BTS system ranks up there with all of these cities It's a quick way to get around very inexpensive and clean to boot    My only complaint is the over crowding to the point of basically pushing and shoving to get on a train  I'm not sure what really can be done to help with this but I do feel it needs to be pointed out as it can be very off putting for some    Assuming it's not totally packed andor you can deal with a crowd this is the way to go for travel around Bangkok

title: Quick and nice
review: The skytrain is a nice clean and airconditioned means of quick transport in Bangkok Had a tour to explore the different means of transports in BKK (tuktuk boat1 boat2 bus and train) and so we tried this also

title: Best transportation in Bkk
review: As a person working in Bangkok BTS is the best way to travel Fast and cool You can travel from Chao Praya river pier called Sapan Taksin to Jatujak weekend market in the easiest way with low cost

title: BTS skytrain
review: BTS is the best way to move in central BKK besides that you can link to the skytrain to main airport and to Mochit it also has stations that links with blue and orange bus boats quite cheaper way to do a river tour in a simple boat bus as much as 50baht

title: Must do!
review: I loved the skytrain very cheap and clean and frequentYou can either have a return or single  the ticket office is very helpful Great for getting to Siam

title: Nice to have a good view off the city
review: Just buy a day pass and step in the BST hop over on the MRT and its possible to Bangkok in one day

title: Efficient and clean
review: it was clean and I find the transport system of the skytrains very efficient in Bangkok I have been to Thailand several times and i find myself feeling safe whenever i take the sky trains too The system is really nice and it goes to all the major malls in the city

title: very easy to get around
review: fast and convinient However the language can be a problem with the counter staff But on the whole preferred this to travel around Bangkok

title: Only without luggages
review: Perfect way to move around Bangkok fast and cheap At every station there are some ATM to print the ticket 1 Have coins (if you don't have them  there is a change office in every station) 2 push the botton with your destination name on the map  (every button has a different number that is the cost to reach that station) 3 insert coins 4 retire the ticket Is a card that you insert when you  entering in BTS and you return it when you exit (so don't lose it) 5 Enjoy BTS Just one advice Bangkok is very crowdy and in many times BTS are full of passenger so don't use it with luggage (example from airport)

title: Trains are easy in Bangkok.
review: Very friendly staff easy to get aroundgreat price can get you where you need to go Look up on line where and the train route you need take a photo off your computer of where you want to go Everyone was helpful

title: Fast but a bit cold
review: Fast and safe to travel in the city Keep with you a long sleeve clothe since the aircondition is always on and inside is too cold than it should

title: SKYTRAIN A/C SAVES THE DAY
review: Cheap and a fast way of moving around an extremely busy city not to mention the airconditioning as well it is an absolutely dream to travel in then skytrain

title: Best Way to travel in bangkok
review: Because going in cab will lead to Jams and a lot of waiting so its always better to take BTS Skytrain These are best ever especially for tourists

title: Cool, fast and convenient
review: With the card it is so easy and convenient fast and cool I think is the best way in combination with the underground to travel around BKK

title: A regular, Urban Metro
review: The metro made it convenient to explore the city at our convenience We even made a visit to the AirportSuvarnabhumi just to get a feel of the Metro

title: Fast and comfortable Don Muang airport transfer
review: Bangkok's skytrain (BTS) complements other below ground services and the airport sky link   Further new lines are being added    Trains are regular fast and clean  The BTS is also an excellent choice for air travelers who can board along Sukhumvit (where most hotels are) and exit at Mochit with A1 or A2 Airport bus service connection  Carrying luggage children elderly or infirm is not a problem with lifts available at most major stations incl Mochit  The current total cost per person is in the region of 70 BT per person from say Asoke to Don Muang which compares favourable against taxis  The BTSbus services often faster as they bypass congestion in peak times

title: Great way to get around - clean and AC is awesome
review: Helpful if you buy tickets ahead of time as the lines at some stations can be as long as your sky train trip  With a little planning you can figure out how much you need to load on your ticket and buy ahead of time at the glass booth

title: BTS Bangkok
review: It's convenient to travel the city by BTS but it's always so crowded You have to que in line to buy tickets everytime

title: Rabbit Card - Sky Trian Bangkok
review: This is definatley the best way to get around Bangkok and its worth buying a Rabbit Pass and loading it with Thai Baht its like our Myki Card but better

title: First class rail system
review: This rail system makes travelling around Bangkok simplewith its moderncleanair conditioned smooth running carriages and regular clockwork like timetable However if there is a drawback it's probably its' inability to reach the inner places of the city It is definitely the quickest way to get around but remember to purchase tickets before you travel from machines on the platforms

title: Great easy use!!
review: We used this with ease especially as never used this before Similar to London tube stations but  with a kiosk for assistance and ticket offices Ekkamai to Siam we then changed here to go to sapha taksin  we returned to lumpini )  It's very easy to navigate and everyone is friendly and will help if you ask  Only issue  we got a ticket to sapha taksin and because we exited at Siam (to have a nosy) we had to surrender our tickets here and buy new ones Don't leave for " a nosy" as will cost you more  The trains are air conditioned large with plenty of seats They weren't too busy when we used them at nighttime (7pm onwards) Finish running at 12pm

title: !Fast and Reliable!
review: Comfortable and fast Always on time and will never let you down Its vry cheap to travel in and takes you anywhere in town

title: getting around BK
review: This is the best way to get around BK fast clean and efficient perhaps not so good if you are disabled as there are lots of stairs but safe and cheep

title: You can set your watch by its service
review: Great way to get around Bangkok even to and from the airports Reliable timely and cheap service that avoids being hassled by tuk tuk drivers

title: Very good
review: Everyone knows that Bangkok was terrible with traffic jam This transportation was very convenience Rabbit card is recommended to use

title: Usefulness of Sky Train, subway, and airport train
review: It is now possible to avoid the hassles of road travel in Bangkok There is a high speed train that links up with the Sky Train which in turn connects to the subway which in turn links up with the state railway You can take a bicycle on the Sky Train DrawbacksMany stations lack escalators and none have WC facilities And it can be a bit of a hike eith inadequate signage at the links between systems

title: Clean, fast and really cold
review: The fastest way to move around Bangkok together with MRT The problem is that there are just two line which isn't enough to visit most of these places

title: Suoerfast and clean
review: If you are traveling alone then this is a wonderful option However it may seem expensive at times compared to taxis or bike taxis or tuktuks Just one station would cost you around 15 bahts But undoubtedly this is the fastest mode of transport Siam and silo Are major lines besides the airport link There are no indicators on the stations suggesting the time of next train

title: Quality public transport
review: Cheap & clean public transport Gets you to your destinstion quicker than taxis or Tuk Tuks fighting thier way through the bangkok streets

title: Crowded & Cold
review: Positive   Its cold Its fast Brings you everywhere  Negative   Its cold Its crowded Cheaper by taxi if you travel with more than 2  People are not going inside instead stoping in door areas so you need to wait for the next train

title: Lifeline Of Bangkok
review: When they built the BTS people thought nobody would ride it and it'd be a big boondoggle  They were so wrong as it's the lifeline of Bangkok along with the less crowded and equally awesome MRT (Subway) system  The BTS gets busier every year and it's often packed for hours at a time around rush hours but it beats sitting in traffic down below

title: Efficient Transport, Ineffectives Vending
review: Transportation is very efficient low cost for rapid transport The cleanliness is ok But the vending machine can only receives coins not the bank notes creating a long queues

title: Keep away from the taxis
review: This is no doubt best way to travel around Bangkok and if booking a hotel get one near a station It also connects with the river boat services so you can probably avoid taxis who are very dishonest

title: Excellent service
review: Air conditioned comfort frequent service and well mapped for the first time traveller  Easy to read instructions on the ticket issuing machines or advice from the change booth

title: Quick easy and cheap
review: Brilliant easy to use train audio in various language to tell you station names and electronic maps on each train which are spotlessly clean

title: Best way to get around
review: Very easy and cheap way to go around the city and especially for those who like to shop because it runs through all the shopping malls)

title: Limited reach
review: Ok  But limited reach within Bangkok  The best bet to getting around is still the motor taxi regular taxi which are very affordable

title: Easy access to main tourist attractions
review: comfortable journey saves a lot of time & money connects to most of Bangkok tourist attractions  The only thing is BTS need to improve their ticketing system every station change you have to buy coin there should be one card for all the journies

title: Easy Conveyance compare to other
review: It is a very Good & easy way to travel in Bangkok Compare to other conveyance it is great connectivity with Mall to mall or visiting locations

title: Way to go
review: Great way to get around very clean efficient service reasonably priced Had no security issues friendly staff willing to assist

title: Fast, cheap and convenient
review: I have been to Bangkok several times and if I can I always try to stay near a BTS or even better Skytrain station It s cheap you dont wait long you can enjoy the AC and the view (skytrain) and it cover a lot of areas in BKK Knowing how bad the traffic is in BKK BTS Skytrain is definetely the best option to go around BKK

title: Very Good
review: A clean skytrain in Bangkok So beautiful green and building view So many people use it So crowed

title: Good Experience.
review: The Skytrain gives good connectivity between most parts of the city The time between train is less Also the sky walk beneath the track is huge and clean where people can freely walk

title: Best way to travel around central Bangkok
review: I live in Bangkok own a car but use the Sky train (or the underground) if I am travelling along Sukhumvit Road especially The system does not go everywhere but it is covers most standard locations Underground and Sky train connect at several stations Cheap fast and frequent  Expect full trains at morning rush hour (~8am)  but trains are every few minutes

title: Fantastis Intracity travel option.
review: I cant imagine Bangkok without the BTS Skytrains Its so convenient to use the 2 lines and interchange at Siam You can reach almost all places in Bangkok with the BTS

title: Clean, fast
review: It's a good system clean fast but coverage could be slightly better and it's also annoying that the metro and skytrain don't share the same cards

title: Fast and convinient
review: Taking bts in bangkok is saving a lot of time especially on rush hour But bts in bangkok not reach many tourist spots Sometimes easier to take a taxi to reach tourist spots and if you travelling with your friends taking taxi sometimes cheaper than taking bts Some bts didnt have escalator so we have take the stair But once again taxi in bangkok mostly doesnt want to turn on the meter Last time I visited bangkok I used uber many times Cheap and good service

title: Everyday Use
review: i take it everyday even tho very crowded in the morning and evening its a must clean undderstandable and useful

title: Easy and quick
review: This train line covers most of the big hotels shopping centres and tourist attractions After seeing the traffic in Bangkok it was nice to have a route just for the train where you don't feel the craziness of the roads in Bangkok   Not expensive too so all in all a great way to get around central Bangkok

title: Better Than Tuk Tuk
review: Very convenient and economical to get around Bangkok  They make announcements in English which is very helpful  Buy the day pass if you are going to be using it a few times the same day

title: Excellent transport in Bangkok
review: It's an excellent way of moving around within the city of Bangkok Cheap and time saving Its very neat and clean and runs very frequently You can be saved feom all the busy road with full of traffic

title: The way to get around
review: Very clean airconditioned transport Quick and simple to use  We attempted a cab back from the World Central Plaza one evening and it took an extra 35 minutes because of the traffic Obviously didn't make that mistake again

title: Best Way To Get Around!
review: Since traffic in Bangkok is a nightmare I find the BTS the fastest way to get to most places around town It may not get you everywhere but it will get you close

title: Easy sky train
review: It is a fatest and easy way to travel around Bangkok Mostly I stayed at some hotels near Sukhumvit line So it is easy for me to catch the sky train and continue some eles by Tuk Tuk or walk

title: Easiest way to get around the city
review: Skytrain is easy for tourist to navigate and best way to travel around the busy city of Bangkok You may want to get the top up card for paying for the journey otherwise you will need to line up each time and prepare enough cash to get the ticket each time

title: Easy to use and cheap enough
review: The sky train was incredibly easy to use cost of trips ranging between B15 and B38 (B26 equalling about 50p) clean reliable and connected by the skywalks The only problem for me was that it didn't quite get to all the places I wanted it to eg River city or wat pho etc

title: Fast and efficient but not extensive enough
review: The easiest and fastest way to get around Bangkok is probably by BTS esp during the peak hours where traffic jams are expected to be everywhere However I find the system not extensive enough A lot of the places still can't reach by BTS You could take BTS to the station nearest to your destination then take a taxi to your destination

title: Love BTS
review: I absolutely love the BTS It's clean cheap and you're able to avoid the cab drivers I recommend getting a pass and charging it

title: Explore bangkok fast
review: If you have less time take a pre paid pass for BTS rail and travel through lots of placesIT has very good connectivity throughout cityGoes form one end to anothermaps of train are easily availableIn my view best way to commutetrip money gets easily deducted form your pre paid pass

title: A most convenient system
review: The combination of BTS and MRT make transport around the central city area extremely practical and cheap Depending on your destination you may have to change trains but the ticketing system allows you to purchase fares across all lines The BTS is being extended so it will become even more efficient

title: Good, clean and fast
review: In Bangkok during the day when you have a lot of trafic jam the BTS is the fastest way to go Only the endless stairs are tiring

title: Commute within the City
review: great connectivity across the city amazing advertising model The trains are clean and a fun way to interact with people

title: good service
review: Excellent service Very Easy to take Goes almost very corner of the city from the center Very cheap

title: A must use
review: Cheap prices very helpful staff short waiting times loads of stations access to most tourist areas A must use when in Bangkok

title: Easy way to moving around inside the city...
review: Go through most of the places in Bangkok Easy to use Station Mo Chit is where the famous JJ market is Tip One day Pass card will be helpful for those who love to go around as well as saving money (140THB)

title: Comfortable but limited reach
review: Easy to use comfortable not too crowded punctual Only limitation is its reach Mostly useful for shopping district downtown and also the weekend markets outside town

title: Done with the tourist in mind!
review: So here we are in a country with a different set of letter and a totally strange language to me I cant understand neither what I see nor what I hear And yet the train lines have been so well designed the indications everywhere so perfectly translated and well placed that I feel it as one of the most comfortable systems I have seen The announcements of the stations are done in both Thai and English and the guiding inside the stations is logical and easy to follow  You can find it mega crowded on rush hours and going to heavily frequented places  but it's still a good way to get around

title: Excellent Public Transport
review: The BTS is a fine way to get around Bangkok's crowded streets  Often it is the quickest way to get between places on its route  Integrates well with the MRT subway system thus extending its reach  Reasonably priced and safe  but yes you may need to stand

title: So cheap but can be crowded often
review: Look it's cheap but popular and as such crowded even off peak I liked the alternative MRT However the frequency of the BTS was much better Still both have that incredible ability to beat the infernal traffic jams which is important

title: Excellent!
review: Very good We took it from the airport to Ratchaprarop station Very efficient system  Very clean also

title: Not recommended for family travellers
review: Not recommended for families at all on peak hours Good for solo travelers poor English speakers Not clear signs

title: Quick clean and safe
review: With easy to follow directions and links with the MRT and the River boats and depending on where you want to go will get you there quicker than a cab most of the times I have caught it from Sukhumvit to the airport on a number of occasions cheap and easy

title: absolutely recommend
review: BTS Skytrain is very comfortable people behave themselves politly nobody speaks on the phones wagons are very clean  this type of transportation is one of the best around the world

title: Great way to get around
review: Quick cool and easy to use  Hope they extend the line to get to Chinatown and the Grand Palace areas one day

title: Good transport
review: Easy to use we went to  the end of the line to visit the Sunday market The market is such a maze we couldn't find how to get back to the sky train and walked quite a long way

title: Best Mode of Transport
review: Highly recommend the train service in Bangkok It's the most economical fast and convenient way to travel  Most of the times trains are full so you may not get a seat except in off peak hours   Highly recommended

title: Easy.
review: Get change first at counter for ticket machinesa cool ride that is in ac comfort Not easy to use with suitcases because most stations are up lots of stairs

title: Best way to travel
review: & that's saying something If you catch this during one of the many rush hours you can't physically squeeze into the trains Then if you do manage to get on you either get dragged off at a station along with everyone else or you can't get out when you want However having said all that it really is the best way to get about We go to Bangkok every year so have invested in a Rabbit card which makes getting on & off a lot easier If you're just there as a one off make sure you've got plenty of change to save queing

title: Well designed for commuters, but need to wait for quite long time
review: The BTS skytrain inside is well designed comparing to Singapore MRT There are lots of handrails for standing ppl Space also is wide too But the skytrain approaching timing is quite longer if compare with Singapore MRT and I'm not sure normally the interval timing is how longMaybe is 153minutes Not sure

title: Easy Connection
review: I arrive at Don Meaung Airport took a bus A1 30 baht to Mo Chit station 37 baht to Ratathewi station then 100 baht taxi to hotel first to save some money and second to avoid the evening crazy jam If I take taxi from airport it would be 400 to 500 baht

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Once you worked out how to get a ticket  great way to get around  Easy clean and safe Would be better if ticket machines took notes

title: Congested but fast
review: Fast on time and clean Did the job and easy to follow the guides It was often congested no matter what time you managed to get on but it makes travel around the city easier I wouldn't recommend taking small kids or prams onto it though

title: Second Best Way to get around in Bangkok
review: Use the river if you can but for other destinations in Bangkok use the Skytrain We could see the Skytrain from our  Silom Road hotel and decided to try it out This is a great way to get to the areas of the city along its route Ticket prices are very reasonable compared to taxi fares No traffic jams    Compared to many of the other elevated LRT systems I have used this one was definitely above average in terms of cleanliness Very smooth and bright Keep your hands to yourself and protect your valuables

title: Good value
review: If you are a group take a taxibreak even is around 2 peoplehowever if you want to get somewhere quickly take the Skytrain out of rush hour Easy to use and easy to understand if stuck ask a local they love to help

title: Superb transport links.
review: My partner and I loved how easy it was to use the Skytrain around Bangkok  It's cheap efficient and modern with great air con  It is easy to use once you have worked out the machine  The staff are helpful too  So much less complicated than the London underground

title: fast and frequent
review: It is very practical to use the BTS in Sukhumvit Although it gets very crowded at peak hours but if you have to queue up it only takes a few minutes for the next train to arrive Make sure you always have a lot of coins otherwise you also need to queue for the moneychangebooth before queuing for the tickets

title: Sky train is a breeze
review: Anything along the route is easy to access The trains are clean modern and my experience is that a train comes to the stations about every 10 minutes So never a long wait In the heart of Bangkok traffic jams are nasty The BTS is a breeze

title: Helpful
review: Clean fast and made our trip easier and easier cheap compared with taxis  we stayed in amara hotel so we took bts from chong nonsi station

title: easy and convenient
review: Fast and easy to catch you don't have to worry if you misses the BTS as there are frequent services

title: bts
review: Use this public transportation to travel inside bangkok it's very cheap and safe You can visit Siam Central World Chitlom Asok Asiatic using this train

title: Easy to use and useful
review: This is the easiest way to get around Bangkok by far The traffic is very bad in central Bangkok and taxis and tuk tuk take a while to get any where The sky trains are cheap with the most expensive single trip 50 baht or an all day card 140 baht The sky train serves the centre of Bangkok and you may need to get a taxi or water taxi for some of the sights further afield The trains are all air conditioned and clean and they run a very regular service one also goes straight to Mo Chit which is where the weekend market is

title: Excellent way to get around Bangkok
review: Fast efficient and air conditioned  Day tickets are cheap and its easy to work your way around  Stayed on longer sometimes to cool down but avoid in rush hours

title: See Bangkok by BTS Skytrain
review: I used the BTS sky train only twice The experience was thrilling I was highly impressed by the discipline punctuality politeness and cooperation of the staff and locals with us foreigners It was a luxury as well and yet thrifty way to reach out to far off places

title: Very functional
review: Always on time an d very functional especially compared to the once we have in Europe this is lightyears ahead Clean and English explanation available it is very clear how to use it just give it a try

title: Very clean and easy to use.
review: Really enjoyed being in the stations very clean So easy to use you just look at where you want to go press the price button that corresponds and get your ticket Very cheap too Cost us about Â£1 each to get to town from Sukumvit

title: best transportation you need in bangkok
review: go whatever you want and provide a nice direction of every exit If you just take the bits you at least can visit 50 nice place of bangkok Also planning for a good route if you stay for 5 days i suggest to buy the special package Rabbit card save a lot And also provide some special discount at Macdonald and 711 Most of BTS ticket machine only accept coins you need to get the change from the ticket counter  Avoid the busy hour like 6pm and 910 amleave some space for the local That have a details reminder from the tv screen in the cabin So you won't miss any one  Between plan before you go BTS and different with MRT some of station have interchange section Some nots  Most of station provide stairs and after a long long walka bit tired for that And each station is about 1545 baht which depends the distance But one thing is not really good where you go to exit 1 you must need to go down to the street and get up from othersyou can't cross between two exit

title: Very well connected- best way to travel within Bangkok!
review: It is easy economic not very crowded wellmaintained and fast way to travel around the city It connects main points very well and we took the skytrain for almost all the destinations we went to The stations are also very well maintained and provide specific directions for exit and stations The ticket dispensing machine work like a dream (they did for us p  ) Overall quite a good experience plus it saves your money and time

title: Great way to move around in the city
review: We used bts throughout our travel in Bangkok It's well connected to all tourist spots Felt it was crowded in the bts which are connected to malls It's easy to use It's cheaper to travel in bts rather than tuk Tuks or taxis

title: Very good
review: Connectivity is awesome its fast and also frequent We used this to roam around bangkok Any market temple famous spots can be reached using BTS and a little bit of walking )

title: A turn off to change paper money into coins just to buy a ticket
review: Good service and clean interior  However it is cumbersome to always queue up just to change paper money into coins (at the counter) Then queue again at the machine to buy the tickets   This is 21st century  Can't the operater put a ticket machine that accepts paper money  Duhhhhh

title: A great alternative to handle the horrible BKK traffic. But with limitations...
review: If you're looking for a quick way to move around some attractions this is a great choice  Taking a taxi or a tuktuk can be a nightmare during rush hours which is most of the day except for the night PROS  It's FAST and useful for some destinations cheaper for a couple has a good connection with the ferry service CONS  can get really crowded it's not that cheaper if you're traveling as a family and it doesn't get you everywhere

title: Quicker than a cab
review: excellent service  reasonable prices  and easy to comprehend for the non local traveler  Worth using to negate the awful traffic in Bangkok

title: Not the best, but sometimes the only choice.
review: The BTS skytrain seems to get busier and more crowded every day From a service where you could always get a seat to the point now where you'll often need to wait for 2 or 3 trains to pass before you can squeeze on Not so bad during the middle of the day or late at night On a positive it's super reliable and a hundred times better than sitting in Bangkok traffic   If you're staying in town for a while the refillable rabbit cards won't save you any money but they'll save you lining up for a ticket every time and they can be used at food courts and other places around town Multiple trip cards don't work out very good value unless you are travelling long distances    Worth noting there's no eating or drinking on the BTS and most stations do not have elevators (working ones) for anyone with mobility issues

title: Great setup. Easy to use
review: Used the BTS for our stay in Bangkok It was awesome and easy to get around to the markets Great time Thanks for the fun Bangkok

title: Get to know the BTS and MRT
review: If you are staying in Bangkok a while make sure to get the rabbit card Load it up with however much baht you want So when it gets busy you do not have to wait in line to get changebuy tickets It simple swipe to access Get to know the BTSMRT lines and areas as the traffic in Bangkok is CRAZY   If you want to rent a scooter be careful as riding in Bangkok is different than in Canada or Vietnam They do not watch out for you  If you use it a lot in the day buy the Day pass for the MRT they have dayweekmonth pass  Both lines shuts down at 12 Midnight Taxis and Tuktuk knows this so they will start charging 100200 baht right away ALWAYS ask for meter and if they say no move on The older taxi drivers will usually say yes to the meters as the younger ones will try to rip you

title: excellent
review: Perfect way of transportation very safe and clean I wish all countries could copy such a great exemple

title: Wonderful Mode of Transportation
review: BTS is fast and clean It has really good AC for a cool confortable trip A little pricey but it is worth it

title: Getting around in Bangkok
review: Very reliable and clean Takes you the most important places and are always on time Much better and faster than sitting in a tuktuk or taxi in the crazy Bangkok traffic

title: Efficient Transport!
review: A quick and easy way to get around Bangkok airconditioned and inexpensive  The trains are very frequent and make travelling around a very busy traffic congested city a breeze

title: hassle free transportation
review: so easy to take a ride strong airconditioning and clean change your bills with coins at the counter then buy your ticket in the machine  so easy check the fare for your destination (just on the left side of the machine) then press the fare drop your coins (the machine gives change) get your card and your change (you will buy 1 card at a time) you get to see the amazing views of bangkok esp the temples and tall buildings Free BTS map in the stations be sure to grab one

title: Excellent way to travel in Bangkok
review: We found this to be our preferred way to get around Bangkok Clean cheap easy to navigate and user friendly THere are people everywhere who are more than willing to help in the event you need some

title: Travel
review: Cheap wonderfully cool and easy to use Trains run almost every minute Be aware thought that it shuts down at 12midnight We didn't realise this the first day that we bought a ticket but simply caught a taxi home A great way to get around the city

title: Lovely Transportation!
review: Clean fast reliable love it It's very close to my hostel safe my time to go everywhere Very easy to understand the map If you are lost ask the security guards they will always help you

title: Packed with lots of people but an excellent and rapid transport to any places of interest in BGK
review: To use t o avoid traffic jam but be prepared to lots of people Taxis are cheap in banglok and somehow easy Just make sure they turn their counter or just bargain the price beforehand

title: Easy to ride
review: Quite straight forward easy to follow Very convenient Plenty of seats to sit  A great way to use for transportation around Bang kok

title: not cheap, but gets you there fast
review: only has two lines doesn't get you all over the city it's freezing inside the trains but it gets you to your destination fast

title: Beat the traffic
review: Safe cheap but you need lots of coins or get stuck in a long queue fast way to deal with the traffic of Bangkok

title: Fun, clean, fast, not too pricy.
review: The trains were wellkept orderly spacious and welldesigned The fair wasn't cheap but not terribly expensive either

title: Easy travel around Bangkok
review: To take the sky train is a very easy and cheap way to travel around Bangkok Either buy a one or multiyday pass or pay single trips in the automatic ticket machine The stations are very clearly marked with the ticket price and you just press the price and insert coins in the machine and you get your ticket and chance

title: Amazing Skytrain System
review: The Skytrain systen in BKK works great and is efficient is clean and always air conditioned  Best way to get around when traffic is bad  Also quite reasonable priced  You can also take from the international airport if you don't have to many heavy bags

title: Nice train
review: Close to hotel and shopping train service was outclassed little bit rush but I think it's good choice compare to taxi it stuck in traffic is terrible in bkk

title: The best public transport
review: The sky train allows you to easily see all of Bangkok without queuing in traffic for ages It can get quite busy but that's expected in any busy city It's very clean and has good air conditioning You purchase tickets from a machine but if you have no change there is a service desk which can swap money for you If you want to purchase a day pass this is also done at the desk and it is great value for money The only downfall is it doesn't serve the area of Bangkok that has Khao San road and the grand palace etc

title: Only way to move around, he!
review: With traffic as it is in BKK get a suitable ticket  deal and use the Skytrain then maybe a cab or a motodop to reach the "Sois" adjoining the large avenues Top public service Cheers

title: Good Mode of Transport in Bangkok
review: take change exchange coins for your currency notes machines accepts coins onlythey dont have ticket countersthey have change countersyou can get exact change for your destinationsgood thinking bangkok

title: Good
review: Perfect means of transportation when in Bangkok The sktrain is fast cheap and reliable Beats a taxi

title: Good Transportation
review: The BTS in Bangkok is very good clean and easy to understand The only thing is somehow is is so busy u have to let trains go because one does not fit in

title: Avoid the traffic jams
review: Use the bts to get to the outer extremities and catch your cab from there Quick cost effective and environmental  Shame though that they don't run more trains They are very very full these days with barely standing room during peak hours  All that said they are always clean and free of vandalism  Don't forget to buy what's called a rabbit card Top it up as you need

title: Quick, AicCon and Safer than taxis
review: easy to use quicker than taxis and safer than tuktuks in the city also great AirCon to get a quick break from the heat

title: Very convenient
review: Bangkok being in the top 10 world wide for traffic congestion during day time BTS together with MRT are the best travel option Trains are very clean and very well air conditionned if you are travelling a longer time on BTS a light jacket may be a good idea

title: cheap & best way of Transportation
review: Cheap and best way to reach anywhere around the bangkok without getting stuck in the hectic traffic of Bangkok

title: Great way to get around
review: Clean cheap prompt fast and efficient If only their operation times were extended to after midnight Otherwise the best way to move inside Bangkok

title: cheap and easy to use
review: cheap and easy to use it is the best way to reach your destination faster and cheaper two things to know 1 only coins to purchase the card 2 do not loss your card or you will pay double

title: Theeee best way to travel
review: BTS is the best way to travel when in Bangkok cabs tuk tuks (for the experience) but if you want to get from one palce to another fast and hassle free then take the sky train

title: A must in busy Bangkok
review: Such a good service So clean The air con is a god send in the heat I would say it is one the easiest cheapest and cleaners ways of getting round Bangkok

title: So good
review: The train trip was so good We did a night trip with a sleeper We were travelling from Chang Mai to Phutsanulok Train is punctual and comfortable The seats are pulled down to make a bed and the top bunk is also pulled down at around 1930 for anyone travelling with children The food service and quality was awesome So much food and so cheap Would highly recommend the train for travelling in Thailand We also got the train from Phitsanulok to Bangkok at 0800 arriving in Bangers at 1430 and we found this day trip to be long Would recommend any train travel overnight The toilet is a hole in the floor which is cleaned regularly throughout the trip The train police are very helpful and obliging

title: Perfect to get arround
review: Easy way to travel arround and see all the highligts Fast and cheap  To many traffic in Bangkok to go faster by taxi

title: Reasonably priced, often quicker alternative to the taxis, especially when you're travelling alone
review: BTS Skytrain's cars are a little smaller than those of MTS trains They are usually not very corwded lateast in the offpeak hours  Since they cover many of the busier areas of Bangkok you usually never too far away from a BTS station as a tourist  The train pass system is easy to use and all the trains are air conditioned

title: Fast train service with great Bangkok views
review: BTS runs along Sukhumvit's shopping and entertainment precincts giving access to quality shopping It also goes to Chatuchak weekend market and to the Chaophraya River area If using frequently buy a card and load up a few hundred baht to avoid queues

title: Great System
review: BTS Skytrain service is convenient with frequent trains connecting all the major areas of Bangkok The air conditioning inside the cars works very well which feels great after spending time outside in Bangkok's heat Fares are also quite reasonable

title: The Best Way around Bangkok
review: The best way of getting around Bangkok There's also the Skywalk which is below the Skytrain and above the roads  so you can move from one to another easily Especially convenient around the inner city BTS stations along the Sukhumvit line where Nana Ploenchit Chitlom and Siam are all in a row and connect up shopping centres and much of the tourist action Cheap (THB 15 per stop and THB 120 for a full day pass) and super convenient compared with overpriced tuktuks that can end up taking you places you dont want to go and being stuck in sometimes gridlock traffic

title: Clean, convenient and safe
review: The BTS system is Bangkok is clean and safe  I used both the BTS and the MRT systems during the day and night time  I feel safe and comfortable There are security guards posted right in front of every stations and on the platforms  System will announce every stops in English as well as Thai  Very convenient to use and affordable

title: Nice cool air con in train
review: Excellent high speed tube train  Travelled to Chatuchack market on the train Good service and easy to manage ticket system

title: Beating the traffic!!
review: If you are sick of the traffic in bangkok then this is a good medium for travelling Convenient and cheap for solo and budgeted travellers But with small kids it can be a bit inconvenient as the crowd can be crazy during peak hours Its a faster medium and its clean as well But they should seriously update those ticket machines Someone might get confused while using it for the first time Sometimes those work sometimes they don't But all in all it was a good experience

title: Good for travelling
review: The location is just perfect wouldnt need to wait too long for arrival it will be better if they can lower the ticket price

title: Let the train take the strain
review: Air conditioned coaches bliss No overcrowing when we travelled Easy to follow route plan above each door on the train So much better than Merseyrail

title: Easy and efficient
review: The sky train offered phenomenal views of Bangkok and was an adequate way of transportation throughout the city It was reasonably priced My only complaint is that the train gets really packed at peak hours

title: Pleasant ride, good mode of transportation
review: We had taken Skytrain few times while in Bangkok The routes can be clarified at the stations staff does understand English quite well The actual view from the train is not bad we spotted few places and jumped off and explored Only word of caution is to avoid in peak hours the train is jampacked Well it's the same in any megalopolis I guess

title: Easy to use and inexpensive!
review: The best way to get around Bangkok If you're planning on staying for more than a few days and doing a lot of sightseeing buying a multipass is really worth it I always book a hotelguest house near the BTS you'll save a fortune in taxis

title: Key to the city!
review: Very easy to understand and makes traveling around Bangkok really simple Most instructions are repeated in English which makes the service very accessible for foreign travelers

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy way of getting around the city The system is easy to navigate The trains are air conditioned We managed to get to all of our places with ease

title: Convenience in transportation
review: BTS transportation in Bangkok is very convenience and safe money It is clean and right time and every tourist attraction places are reached Ticket system is very simple and easy and change of money (coin) is also easy in station It is cheaper than using Taxi to International Airport I like so much and 100% recommend for this

title: A Must In Bangkok
review: A great way to get around Bangkok It's fast frequent inexpensive & cool Did I say cool Yes Beats bargaining with taxis & being stuck in traffic jams And walking on those broken pavements I've never had a problem no matter how packed the Skytrain was Try & book accommodation near a station you'll be thankful you've saved yourself a lot of stress & time

title: Bangkok BTS Skytrain
review: Best way to get around Bangkok ( to beat the jams )  fast clean and takes you almost everywhere suggest you download on your phone or print out the Bangkok BTS map for easy reference

title: Get a card to avoid the queues
review: If you are in BKK for more than a day or two it is really worth getting a Rabbit Card It cost a 50 Baht deposit (and whatever you put  on it) and you can cash it in when you leave It avoids you queuing to put the coins one at the time in the ticket machine working out how much for the stop you are going to and joining another queue when you realise that you dont have enough loose change In the rush hour and at  some stops (ie Asoke) thses queues can be quite long (and hot) Why change a first world ride into a thrid world experience if you can avoid it The service if fast and frequent (and the trains are air conditioned)

title: Highly recommended
review: Good and cheap way to get around the center (along with using the subway) as well as to avoid annoying tuktuktaxidrivers and heavy traffic Sometimes too overcrowded though

title: Great Transportation
review: This is a great way to get around Bangkok and avoid the terrible traffic Very easy to use Maps are in Thai and English Trains are on time air conditioned and clean

title: Great way to explore Bangkok!
review: The BTS here is similar to Malaysia monorail but just better The workers are everywhere ready to help and there are many machine ticket You can reach almost everywhere by using this transportation service I rate 4 stars as Japan still the best

title: Good train system but not very user friendly
review: BTS skytrain run within Bangkok The frequency of train is high The train line cover the major streets of Bangkok  However you cannot go to Grand Palace Wat Po and Wat Arun by BTS  It is not easy to climb up the stairs to BTS skytrain You may need to walk a bit in order to get escalator The service counter is not really helpful If you want to buy ticket the counter will just give you some coins for you to buy ticket at the ticket machines Only in some rare cases they will really sell you the ticket at the counter

title: Efficient Journey in the City
review: This is most efficient travel mode if you want to go many places in the city center area Although to me fare appeared on a higher side but not getting stuck in Bangkok traffic you can discount that Overall a smooth and time saving trip

title: Quick and comfortable way around BKK
review: The BTS sky train makes it very easy to to get around all those shopping centres and attractions Very clean airconditioned carriages and a very easy system to follow too after the initial visit

title: good way to get around
review: Good way to get around being enlarged currentlyto airport  rush hour should be avoided unless you are prepared to hold you place with sharp ellbows

title: Fast and clear.
review: The best way to move at BKK but it is better to avoid rushing hours during weekdays It is used to be very crowed

title: Awesome
review: Awesome and Convenient  Avoids traffic and stations over the weekend is  like a carnival  Easiest way to learn the city

title: very convenient and cheap
review: To avoid the traffic jam in BKK you must try the BTS to go every where in BKK The ticket is very cheap and very convenient

title: Convenience to reach the destination
review: Convenience and good transportation mode for travellers Travellers can rest well before they reach for the destination Neatclean and comfortable

title: Convinient
review: The BTS Skytrain was an extremely convenient way of getting around Bangkok There are plenty of stations of which most are conveniently located near hotels major shopping centres and major tourist attractions We regularly used the Skytrain and found it at all times clean and well kept As you would expect around the more popular locations it is standing room only but where today is it not The ticketing is fairly intuitive providing you take the time to stop and read the requirements Like with most things these days the ticketing is automated so you need to understand where you are and where you want to go to ensure you conform to the numbering system  You will require change to purchase a ticket however a teller can provide you with the change or if you are really stuck can assist by issuing a ticket But note that this may not happen at all stations

title: pleasant BTS
review: the trains are clean the stations maps are easy to understand the fares are relatively cheap and travelling on them are really convenient and fast best way to avoid the traffic jams on the roads by taxituk tuk

title: Love the exploration
review: Got us where we wanted to go  Can't beat the price  Some what crowded the train doesn't get you to all of the temples

title: Amazing Train
review: I rode the trains all over Bangkok The price is cheap and the of stops is great You can easily navigate around the city on this I rode it to embassies shopping water taxis the railroad station and museums Definitely ride the BTS

title: Great Public Transport
review: Though i was having problem at buying tickets as they don't speak english I met a good gentle man who help me buy the required ticket and which station i should get down  You have to be familiar with the areas to use this

title: You've got to try it!
review: Cheap Convenient Easy to use Crowded at busier stations as expected Great experience You've got to try it

title: Dependable way to explore Bangkok with the locals
review: The BTS Skytrain was always on time and we did not have schedule delays The route map was easy to read and navigate If you're in Bangkok for a few days buy the 3day pass The train is crowded during rush hour

title: Clean and efficient!
review: Great way to get around Bangkok Don't worry about safety as people in Thailand are generally very friendly Also has AC so it's a nice break after walking around the scorching hot streets of Bangkok Also very easy to figure out and clean

title: Service excellence
review: These guys are awesome I was pregnant during our trip and i fainted as my husband jumped on and i missed the doors closing He had our bags etc  The operators went our of their way to unit us and let me ride free until i found him

title: Not bad at all
review: easy and cool transport to escape the heat People are very calm and friendly in the train and patient

title: Such a quick and easy way to get around BKK
review: Love the skytrain  saves you tons of time versus going by Tuk or Taxi if you're further that around the corner that is I like the fact that you only pay for the amounts of stops you'll be using to get to your destination This seems like such a fair system wish Copenhagen department of transportation could figure this out  Tip once you get your ticket hold ON to it Once you reach your chosen stopstation you will need it to get out from that station Once had a friend get stuck because he threw his away after entering start station Had to go buy him a new ticket so he could get out or you will have to jump over the exit booth don't suggest that as all stations do have guards  Another tip if you are new to BKK or want to doconsider doing a river cruise is to just take the water taxis from the river like the locals The tourist river tours easily run up to 1000 Bath pp even seen higher prices  Yes you won't get some more or less anoying guide saying a bunch of stuff and so what It will save you around 1000 Bath which you can spend in 2 minuttes if you decide to treat yourself to what I call my favourite shopping mall  Siam Paragon  Ladies you're worth it and the skytrain takes you directly to the door Get off at the Siam stop and have some fun

title: Best Way to Get Round
review: Cheap spotlessly clean and efficient Ride above the traffic and fumes on the BTS The air con is a real added bonus on those humid days

title: Forget on-ground transportation, use BTS
review: the most comfortable way to get around this busy city be ware of a rush hour since it can get crammed at times otherwise have a good sightseeing trip with the sky train route

title: Must-try when you're in Bangkok
review: First of all i have to say this I'm from Vietnam That's why when use the BTSMRT in Bangkok i feel very very jealous The whole system make me feel like im in Shanghai or even Paris Inside is very cool very clean very crowded It's super easy to purchase ticket with coin and it also have counter for you to exchange coins Cannot imagine bangkok without MRTBTS

title: The way trains in Europe should had been
review: Cheap (full day pass less than 5 EUR)  Very clean (not 1 piece of paper o the floor anywhere) all seats cleanfresh on time perfect AC running every 510 minutes Each station has hosts keeping the order on the stations  Really good  the way I wish trains in Europe would be

title: Safe And Sound
review: This service is efficient clean and amazing value for money Both G4S guards  of which there are many  and other passengers were happy to advise on how to use the trains Change for the ticket machines can be obtained from the ticket kiosk and buying tickets for your destination is very straightforward A great way to get round Bangkok Congestion is inevitable at peak travelling times as in all cities but the trains run frequently Very impressed by security British public transport please take note

title: Fast and convenient
review: It is fast and convenient and has english signs for easy navigating   Just try to avoid during rush hours when people goes to work or comes home from work During weekends its not too crowded   But when your in groups of 4 people taxi is cheaper and entails less walking

title: Move fast and easy around Bangkok, even from the airport
review: Good to use to get away from the traffic jams The Bangkok Mass Transit System commonly known as the BTS or the Skytrain (Thai à¸£à¸à¹à¸à¸à¹à¸² rot fai fa) is an elevated rapid transit system in Bangkok Thailand

title: Make sure you take the train!
review: Clean air conditioned and efficient  considering the Bangkok traffic the best bet for getting where you want to go

title: Fantastic way to get around
review: This is a great way to get around Bangkok As a family of 4 we took this every day all around Bangkok It was very convenient air conditioned and inexpensive

title: Use during rush hour
review: Use it during rush hour will save a lot of time If you're with 34 people a taxi on the meter will be cheaper though

title: Efficient and easy to use
review: Great way to navigate the city especially with the nightmare traffic on the roads The line goes to most of the main tourist attractions and run quite frequently Ideal for if your hotel is near a station

title: Ease of use
review: Very easy to use We used it from the airport to the center and later on to move around bangkok Easy to navigate and certainly a good way to do things your own way

title: crowded
review: good to roam i specific area of bangkok not a big networkcrowded during peak hours so roam during off hour

title: best way through bangkok
review: this is the fastest way through Bangkok easy to use and cheap gets full during Peak hours cool inside  hot outside

title: 2 thumbs up
review: The train is always on time Staffs are friendly Organize and most importantly it's cooler inside 2 thumbs up

title: Fast and clean
review: It is the best way to travel in Bangkok you arrive very fast to all the places with a very low price The only problem it covers only a small part of the city (not the center) and it is crowded at the rush hour

title: BTS Train
review: Staff friendly U need coins to buy tickets or else u can change coins at the counter or buy topup commuter cards Dont travel during peak periods Very crowded No escalator to go up & down to platforms Cimbed up & down steps like 3 storeys high Lift is located at strategic place U need strong knees Local commuters very considerate & polite Queueing to board & give up seats for elderly & children Thumbs up to Thai ppl

title: Main transportation :)
review: Very cool wide and spacious Totally satisfied I think one of the best in Southeast Asia Make sure you alway have enough coin to buy the ticket or else you can opt for monthly ticket )

title: Good train system
review: Organised clean and ontime service Air conditioning system is also good Quick and easy to get from one station to another

title: Better than taxis
review: Very prompt clean and easy to navigate Easy to get into the mains hopping area from hotel zone leads right into the main malls

title: Take the train at any opportunity
review: The BTS is efficient safe and inexpensive  It has also expanded considerably over the many years I have been visiting Bangkok  The only downside is that there are very few lifts or escalators from the ground  Usually one has to walk up many stairs to get to an escalator  After a long long day I have often found this tiring

title: Bets choice!
review: I would strongly recommend this as the traffic in BKK can be really crazy Please bring lotsa coins ( or these a counter to exchange) )

title: Use the BTS to access all Bangkok Sights
review: We were near Phloen Chit and Nana BTS stations The system is so easy to use and makes it easy to access all the sights of Bangkok It crosses the underground at several stations and the 2 BTS lines cross too so it's easy to use both

title: Easy to use
review: When visiting the great city of Bangkok it is very easy to just hop on and off the skytrain to get where you need to be We always buy the day pass as it allows you to go anywhere you want with in the system Well implemented clean and safe

title: Good Good Take
review: I took BTS everyday except for the last day going to the airport It's super convenient and very easy to go anywhere you want with BTS But It's so crowded all the time (

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: So clean and efficient Great way to travel in Bangkok Coins only to buy tickets which is a bit of a pain but there are clerks available to give you change

title: ...But crowded too
review: Nice service I feel very convenient with this route Located all the way of busy traffic road in mid Bangkok takes me as fast as it is flying above the road Any bettter service than I prefer

title: BTS - Away from traffic jam
review: We're staying in Bangkok for 8days  By BTS to anywhere  EASY  Convenience  Clean and safe    Reminder  Ready some coins  It's because some of the ticket machine only accept coins  Or you have to wait long queue to ticket office

title: Thought it would be cheaper
review: 30 baht for a ride Not much cheaper than a taxi or tuk tuk Surprising Great aC inside though What else can I say

title: The only mass transit that got the air conditioning right!
review: This is the only metro in all major cities I know which cranks up the air conditioning to a nice cooling level ) Extremely convenient to get around everywhere  if you plan on using it consider buying a topup "Rabbit" card or a "BTS" card

title: Cool, convinient but crowded
review: It is more than a transportation It is a very good way to look around Bangkok city But it is very crowded in rush hour and also a little bit crowded always

title: Bts sky train
review: Dead easy to usecheap & clean We had no problems at all so easy to navigate the ticket machines and route planning was a breeze Fully airconditioning on trains and so much better than overpriced taxis & tuk tuks

title: Seats can be softer...
review: BTS Skytrain is very convenient clean and cheap seats are too hard for long ride lol Even though my husand and I cannot understand any Thai we had no trouble riding and finding the right stations

title: Easy to get around on
review: Buy a ticket and go  Its easy  Staff are helpful to purchase a ticket or just use the machines

title: BTS skytrain..good option
review: i have used the BTS skytrain once and felt very comfortable in it users are very respectful with visitors

title: Ok transportation system
review: The biggest problem we found is that it's quite a wait in between trains  Even just a little bit less time would mean a much more pleasant trip  I didn't mind the crush (part of the the experience) but when you have to wait 1520 mins for each train it can be annoying

title: The BTS Skytrain is THE BEST and every visitor should use it!
review: The BTS is fantastic It is clean well run and on time The Thai people are correctly very proud of it It goes to many places "on the tourist map" and is very easy to navigate if you speak English (or Thai ) as everything is written in both languages I avoid tuk tuks like the plague that they are and always try to take the BTS Skytrain first  for as much of my trip as possible

title: excellent system
review: if you can take the bts your life will be much easier  well maintained clean and very cool aircon  if there is no bts service to where we want to go we don't go loltraffic in bkk is a nightmarejust wish it was open 247 for our late nights out

title: Great way to get around
review: BTS is the best way to avoid the usual congested traffic in the city of angels All important points are connected and it's easy to find your way due to easy to read signs and ever so friendly employees ( even when their English isn't the greatest)

title: Easy to figure out and get around as an English speaker
review: My first ride on the Skytrain was on my own although with specific directions from the front desk staff at my hotel  There are maps and signs all around in both Thai and English so it was easy to orient myself  Without any trouble I found the correct platform made my transfer at Siam and made it to my stop  On the train they announce the stations in both Thai and English so it is easy to know when to get off  There are also detailed maps that help you navigate to the correct exit for your destination which is wonderful because it keeps you from having to cross too many streets at street level and navigate the traffic    The trains were clean and I don't think I waited more than five minutes for a train the entire trip  I recommend this over taking a taxi as the traffic in Bangkok can cause you to waste a lot of time waiting to move    You can purchase tickets with either coin or paper money but pay attention because certain machines take coin only  Ticket prices are reasonable although at peak times the queue for purchasing tickets can take a while

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok
review: One of the life lines of Bangkok city with MRT BRT and Chao Phraya boat expresses The best way to travel in Bangkok is the BTS and MRT There is heavy traffic on the roads and you will invariably get stuck in one place or the other for at least an hour most of the times We got stuck in one traveling by a taxi from Mo Chit terminal 2 Bus station to Mo chit BTS station A distance which must not take more than 10 mts and 50 Baht took us almost an hour and costed 100 Baht Yes taxi meter keeps running faster when it is stuck in a signal or traffic jam than when it is on the move or that is what you will feel Trains and stations are very clean There are security personal to guide you how to reach the near by malls There are 2 lines of BTS  Sukhumvit and silom line The malls have direct access from the stations or sky walks which takes you in the direction you want to go Each station will have a map of the BTS lines so you can easily find out where you want to go and what will be the fare If you are there for just a day and wanted to travel a lot buy a one day ticket for 120 Baht and you can travel as many times and trips that day If you are staying for 3 or more days you can buy rabbit cards which allows you to prepay and make many trips and saves you the hassle of checking the price or buying a ticket every time You will get a refund of the unused amount when you return the card Taxi will seem the cheaper option when there are 4 people but then you are likely to get stuck in the traffic any time of the day The BTS starts at 6 am and runs till mid night There is a train for every 3 or 5 mts During peak hours the train are crowded but still you can travel There will be announcements as to what is the next station in the train so that you know when your stop is due There are stations which are interconnection between the two lines and other stations which are interconnections with the MRT To travel via boat take Silom line BTS train to Sapan Taskin station and walk down the steps directly to Central Pier from where you will get several type of boats to travel along the river Places like Grand Palace Wat Pho Wat Arun China Town Thonburi station are easily reached by boar

title: Easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is air conditioned and clean It is very easy I hardly ever take a taxi  I take the BTS or a motorcycle taxi most places to avoid Bangkok traffic

title: BTS..air conditioned access to shopping showcases in BKK
review: Pretty Slick operation clean and air conditioned and easy to coordinate your way around the city  Just don't upset the security staff at the station

title: Convenient and clean
review: The ticket office the explanation boards and the punctuality are quite impressive Can dare say it even is better than the breakdown prone SMRT

title: Best service
review: During my stay in Bangkok I got a rabbit card and explored the city everyday using BTS  It was so quick and convenient to reach any part of the city Great facility and Bangkok people are lucky enough to have such wonderful train service

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok
review: One of the best ways to get around above the traffic and in air conditioned comfort  You will need coins to use for the ticket machines  The number on the machines indicates how much you need to pay  The ladies at the change counters will exchange notes for coins so you will have the correct change

title: Lousy & Bad Attitude of people travelling on BTS
review: BTS is very fast and quick downside is there's too many rude people pushing shoving and not enough space for luggage people with big bags and the door alley is way too small to accomodate huge crowds

title: Not bad
review: Average compare to metro in Dubai Too hot since waiting area is open at times the station doesnt appear in English

title: I love love love this train that brings me everywhere I want to go
review: The best thing about this train is that it's easy and fast Never less it is a train that a lot of people use So don't be shocked when you are standing close to other people )

title: Regular visitor loves to try new things in BKK
review: Well connected very convenient Just avoid peak office hours and public holidays It's a "must try" actually to be honest  in the peak hours too it has its own charm How the crowd moves and yet there is a kind of system in the chaos To experience it i tried it several times and got on and off at different stations People are helpful in case you feel lost

title: excellent transportation
review: The sky train goes all over downtown Bangkok  It's easy to use and very efficient I loved it  It's like light rail in the United States but more user friendly  Sometimes during rush hours it does become a bit crowded but it's still fun and easy to use

title: Effiecient
review: Loved the quick and easy sky trains They take you to many locations There is only two lines There is air con Best way to travel when there is traffic in bangkok I like how people queue nicely compared to london tubes

title: reliable, fast and convenient
review: Well BTS is a life saver in Bangkok  Everybody knows traffic in Bangkok is almost nightmare  Thanks to the BTS which makes my trip and travelling so much easier  The price might be high for locals but it's reasonable for travellers  It connects to many tourist spots and hotels    There are some suggestions though  If the country can start developing elevators going downward it will be perfect  It is a hard time for self travellers carrying heavy baggages going down  Another thing is the gate doors which look like crab's pincers close too quickly  My thigh was slammed and bruised because i was too slow (I was pushing two baggages)  The helpers at the station offered help which was very nice  And every time I felt anxious while passing the gate    On the whole the BTS is a great infrastructure and really contributes a lot to the city May God bless Thailand

title: brilliant
review: good clean quick travel around Bangkok worth getting a rabbit card to save money no drinks or food allowed very safe for single travel too

title: Perfect
review: Easy to use great for getting to the airport could be closer to some popular atractions but still great and cheep

title: fastest way in bangkok
review: The best way to travel in bangkok with low prices fast but full while rush hour better than taxis

title: Great way to commute..
review: Excellent way to commuteit was expected to be crowded but quite clean though still some more work can go into it

title: The best way in Bangkok
review: it is the best way to move in Bangkok it is will organised and make the ways easy from one region to another with good price of the tickets and it is many lines intersecting and one of them going to the airport which is a perfect thing

title: Use it all the time
review: if only UK had a Sky Train Fast cheap clean regular from 6am to midnight you can eat your lunch off the floor it's so clean air con on full it takes us most of the places we want to go in Bangkok Buy a carrot card to save on fares and not having to queue to buy tickets at each station

title: very convenient
review: It's very reasonable and convenient  But to purchase a ticket was a kind of trablesome  There is a machine you can use a bill but most ticket machines are coin use only  You need to have eough coins before hand

title: Fast way to commute.
review: Fast and cheap way to commute I must say Skytrain was suggested to me by  a local Really enjoyed my experience

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: Great alternative to tuktuk and taxies If you have never been in Bangkok you should try a tuktuk just for the fun of it But if you just want to get from one place to another I would deffently take the Skytrain They are airconditioned and clean People line up and behave nicely The Skytrain is fast Just avoid rush hour if possible

title: Best tour in Bkk
review: Best way to see BkkWhen it opened in 1999 it changed the city totallyTake it allover and enjoy uninterrupted view over so many places

title: Couldn't be better!
review: Been there form Ratchatewi Station to Siam the sky bridge was so convenient that we could travel from Siam to Central World Despite the dirtyish at some part of the bridge

title: BTS ... Best Trains Service!
review: If you are travelling anywhere near the train lines this is an excellent way to travel  clean frequent generally easy to find a seat  stations are welllaid out Announcements on trains are helpful Buy a multijourney ticket and it saves those long queues

title: THE best way to get around Bangkok.
review: Once you get past the chaos of figuring out and purchasing your tickets to your destination it works very smoothly Buying the tickets is the most difficult part The train itself was very neat and clean very efficient and quick to many locations Far better than a car in traffic (which we did on arrival) or attempting to hail a cab (even more chaotic and crazy than traffic)

title: convenient and affordable
review: best way the move around in Bangkok with connectivity to most of the tourist spots and other local attractions

title: Convenient service
review: We tried the BTS and the instructions are easy to understand It is very convenient as the train arrives and departs on time and though it gets crowded on peak hours but I'll still take this one rather than getting stuck in traffic

title: Efficient and Clean
review: The trains are very packed during peak hours But they don't push each other to get into the train Besides the train is always on time and very frequent

title: Absolute best way to travel around Bangkok
review: The BTS is one thing Bangkok got right The BTS is extremely cheap extremely cheap and extremely convenient There are stations dotted out all through Bangkok making it a breeze to get from one end to another The BTS definitely beats getting a taxi or tuk tuk seeing as it is ALWAYS on time There are trains every 25 minutes depending on the time of day so you're never waiting around for very long

title: My favourite mean of transportation
review: MRT and BTS are the best way to travel in Bangkok Fares are affordable wagons are clean safe and well airconditioned All the major destinations (airports railway station shopping centres ferry docks and business districts) are along the network of sky trains and subways Most stations have escalators and lifts but for the ones not equipped be prepared to be in shape to climb those stairs when the mercury reaches 40 degrees Celsius

title: Cheap and easy.  Taxi advice below
review: If you are worried about getting screwed by the taxi from the airport  or anywhere for matter  take bts  For a couple of bucks you can get from airport to Sukumvit or silom areas  It's air conditioned and on time  If you have lots of luggage or heavy bags then it might be better in a cab  If so tell you taxi to use meter  If he refuses get out of cab and get another  There are hundreds of cabs  If you have problem with them use your phone and take picture of their I'D located on dash   Then say you call tourist police or police They will turn meter on or leave  Don't let them give you a set price  Some of them are honest but many are not and think all tourists are stupid  So I hope this helps someone  FYI fare from suvarnabumi to Sukumvit is 350 to 450 baht traffic pending with tolls

title: Great Revisit
review: Wonderful network efficient and fastcertainly amazing from 32 years ago when my visits were always a worry to airports for us crew during floods and traffic deadlocks

title: Very Well Connected.
review: Very efficient and clean Getting from one place to another is pretty easy in Bangkok There's no need to take a cab at all unless it's in the early hours of the morning The only confusing part is when there's a need to change train but the people there are rather helpful

title: Efficient and clean
review: I wish Manila's train system was more like this It's fast clean and has interchanges with other major mods of transportation like the ferry and the old railway station (Hua Lamphong) Wish there was a line traversing the other side of the Chao Phraya though But hey ferries have their charm as well

title: first world
review: The BTS makes travelling in BKK not just easier but so much more cheaper it is so accessible and a useful tool when travelling in Bangkok

title: Great way to travel
review: Great way to get around the city when temps are in the low 40's Trains are only crowded at peak times

title: Fast and efficent
review: Fast efficient and zirconperfect gets you where you need to be can be congested at peak times but that's normal everywhere Saves you a fortune on cabs but don't miss out the Tuk took experiencejust hold on to your bags

title: Could Use Some Improvement...and Attitude!
review: Average staff can improve on their attitude  From Siam to Ratchathewi (oneway) you cannot join the queue in purchasing tickets  Tickets must be purchased through machine  But no signboards say so  Most staffs do not speak English

title: FAST EFFICIENT
review: Everything is explained thoroughly and cheap access to different landmarks shopping etc You can buy your ticket via a machine or even a 'human'  On time every time I used it and very clean  Thailand can be proud of this

title: He fastest way to move around central Bangkok
review: The skytrain or BTS as the locals call it is the best way to move around central Bangkok You have stations at the major shopping areas and as the network is growing also further and further out Into suburbia If you are new to BKK it is a rest way to discover the city  start at one station and make that your area to explore for the day Some of my favourites are Sala Daeng  where you find nightlife and restaurants on the famous Silom road and its surroundings Siam is the heart of the city where you ha e no less than 12 malls in a row more or less connected with each other See the high street fashion in Paragon and Gaysorn plaza local designers in Siam Centre and all in between on the malls around  One thing about the BTS though try to avoid the rush out of you are visiting for pleasure  it gets pretty tight in there

title: The best way to beat Bangkok traffic.
review: It can be crowded sometimes but it's also the fastest way to get around Bangkok Bring some coins if you don't have the rabbit card

title: Fast, cheap, no traffic
review: the best way to get around Bangkok buy a Rabbit card and top up as you go maps are easy to follow and you can connect to the MRT (subway) from various stops I use it every day

title: Best way to get around
review: Fares are cheap and it's easy to get around Buy a Rabbit top up card and swipe yourself in and out quickly The downside of the system is that there are only stairs to get down from platforms but there are escalators to get up Essential if you are carrying luggage

title: Best travel option if going your way
review: Moving around Bangkok via the Skytrain is the best option to avoid the heat and traffic The service is very quick and efficient The train is always clean It can be a squash at peak times but just go with the flow

title: Fastest and most efficient way to get from point A to B in the CBD
review: The skytrain and the MRT (underground subway system) are probably the most efficient way to traverse Bangkok The stations connect with all the major shopping malls including Siam Paragon MBK Central World Emquartier Chatuchak Central Chitlom Lotus Tescothis is not an exhaustive list  The BTS and MRT are airconditioned clean and priced competitively Also the fellow passengers give you a kaleidiscope view into Bangkok's urbanscape Definitely worth trying out

title: The easiest way to get around central Bangkok
