review: My review is probably going to echo most other reviews on this site Yes the BTS is the easiest way to get around the central areas of Bangkok  There are two different BTS lines  one that runs through Sukhumvit which does the central areas of the city Easy access to the largest malls in Bangkok (Paragon Central etc) There is a second BTS line that you can use if you're at Siam BTS station This line runs through Silom and to yet another mall  MBK On this line you can get to the more outskirty areas like Saphan Taksin Chinatown etc  Do be aware that no BTS line actually goes as far as Khao San road or the Grand Palace   If you ask for directions to the closest Skytrain from a local it's best not to call it Skytrain Here in Bangkok people just refer to it as the BTS  You can buy day tickets for a small amount and if you're a tourist this is probably the best bet If you're staying in Bangkok for a couple of weeks it's going to to be worthwhile getting a Rabbit card which is basically a prepaid pass for the BTS But it also gets you a discounted rate and vouchers for various restaurants in the city  I live and work here so if any further advice is needed just send me a message

title: Convinient way to get whatever you want in Bangkok
review: BTS skytrain is one of the most popular  public transports in Bangkok It's fast has air conditioners clean and covers practically the whole central part of the city You can take motobike to the BTS station and then continue your way to any place you need In mornings and 58 pm it's too croudy as in any other big city but still it's the cheapest way

title: amazing transportion
review: Took Skytrain many times airport twice Sightseeing and going to train station to leave Bangkok So easy once you get the hang of it

title: Lifeline while travelling across Bangkok
review: Quite affordable easy to locate clear maps superb connectivity clean spaces But too much of walk

title: Ease of travel
review: BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok It's low price and consistent schedule are what I love Especially when the traffic is terrible Avoid during the afternoon rush unless you're ok with crowded spaces

title: Fast cheap and efficient
review: Great rail service connecting airport rail service to the city cheap and easy to use Felt safe Good stops servicing key parts of the city

title: Great public transportation
review: The skytrain runs through the center of the city is clean fast and easy to use The biggest surprise was how orderly everyone behaved when boarding and leaving the train Very affordable

title: skytrain is gooooood
review: train was goood enough bu comapred to dubai metro but its cheap and no need to wait for long time )

title: Skytrain is quite a fun experience in Bangkok
review: People were courteous at the counters as well as the fellow passengers Very convenient to travel by during rush hours fast and clean

title: Faster than taxi
review: Rabbit card is a worthy buy compared to oneday pass 150baht That's because you're probably stuck shopping for at least half a day at one station itself and will only take about 4rides per day Rabbit card has a nonrefundable card fee of 50baht and a refundable deposit of 50baht The cost of a train ride between stations on the same line probably cost at least 1625baht n up to 50baht on different lines   Take the bts better because traffic is horrendously bad in BKK

title: good train
review: ticket machines are easy enough to work out just make sure you have change as u cant put more than a 50b note in it they are quick and have aircon altho the stairs to get up to the platform are a bit of a killer if u are going up and down a few times

title: Clean and on time
review: What more do you want from a transport service Cleanon time and cheap B130 for a one day ticket Look at the platform and ypu will see where the trains will stop

title: Very clean and comfortable way to see Bangkok
review: The trains and stations were the cleanest I have seen If u have strollers they will open the big gate for u to leave People will give you seats for children handicaps senior and pregnant women The train connects to subway and airport rail link

title: Always efficient and easy to use
review: The transport is very well organized wellsigned and has aircon Very easy to use especially compared to our crap public trains in Vancouver Canada

title: Very efficient!
review: Have been using BTS since I arrived in Bangkok Love how efficient it is Just make sure you have coins so you can purchase tickets at their automated machines but if you don't have you can head to the counter and let them know where you are going and give them the money they will give you enough coins change to purchase the ticket while the remaining will be given in paper money

title: Efficient and Easy
review: Definitely the most efficient way of getting around Bangkok Trains are plentiful They're clean It's cheap It goes just about everywhere and it's easy to use

title: Good, clean and speedy
review: Took this and the Air Rail Link from BKK airport to Vie Hotel and it couldn't have been easier No escalators but elevators available Have coins ready or get change from Information window

title: Best way to avoid traffic and Cheap.
review: Very well connected and very easy to commute I find this to be a very economical way to travel If you choose your accommodation near a BTSyou can save some big bucks

title: fast and efficieint
review: one of the best ways to travel around bkkyou can either buy a day ticket if you plan to move around a lot or if you just need one ticket you go to the ticket machine to see how much to you next destination (if you are at for eg Asoke you see the name of he station you want to go to and the amount will be written for example 31 baht ) Then you go to the machine next to this information and press the 31 slot and put in the money Ticket will come out If you dont have change its the job of the ticket office to provide change so dont be embarrassed  they are very helpful

title: Getting around
review: The skytrain is an excellent way to get around in Bangkok and certainly one of the cheapest ways On average a trip will cost you about 30 bht Most of the stations are close to shopping locations which makes it very convenient There is a train about every 3 mins Brilliant

title: Impressed by the sky train
review: I was really impressed by the skytrain When you look down on the traffic jams you know you made the right decision The good news is that they are planning on extending it They really need more lines

title: Air Conditioned Comfort and Convenience
review: The Skytrain is the most convenient safe and clean means to move around the city The extensive network can deliver you close to many if not most places especially if you also connect to the BTS subway stations at several points along the system  While it can be very crowded during rush hour and when it rains it still is guaranteed to get you where you want to go in a relatively fixed scheduled time whereas taxis with traffic can be unpredictable During rush hour a run from Saphan Taksin ( by the Chao Phrya) to Asok station on Sukhumvit even at rush hour will be no more than about a half hour to 40 minutes A taxi during the same time may be a half hour to an hour and a half Aside from convenience and efficiency the trains are an air conditioned refuge from the sweltering heat and humidity While taxis are cheap in Bangkok the Skytrain is still the best way to move around the city in my opinion

title: Great way to get around
review: Bts skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok  Can be very crowded in the mornings and late afternoons but still great way to beat the traffic So I always surguest to find a hotel close to the BTS so you can get to all major shopping areas markets and the river and nightlife areas

title: Skytrain
review: This is a brilliant system  A pity it does not go into the tourist areas  It makes travelling into town really easy you would be mad not to use it

title: the fastest way to travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS and MRT are both excellent ways to get around Avoid rush hours though as it gets very busy

title: Past the traffic jams
review: Nice and smooth ride Very clean and gets you to your location quick Stops at almost every hot spot in the area

title: Easy to use.
review: Fastest way to the markets train was spotless and easy to buy tickets at the station They run fairly frequently only had to wait 5 mins max Good service

title: Best way to get around in Bangkok
review: Best and quickest way to get around the main areas as the road traffic is horrendously busy and at a regular standstill Choose a hotel near one of the stations

title: Sky train, an enjoyable ride
review: In a city where traffic jams are a way of life BTS is a great way to travel in Bangkok The train reminded me of the tube trains in London  Sky train implied monorail but it was not what I expected

title: BTS skytrain is very popular in BKK
review: BTS skytrain is very popular for people to use as travelling in Big city like bangkok Fast on time and  no traffic also save never missing an appointment

title: Useful & cheap
review: In my opinion it's the best way to get to the city center and has a few stops which let you change to other transports It is safe quick and way cheaper than taxi

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Clean and fast train services The locals call it skytrain as they also have an underground train services But be prepared for many long walks in Bangkok The escalators within the BTS station mainly are upgoing and stairs going down No elevators Coins operated machines for ticketing

title: BTS is a must for a visitor
review: Bangkok has a traffic problem and BTW is a good way to get around of it Very simple to follow directions and staff You can find your way around in Bangkok

title: Will use again
review: Efficient and comfortable but quite costly Still better than any other mode of transport  in Bangkok

title: Buy the Rabbit!
review: Clean airconditioned efficient and gets you to most places Buy the Rabbit stored value card because it saves you a lot of pain when queuing to buy tickets esp at popular stations where the line takes forever Although taxis are arguably cheaper when you ride with another person I prefer the BTS because it's hasslefree trafficfree and just more comfortable than the rather jerky car rides Would also recommend taking the BTS to transfer to airport rail

title: Great riding to see suburbs outside the city.
review: We enjoyed riding on the skytrain as we rode from 1 terminal to the other and the far terminal was in the suburbs which were interesting after being the busy city  Announcements were in Thai and English which was a great help and you could track your progress in lights above the doors

title: Wish Australia had something as good as this.
review: Trains are quick clean and cheap Easy to understand and use the fare structure You may have to stand but the positives outweigh that

title: BKK BTS stay close and use it often
review: When choosing your accommodation ensure you choose a hotel located within 500 m of a BTS  This will maximise your holiday time as you wont get drained in the tropical weather waking to your hotel Don't forget in hot humid weather it is sometimes impossible to walk more then 50 metres in the hot sun  If you are in BKK for more then a couple of day sit is worth buying a pass and topping it up as you go  This way you bypass all the long after work queues at the ticket vending machines and can directly enter the BTS ticket gates with out a fuss

title: Efficient but limiting
review: Fast and efficient way to get from one end of town to the other but serving very few locations Often very busy and packed If you are not a fan of the London Underground avoid peak times and popular locations like popular markets on weekends

title: Fast and reliable
review: We have had enough of the tuktuk drivers and taxi drivers trying to scam us so we tried using the sky train We're impressed and only cost us a couple of baht

title: Wish they had one of these in very city
review: They recently enlarged the coverage of the skytrain  It is reasonable in price and takes you all over the city and to the airport if you need  The platforms tend to be high and there are a good amount of stairs  Escalators are available and if you do not have exact change for the ticket machines there are staffed booth to give you change  Clean air conditioned well cared for usually pretty crowded but not terrible Well lit and safe Convenient stops Maps are clearly marked and easy to use  In the past I have had multiple day passes which is very economical

title: Highly efficient
review: Fast on time efficient and helpful staff day passes are useful for those wanting to travel to many places although the network is limited to the core and subway and other forms of transportation are required to reach several tourist spots

title: Good location
review: Excellent location which near BTS and MRT shopping mall and easy to go airport and also other stations

title: Cheap Sightseeing
review: Great way to see Bangkok and very cheap The skytrain is very safe and goes to the Chatuchak weekend market as well Easy to get around to many places in Bangkok

title: convenient tranport
review: suggest to purchase rabbit card instead of cash because there just accept coin to purchase ticketthere is long q when u exchange coin at counter

title: Perfect
review: Just a walk across the car park from the dusit Thani hotel Really easy to use very good price and ran on time Very clean onboard

title: Best transportation in bangkok
review: clean and fast transprtation in bangkok you can use a day pass (unlimited rides) for about 140 bhat

title: easy transport
review: Easy transport across the city especially if you are travelling alone Faster also given Bangkok's constant traffic snarls

title: First Class Service
review: BTS Skytrain Excellent Air conditioned Safe Clean & tidy Great value Use it  Public transport in Thailand is very good and very affordable Internal air travel excellent value too

title: Great way to travel.
review: Be careful buying reloadable cards if you are not a long term traveler or native Each line is a different company and requires a different card

title: Cool and convenient
review: It is cool really when you had spent hours under the burning sunshine in Thailand BTS offers you a good slot whether you stand or sit and drives you to the very convenience spots in town where you can easily gets to other popular places on your foot

title: Best way to get around, avoiding the horrendous traffic
review: Traffic in Bangkok is terrible with it seeming to be rush hour and grid locked most of the time  We used the BTS Skytrain for a short distance It was efficient and easy to use but there's no escaping the crowds as it was packed Definitely no personal space It was cheap and quicker than the road though

title: Does not get you everywhere
review: Looks good Works ok Costs are reasonable But travelling with 6persons maybe beter to get a taxi And this train has limitations Does nog get you into the centre of Bangkok

title: It's the only way to fly, Skytrain
review: For some reason I thought the BTS would be let crowded I will take it still because of the air conditioning and close the hotel I got across the city for 42 bhats about $119 Each way The street level was too congested

title: Easier then you think
review: Its too busy not some of the time in BK all the time This train is great take your time and nut out the routes it can be confusing but well worth it  30 min in taxi is 5 min on the BTS

title: BTS has great connections to the boat docks, famous weekend market, and big malls
review: Can be crowded but it is easy to maneuver I travelled solo as a 58 year old woman and could manage the system and how to pay Plenty of signs direct you and there is plenty of personnel if you need help They have been very friendly Take the BTS to the weekend market or to the ShangriLa Hotel (back entranceKrungthep Wing) and at the same stop you can board many different boats to go to the popular temples It helps to do that when it is so hot

title: Sky Train Bangkok
review: A great way to get around the city can get pretty full at times but it is clean cheap transport and a good view of the city while you travel

title: Clean, safe, fast and cheap.
review: One of the best transportation systems in the world  Clean safe fast and cheap  Can't get better than that

title: BTS outstanding transport !
review: So cheap and easy to get around  No need for sitting in the traffic this will get you everywhere you need to go quickly and it airconditioned

title: Efficient & Clean, Best Transportation Around Bangkok
review: the BTS Skytrain covers almost all the Attractions of Bangkok It is interconnected with the AIRPORT LINK MRT and FERRY also Trains are clean Staff of the train are very helpful Buy the 1 Day Pass for 140 Baht for Unlimited trips from 6am to 12mn The BTS is not for the Disabled and Elderly though as there are some stations wherein there are no Elevators or escalators available

title: FAST way around Bangkok
review: Great way to travel FAST  Taxis take forever due to the high traffic  Try to stay in a hotel near the BTS  Only problem is that it doesn't  take you everywhere in Bangkok  Clean roomy cheap

title: Fast, clean and safe!
review: Great way to get around Bangkok easy to get the hang of too so give it a try It also avoids traffic congestion if you have to be somewhere though it is fun to use other methods of transport

title: Most efficient way to travel around Bangkok
review: This is the best subway system I've ever taken All signage throughout the terminals were equipped with English translations and the station attendants were very helpful If you didn't know where to go you could tell them the landmark or area you were looking to travel to and they would print you a fare ticket to that destination Very cheap too

title: getting around Bangkok
review: Taking the BTS was a great way to get around the city and avoiding the taxis and city traffic (which was always pretty heavy) The cost was cheap and if you plan on using it all day there are passes which make it even easier Depending on your destination and stops the crowds can get pretty dense but there is always a sense of order Lining up there are queues and people waiting to get on allow those departing priority so that you don't have people trying to get on and off at the same time Airconditioning was Great so between stops a nice way to cool off Would definitely recommend this as one of the ways to get around

title: Best Way to Navigate Bangkok
review: As a traditional user of taxis and related transportation throughout the world I must admit that the Bangkok skytrain system is an excellent mode of getting around the City and preferential and faster than conventional automotive transportation given the heavy traffic throughout the City  Of special importance is the carrying of change to purchase tickets from the machine as it does not accept bills necessitating long lines in order to purchase same from an attendantcashier  Overall a decidedly efficient and clean system

title: Be prepared
review: Busy but an easy way to get around town Be aware that there is a strange system of counters manned by staff where instead of giving you a ticket they will only give you change to use the ticket machines

title: Traveling Aound Bangkok
review: The sky train is a great way to get from one side of Bangkok to the other  or to go anywhere in Bangkok Any time I used it was always very busy traveling  out of city never really busy going into city If traveling with young children take a taxi home

title: User friendly!
review: I simply love the fact that I can easily go to places by using the BTS train  without having to deal with the traffic jam I hope that they expand the BTS lines

title: Clean and easy
review: Skytrain has made travelling around Bangkok way easier Nice and clean way to travel It connects all the main spots in Bangkok

title: Improving over time
review: The coverage across Bangkok is gradually extending and the trains seem to be coming more frequently Many stations have escalators welcoming you in however when you attempt to leave access is still poor exiting stations especially for parents with children and disabled I still would prefer on many occasions to chose the hassle of stairs compared to sitting in a taxi for hours on end however

title: Better than Msia s LRT n monorail
review: The title says it all The public transport systems is the best The staff located at the stations are always smiling and willing to help if you are lost And the best part of all it is always clean and air conditioned despite the 40Â° weather in Bangkok Bravo to the public transport well done

title: Shopping in BKK made easy.
review: The maps are simple to read it's a very cheap & convenient way to travel Look out for the stations connected to malls like Asoke station with the Terminal 21 mall & Siam station that connects to the sky bridge However avoid peak hour whenever possible

title: Very convenient
review: Just perfect  Safe fast cheap and CLEAN No have any equivalency in Europe  The only way to be on time stress less

title: The Best,Easiest & Quickest City Transportation System in Bangkok! (Combined with the city MRT rail network.)
review: The "Most Comfortable" (Airconditioned with limited seatsbut most people stand)Cheapest (For a few dollars get you to most places around BKK) and "Quickest" Bangkok city transportation (WOW it's easily street accessible with frequent & fast trains and you avoid the ALL the Bangkok Heat PollutionNoise Traffic jams and Peak Hour city rushes  IMPORTANT TIP Either buy a Multi Pass for extra tripsdays is cheaper and easy to use as you swipe thru on the entry and exit into the BTS Sky train  Or MAKE SURE you always carry plenty of  10 & 5 Baht coins as there are mainly coin operated dispensing machines if you don't buy a plastic Multi Pass card pass Like any large busy city electric train bus and rail network best avoided during peak times like morning & late afternoons  Another Tip Go after 1000am as most city shopsshopping centres open from 1000am to 1000pm) & avoid late afternoon afternoonearly evening  500pm700pm city workers going home

title: As soon as possible
review: Do this on your first day because you need to use it to get around I tried the alternative and found myself stuck in a taxi for an hour and a half at rush hour  Go to a counter buy a day ticket for about Â£3 GBP and it runs out at midnight It does get very busy but it doesn't get stuck in traffic There are only two lines which connect to train and tube links You can get a map at the counter where you buy the day pass A good way of getting around the city

title: Clean, safe and efficient
review: Excellent way of travelling around bangkok Clean safe and easy to use We used the Skytrain to get to MBK mall and the tourist temples including the Grand palace (via the ferry service)

title: Buy a Rabbit Card!
review: Buy a Rabbit Card If you don't speak Thai the BTS is definitely the way to travel in Bangkok It is fast safe clean

title: A subway system in the air.
review: The sky train or Bangkok metro system with elevated pathways is very convenient to get around in this city The train are confortable and go to major places From the elevated platform you can look down or out to see the surroundings The system is used by most people and can be very busy at peak hours Very nice experience

title: Fast and efficient
review: We took the train to get around the city it was efficent cheap and fast too The train is clean and not so many people

title: BTS Skytrain Makes Traveling In Bangkok City Convenient
review: BTS Skytrain makes travelling in Bangkok city so much easier than before With links connecting to the Airport Rail Link and also the MRT most of the attractions in Bangkok can be much accessed to Frequency of the BTS is about 5 to 7 minutes per train Road congestion in Bangkok is one of the worst in the world don't be surprised that you will be traveling faster by cars and buses Convenient is the key of this useful transport

title: Best and economical travel option in bangkok
review: Neat clean and fast Entire trip was use BTS for commuting option Cheap and reliableall time remanded

title: What a tremendous change
review: There are no words to describe the city without skytrain I lived in the city until 1995 Road congestion was terrible  Cars barely traveled  driving of 15 minutes lasted at least 60 min  The taxi drivers "robbed" the tourists  The Skytrain has improved the lives of thousands of citizens and touristst

title: fast n well connected
review: this is one of the best method of moving about in bangkok if you want to avoid traffic congestionits not that expensive either save all your coins for bts skytrain but don't worry  if you dont have change you can always buy coins near the counter where you buy your ticketsyou can also avail of free maps for the city

title: Best transportation in Town
review: There a best transportation in town is BTS skytrain it avoid the heavy traffic and fast to take me to the destination

title: Great way to get around BKK.
review: Great way to get around the city Great value A bit crowed during rush hour I highly recommend using this service

title: Fast convenient and comfortable
review: I was impressed with the train system Trains were clean and comfortable even at peak hour I found the system well connected to most places a visitor to Bangkok would want to see

title: Clean, regular and efficient.
review: Always clean and at a cool temperature Regular trains  covering most of the city Escape the pollution and traffic below Super convenient as it runs until midnight

title: Convenient
review: Easy to travel in bangkok with the bts but the queue for tickets  is long if you come at a peak period and its better to spend a little more on a day pass than to queue every time

title: A good way to get about a big city.
review: Makes London look third world Very clean very safe and no idiots eating and drinking and dropping their litter as they leave  And eople wait for you to get off before getting on It is also easy to work out routes fares and get tickets I always get confused on leaving the station as there are no many exits  but I guess that is a failing on my part

title: Cheap price
review: It is fast and definitely cheaper than any other transport means It goes from the airport to the center of the city every 5 minutes and it cost just 45 bath

title: BTS sky train review
review: Very efficient and convenient And also at a reasonable price Fulfills the requirements of our trip

title: Long wait for train even at peak hour
review: Very crowded and train can add a few more carriages to ease crowding Increase frequency at peak office hours But love their supercool train carriages

title: The best way
review: I take the BTS thailand for go to work It's help me very much I go to work on time everyday I just spend time about 20 minutes from Mochit station to Thong Lo station It's very quick The BTS is the best transportation for me

title: Transport
review: It takes you from one place to another  Clean and efficient  If you've ever taken a train before you know what it is

title: Cheap and Easy
review: Easy to navigate and is also cheap so its a winner  Only downside is that it can be a tad crowded but the trains have ac so not too bad

title: Best way to go to anyplace you want
review: Clean near to a lot of tourist spot Fast and efficient Quite reasonable cost Need some time to be careful at interchange stop as it may be a little confusing

title: Easy way to travel
review: BTS is so handy to almost everything Super esay to get around and cheap enough that it won't impact your wallet

title: Great air con, a breeze!!
review: So nice to jump on a train from the hot busy city East way to travel  Need change for tickets cheap to travel and can change to MRT

title: Nice and Convenience
review: The sky train was so nice for Bangkok people and tourists This was the great choice for travel around Bangkok The cost of travel was low

title: Faster, better transport if your route fits
review: Easy and faster way around the city Limited to a few lines so tuktuks and taxi must be utilized as well Lacks service in the western part of the city where some main attractions are found Coins only is totally out of date but they have exchange services at most if not all stations

title: cheap and convenient
review: Great pric great access and very clean these fill up very fast so most passengers end up standing but it is a great travelling option at a great price

title: Great way to see Bangkok
review: Bangkok was unbelievably hot and humid in May when I visited entering the skytrain was like stepping into a heavenly cool rockpool More importantly the trains were easy to use quick and ontime

title: Great train system
review: Easy cheap and interesting  A much better option than getting caught up in the Bangkok traffic  We used the train to get from the airport to our hotel  Comparing this to the taxi ride I wouldn't hesitate in using the train  Of course you need to get your bags from the train station to the hotel but you can jump in  a cab

title: Invest in a Rabbit (card)....
review: Buy a Rabbit card at the window of the first BTS station you board and make your life easier Best transportation solution in the traffic burden capital of Thailand Clean Cool and Efficient

title: the best way to travel around Bangkok
review: BTS sky train is the most convenient way to travel around Bangkok it is also connected with the MRT lines through few of its stations BTS sky train offers oneday or weekly pass along with the normal stationstation pass The ticket system is selfserviced and pretty easy to do It saves a lot of money for small groups (34 person) but most importantly it saves a lot of time in the busy Bangkok traffic

title: Great way of commuting
review: Travelling in busy Bangkok was made very comfortable and busy by BTS Connecting to every important location and streets Very Comfortable way for tourist to travel across bangkok

title: Most effective transportation system in Bangkok
review: If you stay close to any of their stations With Bangkok streets in a virtual state of traffic jam it's a wise idea to book a hotel that's close to one of the BTS stations Clean reliable economical and on time  It also connects to the city's most popular places and attractions such as Siam Paragon Central World and more

title: Busy station
review: 2 places  that i love to travel in asia is singapore and thailand as its easily travelling for buz people with the less cost

title: Clean and modern
review: Very clean and modern Be warned that the airport line the BTS and other lines seem to be operated by different companies so I had to pay separately to ride each line The ticket machines I used didn't take notes but there was a change service available

title: Best way to see Bangkok
review: Fast efficient system will get you around Bangkok much quicker and cheaper than taxis Plus you get to see some of the amazing buildings and views from up high

title: Cheap clean and quick!!
review: The best way to travel with a birds eye view thrown in  after being ripped off by tuk tuk drivers Bankok ones are the worst they all have a different agenda and its not getting you from A to B so save money and frustration take the sky train so easy to get around and well air conditioned too

title: Convenient & Efficient Service
review: Makes travelling within Bangkok a lot easier Functions very well Puts the London Underground to shame its hugely efficient clean cheap and easy to use

title: Priceless option to get around Bangkok!
review: This option for moving around Bangkok is a must  I get a BTS card and use it during my trip  You will save money by using taxis less and save a lot of time during heavey traffic times of the day

title: Convenient but pricey
review: The skytrain is a great quick way to travel especially during busy traffic jam periods We found the train more expensive then a tuktuk or even taxi when travelling as a group of 3 or more

title: Mr
review: Just excellent n fastest wsy to move in bkk It is also cheap U can go within 20 minutes while by taxi u need t go same distance minimu ne hour or even more time

title: Quick and easy
review: Very quick and easy to travel about price good Some stations need change for ticket machines but either money changing desk or buy ticket at them As a skytrain it is above the road can be difficult when carrying cases not always lifts or esculators

title: Beat the horrendous traffic and use the BTS
review: We used the BTS a noof times especially while visiting the shopping malls The whole bunch of them like Central World Grand Hyatt Amarin are easily accesssible from the Chitlom station

title: Very Convenient way to travel within the city
review: BTS Skytrain network in Bangkok makes it possible to have easy access almost all the major attractions Also connected to the Airport link from Suvarnabhumi airport One problem is that many stations do not have escalators and so it is an issue if you have heavy baggage to carry Crowded at peak hours

title: Probably the best way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is very efficient and mostly convenient We found that with luggage from airport that there were too many places that we had to use stairs Otherwise a great option The ticket office actually only gives you coins to purchase from machines so you can probably skip that line (we learned after 34 times)

title: recommended transprtation
review: In rush hour the bts is very crowded if your 2 persons or more you can a take a taxi the bts is quite convenient

title: Safe, fast and cost effective.
review: We loved using the Sky train with our kids (ages 5 and 12) It was cheaper than a tuktuk or taxi and the people were smiley and friendly to be around   We'd have spent a fortune if we'd used tour guides to take us to the places we visited in Bangkok This was much better

title: Way to travel in Bangkok
review: We bought day tickets and traveled daily all over Bangkok The staions are close to main attractions hotels and shopping centres Easy to use safe clean affordable and good air conditioning `Single and return trips are also available

title: Value for money
review: Very convenient for smaller group commuting from one place to another while if you take cabtooktook it will be expensive

title: Best way to get around .
review: Forget taxis this is easily the best way to travel it's above the traffic and cooled to artic Temps We used it to get to the river ferry and back They do an all day pass

title: best way to travel in Bangkok
review: always the safest and best way to travel within the Sukhumvit and Silom areas You planned a long stay I would suggest for the Rabbit touchngo card

title: Best mode of transportation in exploring the city
review: The best mode of transportation in exploring Bangkok It's my 4th time to visit this wonderful city but I always chose to ride the taxi in getting around But this time my husband and I decided to take the train and it was easier for us to get to our desired destination The officers were helpful too Very clean and safe for tourists

title: BTS is life
review: Being stuck in traffic for 3 hours is normal in Bkk Do yourself a favor and use the BTS it's cheap fast and will get you almost anywhere you need to go

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: It is hard to understand the speaker on the train Language and speaker quality issues Just be sure to watch for your stop or you will miss it like we did

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Convenient affordable on time and good AC This is the best way to get around Bangkok  We used the skytrain every day and mixed it up with tuktuks boats and taxis when

title: The quickest way to get around!!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton Grande adjacent to Ashok Station and there was a direct walkway to the station from the hotel Easy to find your way around and cheap   It is well staffed by security at stations who are eager to help and we were a little unsure of which platform we needed when a youngster just walked up and asked if we needed help so found our way without problem  Compared to road where it takes ages to travel short distances it is certainly the best If you have nerves of steel there are guys riding around on scooters with orange HiViz tabbards on who will get you from A to B the quickest (and most expensive apparently) but when you see them simply ignoring red lights and crossing junctions weaving in and out of traffic lanes it's not for me Cabs and Tuk Tuks are OK but get snarled up in traffic

title: Super fun and easy way to get around and grab views of the city.
review: Very clean and inexpensive I recommend this over taxis if possible Very easy to get to the river boat temples airport and other important places around Bangkok

title: Great Public Transportation
review: Excellent Easy to use great value And easy connections We went from Bangkok to the airport and it cost us just about 90B  I would recommend people use the BTS + MRT to get around Bangkok instead of expensive taxis

title: Greeat
review: The BTS is a fantastic way to travel in Bangkok  Honestly it hits all the "hot spots" that you read about  If you have time I'd suggest hitting up each stop just to see what this vast city has to offer you

title: Best way to get around town
review: By far the best way to get around BKK Get a pass So you don't have to fish for coins at every entrance

title: easy and fast way to get around
review: cheap and fast travel if your destination is close to the stations clean and litter free not suitable for any one with walking difficulties

title: A cheap, clean and stress-free way to get around Bangkok
review: A great way to get around the city Trains are regular and always SO clean Also  it's about 80p to get from one side of the city to the other which is amazing

title: Easy transport
review: So easy to use I don't understand why melbournes trains are so complicated with their ticketing system

title: Handy to travel to MBK for cheap shopping but laughable bad ticket recetionists :-)
review: Nice and handy to ride to MBK (cheap shopping complex) but very crowded Need to use machines to buy tickets as ticket clerks will only give tickets to THAIS  when you askthey give you COINS to put in the machine   I joke not  You just have to LAUGH what a progressive international city )

title: Easy, cheap, convenient
review: Easy and cheap way to get around many areas of Bangkok Carriages are clean and air conditioned Can get busy during peak hours but still never packed to the brim like a London tube

title: Best public transport experience in Thailand
review: Clean fast cheap and punctual The only regret I have about the service is that it doesn't go downtown where the big attractions are

title: The better way to beat traffic jam, but not cheaper if travelling in group.
review: Queue was long to buy tickets or top up the card However still the faster alternative form of transport as compared to taxis or tuk tuks   If travelling in groups not necessary cheaper

title: Bangkok Commute
review: The train and train stations are clean Very accessible as a mode of transportation and cheaper than taxi If you plan on touring the city riding the train is the best way to do it Tuktuks will just rip you off

title: Great way to avoid traffic and CLEAN
review: Took a bus into bangkok that dropped us of near the bts and far from everything else   To my surprise it was easy and not to pricey About 42 baht to get dropped off and then another 65 baht cab ride to Khoa san road (Take a meter taxi not the tuk tuks)  Not perfect but a convenience that is nice to have

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Secure and fast way to travel Also very easy to figure out the routes and the different rates Also AC inside )

title: Cost Effective
review: Easy to use  Have explanations of stops in English  If you can read a basic map and have any sort of direction you will be fine  Like every city it gets crowded certain times of day but overall people are extremely polite

title: Excellent really fast
review: Allow you to skip traffic jam and to go really fast across the city The train is really clean and also have a good view of the city

title: Very Convenient!
review: i so love this transportation very easy and cheap stops are near the tourist spots it is very convenient for tourists who plan to stay longer in Bangkok i suggest you buy smartpass to avoid long queue in buying tickets

title: Very modern and inexpensive
review: The BTS Skytrain is a safe efficient quiet reliable affordable way to get around this very busy city I believe everyone who visits Bangkok should use the Skytrain  at least once even if for a short distance

title: Wonderful mode of transportation
review: Wonderful mode of transportation to avoid the heavy traffic Please have spare coins or prepare for long queues or purchase day pass

title: Best way to travel
review: The best way to get around Bangkok is to use the train  They have several different payment options  I found a 15 trip pass really useful because I didn't have to search for change every time I wanted to ride the train  The train and stations are very clean

title: Rapid transport
review: Quick easy system to use Links with local buses and trains Have ready change for machines there are controlled change booths at stations Timetables quick in between each train

title: Speedy, efficient, nice
review: So easy to use Although it is endlessly fun to ride the tuktuks around Bangkok weaving in and out of the traffic this is a speedy quick clean efficient option Enjoy

title: Safety features
review: Thailand has very good Skytrain system  Specially gates only opened when train arrives and locked when train leaves  I think it is a very good features and wish we have this in DC and New York

title: BKK's "closer to heaven" train-line love
review: Bangkok's own "closer to heaven" trainline makes travelling to from and within a breeze Freezing meat locker temperatures on the train is always a welcome feeling in the sweltering heat

title: Good
review: Almost cried of laughter when my friends and I saw a 'no durian' (a vile smelling fruit) sign but was very grateful for it  Good clean trains reliable and frequent

title: Efficient, good air con and cheap but...
review: We (wife and I) found the BTS to be the quickest way around BKK even though we often had a driver on hand (through family)  The road traffic is often at a walking pace or slower so the BTS offers a brilliant and speedy way of getting around town    We typically had 4 stops to get to Central (Chit Lom) I think it was from Phom Phrong and this cost 28 bhat each way per person from the machine  The service was frequent and although often busy like the London Underground there was always room or another train shortly  A couple of points to note  the counters provided change to plough into the automated machines to buy one off tickets or you could get Rabbit cards which are essentially Oyster cards so it depends how much you intend to use it as to whether you PAYG or Rabbit  The other point is that like much of BKK (think pavements and lack of high chairs in lots of restaurants) the BTS is not particularly child friendly  We encountered very few escalators so carrying our 1yr old in the buggy up a lot of stairs along with the inevitable shopping bags meant we were very grateful for the good air con in the carriages    Otherwise awesome service all round and recommend as long as you're aware of the above  There is a downloadable BTS map in Play but no idea of other app stores   Hope the above helps

title: Blade Runner at Night
review: Don't miss a ride on the Skytrain at night where the lights of the cars and elevated walkways Then you arrive at what feels like a floating platform very cool if Androids dream of electric sheep  A great way to get around the city and escape the traffic

title: More convenient if you are a regular visitor
review: When visiting Bangkok as we do on a regular basis queuing to buy tickets for the MTR can be frustrating Suggest buy a Rabbit card and charge it up with as much value as you like and use ot for any journey till the credit runs out The card remains valid gpr five years so when you come back use any credit you have for the next visit

title: Easy Transportation
review: An excellent way to get around town  Very clean and easy to get around town announcements made at every stop to assist  Stops at convent locations

title: Great System
review: The train was so clean and so nice Air conditioning was great I loved the fact the locals line up in organized lines while waiting for the skytrain to come It made the boarding and unboarding process easy and efficient

title: Best way to travel within Bangkok
review: Skytrain is a efficient way to travel around Bangkok No traffic jam but can be a bit cramped during rush hour It's just brilliant I love the Skytrain and I always pick a hotel close to a BTS station

title: Clean, fast, easy to use.
review: Even without speaking much Thai the BTS system is incredibly easy to use The people who work there are very helpful (and very used to foreigners) This is a cheap and efficient way to get around Bangkok

title: The best reason for living in Bangkok
review: Without the BTS I would not live in Bangkok I am retired and don't want to drive anymore Most of my daily commuting is within the BTS area It's always reliable and cost is appealing Once you get comfortable with the layout you can travel easy with the center of Bangkok The only downside is that it can get very crowded at rush hour Buy a Rabbit card so you don't have to keep buying individual tickets every time Please no eating or drinking on the skytrain system

title: Very helpful tool
review: Once you have a map in hand of the BTS you are set to see a lot of places in Bangkok To start with it will easily get you to and from the airport  My advice is to plan your daytrips with a copy of a map of Bangkok and the routes of the BTS It is possible to see many great attractions using the BTS system  The trains are usually loaded and be prepared to stand for a while All anouncements on the trains are made in English too which makes it easier to navigate The stations are really clean and its straightforward to get on and off the trains There is no long waiting either Trains run frequently and on time Ticket prices are astonishingly reasonable  much cheaper than taxi's tuktuks and motorcycles plus much safer I might add   We spent a week in Bangkok using only the BTS system and our feet It takes proper planning though but certainly no rocket science

title: efficient and fast mass transit
review: i took the airport express to travel from the airport to the business district and later traveled on the BTS to different locales in and around sukhimvit and the railway station very efficient however hard seats

title: Cheap way to travel
review: Great mode of transportation and seeing the city Very cheap and would recommend trying it out while visiting

title: Convenient, Cheap, FAST
review: Excellent and clean way to travel Picks you up at very convenient places and is extremely inexpensive

title: Great service
review: The trains are clean The schedule begins from 6AM to Midnight Sometimes the connection station like Siam and Asoke can be very busy and crammed with people queuing up for buying the tickets or exchange coin to insert in ticket machines The best way out for the problem is prepare the coin before getting into the station during busy time(Weekend and the late afternoon in weekday when people get back from work) You can buy a ticket directly with the officer in the counter if you want to avoid queuing up for the ticket machine again

title: A great way to clear the coins (for non Rabbit card users) !
review: Generally packed but it is God sent when you are exhausted to walk any further   Ratchadewi Station allows for the purchase of ticket at the counter not for Siam Station as it has very high traffic volume   So far only used the BTS to Saphan Taksin Map on BTS will light up the stations that the skytrain passes by making it convenient to keep track of commuter's own destination The signboard for the free shuttle boats to Asiatique The Riverfront is dubious  following the long queue seems to be a better idea as the majority of the people lined up are tourists   2nd time was to Chit LomPhrom PhongSiam Bought macarons and the strong airconditioning was helpful in keeping them cool and not melt

title: Reliable, gets PACKED during rush hour
review: The reach of this is limited as it doesn't access all parts of Bangkok It also gets very packed during rush hour to the point of people not being able to squeeze on and having to wait for the next train It's a good option for things within it's reach though Price is according to distance and you buy a ticket at the machine (using change) I went 2 stops and it was 25 Baht

title: Easiest way to travel
review: Nice easy and cheap Getting tickets from machine is very quick Sometimes busy but hey it's Thailand

title: Best thing about Bangkok
review: Great service easy to use Fast efficient and on time Best way to travel to all the great shopping centers of Bangkok

title: Efficient & Clean
review: Efficient and clean skytrain Thais are generally courteous and easy to deal with compared to India (New Delhi) they rush into the train without forming lines Very dangerous

title: BTS & Taxis Bangkok
review: Easy way to get around but if you are a family then taxis are usually cheaper overall because you pay one price for the taxi instead of 4 tickets

title: Skytrain connects BKK destinations
review: BTS Skytrain network connects most parts of Bangkok along the northcentralsoutheast (Sukhumvit line) and central southwest routes (Silom line) Reasonably clean and not too crowded Would be better if the ticketing systems are integrated with the MRT & Airport Rail Link lines A day pass is only 130 bahts plus tax

title: Easy to navigate , Clean
review: AC in BTS is good and cooling Can be quite crowded during peak hours and also at certain interchange station for instance chit lom and siam Good to have the top up machine now that accept notes at some BTS station But majority still have long q  Convenient to use the rabbit card Recommended to get the rabbit card if you travel to bkk frequent save the trouble to q up and buy the ticket

title: Very Convenient.
review: Pros Fast Extensive Dependable(mostly) Clean Safe Cons Pricier compared to MRTs in cities like Shanghai Overall the best way to travel around Bangkok far cheaper than the tuktuks and way safer than the mopeds PS I wouldn't recommend getting a day pass unless you intend to travel quite a few times

title: The only way to travel
review: This is the best way to get around Bangkok and avoid all the traffic jams I always use the Sky train to get to the Chatuchat market It's efficient and cheap and easy to work out

title: Grab a BTS map, and get going
review: Great to get around town Takes a little time getting used to but once you figure out the automated ticketing system it's a breeze

title: Good transportation
review: This train was very useful when I stayed in Bangkok The train came every 10 to 15 minutes and had good AC Furthermore it wasn't so expensive and I went to "Mochit" and "Si lom" Rd by this train However this train hasn't bounded for "Khaosan Rd" yet It is inconvenient for back packers So overall is 4

title: Good
review: It is an easy to explore Bangkok  Try to get an accommodation near the bts and easily travel throughout the city

title: Great and fast way to get around the city
review: very clean and very well air conditioned  It will take you to most famous sites and if it is a rush hour time in bangkok do not bother taking taxi just take the bts and it will save you alot of time and money

title: Perfect way to get around Bangkok
review: I was sceptical at first in using the public transport here in Thailand and was totally wrong I now use the Bus as much as possible It may get a bit squashy due to the amount of people but it is exceptionally clean and safe

title: BTS Nice and Clean
review: BTS nice and clean We like BTS For the waiting time is not too long for BTS staff unfriendly and no smile

title: Easiest way to get around the main drag
review: Cheap efficient and air conditioned Simple to plan your journey and helpful staff in case you get stuck

title: Easy city travel
review: Very efficient covers a lot of city but may need to supplement with river travel to get to some places Easy to work out how to navigate and getting tickets etc Cheap as chips to travel Generally pretty busy

title: Fast.
review: A very efficient mode of transportation since the roads are perpetually blocked It is fast and connects to all the major shopping malls of repute

title: cheap and easy access to many places in Bangkok
review: easy way to get around Bangkok The stations are well marked You have to have change at most of the stations to buy your ticket but there is a place to change your bills before using the machines to buy your ticket Why they donÂ´t just sell you the ticket at the same time I donÂ´t know

title: Great way to get around the city
review: The sky train is a great way to get around the city It is punctual clean air conditioned and cheap Even though it can get crowded during rush hour people queue up nicely in order to get in Signs are posted in Thai and English If you use the train more than twice a day a day ticket is the best way to go

title: Very practical
review: Our hotel had direct access to the sky train and we found it very practical to go to the city center It is cheap and there is the day pass option You can take a map from the station and travelling is made easy Every time of the day we used it was very crowded but the travel is great because of the aircondition inside the wagons

title: Great service
review: Recommended for travel fast clear best way to move quickly in Bangkokcheap and reliable why would y travel any other way

title: very convenient
review: very convenient and cheap if you are travelling alone But if u are in a group than i think taxi will be more cheap

title: Easy to use tickets, brilliant travel idea in busy city.
review: Good service felt a bit vulnerable to  pickpockets so keep your hand on your wallet and phone don't leave your bag out of sight

title: Perfect way to explore Bangkok
review: My trip was perfect because we didnÂ´t take any traffic jam and didnÂ´t loose time using taxi or tuk tuk Very easy to use and organized REMEMBER TO KEEP YOUR TICKET UNTIL THE DISEMBARK

title: Excellent
review: The BTS Skytrain is Bangkok's version of an underground in most other cities but it's overground  Really easy to use and the quickest way to get around a congested city

title: Much better than a taxi
review: Very easy and cheap to use  Much quicker than using a taxi in the busy Bangkok traffic  We always use the train when in Bangkok

title: Good way to get around.
review: Easy to use Easy to understand clean and felt safe at all times We used it to get out to the airport to meet people and back to town Used it to get almost all the way to the Don Mueng Airport It was great faster than taxis and cheaper and AC  The taxis I was in barely had the AC on at all

title: Fast, efficient and clean
review: The skytrain is an absolute boon  fast efficient and clean It is the best way to get around Bangkok

title: easy to use
review: easy to use trains run very frequently and the station map is very easy to read fan close to our hotel (pullman hotel g) and goes to all the main shopping areas

title: the only way to fly
review: If there is anywhere you can get to by BTS go there by BTS  Clean efficient fast and cheap with so much eye candy in transit it's impossible to get bored to death as is derigeur in Bangkok's logjammed taxi mafiasco mayhem

title: Expensive for many locals but clean and fast!
review: BTS is the only way to escape sukhumvit traffic jam if you don't have a motor bike For people who live here I advice to buy a rabbit card Don't forget to register it on the Orange kiosks available in all BTS stations and in some malls because you can get cash back and discounts on tops major etc

title: Better than world class
review: I wish Australia had a system this good Fast clean build to move a serious amount of people No myki

title: Fast way to get around
review: A very quick convenient air conditioned inexpensive comfortable way to get around Bangkok though the busy times you have to stand

title: Better Then Sky travel(BTS)
review: I mean this is probably the best JR experience you will get outside of the Japan It is just great and please do try to ride it on a Sunday from one end to another Brilliant Will expose you to a whole new Bangkok and covert you to a public transport in general on matter from where you are Well done

title: Reliable means of transportation
review: This is the most reliable means of transportation in Bangkok It is not expensive even though expensive than common bus (can be as cheap as 7 Baht) Can be very crowded at busy hours as the one in other cities One drawback the route are not as comprehensive as we want (does not cover Grand Palace Khao Saan area)

title: Fast Quick and Comfortable
review: Nice transportation quick and fast suitable for city life and comfortable we cannot wait for taxi and traffic in BKK so this is the best choice for city people

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Becoming more and more crowded every year I visit Bangkok The cabin are too small to accomodate the volume of commuters

title: Great way to get around the city
review: Fast cheap and cleaner than the London underground Exactly how public transport should be fantastic

title: Punctual
review: A bit crowded but overall ok and everything just awesome is convenient and cheap if travel alone  Punctual

title: Great way to get around!
review: Easy to use once you figure out the ticket system it was clean and quick offering access to much of the city Check to see if you would be better off getting a pass for the day or multiple days versus just getting to a destination

title: Convenient
review: Cheap and easy to use You can get to most of the major shopping centres on sukomvit road by skytrain Its busy during peak hours but unlike the road you can actually get somewhere using the skytrain in peak hours

title: efficient train syste
review: Very efficient train system for Sukhumvit and Silom Some times a bit too crowded during rush hours and too cold

title: City's Heartbeat
review: Very helpful clean and interruption free travelling option Your only need BTS Skytrain if you are living in Sukumvit Road

title: Excellent
review: Excellent way to get around Bangkok Very convenience transportation for local people and traveler also The train is fast with clear instruction for us to get up and get out The train is clean and safe the ticketing staff were friendly and helpful with directions etc

title: Easy, bring coins!
review: Fairly straight forward system not the latest  cleanest train cars but especially when you want to get around by yourself this beats taxis

title: Quick form of travelling
review: We caught this back from a river dinner late one evening very good mode of transport quick clean and air conditioning

title: Chaopraya experience
review: My first time to see and experience this side of Bangkok Great experience both by day and night But the evening ride along the river with lighted buildings from all sides is simply amazing

title: Easiest Way to get round
review: we found the Skytrain extremely convenient to get around and about to all the places we wanted to get to when visiting bangkok

title: best way to travel in bangkok
review: fast efficient but soooo cold the aircon was probably at 18 deg clean and fast and reaches many locations in Bangkok

title: Quick, clean, affordable.
review: Fairly easy to get around but hard to find stations (for us) The map our hotel gave us was not to scale We took the water taxi to where we thought we'd get the BTS but were miles away Still quick and affordable way to get around

title: Easy access to city sites
review: Easy to use to get around cheap and all stops have points of interest Get a map from that ion that highlights sone of these

title: Safe, easy to use transport!
review: This system is great  Clean fast safe cheap airconditioned and easy to use  Is on the route of a lot of Bangkok attractions  Definitely recommend using it

title: Reliable and pleasant
review: Bangkok is a nightmare for drivers  Traffic jam in Bangkok City is the norm  In fact you can be stuck in traffic at 3 am in the morning near Nana or Siam  The BTS Skytrain is your only way to commute in the city without wasting your holiday (or for the citizens of Bangkok valuable time of your lives) battling the traffic    The trains are clean reasonably spacious on time  There are enough handles for standing passengers  The service of trains are frequent and the fee is although not particularly cheap (it would usually be cheaper for 3 or more persons traveling the same distance in a taxi notwithstanding the traffic) it certainly cannot be said to be expensive  Last but not least it is very reliable  Unlikely the innercity mass transit system in some countries the BTS Skytrain's workers actually do care about their jobs and the jobs of others  They rarely go on strike  Overall the BTS is reliable and pleasant

title: Convenience only for city shopper
review: if u are travel in less peoples which less then 3 peoples u can take BTS if more then that you can consider take cab or van BTS stop is quite convenience only for city shopping mall

title: Best way to travel
review: Central Bangkok is known for its heavy traffic flow hence the sky train is always the smarter choice  it is not only convenient but reliable  punctual and cost saving Check your routes to ensure your destination is doable by Skytrain

title: easy way to get around
review: the bts is cheap and very easy to work out how to use even if you don't speak thai although does get very busy so expect to be jammed in like a sardine at some peak times  but much better than getting shaken down by a taxi driver all trains are airconditioned and a trip will set you back a small amout of coins which you will use the automatic ticket machines at each station

title: Getting on the BTS (train service)  in Bangkok!
review: Fast and pretty much on time good to use this to beat the jam going around BKK city Only available on certain areas though

title: Best way to navigate Bangkok
review: BTS is very easy to use extremely clean safe and everyone is very polite  So much faster than a taxi

title: Sky Train
review: Great way of getting about Bangkok Cheap a bit packed but runs well and very easy to follow routes

title: Bangkok transport
review: We stayed in riverside condo just across the river opposite Shangri La hotel We just had to take the condo shuttle boat to reach Saphan Taksin BTS station to go on Silom line to major shopping centers BTS is great if you stay near a station

title: Your best friend in Bangkok
review: learn it   use it it will save you a lot of money vs debating a price with the taxis It goes everywhere you want to with some walking If your staying along time buy a one day pass or a rabbit card it will save time when traveling during rush hour  no need to wait in line for a machine to buy a ticket

title: BTS Skytrain great means of transport
review: The BTS Skytrain is a very cheap and an effective way of getting around Bangkok It is exactly like the London underground except even easier cleaner and cheaper You cannot get lost All above ground and a good way to see the sights as you travel

title: Inconvenient with people with baby car
review: There are no escalators and lifts for most of the stations which are very inconvenient to those with baby car

title: clean, efficient way to get around business district
review: Easiest way to travel around Bangkok's business district but won't get you to too many tourist attractions We took it to BKK (mall) and Jim Thompson house If you don't like the noise and heat of the tuk tuk and taxi transport and the skytrain is going where you need to go definitely choose this option

title: An amazing way to beat the traffic
review: The BTS skytrain is great it is clean efficient and trains are frequent We have a Rabbit card which we load money onto and the card is valid for 2 years or you can get a card for a month which is a cheaper option but if you dont use it within the month you lose any money left on the card An absolute bonus way to travel around the city

title: Great transport method
review: Before visiting Bangkok I always read about how crowded it is and I simply don't see how  compared to London it is absolutely empty and on many days and times it is actually completely empty This might be partly explained by the fact that there are cheaper transport methods but certainly no faster ones in Bangkok's terrible traffic It is great to be able to use the Airport Link from Phaya Thai station making it very easy and cheap to get from the Airport to many hotels in town  and no it's not a problem not even with suitcases in rush hour  somehow everybody always makes it on the trains The trains are extremely clean and very well air conditioned  The only real problem is that the system coverage is not great and many Bangkok's biggest attractions are no where near a station but all the big shopping places (malls markets) are and you can really see a lot of Bangkok's skyline in only a very small amount of time

title: Good alternative
review: If you are sick of the traffic and overpriced taxis then bts is a good medium for traveling But it can be very crowded and packed during peek hours Be careful with kids as it can get really crowded Tourists can give it a try

title: Superb City Connectivity
review: By far best commuting means within Bangkok City   The connectivity is fast and almost all shopping places tourist places restaurants and night markets are well covered by the routes

title: Good way to get around BKK especially off peak!
review: The Skytrain is an efficient and affordable way to travel around BKK I used it to get from the airport to where I was staying you just have to be careful to get off at the junction stations I also used it often to commute aroundsure it gets crowded at peak travel times but it is a good service

title: Fantastic effectiveness!
review: This is really the best metro I have ever taken in my entire life Even if you just miss a train it never takes long before the next one gets there The fee is really cheap and it is extremely fast and effective You can get from one side of Bangkok to the other in about 30 minutes and it would cost you just over 50 baht The trains are all airconditioned which feels perfect in a warm environment like Bangkok Inside the trains there are TVsets which display the name of the upcoming station and a female voice notices you two times what the next station is going to be  The only downside is that the tickets are bought from vending machines that do not take paper money So then you have to stand in line at the station twice  first to get change from a cashier and then to buy tickets at the machine There are only two lines in entire Bangkok so there are some places where the BTS skyline doesnÂ´t go So itÂ´s a good idea to get yourself a map with the BTS routes displayed When itÂ´s raining you can count on the trains being filled to the limit  But really the best way to get around And a mustexperience for tourists

title: Great public transport
review: Cheap and easy to use with frequent services to anywhere you want to go Trains were clean and air conditioned and people did give up there seats to the elderly

title: Airport link was smooth and easy to navigate
review: it was our first time to Bangkok but we decided to take the Skytrain link from the airport into the city  We figured out how to buy tickets which are actually tokens  Ride was smooth  we had seats the whole way  Would recommend

title: Land of Smiles
review: The Thais have led us to believe that they are a very tolerant people  This is true to an extent One can see this in the number of gay and gay friendly bars in Bangkok and the number of lady boys who grace the streets of this vibrant city  Unfortunately this liberal attitude does not carry over to it's public transport system  Whilst kissing my wife on the platform of Chong Nonsi BTS station (horray for gay marriage)  an overzealous guard on the opposite platform felt it his duty to whistle frantically while waving his arms shouting at us to stop  The whole scenario was quite comical and also can be used as the perfect metaphor for the hypocrisy of Thai culture  Liberal  Don't count on it

title: Quick, clean, cheap !
review: Great way to get around Bangkok Clean quick and cheap Why bother haggling with the TukTuk and Taxi drivers and battling the Bangkok traffic

title: easy and fast
review: GOOD COMMUNICATION SYSTEM was easy fast and clean went to all the hopping areas and was open till late at night

title: Best transport in Bangkok
review: Clean modern kind of cold inside There are signs where to stand to enter very we'll done and everything is in order Best transport in Bangkok

title: Average, not so friendly system
review: One day pass is recommended 140baht and you can avoid the time for buying tickets  Long queue for tickets most machines only take coins but onethird of the coins you put in fell out automatically Freezing cold aircon in the cabin but stuffy desert like waiting area No sign telling you when the next train will arrive And long waiting time for trains

title: Good service and way to get around Bangkok
review: Convenient and inexpensive although doesn't travel to all parts of the city Ticketing system for visitors is initially very confusing and also inefficient No smart card or dailyweekly ticket Separate ticket is required for each trip and queues at machines and windows could be long

title: Bangkok trafic
review: Dont ever take a taxi if a Skytrain is around youit is quicker and cheaper tooThere is aircondicion and the trains come every 5 minutes

title: A clever solution
review: The best solution for Bangkok not so costly to build but quite helpful to ease the traffic jam in Bangkok The fare is not cheap compare to MRT its quite expensive but very useful we can go practically fast between any destination

title: Great Way to Travel around Central BKK
review: Easy to use purchase a "rabbit" transit card  As you use it you can "top up" the card when required (cash and MCVISA accepted)  Avoid traveling during peak commuter times AMPM as the cars are VERY crowded (expect to stand in those times) Cars have great AC which is nice considering BKK's average temperature

title: AVOID IN RAINY SEASON
review: The skytrain is really the quickest way to move around the always jammed trafic in Bangkok Its not to expensive and if time is your need here you are save unless its rainy season last april overcorowded platforms and more than 2 hour waitungs till a workable train arrived but with the loudspeakersa telling that nexy train will arrive in 10 minutes due technical problems

title: Amazing views of city
review: Fab views of the city and really great first glimpse of the capital city plus air conditioned great link from the airport into the centre of the city taking around 30 mins with seating available

title: A super easy travel alternative in Bongkok
review: The Shy Train is the fastest and easiest way to move around in Bangkok as well as being relatively cheap super efficient and the perfect pace to cool down from the humidity and heat of the city

title: Convenient
review: It's convenient to take BTS in Bangkok in order to avoid the bad traffic but the fare is a bit expensive compare to taxi  But it's not suitable for elderly as most of the BTS station do not have elevator Elderly found difficult to climb up high stairs

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is the best way to get around Bangkok and is very easy to use  All trains are air conditioned and everyone is very helpful if you are not sure which direction you need to go

title: Easy moving
review: A quick airconditioned and quite inexpensive Sometimes quite crowded Simple to use even with the kids At their (BTS) website you find everything you want to know (maps fares routes ect) Timetable is accurate If you miss the train the next one comes in a couple of minutes You can change to MRT or a river boat at the certain stations and by these three mode of transportation you can reach all the main attractions of Bangkok

title: Seriously the best!
review: I mean seriously I LOVE the BTS So easy so efficient and so easy to use Better than many public transportation hubs in the US and Europe in my opinion What's not to love Way cheaper to get around than Taxis and Tuk Tuks Give it a go

title: Fast, air conditioned and the best way to get around
review: If you're traveling around Bangkok this is one of the best ways of getting around Its fast simple usually spacious air conditioned and goes to most places that tourists would wish to visit  If there's a place on your visit list that isn't covered a good way is to take the BTS to somewhere near your destination and then do the last stretch on foot or by tuck took (or taxi) depending on what suits you   Keep lots of small change in your pocket to purchase tickets otherwise you'll have to queue

title: So convenient
review: Absolute boon in  Bangkok  easy to negotiate the Skytrain avoids all the hectic traffic of Bangkok's busy streets and the hassles of dealing with Tuk Tuk and Taxi drivers Fast and efficient

title: Efficient and cheap way to get around
review: My husband and I have visited Bangkok three years in a row and the Skytrain still remains a great way to get around â clean safe and efficient and not to mention â cheap   There is also good security on the platforms and at the entrance gates â always willing to assist with the bypass gate if you have kids in pushchairs or have a lot of shopping bags   We purchased an adult Rabbit card (multiple trip pass card) on our first visit in 2011 and have used the same card on our subsequent two trips a year apart â only having to top it up with either a trip bundle or with a Baht amount   If you are planning of spending a few days in Bangkok and making a lot of use of the Skytrain â it is a good option to purchase a multiple trip card and load either the trip bundle (of which there are different options depending on how many trips you intend to take) or Baht as this will firstly save you money as the bundled trips are at a reduced rate and you donât have to stand in a queue at the ticket machines which can be quite long in peak times and at stations near the tourist sites  They have a really good website in English which explains the route stations and attractions near the stations and all the info regarding the ticket system  The ticket machines at the stations also have an English option making it easy to purchase your tickets  The staff at the stations are great and there is always someone to assist in English when you want to know something or purchase the multi trip tickets and there is normally someone to assist at the ticket machines

title: Great!
review: It was a really sufficient mode of transport to get around Bangkok A bit tricky to work out which train we must get onto but once I figured it out it was really easy and fun to use Super cheap

title: The best way to travel with lots of tips for newcomers
review: This is the speedy way to get around Bangkok It is fast comfortable particularly well air conditioned and very frequent It is light years ahead of the London Underground Also known as the BTS it swiftly connects major parts of the city Interestingly it is the preferred " middle class" mode of transport and the travellers above will be so different to those down on the streets It seems that everyone is peering at their mobile device as they travel  Tips for newcomers  Access is not great for those with any impairment There are very few elevators and while there maybe an escalator from floor level this may start with steps and the next floor may be stairs It is invariably stairs down two long flights usually   The service interconnects well with the major Malls eg Siam Paragon Terminal 21 Central World and Emprium with walkways at "sky" level into the malls  There is a clear standing point to join the trains perfectly aligning with each door It is not a free for all like most subways Some stations have barriers by the platforms which open when the train arrives  Tickets are coin purchases for single journeys Some stations have machines that accept noteChange can be obtained from ticket offices ( at all stations) Ticket offices will not issue tickets for single journeys the machines have to be used They are straightforward but have a habit of rejecting perfectly good coins The tickets have a correct way of insertion shown by an arrow on one side They are retained at the end of a single journey  Alternatively buy a one day travel card for unlimited journeys 130 baht buys as many journeys as you wish before midnight Depending on length of journey For many tourists this is 45 journeys This ticket can only be bought at the ticket office  The service can be really crowded in conventional rush hours It runs from after 5 am until just after midnight   There are many shops and or coffee bars at ticket office level They vary by station There are cash machines ( ATMs) at almost every station There is a very good male female hairdresser manicurist at Nana opposite the ticket machines  Because of the difficulties of escalator access and lack of designated luggage space it is not great for carrying suitcases You cannot guarantee the train will be empty for to provide luggage space You see few pushchairs and even fewer people with disabilities  It interchanges well by walkway for river services at Saphan Taksin and you leave the station by the walkway which delivers you to the pier Watch out for beggars and those telling you the place you are going to is closed Best to ignore well meaning ( or not ) strangers as you study the maps They might flatter you by telling their great love for your home country but they WILL have an agenda  Station signage is very good Exits corresponding to hotels malls and other attractions are clearly labelled  All the platforms have a security guard supplied by G4S They can be identified by their military style uniform with a light blue shirt They can often be found standing at one end of the platform  There is an excellent mobile and data signal throughout  If this was helpful to you please vote accordingly

title: The only way to travel in BKK
review: Honestly when you are booking your hotel ensure you are no more than10 mins max walk from the skytrain   It is a blessing in the heavy BKK traffic it is super cheap and it is icy cold with the AC   It can get very busy at the peak rush hour times especially between 57pm but still it's probably 45 times quicker than a taxi and much cheaper

title: Fast, comfortable and cool.
