review: Unfortunately it is not always an alternative But if it is you should choose the BTS as yout means of communication around Bangkok It uses 3040 minutes on trips that takes 23 hours by car is easy to navigate and has great air conditioning Even during the rush hours it is not overcrowded It is even cheap if you are a traveler on a budget     Try to plan your hotel booking so that you are close to a BTS station It will make your life in Bangkok soo much easier It is reliable cheap and has easy access to the airport express and other public transportations

title: fast and not furious
review: If you are in hurry and want to avoid traffic jams this sky train is the best option to reach the city centre But please be aware that this train will not be too comfortable if you have too many or big size luggage Not because the train has no space for your luggage but because your destination station might not be too friendly with your luggage (depends on the stationyou might have to drag your suitcase along the stairs before you can find any escalator and or elevator)  I always love the scenery along the way you can distinguish the different pattern of periurban area to city centre of Bangkok during your ride If you need to change to a taxi in Makassan or Phaya Tai just go down the station and find the taxi booth But again you have to be strong enough to carry all your luggage downstair without any cart

title: Forget the taxi, take the skytrain
review: If you are in central Bangkok forget taxi's take the sky train  Above the traffic it will get you there faster calmer with a sense of adventure  If you are venturing further out take the sky train to it's end and then board a taxi   Take it from a "native" expat we've lived here 12 years

title: Not bad
review: Sky train is a great way to get around Bangkok since the traffic is always horrible We did save hours using skytrain instead of a car Ticket system is easy to useunderstand Skytrain can get very packedcrowded before and after working hours avoid those house if you can

title: Best way to get around BKK
review: The sky train is a great way to get around town It is inexpensive reliable and easy to use Highly recommended if you want to see the sights around Bangkok

title: best means to travel
review: Provides very good connectivity across Bangkok If you planning for shoppingSky train provides good connectivity to China Town MBK Mall Chatuchok market etcand you reach Suvarnabhumi airport in less than 1 Hr using skytrain Truly a best and economical way to travel in Bangkok But beware of cons and thugs on couple appearing to be returned from Dubaiwere asking us show Indian currancy when we said stubborn No they just disappeared so don't show your wallet to any stranger Other than that if you are cautious then there is absolutely no problem

title: At last travelled in SkyBus
review: The current outings in Mumbai about SkybusMono Rail & Metro Rail aren't on positive node Hence I feel lucky to get glimpse & experience of travelling through BTS  BTS is very well connected I saved MAP obtained from their website on mobile for convenience purpose  We opted for it when we went to ChatuchakJhatujhuk Market We took train at Phaya Thai & get down at Mochit   Both stations are equipped with MAPs written in English & Ticket counter staff also speak & understand it   Procedure of obtaining tickets(very simple & easy) 1) The ticketing system only works on Coins so first check out Fair for One way Return Journey towards destination on chart 2) Exchange Baht Notes with appropriate amount of coins(If you got enough coins skip this step) 3) Select desired station & Put coins into machine 4) Put ticket into validating machine & it will open the gate for you 5) Don't misplace ticket as its key to enter & exist station without it I found no way to enterget out of station  Inside BTS It was office closing hours so as expected it was rush inside but soon got cleared Victory Monument looked phenomenal Overall its easy to access & most convenient mode of transport  Tip Keep camera ready Many things too shoot & capture

title: Cheap and easy
review: The best way to travel Always on time no traffic and never says no ( like taxi drivers) Very cheap and easy to use Just buy rabbit card and it will take you on all public transport around Bangkok

title: Bangkok Skytrain (BTS)
review: A really good public transport system Cheap and frequent train service Servicing all the major centres around the capital

title: Best way to navigate Bangkok
review: Fabulous system chaep and easy to useGlad to see they are extending the network too extremely clean with clear information announcements and freindly staff

title: On time, AC and easy to use
review: This service makes life in Bangkok simple and accessible Just watch out for the entrance and exit gates when carrying bags as the sensors cause the barriers to close on you before you are through

title: Easy & inexpensive
review: We found this mode of transport to be the best to get around the city to bet the traffic jams   It was easy to work out what ticket go buy for where you were going to go  Getting on and off was easy  Some of the stations have escalators one way but most are stairs updown to get to the platform  Would definitely use these next time in Bangkok

title: Travel Made Easy
review: Heaven sent what with Bangkok's horrendous traffic jam Relatively affordable clean & scheduled like clockwork with important destination as its station Announcement on station stops are in dual language (Thai & English) Connected well with MRT & tickets machine are readily available   The website is informative enough to prepare you for your first trip

title: Beat Bangkok traffic
review: I generally consider using Skytrain to beat the traffic and reach my destination faster besides cheaper cost if we are 1 or 2 persons If 3 or 4 persons then Bangkok Cabs (on meter) is equally works out cheaper BUT there is a big traffic chaos Only if you are lucky you will not encounter traffic jam   I kept my Rabbit Card with me which I bought last year and it was very easy again Do buy it for easier travel at Skytrain   You can even buy an Baht 130 Full day pass if you feel you can extract the value out of it

title: Quick way to get around
review: Using Bangkok's Sky Train can be confusing at first but there are plenty of peoplestaff to help you They understand the issues that first time users tourists might have and get you 'on track' pretty quickly The Sky Train is a network of lines servicing the City of Bangkok which includes a line to the airport There are stations close to key tourist hotels in the city with easy access However the Train which is literally high above the road system and traffic is heavily used by the citizens of Bangkok to commute as much as it is by tourists The most popular use of the Sky Train that will  be relevant to you is the trip to the weekend Chutachuk Market The trip is quick and direct Yes you may have to stand but the carriages are air conditioned and the trip is short You also get to see a bit of suburbia on the way a bit of free sight seeing The alternative by road taxi or otherwise will be in peak hour traffic and stressful Take the Sky Train The fare to the Market is going to be about TB15

title: Fast and easy
review: Initially we only used taxi and tuktuk but we wasted so much time caught in traffic jams that we decided to use the BTS skytrain  What a relief  We just needed to get ready enough 10 and 5 baht coins in hand check the fare on the 'fare info chart' then go to the ticketing machine press the button for that fare and insert the coins into the coin slot  Ticket comes out followed by change  Then off to catch the skytrain Surprisingly there weren't many crowds so we didn't encounter any jostling or pushing  What impressed us was the officer on duty inside the 'circular office'  We had some problem at one stop and couldn't get our card to work  She stood up immediately and called out to us and solved our problem within seconds  Thumbs up to such prompt and alert staff Yes we saved so much of our precious time when we used this public transport

title: Transit Systems in Bangkok
review: We have just returned from Bangkok a city of organized chaos  BKK is known as the hottest city on the planet with a mean temperature of 28C (according to Travel Channel)  It is always hot and humid and unwalkable so the transit system is the way to travel  The skytrain is like an oasis of coolness and if NOT crowded stays cool however during rush hour it does get warm  The skytrain now connects with the subway system the MRT and because of this wonderful underground and overground transit travel you do not need to hire a taxi and sit in grid lock traffic for hours on end as the taxi driver plays Buddhist chants for you and tells you that his taxi is also a "Wat" (Buddhist temple)  Great airport link as well get from Suvarnabhumi straight into the city avoid buses taxis and speed off into the heart of BKK The Thai staff is helpful to aid lost "farangs" (foreigners)  The Thai people themselves went out of their way to help us  It is in their culture to have "kreng chai" (consideration for the other)  The skytrain and MRT are clean comfortable cool steady service and did I mention cool  The signage is both in English and Thai and if confused someone will always help you out  We had a wonderful experience in BKK a city we used to hate is now easier to love

title: Forget the Bangkok Skytrain after fares hike
review: The Skytrain when I first came here 9 years ago was a Godsend from the awful traffic but it soon became a overcrowded disorganised nightmare  It was impossible to sit unless you got lucky and someone got off near where you were standing  This has got worse since they restructured the fares recently instead of fares being in multiples of 5 and 10 baht they are now a mishmash of all sorts of numbers such as 24 baht 31 baht up to 52 baht (the maximum was 40 baht)  At the Victory monument station yesterday (a Saturday ) there were queues of about 200 people at the change booths lines of about 25 people per pay station all confused about what they had to pay and now they have to wait for change too  Impossible  One good result  on my short journey I could sit all the way because people have stopped using the Skytrain so much whether due to confusion or impossibility of operation I don't know  The idiots whi made this change should all be fired  why didn't they just hike all fares up by 5 baht and make it easy  Oh but this is Thailand where noting is simple or thought out in advance  Take a bus

title: Fast travel
review: The good reliable fast and easy to use  The bad very strong AC sometimes a problem when you come in sweating  on the train and on the way to Saphan Taksin stop (where the boats are) there is a well dressed and very sleek Thai "gentleman"  with good English and knowledge and with a mustache who approaches tourists and says he is a teacher and after some time talks you into going with him to the non tourist pier (where they charge you 1500 baht for private longtail tours of the river and sights) He managed to trick us on one day and then we say him pick up other tourists 2 days later

title: Keep more coins or get a Rabbit save value card to travel thru Slytrain
review: It is convenience to travel around Bangkok using BTS however you need a lot of patience  Most of the ticket vending machines only accept coins so before you can go to the machine to buy tickets have to first queue up for changing coins  At peak hours this queue is long  Now you have the coins then you can line up for tickets  So we end up buy a Rabbit card its a stored value card top up then can go saved a lot of time  This card have to deposit 50 baht and cost 50 more to purchase it sounds not worth to buy as we are only tourists but when you see those lines in rush hours you will not mind anymore  We did not return the card because it valid for 2 years maybe we will back Bangkok some days  Thats why I dont know that 50 baht deposit will return or not

title: Move around like a 'local'
review: Get a map of the BTS and MRT routes and mark on the map the nearby places of interest that you are planing to visit This will be your reference master plan for your Bangkok city exploration Our self planned vacation in Bangkok based on this map took us to the following placesMBKNational Stadium Siam ParagonSiam Ocean World Madamme Toussard wax museumSiam Discovery Centre MochitChatuchak weekend market Saphan Taksin PierAsiatique Riverfront ProtunamFashion marketBaiyoke Sky Tower & Restaurant Chinatown Siam Niramit Show (by MRT) AsokSukhumvitnightlifeTerminal 21hotel etc This is the best most convenient most reliable and most efficient way to move around Bangkok city The trains are few minutes apart don't get stuck in traffic jams and are close to main shopping centres hotels and places of interest Most of all you never have to haggle with a tuktuk or taxi driver for the fare and feel cheated afterwards The prices are fixed and the routes can be planned ahead for example you can stay in a hotel within 5 minutes walking distance to a station If you travel a lot in a day you can also buy a day pass that allow you to hop in and out anytime anyplace anywhere It connects with the MRT underground trains and all of a sudden the scope of your exploration is widened and your destinations become easy reach There are plenty of ticketing machines that show the exact fare for any particular station you target is easy to operate and gives you back absolutely correct change If not you can also get ticket (token for MRT) conveniently from the ticketing office Queues are efficiently handled and people movement in the tunnels overhead bridges elevators turnstiles and connecting platforms are smooth Directions are cleary displayed in readable English so you know exactly how to move like a "local" You only need other transport when you get out of town like going to the Floating Market or getting to the airport

title: Take It Whenever You Can
review: The Skytrain is a great way of getting around Bangkok  And while it won't get you everywhere it just might connect with other modes of transportation that will such as the MRT (Metro)  And while it can be crowded at times it moves along swiftly beating being stuck in traffic at rush hour  If you'll be using the Skytrain a lot get the Rabbit Card which also offers you a number of additional discounts and deals

title: good choice for wandering the heart of Bangkok
review: The heart of Bangkok means great shopping centers  MBKCentral World Siam Center Siam square Siam Discovery Siam Paragon Kesorn Shopping center etc The traffic around this area is terribly crowded by thousands of cars from 10 am to 10 pm If you want to arrive heart of Bangkok and wander around by cheapest and fastest way I really suggest BTS skytrain Buying 1 daypass only150 bahts then you can get on and off  unlimitedlyIf you want to go shopping at Jutajak or JJ  market just take Suchumvit line ahead to Mor chit which is the terminal station There are many fantastic places you can visit by BTS sky train please ask for more information at customer care center  at Siam sqaure or any  ticket booths or visit this website httpwwwbtscothcustomerenmainaspx FastSafeConvenientInexpensive try it

title: Excellent
review: The BTS sky train  system in Bangkok is really a great experienced It is cheap and also convenient to purchase the ticket with coinpaper note from the ticket touch screen machine as par locationYou may also take ticket from booth in respective counter and then give the coin like ticket to enter in the main area If any hazards may causing a typical sound with red light blinking if you want to carry your luggage through it you can take help from the guard call them to open the gate for easy move This BTS link all the major area and major big shopping mall The train is smooth with Ac and give proper acknowledgement for the station you need to arrive Lots of information food vendors souvenir shops and full location are guided on poster in the station  Visited December 2012

title: è¦³åã«ã¯åããªãããï¼
review: I was in BKK for a few years I often used to use sky train It was so convenient to move from one area to the other It's clean not so expensive for kids are as same price as for adults It connects between shopping areas So in my opinion it's not so convenient for tourists Although depends on where you want to go after getting off from the trainI think you will use a taxi to some architecture or markets etc In Thailand taxies are soooo cheap If you use the train with your friends(more than 4 or 5 people)it will take more expensive than 30minutes taxi  However train doesn't know traffic jam If you don't have much time I suggest the train

title: Limited usage
review: I find it useful only if both Point A and Point B is within walking distance from the BTS stations  However there are currently only 2 BTS lines and since Bangkok is so big it is more likely that BTS is not that convenient  I still ended up having to take a cab because my final destination is too far to walk  However you can use the BTS to avoid certain downtown areas with severe traffic congestion  Plan ahead of where you want to go consult the map to see which is the closest BTS station to your destination and hire other modes of transportation from that station

title: fast & convenient way to see Bangkok CBD
review: as a resident of bangkok for me it's a mean of transport that would get you through Bangkok CBD if you continue due East on Sukhumvit line you'll also see the eastern suburbs as it's now extended to eastern edge of Bangkok Purchasing ticket for single ride may be confusing Most ticket vending machine only accept coins (only few machine at couple of stations accept notes) you'll have to walk up to the counter exchange for coins then come back to the ticket machine (Yes the counter won't sell the single ride ticket directly to you) Multiple ride ticket can be purchase at counter though Avoid both morning and evening rush hour as Bangkokian commute to work and return home (06000830 and 16301930) you can take fullsize bicycle on skytrain at offpeak hours contact stationplatform attendent (although you might get 'stared' by other passengers  bangkok is not so bikefriendly)

title: BTS is best to travel in Bangkok
review: BTS is the best way to travel in busy Bangkok now Good price with punctuality Try to avoid business hour

title: the only way
review: Great way to travel after trying the (tuktuk)which a great once of and the local taxi cabs i find the sky train the most conveinent way to get to your destination its fast clean and good value for money

title: Saves time 4 sure!
review: This can take you to most hotels major markets shopping malls and connection points for Bangkok sights in a rather short time Beats Taxis&TukTuks hands down Clean and convenient but needs more facilities for disabled and can be very crowded over the rush hour (of course)

title: Bts is an easy and cheap way to move around bkk
review: Its very convinient to use BTS in BKK especially when going to Sukhumvit areaThe trains are being equipped with aircons which are  very usefull in hot and humid weather BTS also has an interchange with MRT and Airport Rail Link ( from Suvarnahbum aiport) The only donwside is that BTS doesnt cover yet the whole BKK

title: Bangkok's lifeline
review: I can not imagine moving around Bangkok (They call it BKK for short) without BTS It is so convenient comfortable (though crowded at times) frequent and well spread across important shopping entertainment and sight seeing locations The fares are quite reasonable and smart pass for long term stay is a way to go

title: Great way to get around a traffic laden city
review: Easy to use and clean Unlike the MRTMTR in HKSingapore the locals actually let passengers off the train before crowding onto it Faster than taxis and tuktuks of course with the added benefit that you don't spend the journey wondering whether you have been ripped off  I actually want to revisit Bangkok for a few days buy a 3 day pass and plan my trips round the Skytrain stations

title: One of the three best ways to travel in Bkk
review: MRT BTS and the Canal taxi The BTS can be a mad house from 7am9am 4pm6pm MF There are two lines the Sukumvit line ending at Mochit and the Silom line ending at the National Stadium next to MBK They upped the price by a couple of baht so it makes it a pain because its done in increments of 12baht vs 10baht (Current rate 313 baht per 1 US) The hub is Siam it is where Silom BTS and Sukumvit meet Asok is where you can catch the MRT if you get off at Rachtawithi and walk towards MBK you will cross over elephant bridge under that bridge is a water taxi that runs from Golden Mount (Grand palace area 1km) out to Bang Kapi Its also a great way to get around When you get on the BTS don't be a Farang and stand in the doorway move inside don't be the person the Thais are mumbling about showing no respect for the many people who use the BTS I speak Thai since I have lived in Thailand for over three years and nothing is worse than a traveler blocking the door with a giant backpack assuming everyone else has to walk around them Also remember to give you seat to women children and monks

title: The way to go
review: The skytrain is certainly a great asset for Bangkok It is clean regular efficient and inexpensive Bangkok is renowned for it's traffic jams at all hours of thhe day The delays can be very annoying for a traveller on a limited time schedule The skytrain is the solution The steep stairways can be avoided if you take the escalator or the elevator Remember no food or drink is allowed this is strictly enforced And you can even watch Tai adverts The last train departs at midnight

title: No jam!
review: There is no jam at all Train is cooling and fast It is not crowd as it is relative higher price compare to the motorcycle taxis

title: good
review: the skytrain is an easy way for you to get around in bangkok as their location are mostly near to tourist attraction

title: World class
review: Bangkok's BTS Skytrain is truly world class It is clean fast and affordable  I just wish they have more ticket vending machines that have English instructions and that take paper bills instead of just 5 and 10 baht coins The lines at the ticket booths can get long at times especially during rush hour

title: Great and cheap way to travel around Bangkok
review: Although it only covers part of the city if your hotel is near one of the stations it's a great way to get around Cheap and easy to follow once you know what you are doing

title: Best and fastest way to get around Bangkok
review: Spending 45 mins in a cab to travel one mile is not getting to your destination in a hurryHowever the Skytrain network is fastcleanairconditioned and inexpensive Trains run every few minutes and are normaly quite fullTickets can be purchased from ticket machines at the stationsAll in all very efficient

title: busy
review: A modern train with lots of information ) you can buy a ticket by yourself just indicating where you want to drop off  VERY busy during the rush our in the afternoon ( bring many coins with you otherwise you might not be able to buy your ticket Trains are not so available for "paraolimpians"

title: I wish the public transport in the UK could be as good as the skytrain in Bangkok
review: A very good experience Get on one of them and you can stop at most of the shopping areas in Bangkok The aircon in the skytrain is working and the fare is very cheap They are always on time

title: skytrain
review: Easy to use although can get a bit crowded but very clean and user friendly Easy to purchase the tickets from the machines cant go wrong really

title: Quick, easy and efficient
review: Why can't every city in the world have this I find travelling around Bangkok by Skytrain the easiest way and have never had any problems navigating my way around

title: best way to get around
review: get a Rabbit card if you're using the skytrain a lot  you pay an additional 50 baht which is refundable (with any leftover credit) when you hand the card back in

title: Just so handy
review: What a no fuss way to get around Bangkok  Once you master getting your tickets it's a breeze The Siam stop is a great hub to  use and is right on the doorstep of shops sights and connecting to the other rail line

title: Use it, it is the fastet way to get somewhere
review: the skytrain is a good way to avoid the traffic jams in Bangkok It is easy to use has aircon and is cheap too

title: Fastest and efficient way thru BKK
review: Get on at Thaksin pier  Sathorn wher boats from hotels drop you and it is a 2 min walk to the trains Avoid rush hour but beats taxis in traffic on speed anytime

title: Frequent and easy to use trains.
review: Taxis on Sukhumvit take forever so take the Skytrain  Mingle with the students ladyboys and tourists  For usually around 30 BHT you can go anywhere  You ask the person in the booth for change and buy your ticket at the machines  The cost depends on how far you are traveling  You can also buy a multiple ride card or unlimited one day tourist card from the station booth  The glass station booth is always located right next to the turnstiles

title: easy to use
review: Good system clean Only problem is it does not cover a large part of the city It would be useful if there were choices of either bus or train (sky train or underground)

title: If only public transport in the UK was this nice!
review: Very easy to navigate to your destination and very cheap to travel It's very modern and the cleanest public transport I've been on a lot of this may be due to no food and drink allowed on the service but that's not necessarily a bad thing Can get quite busy so at times you have to wait for the next train but everybody is civilised and no pushing or shoving  The air conditioning is a nice touch and adds to a pleasurable journey

title: It saves your time and money
review: Trafic in Bangkok is really bad You would lose most of your time in trafic Forget not to mention that taxis cost quite too much this would incluse tuk tuk as will Therefore the mist convinient way to comute in Bangkok is eithere by using the skytrain or the metro Both are great and take you to almost every where However using the train or metro means that you will have to walk a bit

title: Great but limited to small part of the city
review: the skytrain is a great way to travel in Bangkok and specially if you go to the Thomson house However the service and the lines only serves the east and south part of the city with is not good for any of the temples

title: very convenient mean of transport in BKK
review: It is the most convenient mean of transportation in a busy city like Bangkok The time tables are also well organized as well as the information The cleanliness and its air cooling system inside all berths is  very efficient The fare is also reasonable

title: Absolutely necesssary
review: Such a great way to get around the main parts of the city Not perfect but clean and generally efficient  not even that expensive Makes avoiding traffic that much easier

title: Very efficient
review: I did most of travellng along Sukhumvit on Skytrain Bought a rabbit card as I stayed for a week and got discounts on every trip Skytrain was really convenient for me & my family as it had direct walkway to the mall adjacent my Hotel Actually direct walkways are available at most of the Malls via Skywalk Only con I can mention here is lack of elevator escalator at every BTS was a bit hassle for me to carry my kid's stroller together with all the shopping bags)

title: Comfortable
review: Its great its fast its cheap its crowded its BANGKOK  Perfect way to travel around with this similiar to the SMRT in Singapore

title: cheap quick clean and cool
review: Nice cheap quick way to get to where you need to go easy to use and great to get out of the heat you can get right up to the weekend market which was fantastic

title: Travel in skytrain
review: The skytrain is good with nice interiors We availed the skytrain from nana station to visit mvk market The whole journey was

title: Easy and Comfortable
review: It's a comfortable way to travel in Bangkok There are 2 lines the Silom (National Stadium to Wongwian Yai ) and Sukhumvit line ( Bearing to Mo Chit) Both the lines intersect at Siam station Very convenient Also you can connect to Cental PierSathorn  MRT and the Airport Rail Link at certain Stations Get hold of a map which will help you to know the stations and the connectivity and which platform to wait  If you are making many stops in a day buy the day ticket at 130 bath which gives you unlimited travel on the day of purchase

title: Cheap reliable & easy
review: The sky train is a good cheap way of getting around although it doesnt cover a large area ie major tourist points but then this would be a major engineering build to do this Never the less its a must use so try it

title: Always a pleasure
review: It's always a pleasure to ride the skytrain  it's clean fast and cheap and a great way to see Bangkok from above If you ever visited Bangkok in the days before the skytrain and experienced the almost constant traffic jams when on a bad day it could take several hours to cross the city to your destination you will appreciate how wonderful the skytrain is Of course it gets a little crowded in rush hour but most of the day there's plenty of room and as it's air conditioned too what's not to like

title: Cheapest and quickest way to get around Bangkok
review: We were lucky that our hotel provided a free ferry service to a pier close to a Skytrain stop Skytrain proved to be easy to use cheap very regular and comfortable

title: A must do
review: I use the Skytrain to go most places in Bangkok It's cheap fast and easy Look at the map for a time first and then use the destination codes to buy you tickets from the vending machines You'll need your ticket to get out of the system so don't loose it on the train

title: Excellent and efficient
review: Excellent price (compared to underground transport in England) efficient and quick service  All machines were available in English so easy to navigate and buy tickets

title: Speedy way to travel in bangkok
review: Skytrain or BTS as they call it is a speedy way to travel in bangkok The tickets range from 30 baht to 55 baht depending on the distance to travel One can also buy a daily pass worth 130 baht for unlimited travels There is a facility of rabbit pass which will allow fixed number of travels at a cost This lowers the overall travel cost One can select the option based on his or her requirement  Please note the prices are based on rates in Aug2012 They are bound to change

title: Nice views
review: The views from the skytrain are really good but you have to stand at least I did because it was quite busy and it doesnt seem to be the best way to get around the city because the network doesnt cover some places that I wanted to go which was annoying

title: Air Conditioned and Easy~!
review: Easy cheap and the AC feels fantastic The only disadvantage is that it doesn't take you everywhere in the city

title: Escape Choatic traffic atleast in central part
review: Though it wont take you every cornerattraction of Bangkok it pretty much covers central area it costs around 30 to 40 bahts maximum and day pass is available if traveling more frequently in day Also BTS and metro are both different and need separate tickets you feel a sense of satisfaction when you traveling in BTS by looking at chaotic traffic outside

title: Difficult to understand
review: We tried to use the skytrain a couple of times but found it to be quite a tiring experience trying to work out which BTS goes to which area (it seems some areas are not covered so we always had to take taxis at the other end anyway which kind of defeats the point) and buying tickets is a bit tricky

title: Cheap, reliable, and air conditioned.
review: The Skytrain in the best way to get around in Bangkok There you can get to everything that you may want to do and get a cool ride to do it in Best bet for traffic ridden Bangkok Visit the city not the congestion Must use

title: Best way to surf through Bangkok
review: Love it   Fast easy cheap and beautiful way to move across Bangkok Just a pity that there's not more lines

title: Good to use Skytrain
review: Great to us the Skytrain to travel to places such as chatuchak and siam central Very convenient  The traffic in Bangkok are well know busy So travel by sky train would be the best idea

title: fast
review: i prefer skytrain to taxis fast and convenient Like the sky walk as wellhowever can be too crowded at67 pm

title: The way to go in Bangkok
review: Gets you where you have to be on time and in a comfortable way Combine it with scooterrides where necessary and you're the fastest moving person in Bangkkok

title: great way to get to distant areas of the city
review: An excellent way to get to distant parts of the city The tram is clean and air conditioned Can be crowded at times but still a good way to see the city above the traffic

title: Great way of getting around
review: Perfect way of getting around the city Clean on time and the announcements are all in english From the airport it is so much cheaper than taxi or tuktuk and it takes you right into the city

title: take it and stay out of traffic!
review: i loved people watching on the skytrain everything is so well organized but there is crazy ac and it can be really cold

title: Excellent Way to Travel
review: I always use the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok when I visit it's fast and cool and the stations are easy to access  The reason I give 4 stars and not 5 overall is because it can be very busy and often it's difficult even to get standing room at busy times

title: Fastest way to get around
review: This is easily the quickest and most comfortable way to travel in Bangkok It is also economical if you are travelling alone However if you are a family of four a taxi may be the cheapest Stations are close to important points malls interchanges (MRTAirportLink and the river ) so getting around is easy Maps have the relevent information for the same  All in all my choice of travel around Bangkok

title: fast and convenient way to get around bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is a fast and convenient way of getting around Bangkok and it saves you a lot of time and money compared to taking cabs A lot of the cab drivers are crooks and would take a roundabout way of bringing you to a location so that they can charge you more Anyway back to the BTS Aside from being fast and convenient it is easy for tourists to figure out since there is English signage and there is a organized system The best part about it is that people actually queue to go inside the train doors which is a welcome change from the stampeding pushing and elbowing you see in the trains of other crowded Asian countries Bravo to the Thai people for their orderliness and discipline What needs improvement is that not a lot of areas are covered by the BTS and there are other train lines so it is a bit confusing unless you are a local or a veteran traveler

title: Convenient but too crowded
review: The skytrain in Bangkok is convenient and cheap it can avoid traffic jams but every time when we travel for the skytrain it is very crowded so sometimes we prefer to take MRT instead of that  Furthermore we need to call the staff to open the door next to the lift as we carried babytrolley sometimes we cannot find the staff and cannot use the lift therefore we need to carry the baby trolley to walk up and downstairs

title: Great public transport
review: Very easy to negotiate and to see where you are going Cheap and very reliable never had to wait for more than a few minutes for a train to arrive

title: just had to try it.....
review: A quick and easy way to travel  minutes walk to our hotel (Plaza Athenee) a great way to escape the traffic in Bangkok so accessible to all major shopping centres

title: on the move
review: this is the only way to move around Bangkok it is cheap cool and easy to follow the maps takes you to all the places you want to be and great shops on the main platforms if you like it buy it they are truly great bargains

title: Easy to use transport
review: The Skytrain made travel in Bangkok easy and affordable  Tickets are easy to purchase and don't forget to buy yourselves a day pass for 130 Baht if you'll be using it all day to get around

title: The only way to get around Bangkok!
review: It's just so easy and cheap  You don't have to argue with taxi drivers  We stayed at the Pullman which is Chong Nonsi station only three stops from Siam Centre and the glorious MBK shopping Mall (truly the best in Bangkok)

title: Bust the traffice
review: The Skytrain and the MRT are the only ways on how to effectively beta the Bangkok traffic You thought traffic in Brussels London Paris Rome was bad  Come to Bangkok This is bad and mad Unless you take the Skytrain that is Still gets crowded in the morning but the Thai are such lovely and respectful people that even an crowded metro is something enjoyable  Tip  if you plan to do more than threefour journeys per day  buy a day pass Thailand is cheap by European standards but the Skytrain can be pricey

title: Clean, On Time, Cheap and Very Convenient
review: Used it for a week never waited more than two minutes for a train It's clean super efficient and cheap Orderly embarking and disembarking People are respectful of your space and helpful if you need it

title: Skytrain clean and modern
review: Bangkok's skytrain is very easy to use clean and modern Cheap way to get around Bangkok and quicker than taxis and better tha walking

title: Exellent!
review: One of the best ways to go around in crouded bangkokreally easy to learn the skytrain system and its really cheep

title: Ease of Travel
review: This made travelling around Bangkok so simple  I'd recommend you get a BTS card and load it up with 10  15 passes

title: The fastest & cheapest way about Bkk !!
review: A day pass for 130 bht is great if you do a lot of travelling or use the ticket machines like the locals to get the ticket to the desired destination

title: best and cheapest way to get around Bangkok during peak hours
review: Bangkok traffic is famously slow and frustrating Particularly during peak hours of the day BTS (linked to Mtr) will get you around Bangkok cheaply and efficiently Maybe I have been lucky but in all the trips I have never once encountered a situation where the system 'is temporarily broken'  which is frequent in London and Paris

title: Efficient
review: It is efficient clean aircon execellent announcement for next stop stations and above ground so you get a good high view of Bangkok

title: Convenient and cheap transport
review: BTS has very clean stations which can be crowded during peak times but travellers are polite and queue accordingly to enter the train If you are in the city for a few days then it is cheaper to purchase a multiday use ticket â a smartpass â that allows you to store credit onto a magnetic card which can be topped up at any time The colourcoded signage is excellent so long as you know where you want to go and are not colour blind The exit signs will guide you to your destination easily and without having to exit onto the street level in some cases Some of the platforms exist onto an elevated concourse that allows you to walk above the traffic under shade and protected from the weather This is very convenient when the night markets move in and there is little space on the footpath for walking It is definitely much cheaper & nicer to use the BTS than catch a taxis around the city

title: Very nice traveling by skytrain
review: It's the second time that we're in Bangkok and we take the skytrain It's very good and nice traveling

title: Every big city should have one.
review: Fast cheap no delaysmakes Edinburgh's tram project look third world Every station is well signed and i found it not too crowded

title: The only way to travel.
review: It gets you the most of the places a visitor needs If it does not you may want to talk to the nearest point of your destination and then take a cab especially in peak hours in the week except you are travelling in the wee hours or first thing in a Sunday morning

title: Best way to discover BKK
review: Beat the notorious Bangkok traffic by using the skytrain as far as possible Its not only lighter on the wallet but also more convenient and comfy There are maps everywhere and the staff are very friendly and will explain the connections & where you need to get off  Tip In case you need coins for the automatic vending machines  there is a counter n every station who will gladly change your notes for coins Very user friendly

title: Great
review: Fast cheap clean efficient We used the SkyTrain for easy access to Downtown Bangkok Does not take you near the older areas though eg Grand Palace

title: Excellent.
review: As public transport goes the skytrain is a cut above the rest It's cheap clean efficient effective and you can take in some nice sights of Bangkok whiles you're travelling around

title: Convenient
review: Need transport in Bangkok Taxis are cheap but not all drivers speak English Bring a map to show where you wanna go Or else use the Skytrain Modern cheap and fast

title: easy to use
review: i recommend getting around on this as its soo much cheaper and also very quick i found it easy to use especially easy as i dont have this system in my country

title: Just too convenient!!!
review: The best way to get around most of Bangkok especially if you are alone and dont have too much to carry  If there is 3 or 4 of you then the taxi is probably same cost but will take longer

title: Best idea since Pad Thai
review: Take the skytrain  easy as pie and cheap as chips Best way to get around and stupidly cheap Although Bangers is a great city to walk too

title: Skytrain
review: Clean cheap prompt and safe Used it the whole time in Bangkok Would recommend a hotel close to a skytrain station

title: One of the best choice for tourist to travelling around
review: Many destinations locating nearby the sky train so this is the easiest way to get there But in the rush hourit was so crowded In the early morning lying on your bed maybe the best things to do

title: great transportation
review: use BTS better than taxi  stay away from traffics  easy access  clean and safe cool ride  beautiful decorated train  tv in cabin so entertain be careful miss off your station

title: Public Transport via the BTS
review: Train riders are generally wellbehaved not to rowdy or noisy Train can get really packed during rush hours  Always a timesaving mode of transport while in Bangkok Clean interior locals still offer seats to those who need them most

title: Pretty great
review: It has instructions in English its well lighted and the Aircon works really well works till 0200 hrs and it always on time And its really clean  I'd compare it to the New York tube system which is the best compliment I can give it The only difference is it's more restricted in its scope

title: Reliable &  air-conditioned
review: A good inexpensive way to get around town that stops close to many places you'll visit during your trip It gets pretty crowded during peak times however & note that there are NO public toilets at the stations You may also not eat or drink on the train or at the station Staff are friendly & helpful if you need directions or info & you'll find someone who can speak English at most stations

title: Clean and easy to use.
review: Trains run on time signs all in English  Maps clear and easy to use  Very cheap to use  Only downside is that it isn't built as far as the Kho San Road area

title: Excellent mode of transport
review: Easy to use and near to some main tourist attractions Just shame it doesnt go round the whole city

title: cheap and reliable
review: One of Bangkoks great forward visions very nice public transport very cheap and clean way to get around Bangkok Only negative was not much in the way of seats but it is so quick it's ok

title: The Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok, taxis can be helpful but this beats the frequent traffic jams.
review: Skytrain can be very very crowded so if you're claustrophopic try to travel on it at lowpeak times such as before and after rush hour in the mornings  Weekends aren't too bad  But truly taxis are in high demand and traffic is always thick in Bangkok so train or an occasional tuk tuck for short distances is the way to go most of the time

title: Travel experience
review: Traveled on the train once and found the service to be fast clean and convenient Ticketing staff was helpful

title: User friendly
review: We don't speak a word of Thai but the Skytrain was still super easy to use and manuever It was also really clean as they are strict about restricting food and drink It was also nice and airconditioned

title: Veri nice train
review: Very nice clean and fast transportation option in Bangkok One big disadvantage of it is that it don't goes to Khao San road or somewhere near

title: Best transportation service in Bangkok
review: The sky train is a very modern means of transportation fast and clean The only trouble is that it does not reach several areas of the city specially the historical sites

title: another experiences in BKK
review: this time  we go around bangkok  and get experince by using local transporation instead of join the big tour by travel bus due to our hotel near the sky train station we  are very happy to try nice and cleansimilar with MRT in Singapore

title: crowded
review: extremely cheap but crowded the traffic in Bangkok is gridlock the skytrain atleast gets you to places quickly

title: fast above the city
review: excellent way to beat the traffic Wish we had it in LondonFast and cool way to fly across the city to different locations and to visit the great shopping mallsTry the sky walk from the skytrain at Siam to Central World terrific

title: Convenient and cheap - avoids the traffic jams
review: Lots of English signs and very easy to use  great for avoiding the notorious traffic jams This train has several routes and you can connect easily to the airport I use the train in the city as well avoids having to sit in taxis and jams

title: The only way to travel!
review: Clean cheap cool easy to use and by far the quickest way to get around Bangkok  There is nothing to dislike about the Skytrain it would be very difficult to get lost there are always plenty of other passengers who are always willing to help  Pity some other cities (Melbourne) did not adopt the system they use in Bangkok there seems never to be a problem  Love the Skytrain

title: Quick, easy & convenient
review: With the crazy traffic in Bangkok this is the quickest and easiest way to travel Cheap convienient and simple

title: Great Transit System
review: I'm not a city dweller and sometimes get concerned when using transit systems during my travels  However the BTS in Bangkok is convenient once you accustomed to the ticket machines and you have a basic understanding of the stops  Asok is the stop that connects you to the subway and that in turn will get you within walking distance to the express train to the airport

title: Best/Only Way to travel in Sukhumvitt
review: The BTS is the way to go the traffic in BKK Sukhumwitt can be so very clogged If you value your time and I do then use the BTS it is easy super fast and reliable  It is also very very safe  However after midnightit turns into a pumpkin again That is it does not run to outer stations or if it does the frequency is too far between

title: A must to get around Bangkok
review: A clean cheap modern safe and reliable service to enable you to travel all over the city  Make sure a station is within walking distance to your hotel you don't want to be tuk tuking or taxiing around Bangkok all the time

title: Great!
review: Super efficient and easy to usetravelling by train in Bangkok is esy as 123 Go to the ticket machine and your on your way

title: Fast and frequent
review: A good alternative to using taxis or tuk tuks safe and hassle free Good links to shoppping and especially the weekend market from Sathorn Pier

title: getting around
review: Cheap as chips easy to understand "how to" and takes you all over Bangkok A quick look at any tourist map go to a station pick your destination buy your ticket never wait more than 2 or 3 minutes and off you go

title: Fast, frequent and good value
review: The sky train is by far the preferred way to get round Bangkok as you avoid sitting in endless traffic We are staying near Sathorn and therefore have easy access to get to Siam Square or Sukhumvit which where most of the shopping is Only disadvantage is that you need different tickets for Skyrrain vs metro (MRT)

title: skytrain travel
review: skytrain is an easy and cheap way to make your way round in Bangkokwe found the trains clean efficent easy to use  and on  time

title: Packed always
review: Best way of trasport form in Bangkok Its very cheap and you go to most places in Bangkok Its a bit packed but I think you will enjoy the journey as Thai people are most friendly people I have seen

title: convinient way to travel around bangkok
review: There should be escalator for going up because the train level is quite high from the street level  But if you choose hotel near the skytrain it will be nice

title: Fast way around central Bangkok
review: Good way to get around above all the traffic and not too expensive You need cash to pay for the automatic ticket machines which are pretty straight forward to use

title: Awesome efficient transport in the middle of  crowded city
review: You have to marvel at this miracle in the heart of a very congested city with badly behaved taxi and tuk tuk drivers  The service is frequent The trains are not too crowded even in peak hours The carriages are air conditioned And very friendly for the disabled I wish all Indian metro cities had modern transport systems like this

title: unlike any public transportation I've seen
review: so clean easy to understand friendly and VERY INEXPENSIVE Felt very safe as I was a woman traveling alone The stations all have kiosks with places to buy coffee flowers foodvery well run

title: nice ride!
review: this is the first sky train ride and i enjoyed it not that crowded and noisy you should this one be sure to have pocket change when going on the ride its much easier and faster for you to  go in

title: Great way to travel!
review: The skytrain is a great way to escape the heat and craziness of central bangkok and not only that it's also pretty cheap We really enjoyed going on the skytrain if only the London Underground was as nice I might enjoy my commute to work in the morning

title: Quick way to get around the city.
review: It was freezing inside the trains after the heat of the city Good views over everything Well signposted

title: Good way to escape city traffic
review: Good views from the train and very frequent in rush hour Nice way to beat the traffic and the heat

title: Envious
review: Every city should have such an efficient clean train with such frequent and reliable service It truly is an attraction in itself and I wish we had one   Try to get a Rabbit card as it's better value (there are multiple trips included on it and a refundable deposit when you finally return the used up card to a BTS station)

title: Better than taxi
review: It's quite pack at any times but definitely better to avoid the traffic jam of Bangkok In order to get the ticket you might change coins at the information and then go to the automatic machines be aware that at the information they are not printing out tickets

title: Excellent public transport
review: Clean reliable and efficient  This was a great public transport system  Also was able to track which stop you were at

title: Efficient and cheap
review: Very easy to get around in BKK And except for the little boats that go on the river the cheapest way to get around in BKK

title: efficient but can be expensive
review: make sure you get the multi ride pass Taxis can be cheaper if you have many people but the BTS is a good way to get around the bad traffic jams etc People are polite and they queue to get in the carriages so don't just barrel your way through

title: Cheap, fast and best
review: The best way to travel around bangkok 3 usp's include speed cost and comfort Very modern and safe way just like the spanking new dubai metro Buy a rabbit card and top up money into it for seamless travel

title: The quickest, cheapest and best way to get around Bangkok
review: Simple cheap safe and fully airconditioned carriages This is by far the easiest and best mode of transport to get around Bangkok (not to mention the quickest in light of the traffic congestion) The maximum single journey fare is 55 baht (Â£1) although savings can be made if you invest in a Rabbit travel card which can be purchased from the information desks at each station All signage is in Thai and English the staff speak English (some better than others) and their website is actually rather helpful (httpwwwbtscothcustomerenmainaspx) The network doesnât reach all parts of the capital just yet but route expansions plans are in place for the future

title: Clean, safe, and bypasses traffic
review: The skytrain is my preferred method of transport in Bangkok Cars are very clean safe and trains run every 510 minutes so you rarely have to wait With buses taxis and tuk tuks the traffic can easily double your normal travel time but the BTS bypasses all that I always get a hotel near a BTS station and when sightseeing I take the BTS as far as I can and then (if needed) a tuk tuk to my destination Some taxis will not go across town during heavy traffic hours (most of the day) so BTS is often your only choice There is a security presence at each station and I've never felt nervous even traveling alone at night

title: very good
review: I like very much becuase it is very easy  go to the city and anyway in cityA very good  with a convenient

title: Timely, quick, hassle free travel
review: the ticketing is hessle free The reach of the train is good Almost connects to all part of the city or connects to the MRT

title: best way to move, but not disable frendly
review: The BTS is by far the most convenient way to move in central BKK but if you travel with heavy luggage disabled people or kids and strollers keep in mind that most stations does not have elevators or lifts going down ( it seems that elevators are there for convenience not for access even going up you'll have few steps to access them from the road) It can be very crowded on peak hours especially in the morning

title: Besy way around town
review: By far the Best fastest and easiest way to get around and if you include the new subway can't be beat

title: Fast and easy
review: SkyTrain The best way to travel in Bangkok Bangkok traffic can be pretty bad the Sky train is a good alternative It was fast and easy to get on and off We tried using taxis but often at the malls there was a line at the taxi stand you had to wait up to 20 minutes just to get into the taxi they often it took another 3045 minutes to get to your destination The Sky Train was much faster and easier

title: Better than taxi's
review: If you travel a lot buy a day pass for 130Baht it will take you to most places in Bangkok the balance you can do with a tuktuk (20baht max)

title: Crowded but people are not pushy
review: Much better and faster than taking the taxi There are a lot of people but most of them are waiting in lines and are very patient You seldom see people cutting lines if you do most likely that person is a tourist

title: Great way to get around
review: Cheap and efficient  great way to get around some of the main places in Bangkok Ticket machines have an English option and it is really clear how to get a ticket for the station you want to get to Much quicker than a taxi or tuc tuc as the roads are always so busy

title: Good coverage to siam & malls
review: Good but there are no escalaters to skywalk The climb to the ticket counter is long especially with kids Also the concourse also do not have escalaters or lift You will never get a seat in sky train  its always crowded

title: Just few minute from hansar hotel
review: Nearest BTS Station is Rathchadamri and it's located very near from hotel just 3 minute walking If you want to take motorcycle taxi also availbale in front of hotel

title: best and cheap transport
review: well connected to most parts of Bangkok  fast and short waiting times  Also good connections with other public transport

title: Skytrain
review: I admit I love the Skytrain although it is now crowded most of the time It is a great and cheap way of getting around While taxis probably cost about the same if a group of you are going out Bangkok's famous traffic jams make the BTS (and MRT) the only way to get around And I'll put up with the crowded trains and the utter chaos that can be Siam interchange station I just wish the BTS would be extended after National Stadium as that part of town is only reachable by taxi or tuktuk

title: good way to beat the traffic
review: We tried the skytrain from the airport to the city and it was fast  I have always taken a cab from the airport to the city but it's always traffic specially during rush hour  The sky train is conveniently available from the airport  More affordable and faster than taking a cab  However if you are going to use the skytrain in the city it can be a bit tight  Also climbing the stairs can be tiring too after a long day of walking and touring the city

title: Super fast. No waiting time
review: Great way to travel in Bangkok Once a multi transportation card is introduced then it will be more easier  Right now th Rabbit Card is only used for BTS Skytrain

title: convenient
review: very convenient but you need coins to buy tickets and so will have to queue for the coins although you can get the tickets in the vending machine

title: FAST >>>>>> & Cheap
review: Is clean cheap convenience fast and safe to travel  If you have experience Bangkok's traffic then you know how good it's the Sky Train   But stay away from rush hour

title: Very quick and efficient..
review: The best mode of transport in Bangkok It's quick and efficient or you can be sticking traffic for hours It's better to get a BTS map either in the hotel or the station Buy a one day unlimited pass or a rabbit pass which can be recharged and is valid for longer The one day pass can only be used on that specific line so it's best to confirm while buying it

title: Most convenient to move around city center
review: When one knows the traffic situation in Bangkok  it is worth riding on the sky train as it will save you a lot of time and stress    It is by far the most convenient to move around the city center

title: a little bit dirty but a good mean to move
review: It sounds dirty and smelly from approaching by the stairs but it should help people getting around Bangkok saving time avoiding the craziest traffic jam ever seen

title: Easy to Use
review: Ticket machines are clearly marked for the cost for your destination  The trains are busy with people but everyone is considerate  We "old folks" even got offered seats from some students  The stairways at the Mo Chit terminus (where the weekend market is) were very crowded

title: Why is this considered an "attraction"?
review: It was nice  Cool air conditioning on a hot day  Interesting video advertisements to watch  Clean  But it's not an attraction everyone  It's just transportation

title: Convenient and cheap fares
review: Must take it to airport cheap and fast Access to shopping center and tourist spots Clean and easy for disable and elderly

title: zoom zoom zoom
review: it is so easy and quickeven in rush hourto get anywere in BKKit's amazing how much greenery there is when you see BKK from this angleand how so many of the people liveWe use the sky train even if it is only 2 stops per sector you cover so much 'ground'

title: Spick and Span
review: One cannot think of commuting in Bangkok without having to ride Skytrain Especially tarvelling in and aroung Sukhimvit area it is amust You can enjoy Speed High Frequency of service everything great

title: Great service unless it's rush hour
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok The thing I like about it compared to the underground is you can see where your going Also nice and cool after being in the crazy BKK heat Beware if you travel during the rush hour it's like a can of human sardines

title: On my way
review: Take me to the my destinations on time  fast and reasonable price Especially connecting wtih MRT that made my life so easy

title: Crowded but easy travel
review: Easy to get around the city Although crowded the air conditioning makes travel comfortable Frequent service throughout the network

title: Quick clean and Cheap
review: Easy to use and cheap although can be very busy and not surprising when you consider the traffic problems

title: public transit
review: Reliable  fast  confortable  can get crowed at times but very well laid out and constanbtly bing expanded

title: Most Convenient
review: Its best to travel  by the Skytrain since its cost effective and fast  Bangkok traffic can be a nightmare and the inter link with the metro is a boon for connectivity  Please carry change in denominations of 5 and 10 baht since its a self service automated ticketing which accepts only coins of 5 and 10 bahts only  There is a counter to get change but there is always a queue

title: fast..
review: cheaper than taxi and fast used it to travel from airport to the hotel which took just 30 minutes and a very comfortable ride and also within the city to hop to different areas and malls

title: Definitely the way to go to avoid notorious Bangkok traffic!
review: During our trip to Bangkok over the weekend we took taxi's tuktuk and the BTS train  Hands down I will always opt for the BTS to avoid the traffic taxi and tuktuk fare hassle  When traffic on the road is heavy you will definitely get to your destination faster  and when traffic is light on the roads the BTS is a cheaper alternative albeit the lessdirect route  The BTS is clean convenient and airconditioned

title: if u r on airport want to go citybangkok
review: pl catch sky train to paya thai it cost only 45bath n u will be in city most popular area ie around pattunam market their is many many guest house shopping area indian food

title: Good when traveling alone and/or fast.
review: As soon as you  are 23 people it is not cost effective  However it is fast clean and comparatively to other cities safe

title: Cheap and convenient
review: The automated machines to purchase the tickets are in Thai which needs abit of figuring out what to do with it However any friendly local will help you with it )

title: Great way to get around
review: This is an efficient and easy to find your way around Bangkok although we used it to get to Chatachuk market which was  the end of the line so couldn't go wrong Good value and very clean

title: clean and easy.
review: Tis what it is cheapest and easiest way to get around bkk Try the multipass ticket that you can top up or the rabbit ticket 15 trips for 300ish bart

title: Scared of the infamous Bangkok traffic- Skytrain will save your day !
review: Interconnecting most major parts of the city the BTS is probably one of the fastest most comfortable and convenient modes of Public transport in Bangkok

title: Beats the traffic
review: Easy to navigate signs and announcements in English to make things simple Skytrain is clean and gives good views of Bangkok

title: Great to CCK
review: We used the Skytrain to reach the Chatachuk market  The stations are central and from them you can get to the shopping centres all of which have wellpriced restaurants and designer shopping centres for those that want to shop    The best hangout place in Bangkok the Hard Rock Cafe is  not too far from the skytrain station

title: Getting around Bangkok by Skytrain BTS
review: Quickest way to get around Bangkok cheap and clean not difficult to understand routing and each stop announced on loud speaker runs early morning but finishes midnite a day pass is great value but you will still need to use a taxi to get to some attractions if taxi is a must then use the metre taxi as the Tuk Tuks are now a tourist rip off although i do recommend one tuk tuk ride just for the experience

title: So clean easy and convenient
review: The train is the cleanest I have ever been on It is also extremely easy to navigate and very cheap Oh and the air conditioning is a huge perk in steamy Bangkok

title: Best means of transportation in Bangkok - SKY TRAIN ( BTS )
review: This is the best way to get around most of the places around bangkokBut not every places are connected by skytrainFor example if you want to go to Indra market the nearest BTS station is Chitlom which is around 1015 minutes walk awayAlso if you want to visit Grand palace the nearest skytrain station is around 1520 minutes by tuk tukBut I would still recommend using sky trains as far as possible if you want to skip Bangkok trafficWe did the mistake of getting cab from Gem factory to Grand palace and it took us around 25 hours to get there (   So on the positive side 1It 's cheap 2Almost all major shopping areas are well connected  and in many cases the exit of the Station directly takes you into the shopping malls like Siam Paragon  MBK etc 3It 's clean and the process of taking tickets are very easy ( Self Serviced ) 4 There are security guards all the time on the platforms as well as near the ticketing counters  On the negatives  1Sometimes it can get very crowded  esp in late evenings

title: BTS
review: Super Convinient way to travel around the city conectiong to other routes and the subway got to visit alot this way

title: Don't loose your nerves in traffic jam
review: Bangkok's traffic is a nightmare and I don't understand why tourists are affraid of using the BTS or Skytrain There is only 2 or 3 lines everything is written in English and people really helpful For 1 or 2 USD it brings you to major destinations Taxi is cheap in Bangkok that's right but you can be stuck for 2 hours or more in the traffic (we did it)

title: Clean, efficient, and air conditioned!
review: The skytrain system is very clean safe and efficient  All signs are in Thai and English  The fare system is a little confusing at first (you have to know the fare cost for where you are going and then purchase a ticket for that exact fare each time you ride) and many of the stations have ticket dispensers that only take coins  There are ticket booths where you can get change at every station however but it just means having to wait in two lines (one for change then one for the ticket machine)    Once you figure out how it works it's quite easy and much quicker and more comfortable than taxis

title: Easy Transportation
review: You'll definitely want to visit the Skytrain to avoid the crazy traffic of Bangkok's streets  Easier and less hassle than trying to hail a cab with meter or dealing with the tuktuks

title: Great way to get around the city
review: The skytrain looks brand new is well maintained and easy to follow The stations are a bit confusing and getting your ticket can be a real adventure because there are so many people waiting in line and trying to get their tickets too

title: Best way around Bangkok
review: Fast cheap and efficient what more could you ask for in public transport This is the easiest way to get around the city

title: Fast connection
review: great clean system unfortunatelay with own ticketing So you have to buy tickets for Metro and Sky Train separately  two times queing and searching for change

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: This has got to be the best way to get around the city Cheap efficient and very clean Stations are spotless with excellent signage and easy to follow maps Ticket machines are easy to use Trains are well air conditioned

title: SkyTrain
review: We found the platforms a little confusing and the staff at  ticket and info desk were not always able to understand our queries

title: BTSardines
review: For my personal taste the BTS is too crowded from onnut into town since the new stations opened Get a taxi unless you like crowds

title: A great way to get around
review: So cheap (between 15 and about 40 baht for a journey) and really easy to navigate buying tickets etc  Get change from the counter use the machines which link the map and prices to make things easy  Trains are frequent the airconditioning a blessing )

title: Inexpensive and efficient
review: Very good service and excellent connectivity to the fun things you want to do Choose a hotel near the skytrain and you will be happy )

title: Pom La Koon Skytrain
review: The skytrain is absolutley fantastic and is the only way to travel within Bangkok  We get on it every time we visit Bangkok as we go to the weekend market only wish Melbourne had something like this

title: Nice view
review: A nice way to see the city from an elevated position but other than that not particularly exciting compared to other attractions

title: Good
review: The Skytrain was clean cheap and easy to use My only complaint would be that it doesn't go downtown so it will most likely be of limited use to tourists

title: Best option to Travel
review: Skytrain is covering most of the most important tourist locations of Bangkok with very low fare Trains are very clean and safe

title: Just like Tokyo
review: Super clean freezing cold air conditioners easy to navigate just like Tokyo trains If you are by a Skytrain don't hesitate to jump on We loved riding it and one of the stops is right by Jim Thompson's house which was a fun tour and worth a visit

title: Expensive for a Family
review: It may be better to take a taxi from your hotel to your destination if you are travelling as a family unless of course it is rush hour

title: Great fast way to get around!!
review: Value for money way of travelling around sometimes packed but can't win them all great for the big malls MBK etc patpong market and big weekend market

title: #1, why?
review: As I am writing this Skytrain is ranked number 1 thing to do in Bangkok and I am really shocked I think this is really unfair with all the good things to do in this city The Skytrain is just a way to get around and not a very good I've either I can never get the hang of buying a ticket you can't just buy a ticket first you have to ask for change then queue then use some strange machine where you don't choose your destination but choose a fare which you have to check on a map while people are waiting behind you Too much hassle for me

title: Very efficient transport!
review: The Skytrain enables you to move quickly through Bangkok with no trouble from the congested streets It also has some great views of the city from above

title: skytrain
review: just over the road from the hotel and mbk centre we didn't travel far on the skytrain but it was on our "todo" list

title: very clean and on time
review: a cheaper alternative to taxis and took took and you know where your going and how much your paying

title: The only way to get around central Bangkok
review: Fast efficient clean  the only way to get around the center of Bangkok if you want to avoid the horrendous traffic jams  The carriages can get quite packed during rush hours but nothing as bad as subways in some other cities  Many stations have SkyWalks which connect directly from platform level into the shopping centers  very convenient   If you are here for more than a few days an intend using the Skytrain for several trips buy a stored value card and avoid the queues for single journey tickets

title: Sky Train
review: Best mode of transportation in Bangkok Tuk Tuk(auto wallas) are all chor's one of them was trying to kidnap us when we were there as we had purchased and was in possession of gold ornaments If you are in bangkok wherever possible use sky train

title: Didn't except that
review: Bangkok is such a surprise especially since the rest of Thailand is somehow less modern So the sky train is by far the biggest surprise 2 lines which are linked to the most coveted areas of Bangkok and a great day pass for unlimited travel AC is great

title: Too hot
review: Public service is very good in thailand Btw i prefer to use mtr considering the air condition service No internet access in the platoform at all

title: Fantastic
review: The Sky Train is fantastic and a cheap way of getting around Bangkok Get either a daily or weekly pass  you can jump on and off anywhere you like The trains are every few minutes so you never have to wait long if you see one pulling away as you walk onto the platform

title: Skytrain
review: Gets you from A to Bfast  Make sure you have your coinage ready before you get to the stationthe change lines can be pretty long

title: Okay outside of peak hour.
review: If you are sticking to the main central part of Bangkok the skytrain may well help you get around quickly Beware though during the busier parts of the day the trains are packed solid and massive cues are a result

title: good not great
review: One of the nicer carriages compared to mass transit rail systems in major cities but the network is still limited although they have made some extensions Still needs to have much more stations to make it a proper alternative to taxis which are still the best way to get around Bangkok (despite mostly being a bit crazy if not very crazy or even very very crazy)

title: The way to travel in Bangkok
review: I have taken the Skytrain at least 20 times and never had any problem Never have I seen it as dirty as the counterparts sometimes are in New York and Manila or as crowded as the trains sometimes are in Tokyo What I do in Bangkok is defined by what I can do on the Skytrain

title: awesum sky train
review: its an expereince to see the city thru the mobile semi air transport must do do take the week pass so that its economical

title: Best and safest form of transport in bangkok. (And MRT SUBWAY)
review: All the scamming tuk tuk's and taxi drivers are a waste of time They will smile at you and scam you without blinking an eye This is not only typical in Thailand but anywhere you go there is heavy tourism Take some time Map out where you want to go and look on the map where it is If it's in Bangkok there is likely to be a BTS or MRT near by You can download some free or paid apps that have them

title: Excellent and convenient way to get around
review: Cheap day passes for 180 bhat unlimited day travel Best way to get around Bangkok Get a map of the subway from the hotel and you will be set Must remember that the subway closes at midnight so plan well for late night sorties

title: Excellent service apartment, good location and great service
review: I'm sure I will come back and stay in this apartment again The location is very good and conventient just behind JW Marriott (2 mins walk to BTSNana station) We chose 3 bed rooms apartment Inside are huge modern and clean Especially with the big city view balcony The staff are excellent and very helpful The infinity pool on the roof is so great You can see the whole view of Bangkok when u swimming It's really suitable for couple friends and family to stay The price is very reasonable too

title: Skytrain - a must!
review: Skytrain is one of the most important things in Bangkok Before reserving a hotel check if it is close to a skytrain station If not forget it The skytain covers most of the city from Banga in east from Thonburi in south and almost to the old airport of Don Muang in north It will take you five minutes to cover a distanse which takes 30 minutes or more by a taxi The best part of it is that it runs every 510 minutes and the price for a dayticket avilable from six in the morning to twelve midnight is 120 baht or 4 UDdollars

title: Growded, but efficient
review: Get you around all over Bangkok Allways crowded but thaipeople are carefull with strangers Low prices and easy ticketing system Trains comes and goes all the time You can also get off he train and walk along the track on the Sky Walk under the Sky Train over the traffic and with a roof over all the way

title: Crowded
review: Its quick to get around on the skytrain but sometimes very crowded and could do with more carriages Takes a lot longer on the bus

title: Reliable and fast
review: I used the skytrain to get to downtown Bangkok at Makkasan station Then grabbed a cab to my final destination  Don't know why the faster red line is 3x more expensive than the reasonable fast blue line

title: Cheap and good way to get around
review: It costs from 15baht to 25baht to get around per person It will bring you to favourite shopping haunts like MBK shopping mall to ChatuChak Sunday market

title: How transit should be
review: By far the easiest safest cleanest way to get around Bangkok It doesn't go everywhere but if your destination is near a stop it is definitely the way to go  Also I find public transit interesting from an infrastructure perspective and it's fun to see a (relatively) new system in action

title: beat the traffic
review: keep the 10 bath coins and beat traffice by using the BTS Cheaper and faster than a cab and most probably safer )

title: Easy to use and cheap
review: If you want to get around Bangkok try the train it's cheap easy and very clean I'd reccommend you get an all day pass for approx $400AUD and then you can use it as much as you want through the day up until midnight

title: Excellent way of getting round Bangkok
review: Very clean and modern transit system  It can get crowded at rush hour though  Trains are regular and map is very intuitive

title: Very Easy and Safe
review: A good way of getting about east to use inexpensive and safe I traveled all over the network for six days always felt safe and found staff very willing to help when i got lost or needed to find best exit for the place i was visiting

title: More cities should have this...
review: Bangkok's skytrain is an easy and inexpensive way to get around to most parts of the city  Although crowded with workers at rush hours it is air conditioned quiet and very fast  Toronto really needs to adopt the "pay for the distance travelled" method of charging customers My only beef is that they close the service at midnight and I think it should run till 200 am

title: good way to get around
review: Traffic can be very bad in BKK this is one of the alternatives  Also consider Tuk tuk they can weave through traffic pretty well

title: Cheap, efficient, wish it went further
review: Quick efficient air conditioned it get's you close to most things Trust me unless you love the smell of partly combusted hydrocarbons mixed with hot humid air you don't want to take a Tuk Tuk as it will take forever Skytrain fast and fun

title: Efficient, Clean & Easy
review: Very easy to navigate & travel around Bangkok The 120 baht for unlimited all day access is a great deal

title: Get there quicker!
review: Quick and easy way to get around Bangkok shame it doesnt have many stops But still it was quick and very well air conditioned

title: We have no choice BUT to like it!
