review: It gets you places during traffic That's awesome Unfortunately not all stations have escalators to assist elderly people  Very efficient for the most part but it is starting to get very congested during rush hour

title: Fast and Easy
review: its easy and fast to travel compare to the bus the staff at the counter are very helpful in giving instructions

title: The ONLY way to travel in BKK
review: Clean cheap and fastby far the best way to get around especially during the hours of 48 pm  If you plan to stay more than a day or two buy a fare card from the office so you don't have to stand in line every trip

title: No escalators to the platform
review: Its cool and cheap and the best way to get around humid busy Bangkok BUT it was built without any escalators or to the paltform (they ran out of money due to corruption) without that its knackering walking in the humid heat No wheelchair access either

title: Fast and efficient
review: The Bangkok skytrain is the recent addition to the metropolitan transport system complementing the existing rail and metro lines  While the system is still in full expansion (with several new stations planned to open soon) it already offers smooth connections between the central parts of the city as well as a perfect transfer fromto the Airport Express

title: Woohoo
review: That what you need to travel around Bangkok with skytrain get to see lots of thing especially all the building along the way

title: BTS - cheap way to get around
review: Easy to make your way around the city using the BTS Cheap too I would not recommend tourists to get the rabbit card as most of the times the ticketing machines do not have long unbearable queues

title: most convenient way around bangkok..
review: its the most convenient way around bangkok it beats the traffic around the cityits easy to navigate and follow instructions  we took the unlimited card and its all worth it

title: Clean and cool...
review: These trains are fantastic  only wish they covered more of Bangkok Really clean and wonderfully cool Fares are clearly displayed (20 40 baht a journey or you can get a day pass) and many stations have change booths as its easier to use the self service ticket machines that are in English as well as Thai We used this and the riverbus system to get around most of Bangkok Go for it

title: Easy and fast
review: Love the transit system Easy to access and connects downtown bangkoksukumvit everywheregreatttttt

title: Great way to travel
review: Easy to work out how to use it this is a great way to travel around Bangkok  We really enjoyed using public transport in Bangkok and found it to be clean and reliable

title: Great way to travel Bangkok
review: Don't rely on it to get back to your hotel to catch a flight though as there are also delays on the Sky train It is however a good alternative in peak hour traffic

title: Easy and Quick Means of Transportation
review: The Skytrain provides access to many major areas and is fairly economical to use  Good during the rain as most of the station is sheltered and good during hot weather as the trains have AC  I found the frequency to be very good as well and the train runs until midnight  If you have 2 or more people a short trip will cost around 25 Bhat each it is sometimes worth taking a taxi or another form of transportation if your origin and destination are not next to a BTS station and if you are not going that far  Buy a Rabbit Card these have a 50 Bhat nonrefundable charge but if you are at a busy BTS station it beats waiting in a huge queue to buy a ticket

title: Take the City Line from the Airport
review: It costs only 45 baht per person to Phaya thai way cheaper and safer than a taxi (less risks of accident) From there you can jump on other lines or on a bus line Bus line nr 59 runs to the Khao San area  If you alight the train at Ratchaprarop you are close to the Pratunam area Bus line nr 77 to Victory Monument Chakutchak and Mochit 2 or in the other direction to Silom road

title: Get about the city
review: Cheap and easy access to the main parts of Bangkok Clean and reliable 5 minutes from the Shangri la

title: Efficient!
review: Very fast and good service Only problem was with ticket buying  most machines only allow purchase ticket by ticket  If travelling in groups of 3 might be more efficient to take taxi (if not being surcharged)  I had a really bad experience with taxi driver in Bangkok (the guy tried to charge me like 6X the normal fare and we had a huge argument) and now I would rather take the Skytrain even if it is slightly more expensive

title: Faster Transportation Method
review: during peak traffic times  It helps to have coins to purchase tickets so you don't have to stand in line for change  I usually needed 2530 Baht

title: Great way to get around
review: I will always use the Skytrain if time is on my side (ie I don't have to get up at 430am to catch a connection flight) The trains are incredibly clean very frequent and if you know the name of your destination easy to find on the train map at each station   Not all train station staff speak enough english to point you in the right direction but many travellers do Affordable quick easy to use I highly recommend using the Skytrain to get around especially if you are not under duress to make a flight Will always use it when in Bangkok for a few days

title: Easy way of getting around
review: Quick convenient easy to use well priced and cleanstations are Key locations and stations so easy to get around the large and busy city of Bangkok

title: A Must
review: The best way to get around BKK if you can Clean with powerful air con  wonderful However some travellers may have problems climbing the steps to get there

title: Efficient
review: The sky trains are an efficient and cost effective way of getting around in Bangkok the trains come on time they are clean The maps are set out well and you are notified of the stops in advance All in all it is pleasant

title: GETTING AROUND
review: Very handy and easy access from the hotel a short walk up to the main Soi and there are plenty of local food stalls to sample on the way

title: no traffic here.
review: When I moved here 4 years ago nobody used the skytrain now the word is out It is without a doubt the easiest way to get around Bangkok and most fairs are 40baht or less That's just over a dollar great deal

title: Very convenient
review: Skytrains are well connected and convenient and connected to almost all the major tourist attractions

title: Cool way to get around
review: Lots of stairs to negotiate with a pram and a baby but once you are on it's air conditioned You need change to get tickets and sometimes you have to line up to get the coins you need Plan ahead

title: Very easy to follow
review: Very easy to follow impossible to get lost  Very clean and nicely airconditioned  And it's very reasonably priced Definitely the way to get around and faster than cabs as Bangkok has a lot of traffic

title: Sky train
review: Quick easy cheap and cool Much better than taxi or tuk tuk Don't be afraid to try the staff on the ticket booth speak English so will help you buy a ticket and worked out where you are going is easy as the lines are all colour coded

title: Best way to get around to most metropolitan areas...excellent and clean public transport!
review: The sky train is a gift to the headache of Bangkok's traffic nightmares I just can recommend to anyone who is not worried to do a little walking as it takes some efforts to go to a sky train station and most like to exit one and to make your final journey (or descent) by foot or fetch a cab or alternative transport for the remainder of your trip As an example I often go by sky train from Sukumvit soi 2 to Sukumvit soi 48 and it takes about 12 minutes onlyby car (taxi) it can take you easily an hour or longer Take the sky train in combinations with final short walks or taxi rides The sky trains are very clean and nicely air conditioned however sometimes a little crowded but this ok for a safe and quick and very cheap journey above the messey and jammed roads of Bangkok

title: BTS
review: best and quickest way to get around Bangkokairconditioned and very cheap to travel missing all the trafficeasy way to go to the shops

title: The promise of traffic free travel around Bangkok
review: It is pretty much like metrounderground systems in other cities and is an awesome way to get around whilst avoiding the nightmare that is Bangkok's traffic  There are only a couple of lines at the moment and so it is not the answer to all Bangkok's commuter woes (yet)  but this will change in the future    The walkways between major malls and intersections and the stations is a great feature too

title: Conveinent, cheap and efficient. Limited routes
review: Traffic in Bangkok can be really really crazy So the skytrain is a good alternative If you need to go somewhere you should first take the skytrain to the correct area and then take a taxi there Otherwise you could spend hours in a taxt in traffic literally When you are on holiday you don't have so much time to waste sitting in traffic

title: Best possible way to Travel in Bangkok
review: Well connected and best way to travel inside the citiAvoid Traffic congestion To any place of attraction you can reach by Sky trainWe had taken it twice and stations were easy to locate and find places The self service ticketing requires coins of 10 or 5 baht which you can get from the manual ticket counter They will not issue ticket manually they will instead give you coins and tell the fare for the station we mentioned ones you pay them Convenient way

title: BTS
review: the best transportation solution ever very clean very fast no traffic jam`s very cheap straight to the point

title: clean reliabe transport
review: very professional and effective mode of transport  trains are clean as are the stations and well up to the standards of any modern country  limited routes but still a great way to get around One tip  the people at the booths are for change only and to distribute tickets  and dont hand over a thousand baht note as you will get lauged at  lol

title: World class city transport
review: Glide across the traffic quickly and in comfort The Skytrain is remarkably efficient and easy to use Also gives you good idea on the layout of Bangkok We only used taxis to get to a spot away from our preferred Skytrain Get around the city quickly Ticket system easy and allday pass worth it We also used the Express train to airport took about 20 minutes and delivers you right inside the airport great system Trip to airport from city is about 80Baht

title: Great way to see Bangkok
review: Get a day pass for sky train and a 3 day pass for metro and travel everywhere you need to in Bangkok for a bargain If you want need a taxi they are cheap on the meter and very safe But look at the map and get the train as close to the location as you can then get a taxi Such a cheap way of seeing all the sights One day Sky train for under Â£4 and 3 day metro for under Â£5 Tuk Tuks are fun but some of them are a bit crazy so keep your trip in these short

title: easy to get around
review: the skytrain is so easy to use we go all over from nana to mbk and various other places a lot quicker to use than taxis especially in rush hour although they are crowded it is the quickest way to travel

title: Sightseeing from high up
review: Get a map of the Bangkok trains MRT and BTSSkytrains The skytrains cover most of Bangkok's business regions It's especially useful if you want to discover the shopping centers and plazas

title: Easy to use
review: When i say easy it would be if you have a sense of direction we got lost one day and had to jump off and on But at no time did we panic The skytrain is clean and spacious and is a great way to getting around

title: Beats the traffic, but limited routes
review: We used a car for much of our trip and it was brutal We are from LA so we know brutal traffic The Skytrain helped a lot of that but it's routes are limited so you can't see all of Bangkok

title: Avoid busy hours
review: It is difficult to get in in rush hours Other wise you may have to wait for a long time at the station

title: Skytrain
review: Efficient affordable Air conditioned and easily combined with the River Boat Ferry to easily get around Bangkok

title: Cheap and easy
review: Easy to use I only wish they offered passes which covered the MRT and LRT The trains cover all key sights and are frequent just make sure you read the exit signs or you could come out a long walk from where you want to be

title: good to reach locations
review: It is good to reach different lcations You can take THB130 ticket for a full day travel looking at the bakgkok traffic it is very helpful to reach destinations with out traffic block

title: Sky Train
review: Sky Train is the best way to get around Bangkok cheap quick and regular  We never had to wait long and it got us to all the areas we needed to visit

title: Cheap!
review: Very reliable and for such a small price this is better than getting taxis in Bangkok At least you won't get ripped off and you won't be stuck in crazy Bangkok traffic It's clean and very safe

title: Good
review: Easy to use airconditioned Ride above the traffic jams which are below you as this is an elevated mass transit system

title: easy
review: skytrain is easier & more convenient & reliable than any form of transport in australia it makes australia look like a third world country when it comes to transport

title: A rethink.  Time for BTS to wake up and fix its problems.
review: Though the SkyTrain (and metro and airport link and bus rapid transit) revolutionized travel in Bangkok the system had several compromises which now make the SkyTrain a less than stellar system compared to peers in the region  with the possible exception of Kuala Lumpur's fragmented rail "system" 1 Train length and capacity  3car trains may have been fine in the first couple of years  But Singapore MRT trains for example are routinely 6 cars for a city with considerably lower population  BTS trains are packed to the point that some folks cannot board trains at some times  There's talk about 4car trains systemwide  Not enough  Time for 6car trains 2 The shortage of escalators may stem from tightwad tendencies plus poor planning at inception  BTS has mud in its eye when compared to the alternatives in BKK and elsewhere I know people who won't ride the SkyTrain because of this lack of escalators Let's get the mud out of your eye BTS and install more escalators 3 Shutting down the system at midnight (actually more like ~1140 PM) on Friday and Saturday  BTS can do better than this 4 Flow through stations at rush hour is worse than in Boston a system designed over a century ago  Time for BTS to renovate its stations for smoother passenger flow 5 Previously BTS had several shuttle buses to extend its service area  It dropped them  when it should probably have extended them (and perhaps made them no longer gratis but still reasonably priced and perhaps using the same tickets as the skytrain itself)  There are other issues  but progress on these would be a good start at getting BTS out of its mediocre complacency

title: Using the BTS
review: Very cheap and easy to use Would recommend using the BTS whenever possible in preference of using taxis and tuk tuks  advantages no haggling over fares quick and clean and also air conditioned

title: Rapidly like a rabbit
review: Clean fast secure take a rabbit card 50 Baht deposit (refundable) and at least 200 Baht that brings you everywhere in town

title: Best to use a train in a city like Bangkok. Helpful, easy, on time.
review: Travelling in and around Bangkok or want to go shopping without haggling with taxi drivers The most reliable and convenient option to travel is to use the skytrain It's easy helpful and convenient to use the services if you were to choose a oneday pass

title: change
review: i did not like that you had to stand in line to get a token then you had to stand in another like to get a ticket

title: fast and easy to buy tickets
review: clean fast easy to buy tickets great way to travel around bangkok especially during rush hours although it may be a bit crowded

title: Good
review: Aircon tv's cheap and quite fast Good way to travel however can be a bit over crowded Helps get around without worrying about the Bangkok traffic

title: Fast!
review: The skytrain was an easy way to travel saving heaps of time in traffic We never ever waited for a train and the ticket staff were also great

title: Gives British Rail some competition
review: easy safe and efficient As a solo traveller this is the easiest and cheapest way of getting around Bangkok

title: The way to go...
review: Avoid the taxis tuktuks and busestake the skytrain for reasonable rates within reasonable times It's the easiest way to get around and you can check websites that tell you what skytrain for different attractions or check skytrain stops and the attractions there

title: Easy travel
review: Good to get around especially during rush hour when the roads are in dridlock Convienant to use and very regular

title: Convenient and easily accessible
review: Airconditioned  cheap and reasonable fare goes to major spots   Long lines at some of the busy stations

title: Convenience
review: Cheap and convenient method of getting around central BKK (the business shopping and main hotel districts anyway) Easy to understand and use with many helpful staff locals and tourists around if you need a hand

title: Forget Taxis
review: Bangkok traffic is horrible Sky train just makes life a lot less stressful It runs very well and you can reach most of the places you would like to see It is also very easy to navigate around

title: Simple and quick
review: The skytrain is great might find it simpler with coins to pay but otherwise easy to use if a little pricey for short distances

title: Very clean but overcrowded
review: Need of more cars overcrowding at noon time and "rush hour"  especially 48 pm  Soon it will be like Tokyo hire people (with or without white gloves) to shove people into the cars

title: Efficient
review: A fabulous alternative to the hectic Bangkok traffic jams Clean air conditioning on time fast inexpensive A great solution

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Travelling around in skytrain is very convenient and comfortable The train stations are nicely maintain and clean

title: very helpful
review: direction are not very clear but since there is only 2 lines Silom and Sukhumvit so it is easy Don't foerget to ask where exactly you want to go so you can pay the right fees

title: cheap and no traffic
review: This is a very easy way to get around Its less than a dollar its safe and clean albeit a little crowded However its better than braving that traffic

title: Cheapt and fast
review: Sky train is fastest and cheapest way to transport in Bangkok u get trains in every 25 minutes and u can reach very fast from sky trains saving hours in red lights and 100's of THB  Many malls are directly connected to sky train platform like siam paragon or MBK  They have change counter and automated machines which are really good to use and u can take day pass also to save more bucks )

title: Skytrain listed as an attraction?????
review: Come on guys    I've given this a one just so that it loses some points  since when as a transport system been an attraction  The BTS in Bangkok is great  I saw some reviews saying it's started to get congested at peak hours  can you name any public transport system in a major city that doesn't  Skytrain is clean airconditioned reliable and reasonably priced  Don't hesitate to use it  but be aware that there are very limited number of escalators

title: Convienent Travel in BKK
review: Great way to get around the city  Connects with the metro and is easy to use  Have your coins ready

title: Brilliant
review: Very clean air conditioned cheap and an excellent way to get around Could not recommend this service high enough 5* all round

title: Quick and easy
review: A skytrain station was located outside our hotel which made our journey to the MBK center very easy It is cheap and very quick

title: Easy to use
review: A similar system to New York Paris subways you buy a ticket from the vending machines there are change facilities available and the cost and lines are clearly marked on the vending machines in english There are guards at the turnstyles just in case you have any issues there and we found them very helpfulThe Thai people are very polite and even though the sky train was crowded there was no pushing or jostling A great way to travel especially when the roads are jammed with traffic

title: study you map first
review: you need to know where you are going first and learn to spot the numbers at each stop and the colours of the different tracks

title: Clean, efficient - use it
review: The Skytrain in Bangkok is just like the one in Singapore  Both are clean quick and work with zero fuss  They are smooth and slow down correctly at the station so that your not thrown around like a rag doll in London Tubes  Use them

title: Take this whenever you can
review: In expensive clean and quick Access to most of the city  Can connect to MRT (subway) at Asoke  Avoid during heaviest rush hours if you can

title: Convenient but...
review: Really a little better than okayit is easy to use ONCE you navigate up the stairs Few stations that we used had an escalator or elevator Ticket machines are easy to use if you know Thai or English Announcements on the train in Thai and English plus a monitor Day passes sold at ticket booth 130THB per day

title: Extremely convenient and efficient
review: This is an excellent way to get about Bangkok The network isn't very extensive but what is there is extremely easy to navigate and very clear to use It can get you around and about for a good price and serves a good portion of the city that lies inwards away from the river (leaving you to navigate the multiple boating options for destinations up and down the river)

title: Cheap, clean, and quick train
review: The Skytrain is a good way to get around if it happens to go where you're going It's not the most extensive system so don't expect to hop off and be right next to where ever you're going  The price of the train is very low and it's impeccably clean It's air conditioned and offers welcome relief from the heat and humidity of Bangkok Don't hesitate to take it and walk to your final destination which is probably a better way of seeing the city than hopping into a taxi every time you need to go somewhere

title: Very usefull but it doesn't reach every spot!
review: The service is very usefull but it does not reach every spot or attraction of the city It is impossible to visit the city using only the Skytrain You need to take a taxi or tuc tuc to reach many attractions And bring a scarf when you step in because it is freezing inside

title: convenient
review: It's very easy to travel around Bangkok with the skytrain especially if you don't like the Bangkok Jam Buying the ticket is also very easy and cheap If you are not sure of the nearest stop to your destination you can get help from the staff

title: The best way to move around Bangkok
review: Modern clean reliable maybe a bit costly compared to taxi but much much faster and reliable In most cases you can buy tokens only from machines and pay only with coins To get them you have to wait in a long line sometimes

title: reliable
review: This service was easy and reliable The stops were read out at each stop and also there was a map on the walls The trains were air conditioned and very clean The price was also cheap

title: Very clean and Comfy
review: Though the Skytrain only has 2 lines (don't know if they're going to add more lines in the future) this mode of transportation is really comfortable and the whole train is really clean Also if you're looking to go shopping just get off at Siam or Chit Lom and there are malls and small markets galore

title: Very convenient!
review: Great way to travel in Bangkok  Very cheap and convenient  All signs and ticket machine are in English  You know what you have paid for and no haggling required

title: link to all the city corner
review: its great for kids and for us no need taxi or tuk tuk in Bangkok we can go all around the city by skytrain in it link to railway mrt and taxi boat

title: great
review: they sky train was really great and easy to navigate your way around we really enjoyed it It was very clean and tidy The only let down was the dogs and beggers everywhere at the stations a little gross

title: Clean, cheap, punctual and air-conditioned!
review: The best way to travel around Bangkok We were travelling with our young children and were always given a seat Stations can get a bit crowded but otherwise our journeys were all hassle free Keep your 10 baht coins for the ticket machines although they have staff on hand to give you change if you need it

title: Easily accessible
review: Do without the traffic and take the BTS clean and pretty convenient Would highly recommend above taxi's Tuk tuk's might be ok as long as they dont take you to different locations other than the one you want

title: Cool Speed in Bangkok
review: It's fast and cool Although it has limited coverage it does what it does very efficiently and incredible cheaply Make sure your hotel is near it

title: Must go in bangkok starting from airport.
review: Use it as the only mode of travel in BangkokAvoid taxis since they are always stuck in jams Avoid tuk tuks since they overcharge  We took the skytrain from the airport and reached our destination so fast You get to see real character of Bangkok herenormal people and some fantastic sights from the trainThere are announcement in English and people around you will readily helpYou save a lot and there is no headache of finding a taxi Train has fast service and you dont have to wait longThere are elevators also available and the staff at the stations is generally helpful

title: Easy, cheap, safe transportation
review: Great way to get around Bangkok The route is rather limited but if your destination is near a station you can get around easily (and cheaply) by tuktuk or taxi Great way to get the feel of the city

title: Easy to naviagte
review: Really clean and easy to use system Safe as well The agents at the ticket counter will help you navigate the map They will also make change for you to buy the tickets at the self serve ticketing machines

title: Loved it!
review: It was something different for us great views cheap travel and even not bad I loved the ride with my friend The seats were clean and it was a good option to see how the city looks

title: Escape the traffic jams
review: Usually much much quicker than taking a taxi and a lot easier to estimate how long it'll take to your destination Efficient safe and cheap

title: Skytrain
review: Loved the frequent service and really affordable  You don't have to wait to long but I do recommend you have coins on you as sometimes the machines don't take notes

title: Easy way around!
review: The stations are easy to work with the prices of all the stations displayed right in front of you this made it really easy for tourists to figure out Trains were frequent air conditioned and clean   Only things that were a little annoying was that the ticket machines didn't accept notes so you constantly had to go to a booth to get change and then go buy a ticket Also the BTS doesn't go everywhere

title: Excellent
review: Skytrain is an easy quicker and yet cheaper means of transportation in Bangkok The raillink from the Airport to the Skytrain and then onwards within the city on Skytrain is perhaps the best mode of transportation in Bangkok As the train does not face any trafic jams it is also the fastest means and obvioulsy the safest also

title: Decent Option for Traveling within certain area's
review: The BTS is an excellent option to travel within the city area with a great scenic view of the city  Airconditioned and decent in terms of cleanliness (Not close to the MRT at Singapore but much better than most of the trains in Paris )  However if you are more than one person travelling from a particular point it may also be worth it to check the cost of traveling by taxi as it may turn out to be cheaper Spl if you are to travel till the station by another mean of transportation For eg we stay near Baring BTS but to get there it costs about 50 Bhat by taxi Then for both of to travel say till Phrom Phon BTS Station would cost another 110 Bhat one way However in 110 Bht we can just take a taxi till our destination from the main road of our house   Also a lot of the tourist attractions may not be close to the stations so you may need to take a tuk tuk express boat  taxi or walk Do your research online   You could compare costs by checking the BTS Website  httpwwwbtscothcustomeren02routecurrentaspx# vs the taxi fare httptinyurlcom9hxegm3  It is still an experience and one should try it out if you are just visiting for a few days )

title: How to avoid the traffic
review: In the best tradition of public transport systems the BTS is regular convenient comfortable and runs to schedule

title: The way to get around Bangkok
review: You really don't want to drive in Bangkok with it's uncertain daily traffic jams you could easily be stuck in traffic for hours the skytrain is defiantly the best stress free and quickest way to travel it links up to most of the major shopping malls and buissness centers if your a tourist they have special unlimited travel cards one day three days to a month getting a pass or card is defiantly the way to go it beats waiting in lines at crowded  times and keeps you from trying to find the correct change each time you take a trip at the counter where you buy your pass or card they have a little pamphlet in English that shares the attractions at each stop it is an short distance if not right at the doorstep of may of the city's major hotels also it's completely covered the connecting walkways so if your in Bangkok during rainy season you may be able to get to your destination perfectly dry also traffic can be at a standstill if it's raining and getting a taxi impossible SoBe sure you get a sky train pass and zoom on by the hectic city on the roads belowyou will be glad you did

title: Great way to see the city
review: Fast clean cheap and efficient  When the Bangkok traffic starts to back up the skytrain is your best option for getting around the city

title: Amazing
review: Seriously  it's the best public transport I've been on and the air conditioning is a blessing on those hot and humid Bangkok days It's inexpensive compared to other cities and it's the best way to get around the city Find a hotel near the Skytrain and you'll be happy you did

title: very cheap
review: very cheap and fast to get around shopping such as MBKOR TERMINAL 21 Its very clean fast and loads of space on their

title: An escape from the gridlock
review: The Sky train cut our journey times from 45 to 5 minutes Despite the fact that at most times it was standing room only and not all enhances have escalators it was well well worth it Each trip costs BHT 15 one way and the smart passes (minimum BHT 100) are very useful Although at times they seem to malfunction but are quickly fixed by the ticketing office

title: Scenic Views and Really Fast
review: Staying in Bangkok in a little quiet hotel 25 km from the City I took the skytrain every day I enjoyed it so much looking around getting an impression of this fascinating town

title: Skytrain jump queues
review: Just carry coins No waiting in line to have your notes changed Great way to see the city and the sights but be careful in peak hours IE Sardines

title: Amazing
review: Really cold great relief from the heat outside Will want to ride just for the fun of it Oh and super cheap

title: Fast and efficient
review: The skytrain gets you around Bangkok Cabs get stuck in the traffic jams So use the skytrains to get around town

title: Fast but child/family unfriendly
review: Itâs fast way to travel around but make sure your hotel is close to the train station I found that very confusing to travel with children â no elevators walking up and down no clear information about child fares (not even on their website) If the child is over 90 cm (mine was taller when he was 2 yo) he pays adult price which is unfair I think Plus you have to carry your child through the gate â imagine if you have at least two of them and a luggageâ¦

title: Clean and efficient
review: This is a great way to avoid the traffic woes of Bangkok  We found it both clean and efficient and not to mention cheap  Station staff were helpful in answering any queries

title: Great way to get around bangkok!
review: This is a great way to get around Bangkok and beat the traffic Trains are clean modern and efficient

title: Clean and modern. Excelent transportation system
review: It is an excellent option for travelling through Bangkok Price is reasonable and the train is great

title: Best way to travel
review: Fastcleanon timea very convenient way to travel in BangkokEasy access to the main shopping malls the river shuttles

title: Easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is easy (instructions and directions are in both Thai and English) cheap and super clean  It gets busy between 36 pm but other than that issue it is my first choice of transportation in Bangkok

title: Great transportation for Bangkok
review: Convenient clean and on time  Probably the most orderly thing in Bangkok  The only problem is it's too crowded

title: convenient
review: easy to use gets you linked to most places however if you 2 or more taxis are cheap and easier as long as they run a meter

title: Skytrain
review: Fantastic way to beat the infamous Bangkok traffic Convenient Stations airconditioned and cheap too

title: The fastest and most reliable way to get around town
review: The Skytrain in Bangkok has two lines that connects and takes you almost whereever you want to go and it's fast and leaves every five minutes It's cheap too

title: Busy but not expensive
review: At certain times can be very busy try to a have change before going to the station or you will need to queue just for coins

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Skytrain is cheap and convenient and lets you avoid the amazing Bangkok traffic The trains are clean and fast and run on time Navigation is very easy and signs and stops are all in English as well as Thai Another plus each ticket has a train map printed on the back Skytrain is a nobrainer for getting around Bangkok

title: Very clean
review: Great clean cheap way to get around Bangkok  The Skytrain is first rate Cleaner than even the trains in DC No fooddrink is allowed so no nasty spillage or ratslike you'll see in DC and NYC  Also it's nice to get some air con when traveling between places )

title: BTS Sky train
review: Best way of getting around Bangkok easy cheap and comfortable  Even in peak hour was not too crowded

title: Easy to use
review: Staff on the platforms were very helpful as we are english speaking and one of our group is in a wheelchair

title: Good transportation with BTS
review: Very crowded train especially in the weekend very convenient transportation to go to places like night market shopping malls or restaurants Easy and user friendly to buy the train tickets from the ticket machine

title: the best transport
review: Sky Train is the best transportation in Thailand It's very fast and not very expensive We enjoyed it even because it was clean and with air conditioning and we avoided taking the terrible and expensive tuk tuk Sky Train goes everywhere in the city of angels

title: Every city should have one!
review: Staying in Banglampoo and want to visit Siam SqSuhkumvit area Take the Chao Phrya Express boats to the BTS Saphin Taksin and grab the sky train Staying around Siam Sq  Suhkumvit and want to visit Chinatown area Take BTS then MRT to Hualampong Station Want to visit Grand Palace area  BTS to Saphan Taksin and take express boat Want to go almost anywhere in Central Bangkok Take the sky train combined with the river express and the underground MRT subway What a wonderful system and it's cheap

title: Very easy to use. The fastest and easiest way to get around.
review: Very easy to use The fastest and easiest way to get around I was at first worried about finding way but it is simple and convenient

title: Best mode to travel within city
review: Clean fast and frequency is pretty good Yes thatâs Bangkok Skytrain At main stations you can also buy ticket by simply selecting the station where you want to go At others just ask the fare by telling the destination to the person at the counter exchange for coins( if you don't have enough change) and buy the ticket For some strange reason machines keep on rejecting the coins but no need to panic just take them to the counter Person at the counter will change it without a word We saw a tourist shouting at the counter I still can't understand how can a problem be resolved by shouting at them when the real reason is that people understand very little English At main stations you will find Tourist Information bureau donated by the symbol âiâ and they are generally very helpful Specially the lady at Taksin station Most of the attractions are easily reachable by Skytrain which makes it all very easy

title: Best Way To Get Around Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain has been one of the best things to have been constructed in Bangkok It is clean cheap air conditioned & easy to navigate the two main lines  the Sukhumvit line & the Silom line It is a good idea to try & find a hotel near the line as you can then get to the best of the shopping (MBK Central World Emporium Chatuchak Markets) and great restaurants  If you have any issues trying to work out from the station maps how much it will cost you from one station to the next there are people at the counter who give change & can advise you how much to pay Unfortunately many of the stations only have stairs to access them (the odd one has escalator access or access directly from a shopping centre) so if you have problems with stairs or have small children you may find it a little difficult In saying that I took my relatively fit 80 year old Dad to Bangkok last year & he managed fine

title: Most convinient
review: If you want to avoid the rush at the change counterscarry your own change preferably many 10 bhat or 5 bhat coins  Carry your ticket card safely  If you choose to travel multiple times (business shopping pleasure) over 3 or more daysits useful to buy a Period Pass  httpwwwbangkokmetrocothticketaspxLang=En&Menu=13  Go to the bathroom at your Hotel since you will not find a facility at the stations  I always take the sky train from the airport to Makassan (then travel onwards within the city by cab)its cheaper (90 baht only) than a taxi from the airport to Makassan(250baht)

title: convenient way to get around Bangkok and to/from the airport
review: Bangkok is renown for it's traffic so I was so thrilled to discover the Skytrain I love going to Bangkok for shopping  so Skytrain is perfect for that It connects to all the major shopping areas  Emporium Siam MBK Chidlom Central World  and of course  all the way to the popular Chatchuchak Weekend Market It's a really inexpensive and fast way to get around You can purchase a day pass  which saves you the hassle of getting change every time and also is a good bargain Most recently  I tried the newly inaugurated ride from the airport This is only recommended if you have NO luggage  just carry on Because the 2 stations in the city requires a lot of walking  updown the steps and there are no elevator access It's cheap but unfortunately is not as fast as a taxi which gets you door to door The  Skytrain is definitely worth using when you're in Bangkok

title: Sky Train from Airport to Phaya Pai
review: Fast 17mins  20 mins from airport to Phaya Pai Ticket is about 150Baht open for two weeks The ride is cosy and easy You can relax on the way down If i am not mistaken its about twice the amount of time

title: Absolutely brilliant
review: Its just marvelous the only hitch is that by river the access is a bit indirect first you have to light Mahraj pier and then you have to get a boat to wat arun place where they sell tcikets is not tidy and always some confusion and yes you dont get a tciket from Mahraj to here means the collector can misappropriate finds

title: Quick travel, but relatively expensive and a real pain with a baby stroller
review: The Skytrain is a great way to travel if you're just adults in your group but with small kids it's different  Children over a certain height pay full adult fare  so our 3 year old paid full fare  That makes the journey more expensive except at the peak of rush hour when taxis are really stuck in traffic  Also there are very few working lifts and at most stations you have to use stairs or escalators to the platforms  so you need to carry baby strollers (not sure what you'd do with a wheelchair)  Having said all that our kids do love riding the sky train  nice aircon good views of the city

title: Much better than the UK Underground!!!
review: I have always used the underground in the UK But the Sky train and MRT train are just the best The stations are well manned lots of security shops very friendly staff speak english on time very fast clean air con lots of announcements cheap and the list can go on I was so impressed with them as I work for a Train company myself The great thing is no food and drink is allowed on the trains Now if we adopted that policy maybe our trains would be that clean on entering there are sniffer dogs police and metal detectors so no crime What can I say we used the train to get everywhere and loved it

title: At rush hour, the metro is like in Moscow
review: During rush hour everyone huddles together nothing is visible from the windows Therefore I didnât get any pleasure but I achieved my goal  I got to Asok for 28 baht from the business center (3 stations) Convenient ground crossings from the metro to shopping centers are a thing you donât have to go down into the hot asphalt city but you can immediately go to the shopping center when leaving the metro

title: Travel by train
review: Traveling by electric train is considered a convenient and fast journey Although it may be a little crowded it is not considered a hindrance to the ride But I'd like to add more chairs

title: Overcrowded!
review: Great to get around but it's so crowded it's almost dangerous Sometimes you have no choice but to use it because the traffic is so bad

title: The best
review: The best way to visit around the city No traffic jam and comfortable Many malls are connected with the BTS station

title: Best public transport option
review: No traffic jams all well marked and instructed trains are convenient and efficient even when the city is smashed by heavy downpour People talk English at the counters you need to only be careful that sometimes are run with different operators and tickets are not same Airport line and the rest Really recommend

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: Fast clean safe and cheap  Choose your hotel to be within a 5 minute walk of a station and you can avoid the infamous taxi and tuk tuk scams  Maps and ticket purchases are also in English There is 1 ticket machine per station with an English option and cash payment This is easy to use 1 Choose English in the top corner of the screen 2 Tap the screen near your destination station and then tap the station name 3 Identify the number of tickets 4 Feed a sufficiently large Thai banknote into the machine to pay Your tickets and change will be provided 5 Tap your card to enter and go up the stairs on the side of the last train station of your journey Keep your ticket as you will need it to exit

title: Very effective
review: Very comfortable and efficient transportation for daily travel Many shopping malls are connected with this BTS line

title: Wonderful transportation
review: Wonderful transportation system in the developing country The staff are very nice and they can speak English well

title: Efficient
review: The easiest way to circumnavigate frantic Bangkok A very afffordable option Can get crowded during peak commuter times

title: super easy way to get around Bangkok!
review: We rode the BTS Skytrain a bunch while in Bangkok and thought it was supereasy to use and affordable  Would definitely use again instead of taxi's

title: Clean, Safe, & Easy to Use
review: Well worth it given that traffic in Bangkok can take hours to drive just a few kilometers especially during the rain  Don't be intimidated by the routes trains or ticket system  All very intuitive in English and selfexplanatory

title: Very clean
review: This system is very useful for getting to many points of interest Wish it ran all night It's very safe

title: Good way to commute
review: expect it to be crowded during the rush hours  they have now upgraded the vending machine so you can scan and pay

title: Aug 2022 visit
review: I had never been to Bangkok before and I still had no problem figuring out how to use the Skytrain system I saved so much time (and money) getting around Bangkok utilizing the Skytrain system The traffic in Bangkok is staggering I would never opt for a taxi or other street vehicle transport over Skytrain

title: Best way to guide your way!
review: If you getting hurry you must to thinkking at it in the city traffic is normal things but you unable jump or killing your times so here best  options for everyone and need it

title: Timing
review: It's very good at going around the town especially during peak hours where traffic is horrible Also most of the shopping malls are offices that have a direct link to the building

title: TO the BIG Bangkok Market
review: We took the skytrain to Bangkok's biggest Saturday market Another VERY hot day but the market was super  Getting there from our godson's apartment was easy by skytrain  Simple to operate and we bought our tickets at the platform with our godson's help

title: Fast & Covenience Transportation System
review: The first electric rail transportation in Thailand Fast & Covenience Transportation System suitable for many place in Bangkok

title: Great mass transit
review: On time good and clean Staff go out of their way to help people Especially people that are physically andor mentally handicapped

title: Very reliable rail mass transit, easy to figure out
review: Save time and get a Rabbit card first You don't save money but you save time at ticket machines finding change waiting in line and figuring things out Also you can change your destination in midroute without penalty Just don't lose the card  or you will likely lose the value you have on it Don't put more than THB300 on it just in case  BTS is efficient much faster than taxis between stops and has plenty of English mapssignage to help anyone figure out how to use the system  At certain times the train is extremely crowded especially at central stations like Siam Unlike NYC BTS cleans their trains throughout the day and sanitizes at night Seating is very limited and riders are expected to give seating priority to monks elderly women and the injured Be respectful and follow the guidance  their culture their rules There are new stations opening and a new system opening to DMK Transfers from one system to another (eg BTS to MRT or ARL) usually involves a bit of a hike (up to 1KM) but there are signs

title: Best way to travel around the city
review: Easy to plane and understand the routes Staff too is really helpful and will guide you thru Conditions of the stations were pretty good and one will like using this option

title: BTS Skytrain - too expensive
review: WeÂ´ve only used the skytrain once ItÂ´s clean but also expensive compared to other transportation and it is not necessary

title: Quick & Efficient
review: Stayed three days in Bangkok Used sky train every day from Victory Monument Station Watched You Tube video before using Great for getting around all main attractions and cheap   Found Saphan Taksin station particularly useful for the river area and Sathorn Pier River trips available from here  used Boat 4 U Hop on Hop Off   Purchased tickets both from kiosk and machine  easy to use can select information in English On first trip I took photo of train map on my phone for reference

title: Easy
review: Easy to navigate even for tourists who don't speak Thai Quick and efficient way to get around the city

title: Easy way to get ariuns
review: I watched a short YouTube video before I headed out for the day  Cheap and easy to use I didnât use the ticket machines and got all my tickets from the ticket booth Staff were helpful

title: Best and most convenient way to travel
review: With the traffic in Bangkok the easiest way is to travel with the BTS Itâs clean on time convenient and safe

title: BTS Skytrain
review: BTS Skytrain is a fast and trafficfree transportation but because we were staying at the Khaosan road which is quite far to the BTS station we only tried it once While in Thailand we used an online taxi because it was easily reached more economically because we were five Hopefully the next visit will have many additional BTS Skytrain routes

title: Great way to get around
review: Really liked this modern air conditioned skyliner   Best way to travel from airport to hotel   The multi day passes are particularly good value

title: Best mode of travel.
review: The BTS sky train was my favorite way to travel around Bangkok Clean inexpensive air conditioned and efficient

title: First class customer service
review: Travelling with friends from Taiwan one of whom has an impaired vision The moment the bts staff saw my friend (who carried a walking stick) the staff rushed over to ask us where our destination was We were next escorted through the side gate to get to the train platform He also ensured that we boarded the train safely Upon our arrival at our destination there was another bts staff who were waiting for us He escorted us down the lift and out of the bts station Thumbs up for the great service Experienced similar service in Japan Singapore is lagged behind in this area and should follow the example set by Japan and neighbouring Thailand

title: Wonderful!
review: The sky train is a great way to get around and we use it every time we are Bangkok Clean air conditioned and runs like a well oiled machine

title: Very Convenient!!!
review: My daughter and I took the BTS as our mode of transportation Friday night from Siem to Terminal 21 Mall During heavy traffic this mode of transportation is most convenient in Bangkok if you need to get somewhere quick The BTS is also an expensive mode of transportation  Definitely the way to go

title: Easy access to many places but overcrowded
review: Its a nice option to go to most of the places however overcrowded in the evenings Its little difficult to get the tickets as well

title: Paul
review: The BTS security checking is useless can they check terrorist  They don't check every passenger Wasting tourists' time

title: BTS
review: The advantage of taking  BTS is saving time  avoiding traffic in Bangkok and saving funds  Every station is only 1 KM distance

title: MBK to Sala Daeng
review: We visited MBK Centre and decided to catch the BTS back to our hotel area We caught the BTS at National Stadium heading for Sala Daeng The user experience of the trains is great  the map inside the trains tells you where you are and you can see the stops light up as the train progresses Made it super simple Not to mention cheap

title: Absolute do

title: Business
review: Very neat and clean Impressive It is very easy and convenient to go all key points All the coaches are very cool Each stations is very clean

title: Great way to get around
review: If you are near the skytrain I highly recommend using it to get around  Quick and easy to buy tickets and reach all the major attractions

title: Excellent!
review: Great fast way to get around the city Lots of maps lots of staff and very inexpensive Highly recommended

title: Best BTS
review: Love this public transport It is so convenient and efficient  Although the trains are always pack you will never miss your journey  Clean fast like lighting

title: Very efficient and user friendly
review: We traveled along the BTS line and found it very clean fast not expansive and user friendly It avoid traffic jam on the road as Bangkok is famous for its bad traffic

title: Great

title: Very convenient
review: I found it very convenient and one of the best way to move around Bangkok Bangkok's taxi service is notorious For tourists (my experience) they don't use the meter They will voice their own fares So fellow travelers do try the sky train or mrt for hassle free travel around Bangkok

title: Best way to travel
review: Used the BTS service and it was convenientfastclean well managed with staff at stations being very helpful in giving guidance location maps also gives you guidancethe announcement in English inside the trains does help whole day pass of 145 Baht is worth it depending on your usage

title: need more ticket machines
review: The first hurdle is buying the tickets as the queue are so long we waited nearly 30 minutes Then the queue for the train was long so in all going 3 stations took us an hour

title: Convenient

title: Easy to use

title: Very clean Very efficient
review: we used the train to get to the king power tower and back it were amazed at how clean and efficient it was and provided us with a different view of the city whilst avoid the busy roads and streets we bought our tickets using the touch screen computers(in English) in the station and payed with cash

title: Similar like we have in Tokyo
review: good and cheap way to explore Bangkok it saved lot of my time and money to visit Bangkok city i will recommend others to travel by BTS don't waste more money on taxi they are expensive and late because of traffic jam

title: Timesaver
review: The train is nice and modern although very busy during a rush hour Carriages are quite modern air conditioned Announcements and descriptions  are in English as well So go The network could be wider

title: Great
review: Nice and easy ticket machine easy tap English screen type in your destination and put your money in and you get a token tap it on the glass of the style and it let's you through then at your stop put the token into the slot easy

title: Easy to commute but way too busy
review: Trains are good and clean and services are good Train has English speaking station information so you know where to get off It is good experience however trains are packed (around 10 AM) and we had to let go 1 train All trains are packed like sardines

title: Easy

title: The best way to get around BKK
review: This was a great experience its the best way and by fare the fastest way to move around BKK i suggest to every turist to use the BTS and not the tuk tuk  it will take you to almost every corner of BKK  the price you move fastis cheap comparing to taxi or tuk tuk It also connect to the Airport train Day pas is about 150 bth

title: great
review: thi  s was a great experience i suggest to every turist to use the BTS and not the tuk tuk  it will take you to every corner of bkk  the price is cheap comparing to taxi ir tuk tuk

title: Easy when you know how
review: The Bangkok Sky Train is such an efficient service ( and cheap) that itâs the obvious way to travel throughout the city They donât seem to issue Sky train maps any more which is a pain and although I always bring one that I got there on my first visit in 2007 itâs not 100 per cent reliable as some of the lines have been extended and arenât on the map Mo Chit is no longer the last station on the line which got me confused Until I got used to it I bought a day saver ticket which gives unlimited travel for a day so you can use any amount of trains till you get back on track and thereâs no need to keep queuing for tickets

title: Great experience
review: Fastest and best way to travel Very economical and comfortable A must travels and try for all You also get great sky view of the city

title: Good service
review: Good service but now very busy A good way to get around Bkk and to reach Payathai for train to Airport

title: Conveniently linking to Must visit places!
review: BTS is very tourist friendly rates and stations are visually available Tickets are easily purchased at the counter if you're not comfortable having a Rabbit Card Links to Chatucak via BTS Mo Chit and Pratunam via BTS Ratchetewi

title: Easy to use
review: The easiest and cheapest way to get around Bangkok As an extra bonus all the trains have brilliant air conditioning  which allows you to cool down between attractions

title: Clean and Efficient
review: The best way to go around Bangkok Get the Rabbit card for a smooth experience Easily connected to the MRT and Airport Rail

title: Cheap but crowded
review: A good way to experience the locals' life BTS allow you to avoid the traffic jam in Bangkok However expect crowds at the peak hour (such as evening) and you might need to wait for the next (or 2 more trips) to get in You can use coins which is available at the counters of each stations Sometimes there were security officers who will randomly check for bags

title: Brilliant way to travel
review: Very clean mode of transport We found it easy to navigate our way around This is also very clean with air conditioning Very cheap too

title: Quick but busy
review: A great way to get around central Bangkok Pretty crowded and squashed space when travelling Also not every station has an escalatorlift so lots of steps up and down

title: One of the best urban rail systems
review: I first rode a Skytrain in 2004 Since then on my occasional visits to Thailand I prefer traveling by Skytrain when I can The trains are clean and safe the stations are well maintained and people (except tourists) are orderly when boarding trains even at crowded times

title: Fast moving
review: Skytrain is a great experience  cheap and easy to get around Clean and tidy and on time Stations are good and staff very helpful

title: Amazingly efficient
review: Enjoyed using the Skytrain to move around Bangkok  Initially confusing to understand prices and stations but was able to understand after using for a day

title: MANAGING TIMES IN TRAVEL CAN GET .
review: NOW THE ROOT OF TRANSPORTATION MORE IMPORTANTLY not for business but also students saving times to school and universities

title: Fairly easy to navigate and clean
review: An easy way to get around Bangkok as long as you know the name of the station you need to get to it is easy

title: Very convenience but cold inside
review: The train is great to avoid the congested road The only negative is that the Aircon is on full blast If you are all sweaty from walking on the streets be prepared for a cold blast once you step into the train

title: Not user friendly
review: The train system need a lot of improvement Firstly the ticket system  Where I come from we only need 1 card or ticket for all train Train system in Bangkok need to be synchronize for commuters It makes the journey seamless

title: Stay out of the traffic!
review: As a visitor the first couple of times I only used taxis but this is a huge money saver and time saver as taxis can be stuuuuuuuuck for more than an hour sometimes

title: Convenient Transportation
review: They were quick comfortable a very good way to go around the city without worrying about the heat

title: Brilliant - get on it
review: Do yourself a favour and avoid the traffic jams of Bangkok and hop above it all and get on the bts We used this mode of transport a lot to get around and itâs a fantastic system  I recommend  only one issue  many many stairs

title: A nice ride good with kids
review: We were heading towards siam square from suarvnabumi airport terminal and opted for the sky train to give our children the chance to experience something new The trains are clean and punctual and you can catch glimpses of the city from a different angle Also reasonably priced I'd recommend it

title: Easy way to travel and affordable
review: There are regular trains to many destinations within Bangkok The trains are clean We walked to the train station at midnight and it was closed think it closes at 1130pm

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok CBD area!
review: The traffic in Bangkok can be nightmare so using the BTS is a guaranteed way to avoid the horrible traffic It's so convenient I used BTS all the time to go the Benjasiri and Benjakiti parks However avoid rush hours eg 700 o'clock in the morning if possible especially those going into town lines and 500 pm going out of town lines ^_^

title: Very convienent
review: Buy a day pass and explore this city that is extremely difficult to drive around in a cab or uber Very good value

title: Best way to get about
review: If you are a tourist probably the most effective way to get about avoiding the ground level street traffic  It is exceedingly convenient to anyone staying along the Sukhumvit corridor  It is both easy and cheap to use tickets are obtained from machines that take cash only (with an English language option) or at ticket offices where the staff seem to understand English  Alternatively you can get a travel card which can be topped up as you need  Trains run from left to right at platforms  They are very popular and at times very crowed  Asoke station being an interchange with the Metro seems to always be busy but it all works and trains rum regularly so there is very little wait time

title: Too busy at peak hours
review: Sometimes itâs unbearable to use during peak hours Squashed in like fish And is not cheap anymore

title: Sky Bus
review: It  was nice experience to travel  by sky  train There was no delay in reaching our destination I would  suggest the tourist to travel by  sky train

title: The perfect way to see all of Bangkok
review: Fast efficient regular spotless The perfect way to explore all of the city Easy to buy a ticket either through the machine or ticket booth Note the machine will only take coins not bills Go to the booth itâs easier and their English is perfect You could buy a multijourney Rabbit Ticket if staying for a week or more otherwise you will need to buy singe oneway tickets for all journeys The fares are based on distance Easy interchange between colourcoded lines and English announcements inside the train to tell you the next station

title: Don't be intimidated: try the BTS!
review: I took the BTS from the Ekkamai station where my bus came in from Pattaya to the S7 stop which involved a transfer All went smoothly and I stayed out of the famous Bangkok traffic jams When I bought the ticket I told the woman where I wanted to go and she helped tell me what stop to go to for the transfer The skytrain is clean modern and posts its next stops so you are not left wondering when to get off  Give it a try

title: Best way to beat the Traffic Jams
review: Cheap & fast way to get from Points A to Z sure beat the traffic jams in Bangkok Very efficient and user friendly

title: Really the best to go around , in sukhumvit so much traffic sometimes
review: Really the best to go around   in sukhumvit so much traffic sometimes  You have the view also And quick from one place to another place

title: Easy rider...Bangkok.
review: The BTS is such an easy way to get around the main central areas of the city Itâs inexpensive efficient and very clean However it can be packed

title: Clean, Fast and Easy
review: It is the best way to go around Bangkok Take a chargable card Some of them are valid up to 5 years Stations are well indicated on the TV sceens in the train There are only 2 lines no risk of confusions

title: " so easy too use& family friendly "
review: This above city railing is so easy too use and family friendly Staff at kiosks appear too all speak good English to assist you with going too where you want to go Security personnel on platforms are also very helpful The trains are really clean and there's a very ordilary pace for alighting and getting off the trains It doesnt cover all of Bangkok but it is helpful for some places Stations have lifts for disabled users The rest of the world can learn alot from the Thailand way of helping people get around

title: very convenience to travel
review: Fast and reasonable fare to visit Bangkok city tour spot in a few BTS station  security is good so you are very safe in and out the BTS station

title: So convenient
review: BTS Skytrain is a life saver in Bangkok U can literally get from any part of Bangkok to another in minutes Plus itâs connected to subway to Even if u are a stranger to the citythe instructions are so clear i cant get lost or confused Prices are affordable too I just wish they had connectivity from downtown too

title: Best way to travel around bangkok. And cheaper than take a taxi
review: For foreigners and thais on the rushhours is quite hard to call a taxi Bts is easiest way to travel from sukhumvit to Prathumwan or Jattujak If your group have a few person 23 person use bts is cheaper than take a taxi MBKSiam Station theses are very attractive mall and Landmark in bangkok Siam Station have Siam Square is a trendy Square a lot of fashion shop and restaurant for teens Siam Paragon Have Aquarium and Theater Very easy to visit

title: comfortable and fast
review: I use sky train from Siam Paragon to Nana station very comfortable and faster than taxi because in Bangkok is traffic jam and have many stations to drop you at Sukhumvit road inside the train have information and show all the stations please decision to use sky train when you stay in Bangkok

title: Transport
review: Itâs so easy to get around on the BTS system similar to the London Underground but on the surface and itâs clean with AC which you really appreciate Itâs also fairly economical too Maps are in English and Thai so that helps

title: Easy to use.
review: Used whilst in Bangkok for three days had seen a video how to use the system Low season often it felt we were the only tourist on the trains Personally I loved the AC lol Efficienteasy way to get around really loved the three days using them

title: On time
review: Itâs the cheapest and it takes you almost everywhere in Bangkok If youâre staying more than 4 days itâs better to get a Rabbit card Get your passport and buy a Rabbit card so you donât have to buy a day pass everyday

title: Loved the Skytrain!
review: Bangkok's Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok During our 6day visit we rode the Skytrain everyday always buying the oneday pass It's safe fast and efficient It's on an elevated platform allowing riders to see the city from above We rode it to get to Saphan Taskin stop where we caught the Chao Phraya Hopon HopOff Tourist Boat We rode it part of the way to Amphawa Floating Market

title: Great system
review: A wonderful system for getting aroung Bangkok quickly Outside of the rush hours the trains are not so packed The only problem is that if you need to change to another line you will need to buy another ticket

title: sky train
review: service every 2 minutes peak times are very packed so if your not a people person avoid these times but a clean cheap way of getting around Bancock  highly recommend

title: Crowded
review: Took it from the airport today into Bangkok It's by far the quickest routebut was crowdedit did however have disabled toilets

title: fast, cheap
review: We used the train for single journeys and a day ticket They were bought at the ticket office with no problem no need for getting change or lining up at the machines Around Â£4 for the day

title: Definitely best way to get around
review: The traffic in downtown Bangkok is not just bad it's really bad Most people here say that before you even get here So travel quickly with little stress by skytrain

title: Day pass
review: Get a day pass for 140 baht good from 1200 to 2400 Or if you are going to be in Bangkok for a week or so get a rabbitcard

title: Impressive infrastructure!!!
review: I was impressed with the BTS skytrain system in Bangkok Though I took a short ride it was easy and comfortable and even as a first time rider it was so convenient for me I surely saved a lot of time and money thanks to BTS

title: Best way to travel
review: Love the BTS skytrain Travel to Bangkok on many occasions and use the Rabbit Card for all my journeys on the BTS I use the BTS at least 8 times a day because its frequent fast and easy to get around the various parts of the city i spend my time

title: No traffic, On time, A girl from Myanmar loves this transportation
review: When you are in Bangkok use BTS or MRT rather than cars of buses They have no traffic and they are on time I once used taxi to go to a certain place and I got stuck in traffic and took 15 hour for a 30 minutes ride

title: Hassle free travel
review: The Skytrain is an effective and enjoyable mode of transport when in Bangkok It saves on time during peak traffic hours In terms of money there a small difference in its fares and that of a taxi Ticket counters are operated by English speaking operators and are quite helpful with information Interestingly we did not observe any kind of checking while entering the station which is a sign of peace and security in the city

title: Cheap, easy, clean way to get around the city.
review: If youâve been to Bangkok the one thing you know is the traffic The rideshare companies while convenient donât help when youâre stuck in traffic My friend and I turned to the sky train one day to see if it was a better mode of transportation and it absolutely was Itâs inexpensive itâs clean itâs on time and itâs easy to figure out how to purchase tickets at the kiosks  I would suggest downloading one of the BTS map apps (there are a couple) so you can become familiar with the lines and the stops

title: A MUST if you plan to move around Bangkok quickly!
review: Saying that Bangkok has heavy traffic is an understatement My husband and I recently spent 4 days in Bangkok and used the Skytrain 90% of the time (We took a few tuk tuks and Grabs after the train stops operating at midnight) The fares are very affordable We used it to travel from the airport to our hotel (Modena by Fraser) to move around the city and then back to the airport

title: Amazing Air Conditioning
review: Not only do the trains run on time but in the sweltering heat of Bangkok they are an oasis of cool with their brilliant air conditioning

title: The only way to travel
review: Best and quickest way to get around During peak hour it could take you a couple of hours by vehicle Using the skytrain takes around 20minutes If you use a taxis that have a meter you will work out that this is cheaper then a Toktok I caught a metered taxi and the cost was 70b on the way home I caught a Tokyo and they wanted 200b So always make the counter offer 25% of what they want

title: Easy

title: Most convenient way to explore they city of Bangkok

title: Convenient

title: Brilliant

title: Improved a lot!
review: It has since improved a lot from  my last visit to Bangkok Access to major places and very convenient

title: BTS Skytrain
review: If you have 12 Days in BKK for anything purposesBTS Skytrain is very crucial requirement for your daily transportationSkytrain is active and lifeline channel of Thailand people and all visitors peopleIt is fully Air Conditioning Servicecleanquiet and safety while I was in BKK for every timeall BTS station is located at the great accessible area interchange to MRT and Airport Red Links and link to other bus terminals are reachable for peoples A card and Coin change systemlift and escalators for disabled persons and attached The concrete step ladders is very useful for active passengersIt is always right time service and helps for elder and disabilities persons to come up and go out for easilyTicket rate is very cheap and less taking time to escape the traffic JamWorth for rides

title: Easy way to travel
review: We found this really easy to use and navigate around the city We didnât travel in rush hour so canât comment on how busy it gets Donât be scared

review: Very quick and easy way to explore Bangkokcheap toolanguage is a barrier here as ppl understand very little Englishvery little means yes no thank u etc

title: Clean and efficient but crowded
review: So much more busy than 20 years ago but great service not too expensive and avoids the traffic on the roads  Very handy if you're near the stops

title: A great way to get around.

title: Fast and safe

title: Makes getting quick but very crowded

title: Linking everywhere with heart of Bangkok

title: Very convenient
review: Very convenient and connected to all major spots and MRT station and also water taxi station Price is cheap

title: BTS
review: This sly train  is the first mass transit of Bangkok thanks to it   Now after 20 some years BTS extends to  three directions namely north to Kasetsat Univ east to BangPu  and Tonburi side to BangHwa      BTS makes change to area passing by  means development  follows  its route condominiums  seen along BTS routes and land cost shoots   Anyway travelling via BTS is convenient  especially to department stores and  centers like Bitec   Connecting to Airport Rail Link to Suwanapum airport to MRT to express boat available at certain stations  Try it

title: Cheap and fast transportation

title: Easy to Navigate
review: It can be super crowded during rush hours (it's the same elsewhere anyhow) but it's very convenient

title: Very Good System
review: We pretty much took the BTS to go wherever we wanted to in Bangkok The system is well connected to other train lines like the MRT and famous tourist attractions Office staff at the stations generally friendly but not all Still i do appreciate the ease of travelling in this train and to go where we wanted to Price is reasonable too First time using you might be stuck and make mistakes but after 2 or 3 times you will understand it

title: Overpriced

title: Easy to get around
review: An easy way to get around in Bangkok Comfortable ride but can be crowded And you donât have to stay in the traffic below Come and goes on time Recommended for easy travel in Bangkok

title: The Greatest transformation way
review: Itâs such a very good way to getting to my directions and very convinced when I wanna take a short trip in Bangkok for a few weeks I was really happy with that cheers I love Thailand and the never sleep city like Bangkok

title: best way to travel in BKK
review: one thing u must know is BKK is known for its craziness when come to it's traffic Therefore the best way to travel around is via it's famous skytrain  so use u can go to so many places  like malls and attraction

title: Easy transport
review: By far the quickest and easiest way to travel the sprawl that is Bangkok and due to increase in size shortly with stops further from the capital

title: Best transport
review: Fast clean easy The best way to move in Bkk and avoid traffic jam Not expensive and not too crowded

title: Best service
review: Best transport facility in Thailand I loveed it very much My children also likeed the sky train  Stuffs arw will behaved and friendly to tourists like us Most cheap mode of transportation in Bangkok

review: the only thing which I find is not good sometimes they use their aircondition to really cool down it gets really coolcold

title: Seeing friends
review: It was a bit crowded on peak time which is about 700 PM But it is always convenience due to avoiding traffic jam

title: BTS
review: It is the best way to travel the trains are on time always it very convenient for all the travel i like it

title: easy skytrain
review: Besides being easy to ride the skytrain people that work there are very helpful and most of them speak english Is a good price very clean I met very nice peoplepolite and friendly

title: 1st class system
review: Well run and wellorganized public network that is quick clean and reasonably priced The only problem is that this service is limited in coverage but expansion are being worked on

title: A must do in every city
review: but especially Bangkok Actually with kids it was cheaper for us to use Taxis but we had to experience the BTS Skytrain Crowded but fun quick and pretty cheap

title: For some reason, a rabbit card not requires you to show your passport
review: For some reason you need to show our passport to buy and even to top up a rabbit card Hopeless That said the skytrain is a good way to avoid the traffic Also it's sometimes more convenient to walk on the mezzanine than on the sidewalk  the skybrides are usually connected to nearby malls

title: Save your coins for the BTS "sky train"
review: Great way to get around much of the city especially shopping and getting to the river boats  Fastest way on is to use the coin operated ticket machines  1)  press english buttion 2) tap where you are going  3) after it zooms in on the map pick the exact station destination 4) number of tickets (default is 1)    5) put in coins  Any change and your ticket will drop into the lower compartment  Tap your ticket entering turnstyle SAVE YOUR TICKET when you exit insert your ticket turnstyle  will keep it No paper litter and used tickets  There for a long time get a "pass" at the window and you can recharge it  That you will swipe at exits  Amazing sight  when there are a few hundred people waiting at a busy station But they are all lined up single file for  the side of each door  The center in front of the door remains clear so passengers can exit easily BEFORE the waiting passengers board

title: Efficient and useful
review: Avoid traffic jams and hop on to the BTS Gets you practically everywhere in no time Use the Skytrain to walk on the overhead sky walk in the CenterWorld area

title: Still excellent but getting very crowded
review: I have used the BTS since 2007 It has always been excellent Punctual clean with friendly helpful staff and spotless facilities With the line extensions and population growth as rush hour itâs like Japan or other high volume transport lines Talking to the locals they say the issue is not enough carriages Highly recommended but avoid peak hour

title: Safe transit
review: I'm a 60 year old and traveling with friends but we decided to do different things So I took MRT to other sights at night and felt safe Just have small bills or change

title: Good public transportation
review: We used BTS for commuting between different parts of Bangkok It was good service We found it always on time Ticketing was easy However for near stations it was expensive   It you are traveling in group of 3 Grab taxi services will be more better option based on the costfair

title: Convenient,safe way to travel
review: Yes there are many reviews and advice about using the BTSI tried to follow and get the Rabbit card but didn't have my passport with meSotry and get the Rabbit cardtopup with cash so that you can not only use for the BTS but at other food outlets and convenience storesCashless transactio  is the way to go I used 'LINE Pay' so if you are using LINE app it's good to go at the BTS

title: A must
