review: We disliked the amount of pollution in this city so where possible this option of transport avoided this  Air conditioned too

title: Good, cheap way of travelling
review: So much quicker than getting around by taxi Clean cool trains that run often and quickly takes you to the station closest to your destination From there on you can take a taxi

title: Convenient
review: If you donât mind a little bit of crowd during the rush hour use the BTS instead of the road Use the day pass when heading to more places

title: Efficient and not to crowdy
review: It takes some time to adjust (as usual for mass transit systems in big cities) but not too much There are enough English station names to find your way There are many attractions and areas not covered by the train and this is the main reason for the 35 score

title: fastest way to commute
review: This is definitely the fastest way to commute to certain areas in Bangkok  its getting crowded at certain times of the day but still faster than taking a taxi and surely more safer  Other option is the subway or MRT

title: Clean, efficient and very connectivity
review: I visit Bangkok occasionally about 2  3 times a year Each time I come I am fascinated with the new developments of the BTS   It is usually packed liked sardines during peak hours  but I am amazed that the authority is able to cope with the immense passengers both locals and foreign  Most interesting is the entertainment on the BTS  The advertisements are usually cute and fun so it makes my rider pleasant despite the packed trains  The extension of the BTS to more and more farther routes helps to ease traffic congestion and I give thumbs up for such initiative to improvve the life of the citizens Keep it up

title: Very easy top Learn this way of getting around
review: This is probably one of the easiest and inexpensive ways of getting around Bangkok Trains are very clean climate controlled which is great because they can get packed full

title: A better option to a taxi
review: This train system is easy to navigate and cost very little money  There are transportation representatives at each station to provide change when needed If you have basic map reading skills you should have little issue getting around Bangkok

title: Covenient
review: Cheapest and best way to travel around the city its better for tourist to learn to use BTS instead of being charged skyhigh fees by some taxis or motorcycle taxis

title: Still the best way to get around the city
review: You can't beat the efficiency and convenience of the BTS skytrain It snakes the long stretch of Sukhumvit and Silom areas making it comfortable to get from point A to point B In previous visits we used to get the unlimited daypass but in our last visit we got a rabbit card which we could reload and use in establishments around the city  The trains and clean and cool  and even during rush hour one would feel a level of comfort

title: efficient, comfortable, convenient
review: It is a good clean service takes you to all important places Can connect you to Airport link train at PAYA THA station Pretty economic and convenient to use Stations clean One day Pass cost US$ 45 US$

title: To get around in Bangkok
review: Gr8 too get from airport too Bangkok center and back too airports  Good price as well and easy to find your way around Thay have information in Thai and in English

title: Better than sitting in traffic
review: The reach of the BTS is rather limited and quite a few of the main Bangkok attractions are not accessible You can reach the big malls the weekend market transfers to the water taxi and the metro If your destination is near the BTS then youâre in luck Use if you can as it is much faster than the street traffic Be warned that at peak times you will crammed in there shouldertoshoulder with potentially hundreds of other sweaty commuters

title: Nice, clean, and efficient. However, Grab can be cheaper.
review: Nice clean and efficient However Grab can be cheaper Only use the BTS if you are expecting a jam on the road (which is quite often though)

title: Accessible
review: Accessible to main shopping and business centers The line is along sukhumvit and extends to tourist areas in samrong

title: The Jetsons are in Bangkok !
review: Great way to travel around the city  Wonderful views  Brilliant idea and engineering It's a shame some of the trains are wrapped in  advertising because it makes it hard to see out of the windows  Especially on journey from airport

title: Easy to use
review: Really easy to use but your ticket from a kiosk as they are very helpful You can buy a day ticket or individual journeys Some stations connect with the MRT

title: Fast and inexpensive way to travel.
review: We stayed at a hotel next to the terminal and took the skytrain to the malls and dentist while in Bangkok This is a great way to travel around the city So much cheaper and faster than taking a taxi or tuk tuk especially during the peak travel times I recommend taking the train and getting off close to your location and then walking or taking a taxi to your final destination We found it to be clean and easy to use  The train does get packed during work days but we still found it to be a great way to travel

title: Great transportation
review: The most favorite vehicle during stay in bangkok Almost all the company employee can speak english so have no problem to get any information

title: Awesome!
review: We travelled from Mo Chit to Siam on the BTS after taking the airport bus to Mo Chit Even though we had luggage with us it was still easy to travel on this elevated train The staff at the station was very helpful and spoke good English The seats were comfortable and the BTS was very neat and clean Overall it was a great experience

title: Fastest way of Transport
review: The streets of Bangkok are extremely busy during certain time periods of the day and this is by far the best way to get around town

title: Fast and Efficient
review: I just buy a day ticket for the few trips Money wise maybe better to buy single trips but it is so much more convenient and efficient to buy a day ticket for 140 Baht

title: Efficient and cheap to use
review: Best avoided during peak times as everyone is going and coming home from work which makes it extremely busy Otherwise itâs a very efficient way of getting around Bangkok The last station is listed both on the signage and on the train itself in English making navigation quite simple Tickets can be bought at the self service vending machines You need to know which station you are going to and have small change If staying in Bangkok for a few days it can be helpful to invest in a Rabbit card which can be pre loaded and enables tapping in and tapping out at the stations which saves time lining up for change and tickets

title: Great transpiration system
review: Bangkok is a very busy place and congested Travelling by car is slow The BTS skytrain is easy to use convenient and very efficient I would use the skytrain as my first option in the future

title: Easy to use
review: We used the skytrain several times to meet tour guides at different locations and also to see sights of Bangkok  Found it very easy to purchase tickets either by machine or ticket office  Had a map which made it very easy Most times we were able to get seats but standing wasnât an issue  Clean and efficient

title: Super easy to use
review: Getting around Bangkok is really easy using the sky rail system Buy your tickets at the ticket window at any station All stations are in English and Thai and voice overs telling you what station is next are in Thai and English Really cheap fast andceasy

title: Easy to use
review: I'm not good at public transport  and ticketing etc but this was very simple to use and good signposting  Regular service and lovely clean air conditioned carriages

title: Travel
review: Great way to travel within the city Little crowdy in the morning and evening But anyway a good reason to use it

title: Best way to transport yourself
review: In the long time I stayed in bangkok i always use the bts system Fast and no traffic jams like on almost every road in bangkok If you need to go somewhere you can use bts or mrt

title: Accessible to places
review: It can be crowded specially during rush hour but people line up and wait for others to go out of the train before entering It's a cheap and easiest transport to go around BKK

title: Efficient and well priced means of travel
review: Good signage cleanpunctual service and decent prices Crowded of course so be prepared to stand but much nicer than underground travel If you get a whole day ticket you can get on and off wherever you fancy

title: Super way to see the city.
review: This system works great And itâs a super cheap way to get around the city We used it everyday of our 6 nights on BK

title: Easy to use and reliable
review: There are options to take tuktuks taxis and motorcycle taxis  The BTS was probably the most reliable as a tourist as there is no 'haggling' required to negotiate prices with most taxis out there   The water taxicanal boat was probably the cheapest otherwise but the BTS was easy to navigate and pay

title: Saves time
review: Use it as it is fast easy to navigate and will save a lot of time compared to the chaos on the road  But then be ready to face the crowd

title: during my holiday in Bangkok i use BTS
review: it is convenient and rather cheaper than what it cost in my home country i took BTS from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Central Bangkok luckily i arrived off peak time within 40 min i arrived at Sukhumvit Road where hotel located Most of the time it is clean and frequency of train is every 6minutes Signage in English is everywhere just avoid peak time in the morning and evening 5pm

title: Safe, Simple and Punctual
review: It was my first time taking the train in Bangkok From arrival into Suvarnabhumi Airport to the hotel and also departure from Bangkok It was easy and fast bypassing toll and traffic compared to taking the taxi Most of all the ride only cost less than THB100 for both ways

title: Crazy busy
review: Public transportation in a city is always busy and BTS is the same  But it is clean and very easy to navigate  The ticket agents were helpful and understood English

title: Fast, easy and convenient
review: I used the BTS Skytrain well over a dozen times over my 4 days in Bangkok  It was convenient to my hotel on Sukhumvit and was able to get me close to everything I wanted  It is easy to read the map to find where you need to go  One thing I would do next time is purchase a day pass since I used it so frequently

title: Great way to get around
review: Fantastic way to get around Bangkok clean and fast Easy to understand ticket machine Just research where you want to go and which station you need to disembark  Ferry connection was easy from Sathorn pier as was just a short walk up the stairs to the train platform leaving from Khao san rd Great way to get to the MBK at National Stadium station  It is also handy to access the MRT line  Recommend a day pass for 140baht for the skytrain it allows travel between 6am and 12pm unlimited Tickets not transferrable between BTS and MRT lines You will need to get tokens or a day pass for 120baht if travelling on the MRT line

title: Clean and efficient
review: Took the BTS on my way to CHATUCHAK market The train is clean comfy and right on time From the sound of the engine it is well maintained  Their train routes are easy to adapt and follow No intersecting routesð

title: Best way to move around Bangkok
review: Easy and effortless   By far the most convenient way to get around  Bangkok   Such an easy system to use

title: Excellent transportation
review: You can go almost everywhere with this and its much faster than taxi because of the traffic We enjoyed riding the BTS very clean and fast and easy too

title: A Systematic train system - your best and easiest way to city
review: I have took more than 20 rounds of BTS throughout my journey of 5 days trip it is so convenient so affordable and it is a necessity of traffic means to any places in Bangkok

title: clean
review: nice trains always on time and clean  a bit loud advertisements but its ok if u got headphones  best way to travel in Bangkok

title: So easy to get around with BTS!
review: Itâs my first time by myself in Bangkok and I had some worries about taking the train but BTS took those worries away It was easy to use and the staff were polite albeit some language barrier in some stations Trains were so clean too

title: Best transport
review: Try to avoid rush hour besides that it is a very nice and easy way to travel Remember to keep your ticket all the way you need it for exit

title: Super easy to use
review: Iâm not the biggest fan of taking public transportation in a country where you donât speak the language (or know how to read it) but the sky train was SO easy to use We found where we were going on a map showed it to the front desk help and they purchased or tickets and showed us which way to go without even saying a word Everyone was very helpful and we felt very comfortable riding the train everywhere There are raised walkways throughout the city right off of the stops which makes walking around extremely easy Car traffic is HORRIBLE in Bangkok so this is a welcome alternative

title: Easily avoiding Bangkok traffic and fully air conditioning
review: If you want to travel around Bangkok and also connect to airport rail link to international airport users friendly and best used time not in business rush hours

title: Well organised!
review: Worked very well an on time Good and clear english directions Neat and clean stations and trains Really enjoyed the rides

title: Avoid the traffic and go by BTS
review: The BTS is convenient to get around Bangkok There is also a connection to the MRT and then there is the Airport Link Going by BTS is the best way to organise your time and beats the 2 hour plan to get somewhere and not miss an appointment They open early and the self service has English but there's always helpful staff or friendly locals to ask There are times that there are delays but I've not experienced anything major You can get change for the self service machines on the stations

title: Wish every city I visited had a transportaion system like this
review: Love the BTS for getting to wherever I need while in Bangkok  Whether to and from airport to JJ Market to business areas to shopping to entertainment the BTS is the way to go  Time your travel so you avoid morning and evening rush (or don't and get the experience) grab a strap and explore the city

title: Very easy to navigate
review: We were in Bangkok for 1 week and were told to get a Rabbit pass which we did  I think it was about $300 US  We used the pass once and I promptly lost my card  When we went a second time my husband's card didn't work so not certain why  We just continued to buy individual tickets  The machines give you an English option and are easy to figure out  If you need change you can get it at the information window  All people are most helpful if you have any questions  Plus the best part about the skytrain is that the cars are airconditioned  Such a relief after walking around on typical hothumid Bangkok day  Very safe and clean as well

title: Take the BTS
review: When in BKK I always choose a hotel near the BTS because you can just hop on and connect to the airport link with ease and catch your flight If youâre at ease in taking trains while traveling then this is no different If itâs your first time itâs worth the try because it is so easy The maps are available online or just ask the ticket person for directions It really beats getting caught in BKK traffic

title: Mr. AlBadtaki
review: Vary easy to use and go around and clear instructions also the staff at ticket counter are very helpful and attentive the self serve buy tickets are easy to use

title: Easy to go around in BKK
review: Best to go anywhere with sky train cheap and faster always go with bts train whenever I go bkk  And I recommend everyone to take bts sky train because faster and cheaper  Thanks

title: Great way to avoid the traffic!
review: Well worth the cost to avoid the Bangkok traffic And it is cool as well It does get very crowded during rush hour (68pm and all of Friday night) so be prepared to wait for a train or two

title: You need strong legs!
review: Most of the stations do not have escalator or lifts Staff of the ticket office speak like a bullet train and you need to ask them to repeat a few times  You need to climb the fleets of staircases

title: Fast an efficient
review: Travelled on the BTS for a sort distance on a busy Saturday  Great service prompt and clean Not expensive  Will use it all the time instead of taxis

title: Take The Time To Learn The BTS
review: Take the time to learn the routes and how to purchase your tickets This is the best way to travel around the city

title: Easy way to skip traffic
review: Very good way of transportation in Bangkok but in coalition with Grab in long way I prefer Grab for a up to 4 people In short ways it's affordable and best choice

title: Easy to use
review: Once you've used it you 'll love it  Cheap regular quick  Travelled a lot this way  Loved the way people line up to get on  makes perfect sense  Nice and airconditioned too

title: Travel in the Sky
review: Best way to travel around Bangkok The traffic is ridiculous and it never stops seems like it Oh and get a Rabbit card to avoid lines But you will have to pay to get it You can use it at resturants and stores around Bangkok too so it isnt that bad really convenient

title: Efficient system, clean and safe
review: The BTS Skytrain works like clockwork with clear maps and verbal instructions in English as well as updates onscreen inside the trains Seats down both sides plus ample standing place works well

title: Awesome transport
review: The BTS likethe other modes of transport in Bangkok is amazing The ease of access across the city is almost unparalleled in the rest of the world

title: Cool and Efficient
review: A good way to get around the city Easy to use and all stations are announced in English so you know exactly where you are

title: Skytrain is an easy way yo get around
review: Very easy to use the Thai people are very polite and helpful if you get lost ask  Way quicker and cheaper than taxi

title: The easiest way to get around.
review: Just buy a day ticket and enjoy Bangkok itâs only about 140 baht and jump on and off as you like Great for exploring

title: Easy to use
review: Great form of transport just ensure you have change we travelled from S4 Chong Nonsi to S6 Saphan Tamsin & it was 26 THB each & took only a few minutes the biggest wait was for the train so clean & efficient & interesting as nobody communicates any more as only around 112 travellers werenât on their phones  One of the ticket clerks was happy to accept an extra 50 note but when challenged gave it back so please ensure you have the correct change or know which coins are which that aside would definitely use it again far quicker than foot or the roads

title: Getting about in bangkok
review: Simple easy to use system and fairly cheap to this can take you tot the shops and most of the attractions so can be very useful this was close to my hotel too which helped more

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: I have visited Bangkok several times and find the BTS Skytrain an easy way to traverse the city  English speakers will have no problem buying tickets and announcments and signs are in English   But beware at rush hour  It will be packed

title: Piece of cake to negotiate
review: Prompt efficient clean simple ticket buying cheap icecold air conditioned carriages elevated (views) orderly loading and unloading (pretty much) ontime  a great way to get around and avoid Bangkokâs notorious traffic

title: Well run Public Transport
review: Melbourne could learn a few things from Bangkok to do with public transport we are years behind there train system It is was clean efficient and so easy to understand the maps and ticketing machines

title: A great way to avoid the traffic jam in Bangkok
review: The Bangkok Skytrain or BTS is a great way to travel in Bangkok Although the lines are not as many as those in other cities plan your trip with good research you may be able to go around Bangkok without having to go through the notorious city traffic All major shopping areas (Siam Sukhumvit Silom and Chatuchak) are served by the BTS You can always use the BTS with the MRT and the river transportation One last word of advice Buy the one day ticket if you plan to travel a lot on the BTS during the day

title: Best mode of transport to save time
review: This has to be the lifeline of Bangkok the BTS connects you to all the important places that I as a tourist wanted to cover Bangkok is famous for congested traffic however the BTS makes it convenient and value for money Another plus point is that its clean and the BTS also connects you to MRT (which is an under ground train system)   Do note drinking and eating is not allowed in the skytrain

title: Fast service
review: I came to Thailand On September 2018  I used Bts Skytrain went to around Bangkok I was very happy and people of Thailand have friendly

title: Everyone must try!
review: The BTS is unbelievably easy to use and affordable A train ride can cost about 40bhat I would recommend that tourists use the BTS instead of the tuktuks  meter taxis A pleasant experience indeed

title: Great train service
review: Even though it can be a little crowded at time people in general were very polite the trains were clean and clear information in English trains were very frequent

title: BTS Bangkok
review: The Bangkok BTS system is very easy & cheap to use Simply buy a "Rabbit" for 100 Baht plus add whatever you think you may need ie another 100 Baht and you are away Trips between stations are cheap ie 25 Baht The trains are all super clean and fast Beats using a Tuk Tuk any day

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: The cab drivers are all hustlers and do not want to turn the meter On even though theyâre supposed The Extremely clean and fast This is the best way to travel in Bangkok  Itâs easy to navigate and very cheap

title: Loved the view from the train
review: Loved the view from the train Its a sky train and the view obtained from the windows is marvelous Dont miss

title: Very efficient though crowded at times
review: A cheap and reliable way of getting around  There are only 2 lines with an interchange at Siam It is clean and buying tickets is easy  From Sukhumvit down to the river ferries at Saphon Taksin it costs roughly Â£1 It is packed at peak times

title: Makes travel through the city so simple!
review: BTS Skytrain for trips across longer distances and TukTuk for quick rides Our friends who live in Bangkok let us use their Rabbit card Depending on how long youâll be in Bangkok there are various ways to pay for BTS (See more detailed info here) We found that loading it with 100bht ($350USD) every day worked out great

title: A great day out.
review: For a good fun day out get a day ticket for the Skytrain it only costs you 140 Bart up until midnight We found after using the ticket to pass the styles once it was easy after that everything is in Thai and English there are staff posted everywhere in case you are not sure what to do or where to go Go for it you will enjoy it also a welcome respite to the heat as the carriages are air conditioned

title: Reliable
review: Very reliable and organize transportation system to go to most place in Bangkok People will que in line before go in and always allow passenger to go out first before boarding

title: Convinient
review: The skytrain system is a rather convenient way to travel around modern Bangkok  Maybe a bit price and keep in mind that it does not go in to the old citycenter

title: Convenient Way To Navigate Bangkok
review: We used the BTS Skytrain numerous times during our stay in Bangkok It's easy to use and navigate especially if you're trying to get to a mall or particular attraction as you'll usually find a stop where you can get off and then walk to where you need to be It can get crowded at times but that's expected for public transportation in a huge city But it's definitely an efficient means of getting around the cityespecially when you look out while riding and see the constant traffic jams

title: Bad rap it doesn't deserve
review: BTS in Bangkok has a reputation of being hot crowded smelly with no airconditioning  Not true  We took it several times in central Bangkok and out to chatachak market on a Saturday morning  Every train we rode was spotless icy cold and on time   I gave only 4 stars for 2 reasons  Directions are confusing and stops are only called and marked in Thai  which would be very difficult for a foreigner   And stairs  Lots and lots of stairs  With the exception of the stops in big malls (Siam Paragon etc) there are few stops with elevators or escalators  It's 3 flights up and down to get to platforms

title: Great experience
review: We bought their rabbit card and we used it as much as needed Refilled it when needed It was easy to navigate Very clean and dependable

title: The only way to travel around Bangkok
review: As the title says it really is the best way to get across the city Conveniently placed stations and cheap fares Locals and tourists all sharing the same trains means that itâs easy to navigate and understand

title: Great but crowded, easy to see why
review: Online sources say it took a while for the Bangkok masses to begin using this transportation venue  but now there are many stations and easy access it's become superpopular and supercrowded

title: BTS is well worth using
review: Easy to use and well priced Limited stations but worth planning to include this Clean and easy to understand routes and staff in ticket offices speak English

title: Easy to Navigate
review: Makes it easy to get around We took the BTS basically all over the city and never had any problems

title: Convenient means of transport
review: Convenient means of transport to access some of the main tourist places especially the shopping malls A Rabbit  smart card is recommended to enable easy access through the gates Not really recommended if travelling with luggage even after 9 am as I saw several groups of travellers blocking the doors and the carriages were jam packed Besides the challenging stairs to the platforms the pavements and roads in Bangkok are not conducive for roller bags from what Iâve observed

title: Efficient
review: I travel to Bangkok and BTS was my main mode of transportation A lot of people but very convenient and less hassle

title: Great way to get about
review: Traffic in Bangkok can be terrible so the Skytrain is a great way to avoid it The trains are clean and relatively spacious with good air conditioning which is essential Very reasonably priced and the perfect choice if it goes where you want to be That's the only issues  the network is limited so you may well need to interchange to a taxi tuktuk etc to reach your final destination Hopefully the lines will keep expanding in the future The frequency of services could also be increased slightly there were times we waited over 5 minutes for a train which is more than you'd expect in most cities the size of Bangkok

title: Skytrain
review: The BTS skytrain is absolutely great Queue up and get in The clarity in the maps and ticketing makes it easy even for a first time tourist

title: Easy Transportation
review: Seems hard to understand the map until you really look at it then its the easiest thing in the world  Inexpensive very fast mode of travel and clean  Everyone uses it and at times it can feel like youre on top of each other but its never for very long due to its many stops  Do everyone a favor and wear perfume or cologne so it makes the trip more pleasurable

title: Easy to reach and travel from places to places!
review: If you are in a small travel group eg group of 2 it would be costly to travel by taxi or Grab car Taking sky train is perfect for lesser expenses Daily passes is available if you travel frequent Or else just buy the token on pertrip basis

title: Great Public Transportation System
review: The BTS is a good public transportion system Some of the stations now has ticket vending machine that accept notes Very convenience  Good public transportation system that connects the various tourist spots

title: BTS is the best way to move around the city
review: You can get from the airport link to the city much faster than a cab Only problem is it closes later in the evening Otherwise the smart way to move about the town

title: Faster than being stuck in traffic Jam
review: Taking the BTS is easy and much faster than taking a taxi or Grab as it does not Jam The only downside is that it's very very packed during peak hours and you will be squeezed

title: Does the job
review: Gets you from A to B easily  Trains are clean  Plentiful  Easy to use  Found it was much more convenient than travelling around on the roads

title: Skytrain in Bangkok
review: Easy to move around in Bangkok getting to places or connect to bustaxi Easy to buy tickets via machines

title: Captain
review: Clean and air conditioned and runs regularly The BTS runs regularly and on time And has stops in or close to most of the tourist locations in downtown Bangkok

title: Mike Draper
review: A fast and efficient way of travelling in Bangkok Have used on quite a few occasions as the line runs down Suhkimvit and is like the main artery connecting with the Airport etc All remarkably clean and efficient and very reasonably priced With the traffic very often nearly gridlocked this is the only alternative to beat the queues

title: Very efficirnt and clean
review: Very good way to travel arround Bangkok If you visit their website you can calculate the fair to the station you want to go  It is very clean and also very cold inside the train and it can be very crowded We loved it

title: BTS experience
review: This is better than getting a taxi and getting stuck in traffic We used BTS to get around Bangkok and did not have any problem even if we were lugging a lot of baggage

title: More convenient than taxis
review: When i arrive at Suvarnabhumi airport I go to the city using BTS When I wish to travel within the city I use BTS

title: Best means to egt to the airport
review: Fast airconditioned and most important strictly adherent to the schedule Seems to be the only way not to miss your flight in the city of traffic jams

title: Very Quick & Easy to use
review: We used this to save walking a few miles and it was very quick easy to use like the underground   I would use this again and itâs very cheap

title: It's convenient and connects to popular places
review: I have been to Bangkok a few times over the past 2 years and I found that using the the Bangkok Sky Train to be quite useful When I stayed at St James at Soi Ari I used the Phrom Phong station to connect to MBK at Siam stop as well as Siam Paragon When I was staying at the Solitaire 11 near Nana station I could connect to Victory Monument (for shopping and boat noodles) as well as the Chatuchak Weekend Market or Patpong night market  *Take note my experience at the Nana station is that by the train arrived (heading to Mo Chit) its usually quite full as compared when I took it from Phrom Phong  Many people get off at Siam station as it is also an interchange to another line (which can take you to Patpong station)  The staff there are quite friendly and helpful if you need to change coins to purchase your individual one time ticket

title: Solve our transportation issue :)
review: Our main transportation in Bangkok Our accommodation happen to be near to one of the BTS stations Easy to navigate around the map and you can just hop in & hop off with the 1 day travel pass Price is also affordable Should try it if you are in Bangkok

title: Bangkok BTS Skytrain.
review: We bought a one day pass for 140 Baht each at Asok station and traveled to Sathorn Pier station and back with a transfer at Siam stationVery clean and prompt trains and easy to use

title: Next Station....Asoke!
review: I always use the BTS getting around BKK  If you are on budget or even if you want to arrive on time somewhere then the BTS is the go

title: Easy way to travel around
review: The BTS skytrains are easily accessible and it links many parts of Bangkok together Fares are generally reasonable and the trains are clean efficient and have excellent air conditioning system However it gets very packed during rushpeak hours The only downside is that the train stations usually lack facilities such as fansescalators and lifts which may be quite a problem if you have to carry luggages up to the train platform

title: So so easy to use
review: So easy to use even if youâve never used public transit before My only complaint was at one point the teller who I was trying to buy a ticket from made me go to an automated ticket machine for what appeared to be no reason

title: Quick
review: Super easy to get anywhere simple to use and clean Also very cheap Not always enough space during peak hours but the next one comes within 3 minutes so thatâs alright

title: The Only way to get around Bangkok
review: We plan all our trips around proximity to the BTS This has been the best addition to Bangkok in decades If anything it should be expanded It seems the Taxis in Bangkok charge by time and not distance because you can easily spend an hour just getting a few kilometers The BTS is modern efficient and the riders are very gracious to older people

title: Bts skytrain
review: If you are single and want to move about in Bangkok sky train is the most economical and fastest approach  be it from airport or to MBK or Dusit zoo or Sukhumvit or Chatuchak the metro is the most convenient way helping wave time and costs  a bit crowded at times and u may need to know the nearest metro station but my preferred mode of transport  the stalls besides the station selling juices or sandwiches are a bonus

title: Absolutely necessary.
review: Trying to get anywhere on the road is extremely frustrating with the ever present heavy traffic The skytrain takes you to or close to most of the the things tourists like to do in Bangkok If not it connects you to the other lines that will get you where you need to go I like to walk and immerse myself but I take the trains to get me to the areas I love to visit They are crowded at end of workdays and in evenings Probably crowded for the morning work commute too I'm not up that early Its easy to figure out and there is always someone who is helpful

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Air conditioned Easy way to travel comfortably around Bangkok Tuk tuks are also great so do that too Enjoy

title: Quick and easy
review: BTS works very well for my wife and me We live near Wutthakat BTS station and our travel to and from the city is much faster than by road We travelled with two suitcases when we returned from Laos We ensured we considered other passengers needs for space and movement and there were no problems from the airport (different railway company so a different ticket issuing system) to Wutthakat The stations are situated over a wide area of the city Most places are easily accessed Steps upescalators (in most) and lifts are all provided for ease of movement Buses taxis and bikes are usually near all the exits so going out or getting home is simple Annoyances = some trains and platforms are very crowded especially at major intersecting stations Be aware it may be cramped and you still have a quick safe trip Buying different tickets for different transport systems seems silly but it can be done easily Sometimes you'll stop for a few moments as you approach Taksin (a single line station) but compared to having snails wave as they pass when you're stuck in traffic it is only a minor thing  I was told some carriages leak during heavy rain but I have travelled during monsoonal downpours and never encountered this happening Traffic delays and floods have not stopped any of my trips on the BTS

title: Efficient Way to Get Around
review: This is a good alternative to being stuck in Bangkok traffic Itâs pretty easy to learn the stops The train is very clean Be sure to avoid the weekday rush hours though Reminds me of NYC subways

title: Easy to figure out system
review: Very affordable way to get around Bangkok There is an MTS and BTS both cross and go in different directions

title: Efficient, pleasant and trip
review: Pros Once boarded travelling by train is faster than cars crawling through traffic ridden streets Cost effective Decent interconnectivity  Cons wait time between trains is quite long during off peak hours

title: Good experience.
review: Consider that it's the bsnkjon subway it's slightly expensive if you compare with the modes of transport If you tracing with a family a taxi might work out cheaper There are boats as well There is alsi lots of steps to climb to the sky train which could be daunting if you have bad knees It's a lot of steps from roadblebel to station level and from there anotje long flight of steps to the platform Its similar tk Europe's subway system but opposite going up and no escalators or lifts But it's clean and has ac

title: So clean you could eat off the floor!
review: I've been in many transit systems all around the world Starting with my hometown of Montreal I've been in undergrounds and above ground trains in New York Paris London Chicago to name a few but I have never been as impressed as when using the Skytrain in Bangkok People are polite and courteous the train is awesomely airconditioned and ventilated the floors and seats very clean  The whole system is userfriendly and quite inexpensive not mention incredibly safe A ++

title: fast, convenience but a lot of people
review: best alternative for escape the traffic jam and fast to department store in the city or go to hotel but a lot of people Thai and traveller please check Beware itâs break down  critical every station

title: Great public transportation, particularly in tourist and business areas
review: Skytrain is a great answer to how to get around in Bangkok a city with inexpensive taxis but perpetual traffic  I do tend to take taxis (or Grab) whenever I have luggage or outside of rush hour or when it's raining or when I'm lazy but skytrain is a great option during some parts of the day  A side benefit of Skytrain is that the stations provide a safe and convenient way to cross busy streets  you can often go up stairs or an escalator to a station cross the street (or enter a building directly) at the skytrain level but outside the fare gate and then go back down on the other side  Skytrain itself is often crowded but I've never felt unsafe even as a foreigner who speaks no Thai

title: easy, quick and cheap transport in Bangkok
review: very easy quick and cheap transport in busy Bangkok We took BTSMRT everyday to travel Bangkok ( only use express boat to visit The Grand Palace ) BTS use friendly with English MRT without English in ticket machine (

title: the best way to get around
review: it's the most efficient way to get around the city  even when it's rush hour and packed i would say it's pretty stress free

title: A better choice than being in a car
review: Realised after the first day that itâs a much better alternative to using Grab Probably saved myself 45 hours of being stuck in traffic    Staff are friendly and will ensure youâre heading in the right direction

title: Take the BTS
review: Very easy to use and a great and convenient way to get around Bangkok Try and avoid peak hour though as the trains can get very crowded

title: Cheap and busy
review: We did a number of trips using the BTS which is a great way to get around the city The trains are spotless even when they are at their busiest If you can avoid after 5 as they do get very busy during rush hour

title: excellent service and network
review: we enjoyed using the skytrain to different venues only they do not give up the seats to the elderly although given clearly on the signs but none of the youth or the strong men apply this for elderly people literally I had to request a young healthy girl to give up her seat for me as I felt like collapsing due to severe knee pain

title: Great
review: Clean efifcient way and More cheap if compared with taxis and the TUk TUk ( they probably rip u up)

title: Easy
review: Quick and easy way to move around Bangkok Cheap fares although a rather cumbersome method of paying in cash ( change)

title: fast clean and cheap
review: Very clean and cheap my main issue is that if you need to change to go on the underground you have to get another ticketsometimes get very crowded but no more than other large city's around the world

title: Efficient transport but super crowded at times
review: Great way to beat the traffic jams During rush hour expect to be squeezed to the limit as the trains are totally overcrowded

title: Fast, Modern and Cheap
review: The BTS skytrain is recommended for traveling in the sukhumvit area (for tourists who want to go shopping or to the Bumrungrad International hospital)   There are two lines the sukhumvit line which runs from Mo Chit to Samrong and Siloam line which runs from national stadium to bang wa Iâve not used the Siloam line Itâs fast air conditioned and pretty cheap The sukhumvit area is congested most of the time so taking a taxi will cost you more time and money There are helpful locals and security staff that are willing to help if you are lost or donât know which station to go to   The two lines interchange at Siam station where you can get off to Siam paragon Siam center and a bunch of shopping malls You can transfer to the MRT subway at sukhumvit station (Asok) and also at mo chit Using the subway you can get to the Ratchada area which I guess is the China town of bangkok You can also transfer to the airport rail link from the MRT   Verdict  Everythingâs connected and itâs efficient I highly recommend using public transportation as much as possible because traffic is a nightmare Youâll spend an hour or even more on a taxi and they arenât cheap

title: Bangkokâs Skytrain
review: A much easier way through Bangkok than the crowded streets Fast efficient clean and easy to useâand the major market is easily accessed

title: Best way to get around
review: Bangkok is the most congested city I have visited so far Doesnât matter the time of day there is always traffic We found bts perfect to get around Easy to use

title: Value for money
review: Itâs a great way to travel in Bangkok Itâs less time consuming and fastest way to travel Trains are very frequent The only problem is that itâs crowded and difficult to travel with small children

title: It's good but too much people.
review: Skytrain is new modern it's located on the 3rd level up and people stand in a queue in front of each train doors so the crowd who are going out can get out easily However too much people inside and very crowded We used it only once and didn't use after

title: Great transport system
review: Great transport system easy to get around and understand Easiest way would be to get a Day pass for 140 Baht which makes it easier to hop on and off at different stops especially during busy times so your not queuing to get a ticket or change  Connects to the MRT and BRT although they are not quite as enjoyable  Air con is a saviour when you've been wandering too

title: A great way to get around anytime.
review: With the Bangkok traffic being crazy the BTS is the way around and so easy to use and as the lines are further extended you cand get most places you want to be careful not to try and get on as the doors are closing as the guards get very grumpy

title: BTS!!
review: Very easy to navigate using the BTS Directions are in English and the ticket counter speaks English and is very helpful

title: get there quicker.
review: taxis although very cheap they can be very frustrating what with the endless grid locks in Bangkok so allow yourself plenty of extra time or take the skytrain and get as close as you can so its only a short distance to your location in a taxi

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Used the BTS on my last visit to Bangkok its the best way to get around as traffic is a total nightmare Busy at rush hour but that's to be expected

title: Easy, Clean & Efficient
review: We were lucky to have a Skytrain station very close to our hotel It is a very good form of public transport easy safe clean and efficient It's just a pity it doesn't cover more of the city

title: My favorite mode of transportation
review: I try to catch the BTS whenever I'm not using GRAB because it's so efficient Make sure you get the Rabbit card if you plan on riding the BTS more than a few times You will beat the crowds trying to buy tickets and not having to scrounge around for change Rabbit card has a 100 baht issuing fee but I thought it was well worth it especially if you're trying to buy tickets at busy stations such as Siam Asoke Mo Chit etc

title: Efficient, easy to use
review: Travelling via the BTS was a breeze Everything is properly signed and the ticket machines have an English option Try and use it wherever possible Cheaper than taxistuk tucks and you won't get ripped off

title: Easy to Commute!
review: We were traveling and the train was so easy to take the information desk was very helpful and told us exactly what stops to get off on to get to our final destinations Safe clean and affordable

title: It works !
review: A huge improment of how to get around BKK It runs smoothly and price is cheap Connection to MRT is well thought

title: Take BTS to avoid the worst traffic in BKK
review: Compared to the other public transportation available in BKK BTS is a bit expensive (for 2 stations it is 23 Batt) but once you experience the traffic jam in BKK especially during the rush hours I am sure that you will gladly pay for BTS

title: MBK
review: Fantastic bargains galore A must vist if you're in Bangkok  Fab items selling absolutely everything  Definitely worth a visit

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Easy to use and much quicker and cheaper than taxi or tuk tuk Two stops to Platinum centre great shopping and better than the markets  Airconditioned comfort

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The trains are frequent well airconditioned clean and well signed for exits etc once you reach your stop

title: Super convenient ride
review: Its definitely convenient to take a ride from suvarnabhumi airport if u're staying at a hotel near any bts station A great way to save that extra bucks from taking a cab

title: On time and air conditioned!
review: We used this train from the river station to the shopping centre It was great and so cheap  about Â£1 each for a 15 minute journey It was clean and lovely and cool after the humidity outside

title: Overcrowded
review: The Sky Train is what it is It reaches the parts that the metro does not go   The last time I was here over 7 years ago the BTS was not used by the day to day local people  Now it is become too crowded How things have changed for the good   I think it is now time that BTS add more carriages to the existing trains as it has the capacity to do so Still a cheap and effective way and somewhat scenic way of moving around Bangkok busy streets whilst you are above the traffic jams

title: Comfortable travel
review: If the place you are visiting is near any BTS station then this is a comfortable mode of travel since the streets are choked with traffic during peak hours Check your google map if a BTS is around Ticketing is very convenient People are helpful Though they are crowded but crowd is not pushy Stations are also named in English which is very helpful if you do not understand Thai

title: Daily transport in Bangkok
review: Super easy and convenient to take BTS in Bangkok Itâs a little packed during office peak hours but in general you will be able to get in next train  Buy a day pass at the ticketing counter at THB140 will unlimited rides till midnight If you tend to do shops hopping it worth to get one to save time to queue    If there are escalators from platform to ticketing exit level will be helpful Itâs helpful to those with old folks young kids and heavy luggage

title: Efficient, Clean and Low Cost
review: Ticks all the boxes of being efficient clean and low cost Simple to navigate and certainly beats the Bangkok trafffic

title: Great
review: I think the sky train was fast and efficient whilst I am used to a card in Sydney the coin thing was ok and when I was lost the police officer was very friendly and told me exactly where to go

title: Best way to get around
review: I love the BTS it's the fastest cheapest and best way to get around the city Trains are rarely late but during peak hour the carriages are jam packed full with people

title: An Excellent Service
review: This has got to be the best way to get around this great and crazy city  The Sky Train does get really busy but that is for a good reason it is such a great service It is quick reliable clean and very good value for money You can get an all day ticket for 140 baht (about Â£3Â£350) or just station hop at really good prices I have started planning my Bangkok trips around the BTS now as it saves so much time and money getting stuck in taxis for hours on end It can be a bit confusing to start with but the maps are simple and the staff have always been very helpful whenever I have had to ask any advice  If you havenât already give it a go I am sure you will be impressed  Highly recommended

title: Great way to get around
review: Bangkok traffic can be horrible The BTS is a great way to get around especially if you are staying near a station The trains are no more or less crowded than the London underground or New York subway One peculiarity is that you cant seem to buy return tickets   Google maps does a good job of suggesting routes

title: Time saver when you live or work close by
review: It is  extremely convinient means of transport safe clean and fast but the trick is that you may need more time to get to it than time saved by using it unless you live and or work close by So would need to be expanded to many other parts of BKK to reduce the current pressure on taxi transport

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: If your destination in Bangkok I'd even remotely nearby a BTS station this is the way to travel  bar none  in Bangkok The trains are frequent clean and air conditioned It beats a taxi Tuk Tuk or motorcycle hands down For frequent journeys buy a pass

title: Got Lost But Had Fun
review: Had a great day finding our way on the sky train got lost met some lovely people Would definitely do it again Easy tickets and easy map once you sort out where your going

title: Easily negotiated, efficient transport
review: I took the BTS Skytrain several times and found it to be a very good service It was easy to buy tickets and work out where to go The trains ran often and were clean and safe Just be aware that at rush hour they can be very packed

title: Time saving, avoid rush hours!
review: If you're planning to travel to many places in 1 day by BTS (at least more than 3 trips) I recommend you buy the day pass which is around 100+ THB Its a convenient way to travel in Bangkok but sometimes it's broken and the trains delayAvoid rush hours (79 AM and 58 PM) if you canYou will not be able to breath But you know Bangkok never sleepsTrains are new and nice I think all stations have elevators but can be difficult to find

title: Easy transportation
review: Very easy and comfortable to get around in the city But the price is higher than the local buses So if you are two or more people it is sometimes cheaper to get to places by taxi Worth double checking

title: Best thing to travel in city
review: I really Thanks full to Bangkok sky train  its really make easy way to travel in city Either once a time you  go in traffic you will get upset  here is road traffic is very bad in the evening time and the rain time

title: Timing save
review: Very comfortableand saving time traini like itnext time i want to travel by sky traini think this is the best train which links to airport

title: The only way to get around Bangkok
review: The bts sky train is by far the best way to get around the city Traffic is horrible anytime of the day or night and although you canât use the bts to get to some of the sights it will get you close and shorten your taxi ride from there It is cheap and reliable and easy to use I always book a place to stay near the bts to make it easy to get around

title: Is confusing so know where you want to go
review: Their system is on many levels and not the friendliest in terms of signage So once you really know the stops you want to go to you will be fine Trains are packed and watch your valuables But is certainly a better way of getting around than being stuck in a taxi

title: Easy, Efficient
review: We took the train to the market without an issue Easy clear and fast Attendants are helpful with directions

title: Best transportation in bangkok
review: Best way to travel in the most crowded city in the world  Clean and fast And cheap   Advices Buy a card better than one time trip Avoid peak time specially siam station

title: Easy to use
review: Very impressed with the Bangkok skytrain I found it to be very easy to use with helpful staff which I find is unusual for public transport in most city's It was clean safe and on time every time The best way to get around the city

title: Efficient transport
review: This train system is very easy to use The stations are clean and safe The ticket counters are very helpful and the train network itself is very simple to navigate

title: Good train service
review: Great train service in Bangkok Clean fast accurate No complaints Runs like an efficient subway

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: The Skytrain in Bangkok is an excellent way to get around the city It is reasonably priced easy to navigate efficient clean and will get you places faster than a taxi It is a plus if your accommodation in Bangkok is close to a Skytrain stop

title: Very clean, very safe & very cheap...regular stops
review: We used the sky train to get to our hotel from central Bangkok It was super cheap very clean & we as a family felt very safe on it The staff were very helpful in pointing us in the right direction

title: The way to travel around the city
review: The Skytrain is so simple and easy to use It goes to the major tourist places for a more than reasonable price without the hassle of fighting for the taxi to put the meter on or the famous Bangkok traffic jams

title: Modern, tech-savy service!
review: Easy to use and understand with information available in English and Thai Maps are also provided all around the train to keep track of your location

title: Cool
review: Love the quick and easy way to travel around Bangkok Clean cool and sometimes they play the national anthem Very friendly staff

title: Excellent for getting round Bangkok - as long as it is nearby
review: A great way to get around Bangkok and to avoid the traffic Plus sides  it is fast regular clean and serious air conditioning We used a rabbit card which worked well for us  and avoided queuing for a ticket Can be quite crowded in the rush hour  but no worse than the tube in London  Down side  a lot of the stations do not have escalators or lifts and it can be quite a long climb up to what is often 4th floor level to get to the train Not great if you have luggage Also they stop at midnight  but then Bangkok does not seem a very late night city

title: Cool way to go around the city
review: One of my favorite thing about the BTS sky train is that you donât have to stuck in the traffic of Bangkok if your place and your destination is nearby the BTS station The ticket price is average And you can enjoy different Bangkok view from the train But be cautious on working days the period when people come to work and go back home The train can get too crowded and probably you will have to wait for the next train to get on One more advise if you want to avoid waiting long line to buy the train ticket you can buy The Rabbit card which will cost you around THB100 What you need to is to top up the card the amount you plan to spend for the train while you are in Bangkok then you are good to go)

title: Awesome transportation option in Bangkok
review: We purchased the rabbit card as we were in town for almost 5 days and planned on using the skytrain to get around town  It was worth it to not have to queue in line in rush hour to get single journey tickets   Peak hours are packed with riders so be prepared for that experience

title: Great!
review: Clean and super convenient Fast and safe Goes throughout the city and there is a way to get to the airport

title: Just awesome
review: I love how easy it is to BTS (sky train) It has 2 lines  There is the shorter Bang Wa to National Stadium (where the MBK shopping center is) or the Mo Chit to Bearing line There is an interchange station at Siam  Tickets fares start from 15 THB up to 55 THB  I recommend getting a Rabbit Card (travel card) and 30 day pass of 25 trips All up it costs approx 775 THB (200 for the card including a 100 THB loaded and 575 for the 25 trips) This works out to an average of 31 THB per trip which is perfect for me as I'm travelling a lot between the 2 lines  Plus it means I don't have to wait in line for a ticket vending machine  The trains come frequently and always only a few minutes apart They are air conditioned and they announce their arrivals in both English and Thai   All signage has english at each station so you can't get lost   All in all I love using the BTS and I wish my home country had such an awesome set up  Do note that during peak hours (7am to 9am and from 4pm to 6pm) it can get busy and packed

title: Convinent
review: Was very easy to nevagaite your way around the city in the BTS network itâs the quickest option to get around Bangkok

title: Efficient Service
review: A quick clean and efficient way to move around the city The service is easy to use with ticket machines and a manned counter though the staff manning this were not particularly helpful and were rather rude The trains were air conditioned and mostly operated on time It was very busy and most carriages were packed full

title: Easy Use
review: Found using the trains to be very easy and lots of people whom speak English to help when needed  The trains always run frequently and you can see when the next train is coming  Can be crowded depending on the time but always room to stand and watch as you move along

title: Convenient & Efficient Service
review: We experienced BTS Skytrain services in several times on different occasions From the ticketing counters to train platforms are safe and secure enough Except the peak hours itâs so convenient We found the frequency and punctuality of the trains are comfortable Thank you BTS Skytrain

title: The most convenient and cool transportation method
review: This is the fastest way to get around and will cool you down from all the walking and exploring the BKK

title: Easy and frequent way of getting around
review: The BTS is a very convenient way of getting around large areas of Bangkok while at times very crowded it still seems safe and non threatening for all  Cheap and easy to use and comparatively easy to understand for tourists but and 9it is a big one for most tourists it does not go near the "big" tourist sites which seem to be serviced by the MTR  Luckily they have a number of interchange station but beware that the tickets do not seem to be transferable between the two  The BTS really needs to expand as it is such a great way of seeing the city

title: The way to get where it goes
review: The BTS along with the MTR subway are what I use in Bangkok unless they don't go where I am going  and if that's the case I take them to the closest station then take a taxi to the destination

title: Conenient way to travel within city
review: Great transportationpretty safe but not at night Extremely cheap and convenient but doesn't go to main sites

title: Excellent mode of transportation
review: The Skytrain is an excellent way to get around Bangkok There are zillions of stops  and it seems to cover all of Bangkok If you are staying for a few days Iâd recommend the Rabbit Card Itâs like an Oyster card for the London Underground The BTS is easy to navigate and unlike the London Underground is air conditioned Perfect and so necessary in humid Bangkok Rides are a small fraction of the prices for travel in London Very easy to navigate too and so orderly Like in Japan they queue to embark Contrast London Very similar to the Tokyo metro Modern clean safe and efficient   We used it to get to the International Airport too at a fraction of the cost and time needed for a taxi It connects seamlessly with the train service to the airport   Great service Highly recommend as a means of transportation in the city

title: BTS system is great to get around!
review: Traffic is extremely heavy pretty much year around and at any time of the dsy even on weekends Taking the BTS is a time saver and great experience to mingle with the locals and know more about the city Some of the best malls and attractions are right along the BTS line You can buy a ticket for each ride or you can purchase a "rabbit" card and load it up with funds so you can go in and out of the BTS stations by scanning your rabbit card

title: Great way to get around in Bangkok
review: We used the BTS and were very impressed by the cleanliness timeliness and convenience  If you have a need to get around and don't want to deal with the CRAZY traffic and delays this is a great option

title: BTS is very convenient
review: And easy to navigate  good experience and you get to see BKK from above  I would recommend taking it to any locations you want to get to

title: Getting around in Bangkok
review: The BTS can be crowded at the end of the day Using BTS is a much faster way to travel in the city than using car tuktuk or cab

title: Excellent system
review: Very clean and efficient train system My husband and I used this system several times and we found that it is one of the most efficient train systems amongst the Asian countrues we travelled to

title: Organized and clean but SO PACKED!
review: Amazed at how efficient and organized the BTS was From the lineup arrows to how everyone lines up properly  amazing However it is REALLY PACKED when you get inside WOW

title: Easy, cheap and rapid
review: It is much better than taxi very reliable and an excellent way to get around in this very busy city Trains were punctual people respectful getting on and off the train The trains were clean strict eating and drinking rules on the platform Definitely the best way to move in Bangkok

title: a little difficult for tourists to use
review: We used the BTS Skytrain with a local Thai friend and I was very grateful because the fare calculation and payment system is not at all straightforward and may have taken us quite some time to figure out   The machines only take change so if you only have bills you have to stand in line at a cashier to make change first  The actual train was awesome  very orderly and clean and has great AC which was much appreciate on a hot August day )

title: Fast, efficient & inexpensive way to travel
review: For many destinations the elevated rapid transit system BTS Skytrain is the fastest and best way of getting to and from locations at or close to BTS (Bangkok Mass Transit System) Station stops It is easy to use but the key is distances from the stations The other travel options in Bangkok include taxis tuktuks underground MRT rail systems buses river taxis and express boats Tuktuks are fun but after a few rides you might want to change to something giving off fewer fumes and a little more comfortable Taxis tuktuks and buses are impacted by many traffic jams Thus I prefer the Skytrain Not only does it avoid traffic jams by going above them but you also get a highlevel view of the city Since the Skytrain system is elevated youâll have to walk up and down stairs or when available go on escalators to get to and from the platform level En route you will see markets the architecture of many city buildings lots of roads congested with cars tuktuks and buses Some people and trafficpolice will be wearing breathing protection because of the high level of polluted air    The elevated Skytrain has two lines the Sukhumvit Line and the Silom Line and 35stations At a few stations one can change to the MRT underground railway and the ARL Airport Rail Link    For our stay at the Hilton Sukhumvit Bangkok we were a fiveminute walk to the Phrom Phong BTS Station To go from the Hilton Sukhumvit to the Grand Palace we took the Sukhumvit Line from Phrom Phong Station to Siam Station where we changed to the Silom Line Then we went five stations to Saphan Taksin Station and took Exit 2 to the Chao Phraya Express Boat which we took to Ta Chang Pier No9 From there the Grand Palace was a sevenminute walk

title: Too crowded at peak hours.
review: It was one of the best way to travel in Bangkok by BTS But it didnât go everywhere I wanted to go I heard that they are extending more BTS lines BTS trains were clean very easy to understand the train lines most local had manner they did get up for elderly or pregnant ladies ( that was very impressive) The fare was cheap Be careful one thing no toilet at any station And train was packed during peak hours or rainy day

title: BTS and MRT are the best choice to move around in Bangkok
review: If you do not want to sit in trafic jam use the BTS and the MRT System in Bangkok it is clean quick and convinient

title: quite good
review: Every time I go Bangkok I will sure take there BTS This time we took the BTS to Chatuchak Weekend Market the only not so good is family with young kids will have problem as the station is not stroller friendly as there is no lift from gantry to station platform So if you have stroller or luggage then need have strength to carry up the stairs Overall is station and train is clean and good

title: Very hard to survive in Bangkok without the Skytrain!
review: This is absolutely the fastest way to get around in Bangkok The two lines are expanding all the time and most of the famous attractions and shopping centers in Bangkok are situated along the skytrain route I can't imagine today's Bangkok without the BTS Skytrain

title: Always broke
review: Please make your train better than today   Too much Many time for you say sorry   Fare is quite high and always broken

title: Quick Travel
review: This is by far the easiest way to get about such a busy city that has has such heavy trafficThe trains are quick efficient and clean

title: efficent service
review: The skytrain is an effective method of travelling around Bangkok and is great to avoid the horrendous traffic its clean cheap and on time

title: Good option to beat the traffic
review: If your route falls on the way then this is a good alternative to the Tuk Tuk or cabs The roads have mostly traffic jams So you can save a lot of time We did not get rush also It was a smooth ride

title: Easy to go to anywhwere!
review: Easy to go any where in Bangkok where connect with sky train because you can keep your time and avoid traffic jam problem

title: This system for travel in Bangkok is amazingly easy to use and so convenient.
review: We used this mode of travel almost daily during our 14 day stay in Bangkok There are stations everywhere and it is very easy to use I highly recommend you use it to get out of the busiest traffic we have ever come across You can buy tickets at the station offices

title: SkyTrain
review: Wonderful refreshing air conditioning fast and efficient service and smooth ride Best mode of transportation in Bangkok

title: Very convenient
review: Bangkok is a place with severe traffic jams during peak hours  Traveling by BTS is more manageable and preferred

title: Confusing Confusing Confusing
review: Perhaps it is our age but we found the BTS skytrain difficult to manage Don't think it is a breeze Perhaps we were tired but in the heat and congestion it was all very frustrating

title: what a way to travel
review: The train was so clean and so easy to use was a real experience Considering how many people use it

title: Super convenient.
review: I went to Bangkok and mostly travel by skytrain Clean easy and convenient When I come back I will use for sure

title: Best way to travel around if on route
review: Used skytrain to go to Chatuchak Market Easy to use inexpensive clean and fast We had no problem getting on and around

title: A train
review: It is was you'd expect  a train We managed to find our way thanks to an English speaking very helpful local

title: Nice way to get where you going
review: If there is a BTS station near of course During rush hours trains become extremely crowded and the ride becomes a little bit less enjoyable But it will get you from a to c

title: Easy to travel
review: Using the BTS Skytrain is a must  If you can avoid taxi and Tuk tuk you definitely have to use BTS MRT and boats to travel around Bangkok Taxis are perfect for short distances and at night

title: Time for upgrade
review: I've visited BKK on many occasions and using their trains I seen some improvements ie lifts to bring pax up the train station in some stations However I would think the powers that be look into the following 1 Ticket machine should accept notes During peak hours long queues are formed by commuters to change their notes into coins in order to buy a single way ticket at the coinsonly machine 2 Make the purchase of multiple ride pass card available To date I'm  not sure if such a card exist This will surely reduce unnecessary queues at the ticket machines 3 The trains are always full It'll be good to increase the frequency of the trains I hope commuter convenience can take priority over profit 4 More escalators should be built to access the boarding platforms Currently it's a long flight of stairs Every country will have a sizeable aging population in time to come Perhaps go take a look at Singapore 's MRT system and bring back good practices

title: Excellant Service
review: Chea and convenient way to travel around the city  Connecting all the main tourist spots Tickets can be purchased at the counter or the ticket machine Trains are on schedule and it full during peak hours (730and and 430pm) so plan your trip by BTS

title: Convenient
review: Using the BTS is an easy and convenient way to travel around in the city   Tickets can be purchased at the counter or the ticket machine  Trains are on schedule and it is full during the work times so better to use it after or before the peak periods   Stations are easy to find and the maps are clear to read Itâs shown in the trains where you are and the station that is coming up Announcements are in Thai and English May be a little difficult to understand at times

title: Fun
review: Get the birdâs eye view  We took took sky trains to connect to a new part of the city  The train was full even Sunday morning

title: Great way to get about
review: We have been to Bangkok several times on holiday and always use the skytrain It is an efficient reliable and real Thai local way of getting around the city It is a must do if wanting to see the real Bangkok without having to rely on tour guides The staff at the ticket offices at the stations are very helpful and guides on stations are displayed in carriages as well as stops announced in English and Thai as stations are approached Better and quicker the taxis and a real Thai experience We wouldn't use any other way of getting around Bangkok Definitely worth the experience and well reliable

title: Easy and Comfortable
review: This is the best option for transport in Bangkok city as there are a lot of station spread out around the city

title: Skip the taxis
review: This is the easiest way to get around Bangkok and avoids the delays and frustration of taxis The trains are clean and comfortable but get a bit congested during peak hour The stations are easy to navigate with multilingual ticket machines

title: Easy to use!
review: Great way of getting around and very easy to navigate and above all air conditioned The staff are very helpful

title: I like Skytrain
review: I like to use BTS Skytrain it offers good transport services through its clean and airconditioned cabin and easy to use the services from the way off ticketing and through the PA system to announce the nameâs off the stations and very  useful at a time off bad traffic  and during the rainy days

title: Good transport
review: Convenient reasonably priced clean Extremely useful during the 247 traffic jam Exits are easy to find

title: best ride
review: cheap and best ride for all aged people The route is quite simple but check the destination well how far it is from the station

title: best way to move around
review: Clean fast safe What do you need more The side effects are price (not cheap) and only 2 lines that cannot cover the city

title: Nice and cool
review: BTS SkyTrain in Bangkok is best thing On time  stations are good and very informative  staff are very interested in helping customers Stations are neat and clean BTS mostly cover most of Bangkok main area Traffic in Bangkok is bad so BTS is highly recommended for fast and efficient traveling around Love Bangkok

title: Not the Cheapest, But definitely the Fastest.
review: We took the skytrain for most of our commutes inside the city and on our shopping runs For someone used to London's tube and Bangalore's Metro this is a "Walk in the park" by comparison   Not very crowded (except on rush hours of course) Good coverage to all major destinations in the city

title: Avoid the traffic
review: Definately a must when in Bangkok its quick clean and cheap I must admit it was always full of commuters but hanging on to the straps adds to the excitement

title: QUICK COOL AND RELIABLE
review: Incredible Air Conditioning barshandles all over the ceiling to hold onto Very quick instructions in EnglishThai If its your first time in Thailand you will be amazed by how easy it is to use and how much more efficient it is than something like the NYC subway system

title: Not bad
review: The trip via BTS is convenient Easy to get But navigation while changing the train could be better and we need to be careful as itâs easy to get into wrong direction train

title: Great service
review: Timely smooth and inexpensive Highly recommended Buy rabbit card if u are interested in a longer stay in bangkok Otherwise print a ticket from machines available procedure is easy I bought 15 visits card for 550 Baht but could use it only for 6 trips and had to gift it to a lady on hotel counter They Need to install escalators at all stations

title: Great Experience Travelling With BTS Skytrain
review: It Was A Great Experience Travelling With BTS It Is Easily Accessible Ticket Could Be Purchased Easily

title: The most efficient way to get around
review: Unless youâre staying only in Bangkok for one day I suggest you get the rabbit card Seriously with Bangkokâs traffic this is the most efficient way to get around The trains are fast and arrive on time the stations are clean and well lit and the staff are friendly Also AC inside the train as well as indicators of your location are all fully functioning Donât know where to go Donât worry The trains are always with Englishspeaking expats just approach one and theyâll surely be able to tell you where to go  PS  Some stations even have manicure places and beauty shops further adding to the convenience it offers

title: Comfortable
review: Great commuting option in Bangkok avoiding all the traffic Airconditioned and comfortable 2 lines intersecting at Siam station Btw Siam Paragon is a great shopping mall to stop by

title: cheap and fast
review: every 10 r 15 minutes there Is train cheap and fast that taxi and also very clean comparing other country train

title: Airport
review: I caught the train from the Siam stop all the was to the airport for just 35 THB Easy and cheapest option to get to the international airport

title: Fast, dependable but kinda full...usually.
review: It'll get you there it's easy to usebut sometimes it's full as fu Avoid depending on slow Sukhumvit traffic and use the train

title: Best Way to get Around Bangkok
review: Bangkok is famous for many things including its traffic jams Taxis and tuktuks are not a real solution but the BTS train is It connects all the main shopping centers many five star hotels night clubs and bars as well as the water taxis at the Thaksin station Best of all you can get around easily even during the monsoon season

title: Not easy to navigate
review: Was told this is the easiest way to get around and indeed it is super easy however a little difficult to navigate People are super awesome met a couple who helped us out and told us where to go in a nice way The security was also very helpful at telling us how and where to but tickets

title: Easy ride around Bangkok
review: This was an easy option to get around parts of Bangkok It is safe we had no problems I would take precautions as in peak time it gets packed but we had no problems

title: BTS - Best mode of transport around Bangkok
review: Stayed 8 days in Bangkok Sukhumvit area Moved around using BTS as the mode of transport to get to all the areas that I visited Connected to MRT line at certain station like Mo Chit if you want to go to Or To Kor fruit market Convenient and inexpensive mode of transport to move around

title: Convenient Mode of Transport
review: Any frequent visitors to Bangkok will know the BTS is one of the most convenient ways to get around Notwithstanding the prevalence of taxis (the drivers are not always honest) uber and grab cars the jam in Bangkok means the BTS will likely get you to your destination faster (if there is a BTS station there)  The BTS uses the Rabbit card It is a different travel card from the one which you use for the MRT  If you want to use the MRT and the BTS you will need to have 2 cards handy  Not exactly the friendliest system around but once you get the hang of it switching between the cards is a breeze

title: Easy
review: The skytrain was the fastest and easiest way to go around Bangkok that I tried Much better than taxi

title: Live like a local
review: Its very easy for foreigner to buy the ticket very simple and convenient It is clean inside the train

title: Good service, but busy and poor connections
review: The BTS train is very useful when you want to avoid traffic But it can get very very busy with very low room inside for yourself  The connections are poor you can't get to all places in bangkok with this train

title: awesome
review: So easy to use people in kiosk selling tickets very helpful aftr one use its basically all we used when we could get to the destination required

title: Local bts train travel
review: Fantastic  and we'll managed metro train service in bkk One will feel good to go out for shopping etc

title: Best way to get around
