review: Use it if you can Cheap quick easy Can be a bit confusing buying ticket Goes most places you'd want to

title: Cleaner than expected
review: The reasons why I lile the BTS 1  clean Was actually a nice surprise 2  cheap 3  saves you from the traffic of bangkok 4  the food stalls in the station Haha yes you read right Food stalls Try the various thai milk teas and the waffles 5  reliable 6  its airconditioned Yey A little reprieve from the heat outside

title: Fast, Easy & Affordable
review: Purchase the rabbit card (prepaid) and start riding to avoid jams on the roads The most popular malls in the City Centre are easily reachable by BTS

title: SUMMER HOLIDAY
review: My experience as a tourist on the BTS Skytrain was indeed a novel experience To get to the appointed floor one can take the steps  lift  escalator The fares are well displayed however keep some spare time & small change as the ques may be long at peak hours There are adequate number of small kiosks & outlets for a quick snack or refreshing soft drink The staff is adequate courteous & helpful All aspects are autuomated from buying the ticket to your destination  entrance to the station as well as the exit from the station The train is very clean is popular with all sections of society & is directly connected to various malls & hotels I always found my co passengers neatly dressed  accomodating & courteous

title: Bangkok skytrain
review: The Bangkok Bts is easy to use and always clean It's best to have coins handy because the ticket machines only take coins and the teller lines are always crowded

title: Bangkok - BTS (Skytrain) & MRT
review: Hello Travellers  I am writing a review on the Bangkok  BTS (Skytrain) & MRT  As a young family with our 4 12 year old we were not sure about the convienence of using the Skytrain once we started to use it and that became our best mode of transportation we had that Bangkok had to offer for us to get to and from our hotel (Grande Centre Point Terminal 21) to all the large malls doorstep and other famous tourist locations which was absolutely easy and cheap but quick way to move through the busy but amazing Bangkok city very clean trains with air conditioning and the stations have escalators lifts and direct for easy access and most have direct access to the large malls in the city we highly recommend to use the BTS (Skytrain) & MRT also there are quite a few stores at the stations to grab a drink to cool of in the warm Bangkok weather there are some food stores and other novelty stores depending on some stations vary from another the signs are very clear to follow for Western and all other tourists that ride the Skytrains and Metro trains  All the best and wish you all happy and safe holidays in this amazing city

title: Best way to move around Bangkok
review: Cheap easy to use clean frequent schedules best way to move around BKK If it is to the Chao Praya or to the fairgrounds best option

title: Exceptional
review: The easiest fastest and most affordable mode of travel in Bangkok Strongly recommend the purchase of the 'rabbit' card if one is staying more than 2 days The service is efficient and each trip punctual Delays  none whatsoever One can visit most places of interest utilising the BTS

title: Convenient, clean and fast
review: Still as good as I took it in my last trip  It is an extremely effective means of getting round especially during peak hours as Bangkok traffic will come to a total standstill Not all locations can be reached via BTS as it is just part of a total network that includes MRT river boats Grab carstaxis etc  Google "free BTS pass" for your trip to see  which hotels give the day passes for free for their guests  whether King Power DFS might have giveaway events  if the Thai embassy in your home country might have giveaway events as well

title: Easy and air conditioned comfort
review: We caught the train with our 1 year old son in a pram and found it easy to navigate the stations and bliss once you got on the air conditioned train

title: Easy way
review: It's very easy to use it you can find it everywhere  Very cleanit will big coast you much Easy to deal withsome station are very crowded during the rush hours

title: Its a train that works, limited use though
review: Not sure why this is so amazingly rated on here It's pretty fast and it's clean and cooled nicely by air con But it has very limited use for tourists Ticket machine doesn't take notes or 2 Baht coins for some reason Is being extended so maybe in future it will take more cars of the busy roads andor be more useful for sightseeing

title: Great Accessibility
review: An approximately 10 minutes walk from Play Haus Hotel Convenience and best location for traveler in a small group

title: A Little Crowded !
review: A little crowded but that's part of the experience   I guess   Big city lots of people  it's on time and the signs work   I enjoyed the experience  I think  Just make sure you have a guide or local with you

title: A welcome alternative to the sweltering heat.
review: What can we say We used the Skytrain extensively during our stay in Bangkok and it was faster more pleasant to use and even less expensive than a taxi Highly recommended

title: A great way to get around
review: Not cheap compared to taxi but at least you not stuck in traffic jam all day long Easy to use and navigate The only inconvenience is you need coins to buy the tickets

title: Cheapest mode of transport in Bangkok!
review: My one and only mode of transportation in Bangkok Cheap and hassle free Opens till midnight which is more than enough for you to go around the city with their oneday pass You can also not worry about the traffic jams on the roads which is a bummer if you are rushing to the airport  FYI BTS line and their airport line are 2 different entities which you need to buy separate train tickets

title: Easy way to get around the city.
review: A very easy and cheap way to get around the city Buy the tickets from the automatand pick which zones you need If you are not sure just ask the man at the window he can also give you the coins you need to buy the tickets

title: Most convenient way to travel in Bangkok
review: If the Skytrain has a station near where you want to go in Bangkok it is the best way to travel Clean air conditioned carriages frequent service much quicker than a taxi and you get to see the complex relationship of buildings and land usage in Bangkok Connect with the underground to get to other parts of the city I think the public transport system is a lot better than Londons

title: Quick.. convenient .. accessible
review: A great way to travel in Bangkok  Cleanorderly  well supported  and helpful personal  SIMPLE for tourists and orderly even T peak times

title: Really convinient
review: The skytrain goes everywhere and there not a lot of waiting however beware of the AC its freezing in there

title: Geat to explore but way too cold
review: The aircon is always too strong Was hard to breath inside the BTS for meCheap and modern so its not bad at all

title: Handy, efficient, crowded
review: I used the sky train to go from our hotel to the weekend market  We bought day tickets for a few dollars  The train was modern and fast  Signs and announcements were in English  It was quite crowded and we had to stand  It was a good inexpensive way to get to many places

title: Short and fast
review: The BTS skytrain is air conditioned and comfortable (when there isn't a lot of people in it) The stops are not too far apart the distance between the stations are about 34mins away A lot of the stations are connected to malls making it very easily accessible and super great for tourists like me

title: Super handy to avoid traffic
review: It is really handy as we traveled one way Taxi and then we took this back which saved at least an hour air con clean and the best form of travel for sure

title: Cheap and frequent
review: The BTS train system is very economical and the trains come very frequently A little crowded in peak hours which is expected but jam packed

title: Great way to get around the city
review: A short walk form the hotel we used the skytrain to go several stations  clean efficient and easy to follow the route

title: Excellent means of transpo
review: The best way to explore BKK is using BTS Most convenient and on time good way to avoid the worst traffic in the capital the stations are near the tourist attractions

title: Hassle free!!
review: Much recommended when you want to travel during peak hours when the roads are congested Frequency of trains is good and even as tourists we had no problem in commuting the staff is quite helpful in assisting you with directions to the various platforms and train stations

title: Best way to move around Bangkok
review: Well connected and around the clock  you just need to have enough change in Coins for buying tickets  If travelling more than 2 people its cheaper to take uber sometimes

title: Terminal 21 Mall to Siam Paragon Mall
review: It is my 1st time using BTS Skytrain from Terminal 21 Mall to Siam Paragon Mall  it was fun  Here are my  review about this public transportation  Ticket Price $ (very affordable)  Cleanliness ââââ  Safety & Security ââââ  Punctuality  ââââ  Cheers  Ken Tanone

title: Convenient public transport
review: Good choice of public transport to avoid the road jam at Bangkok just using the BTS rabbit card Another options are using Grab or Uber which much cheaper than the local transport "tuk tuk"

title: Convenient and quick
review: Riding the BTS was very convenient and easy to use Navigating around the city was safe and a breeze

title: Relialable city transportl, reasonable priced. But too packed sometimes in rush hours
review: Too packed sometimes in rush time Otherwise comfortable and with view to some av the attractions in the area if you have access to a window Easy access to major shopping centers from the skytrain stations Easy to buy tickets if you have 10 and 5 baht coins

title: The best connection
review: Since individuell travel within Bangkok is difficult and linked to a lot of traffic jam  BTS is a valuable alteranative to travel within your respective schedules

title: Reliable transportation
review: If you are travelling on your own in Bangkok this is almost a must for your to commute around (unless you have network with you to call Uber whenever you want) Despite being very crowded the cabins you can always squeeze in Cheap and reliable transportation

title: Convenient, reliable
review: Convenient for you to get around the city and it is reliable The fare is pretty cheap too suggest to get the Rabbit card if you plan to travel frequently via BTS

title: Getting around with views and cool
review: The skytrain has been around for a while now so for anyone who has not yet used it when visiting Bangkok give it a try You can buy tap on  tap off cards like those used in London or Sydney and the services are as frequent as most metros Most stations has escalators most but not all of the way up A few like the station near the weekend markets have lifts which work most of the time Ease frequency and the views are real pluses but frankly for a temperate climate person the chilly air con is a great relief from the days when I walked kilometres from one place to the other Of course the other must way to travel is the cheap express boats on the river  cool fast and a mix of travellers and normal city folk A couple of warnings for the uninitiated Try to avoid buying your Skytrain card in the middle of rush hour  I am always slow and that's an annoyance to the workers trying to get to work Also there are seats and spaces reserved for monks and it's the highest insult to ignore this

title: Common mass transit for Bangkok
review: Most convenient for those travel to and from center of Bangkok The longest waiting time between train is just 78 mins and during rush hour train come every 23 mins However during 745830 am travel to center of Bangkok is very crowded sometimes you might unable to get on the train

title: efficient
review: the skytrain is efficient compared to all the chaos going on around bangkok i used it to get around and was always fast

title: Airport to City center
review: Connectivity to the airport is excellent and airport has clear signage 45 Bhats from airport to Phayathai station From phayathai station take an interchange BTS station connecting almost to all the hotels

title: Easy to use
review: Forget the traffic and use the Skytrain Tickets can be obtained from automatic machines with instructions in English Staff at the change counter can also help The only downside is lots of stairs although most main stations have some escalators and lifts

title: A nice transportation alternative
review: Bangkok is one of the city with very bad traffic for me I'm Indonesian and used to be lived in Jakarta which also has a very bad traffic but I think Bangkok traffic is worse Anyway because the traffic is very bad BTS is a great and thoughtful transportation the Thailand government made It's very easy to use cheap and connected to all the places It also connected to most shopping places (malls) by a bridge The bridge is also wellmade and so thoughtful not a typical average bridge you'll think of It's widebig enough and beautifully designed Because it's very convenient a lot of people using BTS so you'll have a crowded train in busy hours or popular destination

title: Convenient, cheap and clean
review: Good connectivity good frequency and an easy way to travel within Bangkok The BRT also connects with the airport link metro and other commuter lines You can always take public transport and walk the last mile  Shops are conveniently located at each BRT station for food and drinks other basics

title: Thai BTS
review: A wonderfully costeffective commuting system in Bangkok Thailand However the tourism industry needs to advertise its use a bit more Starting with the airport BTS should advertise their service in every single mall and hotels

title: Excellent easy to use
review: Excellent easy to use and cheap A much better alternative to getting a taxi to the airport It tends to be busy at peak times

title: The most convenient way to travel in BKK
review: The traffic is very bad in Bangkok The most convenient way to travel in the city is by BTS Most shopping places will have a connecting bridge to the station Plus it's easy to hop between MRT and BTS

title: Great People Mover
review: The above ground BTS rail system is relatively new (to me) and easy to use by tourists It passes close to many of Bangkok's tourist sites including the Weekend Market and cross connects with the MTR and Airport train

title: Great transportation
review: What a great transportation in BKK very helpful to scape the traffic of BKK Safe and very cheap You can go almost everywhere with this transportation

title: Easy and simple!
review: Such an easy system to use Maps at every station so you can work out where you are going Easy to use ticket machines Cheaper and much quicker than using taxis and tuk tuks

title: Inconvenient payment
review: As much as bts is a newer system than metro the most common payment is still using coins to buy single ticket

title: Affordable and on time
review: Bangkok has both skytrain and underground metro trains  Skytrain stations were quite visible from street level  If you know the area you need to go there are maps at the station to show price and where you can get off  For tourists you cannot purchase "day" passes anymore Need to purchase for each trip  If you don't have coins the train station office will exchange for you but you cannot purchase your ticket with them Trips are affordable but there are times where the train cars are packed  even during nonpeak hours

title: quick & easy access within the city
review: it is best way to get around between one end of the BKK to the river side of the city Also inexpensive as well as the trips very quick and efficient Far easier than using taxi due to BKK congestion

title: Cool baby!
review: The best way to travel in Bangkok Air cobitioned fast no traffic and a real Thai experience Serious visitors need to buy a BTS card which can be preloaded with 100500 Baht and speeds through the entry barriers Tip  hold any luggage or shopping bags high to avoid bruised hips

title: Great way to travel
review: I only used it twice to get from Chakuchat markets to Siam and it was great I traveled alone and finding my way around different levels and different trains to get when I needed was easy

title: Everything is easy, simple and understandable.
review: Everything is easy simple and understandable The staff are friendly and will always help and prompt

title: So convenient in jammed Bangkok
review: The BTS is a great way to beat the traffic jams in Bangkok The frequency of the trains is great and it is so convenient to travel when compared to going around in a taxi

title: A convenient way to travel in Bangkok
review: My previous trip to Bangkok was in 2001 so during my recent visit I had decided to rely on the BTS system as my main mode of transport  It's a very comfortable and reliable transport service  beats being stuck in a traffic jam and the tropical heat  I will recommend buying a stored value card rather than single trip tickets That will save you lots of time standing in the queue especially during peak hours

title: The BEST way to do a mall trail
review: Take the BTS from Asoke (Terminal 21) to Chit Lom (Central) or Siam (ParagonSiam Central) and you're sorted for an exhaustive mall trail

title: Easy and affordable
review: The BTS skytrain is a great way to travel quickly and also cuts out the crazy traffic in Bangkok At times it's busy but it does not take huge amounts of time to get from AB and it's not expensive in the grand scheme of things In Bangkok it's 100% best way and most affordable way to travel

title: Used a few times - efficient cheap and air conditioned
review: Used many times including the large weekend market  Can get very busy but easy to navigate   Good alternative to Tuk Tuks

title: Great Travel Option
review: Used this service without notice because our Grab Taxi kicked us out due to traffic jam   I handed my phone with map to our hotel to girl in ticket booth who was very helpful Spoke good English and told us exactly what we needed to do Great Service ððð

title: Confused
review: we got lost when was trying the BTS for our journey back to hotel The staff was not friendly to assist Using Grab is almost the same price

title: Quick and easy even for tourists
review: We took the train from the airport into central Bangkok  this coat 135thb for three people rather than 800thb that we were advised a taxi would cost Very easy quick and nice to see the sights while on the way into the city

title: Riding the BTS during rush hours
review: We had to take the BTS from our hotel to our rendezvous point Being first timers we were a bit apprehensive since the appointed time to meet at 6pm put us right smack into the rush hour crowds at the train stations   Instructions were easy to follow thanks to the train line maps at the Chit Lom station where we boarded for our destination Had to change trains at Siam station had to go down two levels to catch our next ride at the South line going to Bang Wa The train stations were clean well lighted the people queuing up to the ticket machine were orderly and patient  As first timers it took us some time to figure out the money denomination to put the right amount into the machines only to find out the machines can give exact changes if neededamazing really Inside the train coach it was packed with locals rushing home and tourists going for night tours around the city The AC was up to speed easily providing cooling comfort inside the packed coach  Highly recommended a simple easy to follow inexpensive and convenient way to move around the city

title: easy and inexpensive
review: very easy and inexpensive for movement in the citybuy the card and load it full so you dont have to keep stopping to pay for each individual ride

title: Most convenient means of travel in Bangkok
review: I Traffic in Bangkok is miserable  It is a city hard to get around and without BTS train it is almost impossible to go places  Bangkok is a city with very poor planning full of very very long and deep alley  Some places are not accessible except by motor cycles for hire and you can see these service on every side street  easily spotted men with orange stripe vest  BTS has played important role for people to move around  You can put together travel plan from one destination to another using the combination of taxi (avoid tuk tuk  they do not use meter and price gouging is pervasive especially unsuspecting foreigners taxi has to use meter by law you do not have to bargain) Mahanakorn subways and BTS trains  You can purchase senior Rabbit card  I am not sure whether this is limited to Thai residents with deep discount fare  Try to avoid rush hours some of the popular line can be very crowded

title: Very cool
review: Cool and easy to use  if you know where you are and where are you going  otherwise it's a problem You can ask somebody or show the aria on the map and they would tell you what do you need It's ok if you use google map  Another thing is that you need to understand directions also there is another train and sometimes you need change in order to get where you need  Good luck

title: conveniences at its best
review: BTS is the best thing that we discovered during our trip its way cheaper faster and efficient if you want to move from one area to the next in no time BTS is your solution every 5mins one comes and another departs no traffic congestion hustle like the taxis no price change by tuk tuk drivers

title: Making it easy to get round Bangkok
review: The sky train provides a convenient and safe way to travel around Bangkok Trains can be crowded at peak times but are clean and reliable In addition to names the stations also have numbers and it is worth using a map with both as it makes it easier  Tickets are purchased at machines which are simple to use  There are also customer service kiosks with staff though these seem to give you change for the machine but not issue any tickets

title: Cool clean way to see the city.
review: Used the SkyTrain slot during a week in Bangkok It's always reliable and clean Very impressed by this transport system

title: Not enough train
review: they must add more train in peak hours it is too dense however the train is clean and air condition is great

title: Only used once
review: Used the sky train to come back from the weekend market to our hotel Easy to use the staff were very helpful and told us where to change trains Trains were clean and graffiti free (as you would expect)

title: Clean
review: Good transplantation in Bangkok  It is very convenient to travel around the city most  of exit connect with mall

title: Good transportation in Bangkok
review: Bangkok BTS is the most convenient mode of transport to travel around  Majority of the stations are linked with i name it world class bridges in Bangkok  Bangkok has many bridges that link from BTS stations to shopping malls to avoid rain and hot sun and also the forever heavy traffic  It has good frequency of trains coming and going  It is always full of people  I would also praise the people in Bangkok that they are very well mannered  They queue no rush no pushing and no body contact even when the train is super pack  Cheap train fares and easy to purchase ticket  No coins no worry change with the counter staff    It would be good to stay in a hotel near BTS because it brings you to most places in Bangkok and the route map is easy to understand too

title: Excellent
review: Excellent way of getting around the city Quick clean convenient and cheap for most places Sometimes a short walk necessary to final destination but normally not too far

title: Travel from one location to another. Helps to travel faster and quick in case of urgency, Very flexible, services is ver
review: Fantastic very air free comfortable seat enough space neat relax protocol welcoming respect time fast save enjoyable

title: Runs on time and works great
review: I have never had much trouble on the bts It works great most times and travel is a breeze The signages are easy enough to use

title: Fast and fun
review: It is the fastest way getting around town clean with airconditioning It is also sight seeing fun ride

title: Efficient form of transportation
review: Trains are punctual and are not really crowded ( except peak periods )  Trains are also well ventilated however train stations are sometimes a little dirty and very very hot

title: Best to use in BKK city
review: as BKK traffic is heavy at most time Avoid peak hours 810am 68pm and especially Siam station Most covenient if travelling far and especially with a group of above 4 people

title: Easiest Mode of Transportation in Bangkok
review: Definitely a must mode of transportation for while in Bangkok  Of course you must try the Tuk Tuk but the BTS lines are super easy to use and inexpensive

title: Bangkok Airport Skytrain
review: Typical of mass transport in Bangkok  Very straightforward to obtain tickets good frequency of trains good quality of service  easy access at all stations and good connections to Thai mainline rail stations MRT and BTS  Fares are no more expensive than the BTS given the distance travelled and the time saved  Easy enough to hail a taxi or a tuk tuk at the stations

title: Surprising easy to use
review: Very easy to use english is used throughout signs and announcements and ticketing system is very straight forward   Tip  Google Maps has this transport system included in it and it can tell you how much the fare will cost

title: Fast way to get to the city
review: We arrived in Bangkok around 330 pm and the train was a nice way to escape the city's caothic traffic We went all the way to Paya Thai and took a taxi there around 4pm  to our hotel near Kao San paid around 110 Baht

title: Cost and time efficient to travel around Bangkok
review: Pros 1 Save time avoiding the infamous congested traffic in BKK (see the first photo) 2 Value for money travelling cost compared to taxi 3 No hassle of bargaining with tuk tuk and taxi drivers Cons 1 Very crowded be cautious of pick pocket 2 Be prepared for the long Q at the ticketing counters and machines (see the 2nd photo)

title: Slow train
review: Slow glide along BKK skyline It's nice that they always maxed out the AC on the train because the weather outside was always humid

title: All day $5 transportation
review: The stations were clean and staff helpful I used on many days to cross the whole city Reliable trains every few minutes

title: Too many steps
review: The Skytrain is on 2 levels The first level can only be accessed by steps (unless you are lucky and your hotel links straight to this level) With a small child in a push chair it was very hard to get up You get your tickets on this level and it is also possible to use this level to walk to different part of the city missing all the traffic  The trains are accessed on the second level Again lots of stairs but this time there are lifts but most of them don't work   You cannot eat or drink on the platform or trains and this is strictly enforced For a city that is around 30degC with 100% humidity this seams strange as not drinking could easily lead to dehydration  The trains themselves are clean blessedly cool and fast One thing to watch out for is some station (one near the river) only have one platform which services trains going both ways So watch out for the train destination on the front of the train (there are no other signs to tell you which train is coming next or where it is headed)

title: Efficient
review: Great system Easy to use and very cheap Staff helpful Can be busy but felt really safe Does not cover lots of the city for example to see the palace then plan

title: Very nice!
review: A great way to travel in bangkok  always on schedule no delays It as air condition what is great  and itÂ´s not expensive

title: Fast efficient and easy to use.
review: The BTS is super easy to use The staff selling tickets speak good English and are helpful with directions The trains are very efficient but a little crowded  Would definitely recommend giving it a try to travel around Bangkok

title: Ratchathevi Station
review: Very convenient  For a firsttime visitor to Bangkok it is not that difficult to go around Bangkok if you take the BTS  Highly recommended and within budget

title: Good way to get around town
review: The first time I went to Bangkok I only took Taxis However the Skytrain is a much cheaper in some cases also faster way to get around town as you won't be stuck in traffic Also with 30 to 40 bath it is much cheaper

title: Affordable and convenient
review: Run early in the morning until midnight Cheapest way to see a lot of Bangkok without killing the wallet in taxis and tuk tuks

title: Efficient but over crowded.
review: The BTS is a very good way to get around Bangkok quicker than car as the roads are congested It can very packed and you sometimes have to wait for another train to fit in

title: Quick and easy to use, reasonably priced too
review: Don't be concerned about not speaking the local language help is available and if you speak English all information is provided in English too We were not the only nonlocals to use the Skytrain and felt safe and comfortable at all times  The Skytrain is air conditioned too so nice to travel on  The trains are frequent and clean onboard

title: Clean, Cheap, Efficient
review: 1100 of the taxiprice an quicker plus fresher then any other from of transport  Plus one gets the extra tour of the town for free

title: Cheap and Convenient
review: This is the best way to travel in Bangkok It's really cheap and convenient to have fun It leaves every 5 minutes   Please go with the BTS if you want to avoid from the traffic james on the road

title: Versatile
review: Whilst in Bangkok recently we used the skytrain to go and visit the Grand Palace It was an easy way to get to the water taxi you can either get single tickets or a day pass The advantage of the day pass is you can hop on and off as many times as you like for that day

title: Rapid way to go to Silom Road and Siam Square area.
review: By going with Sky Train we can go to the central of Bangkok easier eg Silom Road Siam Square MBK Chatuchak Central World BITEC and can connect to MRT or Airport Rail Link

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Fantastic service and very efficient system trains arriving around every four mins So if you miss one not long till the next

title: Getting around Bangkok is easy
review: Most awesome way to get around but if you're more than 2 and have the time taxi is cheaper If you feel immortal motorcycle taxis are cheapest and quickest

title: A great way to Commute
review: It is a very good means of public transport and connect almost all Bangkok  rates are very Reasonable and effective Very comfortable

title: Simple ride to local market.
review: I used the sky train to get around and it was very simple and straightforward Very much like metro in Brooklyn

title: Excellent transport
review: Perfect way to get are Bangkok cool and refreshing and cheep way to travel Dont be afraid to explore Bangkok on it

title: Transpoet
review: Can get a bit confusing but great transport system I do not remember this when I was backpacking around Thailand years ago

title: Easy fast and cheap
review: So easy to use the sky train to get around Bangkok exactly like any other Metro They are currently developing a link to the west side of the city across the river which we thought would have been useful as we couldn't get over the river during our visit (time constrained)

title: Best mode of transportation
review: No better way to see the city and for fast friendly service I would highly recommend the BTS sky train forget about taxis the city is gridlocked 247 I have never seen so many cars and motorbikes in one place before Take all the stress out of the equation and use the sky train you won't regret it

title: My doughter love it
review: We enjoyed with the trip in skytrain Very easy to find and go And you can save time as trafiic is terrible in bkk

title: Great views of the city
review: We spent a day using the BTS after purchasing a day ticket (I think it was 140 bht each) just to do some sightseeing around Bangkok lovely fridge like temperature upon the BTS which is an added bonus Very easy to use and well organised system to board and get off the train electronic maps that show stations yet to visit along the line in green and visited stations in red so really easy to navigate All announcements are in Thai and English again making the BTS simple to use if you're not in a rush you can wait for the next train if the carriage is busy It does get really busy after 4pm We also used Taxis and Tuk Tuk's in Bangkok and the BTS was by far the quickest way to travel the city as well as having a welcome break from the heat

title: Brilliant & infuriating
review: The BTS is a great way to get around certain parts of Bangkok and by looking out of the window you sometimes get a glimpse of what the city looked like before most of the gardened traditional homes got torn down to make way for malls & condos Of course the arrival of the BTS (and the network is expanding rapidly) merely serves to speed up this process as land prices close to stations skyrocket Consequently some of the most unspoilt parts of the city are where the BTS has not arrived Avoid morning and evening rush hour if you can and don't expect any personal interaction everyone's phone is 20 cm from their face Some stations interchange with the MRT (underground) but confusingly the stations have different names

title: Travel to Bangkok for eveing foodie tour
review: Very efficient and clean transport can be crowded (a bit like the London tube network) and could possibly be a bit confusing if you were 'going it alone' the first time you used it

title: very good service
review: The sky train takes all of the hassle out of Bangkok traffic Cheap efficient and air conditioned it also offers roof top views of the city

title: The best way to move around
review: Every single ride I took with the BTS was a breeze Literally the air con will keep you cool no matter the heat outside The transit itself is smooth and easy to understand Definitely the best way to move around Bangkok

title: Travel with public transport in Bangkok
review: The BTS and MRT have become extremely popular On a normal Saturday they were packed to the last person No wonder because Bangkok traffic is horrible   When in Bangkok travel under up or on the water ð

title: Way to avoid rain & easy access
review: Much bettet alternative during peak hours to avoid sitting jams for hours Very comfortable easy access and well managed Payment could be easier as if you haven't exact change then need to go to cashier

title: Good way for quick moving in Bangkok .
review: First  it's clean  Specially when you are used to European urban transports  Not a tag  not a paper on the ground or in the cars No rush  queue well organized and respected by the people  Fast between two remote areas of the city  No stressed people  Well  A good way to travel in this huge city with a very heavy traffic

title: convenient
review: We used this train few times to travel in BangkokIts better and faster than road travel because of traffic on the road Elders and disabled too are using these trains So the responsible  people must take interest The stairs are  easy for young and able onlyI wish the young generation will be able to communicate with the tourist  in the near future

title: BTS - easy to ride but need to buy tokens early
review: BTS is way of life in Bangkok(BKK) Runs above ground and needs coins to buy ticket So important to always have coins available During peak hour line for buying ticket can take 15 minutes So either buy extra tickets early or buy a multiday ticket BTS is crowded and air conditioning is not sufficient The MRT (subway) is another form of public transportation Much faster and spacious

title: fast and easy
review: this is one of the best and cheapest ways to get around Bangkokit is easy to use and many people are around to help you find your way

title: A great way to trael
review: We enjoyed the sky train it is a much quicker way to get around as the city is so busy that you can't move in the taxiThe train is very clean and efficient

title: Good value for money
review: Very useful but it could be a problem if you have trouble with stairs we found not all stations had easy access

title: Clean & Fast
review: It was much cleaner then the Sky train in Some of train in london and it is fast The only turn down is must wait so long to get the coins and again must put them in machine to get a final ticket Took me 20 mins but train was nice

title: Best in Bangkok
review: The BTS is superbly routed and is 100% reachable to most tourist attraction Well done Thailand on building such marvelous trains as Bangkok traffic jam is not a joke at all  Low cost high frequency clean and punctual one of the best public transport I had used in South East Asia  But one thing make it still weak which is the elevator does not work  All of the BTS i stop non of the elevator works   So I guess this BTS is not wheel chair accessible  Little shame on that

title: Best mode to commute in and around the main area of Bangkok
review: Best mode to commute and cut traffic hassles in main area of Bangkok Connects the prime shipping area and the stay areas of Sukhumvit

title: Very effective, but extremely croweded in rush hours. (be careful with small children)
review: Traveling with the BTS is an experience in itself It is a highly effective way of travelling in Bangkok but kids may get intimidated by the immense number of commuters during rush hour

title: Quick way of getting around Bangkok
review: Travelling around city quick cheap and easy on the BTS Friendly and helpful staff Both trains and stations immaculately clean Good displays on where you are We used them practically all the time and also connected to other train line If your using baby strollers best avoid rush hours To access ticket offices and trains you might have to use the stairs as not all stations have escalators This can be solved sometimes by using the shopping mall escalators

title: BTS Sky train
review: We have been many times in Bangkok and this time we decided to use the SKYTRAIN  This is definitely teh BEST way to move fast in a spotless environment  in Bangkok all day long

title: Quick and clean
review: Great to use for getting around Bangkok Would recommend buying a ticket from a person rather than a machine as they can help with the decision making on the right ticket

title: Fast efficient transportation
review: The trains are kept very clean and staff are constantly sweeping and cleaning between each full run to and from airport Very packed at times and airport staff have to limit number of people getting on If you don't mind standing if you have to it's a quick cost effective way to many train stations from the airport

title: Cheap and convenient mode of transportation to get around in Bangkok.
review: Use BTS train instead of taxi to move around in Bangkok city It is cheaper and faster then taxi due to the traffic jams A adult store value card costs 200 Thai baht to purchase

title: Superb mode of transportation
review: I love to travel by BTS skytrain superb view of city and cheap and fast The only thing required that you should know where to go

title: Efficient system.
review: A economic and efficient way to travel in Bangkok Help is available around when in doubt  Get tickets at the machines or at the ticketing booth Have coins ready or you can get them at the booth too

title: Clean and punctual
review: The sky train system works very well for tourists and commuters alike During rush hours some trains are very crowded but on average this mode of transportation is comfortable

title: Amazing experience!!!
review: Fantastic experience Very quick and efficient way of traveling around Bangkok  if the train line is where you want to go  Amazing views when traveling above busy streets of Bangkok Highly recommended  Always buy your tickets over the counter as there will be someone to guide you which ticket to buy plus they will accept most types of payments Machines for self check in only accept coins  Also if you want to keep the ticket for your scrap book you have to ask someone to let you out without putting the ticket through the machine at the other end of your journey or simply take a pic of your ticket

title: Great way to move around BKK!
review: For a tourist Time is precious too precious to waste inside a cab idling in Bkk traffic Using the expansive network of BTS is the way to see the sights of BKK end to end more cheaply One MOST noticeable thing a PLEASANT attribute of BTS you feel safe as there are no teenage gypsies out to slash your bag or snatch your wallet as you enter the stations or stand on the platformsa usual bane of the modern subways in Europe But still better to be ever vigilant as a tourist in any strange country

title: Good service but poor disabled access
review: Low cost frequent good display of where you are but lots of steps up to the ticket offices and more steps up to the trains We didn't see many lifts

title: Best way to get around the city.
review: Thankful for the BTS transportation Getting around the city during rush hour can take hours to get to your destination where the BTS will only take minutes

title: Great service from the airport
review: Couldn't fault the BTS Skytrain An efficient affordable and cheap way for tourists to travel around The only issue is that it doesn't run in the "touristy" areas such as the Koh San Road near the palace etc Was lucky that my hostel was near a BTS stop so was able to hop on at the airport and get to the hotel within 25 mins Dream public transport

title: Thailand has got this right!
review: While in Thailand we were able to save quite a bit of money and time (the roads are so busy when you get a taxi) using their rail network  The MRT and BTS have been set up to be very accessible and easy to use  we were very impressed with Thailand's ability to move some many people around and we found it all very easy to understand (as a couple that can only speak English)  1  Don't stress if you miss the train there will be another one in a matter of minutes 2  When you purchase your travel card (BTS or token on MRT) the first time just scan your cardtoken and then on exit put it into the turnstile slot  Plan where you need to go and then you can like all rail networks they will call out the approaching stations on route  You may also need to move across train networks (some areas are serviced by the MRT and others by the BTS)  It is really way more stress free than getting a taxi as there are no language barriers and you know exactly how much it will cost you before you set off  Happy trails and enjoy Bangkok

title: Excellent public transportation
review: I lived in BKK for 3 years and used the BTS and MRT (subway) as much as possible Clean comfortable easy to use and inexpensive way to get around the city Avoid rush hour

title: Excellent
review: If only I could carry this excellent transport system back to Ireland with me Fast convenient and easy to use

title: First Skytrain Experience
review: BTS is a very good reliable public transportation We took it a few times during our first time visit to Bangkok  Someone in a counter can exchange your money for coins if you need to buy tickets There are different rates depending on your start & end destination  You have to buy for each individual  It is very clean air conditioned & very nice to walk into after walking under the hot sun & high humidity   I will definitely recommend to visitors to use

title: Very quick and easy - does get full though!
review: Very easy to get around and cheap  Takes coins or notes  We went from national stadium to seven stops for 42 baht  We were slow at hopping on so had to stand but that was ok Got very full very quickly Trains travelled every 3 Â½ minutes at that time of the day

title: Well connected
review: It's the easiest way to move around and to reach on time As bangkok is always with lot of traffic avoid taxi it's take a long time to reach anywhere you want

title: Very convenient
review: This is the best way to move around in Bangkok Although in the evenings it got too crowded yet liked moving around in it

title: Too crowded
review: The BTS is a fast and a cheap way to travel in Bangkok but the trains are crowded all day which will ease the muggings the tariff of a single journey is not fixed for example most of metro services will charge on a single journey but BTS will charge depending on the station and their auto machine will take only coins I waited on the line to buy a ticket and when I reached the employee gave me coins and asked me to use the machine

title: fastest transport in Bangkok - nice view - freezing cold
review: Traffic in Bangkok is one of the worst in the world Even if you have your own car or get a taxi if you're passing through the city centre (or basically anywhere in BKK) you'll get stuck waiting loooooong time SkyTrain passes through the main attractions in the city and central area with which you can skip the traffic What I like most is that it's fast and independent than the terrible traffic Also I liked the fact that it goes very high so you have a very nice view of the city ) The bad thing is that it's always freezing cold inside the trains Imagine Bangkok having a tropical climate outside temperatures are mostly warm (let's say around 2530 C) and humid so you sweat outside And then you enter the train which is around 15 C It's a big change But anyways that's the only downside  In rush hours when it's very crowded you'll see people make a very proper queue to get into the trains so proper that I have never seen in any other city (having traveled to 60 countries) I appreciate that a lot   If you're staying in BKK for a while better but one of these cards which you can pop up It's much easier to use this Your other option is to pay for 1ride but in this case you'll mostly be waiting in a long line to get your ticket (there's almost always line) and then you should also define where you'll get off and pay accordingly However with the card you pop up you can get off anytime you want It'll take the money according to how many stations you traveled (you show the card at the exit gates too so that it knows)

title: Efficient
review: Great way to get around busy bangkok I was staying in main Sukhumvitand used this service numerous timesvery cleanvery organized

title: Comfortable and easy to access, so choose your location wisely
review: Use google maps to see if your Hotel is located within walking distance Some Hotels offer a shuttle which is convenient

title: Good!
review: We moved from Siam to Chatuchak market It's cheap and easy to buy a tickets staff are helpful too  They helped us to change from cash to coin and used machine to issue oneway tickets  On sunday there are few people It's comfortable and fast Announcement by English is convenient but volumn needs to be louder

title: So easy to use
review: This is a great way to get around We bought our swipe card and loaded it up Everywhere you'll find maps charge stations and friendly people to help you get to the right platform When you get to the platform the barriers only open once the train has stopped The trains are beautifully airconditioned and are kept clean and most display or announce the next station And nice and easy way to travel

title: Best ride if you do not want to stuck in traffic!
review: The BTS Skytrain services are a long overdue but already established features urgently needed in Bangkok In the near future more lines will be opened I comment only on the Sukhumvit line (Green Line) as it connects the most places in the business and shopping center of Bangkok The prices are decent and quite cheap in western terms However the infrastructure lacks behind as more and more people (after its extension farther south) are using this transport It is recommended especially when you travel with luggae kids etc to avoid its service during rush hours  6am10am and 5pm930pm as it is packed with people  The BTS management is unfortunately very profit oriented  as can be seen for all the commercial noise pollution they produce within and outside the train and its station  and reluctant to extend the carriages and frequencies required during rush hours Hence its very uncomfortable to travel on the trains during these times

title: Bangkok sky train
review: Highly impressed with travellers queuing to get on train in an orderly fashion and no pushing or shoving involved Fast and clean

title: One must experience in Thailand
review: Bangkok has all the possible transport facilities from Tuk Tuk to Sky Train this expereince is really good and gives one the opportunity to have a birds eye view of the city

title: Great Skytrain
review: The BTS is fast and efficient  We have a skytrain system at home and it is not as good as this one  The BTS is the most efficient method of transportation to get around Bangkok  I do not worry about getting lost in the city  We love using the rabbit transit card to get around It sure beats using cash to pay for your rides

title: something different
review: The Roads were not moving so instead of a taxi we thought why not take the train as in all countrys no one talks to each other anymore so its the same here bucket list tick

title: trains run frequently.
review: Cheap way to traveldoes get a bit congested at busy timeswe used it daily for dental visitsgood experience to travel with the locals

title: Great system
review: Very easy train system to use and to get around we loved it but be warned it gets crowded at times So be prepared for a push and a shove sometimes

title: Travel with Rabbit card
review: Very convenient to travel with BTS in Bangkok   To save your time in buying tickets get the rabbit card & charge it with some amount (may be 500 Thb)  Rabbit card can be used at many other locations  food courts  coffee shops etc

title: Great way to get around!
review: I was hesitant about taking the sky train as i have had confusing experiences with the metro in foreign countries Not this one It is super easy to understand and read and there are lots of friendly employees there to help out with questions You just pick your end destination pay the fee (which is very cheap) and off you go This is a great alternative sometimes as the traffic in Bangkok can be quite congested at any time of day My only draw back was that I didn't use it the entire time I was in Bangkok

title: So easy
review: Bangkok skytrain is great to get around Bangkok also great from airport to city we have used it on several occasions better than taxi and quicker

title: 4D3N
review: Been to BKK so many time finally get to try the BTS to terminal 21 Well purchase of ticket and check on station to go is easy from the control station staff is very friendly and nice   Most important the fare is cheaper compare to the rest of the transportation in BKK  BUT my advise is do not try BTS IF you are in a hurry to some where and happen to carry Lot of shopping bag Cos during the peak timing the crowd is unbelievable Please please follow the Q cos the local will Q up to go in the train  Other than that the BTS system always on time   Enjoy

title: Very efficent way to travel in Bangkok
review: Very quick way to travel around Bangkok & no traffic jams Once you work out the system it is very easy to get around Extremely clean & well kept trains

title: time saving transport
review: this is really a good way to travel in Bangkok as traffic is always bad its neat and clean and cheap also compare to other western countries

title: cheap, clean and efficient
review: Great way to get around town  easy to use and the airconditioning is most welcome on hot days  Only used for short distances but could see many using it for airport and hotel connections

title: Quick, clean efficient service
review: Easy to read  use maps Purchase your tickets from the ticket machines and follow the destination arrows to your platform Board the train which are air conditioned and clean The stops come over the audio system in Thai and English Superb way to get around

title: a little crowded but efficient
review: seems that rush hour in Bangkok lasts all day trains are not that fast but quicker than the traffic below trains are often full but the air conditioning works well

title: Good public transport
review: BTS is very useful fast and affordable The System should be made bigger You can also combine it with boats

title: Very efficient
review: Fastest way to get around the city  Road transport of any manner gets you stuck in horrible traffic

title: Fast
review: Fast and easy best way to go around downtown Bangkok except in the morning when everyone is rushing to work

title: Fast, packed
review: But aircon was strong so it was such a relief from the heat The stops were convenient enough to the more popular touristshopping locations

title: Convenient but limited reaxh
review: Great for getting to the main areas of the city but relatively limited with only two linestracks And as always very busy around rush hour

title: Great skytrain!
review: The train is quite convenient that avoids all the jam   It stops at all hot locations for tourists and just purchase the card for easier travel The card can be returned when you leave

title: A great way to travel
review: My wife and I found the BTS was the best way to get around Bangkok on our recent visit We got a Rabbit card at the start of our trip and it made it so easy to jump on and off along the way   We picked a place to stay that was close to one of the stations to make it convenient for us each day And there is a lot to see and do that is within easy walking distance from each station at the other end

title: Good service. Fast reliable and comfortable
review: I couldn't use the self service machine to get my ticket but there are staff in counter and they sell the tickets to you  Service is comfortable and timely Saves a lots of time But not comfortable to carry lots of luggage

title: Quick, clean and cool
review: This is a great way to get around as it connects most parts of the city You can connect to the MRT underground at a variety of stations as well as the airport rail link it's a quick and cheap way of getting from airport to central Bangkok ( Siam or chit lom) around   70Bht The line now goes across the river to Bang Wa so staying on that side is no longer an issue if you want to get to the central shopping and eating destinations or if you want to catch the boat services on the river from other arias of the city  The service runs until midnight and is quick clean and a welcome break from the heat and humidity( especially in September) if you plan on using it a lot you may benefit from buying a day pass be aware that this only lets you use the BTS and not the MRT or other transportation in the city

title: Ideal way to travel
review: Do note that that ticketing machine only accepts coins So you have to queue at the ticketing office to get small change and then queue again at the ticketing machine to purchase tickets Be mindful to check your change at the ticketing office as the officers have a habit of short changing your 100 baht with only 80  85 baht change

title: Clean and efficient
review: Travelling on the BTS was easy Only grouse was the stored value card we bought cannot be used  on their MRT station

title: Skytrain
review: Trains are punctual and airconditioned Although we travelled at peak times the carriages were not too crowded  Used a day travel card as such made several journeys

title: Very quick and clean transport
review: Very clean and quick mode of transport while in Bangkok We used during peak hours to avoid traffic jams

title: Travel easy
review: The BTS is a nice and cheap way to travel around BangkokIt can be crowded during rush hour but still easy

title: Comfortable
review: When the temperature outside is so hot the fresh spot to stay fresh  the security are so friendly with you they give all information what you need

title: best convenient transportation mean in BKK
review: skytrain is connecting most interesting places in centre Bangkok It is a really convenient mean to get everyway  you can get day fare

title: Excellent way to get around
review: No smoking or drinking allowed Crowded during rush hour but people are very nice The people who work here are very helpful I had a low sugar diabetic issue and the people on the tram helped a great deal and then the staff were VERY helpful It doesn't go as far as you would like but you can use is and then use a taxi (horrible traffic)

title: Clean , always on time
review: if you are alone and want to go on time  this is for you Bangkok traffic is horrible never took taxi on morning and in evening BTS is the only way

title: Easy to use and frequent service
review: The BTS is easy to navigate as a tourist Everything is written in English and well signed The trains are cheap modern and run every few minutes The only difficulty was for my aunt who has bad knees she found the stairs a little difficult at times

title: Quick and Easy
review: Used the Sky Train on numerous occasions whilst staying in Bangkok for 8 days Make sure you get your ticket prior to using the train and you will find that some machines only take coins or notes but not both  Depending where you get on and get off you might find the trains very busy and at one point I thought I was going to be squashed as the train was so packed   The trains were exceptionally clean and you are not allowed to eat drink or smoke on trains

title: It's good
review: I've been in Bangkok for 2 days This is the 1st time I try BTS Train in Bangkok Too easy to find and follow my route the receptioner is too friendly and helpful

title: Best way to travel
review: Great way to get around but try to avoid peek hour as it is very popular with all commuters Can get very crushie

title: Convenient and great when it's not peak time
review: BTS operate from 6am to midnight Very convenient way to travel Air conditioned cooled carriages The only problem is that it does not go to many places of interest  Don't hesitate to ask the station staff for help They are always very helpful

title: Public transportation
review: Easy to use and very affordable We only used it from r brief ride but the train station is accessible

title: Easy to use
review: This is useful for getting around Bangkok as the traffic is horrendous The sky trains are clean & efficient It's best to get a transit card so that you don't have to queue at the station for your fare The senior discount is for Thai nationals

title: Efficient, frequent, vast...
review: Using the BTS in Bangkok is a smart easy move for travellers and locals alike The implementation of this (plus the MRT) has changed the air quality and climate in this amazing city You can get to many places (eg Chatachuk market Chao Praya river watssights) there are frequent trains and it's pretty cheap One caveat is that you need different cards for the MRT v BTS it would be nice to see the city combine these (plus busses) into one userfriendly system

title: Very crowded during peak hours
review: Easy and affordable access in Bangkok city centre Great way to beat the horrendous traffic jams Aircon in the cabins are powerful to combat bangkok's heat

title: Easy to get around!
review: Very easy to get around on the trains I think it's the most reliable too (don't take the public buses) Not too expensive either Definitely recommend the train if a taxi isn't viable (taxi fares add up)

title: Efficient and cheap
review: Its the easiest and cheapest way to get around Bangkok and its very convenient too Its an overground train that ha two lines connecting the heart of te City

title: Very convenient
review: A very easy and time saving transport to roam around Bangkok city It is also low cost Train is available in every 23 mins

title: perfect way to get around
review: at first a little confusing but the principle is very simple I often go for the day pass for 140 baht so in the evening I don't have to wait to get a ticket costs a little more but saves time and hassle

title: Great way to get around
review: I would definitely recommend taking the sky train to get around Bangkok It is reasonably priced and avoids the congested roads

title: Safe and fast...
review: This is one of the most modern  and safe train systems I have ever used  If you are staying in Bangkok a little bit longer then I would advise getting a rabbit card  which you just top up and swipe when using the bts  sky train

title: Good Mode Of Transportation
review: The easiest way to get around Bangkok and avoiding the jam of the city Easy to navigate and get you to most place

title: Great for getting around
review: Staying at a hotel with access to the BTS was a life saver We were able to get to any place we wanted to visit without have to pay for a taxi motorcycle taxi It does get crowed during certain parts of the day so be ready to be squished Its pretty cheap to ride

title: easy, cheap and convenient
review: BTS is the way to travel Bangkok use it to save time and move Bangkok is well connected by the BTS network and all tourist attraction are served well Dont miss the ride

title: MUST USE TRANSPORT FOR SOLO BACKPACKER
review: BTS is convenient as public transport It can be linked to many areas in bangkok The price is reasonable and it is easy to get the ticket

title: Very good and cheap mode of transport offering most modern transport experience
review: Bts is a very good choice for travelersas it is very cheap and you can move to the important place of Bangkok easily by bts It took only 74 baht for myself and my wife to get to platinum fashion mall from phra khanong sukhumvit sitation So very cheap

title: Can't beat for value.
review: This is the best way to travel around Bangkok so easy and lovely and clean  Even during the rush times it is peacful )

title: Convenient but must buy the Rabbit cards
review: Bangkok is always traffic jam  BTS can bring you most of the tourist places  The platform is nonairconditioned but the train provides sufficient aircondition to make you feel good (or sometime cold during nonpeak hours)  If you need to take several rides you must buy the Rabbit card  It costs THB200 with THB100 nonrefundable and THB100 ticket value  But it avoids you to queuing up for buying tickets especially during peak time or at stations after visiting tourist places eg Asiatique

title: This is the fastest and easiest way to travel in Bangkok
review: The train only two railways in both direction so it is not at all hard to get on and get to your destination Just FYI when asking some of the agents they do not understand one gave us wrong direction so I mapped quest the direction but also if you have internet you can use your phone and it gives you each stop you need before getting off and on So very helpful tool I have to say this was extremely easy to travel by train and took you to all the stops for different attractions The train rides were 1560 baht which is anywhere from $25$125 each ride which is not bad at all Plus the traffic in Bangkok is horrific Unless you have a tutu it still can be difficult and your stuck to go a few miles so the train came in very handy during the high traffic hours

title: Travel in thailand
review: The easiest way to get around especially if you don't have a long stay Clean and comfortable Staff on trains friendly and helpful

title: Easy way to travel around the city
review: I found navigating my way around the BTS to be quite easy and it is a very efficient service I would absolutely recommend this as a way to get around th city with ease

title: Very Easy to use
review: We traveled from the pier to shopping centre and it was very easy clear signs and helpful people in the ticket office

title: excellent travel saves time, saves money
review: very nice travelling Self ticketing from one station to another quick journey Saves times saves energy and saves money

title: Traveling made easy
review: Forget the taxi BTS is the best way to get around Bangkok congested traffic  And it's air conditioned

title: Convenient Travel
review: New machines have been installed at most station (observed 1 per station)  it now accepts notes Older machines only accept coins so do keep coins on hand if you need to keep purchasing 1 way BTS Tickets

title: Efficient and Cheap way to get around
review: The 2 BTS lines pretty much covered the main shopping districts in Bangkok it is efficient clean and affordable Best of all the popular malls are connected with walk ways so you hardly have to get to street level to move around malls It get a little crowded during rush hours but it is still manageable With the interchanges with MRT it will get you near many other popular places such as Chatuchak Or Kor Tor market Ratchada Train Market Chinatown etc

title: Pretty user friendly -
review: given that you should have a rabbit card otherwise you need to queue up for coins then tickets esp in station like Asok

title: Good
review: Once we figured out how to use it it was great way to get around the city We used the skytrain and tuk Turks the most The sky train is super cheap

title: Excelent Transportation
review: Very clean station Has a nice wifi connection Always On time The price is cheap with very good service

title: Excellent way to get around Bangkok
review: I love using the Skytrain to get around Bangkok  Clean quick cheap and easy to use  The best way to get around Bangkok

title: Use it
review: Easy to use Get yourself a rabbit preload Card even if your in town for just a couple of days Great to travel on and better than traffic in a taxi ( and who knows what u pay) just endure your hotel is near a bts station and your time in bkk wil be so much easier and go to more places

title: Great Way to Move About
review: Easy to navigate and move about the city  You may purchase day tickets  Please note they stop running around midnight and at fivesix o'clock as everywhere in the world is super crowded so plan accordingly  The individual ticket machines are manageable just make sure you have some some small denomination bills handy

title: Great way to get around
review: Great way to get around Bangkok as well as seeing the city from above    Cheaper than taxis and cool air conditioning ð

title: Efficient mode of transport in Bangkok
review: This is the best way to get around Bangkok  So efficient so clean so modern and affordable  Never disappoints  This is my favourite mode of transport in the city of angels

title: Clean, efficient, cheap and air-conditioned
review: Easy to get around  clean efficient cheap and airconditioned  beats all of the traffic jams and gets you from A to B

title: Amazing infrastructure
review: You feel like you're in Blade Runner as you glide through the city streets above the congested highways and inbetween the buildings

title: Wonderful communication
review: No traffic jam smooth communication throughout the city  Ticketing findings routes are very easy Moreover excess to different reputed shopping malls are very convenient

title: Use it !!
review: We loved this experience Comfort  accessibility  price & convenience all combines is what this is all about Could be little tricky unless you know your way I have seen people traveling up & down without knowing their way out But really nice staff & use it is all I would like to tell you

title: Good mode of transport
review: Good affordable and convenient form of transport Used the sky train to travel to other parts of Bangkok Recommended mode of transport for all However be prepared for crowds at popular stations

title: Good option
review: Sky train is a good option to explore thailand  Simply read the map and choose where to go n get off  The officer are helpfull n im impress they are serve the different ability so nice  Bravokepp going

title: Very useful and worry free for getting around
review: Best way to travel around inner and outer Bangkok by far Best to purchase a ticket card from the booths then mess around with coins at the machines when traveling Also found buying my return ticket at my destination saved a lot of time especially during normal peak hour times Traveling as a family the BTS was very convenient safe and cheap compared to other forms of transport

title: Best way to travel
review: Very comfortable and punctual Best way to travel in Bangkok Quite easy to find way through route maps and area maps at all stations

title: What you need in BK
review: The Bangkok BTS Skytrain was very convenient while you are in busy crowded city The service was smooth helpful in English communication cheap and offered map to roam around is the most awesome and we always stick with them

title: Easy and fast way to move around the city
review: BTS is clean cheap on time and it stops or connects with all the important destination Taking a taxi or uber in Bangkok is a nightmare You'll be stuck in traffic for hours The BTS is the best transportation method

title: good
review: convenient to go to certainmost places   have come to bangkok many times and always taking the BTS )

title: confusing--but fun.
review: Very confusing the first time I got on the wrong train went to wrong place and cost more money getting back A gentleman did walk me thru how to do the paying and figure out the correct train then I had a blast be aware some trains are crammed full and are standing room only

title: Very accessible
review: We ride this all time Very accessible from places to places and very affordable also  It is very clean and friendly personnels

title: Efficient and easy to use
review: Very easy to navigate Fast and effienct service Can get very busy so choose your travel times Stops outside the large shopping malls

title: Model trains
review: This is how an undergroundoverground train system should be run clean on time comfortable and screens that tell you what the next station is perfect

title: Crowded but fastest way around
review: Essential traveling option in my opinion But only drawback is that it can get very crowded during peak hours so taking it with small kids just be careful

title: Best way to get around in Bangkok
review: Great way to get around in Bangkok get you from A to B very fast Its a bit crowded at times but usually alway room for one more

title: Lots of English!
review: If you can navigate the trainmetro (depending on what state is what you call the subway system) you can travel on BTS

title: clean and easy to use
review: The sky train was quite easy to use The people were very helpful and it was extremely clean which was perfect for me and my family

title: Air-conditioned break between sights
review: The BTS is clean fast reliable  convenient and most importantly airconditioned Well worth using instead of a taxi in traffic

title: Rapid service and cheap!
review: Bought the one day pass or 15 trips travel if you are going to use a lot of BTS skytrain No need to queue to buy tickets afterwards  I found it cheap and very efficient

title: Easiest way to move across Bangkok
review: Bangkok city is famous of horrible traffic BTS Skytrain is the fastesteasiest and cheapest way to move  across BangkokIt beat the traffic and is pretty clean It's cheap & accessible to major points of interest and most locations in the city Overallcheapsmoothcoolclean and fast

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok and save a lot of time
review: Clean convenient and time saving mode of transportation in Bangkok The trains are frequent and most train stations have direct connections malls making it very convenient  Also  by using the skytrain you bypass the horrible Bangkok road traffic where you can be stuck for hours   Tickets can be purchased either from a machine or from a counter Also some BTS stations have a SuperRich money exchange counter which provide great exchange rates

title: Air conditioned, frequent transport with views
review: The train was not particularly fast and we're pretty full (standing room only mostly)  We never waited more then a couple of minutes  A day pass was 140 baht per person  If you only need to go to 1 or 2 destinations or are 3 people a taxi might be cheaper  but ofcourse slower

title: Public transit
review: The bts is fantastic in Thailand for getting around and beating traffic Very easy to navigate and is in English and Thai Best hint is to purchase the rabbit card to avoid line ups waiting for tickets

title: Bangkok BTS
review: One of the best transportation modes encountered in Bangkok It beats the notorious jam and it's affordable If you have a group of 4 taking a cab would make more economic sense But watch out for price fixing from cab drivers and jams  Avoid morning and evening rush hours as the crowd is crazy Do not attempt to rush into the train when the alarm of doors closing is on If you are intend to travel frequently on BTS I suggest you buy a stored value ticket from the station so you don't need to queue for a ticket every time you take a train

title: Great way of travel but not available everywhere
review: Clean safe reliable and on schedule  BTS Skytrain is a fast way to travel in some parts of Bangkok Unfortunately it is not available everywhere  The map is easy to follow You can buy tickets in each station by selecting your destination station on the machine  If you are a group of people taxi might be cheaper for short distances

title: Best way to get around
review: The Skytrain is one of the great features of Bangkok The city is large crowded hot and humid so being able to glide across it all in wonderful air conditioned comfort is a delight Often the trains are crowded but everyone is very accommodating We found the 24 hour tickets both good value and easy

title: Good Transport but Tricky
review: Not a great option if you can't climb stairs Very inefficient ticketing system Basically you need coins to purchase tickets and you need to buy a ticket based on where you're exiting No option that I found to purchase a multiuse pass (I was told was only for Thai residents) or multiday pass Taking some luggage was hard in some areas without escalators or elevators But it was a cheap ride

title: A different experience
review: It's really easy to use stations are clean and organice it can be the quickest way to get to a place cuz you avoid the crazy traffic It's a different experience where you will see people from all over the world going in and out  It's could get really really busy so u need to be prepare to be quite close to other people and to stand all your trip

title: Getting around easy
review: Makes getting around Bangkok easy We brought Rabit cards and just topped them up as needed but you can just pay as you go Very friendly staff at the terminals so you can ask them to help if you need it

title: Easy way to move in Bangkok
review: This is the easiest and cheapest way to move across Bangkok even if is full and crowded lol what for me it's not a problem as a person leaving in London lol

title: Quick and fast access to the city
review: This was the only mode of transport we used to get around Bangkok it was fast inexpensive and frequent Services are busy but that is only to be expected with the amount of people travelling

title: Helpful in day to day travelling around bangkok.
review: Great for commuting around bangkok Beat the traffic and is pretty clean   Had some very uncomfortable experience with the guards minding the crowd queuing for train during peak period   Had some even worst experience with some commuters who tried to cut queue and squeeze people in line out during that peak period   Guards need to be more mindful of such commuters and put more control in how the queues are formed and stop people from running to jump queue

title: Easy to use
review: This is like any underground train in the sky good staff and easy to use payment stations so cheap to get around  Fast and quick Well done Bangkok it's a credit to all who built and work for you

title: Efficient and Cheap
review: the Traffic in Bangkok is horrific and you can spend hours trying to get anywhere  the Skytrain is clean WIFI compatible and inexpensive and a quick and easy way to get around

title: Quick
review: Very quick and easy to get about Was very clean and nicely air conditioned Would recommend this means of travel as traffic on the roads can be very bad

title: Comfortable & Good Access to City
review: I used the BTS for most travel within the city Cheap and easily accessible to most locations in city

title: Practical and fast
review: When moving in a rush from one part of Bangkok to the other it is best to take the BTS skytrain You are going to avoid the traffic and at the same time stay fresh Peak hours would be in the morning when everyone is going to the office or school and in the evening when everyone is going home If you have a car or bike and you do not want to drive because of traffic there are affordable parking areas near the skytrain (around 60 baht for car  whole day and 40 baht for motorcycle  whole day) and you simply leave it there It saves you from the hassle of negotiating the bad traffic especially during peak hours

title: Very efficient and easy to use
review: What can I say puts Londons underground to shame Very clean efficient and on time Cheap aswell Takes you to all the main hotspots

title: Expensive but speedy
review: BTS was awesome to beat the typical Bangkok traffic  Kind of costlier than taking a taxi when you ride with 3 or more person

title: A pleasure
review: A glorious way to get around You really appreciate the order and etiquette of the Thais  Especially if you've ever visited KL with its vulgar queue jumping newcomers

title: First class public transport
review: This is supposed to be a third world country but believe me this is first world transport  Always on time always airconditioned and always clean  A fantastic rail system which keeps Bangkok moving

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: The week or day passes are very affordable and we used the train the entire holiday to get around It may mean walking a bit more but it sure beats traffic and we got to explore a lot more because if it

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Took us a day to get the hang of the routes on the sky train but once you know which one takes you where it's really easy The trains were busy in the morning and early evening so be prepared to be squashed if going at these times

title: 1st time getting on BTS
review: At first I was quite nervous to try the BTS service but surprisingly I manage to get to my destination without any hassle From buying tickets and choosing which side of the track was not a problem at all   Really saves time without going through the hectic traffic down below

title: Great way to get around
review: Clean cheep and a great way to get around  Buy a multi ticket so you can pass the lines that can get long at night

title: Easy way to navigate the city
