review: Bangkok is world famous for its traffic problems and the BTS is a great way to get to many parts of the city on the 2 lines that operate The trains operate frequently and while it can get crowded it really is a cost effective way of getting about

title: Best way to travel in BKK city
review: BTS is very efficient and reliable The best part is now there is covered walkwaybridge that connects the BTS stations in the shopping belt Great way to walk from point to point occasionally greeted by neat information board about the history of monuments shrines piers and etc nearby Great work by the Tourism Bureau

title: Smooth ride
review: Great reliable service at a very reasonable price The sky train takes you to all parts of Bangkok with ease The service is clean and cool as all trains have air con Definitely the best way to commute

title: Wonderful Convenient public transport
review: BTS is excellent Mass Rapid Transport in the heart of Bangkok city It will conveniently connect you to most parts of the city including the Airport and almost all parts of interest Available almost 247 with intervals of about 45min Give it a try to avoid the traffic jams in the city Direction maps indicating fares also available in the stations and most hotels

title: The best transportation in BKK
review: Convenience and no need to worry traffic jam in BKK can go to all hot spot in BKK by BTS (eg Siam Center Paragron MBK T21 JJ Market)

title: Really busy most of the time
review: We travelled to Bangkok with family with 4 young kids And we did try to take skytrain to nearby shopping mall The coverage of skytrain is quite a large area And our kids 4 years old free and only a 6year old need to purchase ticket

title: Very comfortable.
review: We used this service for the most of our travel within the city and also to travel toandfro from DMK airport (to the nearest point being Mo Chit) to our hotels I always prefer to use these public transport system (if systematic) instead of taxis to get the feel of the countries I visit

title: Bts sky train is a saviour for bangkok tourists
review: One should take this BTS skytrain to reach their destination that saves a lot of money spending on car hire and lot of time in traffic we can spend that time easily on tourist place taking this BTS skytrain this will be mostly on time and well connected to each and every tourist place in Bangkok don't forget to take a map along with you referring to all tourist places around three cheers to BTS skytrain it saved a lot

title: Good commute
review: If you are located in a hotel on the riverside and the hotel offers boat service then take it to get to shopping area Not to expensive has AC to cool you down Good reliable and fast enough form of transport here in BKK

title: Very convenient
review: Fast and modern Very convenient and efficient way to get around Bangkok But traveller beware The AC is set to minimum so if you don't like the cold bring something warm to wear

title: The best way to get around Bangkok. But can get very full
review: I have been using the sky train for 17 years since it first opened  It is the only way to get around Sukhumvit road area in a hurry unless you want to risk a motorbike taxi experience   However do avoid peak times if you are a tourist and have a choice  From 430 pm heading south east to upper sukhumvit you may have trouble getting on I have waited for 3 trains before now   Once in do expect to get very friendly with everyone as they squeeze you on like sardines in a tin   They run more frequently at these times but in my mind should also increase the carriages too   Other peak times at weekends in early evenings heading to lower Sukhumvit can also be challenge as the residents head for nights out   Otherwise it's the best way to get around Bangkok   It's more convenient to change at Asok for the underground if heading to Chatuchak  market However BTS Mo Chit station is only a few minutes walk to the market and also no issue   The skywalks are a pleasant addition over the years keeping you above the roads and away from the chaos below   I fully recommend getting a rabbit card per person even if you only here for a few days it saves so much time at the stations queuing for change and tickets  As well at Siam Square the queues for tickets can be up to 30 minutes in the busy times  Rabbit cards are easy to get at any station and can be refunded if you don't use it all  Never put more than 500 THB in case you lose it Average journey cost is anyway only 30 50 baht So you can work it out easy

title: Quick and easy
review: Can't really go wrong with the BTS to get around Bangkok It's cheap and simple to use can get busy at times but they do come regularly

title: Another alternative in Bangkok.
review: If you are not a fan of tuk tuk or finding tuktuk is weird then BTS is for you Taking a cab in BKK is pain in the butt sometimes as the traffic congestion is terrible

title: Quickest way to get around Bangkok but avoid 7am to 10am and 4pm to 7pm
review: I've been using the Skytrain for the past 15 years and its the quickest way to get around Bangkok Unfortunately as many have realized this the trains are now very crowded and packed during the peak hours that is one of the down sides  In peak hour you may have to wait for 2  3 trains but they are frequent

title: day pass
review: Stop at each station and expore very good day out get the day pass Value for money and every interesting

title: Skytrain easy to use and regular
review: The Skytrain is clean regular and around Â£1 (40 Baht) for a single journey Queues for a ticket only take a couple of minutes there are machines but I think they only take coins As a family of four we used the Skytrain for several days without issue but we then found that we could usually get a taxi for less money as there were 4 of us this would not be the case with smaller groups

title: Beat the traffic
review: There are traffic signals for every 100 feet or so in Bangkok so using this Skyride equivalent to Metro is an affordable and time saving way to get around instead of a cartaxi You can opt for day pass get a map sit through the ride mark the places you want to visit and safely get around It goes through the major places in city you might need to combine it with taxi to reach a specific place

title: Easy to use....
review: Once you get used to it the BTS skytrain is really easy to use if you are travelling a lot you can get a day pass unsure on price but cheap   The staff talk good English but you need to be patient sometimes The train is nice and clean sometimes cleaner than the UK trains I would easily recommend to anyone looking for a cheaper alternative to a taxi or tuk tuk

title: excellant ride
review: very neat and clean with clear indicationdirection Speed is too good with very frequent availability up to late night

title: Excellent Transport System
review: The only way to actually get about in Bangkok  Other than the odd tourist Tuk Tuk  The sky train will get you about in cool AC and has stops everywhere with no traffic

title: User friendly but not accessible for the disabled
review: Very easy to use You can buy passes with cash but expect to wait for long lines in rush hour If you are in a hurry prepare some coins in advance  Would be perfect if they have lift for the disabled I saw some but seemed like they were under construction

title: Best way to avoid hours in the traffic
review: If you don't want spending hours in the traffic coming or going to the airport just use BTS same to avoid traffic in the city Just missing additional lines and stations to better cover Bangkok

title: Good way to get around the Major Shopping Malls
review: If you are planning to get around famous Shopping Malls in Bangkok do use the service Following are benefits 1 avoid long traffic jams 2 Quick travel in comparison with taxi service Drawbacks 1 Too much crowded during peak hours 2 Lift isn't working 3 Accelerators are not available while going down the station Recommendation 1 Don't use the service if you have luggage with you as its difficult and dangerous to carry bags in accelerators

title: Excellent service
review: Excellent service wish it covered a bigger area Buy a rabbit card a wonder around   Be sure to enjoy

title: Helpfull
review: A mass transportation that you can use to avoid from crazy traffic jam in Bangkok some times crowded but still okay

title: Amazing and efficient method of travel!
review: The BTS Skytrain is both an efficient and convenient way to travel around Bangkok It can get crowded in the mornings and evenings but there is usually room to go where I am trying to go Make sure you have change and know where the stop you want to go to I love that they have maps showing the next stops by the stairs up to the platform because it has saved me many times from being on the side going the direction opposite to the one I want to go When in Bangkok this is the only way to get around the Sukhumvit and Silom areas

title: Cheap travel!
review: Once you've figured out how it works this is a must for getting around Bangkok  Very cheap when compared with British trains  They also run very often  On the downside during peak times they can be very over crowded

title: Wonderful experience and time saving
review: This is my second time at Thailand One of the most useful things in Bangkok is BTS One can save a lot of time and money using the BTS Using the BTS is very easy Traveling in Thailand will become very attractive if you use the BTS

title: Avoid Peak Hours
review: For those who dont mind walking a bit I highly recommend you travel within bangkok with BTS to avoid the serious traffic in the city Yet one better avoid the peak time (like 68pm) at stations like Siam I could manage to squeeze in only after 3 trains passing by   Another point to note station's ticketing machines can be down left you with machines taking coins only  If you would spend 3+ days in BKK worth getting the Rabbit Card which has stored value which saved you time from buying ticket every trip  Yet the card requires a B100 nonrefundable card cost So do your own calculations and see if that worths

title: Good way to get to shopping malls
review: I am staying Near Nana BTS in Sukhumvit road and for me Sky train has been a good way to get around the major shopping malls So you don't have to get a card you can simply purchase paper tickets at the station it can cost up from 25 to 50 Bhat for one way ticket depending on your destination You might as well use google to find your interchange The lines to purchase tickets can be pretty long in the evening so when you board the train in the morning do get the return tickets as well which will save you time in the evening Sometimes it can be difficult to keep track of the stations so keep an eye on the station names at the top of doorways But station names are mentioned in English so there should not be much of a problem   Bangkok is shoppers paradise so when you book you hotels do book it near BTS stations

title: Great way to get around
review: If you are trying to get around in Bangkok to most of the sites  The BTS is the way to get around  Its inexpensive and with all the current lines it will get you there or very close without being stuck in traffic   Get a day card and avoid the ticket lines   But really this is better than almost any other way Fastest and least expensive

title: Cheap way to get around Bangkok
review: The skytrain is good to get around the city without the need to bargain with any tuk tuk or taxi driver However at some times it is very crowded and you can barely get a seat

title: Consider the all day pass - 140 baht!
review: The above ground BTS Skytrain is an efficient and convenient way to move people around There are currently 35 stations with plans to extend this over the coming years During peak hours expect a busy and cozy ride  the trains come every few minutes and are reliable From the road concrete pillars are somewhat unsightly but it avoids the chaotic streets filled with too many vehicles

title: Awesome train service
review: I always take the BTS everywhere as it is fast and convenient You can ask for help at their customer service counters if you need to know which line to take The trains may be packed at peak hour but as they arrive frequentlyits still a better option than taking taxis

title: BTS and no more traffic jam
review: User friendly and clean You can go anywhere by taking BTS and there are a lot of shopping malls around the BTS station By the way there is security checking in the station I suggest to get a transportation card as usually it takes time to purchase the single ticket It is much convenient to have a transportation card

title: Easy to use
review: Highly recommend to get around Bangkok  Easy to use  Very inexpensive  People are helpful if they understand English otherwise pay machines are everywhere

title: Well thought out system
review: We don't have such things in the US so it's always enjoyable to see how convenient mass transit systems can be in other countries   This system is well laid out easily accessible and inexpensive to use It is currently being extended to Don Mueang Airport on one end and the new airport on the other When those extensions are completed in a couple of years the system will be a huge benefit to travelers to Bangkok

title: Best in Bangkok
review: This is the best way to travel in Bangkok It's fast and you can get to any part of the city within minutes It's a comfortable ride n the price is also cheap But try to avoid during peak hours

title: Best way to get around
review: In crowded Bangkok travel by taxi can take FOREVER  The Skytrain (BTS) is a very efficient way to get around  It can be very crowded at times but you aren't on it for long and trains come every couple of minutes  Not for you if you can't do stairs  there are a few escalators but not at every stop  The BTS is cheap and clean and fast and efficient

title: Very fast and simple
review: I use only bts when I'm in town very fast and easy  A bit crowded in the rash hours but much better than taxi and traffic

title: Good option to avoid crazy traffic if hotel near BTS station
review: Bangkok traffic can be horrendous BTS is a good option for those who hops between station   Pros  Avoid traffic  Connects to must of the malls  Easy access with bridges to connects  If hops between malls in a single day there is a day pass which is a cost savings option  Cons  GRAB or UBER may be cheaper if travel in groups of 34 on a single journey  The train may be jammed packed with people  Station is hot as oppose to the underground MRT (fully air conditioned)  Not all location is connected and some hotel in the inner streets may required 1520 min walk to the nearest station  Hot spot like Platinum Fashion Mall is not accessible via BTS

title: Must Do. Mind blowing
review: The rain market is a huge must see the hustle and bustle of a huge mark then the horn sounds the awnings fold back and a full on train passes through the very center of the market Then as if nothing happens the awnings roll out and the market carries on again  Definitely do this if you get a chance

title: Easy even if your not so young
review: Only used this service twice but even given I'm +50 we took the time to read the information watch others and with some minor confusion we got to our destination and back with ease though like an earlier comment get about 100 BHT  in coins and use the ticket machine at the wall just read watch and then give it a go )

title: Getting around
review: Easy to use clean and safe  Buy a travel card as it is more convenient to top up and use each time

title: Easy way to move around BKK
review: The sky train is super easy to use and it takes you to a lot of places Carry coins to pay for your fare so you don't have to wait in line

title: Top Transport
review: Efficient well priced exceedingly easy to use clean and reliable  Bring exact change or you may face a long wait to get it

title: Really well executed
review: Clean modern trains  easy to get around but they just don't go to enough places in a city with probably the worse traffic congestion I've ever seen a decent train service covering Bangkok would be a godsend

title: Easy
review: The best way to commute through traffic Bangkok has the craziest Traffic scene BTS is a blessing It is usually very pack during peak hours though

title: Easy, cheap and quick
review: Get to know the city with skytrain It has a link to airport too I used it when I was coming out of international airport after using the Rail link

title: Convenient
review: I broke a leg and has to use wheelchair when I was in Bangkok Looking at the heavy traffic we decide to try our luck riding the BTS instead I was so surprise on how easy and convenient it was riding the BTS as a handicap even though handicap doesn't have priority as in America but the staff help us enough to make our journey pleasant Plus the pedestrian bridge that connect most buildings (malls and hotels) along Phloen Chit Rd to Rama I Rd is good enough for my wheelchair to pass on it makes the journey even more easy and pleasant

title: Very easy to use
review: Very easy to use and probably the best way to get around since there is so much traffic in Bangkok Make sure to bring change otherwise at busy stations you will have to wait in very long lines to get change and then in another line to buy your ticket Trains have air conditioning which felt amazing

title: very good & safe
review: As a independent female traveler I felt safe and it was super easy to navigate  I had the one stop in front of the hotel so it was perfect sine traffic is horrible It also very clean and on time

title: Love BTS
review: Every country should have BTS and the standards that run alongside it It's clean as no eating or drinking is permissable the trains get swept at the last stop several times daily  The safety is excellent with guards on platforms walkways and gurds checking bags

title: Most Convinient Transport in Bangkok
review: I got a Rabbit card this time and got upto 10% discount in Macdonalds and few more shops Also I was able to pay in those shops with the Rabbit card which was pretty exciting   This was my 3rd visit in Bangkok and I think BTS is the most convinient mode of transportation in Bangkok

title: So efficient!!
review: We hardly used tuk tuks or taxis due to how efficient the sky trains were With the heat of the day coming on to a clean and air conditioned sky train was always welcomed ThE prices are also fab making it a no brainer

title: Very aggressive security at OnNut station
review: After shopping at OnNut Tesco and market we took BTS from OnNut station to Sukhumvit Station After passing through gate was stopped by guard who asked to check our shopping bags He seemed to enjoy using his metal baton to poke inside the bags with great force crushing fruitfood and other items When I told him its only food and asked him not to poke it he took out the baton Looked at me very aggressive and took the stands to beat me starting yelling at me The counter staff came out booth told me to get out of station Refunded my ticket and then followed us out of station taking pictures with phones We are still unclear why you are unable to take marketshop bought food on BTS Welcome to Thailand Land of Smiles HaHaHa don't make me smile

title: Convenient and clean
review: So easy to use very clean and always on time  We rode the skytrain to have a night out and it was very easy to navigate for our first time Highly recommend

title: Clean but the ticket system is a little dated
review: System is fine only 2 lines so nothing to get in a flummox about Only one interchange at Siam for BTS to BTS which may cause you a minor headache unless you know the final stop on the line you are using Check the back of the ticket as the network map is there 90% of the machines only take coins a poor lady spends most of her day giving out change like a toilet attendant The MRT is the subway line  this is the skytrain monorail which cuts through Bangkok and uglifies the landscape and will never be taken down unfortunately

title: Love it
review: People mover that intersects with other lines at various points  including the underground rail however requires two different tickets at this point  crowded at peak hours quickest method of travel in Bkk

title: BKK - Easy Access and Inexpensive
review: Traveled on the Skytrain recently  Found it very clean and inexpensive to use Runs Regularly   easy to access and has an extensive network Only problem is that not all stations are Wheel Chair accessible The Skytrain goes everywhere and is a great way to get round Bangkok for regular visitors locals and new comers alike

title: Killer train and be careful
review: very bad experience was about to fall as people too much not at all a good idea to travel makes me sad that thailand having such system

title: I think the guiding marks here are not clear enough
review: And if you are a physical challenged person it is hard to find elevator Overall the trains are clean and nice it just you need to realy pay attention to the destination you are aheading to and make sure you are on the right way to right exit

title: Frequent and clean
review: The train is so easy to understand (except for pricing but you can always ask the employees) The trains arrive frequently and it's always super clean Thumbs up

title: A great way to see Bangkok
review: I was staying in Bangkok for three nights and I bought a three day pass for BTS sky train a lot cheaper than paying each time you travel A map of Bangkok is handy so you can plan which direction you wish to travel in until you get used to it

title: The best transport in Bangkok
review: Cheap fast and cool inside If you want to avoid the barging at a taxi or tuk tuk take the Skytrain it is much better

title: world class travel experience
review: well managed skytrainneat and tidy Security officers are appointed in every nook and cornersreasonably priced ticket fare

title: A must !
review: Buy 1 day pass to go everywhere Rather than take taxi and get stuck in a traffic jam  Its cheaper and easier

title: One of the best ways to commute in Bangkok
review: One Study says Bangkok is the second most congested city in the world  BTS Skytrain is a nice way to get around Bangkok it is affordable reliable efficient and clean

title: Very convenient
review: The best easiest fastest and economical way of travelling in bangkok Get a map if this so that you avoid spending extra bucks on taxi or tuk tuk

title: Taxis are Slow and Expensive - BTS is Fast and Cheap and Air-Conditioned
review: This is the way to get around Bangkok unless you have to go somewhere way away from a metroBTS line Most things are close to the line though

title: Beat the jam, beat the taxi!
review: I can't describe how much I love about BTS in Bangkok especially when the Taxi always asked for mininum of '200 Baht' to any location in the town BTS is fast and convenient and it linked to many of the major attraction It will be good if they can improve the ticketing system which is super old school to me

title: Great way to get around
review: With the skytrain and riverboat system opening up so much of the city this is a great way to see the city without getting caught in the crazy traffic

title: Easy to access to everywhere
review: Train waiting time less than 5mins very convenient to access other attractions place Fastest way than taking taxi

title: Busy
review: We got skytrain to get us around different parts of bangkok it was slightly confusing getting our ticket but luckily we got a nice local person to help us when you get your ticket you need to keep it as you need to use it at the other side to get back out of the station It was busy but great way to get around and cheap

title: I love it!
review: Cheap and fast and safe No drink or food allowed and its just so perfectly organised  Easy to reach the malls

title: The only way to travel in Bangkok
review: The only way to travel in Bangkok overcrowded and stressful but it is the only way to go unless you want to sit in a taxi all day

title: Best way to move around the key ares in the city!
review: Bangkok is famous for its traffic jam but BTS has solved it allat least for tourists  It almost covers every major tourist spots and key malls and hotels in the city  The only key area not covered was just the China Town  But it's already been of great help  Remember to get a Rabbit card so that you don't need to queue the long line for tickets every time

title: Easy to use and very low cost!
review: The BTS Skytrain is very easy to use and travel around many areas of Bangkok  A big plus is that the cost is very low

title: Fast, and easy to use . . . SKIP the traffic!
review: Much better option than trying taxis or motorbikes Easily decipherable for the first time traveler and incredibly inexpensive It goes anywhere you want to be Can be a bit tight in peak hours but even then people are friendly and trains are clean Staff at each station are incredibly helpful or self service stands are easy to use as well THIS is the quickest and easiest way to see and get around Bangkok

title: Always on time and cool
review: The best way to get around Bangkok especially when it is raining Cabs are hard to find in the rain so use the BTS

title: Its a tain, not more
review: packed in rush hours fastest way to get around Bangkok a bit cold if you are not used to the air condition in Asia

title: Fast and efficient
review: The BTS service is fast clean  and efficient especially during peak hours Travel is inexpensive and a good way to see the city if Bangkok and outer lying areas

title: Excellent Way To Get Around Bangkok
review: The BTS is a fast and efficient way to get around Bangkok The prices are very reasonable for the distances covered and the trains are always clean The only drawback is that more often than not they are very crowded in the central Bangkok area   Please remember if you are waiting at a station for a train then stand where the arrows are on the platform and wait for passengers to get off before trying to get on There is nothing more annoying for a person trying to get off the train to be confronted with a wall of people trying to get on  In addition there is a yellow line painted on the platforms about 1 metre from the edge You are requested to stand behind it  failure to do so results in a security guard blowing a whistle and making you feel bad )

title: Fast and secure
review: I really like Bangkok's public transports They are safe clean and on time The only thing is that the aircondition is killing me Way to cold Bring your hoodie )

title: International standard MRT
review: Not cheap if you're travelling within 5km get an UBER  GRAB instead Recommended if you're travelling out of the town (out of silom sukhimvit pratunam area)

title: An example for us to follow
review: Very quick clean and efficient service  Buy an daily card to save a bit of money  You are not allowed to eat or drink on the train or station

title: Love the BTS gets you to places on the cheap
review: Have used the BTS to get to the following places  MBKSiam Paragon to go to Ocean world and Madamme Tussaads Chatuchak Market Chong Nonsi to visit Silom dentist Patpong Market and the Sunday Walking street market Centre Point Silom hotelRobinsons Pratunam Market once you get off the BTS the market is still about a 15  20min walk away The BTS is great you line up for the BTS and if you dont manage to fit on the BTS no problem the next BTS is 7mins away Instructions are very clear inside the BTS about the stops it makes The ride is smoother than a rail train

title: Very easy to use
review: We took the BTS from MBK to Phelon station and it was very easy to use Even the BTS worker who helped purchase tickets was helpful I would recommend to any level of traveler Much cheaper than a tuk tuk

title: Easy way. To travel
review: Easy way to travelstaff are on hand to help although they speak no English but do their best to point you in the right direction Always someone you can ask for assistance if required Fast and clean and air conditioned

title: Very recommended
review: Reccomend to take a hotek near the BTS sky train It is fast and clean The maps are very easy to navigate and the staff are very welcoming

title: Easy to use and cost effective
review: The skytrain is easy to use  the maps are clear and payment system is easy to follow   As a tourist you can purchase a 1 day unlimited skytrain pass  that can be used from 0600 until 0000 (midnight)  It can only be used on the skytrain  and other trains will need to be paid for separately   Definitely easy and quicker than getting a taxi

title: Great value
review: Bought an all day pass for 140baht each for unlimited travel for one day couldnt beat it for value for money and efficency

title: Superb Service....
review: The Sky Train is one of the local transportation in BKK The system is very good and very easy to follow your route the trains are extremely good (eating or drinking not allowed) Timing and Frequency of trains is very good and seems to be perfectly planned as per traffic peaks during different time in a day

title: Super efficient
review: I love the Skytrain It's cheap efficient clean and reliable I always stay on Sukhumvit when in Bangkok and the BTS takes me where I need to go I wish all cities had public transport like this )

title: Effective transportation for the areas covered.
review: Clean efficient and offers nice views sadly it doesn't go everywhere so it cannot be used as a main method of transportation

title: Handy for us
review: Dead easy for us to get in and out of centre (not that there is a definitive centre as such) of Bangkok Very cool AC which I liked

title: IMPRESSIVE & SO CLEAN
review: Every time we go to Bangkok we make sure that we stay close to the BTS Skytrain   This service is so well organise and so efficient    We never get lost and are constantly impressed by how clean it is as well     This type of service should be repeated throughout the work as it is not only beneficial to tourists but must make life so much easier for locals living and working in today's big cities

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy to use for foreigners had no problems at all Fastest way to move around Bangkok and very cheap as well

title: Easy to use and cheap
review: While in Bangkok we used this a few times including going to the Chaktuchak market and the airport The tickets were about 45 bahts or less depending on the destination or you can have a day ticket that you can use till midnight as many times as you need and it's only 140 bahts (if I remember right ) During peak times its really crowded but so is the traffic on the roads (that is actually worst) so you are better off using BTS depending on where you need to go of course because there are areas in Bangkok where you can't get there by train or metro

title: Super Slick System
review: The Sky Train is a work of art in transportation The system is easily to plan and follow your route the trains are spotless (no eating or drinking allowed) super cool air con and they run on time

title: Great Service
review: Great clean extremely efficient and cheap form of transport that is simple to navigate  I wish it covered more of Bangkok so it saved hours sitting in traffic

title: TFL should learn a thing or two!
review: What a lovely experience  very impressive it beats the London transport system  hands down  cleaner faster and more user friendly by telling you what stop you are arriving at

title: BTS
review: Its very good efficent cklean and love the people so well behaved Was wonderful The security was also good

title: Clean & Easy to use
review: Fast clean n hasslefree Easy to comprehend the routeshowtos even for firsttimers Safe to ride even late at night

title: And away we go.
review: I have visited Bangkok on and off over the past 10 years and have used the BTS quit frequently It is convenient especially when you consider the amount of traffic that permeates the city Fast and convenient most of the time except for the ticket machines and change booths or machines  Minimal confusion at transfer points Announcements and visual map systems showing progression along your route Stops are well placed in front of MBK Chachucha and more The way to travel whether on budget or notMLG

title: Convenience at it best !
review: If you can utilize BTS network  it will reduce your local travel worries to zerofast  convenient and cozy  This is the best way to explore this beautiful city without worrying for rush hours

title: Clean, quick and cheap
review: The sky train was brilliant to use during our stay in Bangkok Station really easy to get to from the road Clean tidy and quick We used this during the busy period as well after school has finished and people were leaving work and it wasnt too busy Tickets are also cheap

title: SkyTrain Too Good
review: Its Great  Its Frequent  Its Clean  Its Safe  Its fine  Its the Skytrain in Bangkok covering the most important places of Bangkok

title: Convenient Reliable Clean public transportation
review: All big enough cities will always have some traffic congestion rails of various types has always been the way to beat this  Though I was not able to try BTS during peak hours their rail maps system of payment and reach make this public transpi very useful for commuters and tourists alike

title: Overcrowded
review: It was totally jam packed could not put a foot inside after missing out on 2 trains got the third and I felt like a fish in a cold can full of people and very cold

title: Best way to get around BKK
review: Definitely the best way to get around Bangkok and to avoid the traffic on the streets Can be busy during rush hour though very safe Since the ticket machines only take coins keep some spare to avoid waiting at the cashier

title: A great Rail system BTS Skytrain
review: The BTS Skytrain is easy to use do not be put off by all the people just go to the board showing you the rail lines and where they run to the board will also show you where you are so for example if you are at Siam and wish to go Asok the board will show you are at Siam and Asok will have a number next to it that is the cost of the fair to go there  Then go to the ticket machine and put in your money and out comes the ticket and change then go to the entrance your ticket will have a little hole on it at one end that is the end up put into the machine then take your ticket when it comes out if you are carrying a bag or backpack etc the security will want to check it before you go up to the station so be ready to show them  You should remember that there is no eating or drinking on the BTS or MRT the trains are very clean so do not drop your papers or rubbish on the floor take your rubbish with you  The trains are very quick so there is no need to run for a train as there will be another one along in a few minutes you will find at peak hour that you have to push to get on the train as they are full try and avoid peak hour especially if you have suitcases or big bags as you will have a problem getting on the train

title: Best Transportation to Travel Bangkok
review: Fast and convenient way to travel around Bangkok Stations are usually packed with people at all times One of the disadvantage of taking BTS is you have to use coins to purchase tickets and you can only purchase one ticket at a time You can change your coins at the counter staffs are pretty helpful & polite too

title: Very cheap and easy to use
review: Stations across Bangkok making it easy and accessible Staff is always ready to help us if we do not know where to go

title: Life line of Bangkok
review: This is the lifeline of bangkok Faster than road transport  as road transport is always jampack Frequency is very good speed is very fast Not much rush Coverage is excellent It should be little cheaper than current price

title: Easy peasy
review: Pleasantly surprised to find the BTS very easy and convenient way to travel around Bangkok  Easy access to shopping malls and also convenient way to walk through and cut through the main traffic roads  also safer option for people to walk

title: Very fast but a little bit overpriced
review: Fast Comfortable Good view A real saver from mad traffic But the price should be lower at list 30%

title: Best way to avoid traffic jam
review: It is the best way to avoid traffic jam as you an see LOTS of taxi private cars and bus on the roads You can take the BTS to many tourism spots The fee is not cheap but not expensive Better to buy buy a rabbit card it saves time

title: Fast way to travel along bts station
review: Love the bts station stops price competitive even travel along family of 6 compare to tuk tuk or taxis

title: Clean and easy
review: By far the best form of transport in Bangkok Linking this with the river transport avoids hours of delays on your trip Air conditioned and simple fare system makes it so simple even on your first visit

title: Easy and Cheap Mode of Transport
review: Beat the Bangkok jam by using the skytrain Fast and clean easy and cheap to use Just change some coins at the booth read the map and other relevant displayed info check price of ticket to your intended destination buy the ticket from the ticketing machine and off you go

title: Cheap and Air Con
review: Would recommend the BTS to travel around Bangkok Traffic is crazy so the train is a quicker way to see the city

title: travell around
review: Great service quick cheap clean and reliable  never had to wait more than a few minutes Stations were well signed for the different routes you could take no graffiti either

title: Modern, safe, cheap and convenient way to move around Bangkok
review: Taking a tuk tuk through the crowded streets and markets is an experience you shouldn't miss ditto on a taxi through the blade runner night of Bangkok But if you want to get there fast and safe take the BTS

title: There is no reason for a tourist to drive
review: Given the horrible traffic condition in Bangkok its Skytrain and MRT is the best way to get around All the stations are linked to nearest malls via covered walkways at least majority are  Many years back you could get a tuk tuk and it would zip in and out of traffic and get you to your destination With the traffic getting worse than before the sky train is your best options What more it arrives on time and you can have your viewing pleasure of the beautiful Thai women

title: My Bangkok Train Ride
review: Bangkok's train system is one of the best It gives commuters easy and smooth ride to most tourist junctions in Bangkok city Fare price is fare enough for the commuters While on train you can see the discipline of people giving respect to those getting off the train by giving them more priority than those getting in Even at rush hour you sure can still get a good ride anytime you wish to Information is also rich for tourists who will never miss getting off the correct station

title: Quick way to move around the city!
review: BTS is a very easy to use transport system in Bangkok They have clear Thai and English signage for each of the stations and the announcements in the trains are also made in Thai and English

title: TICKET TO RIDE
review: Have ridden the BTS a number of times Very fast convenient and easy to understand All trains are clean and air conditioned

title: Worth trying it
review: BTS is connects to the most of the city limits hence taking the Skytrain you will give you a better view to see the city all over So must try if you are visiting Bangkok for the first time Since the Bangkok traffic is high may be worth using train if you are sure about your destination

title: Best Way To Get Around BKK
review: Clean air conditioned and THE efficient way to get around the main parts of BKK for tourist venues as well as businessshopping districts

title: Quick and reliable
review: Very clean and efficient  The air conditioning is a much welcome treat Fast way to get around the city

title: Easy travelling around with BTS
review: Fast affordable and safe Good connection to the most part of the city Sometimes crouwded but that's not to disturbing for short rides

title: Good form of transport
review: Easy to use even for foreigners inexpensive and efficient The  information staff were very helpful too

title: Best way to get around
review: It really is much better than taxi's or Tuk Tuks for getting around Bangkok especially when raining  Between the BTS and the MRT you can get to a lot of places and from there take a taxi to your final destination of the ferry if you want to see Wat Po or Wat Arun  Make sure you have coins as the machines do not take bills if you need change you can go to the window and they will give you change to use in the machines    One tip if you are carrying a bag make sure you old it high as you go through the gate because there is a sensor and if the bag sets it off the gate will close on you and it can hurt

title: Peter Borneo
review: Great way to see Bangkok from "above"  Fast efficient clean and save The staff there is very helpful and most staff at the ticket counters speaks at least some English and are indeed very cooperative Toilets are missing in some of the stations This is a Must do item when in town and of course avoids the great Traffic Jams around

title: Great way to get around.
review: With the hectic traffic in Bangkok the sky train offers a great reliable way to get around  It is easy for travelers to navigate

title: When the traffic is bad or the taxi drivers piss you off, then BTS is the best way to move around
review: It's very fast and make it easy to move around the city of Bangkok It's clean and at office hour there's more train so you don't have to worry if you miss the first train

title: So worth buying a multipass.
review: A great way to get around Bangkok Air conditioned and so quick and convenient  I bought a multipass to cut down on costs Each trip was pennies

title: Cool Travel
review: This is the best way to travelFast air conditioned cheap safe There are easy to read system maps and automated fare machines In case of a question there are manned information booths (English spoken)

title: Very efficient & effective & clean.
review: BTS Skytrain is very efficient & effective & clean  Easy to learn your way around  Moves much quicker than the cars on the road

title: Quicker than a taxi.
review: Cheap and easy way to get around avoiding the nightmarish Bangkok traffic Can be a little crowded but was never uncomfortabley so

title: modern trains
review: Great system clean and efficient Lots of stores on the station and helpful employees There are security guards to ward off any untoward incidents

title: Great connectivity
review: Sky Train connects all the major areas of Bangkok Best way to travel in time Cheaper compared to taxis Sky Train 76 thb per person from Silom to Airport Taxi 500550 thb

title: Airconditioned
review: Trains always on time sometimes very busy but no long waits  Clean  Not expensive at all  Used it every day  The best way to get from the airport into Bangkok much faster

title: Easy to use
review: We used the Skytrain on many occasions you can get anywhere in Bangcock very cheap and easy to understand

title: Affordable, fast, convenient, reliable and neat
review: I was very impressed with the Skytrain The stations are in neat conditions the train cars cannot be better equipped with plenty of space great air conditioning even the monitors advertising and announcing the stops were impressive We used the Skytraing during our entire stay in Bangkok It was safe inexpensive clean reliable and fast I also commend the local Thai people for their great manners an behavior while waiting for and using the trains That was as impressive as the BTS system

title: Faster!
review: Yeah Ä±ts good combination and clearly destination but Expensive  Its too much for local people also for Backpacker's I dont take any more

title: easy travel
review: Cheap easy clean fast beats the traffic jams below You could take a tuk tuk or a taxi but this is the fastest way to get places

title: Cheap and convenient
review: We think it's great Think all cities should go up with their rail systems We only went 4 stations but very comfortable

title: Easy Connectivity Around Bangkok
review: Very convenient & comfortable transportation around the main touristy places of central Bangkok Can be crowded during the rush hours but saves a lot of time wasted on taxis around Bangkok roads

title: BTS Experience
review: You need to experience the BTS SKYTRAINS Cheap and on time one station the others with little effort  They do get very crowded  Buy a day pass from the ticket office 24 hour ticket  Some stairs and escalator

title: Fast
review: This is great transportation compared to taxi If you're confused on which line to take there are kiosks there where you can get coins and the staff there are always happy to help  If you miss one train it's not long before another comes along

title: Quickest way around Bangkok
review: Cheap easy to use clean fast and efficient    Trains every few minutes and take you to the major attractions shopping areas and temples Much faster than tuk tuks taxis or tours

title: Just jump on
review: Like the tube bit bigger not as many lines and of course above ground get some change pick area you want pay get ticket away you go

title: Efficient and cheap
review: Best way to get around Bangkok It's cheap fast and convenient Rush hour can get a bit crazy and crowded but the trips are fast so you dont spend much time in there

title: save your time!
review: with sky train you can go inside Bangkok in few minutes Years ago in taxi for my business trip in Bangkok need from 1 hour to 2 hour in the traffic at any time in the day now the same take me 15 minutes No comment Also Airport line that cross in Phya Thai to MO Chit direction bring you in airport in fast wayAll Bangkok sistem of Mass Transit Transport resolve the problem of time and traffic

title: too crowded and better then tuktuk
review: the bts trains are good but super packed and always packedits good for long distances but take a taxi for short routesthe line to but tickets is very long and the line to get change even biggertake exact change before boarding

title: Good connection
review: Great connection that will get you about anywhere in the city centre Unfortunately it won't get you any further but you will get to the most usual places without being hassled by those darn tuktuk lads

title: Nice way to get around
review: AC is wonderful  It does get crowded in the evenings with people going home Safe and a nice view as you move across the city

title: The best way to travel inside Bangkok.
review: SkyTrain is quick and cheapThe first thing to do is to buy a subscription card so that you will not have to bother with tickets

title: Easy to use
review: Sky train is easy to navigate it's cheap and gets you quickly around the city   It is clean mainly due to no eating or drinking rule on it One point there aren't escalatorslifts at every station which can be cumbersome if having to lug a suitcase up and down

title: Great way to get around
review: Clean easy to navigate reasonably priced helpful staff at stations and extremely efficient way to get around Good value

title: Cheap healthy and safe
review: If it's raining or sunny you can use the train or you can walk in the skywalk under the train from mbk you can reach to Siam station from the skywalk to discovery then to Siam paragon and from there you can use the skywalk again to reach chit lom and also to embassy central and it's safe even its raining of you want to move  a little

title: Best Transport in Bangkok!
review: This is the best mode of transport in Bangkok All the trains are air conditioned and ice cold The machines are really easy to use and are in English Make sure you have a train map so can navigate your way back if you get lost The trains are extremely clean as you are not allowed to drink or eat when travelling on the train system There are no train timings so you have no idea when the train is arriving Try and make sure that the hotel you book is walking distance to a BTS Sky train so you can easily take advantage of this

title: Easy and efficient
review: Very easy to figure out and it helps that the ticket states the stations at the back (refer to photo)

title: Feel like home. lol
review: For international tourist this service is a Gift Economical fastreliable safe(beware of pickpocketer ) ) You actually meet "locals"   most of them are educated enough to understand and communicate in good English so you can start conversation with really unknown people  I take this train to reach Madam Tussads museum

title: Surasak Duangsawang
review: BTS helping people who don't like traffic yam in Bangkokand now we got more lines from Thornburi and nonthaburi to bring people to the cityThen we hope that will be less car in the cityat that time people will be more happy

title: The best way around Bangkok
review: The traffic in Bangkok can only be described as mind boggling  and if you prefer not to age while waiting travelling by car or bus I suggest that you take the BTS instead Coverage is good and the fares are cheap Service is also prompt and reliable

title: Best means to move around Bangkok
review: BTS is the Best Transit Solution for Bangkok  It is clean and cool inside great escape from the heat  It is quick and is best to avoid wasting time sitting in traffic  The stations are well announced and connected with MRT   However there are more and more people using the system that it gets REALLY crowded at peak hours  As a tourist i would recommend buying a day pass to avoid the change and que for tickets

title: Well maintained
review: Cleanliness redefined One of the better skytrains that I have visited in Asia Clearly a mark of excellence

title: Transport
review: What can I say cheaper and faster then a taxi if your in the area the BTS hits If your here a while get the month pass

title: Our go to!
review: We used this every day in Bangkok so easy to use great price & great views of the city We got the train from the airport and changed to get the BTS to our hotel where they provided a shuttle to the station

title: learn to beat the traffic
review: Bangkok is notorious for it's tailback traffic jams and 15 minutes traffic lights The best way to beat the traffic is to use the BTS system to get as close to your destination as possible and then to grab a taxi from there The BTS system in itself is a real joy The cars are air conditioned to the point of being cold (which in the Bangkok heat can be a refuge in itself) and the cars are clean and relatively new The BTS lines can take you to most of the destinations a tourist or businessman might wish including the river where you can catch a tour boat to the Temple of Dawn or a river taxi to any destination up or down the river The BTW system also connects to the underground system and while not integrated by ticket they have several connecting transit stations where you can change from one system to the other Bottom line is learn to navigate using mass transit in Bangkok or learn to sit in a taxi for hours of your day

title: Best way of getting around Bangkok
review: Best way of getting around Quick cheap and easy to use Highly recommend this rather than taxis as the gridlock traffic in Bangkok is horrible

title: Skytrain
review: Easy transfer from airport to this hotelif you know hoe to gohwreare two lanes express and city laneaswel if ucant figurw out just know wherw to go and station staff can help youor do somee google

title: Quickest way to get across Bangkok
review: The BTS is confusing at first but once familiarized it is a brilliant way of travelling in the city Alongside the MTR Traffic is killing and taxis take forever

title: Easy to Explore the town with Skytrain!
review: Cheap way 2 get Around town Easy access and not 2 complicated to understand If u need help 2 get from A 2 B the Thai people are so friendly and helpfull

title: Easy peezy
review: Such an easy way to get around with the kids even with a pram All air conditioned and very safe

title: Very good service
review: With the traffic in Bangkok being as bad as it is Infind myself using the BTS all the time It is a cheap very efficient way to get around Bkk The ticket process is easy and the machines simple to use Probably a good idea to know where you want to go and have a map I would recommend the use of the BTS as an easy and cheap way to get around

title: Fast and reliable, but expensive
review: I took the Skytrain to reach the Chatuchaya weekend market on the north of BKK Freezing temperature inside and the ticket is very expensive in comparison with taxies Btw it's a nice experience and it's worth a trip

title: Easy and very clean
review: This system is easy to use and extremely clean And very cheap Between 20b and 45b you can't do wrong considering getting in a tax will set you back 100 to 200 b

title: Fast transport and very good connectivity
review: My wife and child were 1st timers to bangkok  But were very comfortable with the skytrain  Very clear instructions in english

title: Easy to use
review: Was worried that I would be tired and would find this difficult after a long flight but the signs to find it were easy and the service is excellent Even using the ticket machines is easy and in English

title: Clean and efficient
review: The BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok Only downside is it doesn't state the arrival times and platforms have no seats

title: Systematic and easy
review: Well organized from buying tickets to queuing to board  Best to get the stored value card if intending to repeatedly return to BKK like me  A pleasure to ride

title: Clean and efficient
review: The BTS experience is a must for any visitor to BangkokIt is one of the most efficient and clean mass transit systems and inspite of rush hour traffic the Thais are so orderly it is amazing The airconditioning inside the trains are makes the trave that much more enjoyable

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Nice clean and easy to ride They have expanded the lines around Bangkok so you can get to more areas Recommend getting a hotel close to a BTS station to make it easy to avoid the traffic

title: Fast and cheap
review: The best way to travel around BKK The trains are modern and air conditioned Can be very crowded during the rush hour

title: So easy and fast! Definitely use.
review: The skytrain is so easy to use You buy tickets as you enter the train platform you can buy one way or day pass etc (there are lots of combos you can buy ticket wise) and you head on up Swiping your ticket is so simple  just pop it into the ticket slot and the gate opens After this you head up to the platform there are lots of signs (in English and Thai) telling you which platform is which On the train it is very clean and there is lots of room There are announcements between each stop explaining what is coming next (again in English and Thai) along with a computer screen showing what stop is next You can also get maps of the train Lines from platformsstops or your hotel which are so easy to read and use Definitely faster and easier than taxis and tuk tuks would highly recommend Don't be scared to use them it's very difficult to get lost

title: Functional
review: Gets you where you want to go Cheap no litter but not clean either Maps are mostly in thai so you have to listen very carefully especially if you are a visitor and nonthai

title: BTS Bangkok
review: If one lives in the center of Bangkok the sky train is the only way to get around It takes so much less time than a taxi to go anywhere It is fast and clean and for old people like us (seniors) costs little Crazy to use any other means of transport

title: Great idea
review: The cost for it cheap but it's same the taxi if you are two or more but in BTS you save the time Moreover the skywalks connect every thing for you and you should to try it

title: Works well but not well connected
review: If your in Bangkok you'll be using the BTS It's often faster than taxis because of the traffic  It's cheap and operates efficiently but it's not really well connected to the metro It's all a bit disjointed

title: 1st Timer
review: The Sky Train is a very easy and efficient way of getting around BKK They are very clean fast obviously with approximately 10 million people in the city they do get crowded but that's life Staff and security on the platforms are very helpful Destinations come up in Thai and English and you are able to track your route I recommend using this over the other forms of transport around BKK  1010 from me

title: Really easy to use
review: Good route maps reasonably priced clearly signed Multilingual announcements  Clean modern and regular service  I was travelling with my daughter but would feel comfortable travelling alone on the Skytrain

title: Very clean and prompt
review: the service runs on time and the trains run on time the only problem is you have to have change and cannot use notes

title: Extremely crowded
review: Skytrain could be a good option for locals but as a tourist I found it overly crowded and comparatively expensive If two people share a taxi to reach a destination it will cost almost similar to reach the same destination by skytrain So I did not find it much convenient

title: Convenient Public Transport
review: I find BTS is a better public transport in bangkok town compare to taxi More frequent during peak hours will not feel warm even full in peak period

title: Connvenient travelling but be aware of Friday afternoon rush hour
review: Great way to travel around bangkok No traffic jams and very cheap as well (unlimited travel with a One day pass only 140 Baht which is aroung 35 euro) Also very cool due to the airco Dont forget to stay in line and dont behave as you are thje only one on the world

title: i almost never used a taxi .... BTS  is the KEY
review: Everybody knows that bangkok is a big town  First you think about  daily taking a taxi  gosh   But i was surprised from there Skytrain SUPER modern Actually i didnt saw a more modern Skytrain no where in the world And the tickets are super cheap

title: Great mode of transport
review: The skytrainh is a very easy way to get around Bangkok Cool and airconditioned and you never have to wait long The best way to travel around Bangkok

title: Quick clean efficiant air conditioned
review: The quickest and cheapest way to get around bangkok Lovely and air conditiond runs like clock work Wish british trains where this good

title: Best mode of transport
review: Best way to travel in Bangkok to avoid huge traffic Comfortable and well maintained stations and trains

title: Fantastic BTS
review: i just take bts at Chidrom station to MBK inside the bus clean and comfortable Price is fair but difficult to exchange money

title: Use it
review: Brilliant system very easy to use and cheap as chips Fantastic way of cutting out all bangkok's traffic fast speedy and clean

title: Efficient train system
review: BTS is popular with locals and tourists alike You can go places in Bangkok that BTS passes along in minutes instead of being stuck in road traffic which can be really terrifying It can get overly congested during peak hours especially at around 6pm  7pm weekdays

title: Very easy to use
review: Used the sky train while in Bangkok  really easy to use as everything colour coded Very cheap and keeps you out of the traffic jams  Nice to get into the air con for a while and very clean

title: Easy to use but small children also need to buy ticket
review: It is  easy and convenient to use I love the systematice process cos the tickets obtained at the stations by cash in to a vending machine Good things is small change can be obtained at the station They request my small kid to buy ticket for herself too but the end the machine couldn't detect my daughter when she pass through because her height is low So I wonder why she still need to buy ticket

title: Convenient! BTS stations at most major places/venues/etc
review: Convenient Easy to find easy to get around in Bangkok with BTS Bought a 1day ticket for 140 Baht very convenient

title: Clean!
review: Thailand's skytrain is very clean compared to a lot of public transportation in other countries I wish it went to more places though especially Rama 4 Road

title: Very fast, inexpensive and convenient.
review: If your destination is near the Skytrain there is no better way to get there  Traffic in Bangkok is very unpredictable and can be horrendous at times so taxis though not very expensive are often a poor choice  However I would choose a taxi when there is little chance of congestion (late at night or on Sundays and holidays)  If you are in Bangkok for more than a day or two I suggest buying a Rabbit Card for the BTS to avoid long lines for every trip to purchase tickets  Also be aware the BTS can be very crowded during rush hours  Best to avoid those times if you can

title: Clean and convenient
review: Very clean and convenient Great to use during rush hour Also not so crowded But it seems to be bit expensive Paid 28 baht for traveling 4 stations and 15 baht for 1 station

title: Very quick
review: Inspite of a language problem in Bangkok i could take the BTS all by myself  It is pretty straightforward   It helped me reach my destination in 10  15 mins as compared to the 1 hr it would have taken in a taxi due to traffic   Great value for money

title: Fantastic way to get around
review: The skytrain is a brilliant way to get around in Bangkok Easy to work out   great way to avoid pesky tuk tuk drivers

title: best thing in thailand
review: traveled many times on the sky train can not fault it its clean train are regular and good air con

title: Only way to travel with Bangkok
review: I have been in and out of Bangkok and Thailand for the past few years My partner lives in Bangkok so I use BTS everyday it is reliable clean on time safe and cheap  With maps at every station it is hard to get lost   I recommend getting a day ticket and just go everywhere

title: Sky train
review: The best and quickest way to get around Bangkok Air con throughout and a cheap way to travel It's a must you also get great views over such a beautiful amazing city

title: Bangkok from above
review: the main Problem in BKK is the trafficThe best way to save time is the skytrain in combination with boats The mainStation is SIAM SQUARE Lots of Shopping around and direct Access to PARAGON with UNDERWATERWORLD The Station for Sightseeings near the Chao Phaya River is Taksin Bridge

title: Easy to use but staff can be unhelpful
review: It's a fast train gets you to were you need does what it says Well signed on the train but the let down wad the staff The staff seemed to be very unhelpful to the tourist who was unsure which stops attractions  where at

title: Always overcrowded - but might be the proper way to travel in this city
review: Wekk organized system not superclean and not supermodern Full of people (of course) But how can it be in a city with 1020 million people (WHO KNOWS)

title: easy to use 140 baht all day ticket
review: easy to use but always packed  efficient but extremely busy at peak times and in Sukhumhvit area different tickets available 140 all day pass good for short visit 500 baht for month good prices

title: Efficient, cheap, easy to use
review: First time I have used this and it makes a welcome alternative to the notorious heavy traffic jams It is straightforward easy  safe and efficient Easier in fact than the London underground and a far more pleasant experience Tickets obtained at the stations by cash in to a vending machine (change can be obtained at the station)

title: Worst metro I ever taken
review: It is one of the worst train ride i ever had  Staff doesn't understand English and very rude  No smiles  Yes you heard it right NO SMILE  (  The train was over extremely crowded  Buying ticket is not easy as machine only accept coins and it took me an hour to figure out how to buy ticket and transfer to the other train   Staff were not helpful or perhaps doesn't understand simple English    Bottom line Dont take train if you dont want to spoil your mood for the rest of the day  Might as well take taxi as it will be cheaper than train if 3 or 4 people sharing  Train stations are not elderly friendly  You have to take staircase up and down and walk like hell

title: great ride with excellent view of the city,
review: we enjoyed the super fast ride and enjoyed the view of the city and the surroundings bit expensive but excellent one

title: Skytrain in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain in Bangkok is an easy and convenient way to travel avoiding the traffic I would suggest a daily ticket if your intention is to travel to several destinations I paid Bht150 for a day ticket

title: Keep coins handy and avoid it in rushhour
review: The train is cost effective and a great convenience It gets very stuffy in rush hour and the only way I learnt to buy tickets was through a vending machine that accepted coins only which are made available to you by the ticketing staff Best routes to take sometimes takes some planning beforehand I used to use the hotel staff before I headed out to plan my route

title: Enjoy the journey
review: BTS skytrain is a very enjoyable journey you can also move fast in the heart of Bangkok city without taking any traffic jam Its also enjoyable thank you

title: train is too good
review: i had my share of travel in it and it was a very good thing i was travelling from siam to mochid so didnt have any hassels to figure out the travel people were helping inthe info and its so prpmt that u can go by the charts had a wonderful time very clean

title: inappropriate for people withwheelchair or bany car
review: very convenient clean accurate for sure but people with disabilities can not rideBTS i've never found the access to the platform and even to the bts service counter level So not suitable for baby trolleys too

title: great service
review: Easy to navigate and get around Bangkok this service is operational until midnight each day and is a cheap and safe way to get around

title: The best way to commute in Bangkok
review: Its fast its accessible and its cheap BTS Skytrain is the best way to commute in Bangkok You can go to most of the tourist spots by BTS Though it is really busy most of the times especially between 400 pm to 700 pm If during this time you please to catch the Airport link via BTS its better you leave early or take a taxi With luggage it is almost impossible to get on BTS as it is jam packed

title: The best way to commute in Bangkok
review: Its easy its fast and and its cheap Nice way to commute in Bangkok Though it gets really busy in peak hours and sometimes you have to squeeze in If you are planning to go to the airport during the time slot of 500 pm to 700 pm Better take a Taxi or Leave early No Chance you can get in with luggage

title: Best way to travel the city!!!
review: The cheapest way to travel bangkok  It costs at the most 50 THB for a ticket usually not more than 20 THB

title: Great Way To Get Around Central Bangkok
review: The BTS skytrain is a great way to get around central Bangkok And it's expanding it's reach to outer Bangkok During peak times it's pretty crowded especially if you have to buy a ticket before you get on That's why I recommend buying a multiple trip ticket if you're going to be here for very long then you avoid at least one line The train takes you to many of the main places that you want to get to in Bangkok And if you use it in conjunction with the MTR (subway) and Rail Link to Suvarnabhumi airport you can get around to even more places The trains are pretty clean and almost always run regularly and on time One downside is that like most of Bangkok it's not very handicap or suitcase friendly I think most of the station's lifts are out of order So you'll have to use either an escalator (usually one on either side of a station) or walk up the stairs

title: Nice view
review: Commonly known as BTSPublic transportation at a world class standardVery cheapThe view is very nice from train

title: Fast, clean and efficient people mover
review: The BTS Skytrain is a fast clean and efficient way to move around Bangkok from early morning until midnight As one would expect it becomes fairly crowded during rush hour but the air conditioning and disciplined and courteous conduct of the Thai passengers makes it quite tolerable at those times and even better during nonpeak hours If your destination is near a BTS station it will often get there faster via the Skytrain as opposed to taxi The cost of a ride on the BTS is quite economical too

title: So easy
review: Very easy to use and convenient locations to get on also very inexpensive to use Personnel available to help along the way Very clean also

title: Great Transportation
review: It was an easy way to reach other close destination in busy Bangkok city with cheap price and fast You just check in and check out quickly

title: Avoid peak hours
review: If possible plan your journey around peak hours Otherwise you may have to squeeze or wait for train that has empty spaces

title: value for money & Convenient
review: As there is too much traffic in Bangkok Skytrain is the best option  though you have to walk to get there still its time saver and also very convenient

title: comfortable
review: Bangkok BTS IS VERY COMFORTABLE and fast way to get from any central points to another Close to big shoping malls central Sukhumvit Rd Not expencive

title: Clean and reliable
review: It is a breeze that the guesthouse we stayed is just some walking distance to a BTS station We utilized the Skytrain when we went to Sathorn Pier ( for our temple visits) and when we went to Chatuchak The trains are clean efficient and there are helpful things to see if you are not sure where you are going Just remember to stack up some coins because the ticket machine only takes coins but you can easily change your Thai notes in the "Ticket Office" booth into coins

title: Holiday
review: Easy access to different areas of the Bangkok not expensive for the tickets  It's very cold on the train great as its so hot outside its like a treat

title: Must have a trip in BTS Skytrain
review: Extremely well maintained clean  neat and well organized to tackle high no of passengers Most of them are well connected to tourists places like Siam where there are malls wax museum underground aquarium

title: Best way to go around Bangkok
review: Do not take taxi unless it is midnight During the day just stick to BTS and MRT and walk through malls and stores You will reach your destination as schedule

title: Clean & well managed.
review: This BTS Skytrain made our trip in Bangkok so much easier & convenient It would be better if the stations provide the washrooms

title: Save yourself from hassle
review: Save yourself from the hassle of tuktuk and unmetered taxi Get a one day unlimited pass with THB140 with the BTS sky train Just hope in and out to the nearest BTS station and off your way to see the attraction of Bangkok

title: A good alternative to avoid the traffic jam
review: The BTS Skytrain is a good alternative to avoid the traffic jam in Bangkok Took the BTS Skytrain from Ratchathewi station to Mo Chit station and walked to Chatuchak Market which was convenient Many places of interest are also situated near the BTS Skytrain stops and the fare is reasonably priced

title: Convenient
review: A must use transportation while in Bangkok No point to get a one day tourist card as it doesnt make much difference

title: Useful and easy to use
review: It is a train that takes you to different stations It is easy to use and very cheap You only pay one way per person each time It is reliable and clean and stops at useful points throughout the city Not really much more to say as the first sentence sums it up

title: Easy peasy leon squeezey
review: Loved it and was easy to follow and get were i wanted to be  Saim station is the biggest and were you need to switched lines

title: Quick.
review: Cheap & easy to use To your destination fast & quite comfortable So much cheaper than taxis & of course much quicker

title: World Class Public Transport
review: The BTS Skytrain is in good company in Bangkok with the MRT Underground Train  both provide public transport at a world class standard  If you're staying within close proximity to one the stations of either service they should be your primary transport whilst in Bangkok  if you're not staying within close proximity I suggest you should consider relocating   If the Skytrain doesn't get you to one of the mustsee attractions around Bangkok the MRT likely will  and viceversa  Skytrain offers the views of BKK whilst perched above the ground in airconditioned comfort but MRT stations provides a reprieve from the heat whilst waiting for air conditioned trains to come along   Skytrain and MRT each have an interchange station with the Airport Train to and from the basement of Suvarnabhumi Airport  again a great world class service that gets you as close to the airport as a taxi does  I'm also a huge fan of this train service (cheap very reliable and avoids horrendous traffic) and there's another airport link being constructed at the moment (Sep 2016) to service BKK's other major airport at Don Mueang

title: Fantastic on time and so clean!
review: The Skytrain is great value and easy to use for a none Thai speaker  Very cheap and very clean easy to use and on time  I wish we had trains like these in the UK  Near to most attractions and even airconditioned As the city is so crowded and the taxis hardly move as hectic traffic you should definitely experience the BTS Skytrain Easy cheap and clean

title: Services Good
review: The service is Good very clean and modern Not expensive Good experience travel in the middle of skyscrapers

title: Smart way to get going
review: Bangkok is a city that has definitely traffic issues So either plan plenty if time for traffic jams or you can take the BTS sky train It's easy to use and with a reasonably priced day pass ticket you skip all lines at the ticket vending machines English maps are available at any station and on top if being fast (but in a very comfortable way) you can see some amazing scenes

title: Definitely use while in Bangkok
review: We used this to travel to MBK and central world and was perfect for this All day pass costs 140thb each up until midnight Must recommend for travel around Bangkok however it gets very busy on the Siam stops

title: Simples
review: Great way to get around bangkok cheap and fast didn't have time to work out the ticket machines so went to the ticket windows very helpful and always someone about willing to help if you look lost on the platforms You can get day tickets that's very useful

title: Hop around the city
review: Convenient inexpensive way to move around the city that spares you from the infamous Bangkok traffic Get to the major shopping points with ease but needs some expansion to be perfect to get all over the city to include other sites there Not 24 hour service like in NYC Announcements are given in Thai and English maps are easy to decipher and calculations of fares from the machines also Go ahead and use the system

title: Best way to travel
review: Bangkok is a city with crazy traffic The BTS is the best way to commute and it's extremely convenient and cost effective Especially if you're visiting the mall for shopping almost all of them have station which are right at the shopping malls

title: the best transportation in bangkok
review: i used this system everytime  but please avoid the rush hour you will be packed because it's a time for people traveling to their work place and school

title: fastest, coolest and easiest
review: this line almost passes through the whole city of bangkok with lots of connection points  with other railway systems and buses making ur trip in the city as convenient as possible

title: Quick to common locations
review: If your hotel is on the BTS route then it's an easy way to get to MBK Siam Plaza and Central World which cover the majority of shopping needs If you're going to be back then consider a travel pass and avoid the queue for change & then for a ticket token

title: Going around Bangkok!
review: The best way to travel cheap and fast is going by Skytrain or Metro its so easy to find your way around Bangkok

title: Works
review: Works fine But the lines don't go to all parts of the city which is annoying This way you are forced to take a taxi or walk long distances for some areas Also there's no card that works for all public transport systems So you have to switch between cards or buy coins

title: Clean fast and reasonably priced
review: Clean fast and reasonably priced  Great way to get around Babgkok above the traffic with cool aircon  Just try to avoid the rush hour Looking forward to the new lines opening up

title: Fast, Cheap and reliable mode of transport
review: Used skytrain all the time for our visit to places in bangkok It's fast and cheap way of transportation Traffic in bangkok can very well ruin your plan so it's advisable to use trains

title: It's so useful and not expensive.
review: I have been to Bangkok over 18 times but I have not tried getting on this Because my last time in the city was over 12 years ago  Well BTS is very nice as useful and not expensive No matter to worry to late moving by bus and cab

title: Travel across the city couldn't be easier.
review: The nearest station was only 8 mins away from our hotel BTS is a great traffic buster You can spend hours in a taxi queuing whereas the BTS gets you around most parts of the city really quickly We bought a day pass each which was approx Â£5 for the 2 of us or you can get single journeys for as little as Â£030 Queue at the ticket desk either for change for the tickets machine or to purchase a day pass The stations work like the London Underground just make sure you know which line (one of 2) and where the terminal station is so you get the right train All the stations are numbered Make sure you know the name of the station at your destination and look up its number on the machine Select the number and it tells you how many coins to put in All in english and very simple Its not as wide spread as the London Underground but between the BTS and the MRT (Underground) you can cover most of the city

title: Fastest way to travel in Bangkok
review: It is the fastest way to travel in Bangkok area  Sometime going up to the station and coming down is a problem due to stairs otherwise convenient  If you are traveling in a group of 4 to 5 then it becomes quite expensive better to take the taxi if you don't mind the traffic

title: Awesome transpiration service
review: If you plan to explore Bangkok city this transportation will help heaps Awesome aircondition to cool you down while you are heading to your destination I find that you can get around Bangkok traffic jam by using the BTS to get as close to your intended destination as possible and then catch a cabuber or walk

title: Clean and Safe
review: We felt safe and noticed how clean the whole area was  Lots of security who were very helpful especially when the noticed I had a walking stick and one even stopped the train from leaving to enable me to get aboard

title: Convenient, but crowded during peak hours
