review: We stayed at one of the hotels near Nana station and took the skytrain to get to the shopping district For this purpose alone the sky train was cheap and great  the traffic jams can be horrid My main gripe about the system is that it isn't integrated to get to the grand palace you would need to take the sky train change to the MRT and then take the river boat the last of which is the most painful and confusing

title: Most convenient Way to travel and explore BKK.
review: For business or for exploring BKK as tourist its best to use Sky Train It will surely save you a great deal of time and frustrations of getting stuck at long traffic jams of the city Also  may work out cheaper than Taxi depending on distance you are travelling  I go to BKK almost every alternate month for business and try and use Sky train  underground combination as much as possible Reach nearest point of your destination with trains and then take taxi is the best way to travel in BKK  The trains are clean air conditioned the commuters are very disciplined and its always a pleasure travelling on BTS trains   Once you know how to use them its best way to get around most parts of Business or tourist destinations in BKK

title: Far above the madding crowds, inexpensive and air-conditioned too!
review: We use the BTS Skytrain many times travelling into central Bangkok after crossing the river from the Millennium Hilton Hotel Trains come along quite frequently maybe 1012 minutes offpeak but can be really crowded during peak times packed like sardines and standing room only the aircon struggles to cope When not too crowded a decent view of the city can be had when seated and we found the lines and station schematics on the train walls easy to follow after a trip or two At peak times though best allow some 5  7 minutes to obtain your tickets as the ticket office queue stretch across the pathways used by passengers causing a lot of give and take with people breaking through the ticket office lines BTS always clean and any graffiti usually only seen on the windows Compared with taxis I'd always use BTS when I know where I'm headed and also know what it will cost me Overall a big tick from me

title: Good!
review: Clean fast and great What more can you want in a transport Defiantly cleaner than the parts i come from

title: Tourism
review: BTS sky train and MRT in Bangkok is very well organized and very helpful and a cheap and fast mode of transport I think major attractions are connected to the BTS  MRT or are near the stations Very clean and efficient and well maintained

title: easy way to skip the traffic
review: easy to use very cheap avoid the street traffic crowded with people it reaches only little places in Bangkok

title: Great after a few Nigel Farages
review: Got this train last week with friends after a night out quick and easy to work and access Cheap prices compared to taxi and tuk tuk and very many stops Also people on the train were nice and pleasant and no trouble caused

title: It's a train
review: Wow I have never been on such an awesome train This train has everything Windows doors seats the lot I know what your thinking Does it get any better Well it does As week as the aforementioned facilities the sky train actually moves I got on in one place in Bangkok and 10 minutes later BOOM I'm somewhere else I didn't even walk anywhere All trains should do this London totally needs to get on this train

title: Only way to get about
review: Spotless air conditioned  continual and prompt service we waited nearly a full 2 minutes yesterday for our next trainð love this service we got a day pass about Â£3 each but worth every penny as we're going for dinner and the passes were valid till midnight we gave ours to to 2 very grateful backpackers Can get busy on certain parts of the routes at peak times don't let this put you off people move to let you on and off

title: The Only Way to Travel
review: Used the BTS Skytrain to travel to the worlds largest market in Mo Chitt  Fast clean and reliable transport

title: Efficient and affordable
review: Always clean and timely Easy for both locals and tourists to get around the city without hurting your wallet Can get super packed so brave yourself for a little squeeze at times

title: The BTS Rocks!!!
review: We love the BTS it is such a nice way to travel around Bangkok They don't allow food or drink which is nice because it stays so clean It is also Air conditioned so you are very comfortable while traveling The BTS is amazing

title: Costly thanks to terrible traffic
review: Overpriced but more convenient due to the notorious traffic in Bangkok  UBER indeed provides much cheaper service than any of those but  whether time can buy money is obviously a consideration  By the way  just avoid the rush hours and the rail itself is fine

title: Easy and efficient
review: Easyefficient and convenient way to travel around Bangkok city apart from taking taxi (time mostly wasted due to heavy traffic) even though can be packed in the train during peak hoursthe air condition inside is always coldtrain also always on time Thumbs up

title: Easy to travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS skytrain in Bangkok is quite convenient easy and very clean It helps you save time during the rush hours But you have to bear in mind that it is also very crowded in the train itself or at the station Very long queue during the rush hours or when it rains Before here was only the city lines but now there is an extension to the outside the heart of Bangkok From the Suvarnabhumi airport also you can take the train to Phyathai station and then change to Sukhumvit line or Silom Line That is cheaper than taxi

title: Cheap and cheap
review: It's clean and cheap and provides good value  It isn't overly packed and if you need to go across sukhumvit road there's no faster way

title: Great set up.
review: This is the best way to travel around Thailand Cheap efficient and air con It can get crowded but hey took us more than two hours to get from airport to sukhumvit in a taxi Next time we train

title: Get pricey but better than taxi
review: The traffic in bangkok is pretty bad It's faster to take bts Sometimes it's not as cheap as taxi or uber If there are 4 of you

title: One the best!
review: Have traveled extensively by the Sky Train and am amazed by its simplicity & reliability Me and my husband are regular holidayers in Thailand and count on it In fact we make sure we use this for airport transfers as well  to beat the famed Bangkok traffic The BTS staff is very helpful

title: Best way to get around bangkok
review: When in Bangkok the easiest and cheapest way to get around is the BTS ( skytrain) or the MRT ( subway) Safe way to travel no taxi or tuk tuk scams  it is quick and very accessible

title: Only way to move freely in BKK
review: Too good  Fast efficient and cheap  AC inside and always well cleaned  Take a day ticket and enjoy the overview of Bangkok traffic

title: Birds eye view of the city
review: Purchase the day pass travel both lines get on get off check out the areas that are off the tourist track

title: Great
review: I had sky train experience at the time i was traveled Thailand and it was a great experience for me

title: Easy to use, clean and good value
review: Some tourists shy away from public transport fearing it will be too challenging The Skytrain is an exception there are only two main lines so unlike other subway systems around the world it is really easy to navigate and much cheaper and a lot less hassle than haggling with a tuk tuk driver Ps it is also air conditioned so a welcome retreat from the Bangkok heat

title: Fast but crowded
review: I know we were travelling in rush hour but more carriages should have been possible Very fast and efficient and about he only way to get around Bangkok when rush hour or raining

title: Good
review: Good public transportation However it would be better if the place was wheelchair accessible I had to fold my toddler's stroller so many times to climb the stairs It would not been possible to carry my baby and his stroller and other things alone

title: Fastest & comfoatble way to travel in BKK
review: Convenient comfortable and cheaper than taxi  good option for tourist   because taxi driver in bkk many time cheat you

title: It's a train, a bit like the metro in other cities but very useful
review: Why am I writing a review about the Skytrain  It's just a train  That said if you want to embrace the transport system of any city then this will be useful to you  You can wiz around quickly the only issue is that it is not extensive enough

title: Very modern
review: Very modern system and stations also in English Booking easy at the station as you could opt for English Tokens instead of tickets Very efficient Took from airport

title: Expensive
review: I think it is too expensive One way ticket is 40 baht and if you buy all day ticket it is 140 baht  If you just go to the close places you should take a taxi Because most of the time taxies are cheaper than skytrain for groups

title: convenient, practical
review: the right way to travel downtown bkk too many trafic and too warm to walk the street th BTS is easy to use for any foreigner  and it reaches the main places you need to visit when you visit bangkok

title: Great way to travel
review: The Sky Train was a  brilliant way to travel as the traffic in Bangkok is worse than London Obviously very busy in peak hours but really good fun

title: best way to get someplace fast
review: You can sit in traffic for an hour for just a few miles but the elevated train is great go most places in mid city fast Tickets are available at the stations If you can't do automated there is a teller

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Clean and reliable transport around Bangkok and best way to beat the traffic snarls learn the system and you will have no problems pick up a transport card and recharge as necessary

title: Excellent mode of commuting
review: BTS sky train is an amazing mode to travel from one end to another in the Bangkok city It was kind of economical and the smooth ride across different stations is perfect

title: Very convenient and comfortable Journey
review: Use this when in Thailand to go around  It would be much faster than the road which take time due to huge traffic Train travel is cheap cleaner and comfortable as well

title: Fantastic way to travel
review: BTW is safe and convenient  Gets a little busy at Siam but other great and easy to use You need coins or change to purchase tickets or buy a day pass at desk

title: Good experience.
review: Not to hard to navigate just select the station required and it gives you the ticket price to be deposited in coins

title: Convenient Travel
review: MRT makes my travel so easy and less stress I did not get lost and it make my travel a memorable one I just need amap of the train in my card

title: BTS skytrain
review: very fast gets you around very quickly Went to the chata chung market i found it very relaxing and easier than catching a tuk tuk would recommend to travelers

title: Convenient but Expensive.
review: We went to Bangkok with our two teenage daughters We tried the BTS sky train It was convenient and fast to move around Good way to avoid Bangkok's bad traffic congestion  However it is very expensive For four of us it was 150baht for 4  train stops Uber was way cheaper It cost us 90baht for 8km plus being stuck in traffic for an hour  The trains are clean And its airconditioning in good working condition But the train stops are not that well maintained And the two stops that we went to did not have any escalators  Personally I do not recommend the BTS sky train if there are more than 2 people in the group Opt for Uber as it is cheaper and more convenient

title: I highly recommend using!
review: I highly recommend using the BTS to bypass city traffic The BTS takes you around the city quickly and cheaply and I rarely had to use taxis during my trip  The cashiers in the booths were very helpful and there's lots of directions in English to help you navigate the system This is perhaps the most orderly metro system I've even seenused People patiently queued up to the sides of the doors and allowed passengers to disembark and before embarking without pushing

title: Easy and cheap to travel in Bangkok
review: An easy way to travel fast and cheap through Bangkok you are passing major areas like Siam (Central Station) Patpong Silom Road and Saphan TaksinThe Silom line runs from west to south and starts at the National Stadium ending at Wongwian Yai in Thonburi (across the Chao Phraya River) At Saladaeng Station you can also transfer to the MRT Underground

title: Great.
review: Well worth using it to get around bangkok Efficient and reasonably priced   The staff is helpful and professional Highly recommended A great asset to Bangkok

title: Great service
review: It's the best mode of transportation  Specially in a city where the streets are loaded with extreme traffic  One can reach the destination saving a lot of time  One star less coz it doesn't have a station at praduman road ( not sure about the spelling ) which is the main shopping area  Use it to the max

title: Holiday in Bangkok
review: Very easy to use All member of the staff and public are very friendly and helpful The best way to travel

title: Not bad
review: Best alternative to travel as the traffic in Bangkok is very heavy Very convenient but experience a power shortage in one of the trip

title: Better than Australia's public transport
review: You don't have to wait long for a train security when entering stations including bag checks easy to navigate cheap and clean Can get extremely crowded

title: BTS TRAIN
review: The BTS Service is good in Bangkok but quiet expensive Also silom is the station from where you get most connected routes

title: Excellent Connections
review: All the various public transportation are excellently connected From the airport airport & city bus minibus BTS MRT river and canal boats they are linked via various points I find it very convenient to get around Bangkok  and fast

title: Cheap way to get around Bangkok
review: Trains are clean but can be crowded and prices are reasonably cheap making travel around Bangkok easy

title: Sky Train
review: Easy affordable way to travel around Bangkok  Trains arrive every 2 minutes Regardless of the time the trains are always full

title: the way to cover Bangkok
review: It is like the London Underground but 100 feet above ground Very efficient way to travel we bought a day ticket not expensive look at the maps note the end of line destinations as that is what the info given on trains & stations Intersecting lines cross at different levels carry a map & ask staff or security they all seem happy to to help ( just smile at them) &   take your time the next train is only a few minutes wait Be prepared for crowded trains at rush hour you think it is full but at the next stop more people get on  just the way it is Use the system it is the best way to travel  enjoy the experience it is easy to take the wrong line or direction but simple to rectify just get off & catch one the other way Climbing the steps will keep you fit jut take your time

title: Efficient
review: Clean airconditioned efficient and a great way to get around Many stations don't have elevators though

title: Very efficient but expensive
review: Very efficient but expensive well connected and good frequency There are no restrooms even at stations

title: WOW! What a ride. The BTS rocks.
review: I am an American world traveler for decades   I am sure I have experienced over 100 mass transit system around the world My rating system is simple and ingrained to memory evaluation for acceptability in this order (1) possibility of personal danger (2) safety from mechanical failure and human failures (3) fear factors of any other rare source (4) comfort (5) secondary and EVEN unfathomable fear factors (6) a distant last concern of efficiency and price  Simply put the BTS rates the highest in all categories of all the world's mass transportation systems Crime of any sort is almost nonexistent   Trains are comfortable bright colored people are friendly helpful polite generous and very protective of foreigner's safety and happiness I promise   No guns no knives no drinks no food no problem are the rules of the trains   Above ground trains are called BTS trains and underground trains are called MRT All the same in my rating scale  I welcome you you to Bangkok Average BTS or MRT ride is less than 50 cents  Welcome aboard

title: Avoid commuting during rush hours
review: BTS connects major attractions especially malls and shopping spots I personally find it one of the best public transportation in Bangkok The only tips here are 1) to avoid rush hours (78am and 6pm) if you carry large belongings 2) their ticket machine doesn't accept bill notes â it requires you to find all the coins (except two baht coin) you have in your life or go get the changes at the counter This can be a bit lousy

title: Convenient
review: Bangkok's traffic jam is harsh Even more so if you're traveling by tuktuk Been years since i last step foot in bangkok A time when the skytrain has not existed yet So coming back now with my family and having used the skytrain simply gave me a peace of mind knowing my wife and little girl doesn't have to go thru the gruesome punishment that is Bangkok's traffic jam

title: Clean and Best way arount toen
review: this is the best cheap way to get around bangkok it is very clean and efficient it will get crowdy around 6pm

title: Good air-conditioning
review: The train services are good and better than others I will definitely use the train instead of driving in town which was always congested at daytime

title: Great. Especially when u sit down - from Siam square to Saphan Taksim
review: On the way if you do not sit down you will end of standing up all way It is very clean easy to use air conditioned and gets you avoid the terrible traffic during rush hours in Bangkok

title: Must try...very easy travel
review: We are first time travellers to Bangkok and wanted to try BTS Just get the city map and it is so easy and convenient to travel places in BTS especially if you are looking out for shopping the shopping malls are located on the either side of the BTS stations choose a hotel close to BTS station in sukumvit area either near Phrom phong Asok or Nana areas Very convenient to travel

title: One of the best metro systems in Asia
review: Thailand is a tourist friendly country and Bangkok a bustling metro city has proved it beyond doubts by its super efficient metro train system  All the stations are clean modern and has all the information a tourist needs Some of the stations are even linked with other public transportation system like a boat or a train  If you are in Bangkok and want to explore the city do give BTS a try

title: Easy transportation to shopping district
review: Getting to and from the shopping districts Inexpensive travel Buy ticket in the station Fully air conditioned

title: Covenient and relatively cheap and comfortable mode of transport
review: We use the BTS Skytrain and the MRT whenever we are in Bangkok Frequencies are high and it is convenient to get around Bangkok on both the Skytrain and MRT

title: Easy very cheap way to get around and avoid the heat
review: Every time I go to Bangkok I use the BTS skytrain it's just a safe inexpensive way to get around Bangkok can be a very overwhelming city but if you keep your wits about you it's easy to navigate  Most hotels have maps you buy a pass at the stations to avoid getting lost as I have no sense of direction I take a photo of the station that's near my hotel as my Thai is terrible and so is my memory

title: The BTS in Bangkok is very clean and convenient to use
review: The BTS in Bangkok is very clean and convenient to use cheap and quick Probably the most efficient way to travel within Bangkok as the streets are very crowded The trains are crowded with people but thats not a real problem

title: Good public transit, but not a sight to see
review: It's an efficient rapid transit system but there's nothing that makes it stand out when compared to those in other cities It certainly shouldn't be the #2 thing to do in Bangkok

title: Fast
review: Easy to use even for first timerson the train map it also shows howmuch it will cost to takeyou pay with coins and get the ticketvoilacould be cheaper tho i prefer buses instead of this)

title: Good way to commute
review: BTS skytrain is good way to commute in Bangkok It has connection to MRT too at various stations There are 2 lines and one could inter change depending on the destination Frequency is quite good and runs till mid night Only during evening time it runs full however frequency of trains and discipline of people makes journey less uncomfortable during peak hours

title: Bts travel
review: Bts is 1 of the best way to travel tru Bangkok it is cheap and fast not slow and expensive like the tuktuk or taxi

title: Love it
review: Easy to get around anywhere in BKK  a bit pricey and no much options on daily pass Nevertheless a better option than getting stuck in traffic

title: BTS is the Life Line for daily passengers like me.
review: BTS is the Life Line for daily passengers like me Saves from Bangkok horrified Traffic It is very convenient well maintened and the best way to reach almost all the parts of Bangkok

title: Average
review: Personal Feel that is better take cab rather than take bts if you hv 2 passengers and above But provided that the cab driver willing to run with the meter  If not too much heavy traffic   Is much more cheaper and save time than take sky train

title: Very efficient method of transport
review: Very simple to navigate the entire rail service Carriages are clean & they run on time Signage at the stations is very easy to follow  you are either travelling NorthSouth or EastWest Make sure you have sufficient credit on your card which is easily checked at each station or through the payment booths

title: Best way to travel
review: Clean cheapefficientsafe Try to avoid rush hour morning and eveningTrains are not long enough and get really packed especially Siam station

title: try it !
review: any train journey in foreign country is bit of an adventure  gamble but if you dont try you will never know and the ticket office speak  English basically its a line up and down with connection with another  and once you know the eventual destination you van work backwards to where you want to go  and its cheaper than cabs

title: Quite easy once you get the hang of it
review: Simple to use like any other metro system in the world Found it a little confusing to begin with but then pretty straight forward and saves getting ripped off by taxi drivers or tuk tuks

title: Fast, efficient and inexpensive
review: The BTS is the best way to travel around Bangkok   Trains are fast efficient and very clean Tickets are easy to purchase at the stations and staff are always friendly and helpful

title: efficient way around crowded city
review: Very efficient well managed on time service Clean cheap  comprehensive Goes to all of the malls There is a map on every station

title: Good service
review: Over the years the BTS Skytrain service has improved I've used it often ever since my first visit to Bangkok The trains can however get very crowded at times I've seen times when the train stops no one can get in because it's full and then it's off till the next full or almost full train arrives Some of the coin operated ticketing machines weren't working the last time I used the Skytrain I had to try 4 machines before getting a ticket

title: Civilised
review: The best public transport system which is clean efficient and Air conditioned Great to look down into the Embassy gardens etc Can get busy but its a great way to travel and cheap

title: Not too convenient but ok
review: The BTS is just on one side of Bangkok (almost on Sukhumvit Road) and It's not convenient when you connect with MRT (you have to take a short walk for the interchange)  But it's ok fast and cheap

title: Convenient, efficient, well air-conditioned to escape BKK heat!
review: Connects you to most areas of interests (ie malls) outside of the old city  Plan your trip around the BTSMRT network to avoid the notorious BKK traffic jam

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok
review: The traffic in Bangkok can be terrible The BTS skytrain is a frequent clean and safe way to move around It's air conditioned but the stations aren't and you need to traverse a lot of steps as it runs above street level

title: Efficient Train Ride
review: The train ride was smooth and efficient We got to our destination fast and there were no fault or any delay at the time  Security can be a concern as I observed that the deploying guard may seemed to be inattentive or dull at his job No patrolling staff were seen too But not all stations are like that

title: Easy, Clean and Very Efficient!
review: Hadn't got a clue what we were doing today but found it fairly stress free  All day ticket purchased from counter at 140B which although may have been a slight over pay versus what we actually needed However put us at ease knowing we could go anywhere on within the BTS network  Trains are all air conditioned clean and smooth Yes they do get a little busy but if you are from London as I am it's nothing new  Really good system and beats sitting in the chaos on the roads )

title: Clean and fast
review: First time taking BTS There were English words so very convenient  Trains were clean and very cheap Will consider taking BTS when i travel there the next time

title: Getting around in Bangkok
review: This the 1st time I have used BTS in Bangkok It is pleasantly frequent clean and easy form of getting around Bangkok

title: Transport
review: This runs so smoothly & on time  It was a brilliant was to get around Bangkok The service maps are easy to follow and its not expensive

title: Brings You To Almost All the Touristy Places
review: Best mode of transport to beat the traffic Ensure you buy a rail pass and top it up to any amount Unused rail pass can be refunded in full at any station Note the BTS rail pass cannot be use for the underground MRT Not to worry as the BTS brings you to almost 80% of where you want to go Enjoy

title: The only way to go
review: Clean safecheap crowded and super cold AC which is great in Bangkok If you want to get any where quick in Central Bangkok the Skytrain is the quickest

title: Robyn k Australia
review: Caught the sky rail The staff were helpful with buying tickets even though they did not speak English Very clean and efficient unlike Melbourne

title: Very conveignant
review: Of course Bangkok will not be the same if there is not BTS Can go nearly everywhere for 40THB New BTS is on the way

title: Very conveniet
review: If you are in bkk must use bts as much as you can to avoid crazy traffic all the day specially in peak hours And it is fast reliable Can access most of parts  in the city with good interconection with MRT

title: Fantastic way to get around Bangkok
review: Found the BTS one of the quickest easiest way to get around Central Bangkok  It's cheap and runs both ways every 2 or 3 minutes Carriages are always spotless and you don't have people talking on their phones which I find great

title: Life-saving transportation in Bangkok
review: I'd hate to think what it looks like without Skytrain in Bangkok I wish they continue the lines and cover the entire city Access to most of the stations is difficult to impossible for the elderly the disabled or strollers Except so Try to avoid the rush hour trains which are similar to cans of sardines

title: BTS Skytrain
review: BTS skytrain is definitely Bangkokâs most convenient mode of transport and is connected to almost all famous attractions The skytrain offers hasslefree travel at about 25 baht one way

title: On top of Bangkok
review: The Sky train is truly a great experience in travel  So easy to get about affordable and certainly quickest way from A to B   An being air conditioned is welcomed In short every major city should be so lucky

title: Clean and cheap way to go around Bangkok
review: Clean and affordable If you can avoid it during rush hours I was surprised how well behaved the students were on the train

title: Air conditioned and easy to navigate
review: BTS is a relatively quick and easy way to get around city that also has the perk of being air conditioned Can get quite crowded though during peak times Single tickets can be bought at each station there is also a booth at each one to exchange money for coins for the ticket machines

title: Fly across Bangkok.
review: Probably the best way to cover longer distances across the city It costs peanuts and covers a large parts of the town It can get really busy 4pm to 7pm and 7m to 9 am but at other times is less crowded Some stations intersect withMRT underground and the Airport link

title: Great way to move around BKK
review: Sometimes very crowded sometimes not BTS is the choice to get around in Bangkok With a perfect air conditioning system and elevated stations that connects to skybridges to many malls and other attractions BTS "Skytrain" is cheap and easy to ride

title: Fantastic, Faultless experience
review: My girlfriend and I stayed in the fantastic Eastin Grand Hotel which had a walkway on to the station which made life incredibly easy with the sky train stopping anywhere you'd wish to go around Bangkok The service is timely impeccably clean modern and efficient Brilliant

title: average transportation system
review: this review will be a comparison between the BTS skytrain and the Putra Heights in Malaysia Overall the train are of satisfactory speedfrequency and spaceThere is only a lack of window view as the windows are positioned quite low to head level

title: Sky train
review: I am very impressed with the public transportation in Thailand  It's cheap to get around and very safe and clean

title: Clean & Cool
review: Unfortunately you cannot buy a single ticket for all transports (like underground) You buy tickets selecting the destination so price is variable on your trip You can use it to reach the river trips Temperature is very cool

title: best way to move in Bangkok
review: Clean on time and well maintained The only cons are the ticket vending machine you will need tons of coins  So the solution is to go to the cashier and buy the daily ticket or top up cards Then just use them  Can get to Chatuchak market shopping centers or all around Bangkok and the line is extending more and more

title: Excellent means of transport
review: Taking the bts is easy and cheap Saved us a lot of time especially during peak hours when there is so much traffic that even tuktuks are stuck But be prepared to be squeezed inside the trains

title: Easy way around
review: Best way to transfer from BKK airport to to city Ticket price is depending on where you need to go but will be around 2030 bath

title: AMAZING!
review: I rode the BTS every workday for more than 4 years and here's what I know * Timely Every 10 minutes from 6AM until midnight * Inexpensive Less than $4 USD to ride ALL DAY * It goes to most of the commercial and tourist areas of Bangkok * It connects with the other points of public transportation  This listing says I visited in September of 2016  but I LIVE here and I use it

title: Transportation at its best.
review: Fully automated ticketing and service Not much of a hasty crowd Well connected all through Bangkok

title: Covenient and clean
review: Passenger is following the cue is show the metro public quality To buy the bts ticket must use the coin is can change with the bts service counter

title: The Excellent Bangkok Skytrain.
review: This is a very efficient way of travel in central Bangkok The trains are very frequent & spotlessly clean The train is very well air conditioned which can be very comfortable in a normal hot day in Bkk Travellers on the Skytrain are required not to eat or drink in transit the Thais observe this rule meticulously however occasional tourists do not perhaps through ignorance Most people know that traffic in Bkk can be very heavy this is certainly the case in peak hours before 10 am & again building up from 3pm In between these hours it is usually fine to use taxis at peak times however the Skytrain wins hands down Skytrain stations are still being built around Bangkok The oldest stations tend to be around the central area Not all of these stations have lifts however which can make things difficult for those with walking problems or travelling with prams etc as there are usually many stairs to the platformsMost stations do have moving stairs upwards ( but not always downwards) so do look around for these if you need this assistance There is a very good system for queuing at Skytrain stations follow the arrows on the platform or observe the Thai people & do as they do The Skytrain is no cheaper than taking a taxi & more expensive if there are several of you travelling There are ticket machines at the station & desks where you can obtain change for the machines Street & station maps help you to know how much the ticket will cost from your start point to destination Even if you do not need to use the train while in Bkk one journey will be an interesting experience

title: Bangkok BTS
review: The BTS is the best way to travel and beat the Bangkok Traffic There are great shopping and tourist areas on or near the BTS lines and you will travel in aircon comfort If visiting I suggest a Top up card that allows multi trips

title: Clean. Efficient. Fast. Convenient.
review: Clean Efficient Fast Convenient  Just avoid during 810am and 430730 (ish)pm rush hours when you'll be packed in like a sardine ) Though as far as rush hour trains go these are still way smoother and more efficient than NYC subways (which are not very difficult to beat as far as standards go)

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: The sky train is the best way to get around Bangkok cheap compaired to other major cities Get a Travel pass 50 baht deposit then put as much credit on it as you want refunds are available at all stations Then you can enjoy easy hasstle free travel when ever you want without queing up for tickets Avoid in the morning rush hour if at all possible Evenings are not so bad as a lot of workers in Thailand work long hours so evenings are easier with many shop staff working till 10 at night

title: excellent to travel around Bangkok
review: Buy a travel card so you avoid the long queue to get change and ticket during peek hours Also sometimes to full around 171800 hours

title: Fastest and most convenient mode of transport in Bangkok
review: The BTS skytrain has made our transfer from one place to the other very convenient and fast It's reasonably priced also and lining up to paypurchase tickets was very easy even for tourists It can get fully packed at certain times of the day though

title: Very good way to get around Bangkok
review: Having lived in New York I can say the trains and stations are very clean The amount of congestion on the trains during peak hours is the same as New York But clean and graffiti free

title: Going around metro Bangkok
review: The BTS sky train is the best and the most convenient way to move around the metro Bangkok area There are maps around every station and are available in several languages The secret here is that if you're staying for several days buy those passes from the station to avoid queueing up in those ticket machines

title: Easy, Efficient, and Air Conditioned!
review: I love the BTS Skytrain It is absolutely the quickest cheapest and coolest way to get around Bangkok Cars are clean and modern and most importantly air conditioned Seats may be a little hard to get because it's usually full at peak times in the morning and afternoon so be prepared to stand and get cosy in a crowded car Most stations have escalators and some have elevators Highly recommend especially if you want to get around inexpensively and not deal with the Bangkok traffic down below

title: QUICK TRIP, ALTHOUGH VERY CROWDED
review: We have travelled in the Skytrain quite often during our trips to Bangkok over the past few years  While the trains are quite frequent over time it seems that they are getting more and more crowded with each trip  Not a lot of seats either in the trains  most people having to stand for the trip  It is really a great way to get around Bangkok though only wish they had more 'lines" so that exploring of Bangkok was easier I guess that will come eventually  The BTS is a much better way to get around than having to negotiate with tuk tuk  and taxi drivers

title: Convenient transportation
review: The Skytrain is a very good choice to reach the most interesting places and touristic spots in Bangkok Easy to use and find the ways

title: great timely service
review: BTS provides great timely service with vast accessibility all around Bangkok It has walkways that is welllit at night and you can walkuse it without worries BTS is wellconnected to tourist spots or haunts around Bangkok which makes your travel or trip easy and pleasant that you don't need to be in a tour group or travel agents

title: Convenient way of transportation
review: With so many cases of taxi & tuktuk scams in Bangkok BTS is one  of the most convenient mode of transportation in Bangkok But I must say that it is getting more & more crowded travelling in BTS

title: Convenient way to avoid traffic jam
review: BTS Skytrain is good way to get around Bangkok as you will avoid traffic jam However it doesn't cover the whole of Bangkok yet as it is still in the process of expanding It will bring you to most of the shopping malls chatuchak weekend market Asiatique and Chao Phraya river   However it could get crowded at the main interchange stations such as Asok and Siam Buying tickets is not that convenient as MRT as you need to get coins to buy from the ticket machines Coins can be exchange from the counter or coin exchange machines However some new ticket machines do accept bank notes  Tips If there are a few of you 24 pax it may be cheaper to take the taxi as the cost of BTS is not cheap if you multiple Taxis are plenty in BKK anyway Just make sure the taxi driver turn on their meter However I don't recommend taking Tuktuk as they are expensive and dangerous

title: The best transportation in the center
review: The bts skytrain is the best transportation for go in the center of bangkok The most interesting stations are siam (for go to siam shopping center) and is the exchange hub to go silom road  and mbk (shopping center) If you like to go around patunam or pantip plaza you can take the station ratchatewee and walk about 500 m from bts station Is safe cheap  and very clean with air con If you want to forget the traffic jam of bangkok take the bts In the city have also mrt (subway) but is for other destinations Enjoy your trip

title: Easy & Fast
review: its an easy simple & fast public transportation in Bangkok Its reliable On Time and clean The map is also easy to understand Great job

title: Skytrain experience
review: BTS Skytrain of Bangkok is one of the most efficient mode of transport in Bangkok The service is excellent security check is really good and the frequency especially during rush hours is fantastic

title: Good public transport system
review: The Public transports BTS especially is very good and convenient for tourist to hop on to many tourist spots around BKK

title: Good option during rush hour.
review: Taxis are actually cheaper if you have more than two people but during rush hour you'll get there a lot quicker on the Skytrain Crowded but clean and easy to navigate

title: Great service
review: I travel by BTS sky train almost everyday as its very convenient It saves me from all horrible traffic in Bangkok Would recommend everyone to use it

title: Excellent transportation
review: Easy access often departures clean good airconditioning easy to understand big capacity simple ticket system Best public transportation in town (and many others)   Only downside is there is only two lines and does not span the town

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Took the train as often as possible  Much easier than dealing with Cabs  All the signs are in English so it was easy to figure out

title: Great way to see the city
review: Very clean and always on time We were impressed how organized everything was  The fares are also quite low (I think we spend less than a dollar per trip)

title: best way to travel in Bangkok
review: for sure the easiest fastest and cheapest way to travel in Bangkok they have maps to make it easier for you to get around

title: shopping and eating
review: Bts so convenient Going to chinatown siam center central world mbk chatuchak flower market its all breeze with bts

title: Efficient mode of transport
review: The BTS is fast clean and convenient  No need to negotiate prices with tuk tuk drivers or taxi drivers who choose not to use the meter The fares are reasonable and it is easy to purchase your tickets if you don't have sufficient coins you can change your notes to coins at the ticketing booth

title: Cheap quick and safe travel.
review: Don't stuff round trying to find an honest Taxi driver when you can use the BTS Skytrain to get almost everywhere It gets you to all the key tourist places so quick and easy and even in the rush hours we had no problem and we enjoyed the time spent in the cool airconditioned trains

title: No trafficjams!
review: Very convenient always on time clean and fast A taxi is cheap in Thailand but you can get stuck for hours when you end up in a trafficjam BTS is a good solution and not only brings you quickly to your destination but gives you great views of the city

title: Better than home
review: A much better public transport than home (Melbourne) But with taxis so cheapis it worth it Personally only to avoid traffic I think

title: Convenient & high accessibility with BTS
review: The BTS Bangkok route or interchange is so efficient The route is easy to master with the ticket counters coin machine in every station BTS is the major transport hub especially for travelers in Bangkok city I could say It passes through a lot of major areas which can help you to discover many of the hot spots It is so convenient to get around the city with BTS

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok together with MRT.
review: If you are in a hurry there is no better way of travelling Fast and clean No long waiting Connected at several stations with underground MRT Motorbikes are another solution at busy hours but dangerous

title: BTS only way to get around Bangkok
review: BTS one the best transport systems I have traveled on  Easy to get around and user friendly Cost is amazingly cheap

title: Excellent Service!!
review: Loved the skytrain system Fast ad effortless way to roam around Bangkok Stations and trains are clean and well maintained The lowest fare starts from 15 baht and goes upto about 52 baht There is also a day pass available at 140 baht which gives unlimited travel till midnight

title: Easy to get around
review: Easy way to travel around bangkok trains come every couple of minutes this is a very convientent form of travel as well as cheap and you avoid being stuck in the chaotic Bangkok traffic there are BTS stations everywhere

title: Convenient, fast, and safe transportation system
review: Each time I come back to Bangkok I'm impressed with how efficient and convenient the BTS Skytrain system is They have extended it and linked it with the Airport Rail Link along Sukhumvit so that one can  theoretically at least  travel by transit from the city to Suvarnabhumi Airport The BTS Skytrain system is beautifully integrated with the city of Bangkok in a way that adds to the city's character Some stretches of the Skytrain system function almost as fairly temperate elevated walkways above the hot city streets The stretch of track from Siam Paragon to the National Stadium is a case in point The only complaint I have about the BTS Skytrain is the lack of weekly 3day or 2day travel Sky train passes These would be a boon to many visitors to Bangkok Right now if a tourist wants to take multiple trips on the Sky train he must buy an expensive 120 baht 1day pass which expires by at midnight

title: Easy to travel around BKK
review: So easy to master the system of travel The ticket counter person gives coins in exchange for notes so you can purchase your ticket via the machine Super easy

title: So easy to get around!
review: Loved the BTS Sky Train in Bangkok Saved us so much money and hassle having to haggle with tuk tuk drivers Each stop is announced and there are 2 coloured lines with Siam as the station to change lines Air con on the train which was a welcome relief from the humidity Very busy at standard rush hour times and much like London people will just keep squeezing on despite there being no room but if you don't mine that then it's a great way to get around âºï¸

title: efficient way to avoid bangkok's traffic mightmare
review: Bangkok' Skytrain is a landmark in itself However beyond the touristic appeal of riding a rain with AC with views to the hot a humid city its main virtue is that it's the best way to avoid the terrible traffic in Bangkok

title: Nice
review: Sky train it  was comfortable for me and my friend and it very fast help me to travel to other place

title: Escape Traffic Woes
review: Very comfortable and quicker way to commute Connects with ease to shopping malls including ocean world and business district

title: Cheap very clean transport
review: This is a great way to travel around Bangkok combined with river taxis  Apparently there is also an underground but I didn't fancy it

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: I recommend everone to choose hotel accomodation close to any skytrain station With train you will reach all parts you need in Bangkok incl Suravanami airportDepending on how many stations you pass the price increases from 20  60 bath (average)one way ticket  person then from you end station you only walk or take motorbike taxi(cheap 2040 baht and quick due to bangkok traffic jam) or tuuk tuuk or taxi to where you are going Ask your hotel for a city map and at skytrain station ask for line map This is all you need during your stay in Bangkok

title: Clean and efficient
review: Easy to navigate and reasonably priced Fully air conditioned which is great for beating this Bangkok heat

title: Crowds
review: Great cheap and quick service to get around city quickly Downside is most the time it's jam packed and hard to get seat Get ready to battle the crowds

title: Very impressive
review: The way to travel inside Bangkok it's clean  air conditioned manned stations  where you can purchase your tickets and trains that run on time The stations are also manned by police and security guards who check your luggage it's simply fantastic and easy follow to go anywhere within Bangkok

title: Very Good
review: It was a pleasant journey for me and my bestfriend The staff were really helpful on where we should stop and etc to get to the designated place we would like to go

title: Has future potential
review: The sky train has limited reach at the moment but hopefully will be extended in the future I used it a couple of times Sometimes the stations are not well marked and the overhead platforms difficult to reach if you can't climb stairs The tickets are not interchangeable with the other MRT system However on a hot day when you're sick of walking and a sky train is nearby they are great and efficient and airconditioned

title: Hard to navigate for a novice, first time user-
review: It took ages to work out what we needed to do  how the get a ticket and where to go Even changing trains the signage was TERRIBLE Crowded tickets took ages to buy Not fun at all

title: 8 nights Bangkok
review: The only way to travel  It's cheap and fast but very crowded which doesn't matter because you are not on it for long

title: Convenient mode of transport
review: Amidst the hustle and bustle of the busy city the BTS Sky Train is a convenient mode of transport without being stuck in the traffic jam  Be prepared to get either a tourist pass for few days or Rabbit stored value card The queue to buy train tickets with coins at each station is long and slow

title: Great and cheap way to travel
review: When I stay in Bangkok I always book a hotel near the Skytrain The roads in Bangkok can be full of cars moving very slowly The Skytrain offers a cheap alternative way to travel the trains run every few minutes and clean and a safe way to travel

title: BTS
review: Perfect way to get around  Just be aware can be busy but always another train in 10 minutes or less  For tourists in the middle of day very easy form of transport Also you can link with underground train system at a couple of BTS stations  short walk between terminals  no confusion

title: Give it a try!
review: BTS Skytrain is definitely worth a try if your in Bankok Trains comes very often are airconditioned clean and the employees are able to kindly help you get where you're going Most importantly BTS helps locals and tourists beat the awful city traffic

title: When you're hot, hop on the BTS
review: BTS is probably the coolest place if you're feeling hot The air conditioning is world best Get on the BTS to freeze yourself~

title: Good
review: Great way to travel quick and easy but make sure you have change for tickets Very crowded at times but good

title: Best transportation in city centre
review: We took the BTS everyday as the traffics jam in the Centre is very bad You can get stuck on the road for 20 mins for just 2 blocks BTS is fast and economic and very recommended  Avoid taxi in the peak hours

title: Great Air-conditioned Commute
review: We used this often in our 4 days in Bangkok We have been before so we are familiar with it Great way to get around the city at a reasonable price Do check though as for a family of 4 a taxi was sometimes similar in price If you are headed to the Saturday market definitely use it Take it all the way to Mo Chit then a 5 min walk to the market

title: Indespensible way to navigate Bangkok
review: Given the often parking lot type traffic the BTS is the only way to get around It's efficient easy to use and inexpensive It's also clean air conditioned comfortable and smooth Just wished it covered more areas of the city

title: Great way to travel
review: Best transportation for Bangkok Fast clean and cheap Tuktuks are not trust worthy Expensive for Bangkok and as they have low roof you cannot really see much

title: Amazing travel system
review: Super cool way to get around the city and that isn't a pun the air conditioning on the train is a welcome relief from the outside temperature Everything on time smooth transportation

title: Best way to get around
review: The BTS Is clean efficient and fast  If this is an option avoid the traffic ant take the BTS  Bangkok traffic is a nightmare and the sky train is a great way to fly above it all

title: Excellent service
review: This is an excellent Way to get around the city easy to use everything is in English and very cheap The service is fast and has staff all over who is answer any questions you have If your going to use the service all day get the day rider ticket which cost about 138 bht Air con as well is a plus

title: Clean and fastest transport in bangkok
review: Its really clean nice design of the train and railway Its easy for tourist who doesn't know thai    cheers

title: Ideal for getting around the city
review: When traffic is so bad that walking is faster than sitting in a taxi opt for the BTS or MRT The BTS has great air conditioning and provides mapsannouncements in both Thai and English   If you are going to be using it for more than a few trips I would recommend putting some money on a rabbit card or buying a set number of trips for easyaccess  The only disadvantage is that it stops around midnight and can get insanely crowdedespecially at the Siam interchange

title: fast and comfortable
review: BTS is fastcheap and comfortable way of travel in Bangkok back of the ticket stations are named and it is announced in English so you won't miss where to get down

title: Nice, clean & easy to commute
review: Used it on multiple occasion in this short stay both for business visit Airport trip as well as some short visit to down town Its very well maintained & clean much easy way to commute to city in comparison with the hectic road traffic of Bangkok

title: Good transportation
review: Cheap convenient comfortable even during rush hour Make sure you have change with you because the ticket machines don't accept notes

title: Very convenien
review: Very quickly for go to tour or shopping waiting about 510 min but on mondayfriday evening have many person

title: Best and quick way to get around
review: quick and easy way to get around bangkok To visit week end market or around bangkok BTS is the best option You can buy ticket in each station you would need coins but there is an exchange at every station

title: Nice transportation
review: Its a little crowded its not that expensive and you can visit several places specially the malls

title: Commuters
review: Friendly & considerate Thais make the travel in BTS skytrain a nice experience even during the peak hours

title: BTS and MRT is best way to negogiate Bangkok
review: BTS and MRT is best way to negotiate Bangkok Its easy to find your way about signs are clear in English and all stations have manned ticket counter that can offer you assistance Beats a taxi unless there is no traffic  you have luggage or possibly sharing 3 or 4

title: An amazing day
review: It was really an amazing tourthe best way to see the city by cheapest waythe boats under the bridges and many more

title: Traffic no more!
review: Tho the skytrain do not cover all BKK it is still good to go around with Buy the standard card instead of exchange your banknotes to coins It is inexpensive  Travel with 55L luggage are OK enough but do avoid peak hours

title: A great way to travel around Bangkok
review: It is a great way to travel around Bangkok It is reliable with AC but a little bit overcrowded during rush hours

title: Great for getting around
review: As I stayed centrally I used this a lot 140 baht for a day ticket especially if your staying around sukhumvit and silom areas  You can also connect with the mrt  I preferred this to using tuk Tuks or metered taxis As they can get caught up in some awful traffic jams Not so good at peak times it gets extremely crowded bit they are very frequent

title: Convenient and ever expanding transport vehicle!
review: We go to Thailand since 1999 and we just missed the official inauguration at that time Since it's service is up and running we've been using this transportation vehicle at least a few times each holiday While it's a great way to move around in certain parts of Bangkok it could get quiet pricey if you're travelling with 3 or more persons It could be cheaper by taxi though there are no traffic lines  What we noticed during recent years is that not only during rush hour it is getting overcrowded now I strongly suggest the BTS service to add extra trains to the schedules It's nice to see Bangkok from an upper floor passing by And what I miss the most since we're back in Holland are the food stalls at every exit Those fruits and sates are sooo delicious During the last holiday we stayed at Centara Grand Central World Plaza and we did not need to use the skytrain at all But we did use the skywalk many times This is the walking way between the ground floor roads and the Skytrain track So choosing a bit more expensive hotel could save you costs of transportation if you like to be in the area of Siam Square What I recommend people who travel to Thailand for the first time is right after arrival taking the Skytrain from a nearby station to Saphan Taksin From there take the Express Boat on the Chao Phraya river If the weather is ok you could even get off at Pier Wat Mahathat and enter the Grand Palace This way you might scratch it from your todo list immediately and inside the Grand Palace it's also very relaxed Right after this visit take the boat and skytrain back to your hotel for a diner in that area I guarantee a very nice first day using multiple transportation vehicles and you'll get familiar with how to use these as well  If you're about to use the skytrain a lot ask for special cards at the Helpdesks located nearby the entry of the BTS

title: Practical to get in the heart of Bangkok
review: We took the Skytrain from Bangkok Suvarnarbhumi Airport and it took us 12 to get to the Centre of the Capital Lifts are quite hard to find but staff members are very helpful Can be confusing if you take both BTS and Metro tho especially with 2 youngs children and a pram )   +  plenty of currency exchanges desks at the lower ground before jumping in the train Lifts and ramps access (but not always  had to used escalators)   like anywhere else avoid rush hour

title: As a visitor, just get a rechargeable card for $2
review: Quick and convenient system with English everywhere Instead of paying $13 for the day pass just get a rechargeable card that costs $2 with $3 credit ($5 total) If you add an extra $10 to make it equivalent to the cost of the day pass it should definitely last you at least 2 days

title: Love the Air Conditioning
review: Cheap and quick way to travel in Bangkok instead of relying on taxis Taxis might be caught in heavy traffic and a 30mins journey might take more than an hour on taxi Conveniently located

title: Quick and easy
review: Took me a while to understand the ticket machines but once you get it it is super easy and so quick to get around aswell as the cheapest way Customer service always happy to help

title: Easy to go most major area.
review: It is easy to get BTS to most majoy area but sometimes wait so long time in change point And needed line up to buy tickets

title: Wow!  Way to go!
review: THIS is th way to go to get to places  Google map the routes and then get acclimated to the different train stations so you won't get lost   They really have a good system  not like in the USA

title: Inexpensive, fun yet hectic
review: Overall  it was a good experience  for me  It was inexpensive fast  yet in order to get the coins for the vending machine it was hectic to stand in the long que to get the change The sign boards are helpful & it's a bit rushy but you can't beat the service for the price  Highly recommend âââ

title: Not stuck in trafic jam
review: Good and fast way to travel Great vieuw of the city The bts station is big so its a bit tricky sometimes to find wich way to go

title: Much nice than the Loop in Chicago
review: It is a cheap way to see the city and get your bearings The boats on the river bring you here for free A lot of tours start here

title: City travel Cant get Better
review: Is the best way to get around Tidy clean and hassle free recommend using this for anyone Except the peak periods when the trains are full but run so reguarly you dont mind waiting for the next one

title: One of the fastest means of transport in Bangkok
review: The BTS sky train is one of the fastest transport means in Bangkok and it connects almost all the major areas They are relatively cheaper than taxis

title: English-speaker Friendly
review: Very low cost easy way to get around the city Look into taking it from the airport after your plane arrives it is much cheaper than a taxi Easy to navigate as an English speaker as well no need to read the Thai alphabet

title: quick and fast
review: Possibly the best way to travel Bangkok No jam no pollution Only one gripe is that not all stations have lifts and escalators Sometimes to climb the stairs in Bangkok heat can burn a lot of calories Easy fare system ans goes to most places in central Bangkok

title: Always a god send with Bangkok traffic
review: Easy to use clean comfortable and air conditioned And much more pleasant than sitting in traffic for hours on end

title: Very good way to get around the city
review: Bangkok BTS or also known as skytrain for its elevated tracks is the best way to move around within the big metropolis of Bangkok   Most tourist attractions and major shopping malls are either directly connected to or within a short walk from a BTS station  Best to stay at a hotel within the vicinity of a BTS Station as you will not waste precious time as a tourist getting stuck in the notorious Bangkok traffic jams   There are current 2 lines which are the Silom line and Sukhumvit line and both interchange at Siam Station There are also a few interchange with the newer underground MRT  The coaches itself are clean with strong air conditioning which is a relieve in hot afternoons in Bangkok

title: Easy Transportation Option.
review: Used the BTS several times during our stay Easy to navigate with maps located in the station Change counters at each location

title: VERY CONVENIENT WAY OF TRANSPORTATION IN BANGKOK
review: It is the most convenient way of transportation in Bangkok indeed If you are a tourist you can overview the city and never caught in traffic jam with taxi drivers who often cheat you on the price As a business man you should take it if you want to be on time to your appointmentsbut sorry to tell thai people are notorious for being late at their appointments I experience it all the time  The BTS system is very clean and safe People very polite and civilized Air conditioning is runing far too high even thai people agree on that Take it its cheap  If you are staying several days in Bangkok it is better to ask at the ticket office a card named "rabbit " It costs 700 THB for 25 trips if you are an adult less for students

title: Efficient and cheap
review: Staying at the Ambassador Hotel the Skytrain is only a 5minute walk You do have a few stairs to climb but apart from that access is very easy   Finding your route is relatively straight forward Trains run very frequently and you can travel around quickly very cheaply and efficiently Couldn't ask for more

title: Bangkok
review: BTS is the only way to navigate around bangkok quickly Trains come in regular intervals so you are never waiting for long Only issue is it can get very crowded during peak time so you need to make your way to the door before your stop otherwise be prepared to catch the train back

title: Clean but crazy
review: Speedy clean modern train but not easy to figure out where you're going and how to buy tickets  Gets crazy packed

title: Accessible.
review: The BTS shown some upgrading done as compare few year back Passengers are easily access to train level without climbing the stair But not all BTS station have their upgrade Should consider for wheelchair passengers too

title: Great experience
review: Had a great time on and off the sky trains  cheap and a quick way to travel  could see it from my hotel the evergreen place hotel Bangkok

title: Great transport
review: BTS system of transport is monorail across Bangkok city area Easy to use and plenty of guidance available Can get crowded and standing only at times I found my first trip it was challenging however became easier Day pass the way to go Felt safe Elevators available

title: What a nice and easy way to travel.
review: The BTS has really changed the way to travel around Bangkok  The traffic can be so bad but just jump on the BTS and you can get near almost anywhere  There are a number of lines so just pay attention to the last station on the line and follow the signs  The BTS has been much more crowded over the last few years as new stations have opened that access a much larger population  It is convenient to prebuy your ticket

title: Excellent low cost travel around the City
review: Easy low cost travel around the city Rush hour is a little crowded and staff were not that efficient with assistance

title: best way to get around Bangkok
review: stayed at the Asia Hotel Bangkok which is connected to the bts ratchathewi station it made getting around bangkok so much easier the best sites to shop is connected to bts stations Siam (Paragon Centre Discovery MBK) Asok station (Terminal21) Mo Chit station (chatuchak weekend market) so for shoppaholics everywhere bts is your friend

title: Great
review: We stayed at Nana new Bangkok When we discover the way to use the skytrain we were completed satisfied and enjoyed Bangkok

title: Smart,  clean,  efficient
review: Used the sky train quite a few times during my stay in Sukhumvit as it was very close to the hotel I was staying in  I was especially impressed by the helpfulness of the support staff as we couldn't speak the local language  They helped us get the tickets and guided us to the right platform  I really  liked my trip to Bangkok Thailand because of the friendly nature of the people  The skytrain was an icing on the cake

title: Fast way of transportation
review: Very fast we will reach your destination faster than using tuktuk or taxi due to traffic mainly during day time If you want to save time and money use the BTS Skytrain

title: Very efficient
review: The skytrain stopped a few meters from our hotel and made our shopping experience pleasant and hasslefree

title: Fast and cheap!
review: Easy to navigate and really quick from one stop to the next The times we took the skytrain we didn't have to wait long to get picked since it runs pretty regularly Only bad thing was that it was super crowded It's very cheap and easy enough for foreigners so can't complain

title: Convenient
review: BTS is a convenient and comfortable way to move between some areas in Bangkok The ticketing system is not so intuitive but you'll get used to it pretty quick Ticket machines use only coins so it's good to have some spare change with you Avoid riding on weekends because it can get pretty packed

title: Clean, organized but needs English speaking locals
review: very accessible and organized transpo system but we had a hard time communicating with the locals on some things we need clarification of But overall we love how modern their train system is

title: Convenient and time saving pleasurable transport alternative in Bangkok's most infamous traffic.
review: BTS Skytrain along with MRT underground train have made travelling in Bangkok more bearable Now that the BTS system has extended on both ends across Bangkok to Thonburi side and also along Sukhumvit to the out skirt of Bangkok travelers have better chances to reach their destinations and their business appointments on time than using other means of transportation  The trains are also well maintained and spotlessly clean and completely safe Highly recommend for visitors to try

title: most convenient public transport in Bangkok
review: The train is good if you're in hurry and don't want to find a parking space at your destination but it could get very very very crowded during rush hour and as Bangkok is a warm city you can expect smell and sweat

title: The Only Way to Travel
review: The BTS is the best way to travel in Bangkok  try and book accommodation close to one they are super easy to take and work out much cheaper and quicker than a taxi (and more comfortable than a tuk tuk)

title: sky train
review: Very easy to travel around Bangkok on these sky trains You can purchase an all day ticket for a few dollars We travelled out to the Stadium and then back again later in the day  Trains are usually pretty busy so you do have to stand unless your 1st on

title: Can be crowded, but good way to travel.
review: Fast effective means of travelling stops are centered around the main shopping areas which makes it easy to travel  Limited stops can get hot waiting for the train as you may have to wait for more than 1 especially at Siam Beware stairs and not escalators

title: good for siting Bangkok
review: Good fast cheap I used it instead of taxi or tuc tuc that are not good for the Bangkok traffic Use it

title: Great transportation system
review: The skytrain works great it is safe and reliable Signs and voice announcement are both in thai and in English and employees are most helpful even when don't speak much English

title: Simplest Train to navigate
review: Have you serious  trains in different metropolitan cities such as Washington DC  Paris  But I truly love the SkyTrain in Bangkok because it is one of the simplest Transportation medium to use    You look at the map and the circles at your stop will tell you exactly how how much money you need to get to your destination there is no guessing what's so ever    It does get pretty full and sometimes you do have to wait more than one train to get any if it is after 4 or 5 in the afternoon    I love the BTS

title: Beat the traffic jam
review: Cabin are fairly clean One of the best way to get around the city without being caught in a jam Fares are affordable as well Signages are also pretty clear making it easy to travel around Walkways under the train track are able a innovative feature to get from point to point without being exposed to the hot sun

title: Nice and easy
review: Easy and fast Also cheap for european prices Take the skytrain to Saphan Taksim and then take the publicboat to the innercity

title: Easy Transport with a View
review: An easy way to get around but does not have as many stops as the MRT You get a great view though and it isn't overly packed (at least not during rush hour) Recommend getting the day pass and planning your day around it

title: efficient way of transport
review: Efficient fast cheap and a fast if you wanna avoid traffic jams in Bangkok When travelling to the airport the skytrain was a little crowded We had to wait in line which is a good thing and missed some skytrains This wasn't a problem as there were suddenly 3 trains in 10minutes

title: Not the best
review: PORS Easy access to many main attractions in Bangkok Not affect by crazy ground traffic   CONS Not cheap compare to Uber or taxi if u have 2 or more people Sky train entrance from the ground mostly required to take long stairs Stops quite long time in some stops

title: Skytrain easy to use
review: Staff speak excellent english to purchase ticket   Maps easy to understand trains run frequently during the day very comfortable and air conditioned  Best way to travel from the river to the shopping centres at MBK and Siam

title: Easy to use
review: Hot tip At Siam station make sure you listen and read There is one track for two different directions at the station So make sure you get on the correct train

title: Best way to travel
review: Best is to purchase a day or 2 pass It is easiest and fastest and the cheapest way to travel to all the malls and the temples One also gets the see the city while travelling

title: Best choice to get around the city
review: As a solo traveler familiar with public transportation is a necessity to get around  In bangkok rail transportation or BTS is quite easy to learn They provide English language services so that foreign tourists can learn Helps to easily reach several interesting places in the city of Bangkok without being exposed to traffic jams  But since this is public transportation it is used in conjunction with the local people so that at a certain hour will be very crowded However BTS remains the best choice for the travelers can enjoy the city

title: Excellent mode of transport
review: Reaching different places in bangkok was made easy by travelling in skytrain instead of travelling in other modes which gets stuck in heavy traffic

title: Best mode of Transport in Bangkok
review: Considering the high amount of traffic in the streets this is the best way to get around Don't do the same mistake I didDon't hop into a taxi during the rush hour anywhere between 3 pm to 8 pm it will take ages to go from one place to another It took us almost 3 hours just to go from our Westin hotel to Baiyoke Sky tower which is normally a 30 min ride  The BTS Skytrain is very fast and efficient with trains coming every 5 minutes and riding them is fun as you get to see all kinds of people from all over the world  The only problem is the ticketing system in our station (Asok) was a bit troublesome as it used the outdated coin system And the stations had no aircon which was a bummer if you waiting in the daytime when it's very hot and humid

title: good but...
review: Limited routes only take you to some places It was cheap and frequent A bit annoying to have to carry change for the machine I queued up at the ticket counter a couple of times and they just gave me change for the machine   they didn't sell me a ticket   Although taxis are cheap the traffic can get congested so it's a good alternative so long as it takes you where you want to go   I used it to get to the Central Ferry Pier which was good and Asoke where there is a lot of nightlife

title: Sightseeing Bangkok
review: This is a great way to see Bangkok Easy to use and cheap No waiting as train comes every few minutes

title: Efficient
review: The BTS has revolutionised travel around Bangkok Cannot say what the line out to Suvarnabhumi Airport is like but around the city the skytrain is a cool life saver  New since we were last there were safety barriers added to reduceprevent people toppling onto the train tracks Good idea  Purchasing tickets is relatively painless with operators speaking reasonable English  Skytrain maps are at every station so no chance of getting lost  The air conditioning is a wonderful break in the heat of exploration around a vibrant city

title: Unless you wanna walk till you drop.... use the BTS!
review: Clean efficient and frequent  like it's "below the ground" counterpart the BTS is a brilliant way to get to almost anyplace in Bangkok

title: Clean, cold and fast
review: Use it over taxis when you can Well air conditioned and clean Busy during peak times Safe for solo travelers

title: Traffic worse than NYC - You must use BTS
review: There was a BTS station one block from our hotel Sign are in Thai and English and easy to follow Basically this is a east West North south system with a major hub The cars are air conditioned and very smooth There are lines at rush hour but everyone is very orderly The street traffic in Bangkok is so bad that using this system is a must and it's is efficient

title: Mr Mrs
review: BTS skytrain is the best way to get around Bankok The trains run very frequently  So easy to use a day pass  is cheapest way to go Get on and off all day no limit

title: A must in bangkok
review: This cheap and easy to use train service Is perfect for getting around Bangkok Gets very busy in rush hour you might have to wait for a train but no one pushes in unlike London

title: Very easy and convenient!
review: The BTS Skytrain was so easy to take and also very cheap It was also excellent because it's air conditioned If you can get to your destination on the Skytrain I would definitely recommend it over a cab

title: Great way to avoid the traffic
review: Very clean and easy to use I'm from St Louis and rode the metro frequently and I can't even compare the two because the BT's was very well maintained

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: While it can get pretty crowded in rush hour the trains run efficiently and are very reasonable if you buy a pass  I spent a week and a half and used it daily to commute from my hotel to our office  Signs and announcements are also in English so it's easy for a visitor to get around

title: Limited network
review: A fast way of transportation if you want to go across Bangkok Quite modern trains that are air conditioned Prices on medium level Total network is limited since you can not reach the historic part of Bangkok by BTS

title: Easy to figure out
review: We took the skytrain to the Princess Hotel at the MBK Was very exciting and EXTREMELY crowded due to rush hour Easy to use and fun for the kids but would no way call this an "attraction" rather an easy way to get around the city

title: Cheapest & Fastest way to move around in Bangkok
review: 1 User friendly ticket machine in every station 2 Staff at station is very courteous & they speak good English 3 Fares are quite cheap when compared to using Tuk Tuk or cabs But again Skytrain is the best option if you have to reach a particular destination with a particular time in mind 4 Security personnel have a stylish & respectful way of treating commuters I was returning from MBK mall with goods in my hand Security person checked my bag and saluted me stylishly for allowing her to check my bag I truly admired her way of handling people In return I thanked her for doing her job so well 5 Maps and directions are well planned and put up everywhere to make life easier for commuters

title: Quick, cheap and excellent air conditioning!
review: For a tourist the BTS (and the Metro) get you to most places you need to go without having to haggle with taxi drivers who won't turn on meters  Been using the BTS for years and it is so quick  almost cathartic speeding above the city looking at the traffic gridlock below  The aircon is out of this world on a hot and sticky day

title: Clean, safe efficient
review: I only wish North American urban transit could catch up with Bangkok Kuala Lumpur and Singapore  We travelled daily with a 13 year old daughter and sixteen year old son  Safe clean and much much much faster than the clogged roads

title: Easy way to get around.
review: This doesn't take you everywhere you need to get to but it can get you close the MRT is accessible from certain stops  We made it around Bangkok with tuktuk taxi BTS MTR and the river long tail boats  Not as good as London but still a great way to get around

title: Fast and Convenient
review: The fastest and cheap way of getting around Bangkok's busy downtown section BTS connect to many bus stops train station malls and many great locations of interest

title: Traveling is smooth with this
review: Bangkok otherwise is very jam packed but traveling is quick through bts  Keep maps handy and you can travel very easily  Neat stations do not dirty them

title: Enjoyed my first travel
review: Beautiful train Super fast Enjoyed my travel from Asoke to MBK mallWould appreciate cleanliness in train and station

title: Very Efficient
review: Although the Skytrain doesn't cover the whole of Bangkok it is still a good clean and efficient way of getting around avoiding the incessant Bangkok traffic It is also air conditioned

title: Quick and Easy Transportation.
review: The traffic can be horrible in Bangkok which makes it quicker to take the BTS if you're next to one You pay the amount of baht depending on how many stops you need to go through You'll need coins but you can get that from the front desk and all tickets are purchased through an automated machine Just watch the people in front of you and it should be pretty straight forward

title: Everything transit should be
review: This is one of the best public transit systems I have been on It is very clean safe and new and I never found myself waiting more than 5 minutes for a train The ticketing system is super easy to figure out   It's fairly useful for foreigners but as of Aug 2016 there aren't many stops although this should be less of an issue by 2020

title: Easy to use
review: Clean safe and easy to use So much better than a tuk tuk or taxi drive just waiting to rip you off

title: Best way to commute
