review: Given that Bangkok's roads are always almost at halt during peak hours BTS and MRT are two quick ways to get away from the traffic  BTS is connected to several major stations BTS route Maps are available online and also at the back of your ticket when you purchase them There are several ticket vending machine at each station or you can even approach the ticket counters Some counters give you coins to get tickets from the vending machine The vending machines only accept coins so you do need to have enough coins As such the machines are easy to operate you just click on the station's name and they show the amount If u are more than one person it's better to go to the counter They also give a daily pass for 120 BHT and u can use it for that day (unlimited stops) But if you don't plan to drop by many stations in one day just get the tickets as you go

title: A cool place
review: The cheapest and fasted way around Bangkok A much better alternative to taxis or tuk tuks Most importantly growing bigger every year

title: not the same as MRT
review: Thai BTS is a general above ground experience where trains run above the ground unlike the MRT station where the trains run undergound While the station is long the trains cabins are modest so if you stand at the end of the station you will be the lone ranger there as the train only stops at the center part of the platform  Payment is via  cash or coins If you need to change a little coins with a huge note eg 1000b just queue at the station control and the person inside will change it for you The tourist pass is now (Sept 2016) per day so it is not quite a great deal unlike a three day  pass or sth  The BTS used to be quite leisurely where only expatriates and tourists pay for it However in this trip the train appears to be fully packed at different times of the day and there are occasions where passengers cannot squeeze in

title: Fast Modern Service Above the Traffic Jams
review: Hotel had a third floor ramp right into the station Not expensive service and network is expanding to cove more part  of the city

title: Easy and clean
review: We took the sky train to the ferry port and found it easy to use cheap and very clean It was great mixing with the locals who had finished work or school and would definitely use it again

title: A great service
review: This is a really easy service to use The trains are clean and the fares are inexpensive Yes it can get a little packed at peak hour however it's a much easier way to move around when the roads are jammed

title: Great way to get around
review: We used this service to get from our hotel Aetas Bangkok to MBK and took less than 10mins from door to door Super easy to use and cheap

title: Value for 1 day unlimited
review: Update 192016 I bought 1 day ticket  Unlimited travel cost 140 thb ( about $37) Valuable for the tourist you can take BTS to many place such as  JJ market ( mochit station)  MBK (nation stadium) Siam Center Siam Paraon (siam station) Central world (chidlom station ) and you can take sky walk through Platinum Fashion mall just 5 minute ( local whole sale price of clothes ) And many famous place near Bts Its the best way to travel around bangkok by yourself  Be Safe & Have fun in Thailand Welcome to Thailand ^__^

title: Easy and clean
review: Super easy way to get our town and I felt really safe Lots of security on the train platforms so really safe

title: Crowded and sweaty
review: I had someone pretty much rubbing up against me for the whole journey However it is a quick way to get around just needs more room

title: Easygoing and clean!
review: Very nice transporration to avoid heavy traffic in Bangkok Easy to connect with all shopping outlwt in Bangkok

title: Excellent!
review: It's very convenient and cheap way of going around The only downside is that you always need to have change to buy tickets but can be easily done at the counter with friendly staff It's very clean and safe

title: Easy to use
review: Cheap will take you anywhere you need to go Avoid rush hour Check the stops by MBK (national stadium) and Siam paragon Sala daeng also has good restaurants and Chong nonsi has a connection to the BRT for more capillarity

title: Convenient
review: Little costly but convenient SIAM is the main station We boarded from various stations like SIAM saphan taksin and chit Lom Staff at all the station's were very helpful & polite

title: great easy to use transport
review: I always use this when in Bangkokso easy to use fast cheap comfortableand can be a welcome aircon break from the humidity

title: Reliable and cheap form of transport
review: Though it can be crowded but it is able to connect to most tourists shopping spots  Except that it can be quite a walk if you do not stay around BTS located stations

title: Very easy to use
review: This is a great way to get around The staff were very friendly and helpful Even some of the passengers were amazing

title: Wonderful
review: Clean Safe Efficient On time What more do you want All PA announcements are clear and in English Very easy to work out where you want to go

title: Very easy transportation system which had air on!
review: Very convenient cheap and comfortable train which covers most of the city   The people of Bangkok think it gets busy but if you have done a London Tube at rush hour you'll think Bangkok rush hour is a treat  I recommend getting a rabbit card (pay as you go card) saves the queues

title: Fast, regular and wonderfully air-conditioned!
review: Use it whenever you can Only 2 lines at the moment but expansion on the way The cool trains are an oft needed brake from the heat and humidity 180 baht for unlimited day travel is also a bargain

title: Very good service
review: The service is very easty and chepaer than taxi for one person If you travel in teh city a lot then the train si cheaper The stairs in some places are a bit too much Single side escalators only

title: The best urban transport option
review: I really recommend the BTS to move around Bangkok It is easy to get to know safe fast cheaper and crossing main areas Taxis are really unsafe with some drivers behaving really rude and corrupt (no using taximeters or altering it denying service etc) Tuktuk service is only for short distances and motorbike services for distances as far as 2 kilometers  I would look at the nearest station to the place I would need to go then I would take a motorbike to end the travel if it is a little far from that station  Bangkok people are really friendly in the stations including the security personnel you just show them the station (if English is a problem) and they are always kind to indicate You get the ticket in the box office or the machine choose the station that has a number that is the cost and put that number of coins and ready

title: BTS Skytrain - Best of Siam!
review: This is the life saver in KrungthepJust a decade or so ago Bangkok is infamous for its heavy traffic jams Today this city works beautifully thanks to this great transport infrastructure The BTS has taken me to many parts of Bangkok ChinaTown EM Quartier Silom Siam Square and Asoke just to name a few It's convenient and hassle free Just buy the store value Rabbit Card as you would the Foodcourt card in Terminal 21 and you can rock and roll in Bangkok Happy station hopping

title: good tariff rate and for easy transport
review: Did not get stuck in trafffice and was easy to get around the city as only one line to o and one to come  so was not confusing at all

title: Great way to get around
review: For the budget concious this is a good alternative to taxis and tuk tuks and no traffic jams you can get change fro the staff but will need to buy tickets from the machines

title: Easy way to travel
review: We took this to the market It was easy to navigate and convenient way to travel through the city It was close to places we wanted to visit

title: Good public transport to navigate Bangkok traffic
review: Bangkok traffic seems to be getting worse and BTS is a very good alternate to beat the traffic  We learned our lesson fairly quick after it took us over 1 hr to get to a restaurant 5 miles away from the hotel

title: Great system
review: Buy a rabbit card and jump on It's not super cheap like Singapore but efficient Can get you most places of interest  Explore

title: Best way to Travel around the City
review: BTS skytrain is very easy to use for tourist like us The ambiance is great and very spacious though you have to know that it gets very crowded during rush hour but all in all I love their transportation system and the people here are very helpful too

title: Aug-16
review: Extremely easy to use with everyone at the station and locals being really helpful when required And cheap too

title: Best thing since steamed rice.
review: You can get everywhere across the city so easily I actually will only ever choose a hotel that is next to a BTS station  Although it does take a couple of times to get used to connecting with the MRT and other lines it is by far the fastest and most comfortable way to get around Bangkok  Watch out for the doors (don't fight with them they will always win)

title: Quick and Easy
review: We used the BTS regularly buying a day ticket meaning we could travel day or night and we did I especially love the orderly system of lining up whilst waiting for the train waiting till all passengers alighted and then we streamed in efficiently Not the push and shove and coas I have experienced in New York mind you I love it all  It was easy to get to any destination even with train and platform changes and when unsure someone was there to help  With the recent bombings in Bangkok they now have security checking bags when entering the main stations not all that thorough but I did find that made a sense of comfort for me I don't remember these check point years ago so I assumed it was because of the recent events  Go ahead live like the locals use the BTSin fact one day we were in a Tuk Tuk and crawling and at a standstill in peak hour traffic that we jumped out of the tuk tuk as we right next to the station and got on the train back to our hotel cooler quicker and less flustered

title: Convenient
review: The BTS Skytrain is a convenient way to travel around Bangkok  As the network is extended covering more and more areas It is probably one of the best mode of transport to travel  The bridges built connecting the stations and shopping centre has made it very easy to walk from one area to the others without having to cross the road  The disadvantage is that all the stations are built without enclosure so no air condition is provided This could get very uncomfortable when the humidity is high  The other downside is that all the stations are several storeys high and no lifts or escalators are provided in most areas making it a hard climb to the station  The structures supporting the railway track and stations seems to be so much heavier and bigger in Bangkok than for example of those in Singapore or other countries thus making it unsightly   Other than that its a good transport system

title: Easy Travel
review: its cheap and fast kinda uncomfortable during peak hours as it tends be really crowded otherwise its great for travelling within the city if you're on a budget trip

title: Sky Train
review: Excellent service we use it all the time  cheap clean on time convenientair conditioned can be very busy at times but next one arrives very quickly just brilliant service

title: The best way to commute in Bangkok, but..
review: The Skytrain is very easy to use air conditioned and quick However it is so crowded at certain hours that it makes harder to use with smaller kids If you're on vacation you may want to plan your day to get around rush hour (mainly when high school students commute in and out of school)

title: clean and very tourist friendly
review: Very easy to ride and self explanatory The coin purchase was easy however thankfully I didn't toss it because I had no idea you'd need it to get out of the subway Also closes relatively early 11pm or maybe 1130 so you'll need to find alternative travel after that time

title: Amazing Way To Travel.
review: If travelling in Bkk the only quick way to travel is by the sky train It's quick clean inexpensive and even if you can't get directly to where you want to go I suggest you take the skytrain as far then get a taxi The roads are getting more and more congested in Bkk and whilst taxis are also cheap it can take forever

title: Convonient
review: This trains are good for quick movement in Bangkok Pretty fast and clean Best way to avoid traffic jam in Bangkok mainly during office hours

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok but packed during peak hours
review: The BTS needs to add like 2 more carts to each train because during peak commute hours it is a nightmare (67pm) Packed in like sardines you can barely breathe with all the bodies surrounding you   Nonpeak hours are fine Best way to travel in Bangkok because you don't have to worry about the obscene traffic which is during all hours

title: Very Easy To Use
review: The Skytrain is very easy to use and very organized I am from New York so I am familiar with subway lines I found the Skytrain to be better cleaner and more organized than NYC metro system My wife and I took the train from our hotel to a nearby mall Make sure you hold on to your ticket after you enter the Skytrain  you will need it to get off at your stop as well

title: Fairly easy way to get around town
review: TRaffic in Bangkok can be challenging at times  you can often walk somewhere faster than taking  a cab  My hotel was connected to the BTS and I used it several times  The lien is clean and efficient  The trains are often crowded

title: Everyone should take the train
review: This train is clean cheap and will take to to most parts of the city that a tourist would want to go to

title: Moving people, a lot of people.
review: Excellent system very well executed and controlled Very easy to use and a very civilised attitude to queueing and boarding demonstrated by the locals I wish some of the visitors followed their example but no You don't know who you are but I do and so do the locals

title: Good way to move around BKK
review: Between Skytrain (BTS)  and MRT (subway) most portions of the city are covered however there are some glaring exceptions often major tourist sites Plan your visits accordingly Painfully crowded at rush hours and at certain connections between the two systems

title: Good experience but nit great
review: I was comparing this metro with Singapore  Delhi Bangalore Metro Nothing to tell great about this metro As usual it was full of travellers If you never been in Metro then you can try otherwise it is not must activity

title: Perfect if your origin and destination are close to a station!
review: If are leaving from near a station and going to a destination near another station it is the best way to travel Fast Cheap and reasonably comfortable if you avoid peak travel times   Yes rainy weather is a drag but many destinations have covered access but if not you may have to wait in a sheltered area Anyway if it's pouring ground traffic grinds to a halt  so you are better off anyway  So as far as possible book a hotel near a station eg Grand Hyatt or St Regis and try and pick restaurants that are close to a station   I have been a convert for years

title: Easy
review: Us this instead of a taxi as it really is a great way to travel fast clean cheap and safe  You might not always be able to get a seat but it is much faster than taking a cab in the heavy traffic  Airconditioned so comfortable too

title: Great Way to travel
review: What an easy & cheap way to get around this modern cityIts tap on\off system is so simple to use It beats sitting in traffic jams for hours sometime

title: So Efficient
review: Great Prices for journeys across the city Used the Skytrain multiple times with no problems easy to follow maps Some routes were busy but hey we are in Bangkok here

title: Getaway from Bangkok traffic
review: Ease of travel in Bangkok try BTS skytrain save your time and heat in this big Bangkok city Easy to get around Bangkok downtown

title: great way to get around town
review: Understanding the means of getting around in Bangkok is crucial but the BTS is very convenient as its stops are at main points and very inexpensive compared to using taxis Shopping at every stop easy to navigate

title: cheap transport system
review: if you want to visit many places at bangkok  use BTS or MTR as these are very cheap as compared to taxis at bangkok The are self tickets YOu need to see the map first and accordingly coins to be taken from counter for the location you want to visit   by giving  bhat   AFter taking coins you can get the ticket yourself YOu will feel it's importance when you take one taxi ride and pay a lot more It connects malls like siam

title: Standing in the crowd
review: An inexpensive and fast way to move in central Bangkok area Not very comfortable because the wagons are overcrowded However the airco inside makes up for it

title: the best way to travel
review: we used the skytrain a lot whilst we where in BK it helped that the hotel was near to a station but found it easy clean and not to busy it was good value for money as well we found it a better option than taxis as you could be sat around in the back of one for some time in traffic jams

title: On time comfortable, stylish, modern,
review: Good night with the new version and the first place in restaurants Special offer for good rides coming back from holiday today and I'm just going to get my money back

title: Worth for value
review: The price was cheap and we would use this from aiport to city  center It was clean and tidy although very busy during daytime

title: Super convenient
review: Most convenient transportation to get around Bangkok With it being Bangkok you must know that getting on the road is hectic You can get stuck on the road for hours just to get to a really close place Definitely recommend skytrain

title: Great way to get around town
review: Great way to get around town  cheap means of transport  Especially like the covered walked linking you to shops nearby

title: Best and only way to get around Bangkok. Cheap and easy and very clean
review: Traffic is so bad these days that the best way to get around Bangkok is by train It is easy and clean

title: Easy, cheap and fast way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is an easy way to get around Bangkok quickly in air conditioned comfort In the early morning and late afternoon beginning and ending of the work days it can be somewhat crowded but the rest of the time it is the best way to see a lot of Bangkok both on and off the train There are two different lines that run throughout BKK The Silom Line gets you down to the Chow Pri River and the Sukhumvit Line which takes you to large shopping areas and the famous Jim Thompson House Gardens and Restaurant The BTS is safe inexpensive clean and easy to use with signs in English

title: Very convenience
review: The BTS skytrain will help you to avoid the bad traffic in Bangkok  It is fast and not so expensive  You can go through the center of Bangkok which most excited places like Sukhumvit Sathorn or else  The skytrain is coming every 10 minutes and you don't need to wait for a long time It is clean and fully aircondition inside  Very convenience

title: the best way to go around in Bangkok!!!
review: traffic jam this is the big problem in Bangkok city especially during the time 1600 ~ 2000 Using the Skytrain to connect the MRT system you can go around the Bangkok city in easy & save the time

title: Excellent way of tourism transport
review: Highly recommended for tourists The traffic has become very difficult over the past years and we use the BTS as much as possible If you travel light you can get to the airport easily

title: Very convenient
review: A great way to get into central Bangok and is very reasonable If you have a lot of luggage then it is not recommended

title: Excelant
review: Best way to get around Bangkok World clase service easy to use and very reliable The Thais don't do much very well but when they do it's very good Like any major city it gets very crowded in peak hours but the general atmosper is still one of happiness

title: The best way to travel
review: If you can't walk take the skytrain and AVOID THE TUK TUK's Easy to use and takes you to the main shopping markets and food areas

title: clean, fast and annouce very clear all stations
review: Bangkok have two public transportation like metro on and under ground very usefull because the tuktuk and busses are terrible Between both the BTS is unquestionable the best

title: Puts the Underground to shame.
review: A great mass transit system spanning most key areas in Bangkok Very clean (you can't eat on it either) and the air con is a blessed relief in the Summer months

title: No choice
review: I take BTS every morning in a rush hour and they always have problems that make the trains stop at each station for 510min

title: Great way to go to KHAO SAN ROAD area
review: I took SKYTRAIN at the airport to the last stop which cost 45 baht  Than took a tuk tuk to go to khao san road area which cost about 100150 baht

title: Very reliable... will even keep you out of the heat!
review: As I was born and bred in Tokyo I know how a metro system should work Yes Bangkok's BTS Skytrain System is still small in comparison but its a good start At present they have the Silom and Sukhumvit Lines running The trains are clean cool and reliable Can get busy during rush hour but tolerable At least you're not being probed in the back by a station employee like in Tokyo Ha Fares are based on distance (like in Tokyo) but are relatively cheap ex Siphon Taksin Station to Siam Station is 34 Bahts Rather than taking the taxi through rush hour traffic (which is horrendous) why not try the BTS Skytrain

title: Bangkok travel tips
review: Used by tourists and smart locals Airconditioned clean and modernit is the Fastest way to travel around the shopping belt  especially during peak hours when the infamous Bangkok traffic is in a dead lock  But tricky if you have heavy bags to carry Try to get change to pay for the tickets

title: AHHH! Cool Air
review: The BTS is the best way to travel in Bangkok provided it's going your direction Nicely maintained easy to use

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy to use and a great way to get around Bangkok cheaply   Just pay the 25thb at the booth or machine and a train will be there in less than 5 mins   Goes directly to shopping precinct  siam square  mbk siam paragon  patpong market and chatuchuk   No need for a tuk Tuk or taxi

title: One of the best public transport systems I've ever used
review: The BTS line is an excellent and cheap way of exploring Bangkok We stayed right beside National stadium which is the one of the terminus stations on the Silom Line The BTS is split into two lines the Silom and Sukhumvit lines with both lines intersecting at Siam where you can chop and change It also interlinks with the ARL (airport rail line) at Phaya Thai BTS station for those wanting to use the BTS ARL to get back to the airport If you're going to be on and off the BTS through the day for exploring the city I would recommend purchasing a 1 day unlimited use pass for 140baht (around Â£220) whereas shorter journeys can cost as little one way as 35 baht (40p) The carriages are all airconditioned and provide a welcome relief from the Bangkok heat and humidity For areas the BTS can't reach there are frequent connections with the MRT underground line For a cheap clean and excellently reliable way of exploring Bangkok and getting from A to B I cannot recommend enough the BTS We could learn a lot from this back in the UK

title: Full trains
review: Year after year I find the BTS trains more full of people and the interval seems sometimes to be etern They need to improve the frequency

title: Great way around Bangkok
review: Such great way to get around Bangkok  But be prepared for rush hours it can get really crowded and you might have to wait for more than one train to finally get on

title: Convenient way to travel
review: This is the best way to travel when your in Bangkok safe fast without the traffic congestion and good connection with other transport system such as BRT Bus MTR subway ferry  and the express train to airport Easy to use and with air conditioning

title: Convenient
review: Convenient economical and consistent But if you are travelling with someone a taxi might cost as much or cheaper at times

title: A great way to get around Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain services are frequent trains clean and destinations easy to understand  The route takes you to most of the main attractions  it also gets you away from the horrendous traffic jams

title: Getting around quickly and easily
review: A little crowded at times but trains are very frequent cheap and easy to use The Skytrain connects with the other light rail systems virtually guaranteeing easy access to all the City as well as the Airport

title: Awesome experience
review: its the best way to travel in Bangkok which otherwise has a ever increasing traffic Try to avoid it during rush hours if you are travelling for leasuire as it can be really crowded

title: Fast and Easy to understand!
review: I was slightly worried using the trains in Bangkok because I thought that it would be hard with the language (and the Thai characters) however after the first ride it was very easy to use Spent almost 5 days without getting lost or confused Hi5 BTS SKYTRAIN

title: Best Commute for Bangkok
review: While It takes 2hours to get from Sukhumvit Soi 11 to Siam by taxi by BTS it takes hardly 15mins Its the easiest and fastest way to travel within Bangkok and the map is very easy to understand as well Most hotels offer free shuttle to and from the BTS station as well

title: Best option to travel around
review: I was staying in Sukhumvit and there was a Skytrain station very close There are frequent services and was much better and cheaper option then to travel in taxis

title: Best way of transportation in Bangkok
review: Using BTS Skytrain is the best transportation solution in Bangkok As you will struggle to reach your place by a taxi or TukTuk since the traffic there is really killing   BTS Skytrain could take you to the most landmarks in Bangkok with small amounts All what you have to do is getting BTS card which is valid for 5 years and do topup one time depends on how many day will you stay there 500 BHT was enough for a 10 days transportation which is really cheap )

title: The best choice for traveling in Bangkok city!
review: The best choice for traveling in Bangkok city nothing much to say about this  NOTE  Avoid rush hours if possible

title: The way to go
review: In Bangkok forget taxis if your destination is any way near a BTS or MRT stop Since it started about 12 yrs ago it has made Bangkok a far more livable citythank you BTS

title: Amazing ride with systematic procedure in station
review: To get the ticket of desired station its quite systematicThere is Ticket vending machineYou have to put desired amount of coin in it to get the desired ticketExperience of sky train is amazingOne must have at least a single ride to it if you r in Bangkok

title: Good to ride
review: Speed is ok not that fast It's clean and the aircon works fine All the security in the area are helpful if you ask some directions

title: One of the best way to travel in BKK
review: BTS trains are clean & efficient & a smart way to check out the city views (it's elevated) The locations are fantastic you can get to most major tourist shopping malls & places probably only Platinum Mall is an exceptionIt certainly beats getting stuck in the notorious BKK traffic unless you like to brave it via the hired motorbike prices are no issue  The only major bugbear it's there's no prepaid card etc to pay toll so you need  your coins handy & join the queue which sometimes can get quite long

title: Siam Station
review: At first I was skeptic to take this train because I couldn't find the station I was heading to (which was Siam) However when I asked the cashier and handed her my money she took it immediately and gave me change After staring at the map for a while I realized that Siam station was written boldly because it was a "major" station haha Silly me

title: BTS
review: easy to use and convenient stops to the major shopping malls Ticketing is easy with clear instructions

title: Great way to get around
review: This is a great way to get around easy to use and very clean You also dont have to wait long for a trainAs it connects to the Airport train it makes it an easy trip from airport we use this all the time when we are in Bangkok

title: easy commuting
review: When inBangkok we use the BTS Skytrain system a lot it is a very easy and quick way to get around the main parts of town Or at least will get you closer and then use a taxi to connect I think it is reasonably priced and very simple for a traveller to understand the system

title: Easy safe transport
review: Very easy to access many walkways and overpasses to get to stations Best way to get around in Bangkok Stations are close to many hotels and shopping centresClean and fast transport

title: Convenient
review: One of the best ways to get around Bangkok Very convenient and saved heaps of time Clean and cheap

title: A simple way to save money on transport
review: Fabulous way to travel in Bangkok Cheap clean efficient and air conditioned Easy to figure out how much to pay and where to go Locate the station you want to go to at the ticket machine note the number next to the station press the number on the machine and enter the change take ticket Locate the name of the end station on your map for the line you need to take Follow the signs for that name to get to the right platform Listen the announcement of your station in English and get off It is that simple Need change go to the counters manned by humans and give them your paper money The whole process is that simple no language skills needed Save money avoid contributing to carbon emissions and avoid getting ripped off by taxi drivers

title: The Skytrain
review: Just get a refillable card at the office at any station Just swipe and go When the card is empty just add funds

title: Best way to get around!
review: Using the BTS saves you a ton of time and money regarding transportation in Bangkok  Easy to navigate

title: skytrain
review: Skytrain was fantastic right outside my hotel only negative not all stations have escalator on both sides of a busy road

title: Fantastic way to get around BBK.
review: Amazing train service always on time very cheap and clean and easy to useBuy a rabbit ticket save time and cost

title: buzz
review: safe fun people and helpful on the train quick way off going places much better than a taxi gives you a feeling off really being there

title: Perfect for center of city travelling
review: Clean On time Through center of city However waiting for more connection (during many line constructins  )

title: The BEST improvement to BKK
review: Having lived in BKK for the better part of 20 years the SkyTrain is by far the best improvement over the years I rode it the very first day it opened on HM The King's birthday 1999 and have been using it nearly daily ever since   Bypass traffic and arrive at or near your destination licketysplit Taxis are cheap in Thailand and buses nearly free but the cost was never the issueit was the time wasted sitting in traffic   GO BTS SKYTRAIN

title: Quickest way to move around
review: Excellent transportation  organized clean quick and you avoid the bargain with taxis which can be unpleasent

title: Fast and convenient
review: It is so easy to take the BTS in Bangkok Furthermore it is cheap Fast way to explore the city on your own Don't have to worry about losing your way too

title: Efficient and clean
review: I used the sky train quite a few times I was amazed how clean and efficient the system is It's easy to use even for non Thai speaking tourists  I highly recommend the use of the service it makes seeing more of Bangkok so easy and a pleasure

title: Easy to Use & Safe
review: BTS Train in Bangkok is the ONLY way to travel except it does not service the airport or The Palace

title: Excellent Transport mode in BKK
review: BTS experience is really good I work from Singapore it is similar to that Stations are clean with security in the platforms Only disadvantage the first level of BTS doesn't have a lift or esclatatorwhich is tough for elders

title: Easy to navigate
review: Had fun riding the BTS skytrain Very easy to navigate for someone who does not understand thai language Reasonably priced and very good connectivity between key business destinations

title: Excellent
review: It would be nice if all countries inner city trains were this good  Every couple of minutes and cheap  Above all  Spotlessly clean   No food or drink allowed

title: Its better to use BTS Sky Train to Explore Bangkok
review: Its a good choice to explore Bangkok city and its cheap We can go to shopping mall with BTS Skytrain

title: Easiest way to get around BKK
review: Our hotel was located in close proximity to the BTS skytrain It was easy to navigate and saved a great deal of time and frustration in BKK traffic

title: Amazing!
review: I stayed at the Hyatt and this was virtually on the doorstep it made for very easy travel it was super efficient and clean

title: Time Saving
review: One of the best ways to get away from the hustle bustle of the City traffic Bangkok roads are  probably one of the busiest roads across the places i've visited and not to mention the traffic Jams are just there BTS will take you many places in less than what you can imagine Very efficient but sometimes you will find rushed with people Especially the night view from BTS can give you a different perspective of the city I have taken all types of road transports here and i might not take them next time unless BTS does not take me there

title: USE THE TRAIN
review: Love the skytrain  best way to get around bangkok and avoid the traffic jams that seem to be all day recently

title: Best way to GO
review: Best way to get around BKK much faster and cheaper than road and cool with good AC easy to use and cheap Have been using it for years and makes life so much easier than road

title: Escape from the Bangkok jam!
review: Very happy with the BTS Skytrain  Very efficient clean and cool  (very important in a tropical country)

title: Easy to Use, Easy to Navigate
review: I found the BTS easy to use easy to navigateeven for the foreigner  However the coverage area could be more extensive

title: Great way to get anywhere without traffic jam
review: This transport system is awesome It is cheap and simple You can get to most places within a few minutes without the massive traffic jam

title: Efficient Travel
review: A very efficient form of transport to get most places in Bangkok Although a very busy system there are trains every few minutes

title: Reliable, fast and helpful
review: It's real BTS skytrain was a big help to get around in Bangkok fares ranging from 1555 baht depends on distance which is reasonable BTS skytrain usually gets crowded on peak hours there's also free map in each of BTS stop

title: Not easy with luggage
review: I found it very difficult to navigate while toting my suitcase and bag I couldn't figure out where to change trains signage was bad

title: Skied across Bangkok
review: The fastest and smoothest way to ride across the city of Bangkok is via the sky trains especially  good if you are to avoid heavy traffic in the cityAdded to this is that the train make stops at some of the most interesting shopping centres of Bangkok

title: Easiest and FASTEST way to travel in Bankok
review: Easiest and FASTEST way to travel in Bankok While it doesn't go everywhere it makes every other mode of transportation look so bad It used to be empty but now pretty much every one uses it so it gets quite crowded

title: So much easier than the other options
review: Nothing is perfect and yet the Skytrain offers the fastest transport time from one location to the next with still some time to walk shortly to your ultimate destination   Taxis used to be good but now there is too much trafficmotorbike taxis are suitable but very dangerous and I love my knees to much

title: Very efficient
review: We had no problems going to and from the airport with the BTS Skytrain Most what we did was walk to where we're going around the city   There's a choice if you want an express train tofrom the airport

title: Very Effective Public Transport
review: It's just very effective Seats and inside is very neat and clean too It's air conditioned and people are very nice Each stations are clean too with screens for commercials and advertisements I always use BTS when I go to Bangkok and backpack It's really cool

title: Avoid traffic jams
review: love this skytrain  Traffic in Bangkok can be very crowded with this skytrain it is easy to jump on and off and avoid the traffic jams  It is easy to use with maps showing the details of where you are going  It is clean and safe

title: The Only Way to get around BKK
review: the ONLY way to get around  everytime i deal with a taxi motorbike taxi or just driving i know that i have made a mistake and should be on BTS

title: BTS and MRT
review: The most cleanest fastest and economical way to travel in Bangkok Of all the rail systems I have used throughout the world Bangkok's system is second to none It is enjoyable to use the Sky Walkways between shopping malls and just seeing the multiple Kiosks throughout the many stops You have a choice 3 hours by taxi or 20 minutes for a long commute

title: Cheap, spotless and convenient.
review: This was the first time I'd used the Skytrain and wished I'd used it before  It embarrasses the public transport in my home town of Melbourne Australia  Its on time spotlessly clean in expensive easy to use and tickedtokens are easily obtainable In particular I noticed the lack of graffiti which is so prevalent in and on Melbourne trains and trams which is so refreshing  The trip from central Bangkok to the airport is great as being on an elevated line the views of the city on leaving BKK and all the way to the airport are interesting and make the trip seem quicker that it is  If you are staying in central BKK its the best way to get there from the international airport

title: Efficient train system
review: A great way to avoid the Bangkok traffic jam is to take the BTS Skytrain Convenient locations throughout central Bangkok it takes you to many key shopping areas within the city If you are not sure which station to alight just ask the station master at the booth I found all of them friendly and helpful

title: Very punctual and consistent public transport to get around Bangkok
review: I recommend people to take the BTS Sky train as it is quite clean air conditioned and economical It mostly goes to all the main shopping areas of Bangkok

title: Skytrain
review: Easy to buy tickets once you get the hang of it Very crowded mornings and late afternoons to evening

title: The train system works really well!
review: Once we 'figured it all out' we loved using the trains We did not take a taxi onceeven from the airport It is a really good system

title: Bts skytrain
review: Although its very packed n crowded the train is clean n fast The walk between stations are far so its better to  take although its only one stop Also the station staff are not well informed n some don't  understand  English

title: Reliable transportation
review: Clean and tidy On time reliable service My only problem was when I couldn't distinguish the difference between BTS and MRT I suppose many name of the same train service that was confusing to the traveller

title: Comfortable safe and easy way to travel
review: i have used BTS Sky Train during my stay in Bangkok You can avoid traffic jams moreover on the stations every information is available makes your travel easy The trains are clean and you can travel easily to your desired place with the information provided Moreover some stations provide you direct entry in famous shopping malls

title: Easy travelling on BTS Sky train
review: The easiest way to travel in Bangkok Stations are clean and trains are safe to travel on The signage inside and around the station is clear and easy to use

title: Skytrain
review: Excellent service by staff who are willing to assist Information and signs help you buy the tickets to where you want to gofast train service Went to the shopping malls

title: Skytrain Bangkok
review: fast and reliable way to get around in Bangkok  trains are clean and usually run on time During peak times early morning and afternoon  early evening trains are full but run every couple of minutes

title: Very user friendly
review: Fast efficient way to get around at a reasonable rate Good route selection and found it very user friendly for buying tickets etc

title: Reliable Mode of Transportation
review: Great way to move around Bangkok and a day pass is must Beware of rush hour as the trains are very crowded but safe & dependable

title: Convenient, Clean, Quick!
review: The BTS is a great way to travel within Bangkok where road traffic can be a noisy nightmare of traffic jams and slow movement due to bottleneck  I found the BTS to be open airy very clean and a smooth ride It can connect you efficiently between most areas around Bangkok and is quite costeffective

title: Just great
review: I usually try to stay close to the sky train because it's so easy and quick to get about The sky train is lovely and clean because you are not allowed to eat or drink on it It can get extremely crowded at rush hours but there's always another train a couple of minutes behind so you don't have to get crushed There's also a queuing system at rush hour so no manic pushing There's always a guard on the platform so be sure not to cross the line

title: Crowded, fast rides through congested central Bangkok
review: Escorted by a tour guide our small group enjoyed seeing parts of central Bangkok from elevated tracks and stations at night  Some spectactular stations and swirling crowds made this an interesting break from tour buses and cabs

title: BTS Skytrain
review: A great way to get around in Bangkok The fare is reasonable Sometimes the cars are full of passengers is fun to get around

title: Amazing effcient and cold...
review: Where ever you are try to be near the skytrain For short distance single tickets are fine  Can be busy sometimes at ticket stations Carry enough coins

title: Ideal way to get round the city
review: At first it looks intimidating but actually simplesafe and easy way to get round the city as the road network is like a car park for most of the day

title: best option in bangkok city
review: Think travelling around bangkok is a nightmare for a foreigner Try the BTS Skytrain I ventured out with Thai partner in tow in case i struck troubles As it turns out i ended up leading her aroundeverything is well signposted plenty of helpful staff who generally speak english well and all very organised Dont worry too much about timetables as the trains seem to come and go every 5 minutes Air conditioned clean and very cheapand no traffic hassles Sure its crowded during peak times but what do you expect in a city of 7 million peopleFound the thais as usual to be polite and patient travellers No mad rushing or bustling to get on or off the trains A simple friendly way to travel the city and you can look out the window and watch the mad traffic jams on the roads that you have just avoided Note that the BTS and the Metro are different systems so if switching from one to the other you simply buy a fresh ticket at the changeover very impressed and i recommend you give it a try itrs certainly cheaper and faster than tuk tuks or taxis

title: Surprise in the air
review: This a great way to travel in Bangkok Extremely clean and on time Have some change for the ticket machines and do NOT forget to keep your ticket  it is the only way to exit at destination

title: Thailand travels
review: wonderful holiday in ThailandDIVINE LANDSCAPES found some some people very polite and sympathetic and excellent food I will definitely return to Thailand I loved it and was very happy

title: The best way to travel around Bangkok
review: Traveling by sky train is the best way to get around Bangkok Sometimes mostly during rush hours the trains get very crowded The trains are air conditioned and very clean with good security The people who sell tickets speak english you can buy a week or monthly pass which are good deals if you are going to use the train to get around

title: cold trip
review: take a jacket if u dont want to freeze  buy a day ticket you will be usng this more than twice a day unless you can defy the laws of bangkok traffic jams

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok
review: Most convenient way to travel around Bangkok besides MRT I can reach places in few minutes and the best way to avoid ridiculous traffic in Bangkok It is also the cheapest way to travel Air conditioned clean and  short waiting time Remarkably efficient and convenient

title: Simples
review: This transport is so easy to use and very cheap  under Â£3 for a days unlimited travel  Much better than walking on the streets

title: Good, but limited option!
review: The BTS Skytrain is a convenient way to avoid the heavy traffic of Bangkok it is tourist friendly and clean convenient (operates 06000000) and cheap The BTS is limited to two lines so to navigate other parts of Bangkok you need to be familiar with how it integrates with the other public transport systems (Airport Rail Link MRT BRT River Taxis etc) If you are in Bangkok for a while recommend you get a BTS Rabbit Card (Top Up Swipe Card)to avoid the ticket lines

title: Cheap and convenient!
review: The best way for move around in Bkkthe price is really convenient and in less than 30 min you can be in the other side of Bkk wich is impossible by car beacuse of the traffic Really reccomended

title: Clean, cool and fast.
review: The best transportation method to get around in Bangkok with it's notorious busy trafic Look no further if you are near a station

title: An efficient and fast means of transport
review: I just caught BTS to MBK and back from Silom Rd and found it to be a reliable fast means of public transport  Reasonably priced however the plastic seating is uncomfortable I guess not much of a problem as people often need to stand anyway   The ticket machines are easy to use and clear pricing on the wall next to them Would have been better if they accepted notes though

title: Fair price
review: I thought the service was very organized and with a fair price once you just pay the ammount proportional to the place you are going to

title: Love The BTS Skytrain as well as MRT
review: I wish LA had this type of transportation system Sky Train and MRT (the underground version of skytrainare both very clean and air conditioned A way to get around quickly through Bangkok Transportation around Bangkok is inexpensive whether you go by taxi bus sky train  or subway I feel very safe using the Sky Train and MRT I look forward to using sky train more than taxi or busif you plan on using it many times buy the day pass Otherwise buy individual ticket Love going to Mah Broon Krong by BTS because traffic is usually bad and it drops you off at either Siam Square or MBK There is shelter from the rain or hot sun between the National Stadium station and the MBK center There is also currency exchange food eateries and souvenir stores The skytrain is awesome

title: Very convinient and cheap.
review: Trains are coming with gap of few minutes air condioned very simple to buy tickets and tomove from one point to another It is pity there are only 2 lines

title: Beat the traffic chaos in Bangkok
review: The only way to travel around the city  fast cheap and so much quicker than facing the traffic gridlock of Bangkok   Took a tuk tuk from wat poh back to hotel Sofitel on Sukhumvit road and hot half way there when the driver said he was dropping is at a BTS station as traffic too busy  much quicker and cheaper   Returning  from  Bangkok Don Mueang airport to the the city  A1 bus to Mo Chit BTS station then ten stops to hotel all for less than Â£1 and so much quicker than a taxi and a fraction of the cost    Use it where you can

title: Getting around
review: Great convenient way of getting around and reasonably priced we were able to see most of what we wanted by getting the day ticket on each day were travelled around which was Bht 140 per person

title: Easy
review: An easy and stress free way to travel Bangkok trains ride frequently but are often really crowded on the rush hours It is a pity that you have to buy a new ticket when hopping from airport train to BTS and vice versa Queues at the ticket office (and boxes) can be long ticket validity is one hour Trains and stations are clean information in trains and stations is bilingual (Thai & English) with very good airconditioning in the trains as an extra

title: Fast efficient transport
review: Often overcrowded in busy times this is an efficiently run and fast method of transport in a big city that has traffic snarlups

title: Convenient and cheap
review: Bangkok's BTS is an easy cheap and convenient way of travelling There are announcements in English and Thai at every stop so you don't have to worry about being lost Certain stations even connect to the Airport Railway and underground MRT If you are uncertain ask the counter staff and they will direct you Note that you have to prepare a lot of small change as the ticketing machines only accept coins If possible try to avoid morning and evening peak hours on weekdays as the trains and stations can get really very crowded

title: Lovely
review: Took us to the airport A train that goes around the city and take people to places also around the city

title: very good to cross BKK
review: perfect to cross the city during rush hour and other day times You have in BKK no other chance to move in down town very fast

title: Skytrains - saved 30 minutes of your life
review: The skytrain or the metro rail was a great experience While they have automated ticket counters where exact change needs to be tendered they have a counter where you can get change for the amount required While the trains are packed during the morning hours you may have to skip a train or two to get in during the peak hours

title: cheaper
review: if you're in thailand i suggest you to take bts because it's cheaper than taxi taxi is scam in thailand but I'm so confused using btw because its written in thai language i asked thai people to buy a ticket for me when I was in bkk

title: Easy to use, clean, fast
review: Not much to say other than its a fast cheap and efficient way to see the city Recommended over taxis to save a buck or two

title: Fast efficient and very polite
review: We used the sky train several times and found it very efficient clean and very organised To watch everyone queue at the platform edge doors and let everyone off when the train arrives without barging on was a pleasant and welcome surprise If you couldn't squeeze on then another one was along in a few minutes

title: Excellent Way to get round Bangkok
review: Fast smooth ride It's a great way to get round Bangkok and it's cheap The trains are clean and cool and very busy Worth using

title: getting around
review: Skytrain is ideal for getting around also  from the airport to the city centre Clean fast and cheap Easy to navigate

title: No waiting
review: They may be crowded but no waiting time they come around every 3 minutes and very easy to work out I am an old lady 66 and I can do it no troubles LOL

title: Great mode of transport
review: This was a very easy way to get around although very very busy take care when going through barriers as my ticket got jammed and when i redid it the barrier attacked me and I was left with huge bruises for weeks

title: Useful metro line
review: This metro line will cover almost sukumvith rd and siliom rd Also major stations will covered shopping attractions areas like terminal 21 siyam center mbk central world etc There are two interchange to use MRT line and one station to connect to AIRPORT line

title: Not for the frail
review: The main problem with the Skytrain is that it doesn't cater for the elderly  It is well above the street level of course but if elderly people are to use it then escalators are necessary all the way up  not just part of the way  I thoroughly recommend it for younger people and it is a great way to get other transport off the very crowded roads However you don't escape from the crowds and younger people were not very considerate about giving up their seats to an 88 yearold

title: Clean, fast, clear, helpful
review: BTS is the fastest way to get around Bangkok It is priced reasonably it is clean no traffic jams the indications are clear the personnel are helpful It happens that cards don't work or machines don't work No worries someone is prompt to come to your assistance and solve the problem without hassle nor humiliation You are not a "suspected criminal" in the BTS as can happen in other major cities with mass transport

title: A Great Ride
review: Excellent way to get around Bangkok no noise no pollution in the air If your destination is not directly on the route it is sure to be nearby Best to get a daily pass that is good until midnight no line for tickets tap the pass and go Highly recommended

title: Easy Comfortable Cold
review: Inside of the trains are very very cold You feel very well at the beginning but feel cold after some time with your sweaty tshirts on you Sometimes you may need to wait long queues to buy tickets even from the vending machines You have to climb stairs to reach boarding platform But very comfortable and easy to use And try skywalk platforms when you step out of the trains

title: Good for traffic but not cheap
review: if your destination is along the BTS  then makes complete sense to use and beat the traffic  although taxi is much cheaper if in a group of 4

title: Convenience and efficiency
review: So very convenient being located right alongside the hotel  Hotel staff even helped me buy my ticket as was my first time using the train

title: Decent Transport in Bangkok
review: I can understand the good reviews for the sky train as it is fast efficient air conditioned and gives decent views of the city during the day however I wouldn't say it's an attraction it gets you from A to B quicker than any other method of transport

title: Excellent transportation
review: Sky train in Bangkok is an excellent way to travel when you are in this big city Fast train with air conditioning

title: Clean and Quality service
review: Clean and easy to use  They have AC and easy to read signs to help you get around  I have to say that this is first class

title: Frequent trains, watch the peak period though
review: Besides the shopping malls the BTS is another escape from the stifling heat of Bangkok You could even use it like a tourist train checking out some of the spots from up high in aircon comfortThe day passes are good value they give you any trip right up to last train at night and cost about 140THB  less than AUD$6 for unlimited day trips Really the only thing to watch for is the peak times where your personal space can be measured in negative numbers and the likelihood of catching someone else's cold is high I've heard of pick pockets and gropers too in those busy times but never experienced that myself

title: Excellent services outside week working hours
review: Very convenient sky train that does need to be extended in carriages and in stops numbers Followed by MRT and Bangkok is not only cars traffic jams Plus many other public transportsbuses some are freecanal boatsmotorbike taxistaxis with meters on and private cars for the addicted to avoid walking

title: First time to try the train in BKK
review: It was a nice ride compared to the trains in Manila because it is not challenging to transfer from one train to another

title: Bangkoklife
review: As traffic in Bangkok is horrible this is the way to travel And also to se the city I've never taken a skytrain before and I find it very amusing Also seeing all the locals But beware of pickpockets  no food or drinks and airconditions (I have to bring a jacket for long tips)

title: easy
review: very comfortable with the move mrt also great for not imbottigliarsi in grits traffic bangkok I recommend it to everyone then you can also connect with the bts and reach other interesting points

title: Perfect but try to avoid the rush hours
review: Only way to get around Bangkok together with the subway MRT but try to avoid the morning and evening rush

title: nice
review: amazing well managed and organized thailand has more poverty than most of the developed world but the services provided impressed us

title: Easy
review: The easiest and fastest way to get around the city cheap no Tuktuk or taxi scams and overcharge I love how people organized themselves at the doors

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Great way to get around Bangkok and avoid the horrific traffic clean and modern air continuing provides some relief from the Bangkok heat during your travels

title: Good transport option
review: Best way to get around town when the traffic is crazy and always at  a standstill A bit confusing for a foreigner sometimes as and interchange between BTS & Metro requires repurchasing a ticket from the other station We were told ''because its two different companies" Peak hours are crowded Stops to Siam are Always crowded but never unruly Great clean transportation option

title: Easy to get around !!
review: We used the BTS sky train nearly every day for 9 days  Buy a day pass for 240thb  Great value   Very fast way to get around Bangkok Quick trains every 5 mins clean non smoking  Great

title: Cheap transport all around Bangkok
review: I was very impressed by the BTS Skytrain The staff at the ticket desk spoke very well English and helped me to get the right ticket The ticket prices are displayed very clearly on the route map too (the number is the ticket price anywhere between 15 and 30something Bhat I think)  It can be extremely crowded but that's part of the experience Trains are well air conditioned Oh no eating or drinking on the train

title: skip the tuk tuks and overpriced taxi fares and ride the BTS
review: efficient quiet and fastsuper easy and cheap to ride right now theres added security because of whats been going on as of late Really helpful and friendly staff

title: BTS Sky train - Easy to use and cheapmode of travel
review: easy to get connected around Bangkok using Sky train efficient service and cheap Good connections to take you to the river or weekend market

title: Worth a try
review: A great way to get around Bangkok and to access other transport such as the metro and the river ferries Quick clean and cheap  I bought the 17 journeys ticket which was easy to use The carriages can get crowded at times but life is like that

title: Sky train
review: Cheep fast and clean a great way to get around Bangkok  you can buy day tickets and explore at your own pace day or night

title: Much better than roads as traffic is bad.
review: Wonderful service But before going out of a station make sure you know which numbered exit you must take to go towards your destination otherwise you will have to walk long distance

title: Top Public Transport
review: I last visited about 20 years ago when I think they had just started planning or maybe even building it  getting around then was painfully slow But now the sky train is fantastic  quick and cheap its also well airconditioned It doesn't go everywhere but even if you use it for just part of a journey it helps

title: Very efficient and clean!
review: The transport system in Bangkok is so easy I found it very efficient very clean and air conditioned If you are near a metro or sky train it will be much quicker to use the public transport rather than a taxi or Tuk Tuk

title: u can reach most of the places of interest by sky train or the chao praya boat service. the taxis will cost you triple.
review: There is shuttle to the station every hour from the hotel ibis bangkok riverside or u can catch the sky train by crossing the river Do aviid travelling in taxis

title: Fast transportation
review: Operating from 0600  2400 the BTS offers a convenient way for moving through Bangkok It is really cold in the trains which I appreciate

title: Fast but don't bring a child buggy
review: So much better cheaper faster than any other mode of transport in Bangkok Really easy to use The only thing I'd say is they need more escalators carrying child buggy up and down stairs was not much fun Still it was like riding the future

title: Best option for solo traveller!
review: I purposely chose a hotel near the BTS to be able to get around easily especially at peak travel times when you could see traffic at a stand still  It's true that the trains were busy during those times but it was better to stand for a few stops than be stuck in gridlock in a taxi  And even more I was happy to avoid the tuktuks and their tricky detours whenever I could It was a wonderful system with clearly marked stops and very useful signs directing you to your destination at every station  I purchased a card so that I wouldn't need to get change for each ride and would highly recommend that if you have a few days in Bangkok  There's also the option for a day pass but I found this less useful as it doesn't apply to the other types of transport (MRT ART river boats)

title: great clean transportation
review: I took the rot fai fa to get to Siam Paragon (the mall)  We discovered a starbucks at the Paragon which was the most wonderful thing to see when you can't find decent coffee in Thailand  We bought extra large coffees to go but when we tried to get back on the train they wouldn't let us  Half of us were on one side of the turnstile and the other half with our coffees were on the other side  The guard was very rude and wouldn't allow us on  So my husband GULPED his coffee burning hot right then and there  It was a terrible experience especially since the rot fai fa charges high prices to ride it  For the average thai this is not a normal mode of transportation  My Thai family made an exception for us to ride it so that we could experience it   Overall it's a beautiful train with stops at good locations But in the future I probably will not take it

title: Best way to travel within Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is the perfect way to travel within Bangkok Connecting over 50 kms of area the 2 train lines (Sukhumvit and Silom lines) connect at Siam interchange station making it easy to get to any part of the city  You can also connect to the underground MRT train line at Asok station or to the Airport rail link at the Phya Thai station  Fares start at 15 baht up to a maximum of 40 baht  This is also a great way to see the city from above  Tip Avoid taking the train at peak hours as it gets to be very crowded with office workers  You should also purchase a prepaid card so that you don't have to join the long queue to get your tickets

title: Probably the best way to move around Bangkok
review: Bangkok is huge and is always busy no matter the day or the hour Therefore moving around by taxi car or bus is quite a nightmare So the Sky Train once it moves above the traffic jams is probably the best way to move all over Bangkok It's cheap has aircon and is relatively fast By the other hand one may find it also good to have a different view over Bangkok

title: Excellent airport to city connection"
review: This skytrain is a dream from the airport (which is an impressive one itself)  For $150 US and very helpful staff (maybe America can learn a thing or two) you ride a comfortable clean modern train to stops in the city that connect to buses taxis and subways Announcements in Thai and English spotless and painless  By comparison a taxi (even if you are not ripped off) on the highway ran me $21 at off peak times and can go higher  Still a bargain compared to NY

title: Easy, clean, safe
review: Safest way to travel around Bangkok  Maximum fare is 40THB  Air conditioned  Fairly busy Easy navigation

title: Not an attraction but gets you to places quickly
review: I don't understand why this is an attraction because it is simply a means to get you places It is definitely better than the London underground being cooler and with some views but can still get very busy  Quicker than a taxi due to the Bangkok traffic if it covers the area you want to go

title: What a Great Way to Get Around
review: Easy cheap safe and convenient way to get around the city   We enjoyed using it as much for the experience as for getting to places like Siam Paragon and MBK Shopping Centres   You buy tickets from the ticket machines Staff do not sell ticks over the counter Machines only take coins not notes but staff at the booths will exchange your notes for coins if you need  Once youâve got your coins go to the ticket machine select your fare code by reference to the useful station map youâll find stuck to the machine itself insert your coins and out comes your ticket Itâs that easy Use the tickets to go through the barrier and then come out again at your destination There are a some daily and weekly ticket options but we just bought single tickets as needed as they are so cheap â about 20 THB per trip But just be aware that Thailand suffers from hyperinflation so these prices are only valid as at Aug 09 and will probably have gone up by the time you travel  Youâll find staff at the staions helpful and polite  Donât hesitate to use this form of transport as much as you can Especially in a gridlocked place like Bangkok itâs the best way to get around Just be aware though that at peak times in early morning late afternoon they get very full

title: Convenient travel if it's not during People going to work or leaving work, the car is very comfortable.
review: BTS is a convenient and fast way to travel in Bangkok It is a good choice for avoiding traffic problems and real road taxes (except rush hour)

title: Easy to use
review: The best way to get around BKK Easy to use very cheap and a frequent service Very modern and clean Can get a bit overcrowded at rush hour but that's to be expected

title: BTS
review: BTS AND MRT are best  way to get tourist location visit around us fast and easy and there very Helpfull in tickets counter so in Bangkok use Metro ð

title: Good choice
review: Very comfortable and My favorite way to go around the city easier than others Time save a lot and feel convenience

title: Save time
review: The most comfortable method for travel around the whole city Prices and services are reasonable Saving time is a big advantage

title: Best public transportation
review: Comfortable no traffic jam and can go many famous place This is the best way as public transportation There is no doubt about its useful

title: BTS is clean, simple, inexpensive and fast
review: Although it can get crowded at peak times the BTS is the best method of travel in Bangkok if it matches with your destination It is very simple to buy tickets using the kiosks (which can show English easily) or the ticket agent at the window The trains are clean air conditioned and run fairly frequently

title: best way to get around Bangkok
review: It just works The service is inexpensive the trains are clean punctual and of course airconditioned

title: A bit pricey
review: If there's an option to take MRT Take MRT instead BTS is a bit pricey MRT is the faster as well compared to BTS

title: Great Bangkok Transportation!
review: The Skytrain was our preferred transportation for touring Bangkok  It was speedy highly efficient and low cost  Quiet trains with comfortable seats and provided access to most major shopping malls and other famous destinations in Bangkok

title: Good transportation around Bangkok
review: After living in Vancouver Canada and experiencing the Skytrain and also having been to New York City I would say the BTS is extremely good It is fast clean has very good AC (much needed after walking around in Bangkok) is simple to use and very cost friendly It costs about 40 THB or about $2 CDN to go 6 stops All stations are fully covered to keep you protected from the wicked rainstorms All stations have large thermo scans to take everyone's temperature before entering (due to COVOD19) and it is mandatory for everyone to wear a mask (and they have staff to enforce it)

title: Good way to get around.
review: Probably the easiest way to get around although not the most comfortable particularly at peak times Journeys are certainly quiet as most passengers are concentrating on their mobile phones It's useful to have some change when buying tickets but be prepared for quite long queues at the machines and ticket offices Prices are very reasonable Within the carriages are some priority seats for the elderly pregnant or those who with very small children However it seems that many students in Bangkok cannot read given that in the carriages we travelled in all these seats were occupied by young people who studiously ignored anyone with a legitimate claim to a priority seat Using the rail system in Bangkok is much more preferable to going by taximuch cheaper and much quicker

title: Great
review: As long as you live close to a BTS station then everything is fantasic  commuting wise BTS keeps a world class standard much better than e g London subway

title: Fast, nice a/c only way to get around
review: The SkyTrain is fast and will allow you to bypass the miserable traffic Single ride tickets are easy to get and there are other passes too

title: Quick Inexpensive
review: About the best way to get about Bangkok Cheap and once mastered easy to use Trains may be packed most of the time but taxis in traffic worse

title: Good way to beat Bangkok traffic
review: BTS Skytrains are fast frequent efficient and air conditioned The network of lines has expanded over the years so that it now covers much of the city Connection to the subway (seperate fare) gives an even longer range Cars can be crowded at peak times but not during most of the day or evening Easy connection by boat to visit hotels temples along the river and Iconsiam shopping complex (free or very cheap fare) NOTE to buy a stored value card to use on BTS you need to pay 100 bhat (about $325) and show your Passport so it can be regestered to you This is only when you first buy it and is not required to top up value later for other trips

title: Excellent Hotel in Bangkok
review: We recently had a 10 day stay in the executive level of the Marriott Marquee Queenâs Park hotel Bangkok from 1222 October 2019  It is our second visit and we have a further visit in 2 February 2020 for 7 nights  We write to compliment your staff they were all unfailingly polite and helpful but of course we had an opportunity to get to know the staff in the executive lounge club better over ten cocktail hours and would particularly compliment Gail Eak Mu and Toon for their service               Charles Goh

title: Efficient
review: Is what you expect from a transit system Clean on time and relatively hassle free Bit of a stair climb up and down from the stations and can be a bit crowded however gets you close to most of the popular places in Bangkok and is in expensive If there are a couple of you sometimes cheaper to catch a taxi but then you would have to contend with traffic

title: Could be better
review: The Bangkok metro system (to include the BTS) is decent with one drawback Each train line has its own ticket systems so for example if you are transffering between the BTS and the MTR you need to go buy a new ticket Otherwise its a decent system which can get you close most places in town

title: Good
review: Nice but crowdy Fare is not that expensive less than the popular tuktuk Best to beat the traffic out there

title: best way to get ar
review: good mode of Transportation tickets only with coins or at counter Coverage of town could be (will be better in future) Need walk or tuktuk for last meters

title: Very convenient
review: It's a convenient to travel to and fro airport and city center It took less time and money than taxis No bargain needed No need to be cheated by the driver It costed us THB40 per head per adult per trip

title: Very useful though often crowded
review: The SkyTrain is a very useful above ground metro train linking Bangkok south to north via Siam Square the heart of modern Bangkok It is cheap and easy to use Downsides are that it gets very crowded so you often have to stand and that it is elevated so you have to walk up Sometimes there are elevators but not always where you need them Also it is an ugly monstrosity that dominates the streets it is on

title: Trains  / transport
review: Quick easy transport around parts of the city Nothing to get excited about it's a city train system

title: Easy way to get around BKK
review: Took the BTS to the King Power Building get yourself a Rabbit card at the kiosk You can reload it

title: Cheap and convenient
review: It's very cheap and convenient for travelers I highly recommend to use when there is traffic Great job BKK

title: Very cold temperature inside the train, compared to the outside
review: You may want to take a sweaterscarflight jacket because if you have been walking outside for a while and then have to travel a long way the contrast in the temperature feels uncomfortable Though it is not as quick as I would want it to be it is still appeared to be a faster way of traveling than by taxi The personnel at the ticket desk speak English quite well no problem to buy the ticket (if you are buying one way ticket do not forget to return it into the slot at the exit tourniquet)

title: Easy to use
review: By far the easiest and fastest way around Bangkok Just beware the train does get crowed plus you can get to Metro stations and transfer over

title: Save time
review: By using bts in Bangkok you can save time as well cost  You only wait train no more than two mins   It saves your time and cost compare to other transportoin

title: The easiest way to get around
review: The Skytrain was worth every penny Such an easy & convenient way to get around Bangkok Very cheap too

title: Excellent
review: Both the skytrain and metro are excellent means of getting around Bangkok  Clean easy to manage and inexpensive

title: One should experience
review: We took a short ride from one emd to other Good view and exiting You can see the city and understand the major places better And most important you get a feel of the locals

title: Skytrain a  great way to see the  city
review: There is  an extensive  network of  public transit is  Bangkok  It  permits  one to get  around and avoid the horrendous traffic  Its  very quick and clean  We  went  from the Ratchechewi station  to Chang Erawan station in about 30 minutesIt  cost  about 60 baht

title: Connecting airport train to Siam
review: This train connects to the train fromto airport to various locations within Bangkok I was looking for ticket for the whole day for my conveniencebut did not find any such ticket I expected maps with important places marked and closest skytrain station marked but did not find it the stations only had the skytrain maps The only saving grace was the information center who attend to you in English Tre skytrain is comfortable and seems well connected provided you know which place is close to which skytrain station

title: Nice way to avoid car traffic jams
review: As of now there are still few lines operating Two main city lines one to the airport and another one from the suburbs But many are under construction The two main traditional lines so called Sukhumvit and Silom lines intersect in Siam Another one goes to the airport with a few stops in between The connection is fairly easy  cross the platform if you change for a train going in the same direction  change floors if you are going in the opposite direction Trains are air conditioned and very well equipped in terms of handles or bars to hold on Each station is announced at least two times on the speaker system  The problems are that it can get overly crowded at rush hours The lines were extended 4 years ago going into the suburbs It took close to a year to go from 3 to 4 cars per train One line got extended again and there are still 4 cars whereas the platform could accommodate 6 No consideration for the customer  Price is steep Students get a break but extremely small Senior citizens also get a break but only Thai nationals   If two or more persons are travelling a taxi is more than likely cheaper and will take you door to door  Overall a great way to move around if on a schedule but would require a change in management to a more consumercustomer oriented staff

title: Great, useful and pretty cheap!
review: Great way to get around Bangkok nice clean and reliable Has Air con on the train itself and lots of maps to explain where you are and where you are going  Very easy to use similar to London Underground Great views as you are travelling and lots of windows to see the whole of Bangkok

title: Overcrowded
review: The in itself superior skytrain is losing customers simply because they can not get in Reverted to MRT instead but that is not an option for all destinations however  Please BTS make te trains longer

title: Easy transport
review: Does what it says on the tin  very simple and quick way to travel round the city We found taxis were about the same value for a family of four travelling short distances but by skipping the traffic this was far more relaxed Easy selfexplanatory ticket purchase and very easy to follow route maps and station call outs Believe you can save time and money by buying pay as you go tickets in advance

title: A great and affordable mode of transport right in the heart of Bangkok
review: There is no better way to get around Bangkok as it could take over an hour to move 1km in the city by car at any given time of the day It's safe It's reasonably inexpensive It's clean Its fast & efficient What more cpuld a traveller ask for

title: Great Way to Travel, However Many Steps!
review: For travelling it is an option however some stations do not have escalators  so many steps to climb to get to or from the train Very crowded during peak times and rarely the opportunity to get a seat  The distance to get to a station versus hailing a cab ð needs to be calculated  If you are claustrophobic this is not for you during peak times

title: Oct Trip
review: First time using the sky train Was very easy to use and the ticket staff are most helpful Will use this again in the future

title: cool a/c,clean ,on time
review: cool acclean on time You should spare time if you take bts during79 am working day coz super crowd and no space for backpack or big luggageBTS is not allowed to keep backpack on your back in crowd condition

title: Easy to move around
review: A goid alternative to taxi and tuk ruk Sometimes very crowded No chance to buy a ticket at machines with paper bills It could be felt as to cold Other might enjoy the cooling down f a while
