title: BTS Skytrain
review: Good service to opt for slightly expansive though But you don't have more options as Taxi's are more expensive

title: Reliable and efficient
review: We used the BTS train a couple of times and found them to be really reliable and efficient  Being from Australia we're used to trains that are late heavily graffitied and unsure where the doors will end up at the platform  Well Bangkok's BTS trains are the opposite  they arrive on time they are clean and they even have the spots to stand on the platform AND the train actually stops in the right spot  And very cheap to use too

title: Good way to travel in Bangkok
review: Modern aircon trains with added stations (recently) to cover most of the thaÃ¯ capital Need to buy single tickets at each station (lw price) Downside often crowded with people need to stand and wear your backpack in front of you Check local station to see the latest opened stations and access to main tourist attractions (indications are usually good)

title: Excellent trip on the BTS that saves time and money!
review: Iâve always preferred to travel by skytrains in countries that have a great system with up to date networks that save a lot of time and money The BTS in Bangkok is just amazing and I had used it over 20 times during the 1 month I stayed in Bangkok as a tourist Definitely recommend it to everyone going to Bangkok

title: BTS skytrain
review: Amazing experience You will never get lost here as everyone speaks English Very inexpensive saves you time as during the day there is a terrible traffic on the highway

title: First class public transport in Bangkok
review: My wife and I are here for a short weekend vacation via BKK airport and staying at Asia Hotel Plan to visit the usual tourist landmarks (not the temples and palaces though because we have plenty of that in Malaysia too ð) So we know that Bangkok's traffic is the worst in the world we opt to use BTS here We bought a Rabbit Card (prepaid card that can be reloaded) through Klook Costs us 200 baht We used it to go around Bangkok All main shopping mall has its own stop As for Chatuchak Weekwnd Market we can go off at Mo Chit and it's just a short walk And we also use BTS to go to Asiatique Riverfront Just take the south line BTS from Siam or National Stadium to S6 Saphan Taksin And there will be a free Asiatique shuttle ferry there (the clearly marked red long boat) For Sukhumvit line all 5 first stops are at a shopping mall such as Siam Paragon Central World Nana Terminal 21 So expect a very large crowd on BTS To take ARL to the airport the interchange is at Phaya Thai stop

title: Clean, safe, predictable
review: It seems only has a relatively limited number of routes but they work very well One goes straight to the MBK department store best choice for food and gift bargains in bangkok bar none

title: The best Way to go in town!
review: The best public Transport to go in townYou can reach to the center in 20 minuteBut it is very busy and  full in rush hour

title: Good
review: Easy convenient cool good temperature clean punctual new smart elevator connecting to all part of bkk

title: easy to use
review: easy to use not expensive Cuts the traffic jams Air conditioned Should have more lines for better coverage

title: Overpriced and over crowded
review: Very busy and a little expensive With little info on where to go once you arrive at a stop The staff were blunt and not friendly at all

title: Easy and quick
review: Skytrain is the quickest cheapest and easiest way to travel in the center Just remember to check which line and right direction

title: Very easy to use.
review: We travelled from Phuket to Bangkok and used this service to Nana where our hotel was We were BTS virgins and had 3 suitcases It was rush hour and busy but we still managed to get on board without any hassle

title: Fast and cheap
review: Although the track is limited I understand that they are planning to expand It is very fast cheap and easy to get around The staff are helpful if you donât speak the language Security is high but that is to be expected A rabbit card will get you on the bus or sky train Load the card then keep travelling

title: Amazing,fast and reasonable.
review: We bought "rabbit"card from the Bts ticket office and loaded an additional 100 bahts for the usage of the sky train (normal cost per station approximately 19 bahtsThe bts is very user friendlyit literally shows you where you are and what is the next stationFor example if you are in Nana station in Sukhumvit then it will be E3 and one can basically see which station to drop off or get one via the Bts mapHighly recommended especially because of the bangkok traffic and also it is airconditionedThe ticket sellers are generally quite proficient in english

title: recommend traveling by BTS
review: The biggest difficulty in Bangkok is traffic jam If you don't have time I recommend traveling by BTS The price is higher than the bus but it is quite convenient to go to the center of city

title: Clean cheap and efficient
review: Biggest plus point is you beat the traffic This alone is incentive for me to take the skytrian on my every visit to Bangkok Add to the fact that if you travelling alone or as a couple its an cheaper option too  If there are more of you then i guess you split the cab fare and that works out well too for a local twist you can  try the Tuk Tuk as well Other than the distance to and from the station I see no reason why not to travel by the sky train

title: Excellent, easy and convenient way to travel
review: The sky train is a great way to get around Bangkok and avoid being stuck in horrible traffic jams The train system is very easy to figure out If you are going to be in Bangkok for several days recommend buying a rabbit at station and loading money on card so you donât have to go to kiosk every time you get on sky train You will need to have passport to purchase card this is new for security purposes Highly recommend moving around Bangkok this way

title: Another choice of travel mode in Bangkok
review: The lines are now expanding and cover more of outer Bangkok So it's quite a good choice to travel in Bangkok Avoid the rush hours and you will find it a very convenient way to travel

title: Simple to use
review: Although you can buy tickets from a machine you can also get them easily from the kiosk Maps are simple to follow Very crowded but organised

title: BTS Sky Train
review: The proximity to our hotel was perfect  Use of the skytrain to get around is a must  So easy and fast

title: Perfect
review: Perfect to hop around Use a smartphone with a local sim card and you can go wherever you want in Bangkok Also good for going from and to the airport

title: Easy to work out
review: Once I got the hang of this good train system I was sorted travelling around Just walk up to the window and tell them what stop you are going to and get a one way ticket Normally the train was squishy so be prepared to get close to people

title: Gets you there faster
review: Sky train in BKK is a good option as traffics are so bad in BKK  Rush hour on the train is packed so be aware and ready to be a sardine

title: Cheap and it beats the traffic
review: If you need to get through the main touristy areas of Bangkok then BTS is the way to travel It does get very crowded but it's fully air conditioned to escape the heat Always carry coins as the ticket machines aren't fully updated to accept notes at all stations

title: Quick and easy way to get around Bangkok
review: Trying to get around on the roads of Bangkok particularly at rush hour is a serious challenge so the sky train is a great option  Just 2 lines so very easy compared to some cities' systems it is really well airconditioned so even when packed it can be more pleasant than being out on the street

title: Impressive system
review: I can only speak from our experience but we were very impressed with the sky train service It was clean and easy to navigate the lines being well signposted in both Thai and English

title: Very convenient way to get anywhere in Bangkok
review: Taxis are so cheap it sometimes isn't worth it in groups but super quick and easy easy to get round

title: Convenient to travel within Bangkok, but not for everywhere!
review: This train is above ground train system that is very convenient if you know where to go It stops at Siem Paragon which is the most popular shopping place in Bangkok But it has limited location The train and ride is similar however it is nothing like the subway system in Seoul Tokyo and Manhattan It has very limited locations compare to other big cities For city tour I would recommend Hop onoff tour

title: Super convenient way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is an excellent way of travelling in Bangkok Beats the roads any day Trains do get very crowded in peak hour though and suitcasesbig bags cant really be taken on board Trains come frequently and travel fast There are taxis and scooter taxis outside most stations Ticketing is easy and reasonable

title: Good value
review: Really efficient good priced service Does get really busy so be prepared to be standing Easy to use Staff are friendly and helpful

title: Save Your Time!
review: Best way to avoid traffic jam in Bangkok Easy finding station on the map Bought a BTS rabbit card 3 years ago still work Cashier were very friendly can speak English

title: Avoid jams
review: Take the BTS to avoid jam Easy and quick Need to purchase tix by queuing and queue may be long depending on timing   Please count your money before leaving the counter prices are stated on wall near the coin machine One of the ladies shortchanged me

title: Great system
review: The traffic in Bangkok is HORRIBLE so the sky train is a fantastic option Safe clean and inexpensive The routes are well marked and the air conditioning is great which is awesome on a hot day So much better than the NYC subway

title: Great and easy
review: Its is very easy to use the skytrain It easily gets you to places you wanna go Best way to travel is to get the rabbit card as it cuts down the need to have lots of coins to get single tickets

title: Very quick and easy
review: In Bangkok cheap quick easy way to travel and no Bangkok traffic you will get to where u need to go much quicker

title: Great transport service
review: Bangkokâs BTS system with access to the Metro and other public transportation systems is set up similar to European and Japan style system They have kiosk in English as well as attendant stations The staff was always helpful and go out of their way to help including a needed toilet access to the âstaffâ area when none was publicly available for this desperate âtouristâ Service windows are always available but bring coins if you want to use the self service kiosks

title: A great way to get around
review: The BTS is fast efficient and airconditioned Tickets are easily purchased at the counters and platforms are clearly signposted

title: Great transport
review: Finally can travel with their transport top up card (Rabbit card)  Grab 1 to move with ease & convenience

title: Holiday
review: Amazing It's a must when you are in Bangkok cause taxi take too long time from A to B And its cheap also

title: Easy to use and CHEAP!
review: Forget getting overpriced tuktuk or a taxi that just sits in traffic jump on the sky train and youâll be on the other side of town in minutes  We used it for 3 days solid while we were there on our short break in Bangkok  staff all there to help you people on board were friendly to us foreigners and we wizzed from place to place with ease  Great experience can get quite busy but thatâs part of being in a bit city

title: Easy to take and clean
review: Cheap clean and easy to take  Nothing to add except they do not provide map and ticket should be thow when you leave the metro

title: Clean and safe
review: If you want to move in bangkook use bts It is very saftey Very clean You fill very comfortit with air condition that mostly needed in bangkook Take hotel near bts it's very important

title: sky train
review: amazing experience clean effeicient self explnatory no loss of time as compared to road traffic no pollution no pushing when entering or exiting

title: Best Transportation in Bangkok
review: During our visit in Bangkok BTS Skytrain was our primary transportation to explore the city It's very comfortable clean fast and efficient Definetely the best transportation in Bangkok

title: Use the sky train in Bangkok.
review: It is convenient and cheap A day ticket valid till midnight at 140 Bahts lets one go from any point to just any station One is literally on the go We found one train a bit crowded The next train was just a few minutes away

title: So simple to use as an English user
review: We was really worried about using the sky train as we cannot speak Thai at all But the ticket machines allows you to press âEnglishâ and then they are so simple from there Once on the platforms everything you need is in English and once on the train itâs written in English and spoken in English too so there is no need to worry We tried Taxiâs a few times at all times of the day Whilst theyâre cheap this is cheaper and SO much cheaper and I would use every time

title: Convenience
review: I like to travel around with Thailand BTS train with good and strong air conditioning security was good they often check our bags and watch out passenger not to close to the access train door Good management when queuing up to enter the train not like some country ððð Price was reasonable and train arrived punctuality

title: BEST way to get around the city
review: The BTS skytrain is without question the best way to get around the city Fares are incredibly cheap the trains run frequently are clean and have nice cold air conditioned train cars Signage and announcements are in English which is an added plus Skip the taxis buses or Grab drivers and be sure to take the BTS Skytrain

title: A good way of getting about
review: This is an excellent service at a reasonable price Trains run very regularly and are clean Safety precautions on the platforms are good My only complaint would be about the steepness of the steps leading up to the station You almost need to be an alpine climber

title: Best way of travelling
review: I was based less than 10 mins walk from Asok and as a newbie in Bangkok found it the best way for getting around and to the places I wanted to be just be aware that it very very busy especially at peak times you think London Underground is busy well you ainât seen nothing yet but itâs cheap clean and air conditioned your not going to get ripped off by an unscrupulous tuk tuk or taxi driver either

title: EXCELLENT CONNECTIVITY
review: 1 Day pass is excellent explore each stations nearby attractions unlimited journies but a group of 4 may save more if travel by taxi depends on how many trips one takes within the validity of pass start early as its valid till midnight

title: Stops running early
review: Felt safe riding the train the maps are pretty intuitive the routes are easy to follow and there are enough stations around the city The only issue I had is I thin it stops running quite early  It should run until at least 4am (or 24 hours in a perfect world)

title: tourist ease
review: operates within the major tourist areas train is best option since bangkok traffic is awful with air pollution choking and sickening

title: Business
review: The best way to move around Bangkok with their crazy traffic here  Love it and very safe too you can buy 1 day pass

title: Convenient way to move around the city
review: Bangkokâs city traffic is extremely congested Itâs much easier to move around with BTS A 140 baht day pass offers unlimited rides We enjoyed it very much

title: Sky train
review: Easy to use cheap fast crowded Excellent  Rather than fight with the traffic I tentatively tried the sky train the ticket staff speak English and are only too happy to give instructions as to which train to catch and in what directionBeing a mature aged female I found it easy to use and wouldn't hesitate to recommend anyone to use it

title: Wow- cheap!
review: I was staying at the Novotel airport in Bangkok and didn't realise until the second day of my 3 day stay how easy and cheap this ride is I paid too much money for a taxi into the city but on the way back even though it was rush hour it only cost $3 Admittedly I had to stand the whole way as we were crammed in But the train is airconditioned and very smooth and very very cheap

title: Mass transit systems for Bangkok and suburbs, and will continue to be used for a long time.
review: Bangkok Mass Transit SystemBangkok Mass Transit System Public Company Limited Paholyothin road Jatujak Bangkok  Mass transit has become a vital part of Thailandâs public transportation nowadays especially in Bangkok the metropolitan area   Having had an opportunity to visit the headquarters of Bangkok Mass Transit System Public Company Limited or commonly known as BTS on Paholyothin road   Being taken a good care from Mr Nattachai Pradermchit Station services manager at the station who said itâs a policy that comes directly from board of directors to consider giving a priority for passengers to become comfortable and safe when taking BTS The main goal is trying not to stop improving services for customers in all aspects   All credits go to Mister Keeree Kanjanapas  (Executive Chairman) Mister Surapong Laohaunya (CEO) Mister Sumit Srisuntithum (COO) who give guideline of operation as a work plan for staffs and officers to treat customers at the top level as if they are their family members by giving love care and respect to each other  BTS or skytrain is becoming a major route in metropolitan area and vicinity The number of passengers are increasing higher each day When the technical difficulty occurs during the operation there are technicians and well trained staffs who stand by on duty at every station to make sure everything will be solved promptly There are administrators who have been working on promoting public relations for the society in various form of activities  Importantly to all staff units who have got an assignment to do their jobs at each station Whether it be supervisors receptionists drivers janitors security guards etc They are all work as a unity in order to keep the passengers to be satisfying and sustain a prominence for the organization

title: Reliable and cheap
review: BTS sky train is amazing You never have to wait long for a train to arrive The trains can be crowded but it adds to the travel experience

title: Busy crowded but convivial
review: Enjoyed travelling through Bangkok by sky train Easy to use & clearly labelled Tight squeeze but everyone happy to budge up Very orderly organisation of getting on and off

title: Vacation to Bangkok
review: Great for travelling around Bangkok But the entry to the train is really congested Ought to reorgn the entry point accordingly ahead to improve the efficiency Can do better

title: Captain
review: The BTS skytrain is clean air conditioned and timely Easy to use with service booths easy to understand maps and helpful staff

title: Really the way to beat traffic congestion
review: BTS and the companion underground MRT have been terrific additions to Bangkok  They have expanded to enable travel to nearly every part of the city  fast easy and inexpensive  Most points of interest are easily walkable from one of these systems (they interchange at several points however fare cards are NOT interchangeable  Both systems have been greatly expanded and the construction outwards continues  This is good because more places are accessible but bad because passenger use is way up making trains crowded most of the time  Pros include fast frequent service low cost predictable transportation clean always most places within direct reach or a short cab ride from a station and most stations have escalators or lifts to mount the 45 stair (within a stair or two) height (or depth for MRT) if you are disabled or getting older like me  Cons are often crowded no restrooms limited seating not much directional assistance   I strongly suggest that visitors utilize the system BUT study a system map carefully before traveling  Purchase a multiuse ticket  I get a 500 baht Rabbit card (the card costs 100 (about $3 US) and the other 400 is on the card for fares  This eliminates the confusion and often long waits at ticket machines at which foreigners tend to stand and gawk  The entry gates scan the Rabbit card and display how much fare is remaining  For longer rides like to Suvernabumi Airport remember to go potty before riding  Fast air conditioned and clean  Stand near an exit so you can read the station indicator (in Thai and English) because until you get used to Thai pronunciation you wonât recognize all of the spoken station names

title: Quick and easy way of getting around town
review: Day Pass is the way to go if you are planning to visit multiple places  Pass expires at midnight so plan accordingly  Stations are well organized  Trains could get really packed during commute hours

title: Great Service
review: The BTS Skytrain is a pure blessing The price is very reasonable and the service timings etc are great  I would suggest using this service rather than cabs due to the heat and traffic

title: Nice quick subway through the middle of the city
review: Nice subway that is easy to manuever and find your way Not expensive Best bet if your in city for a few days is to buy a multitrip pass called a Rabbit card Then you can come and go without having to figure out fares each time Bring a copy of your passport or Thai ID card to purchase though Goes through the heart of downtown and connects to the Railway MRT line as to expand your area of travel with dealing with the traffic Trains run about every 10 to 15 min like clockwork

title: Easy to use
review: We use this to travel across Bangkok The tickets were very easy to buy and the staff spoke very good English and made sure that we knew which stop we were getting off at Very easy to use Would thoroughly recommend

title: Excellent Service
review: Excellent Service bts trains come every 10 mins perfect way to get around also beats the Bangkok traffic It can get crowded during peak hour but with trains 10 mins apart its efficient

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Great for those travelling to and fro to their destination Efficient and reliable Nevertheless good to have grab app to compliment it

title: Bangkok Transport
review: Greta way to get around Bangkok Ticketing signage and staff all have English One Day and Rabbit top up passes available from station ticket booths

title: Avoid traffic , save time
review: Best way to get around town (also the MRT) Saves me time getting around in time (And you even get a short âcool downâ)

title: convenient travel around Silom and Sukhumvit
review: Busy but easy to get around avoid morning and evening rush hour But great sights on train hardly ever a seat available

title: Easy to use and cheap
review: Easy to use English language is available on the automated machines and routes are easily understood

title: Handy
review: A very practical and inexpensive way to get around Probably better for people who are happy to walk a bit as sky train not as big a network as uk underground

title: Convenient and accessible public transports
review: BTS is common public transports for locals and tourists to access most of the spotting areas and CBD However it is now a bit over crowded at most of the time simply because it is comfortable with air conditioning and reasonable charged for tourists

title: Shopping in Bangkok
review: Using the BTS Skytrain I was easily able to get around to all the places I needed to get to I visited first MBK  Used the BTS line that headed for the National Stadium Got me there quick instead of taking a taxi because of all the traffic they run into Next went to the Siam station on the BTS It was the next stop down from MBK Stopping here allowed me access to Siam Discovery Siam Paragaon and Central World I had to walk around to get to all those but they were all very close to one another I walked back to the Siam BTS and took another BTS to Asok I stopped there to shop at Terminal 21 All this traveling for shopping was made easy by using the BTS I saved on alot of money spent on cabs Price on average for traveling all I would say is about 100 baht

title: Excellent transportation
review: The BTS transportation in bangkok is very convenient and the price is  affordable  I use this transportation every day to reach my office daily and avoid the traffic jam

title: One of the most efficient methods of transportation along Sukhimvit.
review: You'll save time and money opting for the Skytrain vs TaxiTukTuk Once you get used to the stops it's quite convenient

title: Holiday
review: Did the job for me perfectly got me to where I wanted to go well Easy to get to simple and simple getting tickets

title: no review
review: I did not have the opportunity to use this public transportation system thus i have no comments While I was in Bangkok i mainly used the service of the famous TukTuk

title: Sometimes Frustrating,  But Essential to Moving around Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain was operating on a fairly reliable basis when using AIS monitoring network but experienced a serious downturn when DTAC took over monitoring   Long delays and bunching of trains seemed to be the norm rather than the exception  DTAC's performance has been inconsistent since taking over  Hopefully DTAC's performance will have improved by the next time I visit Bangkok since getting around Bangkok in a timely fashion is dependent on a smoothly operating high volume mass transit system that BTS should be the leader of

title: Get a Rabbit card so you don't have to queue
review: Airconditioned travelling comfort not many seats so you usually have to stand Get yourself a Rabbit card best decision we made avoid the really long lines at the ticket countersmachines then you just need to tap and you're through Easy to get around maps at every station We used BTS a lot during our 8 days in Bangkok

title: Bangkok BTS
review: An excellent service punctual clean and good VFM If you plan to use it regularly then buy a prepaid card but note the cards are not interchangeable with MRT or Airport Link The alternative is to have some small change and use the ticket machines which have an English language option and are easy to navigate

title: The best way to go
review: Bangkok's Skytrain is the best and haddlefree way to get around this fascinating city  especially if you avoid peak traffic It also helps in getting familiar with the city

title: Easy and Air Conditioned
review: Bangkok is hot and humid  The Skytrain is efficient fairly easy to navigate and provides a nice airconditioned break in the day

title: Very efficient however expensive
review: BTS is clean fast and convenient however expensive compared to the cost of life in Bangkok It is nevertheless a cheaper option for airport transfer Among other trips I used BTS for a transfer from Asoke BTS station to Don Muang airport Coupled with A1 bus from Mo Chit to the airport at 30 bahts the whole transfer amounted to 74 bahts for a 45minute trip

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: This is definitely the best mode of transport in Bangkok Easy convenient and fast Get a Rabbit card from the ticket office but take your passport to register the card

title: Fast and furious mass transportation
review: We rode the BTS several times  Smooth and fast  Sometimes even late at night the BTS would be PACKED  We had to let 2 or 3 trains pass sometimes to find one with space  The trains aren't more than a few minutes apart (at least at peak time) so it was no biggie  The prices seem very reasonable especially considering how fast you get where you're going compared to just about every other form of available transportation  The BTS is also a great way to sightsee and maybe get a glimpse of something you didn't know was there

title: Nice
review: Very convenient n nice We covered a distance of 42kms in 55 min n ultimately we were near airport Easy to use ticket vending machine

title: Fast, but often crowded
review: The Skytrain is the best way to maneuver around Bangkok However the trains are often very crowded even on the weekends But after being stuck in a cab in traffic Iâll take the Skytrain for now on

title: Whoosh!
review: Yeah travel by skytrain is a breeze itâs whoosh and in no time youre across Bangkok leaving all the traffic behind you so easy to use and the cheapest way to get aroundgo for it

title: excellent transportation
review: We used the BTS to move around in the city and also the walking bridge to move around very comfortable service

title: Breather of Life for Bangkok's choked avenues
review: A superbly planned network of stations and modestly prices is most ideal for the backpacking tourist solo business traveller or young couples travelling on a budget The daily pass for THB 140 can also be bought (not worth if you are using the Sky train for short distances for just a couple of times a day)

title: Bangkok sky train
review: Best way to get around bangkok easy to use with a sky train ticket all you need to do ist top it up no waiting in line to get a ticket

title: Avoiding Rush Hours
review: BTS at the rush hours is really bad Just not only long queue to change coins or buy tickets but often wait for a luck to put myself in train

title: Sensational
review: This system is easy to obtain a ticket clean and cheap If only all mass transit systems were this good

title: trvel by skytrain
review: very clean on time airconditioned only problem carriages were quite full but you get that in every city now

title: Very easy to use, helpful attendants, great service
review: We used this service to go from the river to MBK shopping centre  The attendants were very patient and extremely helpful in giving us information about the stop we needed to use and also provided us with a little map to use if we needed to go anywhere else  A great way to get amongst the general population of the city

title: "Must do" activity
review: It's packed it's smelly but it's a unique experience  The traffic on Sukhumvit is pretty much stationary so the skytrain will get you where you need to go  It's easy to figure out the tickets which are pretty cheap  Try it just for grins

title: Crowded by reliable
review: This is really the best way to get around the congested city The lines have been extended over the years so more people are using it That makes it very crowded We had to wait for a second train several times just to get on However it beats sitting in traffic for hours We found the day pass useful (140 baht) as you can by pass the lines to buy tickets each trip

title: Like tuna in a can
review: It appears that the BTS management are not aware of how many passengers use the train these days There are either too few or too short trains in operation and the passengers FIGHT to get on board  only to stand like a can of tuna during the short or long trip I recommend management take a trip

title: Getaway
review: BTS Skytrain station is in front of the Mercure Siam Hotel is where I stay during my visit to Bangkok It is the last station National Stadium It takes you to most fascinated places and also the interchange for the MRT Station to other places as well Very convenient and easy travelling and not expensive

title: Transportation
review: Very easy and efficient  way to get around and to orientate yourself to the Bangkok area reaches most areas

title: Handy Transport
review: Skytrain is a handy and affordable way to get around the city Train cars and station areas are clean and safe Single ride tickets are purchased from machines or from attended booths All day tickets are available for 140b a reasonable deal if you plan multiple stops My only complaint other than the fact that cars can get very crowded at peak hours is that sky train and subway are not affiliated and a daily excursion often requires you to transfer from one system to the other Most big cities I've visited offer transit passes which are valid for any bus train boat etc

title: Very convenient and affordable.
review: All tourist should utilize BTS to go by simply anywhere in Bangkok Make sure to plan your trip and do a bit of research on the stations and route You can rely on BTS even during busy hour

title: Best way to get around

title: Efficient and cool
review: Great way to get into downtown  Rise above the traffic congestion and glide to destination in AC comfort

title: Avoid the traffic
review: Amazing rail system We liked the fact that we didnât wait more than 5 mins for a train in all the trips we had Easily accessible smooth and comfy Way too much traffic in Bangkok Skytrain a Godâs send

title: Easy to use.
review: Escalators take you up to the stations polite staff that speak English and can direct the fastest and cheapest ways of getting around I bought a day travel card for 140 Baht which got me all over the city  Trains can be quite cramped at peak times and there is usually a 5 minute wait between trains But all airconditioned and clean

title: Around trip
review: We bought a tourist day pass for 140 baht For the first time we just stayed on the line to the end E23 to get our bearings  Use it also as a great viewing pointðto over look the city  Train stops in the city have major shopping mall A easier way to visit the mall and cheaperfaster than road transport The staff are very helpful â¿ï¸ access very good at the stations

title: BTS Train
review: Helpful customer service when purchasing ticket and even though there was a language barrier we were able to understand which train to catch  Train came on time and each stop is communicated before hand  Information on train is also well displayed and easy to follow The trains are spacious and clean and there is designated seats for mother&child which passengers observe I was impresssed when exiting train that the passengers coming on formed two lines on either side of doors leaving the middle free for passengers to exit  after the last passenger got off the train the boarding passengers got on  Trains run up to midnight so we could have a whole day out

title: So easy to get around
review: Our family of 2 adults and 2 kids 15 amd 13 years found the Skytrain super convenient and easy to use  The staff there are helpful and happy to answer any query Highly recommend using the Skytrain

title: Excellent: Clean, Air-Conditioned, Easy and Convenient
review: Bangkok's BTS Skytrain is a convenient fast and easy way to get around Bangkok   We were lucky enough to stay at a hotel that was a 5min walk to the station (4mins of that in airconditioning)  BTS Skytrains are airconditioned easy to understand the routes fast and on time mode of transport to get us where we wanted  needed to be  Often we would get off the Skytrain and look down (from the walkways) to the traffic beneath us and were grateful not to be stuck in it   We utilised the BTS Skytrain 50% of the time we were in Bangkok and will use it again on our next visit  I think it really depends on where you're staying during your stay as it could be a make or break decision on it's suitability  I should also mention that it was very cheap  An all day pass (Expiring midnight) to all the zones costs 140baht (approx $650 AUD)

title: Clean, quick and cheap
review: Easy to use airconditioned and get to lots of places quickly  Always use it were possible because it is much quicker than getting cabsubers etc

title: A Strong rail line that helps you to avoid city traffic

title: Very convenient

title: Very easy to navigate!

title: Reliable way of traveling in Bangkok
review: The BTS sky train is a reliable way of traveling in Bangkok It departs every 6 minutes so you donât have to wait long But it can be very crowded

title: Easy to get around
review: Very easy to use (experienced London traveller) and affordable a great way to see the city too Use this type of transport when going to visit the temples and stop off at the river to take a boat ride for the rest of the journey No food or water allowed whilst travelling

title: Easy

title: Easy
review: Great way to travel to get from a to b and fairly cheaphad to ask advice on where to get off as our knowledge of Bangkok is limited

title: Great Public Transportation!
review: They have a lot of vehicles so even if the train already leaving when you just arrived at the platform you dont have to wait longer for the next train Their vending machine also easy to use If only they have a wide access to the whole Bangkok it will be great

title: Easy to use and always cool!!
review: It was my second time in Bangkok and I canât recommend the Skytrain enough I wouldnât bother trying to fathom out the automated ticket machines as you will probably create a queue behind you whilst you try to figue out the instructions but more importantly you have to use only coins This is daft because you hardly ever get any as most change is always notes Anyway just go straight to the maned kiosk at every station and get the tickets from there then you donât need to worry about having the right change  There are currently two types of ticket machines one you tap like the UK oyster machines and the other you just feed your ticket in

title: Very convenient

title: Comfortable Transportation

title: Saves time

title: Very easy to use and good value

title: Excellent connectivity to the main heart of the city

title: BTS Transport

title: Convenient and Clean if not a little overcrowded
review: Used the BST Skytrain a few times whilst in Bangkok Train is easy to use people in the ticket counters are helpful and travelling by train much more convenient than mixing it with the traffic below

title: major time and money saving
review: clean time and money saving this is the only way of transportation in Bangkok in my opinion as soon as you learn the map which is not hard at all  is the only transportation you should take the staff is so friendly and even with their little English everyone will help you

title: Super!
review: The quickest way to get around Bangkok Prices are good Carriages clean and well air conditioned Very busy at times but part of the Bangkok experience

title: Easy

title: Escalator
review: I notice some of the train station escalator only at one side most people use the staircase for rush hour  Place can be improve from good to better  Overall very convenient will visit BKK and take train again

title: BTS Trains are clean & efficient
review: I have ridden on many mass transit systems throughout the United States Including Seattle San Francisco San Diego San Jose Portland Oregon Washington DC and Boston Mass Internationally I have ridden the Paris Metro and the Lille France system  That said I have experienced the highs and the lows of riding the various systems  Overall I enjoy getting to know a city via the Mass Transit system   For the 6 days we stayed in Bangkok we utilized the BTS RAIL system on a daily basis  The system is well laid out  Of course everything is generally written in Thai but there are plenty of English references    Riding the Bangkok BTS is much like many of the modern transit systems of today  You buy a chip enabled transit card  You then add value to it  Trips are based on the distance you go    To use the system you put your card by the reader  The gate opens for you to enter  At your destination you tap your card (near the reader) to open the exit gate  BTS trains are very clean  No riff raff whatsoever on these trains  They are in excellent condition and it appears the stations are all kept immaculately clean As an added plus the security near the entrance is good    If you travel to Bangkok I highly recommend using the BTS system

title: Clean, fast and convenient

title: Best way to travel
review: I was in bkk for 10 days and probably used this a dozen times With the roads so congested I found them very clean easy to navigate reliable and certainly very cheap  They do cover quite a big area of bkk so Iâm sure youâll see one near your hotel And yes  they do cover most of the âmust seeâ areas

title: Convenience to go around the city
review: Worth it if you are going solo or 2 personsBTS is now covering more and more    but if you are going 3 or 4 taxi may worth it

title: Great service
review: The Day pass worked best for us for multiple trips in the day It is clean and can get crowded too during business hours

title: best way to get around - off hours
review: i don't think there is really an "offhours" time in bangkok anymore but the bts is really the only way to go  reasonably priced kinda fun and it puts you in places that would take hours to get to using a taxi or car  what's not to like

title: Good Value
review: Great service for getting around Bangkok and one day it will even be better when it gets closer to the palace Clean airconditioned and very frequent purchase the daily tourist pass great value

title: Beat the Bangkok Traffic with a Sy Ride
review: We had a week of emerging into the madness of the Bangkok traffic Turks motor bikes buses cars taxis wall to wall One day we planned to make good our escape and reach for the sky The BTS Skytrain is accessed from stairways and escalators at stations on thr route but a good starting off point is BMK department Store in the centre of town and the station is named Stadium from which you can actually see into the National Stadium The Station is well signposted but the staff are vigilant and very helpful and willing to assist you to the ticket office especially if you are standing out from the crowd as you tend to be as a tourist We went all the way to the end of the line where we were directed to alight and cross to the line on the other side all accessible with lifts escalators or stairs The return trip was comfortable air conditioned and the train filled up with people at each station The skytrain is clearly a great way to commute but is also a fun tourist activity to get away from the traffic and view Bangkok from an elevated viewpoint

title: Easy
review: Itâs super easy to take the sky train and totally comfortable The trains are air conditioned and very clean

title: Cheap and easy to use
review: Quick and easy to use A bargain at around US$1 per trip The maps are easy to read and the trains run at regular intervals Stops at many major sites such as Siam (aquarium) MBK mall and the weekend market

title: Its an excellent means of getting around

title: The most convenient travel in Suhkumvit

title: Easy getting around
review: BTS sky train is clean and easy to use can also use this to transfer to the metro It can also get to many of the street markets depending on your hotel location

title: Great way to get around
review: The BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok It's easy to follow the maps and find your way around There are transfers to different lines and at some point everything is spoken in English Great way to avoid traffic

title: Best thing to happen to commuting and traveling in BKK
review: I have visited BKK well before any thought of a skytrain came into anyone's mind Nightmare it was to try to get places Buses taxis and tuktuk It was chaos It still is but BTS is the piece of sanity that makes BKK travel tolerable and often times sane Most tourists can easily use it without much fuss although the ticket vending machines could be more logical and coin exchange machines need to be everywhere instead of making people line up at ONE office window to buy tickets when you have bills Make sure you have plenty of coins for single tickets or buy the passes (you pay for the initial card but can add money to it) Cannot imagine BKK without the Skytrain now It may seem cheap to use but if you are traveling to a place off the route with others consider a taxi as it could actually be cheaper after adding the fare for everyone in your party (cuz on top of the BTS fare you'll need to add a taxi amyway) All in all BTS is very useful

title: It is just hell here in rush hour
review: Thanks to Bangkok BTS I know now how the hell might look like I mean it's just awful The worst case scenario is if you need to go via Siam interchange station in the middle of the rush hour If you can avoid it just do it because it is simply a nightmare where vast crowds of people are waiting for the trains on a small platform and sometimes you need to wait for a second or third train to have a chance to get in Also you can pay for your ticket only in cash because of some stupid rule that the minimum price for purchasing with a credit card is 300 baths and the average ticket price is about 3040 which makes such a transaction nearly impossible This is just ridiculous We live in 21st century not 19th and such services are essential

title: Fast and frequent

title: quick and easy way to get around

title: Good food

title: easy to use

title: Efficient and inexpensive but can be horribly crowded
review: Having used the tube in London for manyears I am no stranger to crowded public transport and I accept it  rush hour metropolis what can you expect the ticket machine did offer English and was sort of user friendly  you will need a pocketful of coins to get a ticket and know that the ticket is good for one day only  we made the mistake of thinking we could get a few extra tickets while we had the momentum only to find them expired the next day Taxis were also a good option outside of rush hour We made the mistake of thinking the tuktuk would be cheaper but turned out to be very wrong on that  maybe got a ripoff tuk tuk driver But taxis air conditioned and safer so our next visit the choices will be Sky train or taxi for the places not reached by train service

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok
review: I have used the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok since my initial visit in 2000 and have utilised it as a means of moving around Bangkok on all my subsequent visits I have always chosen hotels in close proximity to the BTS lines to allow easy access It remains one of the cleanest cheapest (AUS$6 for a day ticket) and most efficient transport systems I have used anywhere in the world

title: Easy

title: Super Service

title: Fast, fun, and airy ride
review: Highly recommended for anyone interested in public transportation and trains The skytrain was clean airconditioned fast and offered an unbelievably smooth ride Bangkok is a large sprawling city and although it's not totally connected by this train it's a great way to experience the cityscape while in transit  In most stations you can get a haircut or a manicure before you head to your next destination I found this to be a bit curious but pretty convenient  One way tickets are cheap ticketing staff and security staff are friendly and informative   One downside is there are TVs on train playing ads and advertisements are plastered everywhere in the stations It's overwhelming for an otherwise pleasant overall experience
