review: Always reliable Always gets me to the important places in bangkok Quite happy that its affordable and well connected

title: Brilliant
review: Highly recommended for mode of travel around Bangkok Cheap way to travel and explore A brilliant experience

title: Convenient
review: BTS Skytrain is one of the fastest and economical ways to commute especially during the weekdays when the traffic is so much more Also for those staying at the Riverside this is an absolute resort

title: Thailand trip
review: Bangkok visit is incomplete without BTS travel It is lifeline of Bangkok Must visit to save time as well as money Very user friendly and economical

title: Efficient trains, ok price
review: Annoying that not all lines are on the same ticketing system Metro should be the same all over Prices are ok Creditcards should be used too swapping coins and standing in lines for this is not so good

title: Easy way to get around a crowded city
review: The BTS covers aside area including Charu Hak weekend market and the riverside area in Silom It is air conditioned and runs frequently It was surprisingly expensive compared to the ferry service costing 140 B for a day pass Just use the automatic machines

title: Fast travel in Bangkok. Skytrain
review: If you need to travel swiftly and easily in Bangkok use the BTS skytrain Ticketing is changing so go to ticket counter if unsure Now starting using wave cards instead of push through cards at some stations Don't worry help is at hand with friendly staff This is a great air conditioned way to travel Swift and easy through downtown Bangkok and extending every month it seems

title: Train ride in Bangkok
review: Stations and trains are so clean You get tv and music on the trains and air con Your not allowed to eat and drink on the trains either Itâs a cheap way to see Bangkokvery easy to navigate

title: Crowded but convenient
review: Took this then MRT to go to Chinatown  It was relatively cheap and easy to navigate  Machines and maps are in English  Only wish it had more lines and stops  There was no real direct way to get to Chinatown (even though it is a tourist destination) but I guess the system is not very old and more expansion is underway

title: No Eating or Drinking!
review: Find your seat and enjoy the ride  It gets hectic sometimes but you just go with the flow  The train is clean so take your trash with you

title: Very Efficient
review: Get a tourist pass if staying a while in Bangkok  The trains are super clean and more importantly the air conditioning works a treat

title: Convenient
review: Pros Convenient to most of the shopping malls Close to my hotel during my stay  Cons Yellow lights little dark

title: Wheelchair...
review: At the station metro  there is elevator but you must find the officer staf metro for use the elevator

title: Conveniently access most part of the city and cost effective!
review: It's absolutely great to commute in BTS to travel around the city Construction is in progress to extend the existing BTS lines Very much looking forward to it Just be prepared for peak hours especially on a rainy day

title: Excellent quick quality travel to avoid city traffic
review: We traveled a short distance for fun It was quick and good value for money Best option to avoid City traffic and a group of 23 people It becomes more expensive for more than 4 ppl

title: great way to travel
review: a good way to travel around bangkok to avoid all the busy roads and very cheap to uswill use this rail link on our next visit to bangkok

title: Connected to most of the main shopping mall in Bangkok
review: If your trip need to spend more than 9 times of BTS train highly recommend daily pass with price 140B Is unlimited until midnight 12am per day You can safe a lot queuing time

title: Why would you not take it?
review: Relax in the aircon and avoid traffic A smooth stressfree experience (especially outside of rush hour times) It might not get you everywhere you want to go but it will at least get you to a reasonable jumpoff point for a cab or bus Give it a try You won't regret it

title: super convenient
review: I used this system for about a month while in bkk for business trip I traveled using a pass valid for 40 rides and costs about 1100 THB Great way to go around the city

title: So easy
review: The BTS Sky Train is simple to use efficient convenient and cheap Signs and announcements on trains are in English (as well as Thai of course) The BTS joins all the major areas and also links with the Metro The carriages are sit condition but not the stations Staff are extremely helpful

title: Easy
review: Very efficient and easy to use best way to get around Bangkok  Takes about 5 mins to work it out only cost about 50 baht

title: Excellent train
review: Clean reliable fast and with excellent air conditioning Easy to use and cheap compared to transportation in Europe However this is expensive if you compare it to the price of trains in Thailand

title: Efficient way to travel
review: Prompt very cool airconditioning easy to navigate Friendly staff with someone there to guide people along and it has to be one of the cleanest and calmest public transport there is in the world even on rush hour   Booking a hotel at walking distance to a BTS station is A MUST You can even get to the airport by connecting to the airlink train   They are adding more lines and stations and so hopefully next time we go it will even be more awesome

title: Whizzing around Bangkok
review: This is the second time I have visited Bangkok in two years and on each occasion I used the BTS a very handy 5 minutes' walk away from my B&B in Krung Thon Buri My Thai is just about nonexistent but with a handful of coins the BTS is cheap and easy to use With a big note (the machines only take coins) you'll need to go to the ticket office where the staff are easy to understand and efficient Go to the ticket machines select your destination (the numbers that mark the stations represent the fares in baht from where you are (about THB16 for one or two stops)  It was always busy but for those used to travelling on the London Underground this is remarkably similar  except that it's overground on a raised track The stations are light airy and very clean and during the day the ones that I saw were quite quiet  but wait until rush hour and the stairs become a torrent of people Happy travelling

title: Fast and efficient
review: Easy to use rail service Fast and efficient Ticket machines and directions in English too Very clean with good air conditioning

title: Easy, cheap, fast
review: Great way to get around some crowds but not as busy as New York subway system  Safe and ontime for the most part only issue is knowing the direction you want to go

title: SHAMOZZLE
review: It's relatively small overcrowded in theory a great way to get about  until you meet the lack of logic in ticketing Maybe it's my lack of experience on BTS but i'm a regular commuter on several Asian cities public transport  HK Taipei Kaohsiung thrash this hands down Queue for ticket machine arrive after 5 mins machine doesn't take notes  you need a huge pocket of change Have to go back to different window and queue 3 mins for change then join the ticket machine queue again ( Avoid peak hour  Bangkok commuters are tired and irritable and i can see why

title: Easy to use
review: On time efficient and easy to use Highly recommended Easy way around Bangkok Best to choose accommodation close to this system

title: Efficient, neat and affordable
review: The title says it all The BTS service is efficient the trains and stations are neat and it's extremely efficient At most places the popular attractions are linked to the BTS like Centara MBK etc  The only problem is it doesn't cover all of the city but still cover most of the places you will visit as a tourist (excluding Muay Thai statiums)

title: Best way to get around the city
review: So easy and inexpensive to travel above the traffic in airconditioned comfort Our riverside hotel had a shuttle boat right to the Skytrain

title: So convenient
review: Most preferred way to travel in Bangkok and well connected Super way to beat the horrific traffic snarls at times

title: Great option
review: This is a great way to get around the city  So easy fast and frequent  We use BTS whenever we can  Just don't go at rush hour

title: An easy way to get around!
review: Clean and inexpensive  We loved incorporating the skytrain into our travels instead of always using taxis  Ticket machines have an English option and single use tokens are easy to purchase from the touch screen

title: Super easy
review: The BTS sky train is Very convenient and easy to use In rush hour it may be overpasked  and you may not be able to get in the first train This is still better than being stuck in traffic

title: Perfect way to beat bangkok traffic
review: This is by far the perfect way to beat bangkok traffic It's effective efficient reasonably priced and air conditioned to save you from the heat Some call it the life line of bangkok and rightly so But the best part is that the bts is best for point to point travels in Bangkok

title: Totally amazing
review: The only way to travel Cheap easy and always on time It may take a few minutes to get a feel for it But well worth the investment A great way to get around Bangkok and if you get confused there is always someone who will give you advice nearby

title: BTS Train Bangkok
review: Great way to get around Bangkok  very easy to use You can either purchase ticket from window or use the machines around which takes coins  My only wish is that they upgrade their system like Hong Kong where they use the octopus cardThis system is fast and efficient and would make it alot easier for tourist and locals to travel to destination rather than queue for service

title: A freezer
review: Always too cold very dangerous A great way to move fast in the city there are many train passing veey often

title: A good travel option
review: BTS is a very convenient option in the city There are some lines and the main ones croos the city with stations near the main attractions

title: Limited escalator or elevator
review: I see many tourists lugging luggage down the staircase Other than lack of escalator and elevator the train service is good People riding the train have great train etiquette queueing up to get into the train carriages

title: So easy
review: We got the train from the airport down to Krung Thon Buri which involved two changes we found the experience pleasant and straightforward   The carriages are extremely clean and getting on and off is a breeze even with suitcases

title: Getting around in Bangkok
review: I live and work in Bangkok and use the BTS on a frwquent basis Coming from a small town in England and having lived several years in Jakarta I love the BTS it is clean and it is quick and efficient

title: Easy commute
review: The BTS is very efficient and clean easy to use and of course friendly staff Itâs possible to buy a Rabbit card with stored value similar to HK octopus card and the London Oyster card credit can also be used to shop at convenience stores such as 711 Although their is still quite a large are of the City not covered itâs convenient and fast to get to most spots

title: Excellent
review: Perfect way of transportation easy to get almost everywhere and cheap as well between 66 and 88 Thai bath single journey

title: easy travel in Bangkok
review: easy to use once you figure the ticketing systembut simple once you dowonderful fast air conefficienthighly recommended outside rush hours

title: Excellent
review: User friendly Efficient clean and well serviced It connects most of Bangkok Stations are close apart enough to get to mist attractions without walking too far Well done

title: Get very crowded
review: It is a very reasonable price and does save you a good few hundred baht if solo However do consider if there are a view of you by the time you pay the fare and add a taxi from the station to the hotel it may be easier and nearly as cheap to get a metred taxi from the airport  I arrived from a short domestic hop but if I was arriving of a Lang haul flight from Europe or oz I would have found it so crowded and over whelming  You have been warned However outside peak travel times you should be fine  Plenty of taxi when you arrive down town make sure they use the metre

title: Very convenient
review: We used the BTS to go most places as it is very convenient and you're able to avoid the traffic It is also very cheap to use as well  Would recommend you find a hotel nearby a BTS station

title: Clean and very efficent
review: The best way to travel round Bangkok clean efficient and inexpensive Avoid rush hour times can get busy to say the least Beats taking a taxi and sitting in traffic jams

title: Easy
review: Way to get about in city  Get a day pass  140 BHT go to river for tourist boat 180Bht hop on  hop off all day

title: conveniences
review: BTS  is well formed skytrain system It connects most of the popular tourist sightseeing pointsExits were connected with shopping malls by footbridges

title: Quick and Easy
review: Pretty easy staff really pleasant Does get a bit crowded at peak times but pretty cheap Easy to get the right train

title: Full but fast
review: Good for a quick transfer through the city Nice view over the city As it is an experience you should at least use it once while being in Bangkok

title: It just takes time
review: In all the videos they make the BTS sound very easy It's not that hard to get around in Bangkok but it just takes time

title: Best way to travel in busy Bangkok
review: We have been coming to Bangkok for a number of years and the BTS is the best way to travel I see some reviews say there isn't enough stops in other areasmate what a complaint All you have to do is go to your nearest area then catch a tuk tuk In past years we have just put coins into a machine then punched what area we want to travel to This can be a headache especially when its busy Being a family of 5 we found it easier (especially if your staying for a week or longer to purchase a rabbit card from the ticket office Check on google what their promotion for the month is We paid 1000 baht and got two adult cards and 3 child cards and it has given us 15 trips each card Its easier to use just swipe at the starting station then swipe again at the destination station You top the card up when needed We keep our card to use next time we visit Bangkok It can get busy but thats life My kids enjoy the experience Our hotel was close to the BTS making travel easy Its totally safe too Hope this helps

title: Disappointed
review: It cover only small area in Bangkok And they need to increase the number of train But it's still the best way to travel in Bangkok

title: Good method to Travel at Bangkok
review: It is safe you must go through the metal detectors and let you beg be inspected if needed there will be many people thus be mindful of your surrounding A lot of places of interest that you can go to via the train you can refer to the peak and normal times for frequency of train (13 minutes) The train is quite small and packed

title: BTS Skytrain
review: I lived in Thailand for 5 years and found that the BTS was definitely quick efficient and easy for getting around the city  It does however get very busy with the locals using the train system to get to work

title: Excellent mode of transport
review: My only complaint with the sky train is that it was not extensive enough (But perhaps Bangkok is expanding it) It was convenient and clean Good public transportation

title: Good way to get around
review: The best way the get around to avoid the traffic jams However during peak hours expect crowds and slight delays

title: Easy to use
review: This was quick and easy way to get to ur location Very easy to use it can get very busy with people but fun to do at least once

title: best transportation around
review: been using skytrain since late 90's  can beat it for getting around in the citywith the addition of the sub rail systemfabtastic

title: good cheap transport
review: good cheap transport around the city  aircon inside the carriage  you can use single ticket all day ticket or a rabbit card

title: Quick and easy.
review: Like any major city Bangkok's roads are congested Taxis are fine  plenty of them and a reasonable price can usually be agreed But above the roads is the Skytrain which runs uninhibited by the melee below Simply laid out and easy to navigate it is the best way of moving about Bangkok Match this with the orange longboat ferries that the locals use and you have a very efficient and cost effective transport network TIP choose your hotel relatively close to the Skytrain for maximum benefit

title: Easy and Convenient
review: Dont be afraid to use the BTS skytrain  it is very easy to work out and well signposted  take 10 and 5 bht coins if you can or you can change notes for coins at the booths  Once you have the coins check your station you want to go too and press that amount indicated  Enter the coins and take the ticket  Good tip to look at last station in the direction you want to travel so that you go to the correct side of the platform  if you head the wrong way just alight at next stop and change sides  Siam station is very busy as it is the main location everyone wants to go to and it is where the two lines interchange   The trains are very clean  no drinking or eating allowed and many announcements in English for next station   Keep bags closed and wallets safe    Enjoy the experience

title: Skytrain is easy to ride
review: Finding your way around a new city is sometimes difficult  The Sky train is easy  The stops are clearly marked and they are announced both in Thai and English  The sky train is also very clean  If you are new to Bangkok this is a great way to get around  It avoids Bangkok's busy streets and easily gets you from one neighborhood to another

title: Good experience
review: Clean On time Airconditioned Great way to move around places in Bangkok Sometimes tickets do not work

title: Quick way to travel in city
review: Be aware that you need cash for the ticket machines Both note and coin ok We travelled at end of day  There was standing room only but it was an easy way to travel in the city so much quicker than road transport

title: Cheap and easy to negotiate
review: Buy tickets at vending machines or desk Easy to plan trip Very organised disembarking and alighting inyto train Quick quiet and clean

title: Best Train
review: Very efficient in terms of usage of sky rabbit card very fast and nice trains Make sure to check first itinerary before using this train system

title: great way to get around bangkok!
review: bts was indeed a lovely experience its the best way to get around and see most in a period of time clean and comfortable as well

title: Skytrain
review: Very comfortable and clean It was also very affordable Some of the best public transport It was also very frequent

title: Very clean and orderly
review: Great way to get around Quick and efficient The train was clean and no eating or drinking aloud The best thing was people queue up orderly to get on the train not like our London Underground Very easy to navigate your way round and very cost effective

title: The fastest way to travel in Bangkok
review: Very convenient easy and a great time saver It is very easy to cover distances short or long extremely quickly What took me one hour 15 minutes one way took me just 20 mins in the return including getting to the station

title: Easy access to many shopping mall
review: I would recommend all the tourists to purchase the daily pass which can be purchase from the booth at 140 bath per day in which you can skip the line to hop on and off for the entire day Try to stay away during the rush hour between 630 thru 8 in the morning and 5 thru 7 in the evening

title: Convenient, fast travel in Bangkok
review: Excellemt skytrain system in Bangkok Easy to use Clean and efficient Aotomatic ticketing machines and helpful staff For a first time user it was a pleasure

title: Convenient but often highly crowded transport network
review: Iâve visited Bangkok annually for 20 years and the BTS Sky Train network gets more and more crowded The platforms are built for five or six carriages but they still Only run a four carriage service which means at peak times itâs often impossible to get on the first train and you have to wait while at off peak times youâre still crammed inside which raises issues of personal space and security It is a convenient system services are regular but it is not always a pleasant journey because youâre jostling around For the elderly and those with mobility issues lifts have recently been installed at some if not all stations but road level access is only from one side of the street You need to work this into your plan There is only one escalator up to each platform and often itâs furthest from where you entered the station so look out for it There are no escalators down from the platforms so the addition of lifts is a welcome one Reasonable pricing and staff are very helpful If in doubt queue for a ticket from the staff on duty Safety doors have been added to all stations which brings some peace of mind during crowded conditions Itâs a more widespread network than the underground MRT system and goes to most key tourist locations such as the Siam shopping complexes Buddha temple near the Hyatt hotel weekend market and Saphan Thaksin river terminal for boats up the river and to Asiatique night market

title: It's hot, it's crowded, it's cheap, it's the best way to get around.
review: The traffic in Bangkok is like a parking lot all the cars are stopped from 4 pm to 7 pm  It can take you 1 hour to go 3 miles  Really  The bts the overhead train costs very little  It runs on time  All hours  It's crowded like in New York City at rush hour  Bangkok is hot and muggy buy a cheap hand held fan you'll need it  Super fast travel around town  Safer than a motorcycle or tuk tuk

title: Convenient and easy
review: BTs is very convenient and easy and fast to travel from places to places easy connectivity Must try

title: BTS Story
review: BTS was excellent and had a lift or escalator on all stations  Often you have to ask if you don't see the signs  Staff was excellent in each station  Buy RABBIT cards if you are going to travel often for extended periods  We were here for a month and found it very usefull for seeing friends and family

title: Easy to use, cheap and great aircon
review: We used the Skytrain for getting into central Bangkok and to the shopping malls around Siam Square The carriages were busy but the aircon made the journey comfortable One way tickets were cheap at a maximum for us of 44 baht each The stations are announced in English as well as Thai which made it easy to understand the system

title: Easy access..!!
review: It's really a convenient and pocket friendly option to travel in Bangkok The map clearly states the stops and the route for travel

title: Good transit
review: Slightly awkward having to pay with a big handful of coins but very useful system for getting to main areas

title: Clean,Efficient, & Inexpensive Transport
review: The BTS Skytrain is a very well run system Fast clean and efficient  The DC Metro could learn a few things from BTS  I use BTS every time in Bkk Get the Rabbit card so you don't have to fuss with cash

title: Train journey from easy Bangkok to city centre
review: Train was crowded so we had to stand for the whole way So research for other options like taxi & tuk tuk etc

title: Super Efficient
review: This is the best thing since slice bread for BKK Very simple to navigate and it pretty much goes through all the key shopping and hotel areas that most tourists visit and its very inexpensive You've never been a traffic jam until you are in one in BKK and the BTS is a life and time saver It does get very crowded at rush hour and you have to put up with some squeezing However the Thai people are very polite I have not personal experienced anybody being aggressive or jump the line or anything like that

title: Easy way to travel
review: This metro system is very easy to use and covers a wide space over Bangkok The metro is clean and spacious unless travelling at just periods then the metro becomes a bit crammed

title: Easy to navigate/Bring coins
review: Luckily I was warned in advance to bring coins if I intended to use the BTS Lines to buy tickets at the counter are ridiculously long at all times of the day and night but  the coin vending machines are easy and efficient I found a couple machines that accepted bills but they were almost always out of service

title: faster than traffic...
review: in bangkok u have to use BTS  fast clean comfortable convenient takes you to most of the major area in bangkok even connected to the chao praya river

title: The train system to go with in Bangkok
review: Bangkok is well known for its dense traffic and traffic jams If you can avoid this by going BTS The quality of service is great A pity that it only covers a few lines

title: Clean fast
review: Clean safe and fast train gets you from the airport into the centre of town Easy access direct from your flight to the train station

title: The Bangkok Traffic jam buster
review: These days the  traffic in Bangkok is far better than it was in the past where just crossing a major intersection meant taking your life into your own hands and there were reports that Bankok people installed portaloos in their cars for the daily commute  However during peak hours 800  1000 am an 400  700 pm journeys that would otherwise take thirty minutes can sometimes take almost two  hours  The best way to overcome this is to head to your nearest skytrain (BTS) station Bangkok's elevated railway This mass transport system has two main lines Sukhumvit and Silom serviced by 35 stations The lines runthrough inner Bangkok to the outer suburbs in the north through  to Thon buri which is accross the river from Bangkok Together with the unerground the skytrain makes uo the Bangkok rapid transport system  If you are staying close to a BTS station a short walk or taxi journey is the way to go Bangkok has an informal inegrated public service system so If you are away from a BTS station then you should get a taxi to the closest BTS station or you  might consider going native and catch a motorcycle taxi to a bus or directly to the BTS station The stations themselves are well signposted to help you to your destination and there is usually BTS  person who will direct you although it may help to write down your destination preferrably in Thai Firstly you go to the station booth to get your change and if very lucky to get your ticket Howeveryou usually buy yor tickets from dispensing machines which show the price when you choose your destination on a screenYou proceed the the turnstyles by inserting you ticket in the slot which opens the barrier Make sure you retrieve your ticket and hurry through because they slam shut and can leave you with a nasty bruiseYou queue diagnonally to the train doors to allow people to get off and hold your ground against queue jumpers as you get on board Once aboard the clean  super chilled airconned trains have the route displayed on the wall above the doors and you will be notified in Thai and English over an intercom as you reach each station on route The fares are comparitively expensive but if you are staying for more than a day a Rabbit pass will save you heaps The journey itself is an adventure You travel above many of Bangkok's landmarks such as the Royal Bangkok Sportsclub opposite Lumpini Park and near some fine Chinese temples You can cross the river into Thonburi  It also gives you a chance to experience a cross section of Bangkok people close up on the train which you would never see from a taxi  I should mention the underground  which links the city centre with the international airport and central railway station The underground interchanges with the skytrain at Sala Dang station in Silom Rd

title: The best way to move around in bangkok city
review: you won't go wrong with this best and easy Well connected take a card if you are here for few days that will work out cheaper Enjoy the stay in Bangkok Its open from 6100 am to 12 midnight

title: Speed Around Town
review: Great to see the trains running at full speed ahead Air con chilled cars were the highlight of the day as we scooted from one end of the city to another a nice way to beat the heat

title: The ONLY way to go to the weekend market!
review: We bought a 15 ride Rabbit card for our 8 day stay in Bangkok  It's the only way to avoid the traffic especially to places like the Chatuchak weekend market    We were staying at a hotel in Sukhumvit with quick and easy access to the BTS station  You may choose to buy tickets for each individual trip but if you do be sure to bring change because the ticket machines only take 1 5 and 10 THB COINS  no paper currency or credit cards  The fares are quite inexpensive  from Sukhumvit to Mo Chit (the stop for the market) was just 44 THB  It does get very crowded during rush hour but you also have an option to wait for the next train since they come very frequently (every 8 minutes or less)

title: One of the best and convenient ways to get around in Bangkok
review: One of the best and convenient ways to get around in Bangkok If you plan on using it for they day buy a day pass (currently for the promotion price of 140 baht Valid until midnight on the day you travel

title: First experience in BTS
review: Nica facility in Bangkok  Initially scared but after some information from local person n BTS team It's now easy for me to explore Bangkok throughout with BTS

title: BTS to Mochit
review: Service was efficient as always Public announcements were clear n adequate Only at certain stretch within CBD that it was overcrowded Lack of civic consciousness among younger passengers to give up seats to the elderly

title: Bangkok holiday
review: 5 days in Bangkok and we used the Skytrain a few times easy and quick From Asok to the markets its the best way to go and after being stuck in a Bangkok traffic jam for 4hrs the train looks very attractive and cheap

title: A good choice of transportation
review: BTS sky train is a good transportation choice for everyone as it helps you to save money and avoid the traffic Jams in the busy streets of Bangkok Saphan Taksin BTS station is next to the river boat station of Bangkok I took this BTS train from Saphan Taksin to Siam interchange   The trains were clean Unlike Singapore the directions to the platform wasn't so clear So far I only know that there is a single tracking system at the Saphan Taksin station Users need to becareful on boarding the train at that station because some trains would move in a different directions that leads you to a different location

title: Great way of travel through bkk
review: Good fast and cheap way of travelling through Bangkok There are still more stations being build Buy a rabbit card for 100 bht and put 200 bht on it and you dont have to stand in line for the ticket machine or desk The bigger station are busy on the smaller stations you can easily topup youre cards

title: Well Organised Train System
review: Can be very crowded at times but easy to get around from place to place  At times we were feeling a bit like sardines in a can but it was all part of the experience

title: Good transportation
review: Very clever transit system optimized for fast interchange between lines at the same platform  Staff very kind and tickets very affordable Good choice for fast travel in Bangkok

title: easy to get around
review: best way to travel around Bangkok miss the traffic and save so much time super easy to catch  cheap and fun

title: Really nice system
review: Very convenient transportation Avoid to use this transportation if rush hour it's too crowded  Easy access

title: Mrs Linda Arendse
review: We took a short trip just for the experience Speaking to the staff because we were unsure as to how it works the language barrier was a huge problem We had to figure it out on our own I would never have been able to do it on my own The train experience was awesome and worth the stress of struggling to get help

title: Best way around Bangkok!
review: Very efficient and affordableBest way to get around Bangkok It used to be hell to get around with BTS its easy )

title: Most Convenient & Comfortable for Travellers to Commute
review: BTS is the life line of Bangkok City for the locals as well as for the Tourists   The Advantage is all major malls  attractions is connected with BTS or very close proximity of BTS   Terminal 21  BTS Ashok MBK  BTS National Station Chayo Phraya River Cruise  Saphen Taksin Night Life  BTS Nana  Chatuchak Weekend Market  BTS Mo Chit Airport Rail Link (Suvarnabhumi Airport)  BTE Phaya Thai  Sky Train runs on two BTS LINES   SILOM LINE  Runs west to south between the National Stadium in the Siam shopping area and Bang Wa in Thonburi (across the Chao Phraya River) You interchange for Sukhumvit line at BTS Siam  SUKHUMVIT LINE  Runs north to east from Mo Chit to Bearing The two lines meet at Siam Station and also connect at two points with the underground (MRT) â at Sala Daeng Station (MRT Silom) and Asok Station (MRT Sukhumvit)   Fares start at 15 baht for one stop rest check at the ticket counter or automated ticket vending machine at the the stations  Trains can get pretty full during peak hours (0700  0900 and 1600  1900)

title: Go for it.
review: It may take a bit of research to find your destination but when you see the queues of stationary traffic below you feel well rewarded It's cheap fairly easy to navigate with good onboard station displays cool and quick to get from the airport to the city centre Lots of willing help along the way

title: Mr e
review: ðððð convenient  cheap and efficient easy to get around and use Great to get to main shopping centers

title: Very clean and easy
review: I was very impressed with the service That said I am from Melbourne where our public transport is average  Very clean fast easy and efficient

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: By far the best mode of transport in and around Bangkok the surface roads can be chaotic with in fathomable one way systems and many many traffic lights The BTS system is inexpensive air conditioned and well thought out servicing all the relevant locationsfast and convenient

title: Reliable and Efficient
review: If you want to travel Bangkok the BTS is the most reliable service there is You wont get ripped off by a taxi or grab and fare prices are cheap The cost can add up though since the Rabbit cards that you scan every time has a set amount of money on it There is no monthly or weekly cards that you can purchase unfortunately Trains can get very packed depending where you are heading but lets face it you are in one of the largest cities in the world Siam Station is packed and you can get lost at times but there are staff and signs everywhere to guide you to where you want to go Exceptional rail system and surpassed my expectations

title: Thailand BTS is an amazing public transportation. Both clean and efficient.
review: I always use the BTS SkyTrain while in Bangkok It is the cleanest public transportation system I have ever seen It is affordable and easy to use The BTS has maps in the Skytrain and at every stop to help you get to your destination   TIP Each stop has a booth with BTS employees who are glad to help travels They all know english and even if they have a challenge just say the stop or write it down so they can assist you This will allow you to buy your ticket with larger denominations as the BTS ticket vending machines only take coins

title: Very convenient.
review: Highly recommend this We only went a few stops but it was fast a little crowded during the rush hour when we returned so if I use the train again I will avoid the rush hour

title: quite crowded
review: It was easy to travel the only downside is it was crowded Its only accessible within the cityhope it can connect to tourist sport in the future

title: Thailand skytrain amazing
review: Only one in bangkok can can take to center in bangkok   And easy to go just by ticket at the station And the train it clean

title: It's literally just a train
review: Don't know what the big deal is about this it's an overground subway Use it to get from place to place it's nice and stuff but it's not an attraction it's public transport

title: If you need to avoid bad traffic in bangkok
review: I recommend BTS in weekend because traffic around bangkok mostly is pretty bad and make you get upset specially if you choose taxi service you might have to pay a lot so this will fast and convenient trust me

title: Very Efficient
review: This is a great way to get around in busy Bangkok The system is easy to understand and the train is very affordable

title: Easy
review: Very easy and efficient to use great way of getting around the city avoiding the traffic on the roads Roads are mega busy no matter what time of day or night it is Would definitely recommend using this Also great value for money

title: Excellent mode of transport in Bangkok
review: Its cheap clean very frequent and I always found someone who could speask2 enough English Ijust that you can by one way tickets

title: Wonderful Convenient public transport
review: BTS is excellent Mass Rapid Transport in the heart of Bangkok city It will conveniently connect you to most parts of the city including the Airport and almost all parts of interest Available almost 247 with intervals of about 35min Give it a try to avoid the traffic jams in the city Direction maps indicating fares also available in the stations and most hotels

title: Very easy to use, not overly convenient for young children
review: The Skytrain is very simple and straightforward to use and very cheap too It's a great option for getting around Bangkok but we struggled at some stations with our pushchair Most have a lot of steps and no lifts so bear this in mind when using it

title: efficient
review: Only used once heading to central shopping centres near Siam station Between Siam and Chet Lom raised pedestrian walkway so can see above the roads of the expensive shopping area  Found BTS very clean and easy to use Can pay for single trips if short stay I'd invest in transit card if staying longer than a week

title: My Favorite Way to Get Around Bangkok
review: Though it got busy a couple of times I truly enjoyed using the BTS Skytrain to get around the city I feel like I really know Bangkok after just one visit because I used this as my sole means of transportation And it's very inexpensive

title: Riding above the Bangkok
review: This is the best way to get around Bangkok  Typically procedure  buy card that can be toppedup when needed  touch and go through the entrance gates  The BTS Skytrains are air conditioned and popular city stops are crowded at work rush hour times but not like Tokyo where pushers a used to squeeze in a few more customers  like Tokyo people are polite and accommodating on the BTS  The subway system is also very good but you do need a different card for the subway system  We found the express from the airport to the Thai Phraya (SkyTrain) stop to be very convenient  The express from the Airport is 45 Baht ($140) and a separate ticket from the BTS Skytrain  Taxi's are inexpensive but use a meter or agree the price before hand  a typical ride in Bangkok is 150 Baht to get across town  however traffic conditions can be bad and taxi ride long compared to the Skytrain  Have fun

title: Getting around Bangkok conveniently!
review: While Bangkok traffic is one of the busiest and dangerous the solution is easy BTS  People will complain of the wait times during rush hour but for the price and safety you cannot find a better deal

title: Brilliant
review: Quick and efficient It's a great way to get around the city You can get an unlimited day pass for 140THB which is great if you're doing a few trips This is one of my favourite things about Bangkok

title: Skip traffic jams, enjoy aircon and view
review: Ok you should take a taxi during rush hour just once so you have a story to tell about the world's largest parking lots But thereafter if you can use the BTS Sky Train system It's crowded at peak times but it's faster takes you by many city sights and is air conditioned  a real plus in this tropical city

title: Easy does it
review: A great way to get around this traffic clogged city cool speedy and cheap Signs and announcements are in Thai and English

title: Cheap way to get to and from the airport
review: Good fast cheap way of getting around Bangkok  with good connections to other transport systems in Bangkok  and an easy way to get to the Airport when traffic is heavy

title: Good and fast connection
review: Very cheap good and effective way to explore Bangkok Trains are very clean (no drinking and eating inside) and air condition works perfectly

title: Very convenient
review: Fast clean and reliable it helps a lot to move in Bangkok avoiding the traffic jams with very low cost

title: Clean, safe and simple
review: No better way to get around Bangkok Easy to purchase tickets with English menu Good signage and great aircon Faster than taxis for most destinations

title: Fast and efficent
review: The best way to get around most of Bangkok  Easy to negotiate and cheep Can be quite crowded at rush hour and weekends

title: Only Way To Go!
review: I'm not sure if you have been to Bangkok but it is one of the most frustrating places to travel in In this city there is 2 different kinds of traffic 1) It took me 30 minutes to go 2 kilometers or roughly 1 mile and 2) I AM GLAD I HAD MY FLYING PILLOW AND BLACKET CAUSE THAT TOOK 2 HOURS TO GO 3 KILOMETERS So this train is a lifehairtime saver It takes you to the most popular areas and it's airconditioned

title: Easy to access & use
review: BTS Skytrain is one of the easiest methods of transport in bangkok it is a little wierd at night as there are peddlers & beggars around this area makes it a little unsafe for solo travellers

title: BTS Bangkok
review: One of my favourite metro systems in the world It is the cheapest way to view the city if you are short of time money energy It is very convenient as the stations are meters away from the shopping malls tourist destinations  the only thing I don't like is freezing temperature always wear a scarf

title: Very easy to use
review: The skytrain is so easy to use its faster than taking a taxi We even  used it to go out to dinner in the evening So easy

title: more easy to Bangkok Access
review: Trick  most of BTS Route will meet Siam Station all tourist should know your destination and Station near by then you can go every where in BKK but to avoid more people on train no traveling between 08000900 and 16001700

title: clean and orderly
review: the BTS is a reliable mode of transportation in Bangkok  The staff in the stations are very helpful  The schedules of the trains are posted and the stops  it is the most convenient way to go around

title: Easy access
review: Excellent transportation getting around Bangkok Easy access to purchase ticket thru the teller and booth machines Great way to  bit the traffic around the city Please add more English speaking personnel to help tourist understand the ins and outs

title: Best option for getting around Bangkok central
review: Buy a travel card and you have quick and easy travel around the key areas of Bangkok While the Skytrain is often crowded is still beats sitting in a taxi in traffic Single trip tokens are available but it is a hassle to queue for those

title: Well in Bangkok is a big city always traffic jammed like other country
review: BTS sky train is another option for your travelling especially if you like to go to the downtown or business area  The skytrain is clean cool and faster

title: fast
review: been to bbk second time great overhead system allows ppl to get good feel of the city and the ever so curteous thai people expect crowded on certain peak hours but everyone gets in because the train is very well designed

title: Best way to get around BKK
review: Try to use the BTS or Metro if you can otherwise youâll have to deal with the notorious Bangkok traffic There is no set schedule but the trains come along regularly And the cars are air conditioned   If you will be in Bangkok for a few days or more recommend getting the Rabbit card It makes it much more convenient to ride the train as you donât have to wait in line to buy a ticket And you can buy things with it like a 1 Baht ice cream cone at Dairy Queen

title: Nice experience
review: I had a chance to taste BTS and it was a nice experience for me unfortunately I only had 3 stations not too far and short time And the trip was at night too not many things can be seen at that time

title: faster than bus
review: it okay for go to work now and best way for travellers to see around Bangkok i hope not have traff jams

title: Best transportation to get around Bangkok
review: Fast and save means of transportation for Bangkok You can visit most of luxurious shopping malls or beat your important business meeting without with no sweat

title: Useful
review: Excellent way of getting about in Bangkok It is inexpensive to use Does get very busy at times so expect to be squashed now and again

title: Great Way Around the City
review: Amazing way to see the city Be mindful of minor rules and regulations Line up people  So easy to purchase tokens and they always have maps at the stations so you will not go missing Do not get confused about the booths though There are booths to buy tickets from and there are booths to get change for the ticket machine Travelling via BTS is just amazing considering the the traffic around the city For tourists learn and enjoy using this means of transportation This can connect you as well to MRT stations

title: Great to get around
review: Great for getting around Bangkok  but usually packed out  we got day tickets so could go on & off as much as u liked

title: Using BTS to get through BKK
review: BTS is a very good reliable service never have to wait long for the next train to arrive Normally would be around 2mins But I would advise to avoid rush hours as it can get very busy inside the train

title: Works pretty well
review: Cheap and easy to use Some stations require coins to buy tickets at the kiosk Could save you some time in line if you always carried a couple hundred baht in coins

title: a very good way to go around without traffic jam
review: we used the skytrain a lot It is a fast and save way to go around at bangkok without traffic jam The BTS has also a link to the Airport Rail Link

title: Easy, modern, fast, everything you want in light rail
review: We took the BTS Skytrain several times and it was always easy to use and worked well for us  At times the signs were a bit confusing for getting inout of the station but otherwise easy

title: BTS
review: Bangkok BTS is very convenient & it almost connects the main Tourist spots and shopping Centres  but hopefully in another  5 to 10 years it will become more connected & better

title: better than taxi
review: BTS Skytrain takes you easily to each point of the city good schedule inexpensive fast crowded at rush hour only

title: Easy and cheap
review: Easy to get aroundgrab a ticket for your zonejust read on the platform walland follow the signs to your train Easy and fast way to get around while browsing at the city (which is too hige to cover) as you go by  Each stop announced so no probs with missing your stop

title: Easy and cheap
review: Only two lines can't get more simple than that And less than $1 per ride Definitely easier than sitting in car traffic

title: Easy transport
review: Great way to get around Bangkok  If you donât want to que for ticket take change It does get busy so expect to stand  It is air conditioned

title: Nice ride
review: My ride was smooth and hassle free Easy to follow directions with English translations in the PA system

title: Easy to navigate!
review: Combined with Google Maps it's a easy and VERY cheap way to get round Bangkok  It's air conditioned too but can get very busy at peak times

title: Ticketing Hassle
review: Though it doesnât cover all Bangkok areas itâs still quite convenient way of transportation The downside is ticketing though We can buy the ticket from the machine but the machine only takes coins Second option for us was the ticketing counter But the queue were always long

title: Fastest way to comute in downtown
review: It's obviously the fastest way to travel in Bangkok  Try to avoid rush hours  Highly recommended for tourists to go around with 1day pass for hopin hopout  The train is clean and quite a number of staff to standby and support

title: Clean, easy to use and air conditioned
review: Sky train is very clean and air conditioned Great way to get around town and stay out of the hectic traffic jams on the street Easy to use

title: Efficient
review: Coming from riding nycâs subway for more than 20 years anything is better I love the people of Thailand and their traditions The only people that ever showed bad subway manners was a ânonThaiâ person

title: easy to use
review: I used this to visit a few sites  It is easy to use and people are very friendly here  The young people will help you if you look lost  I never had any issues and i am directionally challenged

title: A great way to get around Bangkok
review: Bangkok is such an overcrowded chaotic city that this line makes it a lot easier for most to be able to navigate from one neighborhood to the other

title: loved it
review: I loved it I also received free ticket last Friday) It is really convenient and easy to go anywhere you want)

title: Challenging
review: I'm sure this is a great way to get around unfortunately not knowing the city andor the language it is a struggle I am very comfortable with public transportation just the language barrier was too much

title: BTS, Connectivity is The Key
review: Clean punctual and accessible in major places and has great connectivity with the underground train Utilized maximum because of the wellorchestrated network and operational from early morning to wee hours at night (never used beyond 100am but thatâs good enough)   Donât know why they stopped accepting credit cards to load the BTS cards Helpful staffs and even willing to assist on info outside of their scope of work Well trained security and mannered when checking bags and enjoy everytime hearing the announcement âplease report any suspicious characterâ  Definitely a break from the nerve wrecking traffic jam relief Interchanges allows you take the airportlink trains and to other routes

title: Best Public Transport Ever!
review: Reliable safe clean cheap servicewhat more could you want Many developed nations should use the BTS as an example of perfection in public transport

title: Surprisingly good
review: Visited in October and admittedly used it with a tour guide  That being said it was very good  Clean with good AC and clear announcing of the stopsin English as well NY city take noteð Very crowded but hey itâs Bangkok

title: Very clean and useful
review: The skytrain isn't the first means of transportation in Bangkok but it's useful when you're a family of 5 or more and you don't want to take a cab or 2 tuktuk It's very clean

title: The most easy and convenient transportation
review: Totally recommend transportation to travel around Bangkok If you want to travel to many places using BTS I suggest to buy one day pass ticket have unlimited rides for one day and easy to use The BTs train is clean and look carefully to the direction station board to avoid any board mistake train

title: the fast effective way of getting around Bangkok
review: There a two skytrain lines that cross at Siam Square StationThe train is fast one every 5 minutes or less Clean airconditioned and cheap A daily ticket for unlimited travel is only 140 Baht The stations link to most of the major shopping Centres on the routes

title: great trains
review: Very clean easy to use if travelling around Bangkok would highly reccommend the bts it is cheap and snuggly at times lol

title: Low cost traveling
review: Bts very easy to access and low cost can access main international airport via Bts and you can enjoy a one day pass

title: Easy!
review: Easy to buy tickets Most of the machines only take coins and no bills Safe clean and airconditioned

title: Most convenient transportation along Sukhumvit
review: As long as you stay around Sukhumvit the BTS is the most convenient way of transportation However and as you decide to visit other areas you may want to change to a motorbike taxi

title: Clean,safe and efficient...need I say more?
review: BTS Skytrain is is part of the integrated transport system in Bangkok If you take the transport link from the airport it meets the Skytrain at Phaya Thai There are two lines with Siam being the interchange At MoChit at the end of one line is the Chatachuk Market and Saphan Taksin on the Silom line connects with ferries on the Chao Phraya river and longtail boat tours Itâs clean safe and efficient A day pass is 140 Baht and runs until midnight

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Skytrain offers good connectivity to popular places in Bangkok like MBK center Patpong night market Chaophra Boat etc Some stations have a lifts that enable you to travel with baggage There are two lines operating at present

title: 3days in Bangkok
review: Skytrain is a great quick and cost effective way to get around Basically its like the underground only above ground It has busy times and quiet too Clean and easy pnce you get to lnow your wsy around

title: Most comfort transportation
review: Easy to find to find and you can take BTS anywhere to the most famous tourism place they offer one day pass

title: Access to most places, trust the BTS
review: I am taking the BTS lines almost everyday There are two BTS lines  Sukhumvit and Silom Sukhumvit stretches from Mo Chit to Bearing or Samrong (expansion plans are work in progress) Silom Line stretches from National Stadium to Bangwa There are interconnections in some stations (ie access to MRT Airport Railway Link or BRT) In the morning the trains are quite packed It is best to take the BTS before 7am if you want to avoid the crowd Different BTS cards are available for daily or monthly (not sure if there are 3day5day passes available similar to other countries) Generally the trains are clean No food and drinks are allowed inside the station However there are food stalls around just after you pass by the exit Taking the BTS is the most convenient and most accessible way to get around Bangkok They say that condos very close to the BTS are more pricey compared to the others This makes sense When it rains or during late evenings it is safe to walk home from the BTS station It really depends on what you prefer

title: Very Cool, Very Clean, Fun way to get about
review: We used the sky train a couple of times we got a day card 150 bahts  The service is so well managed clean comfortable and pleasant gets you from A to B with a view out the window The thai people are so mild mannered and polite it is so nice to experience the level of public display of respect for others  We took the green line to the river to catch the ferry a couple of times   the 21 million visitors should learn a lesson and spread the message

title: Great Way to Beat the Heat
review: Easy way to get around Bangkok and to escape the heat if only for a moment  Tourist friendly and clean

title: Fast and easy way to get around the city
review: There can be a lot of traffic in the city of Bangkok and the sky train offers a brilliant alternative quick way to get about without sitting in traffic

title: Convenient and fast
review: We got a Free ride during the Cremation OF the king and so we went almost everywhere using this transportation IT was really clean fast and comfortable Almost leads to anywhere you went to Go in Bangkok

title: Good service
review: BTS takes you to various places including the best shopping malls It is a reliable service and very convenient since Bangkok traffic is well exasperating

title: Excellent skytrain
review: It's clean well connected on time fast perfect to get from A to B and much faster than any taxi

title: Avoid BKK Traffic!
review: The BTS Skytrain is a GREAT to get around Bangkok if you are close to a line Traffic in Bangkok is notoriously bad and you can often get to a destination faster by walking But if your dogs are a bit tired from all that walking the BTS is inexpensive and a quick way to get to Sukhumvit Road and all it has to offer as well as other parts of BKK

title: Best way to get around in Bangkok
review: Clean safe and reliable transportation in Bangkok This is my preferred method of getting around  Select a station that is nearest your destination and grab a tuk tuk from there to complete your transit  IMHO an important part of the Bangkok experience

title: BTS - Quickest way around Bangkok
review: The BTS provides a good and regular train service  It is a lot quicker and cheaper than a taxi if you can get a station near to where you want to go  The trains are crowded but clean and efficient

title: BTS
review: Everything ran smoothly on my use of the Bangkok BTS  Good way to travel in Bangkok  The trains were clean and arrived at frequent intervals

title: i love it
review: it is great and have good connection so you can use it when you visit attractions around the city this train doesnt connect old part of town so if you want to go to royal field you have to do it by bus or tuktuk

title: The way to Go!
review: The BTS Skytrain is the most dependable mode of travel in Bangkok And now for just a few dollars you can avoid the taxi drama outside by using the beautiful underground at Suvarnabhumi Airport to connect to anywhere in town

title: Simple, effective but crowded
review: The Skytrain is very easy to use and gets to the destination quickly announcements are in English too very safe  clean but crowded at times

title: Truly the best way to get around.
review: Efficient fast inexpensive and comfortable Get yourself a rabbit pass to give you a set number of trips starting at à¸¿150 (Ensure that you donât need to go further than Udom Suk though as this is extra) The system is logical and efficient and truly is the best way to get around this city

title: 40 baht
review: 40 baht seemed to be the maximum cost if I understood it correctly to travel from one end to the other  I noticed that the BTS structures were being constructed further out from their existing station  Where are they getting their revenue  Honolulu needs to study Thailand

title: 'BTS Skytraind Day Card' is a great bargain
review: Nowadays BTS can be very crowded with huge queues if you need to change some coins So I recommend to buy a day card for THB 14000 as a real bargain The average cost of one ride is about THB 3040 depending where you are going so with a day card you hardly need 4 rides But you don't need to wait and get through the control system very easy Unfortunately it is just for BTS Skytrain so for the underground train system you may need a separate card

title: Fast travel mode
review: BTS Skytrain is a good travel mode in Bangkok We boarded the Skytrain from the airport and reached Ratchapraoop station in 25 minutes which is fast compared to the evening traffic Overall a good travel option

title: Great way to get around
review: Very convenient and easy to commute with Loved that the trains are clean and air conditioned I just think it's stupid that the payment for BTS and MRT are two different things If you have to transfer you have to pay again At least it's better than using the taxis that end up scamming u

title: Efficient
review: Clean and efficient system The map is clear Long queue for ticketing during busy hours at key stations

title: Fast and Convenient Methodology to everywhere in Bangkok
review: I have paid numerous visits to Bangkok and I realized that through taking the BTS sky train to any points of Bangkok is the most convenient and fast methodology to your destination Hence I will purely take the BTS Skytrain as my nearly sole methodology to any points between Bangkok  It saves me a lot of money as well as time for my whole trip

title: Perfect transportation.
review: Easy fast and cheap way to get aroundHelpful people at the ticket station Not to crowded clean

title: Use it!
review: This is an easy and safe way to get around Bangkok It's worth learning how to do it You can buy a ticket from a machine (just hit the # of the stop you are going to) You have to insert coins but there is a booth to get change if you need it Super inexpensive compared with taxis or tuk tuks and bonus you don't feel like you might die on the way )

title: Good Transport System

title: An Experience!

title: Easy trip to City
review: We have taken the BTS often from and to the airport It is quick easy and cheap No traffic hassles and no taxi rip offs

title: Convenient

title: Always clean & reliable

title: BTS sky train ð Bangkok

title: So convenient

title: Efficiency at its best

title: Best mode of transportation in bkk
review: This is the best mode of transportation to travel in bkk All major destinations are connected via BTSIt's cheap fast and easy

title: Best Way to Beat the Traffic

title: public transport
review: Its a breeze taking the train beating the road traffic but not human traffic as practically the train are packs each time and each hour but is a fun and cheap way to travel and getting to your destination  Just ask your hotel for the map and it shows the train station names that you wish to visit the sites

title: Comfortable and easy

title: Great way to get around Bangkok

title: Easy and convenient to travel in Bangkok

title: Too many steps to climb ...BTS
review: It is truly unfriendly for less physical capable to clmb steps to catch train The signage is not clear and far too few  Henry

title: Great train service

title: The BEST way to get around the city fast

title: Not bad but the security guards are little Hitlers
review: Overall its ok a bit overcrowded but the security guards are idiots they treat you like brainless morons I know not to stand too close to the trains but if you even lean your head over the yellow line they go mental the whistles come out the pointing at the signs saying 'stand behind yellow line' begin then they glare at you as if you're trying to murder somebody Honestly I know not to fall into moving trains do they think they are the police The yellow line police If someone is foolish enough to walk into a moving train then they deserve the consequences  BTS Thailand tell your guards to stop acting like the Stazi

title: Great but do not travel in rush hour
review: Very quick and cheap but stay away between 1700 and 1900 so much people and they push to get in Many people wait at the door and looking at their telephone but do no make room

title: Great way to move around
review: The skytrain is a great way to move around given Bangkok's legendary traffic Its quite affordable and although rush hour can get crowded but it saves a lot of time

title: From Sala Daeng to pratunam
review: The bts train service is good and on time  The train is clean and is useful which to help avoid traffic

title: Excellent
review: Excellent system  Designed to make travel around this congested city easier and it seems it does just that

title: Efficient transportation

title: Cannot avoid it.

title: Clean, well maintained
review: Bkk's BTS skytrain if very efficient clean and well maintained It arrived on time in frequent interval The English translation in every station makes it really easy for English speaking people to navigate No wonder foreigners find Bangkok a friendly place The use of the Bts skytrain is highly recommended

title: Best ever
review: If your in Bangkok you have to go from A to B with the skytrain no traffic no renegotiating just pay and drive It's not the cheapest public transport but for bangkok is areally good solution

title: The BTS is the best way to get around in the city
review: Over the past 5 years the BTS(skytrain) has grown leaps and bounds and is a terrific way to get to the river or the the famous JJ Market

title: Fast and cheap and crowded.

title: Convenient option
review: Great sky train service Its connected to MRT and other lines so you can practically travel everywhere by train right from the airport Very convenient way to travel Passengers are very discipline courteous and polite like people in general in Thailand I always prefer traveling by train to Cab You get to see and experience real Thailand

title: Cheap, Easy, and Convient

title: A bit expensive
