title: Sure it is cheap
review: The stations have staff that speaks english and many signs in english so you know where your going There urgently needs to be more lines crisscrossing the city

title: Excellent Mode Of Transport
review: Easy and convenient to travel it link with the MRT Beat the bkk traffic jam Tourist pass B$140 whole day unlimited Overall is great

title: Efficient & reliable service
review: The trains system seems very reliable and efficient Took us a while to understand that some ticket booths requires the exact amount and some gave change Once we had this sorted it was all much quicker Working out north and south east and west was more challenging  it was all upside down for us Seemed very reasonably priced

title: Busy but punctual
review: We used the BTS on Saturday to go to the Chatuchak market unsurprisingly the trains were very busy but punctual and have air conditioning which makes a huge difference   I watched a couple of you tube videos and did a little bit of research before using the trains and this made a lot of difference I believe and allowed us to travel easily on the BTS definitely a good way of getting around Bangkok

title: Cheap, Easy, and Convient
review: During my stay in Bangkok the BTS Skytrain became my best friend to commute around Bangkok It is cheap and easy to use Also it is very clean and felt very safe with security guards at every stop  Notes   BTS uses a card system So after paying for your trip you receive a card Insert the card as if you were inserting a "bill" into a vending machine The card will pop back up and hold it to your destination You insert the card again to leave the station at your destination DO NOT THROW THE CARD AWAY  There is a bag check upon entry at every station  Depending on your hotel Use the airport rail link and transfer to the BTS or MRT There is no need for cab

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: It takes eons longer to take a taxi so just use the BTS and you'll get there in airconditioned comfort It's been expanded and connects with MRT underground so you're all set with transport in Bangkok

title: Broken elevators and escaltors
review: Though convenient to get around the city too many stops that have broken elevators or escalators especially at the transfer stations to the airport line  Saw too many people struggling with heavy baggage up and down a series of flights of stairs  What was the maintenance staff thinking

title: Clean fast efficient
review: Beautiful clean fast and efficient public transportand cheap I found a little difficult to navigate as I had no internet to use maps but a friendly local couple helped me to find my way Ticketing is easy and there are plenty of signs English announcements and screens on the train  Much faster than sitting in traffic

title: very clean and convenient
review: the bts skytrain is the most convenient form of transportation in getting around bangkok clean with good aircon

title: Cheap, clean and quiet
review: I just loved the BTS Skytrain its actually cheap very clean and peaceful It could reach more places but its ok

title: A easy, good and cheap way to explore Bangkok
review: In a city with a lot of traffic BTS Skytrain is at good and cheap choice to get around in the city This time was I used a whole day to travel around with BTS  The green line(Sukhumivit line) goes all the way from Mo Chit  to Bearing with connection to the blue line(Silom Line) at Asok With Silum line you can get all the way from Chatuchak Park to Hua Lampong station and with further connection to Airport Rail Link to Suvarnabhumi Airport and BRTroute which takes you from Chong Nonsi to Ratchahruek It's a easy and good way to explore Bangkok even though it's preetty filled sometimes and you must stand for a while

title: Loved it! Very fast! Loaded in peak hours..
review: Peak hours is loaded in the train but it is a great way to travel in Bangkok Really loved the queuing up to the train and let passengers off before you enter

title: Very convenient public transport in BKK
review: A very good way of transportation to avoid traffic jam can reach many popular scenic spot and shopping mall very easily

title: Easy to use
review: Learning the BTS is a must if you're spending any time in Bangkok as traffic is horrendous  The train is very clean easy to use and gets you to many big stops  You'll need to learn to use the water transit as well to hit big tourist destinations but this is easy and quite interesting    On the train people are very respectful of families with young children and elderly  Having two toddlers we never once rode without being offered a seat  The doorways do get crowded but if you're traveling far just push into the aisle way and you'll find more space    Trains come extremely frequently we rarely waited more than five minutes    The rabbit pass is good to use if riding frequently  You pay a deposit on the card and can fill it when you need more

title: Great connectivity
review: A great and cheapest way to reach the Ferry ride starting point to the Wat pho and Wat Arun I loved the ride and the staff is also very helpful

title: Very Good
review: One of the best ways to go around bangkok faster Their trains are well maintained cold and clean

title: Great mode of transportation but lack of seats
review: It's a great and affordable mode of transportation especially with the horrible traffic in bangkok But it's always full and need to stand because there is not enough seat

title: Interesting stops
review: A good way to go around when you just want to see the area quickly  just hope out and go from one station to another

title: Bangkok Sky Train
review: What a great way to travel from the Jim Thompson House to our stay at the Shangri La Hotel  Clean efficient and easy to use

title: Convenient way of getting around Bangkok while avoiding the traffic
review: Convenient way of getting around Bangkok while avoiding the traffic   Fares were relatively cheap and covered most of the touristy places and shopping mall

title: Short holiday trip
review: Convenient way to travel around and to beat the traffic congestion Interior of the train was clean Stations can get pretty congested due to number of stalls kiosks along the entrance to the station especially during peak period

title: Brilliant
review: Efficient clean cheap and trains every few minutes Perhaps the best way to get around Bangkok Easy to read maps too Get yourself a Rabbit Card We put the equivalent of $15 on each of ours More than enough for three or four days in the city

title: Clouded!!!
review: The most convenience way no traffic problem Value money no time waste would be perfect is have more room it's too clouded

title: The easiest way to get around
review: My first trip to Thailand and I was a little hesitant to use the skytrain as I usually get lost at least once  So I decided to have a go and it is the most easiest way to get around this busy city  It is very straightforward with buying a ticket or a day pass  They also have rabbit cards if you are staying or travelling more often  The trains are very clean and very punctual  No eating or drinking in them  I did see a cleaner cleaning the walkway walls today  Very impressed with the system  Cheaper and quicker than taxis or tuk tuk in my opinion

title: Convenient way to travel around
review: BTS is a very convenient transport to move around during peak hour BTS is always packed with people If you are traveling in group taxi is better and cheaper choice as you don't need to walk too much

title: Linkage between shopping malls and centers
review: Very convenient for tourists cos most of the famous shopping centers were built around those BTS stations If you want to shop in Bangkok better study the BTS map You will need that

title: Fast and easy to use
review: It can get crowded but otherwise is fast and easy to use Inexpensive Convenient Easy connections Lots of stairs If you're lucky there will be an escalator if you have luggage

title: cool convenient
review: lived nana plaza for a month and the bts takes one to just about anywhere fast I avoided rush hours so not crowded  cheap easy and cool refuge from the streets lol

title: Works great!
review: I love the public transportation in Bangkok It is convenient and cheap   Locals are eager to help at least a lonely middle aged girl in trouble) They are really lovely

title: Great way to travel in the city
review: It is a great way to travel in the city it is cheap fast and most recommended than taxis or tuk tuk

title: I love Bangkok BTS
review: What great well run rail system Cheap clean and easy to use The two interconnected lines will take you to most places in the main area of Bangkok

title: Well connected & smooth ride
review: The BTS skytrain is well connected to most of the parts of bangkok It is pretty fast & comfortable as well The staff is helpful & would assist you in planning your journey Most of them understand english so communication is not a problem

title: Cold, packed and unsuitable with luggage
review: If you have luggage it's better to use a cab When we were in Bangkok the preparations for the crematory ceremony were ongoing so they checked  opened every bag at the entrance  if you get it there cause at most stops there is no elevator to get up to the skytrain instead you have to carry your luggage up 35 flights of stairs In the trains it feels like it's 10C less than outside and in the eve (around 57pm) it's incredibly packed

title: The only way to traverse Bangkok
review: Save your self some time and just plan on taking the Sky Train any time you can Tickets are cheap and most of Bangkok's points of interest are accessible Be aware as is the case in all large cities rush hour(s) can be a bit nuts Just plan ahead and you save loads of time

title: The only way to travel
review: this is the only way to travel in the area  Clean trains that run frequently (only from 530 AM to before midnight) soaring over traffic  Tips  if you are going to use the service for a few days invest the extra THB 100 ($3) in a RABBIT CARD as it will allow you to avoid lines  Also during rush hours the trains are PACKED so you may have to wait 1 or 2 trains to get on one but it is organized

title: Amazing
review: TheÂ Bangkok Mass Transit System commonly known as theÂ BTSÂ or theÂ Skytrain is an elevatedÂ rapid transitÂ system inÂ Bangkok Thailand It is operated byÂ Bangkok Mass Transit System PCL (BTSC)Â under a concession granted by theÂ Bangkok Metropolitan Administration(BMA) The system consists of 35 stations along two lines theÂ Sukhumvit LineÂ running northwards and eastwards terminating atÂ Mo ChitÂ andÂ SamrongÂ respectively and theÂ Silom LineÂ which serves Silom and Sathon Roads the central business district of Bangkok terminating atÂ National StadiumÂ andÂ Bang Wa The lines interchange atÂ Siam StationÂ and have a combinedÂ route lengthÂ of 376 kilometers (234Â mi)

title: Use it to get to the shopping mall
review: Much better than a taxicheap and moves fast Gets quite busy but no worse that the London underground Clean and efficient Needs to be expanded

title: Risto tancevski
review: Very easy to use  staff very friendly  runs approx every 10 minutes currently another 5 stations being added cheap and efficient method of transport a lthough currently only covers inner city

title: Way better than the trains in my American city
review: Trains run frequently quiet great air conditioning very clean good security goes to a lot of interesting places inexpensive  I go to Bangkok often and I try to only go where these trains go  It can get crowded at peak times but the Thai people are very polite and very clean (ha ha)  Where I live you wouldn't want to be packed in with many of the train riders  It's okay in BKK

title: Fast with nice views
review: We were hesitating to take it or not and we like it a lot It is a fast way to avoid the traffic jams and the views of the buildings are amazing

title: Fast and easy
review: Hop on and head to ur fav destination The BTS is one of the key transport to avoid the Bangkok Jam

title: Clean, frequent and efficent
review: Good system but here is a few tips First is to forget to try and learn names of stops everything is numbered with a letter and a number This applies to both skyline lines and underground too Another tip is some stations have modern touch screen ticket machines easy to use Others only have basic coin machine if you dont know your fare either you pay too much or not enough(worse) So when you see basic machine go to ticket office

title: Excellent cheap transport
review: The sky train is easy to navigate and is very cheap and quick much better than taxi as the roads are so busy If possible go with plenty of coins as you need coins to buy a ticket from the machine if you don't have coins you need to line up for change and then go buy the ticket Train very clean and quick

title: Take a ride on Bangkokâs skytrain
review: We were in a large group of 15 people and tried the Bangkok skytrain and found it very easy to navigate We went a few stops and then walked across the platform to go in the other direction to get to the MBK Shopping Center It was a lot easier to keep our group together and much faster than taking 4 taxis

title: Easy to traveling in Bangkok town
review: BTS sevice pass in down town area as MBK  Central world  Big C Rajchadamri  Silom  Sukhumvit  PhayaThai ( Airport rail link )  and connect with Express Boat Pier  this is easy to traveling to Old town ( Grand palace  Wat Pho  Flower Market or China town ) Operate time  0530 am  Midnight It have 1 day pass ticket can use all day long  until midnight too

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Gets me to most of the places that I want to go Strong air con and clean Crowded most of the time

title: Easy and cheep
review: Using the BTS mass transit in Bangkok is cheep and easy You can get almost anywhere you would want to get to with maybe a little walk for under $5 USD The traffic in Bangkok is terrible (think New York) Do your self a favor take a chance and use the BTS

title: Clean and efficient but can get crowded during office hours!
review: The traffic on Bangkok roads is insane we used this as much as we could It can get pretty bad during peak hours packed in like sardines but it's still the only way to save time Taxi drivers and Tuk Tuk drivers will rip you off any chance they get and you could get stuck for anywhere between 30mins to 1 hour I recommend using the BTS as much as you can to not only save time but a decent amount of money also The only time you can use the roads in Bangkok is before 8 am and after 9pm

title: Super fast. Super easy.
review: Crazy efficient Most definitely the best mass transit system we've experienced and we've experienced a number of 1st and 3rd world countries   For those debating using the BTS over a cab or tuk tuk I'd suggest to use the BTS to get tofrom your destination or as close as possible Then cab it if you must  Far faster to do that then purely using a cab (due to ridiculous Bangkok traffic)  Easy to use and efficient Trains run regularly

title: The BTS (Best Transport Scenario)
review: I have been using the BTS since the first day it opened In the first year the cars were relatively empty that soon changed as Bangkokians realised just how good this service is My kids went to school 5 days a week on the BTS I can't begin to tell you how much time I have saved from sitting in traffic over the years but I am sure it would be months The BTS has grown and expanded and I think it has reached a point where there is more demand than they can handle Just last Monday I had to wait in line to board at the Phrong Phog Station for 3 trains Bangkok desperately needs more of this kind of services I thank the wise people who built the BTS for taking such a big risk and moving Bangkok forward It's still the best way to travel in the city

title: Beat the Jams
review: Whenever I visit Bangkok the first thing I do is to get myself a rabbit card for my travels within the city by the BTS the most convenient way of getting around

title: Clean and Comfortable
review: This BTS Skytrain is quite similar with what Singapore have It is clean AC works good The single ticket also have Skytrain Stations map really help the tourists The officers are kind but they cannot speak English even the basic so we need to use bodylanguage haha I hope the officers will be trained for basic English course However Overall is comfortable

title: A great form of metropolitan transport
review: The BTS is a great way to travel around Bangkok with things to do at every station  It has great views of the city when riding and is air conditioned  Tips donât go between 4530pm because it is very crowded The same goes for 78 in the morning

title: crowded most of the time and irregular intervals
review: bts skytrain has become the post popular mode of transport to reach the central sukhumvitarea alongside the feedermrt and btsnetworkexpansions over the last few years intersections at siam and asokebtsstations have become so crowded during rushhour that people have been queuing up for trains and let 1 or 2 pass until they could get space in a carriage inside the trains during those hours it's like sardines in a can the operator has been unable to provide enough trains to meet that challenge and is still unable to maintain a regular schedule airconditioning inside the carriage has also been a challenge it being either too cold or too hot inside (admittedly that is a real challange considering the change of crowds in and out) it is up to international standards but there remains room for improvement and the crowds will definitely get worse to the point of tokyo in the 1990s

title: Brilliant
review: Without doubt the best way to get round this crazy city which is manic on the ground 140 bahts for a day ticket and you can get on and off where you like all day Also very well air conditioned

title: good connectiviity
review: BTS Skytrain is like a metro with good connectivity the best thing about Skytrain is that it has a Skywalk as well ie the footover bridge below the metro line making it easy for walkers to commute despite traffic

title: ONLY WAY TO TRAVEL IN BANGKOK
review: I love this fast efficient cheap clean air conditioned ordered transport  I can get somewhere in 10 mins on BTS  SKY TRAIN 1hr in taxi in the never ending Bangkok traffic Only way to get everywhere

title: EXCELLENT TRANSPORT
review: BTS brings you to lots of places that tourist would like to go  Very convenient  Looking forward to the future extension to BTS

title: Signing could be clearer for non-Thai speakers.
review: In spite of this staff friendly and helpful  We were able to get around quickly and cheaply Trains run often  Lots of stairs some escalators  Work for elderly or people  with luggage

title: Easy to use
review: Love the sky train easy to use and safe Announcements for each station are in Thai and English  If you plan to use for more than one trip you can buy a rabbit pass that allows more access

title: Convenient and fastest way to travel and avoid traffic and pollution.
review: Convenient and fastest way to travel and avoid traffic and pollution It is cheap way to travel and almost all major part of Bangkok is covered Lay hands on the skytrain map along with MRT and you can go to every part of the city

title: convenient and cheap public transportation
review: convenient and cheap public transportation with affordable ticket prices from morning till night the BTS is always full of passengers from which employees and tourists ticket costs only THB 30  50 one way not difficult but need to learn a few ways to change base stations BTS

title: Easy to get around
review: Found the BTS to be an affordable comfortablecool (ac on hot days) and safe method of getting around Bangkok

title: Short city break airport transfer and daily use.
review: Quick and easy to use Clean and much quicker than the roads only down side is if you have large luggage and do not know your hotels exact location Can get crowded in rush hour but so do all city rail systems everywhere I just paid for each trip I made but can get cards and load credit or travel passes as well Not sure on pricing of them but if going to be using a lot then probably a better option

title: Too full
review: Using the Skytrain takes a lot of time because the station and also the train is always too crowded and in order to get a ticket you would have to go to the booth to get change first and then get the ticket at the machine If you are lucky they will sell you the ticket right at the booth Then they check your bags too It is pretty expensive if you travel as a family and children pay full fare when they are 120cm tall The Skytrain only has a few stations that connect with other trains and in the end you almost always still need to take a taxi to get to the final destination because Bangkok is just too vast I didn't find it very useful to get to places unless they are close to a station and your hotel is too

title: A must to have a quick view of Bangkok and the local lives
review: Good transport system covers the main areas and is super convenient Recommended if you want to get around faster Taxis will take forever to get from one point to another so BTS Skytrain is the way to go

title: Great way to get around, but can be very crowded at mornings and evenings.
review: One of the best ways to move around Bangkok due to the constant traffic jams in the city very efficient and cheap way to get around

title: A Fan of BTS Every Time I'm In Bangkok
review: Been riding with BTS Skytrain since the time I had my first Bangkok trip 6 years ago It was very convenient clean and the ride was comfortable I had a few hits and misses like riding on the wrong train but the staff were so helpful in giving directions as to what to do Will ride again of course on my next Bangkok trips

title: The easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: Choose BTS Skytrain to get avoid the traffic jam in Bangkok It runs on time schedule and can save more times But it always very crowded during the rush hours between 79 am and 57 pm

title: Pretty cool
review: I thinks it is the best transportation in bangkok  cheapest than taxi Can get you to any place in no time

title: Easy to navigate
review: I've been all over the world and this is one of the easiest transit systems to navigate  Signs for passes could be a little clearer  but overall pretty simple

title: Great efficient transport system befitting a great city
review: Efficient transport system  Use it if you can if you want to avoid traffic jams and the hassle of haggling with taxi drivers who wants to go off meter  An asset to this great international city

title: superb
review: most cheapest  convenient way to travel As bangkok is a high traffic city NTS gets you to places really fast

title: Gotta do this
review: Interesting to go on BTS as this can be a glimpse of Bangkok   Need currency and patience depending on the time of day   Be ready to be pushed (depending on time of day and stop)

title: Convenient and easy.
review: The train makes it so easy and inexpensive to travel tofrom the airport or other places in Bangkok We just asked for help and found the Thais very helpful and friendly One lady walked totally out of her way to show us where to go

title: So fast
review: Aaah this was amazing It took us from one point of Bangkok to the next in a short period Its also so user friendly especially for english speaking people

title: Ideal transport in congested city
review: To' get around in Bangkok center this is often the best option fast clean airconditioned but often crowded

title: Bts
review: The best way to travel across the cityneat and clean sometimes crowdy but usually you will get space to sitit connects 15 stations also it drops near MRT which is again good means to travel

title: Comfortable and quick
review: The Skytrain was super fast and pretty convenient Cheap comfortable and accesible Aircon is a something you appreciate

title: Convenient and value for money
review: It is really convenient to many attractive places shopping centers movie theaters restaurants etc Really crowded during rush hours in the morning and evening though

title: A good means to avoid the traffic
review: Actually the traffic in Bangkok is horrible you could spend more than an hour stuck  by car The BTS is the best means of transport if you wish to move around the town fast Otherwise use a taxi to reach places which BTS does not cover

title: Convenient
review: Took the airport rail to Phaya Thai station then change to BTS anywhere you want to go  Thereâs MRT also different is MRT travel underground

title: Great ride but note not all stations have lifts
review: Great ride but we had a little problem carrying our baby strollers as some stations do not have escalators in the downward direction and also have no lifts Had to climb the stairs with the strollers

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: One may argue that the BTS is the best thing to ever happen to Bangkok It fast convenient and affordable The only problem is that buying a ticket at the vending machines can be confusing for a newly arrived tourist Try to have change readily available or at least small bills

title: Clean and easy to use
review: It was clean cheap and efficient My major criticism is that they need more ticket machines that also take paper bills Almost all machines took only coins (unless I was missing something) and I often had to wait in a long line to change money At least providing one or two coin exchange machines would help a lot The system is not very extensive compared to other major Asian cities but a good place to start I saw how much BTStype mass transit transformed Taipei in the past 30 years Looking forward to its expansion on my future visits to Bangkok

title: Good but doesn't cover all the city well
review: The Skytrain is great but it doesn't cover all the city very well so you still have to ride taxi or TukTuk between

title: Intuitive
review: I don't speak Thai but it's pretty intuitive Staff is nice and they help you and direct you in correct direction Just use google maps to get around

title: Cheap but busy way to travel
review: If using the trains all day get a day ticket which lasts to midnight great value for money and will save your feet from walking the miles that you could easily do in Bangkok Beware the trains are often full so donât expect a seat

title: No visitor pass available
review: Long queue on vending machine but definitely beat taxi as Bangkok traffic is horrible Reasonable fare and well connected to major spots

title: Modern, Convenient and Efficient
review: Tuktuks are fun and taxis can be tempting but if you need to get anywhere quickly in the central core this is the best way to go If you can buy a passcard to save yourself the hassle of buying trip tokens If you do find yourself needing to buy tokens pop into a 7Eleven or Lawson and get some coins The coinonly ticket machine lines are always shorter than the ones that accept bills

title: Efficient and Very Good
review: The BTS Skytrain service is comparable to Hong Kong MTR and train service from the other great cities Great service and excellent ride

title: Avoid the traffic
review: Traffic in Bangkok can be a real pain and can also ruin your plans The BTS is the best way to beat the traffic It is very user friendly and does not take long to get used to it even if you struggle to find people who do not understand youe language Just one point  if the travel distance is short and you are in a group of 3 or more people then it would make more sense to take a can rather than the BTS

title: Inexpensive and quick transport.
review: We used the service twice in four days Good value Very busy we were pretty crammed in but safe and clean service

title: Fast and simple
review: Easy way how to travel in Bangkok From the airport to city center is this the best way The security IS good

title: First timer
review: First time using the BTS and what a simple system purchase a rabbit card load 100 baht and tap on and off make travel around bangkok very easy

title: Fastest way
review: Fastest way to reach major attraction as Grand Palace combining it with a boat drive Orange line Easy to travel all around Bangkok

title: Very clean and comfortable
review: Wonderful experience with the BTS Skytrain which is very clean air conditioned fast  cheap and friendly

title: Easy and convenient to use
review: If you plan to use the BTS more than once or twice I recommend getting a Rabbit card  You avoid the long queues of people lining up to use the ticket machines at rush hour and it beats carrying around a pocket full of change all the time  You can get them from the ticketing counter at most stations  I've been coming to Bangkok for over a decade and always use the Skytrain to get around when I can  It's clean air conditioned and gets you to most of the touristy places you'd want to go to  The only negative is that at rush hour it does get extremely busy and you'll get pressed in bit tight so wear deodorant and plan your ingressexit accordingly  The trains arrive every few minutes so usually the wait isn't too long  Most if not all the train stations have convenience shops and ATMs

title: So easy to use
review: The BTS is so easy and quick to use The train system in the UK could learn a lot   Itâs easy to buy tickets and get on and off the train and there are loads of stops in the high tourist areas  Best way to get around Bangkok

title: Easy and cheap access to the rest of the city
review: If you got a SIM card wih data and use Google Maps there is no need to take a taxi on the busy traffic of Bangkok ride the BTS and reach the place you want to go easily and with great Air Conditioner  Tuk tuks are more pricey than taxis amd they get stuck in traffic too

title: Average
review: Need to take stair for most of the time Not convenient enough when transferring to MTR or airport rail link I'd suggest people to take taxi if you are travelling with 2 people Only trains have AC

title: clean,safe and easy
review: Great wat to get from a to b  Once you get to grips with it (very straight forward) it's a walk in the park  It is clean and very safe security visible at all stations

title: Surf around in Bangkok with an ease
review: Surf around in Thailand's capitol and let the traffic get jammed outside All BTS stations of both lines are extremly clean and safe and moreover the trains are air condiotioned If you make more than 2 short travels in one day a day pass is a great deal  It costs 140 THB and you can use the BTS trains umlimited till midnight what becomes a bargain if you are around for sightseeing So you can go ahead without cabs and tuk tuk's and you are fully aware of where you go without being ripped off as this is a common issue in the personalized transposrtation system in Thailand You will save money time and anger using the BTS

title: Fast and comfortable
review: Our hotel was a short walk from the BTS and we travelled from Victory monument to Thaksin pier Changing trains at Siam was very smooth and fast Very economical and comfortable

title: Efficient way of moving around in bangkok
review: It is super convenient to use the BTS i prefer this way compared to smelly taxisIt is also very cheap so why to waste money if this service is good

title: Fast, clean!!!
review: We need this in the UK   We loved it Very cheap and a beautiful way to glimpse Bangkok and visit their famous malls without encountering the traffic of Bangkok streets

title: The only way to get around in Bangkok
review: The best Air conditioned very inexpensive and quick  It takes you to the very best places in Bangkok all within a few minutes BTS trains leave every 5 minutes or so Very safe and well done

title: Escape the jam
review: The BTS i would say is the best transportation system created in Bangkok to escape the death traffic Station were tourist friendly with clear instruction of ticket purchasing in english Trains were clean and the AC is good to escape the blazing heat   Best tips is to prepare lots of coin as the ticket dispensing machine accept only coin if you do not have coins you might have to join the snake queue to change your notes into coins

title: Easy travel
review: Hassle free travel Super clean and Thai people are very orderly and courteous Indications everywhere so it's difficult for anyone to get lost

title: Easy Way to get around in the heart of Bangkok!
review: Easiest way to get around in the heart of Bangkok Forget standing waving in taxies in the heat And you might never know if the taxi driver even are going to take you there It might be a bit crowdy sometimes but itâs worth it if you donât want to spend your holiday in traficjam

title: Easy to access
review: I just love it because its a skytrain away from jammed the staff also friendly what i like about this service

title: Convenient and Fun Method for Reaching Downtown Shopping Mall
review: I was very impressed with the BTS Skytrain   From my hotel the Ramada Plaza Bangkok Menam Riverside I was able to take a free boat trip along the river that dropped me off near the BTS Skytrain   It was only a few minute walk to the Skytrain which I boarded and took several stops to reach a very nice upscale downtown mall   I highly recommend taking the Sky Train   But be prepared to stand   It is very crowded

title: Excellent train
review: very clean and nice train So fast and cost very low it can takes you from one place to the other very fast I recommend this place to every one very safe

title: Easy to use and clean
review: Found it easy to navigate and use no probs Like a London tube Helpful staff is you get stuck or need to work out the easiest route

title: avoid the traffic
review: crowded slow sometimes hot despite air conditioningI sometimes wondered if Taxis were quickerAvoid rush hour

title: quick way of transport
review: easy to use this quick way of transport Very cheap and with airco in the trains With rush hour very busy

title: Best way to beat the traffic
review: If your travelling in Bangkok this is one of the best ways to travel it's safe and quick Forget about the traffic travelling is a breeze

title: Easy to use
review: Great form of getting around you need coins So change notes with the guy at the station click the number you want and slot the coins in and away you go Easy to use

title: Super convenient
review: I am so impress on BTS BANGKOK is super convenient and bring you to all the tourists spot walking path with under the BTS access to any place you need it  The only thing is not so good is not all the station provided the elevator which is not convenient for old folks   The rest are just perfect for me

title: Easy for first timers
review: For me Bangkok has a reliable public transportation system so make use of their train rather than taking a taxi I am a first timer when riding trains because in Davao City we don't have trains yet

title: skytrain
review: such a easy way to travel round Bangkok does get crowded at certain times also cheap nice connection to the taksin bridge to get a riverboat up to china town

title: Easy
review: Compared to other transport systems around the world I found the BTS system easy to use you just buy your ticket go to the platform get on your train get off at your station most stations are about 3 to 4 minutes away from each other also there's no one to help you if you get lost on the train you have to get off & ask at the next train station

title: Best way to go around
review: The Sky train is the best way to Travel in the cittadini and go from Mall to Mall or somewhere else in this so chaotic and full of traffic jam Capital  definitely suggested ð

title: train ride
review: went on train to shopping malls very cheap to use very big train an experience riding high above roads very smooth

title: Best way of travelling in Bangkok
review: If you want to get across Bangkok in minutes then this is the way to travel Get away from the traffic intensive streets below and at the time of writing for a bargain 37 baht Travel in the evening for an impressive skyline view

title: Very nice metro system
review: The metro system known as BTS is excellent and it's very cold and it feels wonderful after coming from the hot swealtering outside temperature  You pretty much can go everywhere using the BTS as well as the MRT which is the underground metro system

title: Great public transportation
review: Great public transportation I found this very easy to use and understand However the locations were limited and we had to get a taxi to get to most of our locations

title: Does not worth it
review: It's a train Constantly on a bridge Nothing else Nice view of the city but not a lot to expect Better go roof top for the price

title: BTS
review: My husband and I live in Pattaya and have spent many weekends in Bangkok The BTS system is cheap and easy to use Purchase a Rabbit card and you just swipe and go Linked with the Airport rail link itâs a simple easy way to get from Suvarnabhumi airport to the city

title: The fastest in town
review: I just love the skytrain It is cheap fast on time and has an AC I rather take the skytrain than a taxi there you have to bargain all the time And on top of this you can enjoy Bangkok from a higher position Go on a ride and try it

title: Gotta do this and experience local transportation
review: Fun to see the people engaging in everyday life  At times can be very crowdedthat's the fun  Great experience

title: Getting around
review: This is the most efficient way to get around Taxis will get you there too but always a hassle playing chicken with every other road user  The Skytrain is relatively cheap clean and air conditioned Not great access at some places due to stairs so plan ahead if you have difficulty with stairs You must not eat or drink or smoke as this not only casts social disdain through Paddington hard stares it would also incur a 5000 Tbht fine or Â£120 approx at time of review  Very modern very safe and very convenient

title: Experience
review: Been advised to try the sky train while in Bangkok so we did   Reasonable prices nice train but don't know if it is the English but we found the locals quite rude ( can't wait pushing you no respect for disabled people )Very few lifts   but best way to explore This is my sole opinion hope you found it helpful

title: Trips
review: Great location to shopping made life easier to get around to sight see spots to avoid bangkok traffic

title: Only trying bangkok transport
review: Good ambiance fast & clean train cheap and very helpfull for tourism Next trip i will use this transportation again

title: Reliable and convenient means of transport
review: One can use the BTS to overcome the congested traffic on some of Bangkokâs major roads  The BTS stations are close to the shopping malls which makes it a convenient way to get around  Fares are much higher than bus fares and if you have a group of four the fares can be higher than taxi fares for shorter distances

title: It Moves people
review: Found it easy to use  but difficult to leave the station in order to get on the right side of the road Local people will help if they speak English

title: Quick and easy way to travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS system is efficient way to travel wirhin Bangkok you can take motorbike travel during traffic but BTS is more safe way Every three to five minutes during peak times but sometimes you need wait long line to get tickets or have changes ready

title: Easy to get around but limited stations, but also very expensive
review: This is not as great as many people made it out to be  The stations are limited and doesn't bring you into the heart of the city but around the outskirts  There are some stations that take you to the main shopping mall districts but if you ride from end to end prepare to spend 60 baht a person  I rode 6 stations distance with my family of 5 for 40 baht a person that came out to be 200 baht  If I took a taxi by meter it's only 100 baht  So if you have a big group the best economical way may be a taxi or uber or a van  As for the sights along the way again it's nothing  The most scenic ride is the boat ride at night up and down the Chao Paraya River  The BTS line is just dull buildings left and right with some interesting buildings afar  Bangkok definitely is not done building mass transit yet but until they do the lines available now doesn't take you to the main tourist sites  But if you are looking to hit some restaurants or shopping malls then yes this is the best way to go to avoid traffic (unless you're a big group and then cost comes into play)  Some people would say buy those 15 rides+ discount tickets  Do you really plan to do that much  Many of my group went that route and then found the lines don't really go where they want to go and end up wasting the card and at the end of the day spending more money than buying singleentry tickets

title: Good choice to escape from traffic jam
review: BTS is a good choice to escape from traffic jam You can use it to travel in central bangkok You can use it to connect to subway and airports rail

title: Cheap Travel
review: We used BTS very frequently during our 3 days stay Their daypass option is very good You can visit all the major sites in Bangkok thru this Also visit BTS official website so that you can get the idea to visit different attractions using BTS

title: Fastest and cheapest way to travel
review: Bangkok is one of the major cities around the world with the worst traffic ever Taking a taxi might be convenient But with Bangkok's state of traffic it's like burning your money away while the taxi meter is rapidly ticking away Tuktuk can navigate through the traffic But locals rarely ride the tuktuk because of its "tourist's rate fare"   Fortunately the BTS Skytrain is around It is very clean and reliable Trains arrive and leave at predictable times It is also very easy to transfer from one ramp to another Even during peak hours the coaches do not smell The passengers are also very disciplined There are no pushing or slamming against each other While some coaches might be jampacked with passengers one does not feel that hisher private space is violated   If I were to choose among private vehicle uBer metered taxi BTS bus and tuktuk I would still vote for BTS Skytrain as the fastest and mosteffective means to commute in Bangkok

title: Stand in an orderly queue ðð½
review: So worth it to use the skytrain A few stops from the Mode Sathorn Hotel to the MBK shopping mall was around â¬070 The teller told us what ticket we needed to buy however we had to get it off the machine once we knew was it was it was fine   What I loved about it was the people's organisation not everyone scrambling to get on at the same time People wait in orderly queues so civilised & makes using it a pleasant experience   The frequency of the trains is every few minutes and it is air conditioned which is such a relief from the heat Could have def used it more had we the need to

title: easy   to the city
review: very   easy  to the city  shot  taxi ride  42 baht to  the city  only  20 mintues  easy acess   will use again  next time

title: Very convenient and the easiest way to get around in Bangkok
review: BTS is the most convenient way to get around in Bangkok It connects to the metro and the airport link too

title: Great way to get around
review: BTS Skytrain and the Metro are just the best way to get around Bangkok for visitors Once you get to know the routes and how the ticketing works it is so easy and avoids all the traffic delays I am a regular visitor so use it every day I am in Bangkok They have a day pass as well if you are doing quite a few trips in one day My only complaint is you need to negotiate the stairs from the street to most stations At times the centre cars can be quite crowded but journeys are quick and frequent It's worth while taking a few minutes to familiarise yourself with the system

title: Good idea ð¡
review: It is great the Thai government built Skytrain Or BTS as it is knowninexpensive way to travel along the perpetual traffic jam on Sukhumvit road I would hope there was a better way to get to the river around the Grand Palace area

title: Quick, reliable and awesome AC
review: I love the BTS It's quick reliable and most importantly it gets you to your destination without having to haggle or fret over anything Sure in rush hour it's crowded but that's to be expected A major plus is that the major shopping complexes are directly connected by walkway

title: easy and fast to use
review: Its a fast and easy way to travel arround Bangkok Skytrain is just like its name lifted up on bridges over the streets

title: On Time abd Great Air Con on Board
review: Used the BTS to get around Bangkok on a recent trip  Easy to use with signs in English and on time  Air Con in the trains was really efficient and a welcome break from the heat

title: The easiest way to travel in Bangkok
review: When I was in Bangkok many moons ago they didn't have the train systemThe air conditioning on the train is awesome The pedestrian overpasses make it really easy to work around and are a great addition to the city The best way to get around using the BTS is with a rabbit card

title: BTS
review: The BTS is extremely simple to get around It has stops from the main cities to the river and is usually not a very far walk Cheap to get around compared to the taxis It can get pretty packed during peak hours however it is still bearable The train arrives around every 5 minutes just make sure you get on the one heading in the direction of your stop

title: Practical and has a very good stop at Siam.
review: Nice way to transit and not expensive  Can get a bit crowded  Very short wait between trains usually every 6 min or so

title: Fast
review: Efficient we got where we wanted at a reasonable price and with minimal stress We werenât in top rush hour but the train was still busy

title: Fantastic connectivity
review: Hi I took the airport rail link after I landed at suwanabhoomi airport to Phayathai station where I changed to sky train( bts)  Though little skeptical  initially  but later I realised I did the best thing  Superb connectivity no pollution no traffic There r 2 lines running  one sukhumvit lune  and the other Silom line there is no confusion if u can understand then u r a pro  Cons The only problems I found is not all stations have escalators it's very difficult to reach a station after so much of shopping   luggage  to climb so many steps to reach to the sky train not all the lifts are also working at all the stations if all stations can have escalators it would be fantastic

title: So convenient
review: Buy a Rabbit card and make it even easier  By far and away the easiest way to get to most of the main sights in Bangkok  No more traffic jams or fumes

title: Best way to travel in BKK
review: IF you are in BKK and trying to get anywheretake the BTS It is clean safe efficient and very inexpensive It is also cool sometimes the AC is too cold bring a wrap or sweater

title: Frequent Service
review: It was very Gud service We have a train every 510 mins The only thing to look out for is rush hours If u r travelling with heavy luggage then you should consider a Metered Taxi or Non rush hours

title: Social
review: The train ride on the BTS is very comfortable For those who have difficulties in climbing the staircases there is the elevators to provide you with the assistance The BTS runs on a schedule and you do not have to wait for a long time to catch one For the elderlys and those with young children there is no special reserved seats

title: My first trip on a metro
review: I'm from Hyderabad and we call this a metro Our metro is nearing completion Before that I had opportunity to travel in sky train in Bangkok I loved it Very smooth and efficient  Must try

title: Boon for travellers
review: The sky train is the best mode of transport in bangkok very convenient and available very frequently The sky walk connects to all the Malls The trains are very clean and well maintained

title: Some staff seemed to be unclear of directions
review: It is fast but as expected crowded during peak hours   The exterior seemed quite old but the interior is rather comfortable and clean  I asked three different station staff where to go to a particular place and they mentioned different directions and which made me even more confused   Some stations do not allow you to buy tickets at the counter so you will give them notes and they'll give you coins instead to use at the ticketing machine instead Keep your coins   A number of places I've visited are not that accessible to various attractions and require a bit of walking around 1520 minutes usually

title: Easy to use, clean and cool.
review: A great escape from the heat as the cars are well air conditioned They are clean and the system is pretty easy to figure out

title: conveniently
review: you  go to anyplace in bkk if you take BTS Skytrain but have to crowded in the morning in the evening and weekend

title: A great way to get around.
review: Navigating your way around the city via the BTS Skytrain is quite an easy experience At times it can be absolutely jampacked with both tourists and locals but I wouldn't call this a negative experience If you complain about packed trains then you should avoid heavily populated cities  Tickets are cheap and come in a wide range of options  single trips daily trips and so on Whatever is best suited to your travel plans  Most BTS stations are located at great points of interest and make everything within easy walking distance

title: Best transportation in Bangkok
review: Fast easy to use cheap This summarize almost every aspect We got a card for 15 uses and used it all the time

title: Transport
review: I used the BTS train system daily and found it to be very reliable clean and most importantly on time The trains ran every 10 minutes approx Cost was about $1aud per trip very cheap The air conditioning was a blessing and was very cool after a hot walking day

title: expensive and not smooth
review: everybody know Bangkok is a lot of traffic the BTS is a good choice for travel work etc   some station is a lot of people such as Siam  Asoke  but BTS is not smooth a lot of time will break and client fall I am not sure how to improve about this problem or not

title: Best for tourists
review: An affordable & wide networked train system attracts more tourists and Bangkok has nailed this trick Most Hotels & tourist attractions are around a train station Sign boards in the station are in English & getting to the right place is so much easier There are day passes monthly passes & similar ones  The only reason I haven't rated this as excellent is because there are no elevators to enter the train station everyone has to take stairs After the never ending walk at Chatuchak Market all we craved for was a foot massage and we really felt the need for an elevator as there was no energy left to climb the stairs  This is definitely a more easy & reliable way to go around the city especially for tourists

title: Getting around
review: Really the only way to get around the CBD Cheap efficient and reliable Hope there is a stop near you

title: Easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: Definitely get yourself a rabbit card and get around Bangkok without the hassles of traffic jams You can use the rabbit card at convenience stores and even McDonalds

title: Crowds Rule
review: This is the best way to travel around Bangkok Forget the taxis as they will ripe you off not forgetting the horrid jams on the roads One can practically get to any place in the city via this system

title: Convenient and fast
review: This is my fav transportation when I was in Bangkok It is so convenient fast and easy to use Unfortunately the staff at the station could be unhelpful and unfriendly They should work more on their human approach so the experience in taking BTS could be better

title: Clean and efficient
review: Excellent sky train with frequent servicem great views of the city and easy access to many of the prime tourist spots

title: A must to ride
review: By using BTS it's very convenient for us to go to desired tourist spots and you don't need to worry for traffic jamYou can plan ahead your itinerary for the day since trains are accessible

title: Brilliant pity about Melbourne Trains
review: We arrived in Bangkok put our luggage at the "Left Luggage" at Bangkok Airport Level 2 (50 baht for 12 hours) Taking backpacks with our clothing and essentials only for three days  Walked to railway station in the basement level where we bought "tokens" from a machine in the wall  On arriving at Makassan we walked to Petchanburi (small walk) getting more tokens from the wall to change trains to SiLom then walked to the Crowne Plaza  During the day we bought "Day Passes" for 140 baht ($540 aus)   The train liberated us from the constant traffic  Dragging large luggage would have been just ghastly We returned to the airport the same way leaving a little earlier to miss the "commuter crush" finding our luggage at Left Luggage and intact)

title: Not always going in the right direction, but extremely clean & efficient
review: The layout is expansive but remember Bangkok is huge so you may still have some walking to do The trains are clean though and we always felt extremely safe amongst the Thais Much more than most countries

title: Efficient & Cost effective as always
review: The Skytrain is one of the most efficient and cost efficient public transportation systems on the planet More over it it the most polite despite the nationality Well done

title: Excellent way to get around
review: First time in Bangkok we were really impressed with the sky train in particular the price and accessibility

title: Most convenient way to travel
review: I alwaz believe in saving time while traveling with children in bangok with dense traffic bts is the best way to reach places within minutes though one has to walk a bit to reach nearby destinations still its way better being stuck in a taxi

title: Good to get around the city
review: The sky train is good to get around Bangkok but can be quite hard to understand at first especially as it was our first time in Bangkok However it is infinitely better than getting a taxi as traffic in Bangkok is awful  Also the sky train is very cheap to get around and goes to most locations where attractions are

title: A well maintained transit system
review: Ticks all the boxes The stations connect some of the popular places in the city they are well maintained and clean the trains run on time and you can interchange with other modes of mass transport at some places

title: Easy to Get to from the Windsor Hotel
review: Very efficient service clean trains running very regular timesEasy to get to the MBK market using the Sky trains

title: Time saving and economical
review: The Bangkok BTS sky train experience was great it's fast mode to travel within Bangkok The coaches are clean and new Stations are also neat and tidy All major attractions of the city at connected through sky walk of BTS stations

title: The "Sardine" experience
review: Good way to get around the city but try to avoid peak periods as the carriages can get extremely packed to point it can be a struggle to get into the carriage Transport is fast clean and cheap for a couple but the fares can mount up for families who may be better off taking a metered taxi as they are really inexpensive

title: Must use it
review: Cheap and fast Unfortunately does not connect all tourist spots but does connect all business and shopping high areas

title: Travel Experiences
review: Iâm a regular BTS traveler  commuting every day from home to office the BTS does provide an alternative way of commute through certain parts of Bangkok very convenient very fast very efficient The only drawback is the lack of carriages that makes certain stations like Asoke and Siam Square a nightmare during rush hours Very congested and a lot of confusion especially for tourists during these busy periods Would advise all commuters to have the train cards ready with them before approaching the main busy stations to avoid being stuck in long lines to change your bank notes to buy the train cards

title: Easy fast commute
review: Travelled within Bangkok by BTS to beat the traffic  Pretty easy to navigate  Does get crowded but since it's fast it's better than road if the destinations are well connected

title: Super convenient!!
review: Thanks to Uber I usually donât take public transport when traveling to a foreign city where I donât speak the language but the BTS was so so so convenient to get around the city I took it everywhere Easy to navigate and tickets are super cheap Definitely the way to travel in the city

title: Easy to navigate and safe
review: I travelled in and around Bangkok over a week using the BTS I found it incredibly cheap very efficient easy to follow (in terms of lines) and understand and no need to rush because another one is not far away

title: BTS
review: The BTS Skytrain is the quickest way to get around Bangkok trains run every three minutescrowed during peak timesInterchanged with MRT train systemVending machines at station select station you are traveling to push Botton insert coins If you don't have coins you can get change at station windowElevated train system with great views as per photo

title: Cramped but very efficient
review: Like most mass transit systems in very populated area it's cramped and very very busy Everyone in the city area takes the BTS as the road traffic is scary to say the least  For regular visitors do invest in a Rabbit Card as it is a stored value card for your travel on the BTS which saves you plenty of time lining up and scrabbling for coins to buy the single trip tickets

title: Steven
review: If you travel to bankok your missing out (a little bit) if you don't use the skytrain Im not saying use it for the sake of using it but if it's an option you should It's fast it's cheap its a pleasant way to travel

title: Germaine
review: Tour of mbk mallSimon discoverySimon centralExcellent experienceWill do it again Fast and efficient

title: Business
review: Efficient   clean and fast  really a quick way to get around town Bangkok's traffic  is legendary for being so congested

title: Convenient comfortable
review: The BTS is a good way of getting to places to avoid the traffic below it's clean convenient and runs regularly As any public transport it can be packed during peak hours The service is better than Sydney trains Highly recommended to be used to get around to most places

title: Great way to get around
review: I always use this when I am in Bangkok Very easy to navigate Rush hour is sometimes too busy however the air con keeps it cool

title: Reliable and fast transportation
review: We have used the BTS Skytrain many times and it is a great cheap and fast way to be transported in Bangkok   You can always count on the train to come fast and I have never experienced delays breakdowns or any bad feelings with the BTS  I can highly recommend to use it  It is very easy to buy the ticket on the station and you can now use both coins and bills for payment  There are also many cool small shops on the stations

title: very good time table train every 2 mins
review: great train service  clean efficient  much better than English services don't rush to jump aboard as within 2 mins there is another to arrive

title: Gets you off the street and out of traffic
review: Bangkok traffic can be miserable Although the BTS doesn't run as smoothly as it did a decade ago it is still a good ride overall and keeps you up and out of traffic The passengers in general are more polite than on most other mass transit systems The trains also don't smell as bad as other systems For example while Singapore might be a very clean city the stench of body oder on the mass transit system could make you gag If the BTS goes where you need to go take it

title: Very organized
review: Very well run and efficient  Ask at the stations for the best ticket for your length of stay It is very reasonably priced and very clean

title: Expensive method of travel
review: The skytrain is useful and convenient but it is overpriced and not very comfortable  I have traveled a lot in Asia and this is one of the most expensive railsubway systems  They also crank the AC so it is usually freezing on the trains and it is fairly crowded so you probably won't get a seat and will have to stand  It is a cool way to see the city from above though

title: Great way to travel
review: The BTS is a great and fast way to get around as traffic can be a problem most of the timeFirst time we went on it we were looking at the map and 2 different people stopped to as if we needed help Very friendly country

title: Fact and efficient!
review: well planed transport in Bangkok city all direction maps and station network is so efficient and convenience to avoid city road traffic overall service quality worth for cost i used BTS linked with Airport rail and MRT many times while my stay in Bangkok  If any link to Kaho san road it would be much benefits for tourist

title: Harvey M
review: BTS Skytrain is easy to use and reasonably priced  It is the only way to get around the City efficiently as the traffic is almost constant gridlock

title: I was in a Business trip on Aug. 2017
review: As I need to move to more thane one place in a day  and due to the traffic jam in BKK  I found that the easy and fast transport is by using BKK BTS which was faster than other transport in the same time BTS is a clean and on more than 90% on time I was happy to use BKK BTS

title: Easy access around many area
review: The train is considered frequent Don't have to wait long if you miss any Fares are cheap Sometimes it may be a lot of people during rush hour but all are queuing and should not have any issue Announcement sometimes are soft and is good to pay attention to avoid miss the destination

title: Best option to avoid traffic ... plan stays near BTS stations
review: Bangkok traffic is dense and slow If you can handle walking and squeezing in a train (during rush hour) you will save time The BTS may cost more in actual money but what is your time worth And it has pretty good AC

title: fast and efficient
review: The sky train is a fast and efficient way to get across Bangkok It is cheap for tickets and trains are every few minutes it does get very busy so be prepared for the crowds and to stand The trains are air conditioned

title: Comfortable way of transportation
review: Great way of transportation throughout the city comparable to a subway system Quick connections enough trains Can of course be very busy during rush hour

title: Great city travel
review: An allday pass for 140baht gets you to many of the places tourists want to go The Skytrain is an excellent way to get around cheap easy to use with a service every few minutes

title: Quickest Way
review: BTS Skytrain is the Cheapest and  Fastest way Travelling to Bangkok City from the Airport Also in the the City it`s Self Bangkok is Notorious for Traffic Jams Skytrain is Comfortable Clean on Board Information Announced Constantly of Up coming Stations This Form of Transport is Very low Cost No Toll Gate Fees  like you have to Pay in Taxis

title: A good way to get around in Bangkok
review: There are just the two lines right now but they cover a great part of the city and they are adding new stations If there is a station close to where you need to get to then take the BTS There isn't much point wasting your life sitting in a taxi in the Bangkok traffic Get a Rabbit card too Don't wait in line to buy a ticket During rush hours the queues are huge

title: BTS rail link service
review: Pretty stable time scheduling but one thing is too costly measuring by distance with good facility and located in the central of the city

title: Easy to get around Bangkok in peak
review: Great service Convenient cheap and in english Toilets at all stations Easy maps 100% wonderful Station staff courteous and friendly Stations have huge fans to help cool you down Services always on time Plus many have disabled access

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Really efficient and easy way to get around Bangkok  especially to avoid the long traffic delays Groups of 4 would find a taxi slightly cheaper and certainly easier with shopping bags etc

title: convenient but often cramped
review: A great way to get about and beat the traffic Best to travel offpeak otherwise it is sharing space with arm pits and elbows Beware of overloading on shopping as getting to and from the platforms usually involves walking barriers and stairs

title: best way to travel in Bkk.
review: Easy convenient and cheap this is the best way to travel around bkk even getting to the airport is easier as it goes close and you just can take the bus the last few kilometres

title: Get a card, top it up, ride!
review: Thai are practical persons That is why I do not understand why so many of them do not obtain a card for multiple rides instead of queuing up to change money then again queuing up to buy the ticket and that multiple times a day It can be a nightmare during the rush hours I presume that now you visitors know what you have to do Get a card top it up ride There is an additional benefit in buying a travel card you do not have to search for the price of your fare it is automatically detracted from the credit of your card Before you enter a train consult the plan with the route After you get off consult the signs where to exit the station in order to go to your destination Most times your destination is mentioned

title: Best transports besides tuktuks
review: Certain places main areas are always crowded but people in thai queue so its easy for us Recommended transport to go around bangkok as its bad jam during certain time of the day and nights especially working hrs n after work hrs Quite convenient as they go to almost all the touristy places

title: Best way to get around bangkok
review: Clean English friendly convenient simple to use Avoid taxies and use BTSMTS Taxies are more expensive and usually much slower because if traffic The train is surprisingly clean and safe Beware rush hour though The trains get very crowded

title: Very organized and tourist friendly
review: I never commute when I travel overseas but when I heard about the great feedback on their BTS I just had to try it I wasn't disappointed It was my first solo trip and commuting alone is expected to be stressful but not on the BTS It was very easy and organized Kudos to the management and I hope other countries would emulate their discipline

title: how train travel should be
review: I use this service regularly to get around Bangkok clean safe and fast and very cheap No bad points at all

title: Time Saver
review: Trust me by the second day at Bangkok you will hunt out the BTS skytrain  The city is bustling and traffic is at its worst Trains are the best to beat the traffic Get a map (which most hotel lobbies have) and catch a train  Just check the station you need to get to (or ask the staff) and then get your own tickets from the ticket dispenser Some machines only take change (go the the staff for getting change) there is usually a single machine that accepts notes too Office rush hours the trains are jam packed

title: Fast and Cheap
review: A modern air conditioned skytrain that is much better cheaper and faster than sitting in the traffic in a taxi on Sukhumvit

title: Well organised
review: The sky train connects most of the places The fare was reasonable The trains were quite frequent and the staff at all stations were helpful

title: U can reach faster!!
review: Very comfortable and faster ride to avoid Jams in Bangkokdisadvantage is it doesn't take you to Platinum Mall for shopping

title: Efficient, Fast and Avoid the Traffic
review: MRT or the Skytrain are the only way to travel in Bangkok as the traffic is a nightmare  Easy cheap and fast

title: Great for speedy downtown travel
review: great for city travel especially in peak periods Well managed and good overall connectivity They have been consistent

title: Convenience to view Bangkok
review: This is the most convenience way to travel in Bangkok by BTS and MRT But numbers of car is few and during peak time you may need to wait some more train for onboard

title: Clean, efficient, fast
review: We took a short trip just one station down and a return ride and was quite good  No lines no crowd at 9 am on a Monday work day  Easy to get tickets and to get up to the train with the escalator   Seems pretty safe and people on the train were pleasant as a few men gave up their seats for us women

title: Skytrain
review: Very easy fast and cheap way to get around Bangkok Cheapest way to get from Suvarnabhumi airport into Bangkok city

title: Short visit and business trip
review: Getting more and more crowded The over ten years in operational SIEMENS trim and railing system with control and monitoring is well designed and functional The material and systems show minimal wear and function safely As the mass transit system as elevated railway is well used and with ever growing passenger use each day there can be times when the train is really full and sometimes delayed  Passenger manytimes don't move inside the cabin and stay at the entrance doors and block normal filling and optimal use as capacity

title: Very fast and frequent train.
review: You no need to worry you will miss the train It comes back to back in less than 5 minutes Cheapest and fast option

title: Cheap and efficient
review: Probably the best way to navigate Bangkok Can get crowded during rush hour but still better than braving the traffic outside Makes stops at all the key areas of the city and also has connections to the Airport Link which connects you to the Suvarnabhumi airport

title: How nice bts !?!!?
review: Rapid   Sometime the door close and you think you miss the trainsuddenly it open  OMG  It's surprise

title: The only way to escape the traffic.
review: This is one of the best mass transit systems I have been on in my travels It is easy cheap very clean and dependable A trip that takes me about 25 minutes on the BTS has taken me 15 hours if I took a car or taxi Buy a Rabbit Pass and save more time and lines getting a ticket each way you travel Cost 100THB plus what you think you may need for your travel These passes will not get you to the airport however because although you can connect via BTS this train is a different system

title: Great
review: Really great public transport system  very easy to use  much faster than taxi's and very cheap  only takes coins in ticket machines but can get change easily

title: Convenient Ride Through BTS
review: We actually leverage on BTS to save the cost of travelling within Bangkok As overall its a pleasant ride

title: One of the world's best transport systems
review: Great system very efficient clean cool and cheap  They do need to expand the network however at it is currently limited at two lines

title: Grab a good hotel map and the Skytrain will unlock your Bangkok sightseeing
review: My first tip about maximising your time and energy moving around Bangkok is to choose a hotel within walking distance of a BTS Skytrain station  Then everything is fast comfortable air conditioned safe clean and easy  The different Skytrain lines link to the MTR which together will take you just about anywhere you want to go  The Skytrain also links you to the River ferry system  Trains come along every few minutes so you don't even need a timetable however be aware they do not operate 24 hours  Displays on the train and clear announcements about each stop make it easy to work out where you are and where you are going next  There is also a small map on the back of your ticket  You can get change at the counter of any station  Then head for the ticket machine and key in your destination station and the cost is displayed  Just feed your coins and your ticket and any change will appear It's inexpensive and sometimes there are cheap tickets advertised if you are going to certain destination stations   Most stations have lifts or escalators and stairs  Some busy stations are multilevel so take care to follow the signs and check you are headed in the right direction  No problems if you find you are headed the wrong way  just get off and get on another train going the right way  Some stations are always quite busy so don't expect a seat although some seats are reserved for the elderly or those with an impairment  Relax and enjoy the experience  there are some great views along the way as well

title: MRS
review: The ride and cleaness are good  Improvement should be done at Siam Square interchange which is always crowded at the platforms

title: Bangkok trains
review: Highly recommend clean and OMG air conditioned much more reliable than random taxis Tickets very cheap (esp compared to cabs) routes and stations easy to navigate ðððâ¤ï¸

title: Bangkok Traffic Problems? Who Cares?
review: My wife and I quickly got the hang of this excellent sky train service We chose to buy daily unlimited passes which made it quick and easy to go almost anywhere in the city BTS staff are always helpful for lines and directions and we canât say enough about the people of Bangkok who are never too busy to recommend places to see and things to do  Get out of your comfort zone and try this wonderful service you wonât regret it Unlimited day passes are about $900 USD  The alternative is spending your day stalled in fury traffic jams

title: EXCELLENT

title: Fast and convinient!
review: If you want to explore Bangkok and you want to avoid to stuck in heavy traffic half day take the Sky trainif you longer in Bangkok than a day or a returning traveler buy the card which you can reload as you want I used the train a view times  when even the cab driver where telling me i would sit a hour in the car with them because of bad trafficI liked the train a lot and you have some great views during the drive as well

title: Good way to get around Bangkok

title: The best way to get around in central Bangkok!
review: I live right now in Bangkok to study The best way to get around in central Bangkok as a tourist or whatever is definitely BTS ItÂ´s cheap and fast and you avoid the traffic jam If you come here as a tourist the taxidrivers will probably try to fool you ItÂ´s a law in Thailand that the taxi drivers must use the taximeter but if you are a tourist they wonÂ´t and they will fool you and charge you a lot more than you should pay And I would say that in city center itÂ´s better to take the BTS or MRT because of the traffic jam it will save you a lot of time I love the BTS itÂ´s so fast and I use it everyday

title: Easy and Fast!!!

title: Bangkok by train

title: Convenient

title: Nice Subway system
review: I live in NY so I can safely say this is a good train system  I took this train out to the mall to buy a laptop charge and I enjoyed the quiet ride

title: Fast

title: Easy to use

title: Short trip

title: easy to use and affordable

title: Great

title: Simple
review: Dont be concerned about using it Very easy to get around the city on and pretty straight forward Costs are marked on a wall chart and the ticketing machine is pretty straight forward Carry a map if you need direction particularly  when you reach your station

title: A cheap quick way to get around Bangkok.
review: We used this rail service several times and found it most efficient Obviously as peak hour it is extremely busy with busy commuters but they are all so polite and friendly it makes the trip even more interesting This is also a much cheaper way to get around

title: Still the best way to travel in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is still great value and a wonderful air conditioned cocoon to get around in I especially liked the fact that as I was using a crutch due to a recovering broken ankle I was regularly offered a seat by the locals Prices are still good and whilst it's busier than it used to be it is still my favoured form of travel to places that I can't walk to

title: Best way to get around in Bangkok
review: The best way to get from Don Muang airport to the center is to take a taxi to Moo Chit and the BTS train  saves a lot of time

title: Best way to get around Bangkok

title: The way to get around Bangkok
review: Very easy to use and staff are very helpful good prices for all day travel good tip would be to by the week travel card for all day use

title: Reasonable experience.
review: An efficient clean mode of travel although what peak times would be like we are not aware of Being slightly physically impaired I found the many stairssteps very steep and daunting Ticketing system worked well

title: Very convenient

title: Great transit.

title: Dependable, fast mode of travel

title: MBK market

title: Clean Fast Safe
review: I have used many public transport systems around the region and still enjoy taking the BTS Most stations now have escalators so you don't end up too hot getting the station For visitors the ticketing is hassle as you have to change Baht into coins and feed these into a machine Anyhow the process is usually quick  Once through the gates it is usually another escalator up to platform level Waiting times when I visitied were usually 5 or 6 minutes Commuters are not too pushy and the exchange of passengers is smooth (although it can be hectic at interchange stations such as Siam station)   BTS beats walking or taking a taxi when in Bangkok

title: nice one
review: very convenient from the place we stayed and the best part is the skywalk is very convenient and most of the exits leads in malls

title: Easy to go around
review: If you are less than 3 persons travelling to Bangkok I recommend to take BTS skytrain to go to Siam or Sukuvit etc

review: I used this BTS skytrain to go to places around Bangkok its cheap and convenient Compared to the tuk tuks a bit expensive  This is perfect Make sure you know where to get off match it with the map

title: So easy to navigate around BKK on the sky train!
review: Bangkoks networks of sky trains (and under grounds) have to be one of the easiest to navigate around the world Clear signage and announcements in both Thai and English mean that it's super Easy to find your way around

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Easy and safe to travel on  Cheap transportation   You need a round chip after making payment and then you need the same round chip to exit  You pay for you destination and not zones

title: Mr Francois Paris
review: This is a convenient transportation system to avoid messy Bangkok traffic Easy subway from the airport but not going everywhere in the city

title: Best way to transport
review: Aircondition low cost modern elevated rail system Best way to scoot around Bangkok It seemed I never was more than 15 minutes walk away from the sights I wanted to see

title: Fast, cool and irreplaceable
